During the flight I pigged out.  The sandwich was pretty tasty on soft whole grain bread too.  Meat was thinly sliced and flavorful.  Top it off with the chips.  I'm now in the search for those Zapp's chips!  They they perfect spice flavor and crunch.

Trying to find something quick, easy, portable and allergen-friendly can be a struggle at airports but luckily places across the nation are starting to catch on. This place is one of them! I ordered the Mediterranean Salad without the cheese or dressing, and extra chicken. I was so hungry that initially when I saw my salad, I was bummed because it seemed rather small, but when I later opened it up and wolfed it down on the plane, I was quite content thanks to all the different flavors hitting my tastebuds at once. Yum! 

The chicken was hardy, the extra avocado I ordered was a wonderful touch, the artichoke hearts, chickpeas and tomatoes lent other flavor bursts... No need for salad dressing :)

My fiancé got a turkey sandwich, and ate it without me even knowing so I think that's a good sign, ha! And when he realized where the sandwich came from he mentioned how this place makes the BEST PB&J's! Hmmmm....

For airport food, it's incredible. For food in general, it's fine. Just fine. 

And certainly does the trick when your flight it delayed 10 hours at Midway (thanks, Southwest). 

The line is almost always out the door but it moves fairly quick. Not as quick as the 8-minute estimation they have note on their walls, but if you've got 10-15 minutes for a decent and nominally priced sandwich you're golden. 

If they don't have something you want, ask if there's other sandwiches not listed. I did this regarding a second vegetarian option and sandwich not listed on the board (with mushrooms, cheese and some other junk) sounded much more appealing to me than the Mediterranean sandwich with hummus that is listed.
Great tasting sandwich place before jumping on the plane. Surprisingly all the ingredients were top notch.

Awesome service and great sandwiches. It's always hard to find decent food in an airport without paying an arm and a leg. Potbelly has good sandwiches for "regular" price. You go through the line and tell them what you want as they build your sandwich. It can be hard to snake through the line when you have bags, stroller, etc. with you so it is wonderful that have a separate line for people that need assistance. The folks at the counter were great. They saw our little munchkins sitting glum and gave them some chocolate chip cookies. It totally made their day and kept them happy while we waited for our flight. 

We got a chicken and cheese sandwich and the kiddos gobbled it up. I'm always happy to find places that have chicken pieces instead of deli meat in their sandwiches. I would definitely recommend stopping by here for food next time you're in midway.

No complaints. I had never actually eaten at a Potbelly's before.  I was stuck in the Midway airport for hours and hours and hours (I was was flying back to Baltimore from Kansas- a 30 hour jaunt during the Southwest flight scheduling debacle).  

I am not generally a warm sandwich kind of guy.  I was pleasantly surprised.  I got something called a "wreck".  It was basically a club.  The bread was nice. The meats and toppings were fresh and well layered.  Like I said a very enjoyable sandwich, especially for an airport at 9:30 p.m...

Did I say I had been standing around for hours and hours.

I had a connecting flight here at this airport, and we saw a MC Donald's but decided to go to our gate first but there wasn't a McDonald's at our concourse but there was this sandwich shop with a dude playing live music and singing and there was a long line so I thought "it must be good then". I ordered an Italian sanwhich with everything. My choice of cheese was cheddar. They also have provolone and American. The service was quick even though there was a line.
  I also got chips with my sandwich. Picked out "who do? Voodoo" chips. They were good too. Sweet and spicy.
  The bread tasted real fresh and felt soft. I got wheat. Also,  i think the jalapeños on my sandwich were real fresh cuz they were hot and crunchy.  I recommend this place. The music dude was playing red hot chilli peppers, Michael Jackson, and his own original songs.

Man, I really wanted to like this place!!!! I'm so frustrated because I've heard good things about potbelly and their sandwiches.  Maybe it's because they are in an airport.  Who knows.

I ordered their roast beef sandwich.  The roast beef itself just wasn't tasty at all which led to a lackluster sandwich overall.  Nothing special here.  Maybe I should have thoroughly looked at my other options.  

The restaurant was clean although a little dark.  The cashier and staff were friendly enough.  The price I paid was to be expected since I was in an airport but it was most definitely money NOT well spent.  Go elsewhere in my opinion.

For an airport sandwich, this place is top notch!  The line is crazy long, but it moves super quick. I got the new club sandwich and hauled it onto the plane for my neighbor to watch me eat.  It was perfect.  I would pass next time on the cookie.  It was not worth the calories.  

What did I learn today?  I would search out the Potbelly sandwich no mater what terminal I was in.

Always consistently good. And a little time saving tip? You can call once your plane lands and order pick up to be ready for you in 15 minutes, so that if you have a layover or need to be somewhere in a hurry when leaving the airport, the food is ready!

For an airport restaurant, I think this is a good one.  The prices are really reasonable, the sandwiches are made fresh (breakfast sandwiches are under $4), it's pretty fast despite that there is usually a pretty long line. The coffee is good. Most regular lunch sandwiches are under $7 for the larger one. Not a ton of seating, but a good grab and go option.

I was really impressed with the service here. I never realized potbelly serves breakfast. 

The line was insanely long but my wait was short. They take your order in line so when you get to the sandwich area it is already for any toppings you may want. The line was managed insanely well. 

I had the bacon, egg, and cheese breakfast sandwich. I wasn't impressed with the sandwich because the smokey bacon took over the whole sandwich. If the bacon was just plain it would have been great, but the smokey flavor kind of ruined the whole sandwich. 

Lunch sandwiches are all fantastic.

First, I'm a sandwich guy -- I love my sandwiches.  Second, I seem to be the king of long layovers that force me to eat something in an airport.  I don't know that I can agree with the folks here, and say this is the best airport food I've ever eaten.  Superlatives like that fly around kinda easily on Yelp.  I *can* say that Potbelly makes a good, solid sandwich.

I came in at the right time and was 3rd in line...shortly after me the line stretched out into the concourse.  A girl came through with an iPad taking orders, and when I got up to the counter, my roast-beef-and-provolone was toasted and waiting for vegetables.  "Original" sandwich, no sides:  under six dollars.  At an airport.

Good, solid sandwich, good, solid price.

Recently on Las Vegas Yelp Talk, Yelpers chatted over a restaurant chain that they would like to see come to Las Vegas. In this talk thread, a Yelper mentioned Potbelly. After recently eating in Potbelly for the first time, I say ditto to the Yelper.

   Flying nearly across the continent from Washington DC to Las Vegas, we had a stopover in Chicago Midway. This was the perfect time to eat out. Last summer I vacationed in Chicago. I was well informed of Chicago's outstanding food. And I was well informed of all the Potbelly Sandwich Shops. It was time to give them a try.

   Before I go on, I wanted to bring up that if you are unfamiliar with potbelly; it does not mean being chubby. It is a word for stove. Potbelly Sandwich Shop goes back to a time when a couple that owned an antique store started to sell sandwiches. This store was off Lincoln Avenue in Chicago. Now there are several Potbelly Sandwich shops. Mostly in the midwest. Anyways, on the layover, I was thinking about eating by the time of my Las Vegas bound flight. A long line greeted me. The line moved fast, thanks to an employee taking the customers orders on line. This really expedited the progress of the line. 

   The dining area is the food court in the Southwest Airlines terminal. On my table lied the pizza sandwich. What a great idea! A sub that tastes like a pizza sandwich. Potbelly offers the choice of original or multigrain wheat bread. The whole wheat bread that I picked complimented the ingredients of the pizza sandwich. The ingredients were pepperoni, meatballs, capicola, marinara sauce, provolone cheese, mushrooms, and Italian seasoning. This is one of those delicious sandwiches that leave me asking myself, "Why doesn't Subway, Jimmy John's, Port of Subs, or Firehouse offer a pizza sub?" A second question is "How come Las Vegas can't get a Potbelly? " 

   The pizza sandwich and a Coke came out to around $10. Not bad at all. Especially in an airport.

   I agree with the Las Vegas Yelper on the Talk thread that Potbelly is a chain that we would like to see come to Las Vegas. The Potbelly pizza sandwich left a good taste in my memory toward this sandwich shop.

The best food I have found in midway airport. Their regular white bread is vegan. I had the Mediterranean sandwich without cheese and with avocado, mustard and hot peppers. It was spicy and tasty. It would have been better if avocado had been made into a paste and applied in the bread like cheese. They have a salad version of it too. You can also customize your sandwich or salad.

Line moves really quickly and the wait is worth it. Always super high quality at Potbelly. And prices are reasonable. Can't go wrong with anything in their flatbread to lower the carbs and and some flavor. 

If you get the chicken and bacon sandwich, consider adding ranch as opposed to mayo for a nice change of pace. 

Love their fresh brewed iced tea, too.

As a frequent traveler, I have had many a sad airport meal. Pottybelly consistently delivers a different experience! The taste and quality is just like a non-airport location. Despite the constant lines, their employees are kind and efficient. 
What did I get? Breakfast flatbread with egg and cheese add creamy, fresh avocado and mushrooms. Yum!
Awesome service. Friendly and speedy. Long lines move quickly and quality of food is always on point. Breakfast sandwiches are great!

A 4-star for airport foods inside Midway (I believe this is in the Southwest terminal). The sandwiches are delicious and are not priced at a premium like a lot of things you see at airports so you actually get a fair deal.

There was a huge line when I came up, but it moved so efficiently that I was remember being impressed with how well coordinated everything was. Almost as soon as I got in line, someone with an iPad took my order and somehow, by magic...as soon as I got to the front of the line, they knew exactly what I wanted and it was already prepped.

I had the turkey breast sandwich with avocado -- had some tomatoes in there as well. The sandwich was good, but I initially thought the turkey would be roasted and it wouldn't be the turkey meats, but that's alright. The roll the sub was perfected toasted. I wish they would have made the sandwiches with some pre-made addons as I felt a little lost when they asked me what I wanted on there and didn't know the options ahead of time. I also didn't know I had to ask for some sort of dressing separately, so when I finally got to eating the sandwich, I missed the mayo and the dressing which led to a healthier, but less fulfilling sandwich.

Despite that, Potbelly is awesome and this would be one of my first choices inside the airport.

I've been flying out of Midway for years and cannot remember the countless times Potbelly has provided a satisfying sandwich that's quick and consistently great quality.  Even when the line is out the door long, the wait isn't more than 10 minutes or so because they take your order in line and the sandwich makers work at lightening speed.  After you select a base sandwich from the options on the board, you can choose the bread and toppings as you choose, like at most sandwich places.  

The turkey and roast beef are my go-tos with the jalapeno kettle cooked chips.  If you want a hot/spicy addition, do not skip the hot peppers, they are pickled to perfection and provide a kick.  I always ask for extra. Other meal options in Midway just can't compare.

Solid option if you're hungry at Chicago Midway Airport. 

The clam chowder was good enough but nothing to write home about, tasted good but a little watery to my liking. 

But where this place shines is in their sandwiches. The bread makes a sandwich and they've got good bread. I got the Italian which has capicola, mortadella, pepperoni, salami and provolone cheese. Make sure to smother you sandwich with hot peppers. 

The hot peppers will piss off and delight your taste buds at the same time but it's sooooo worth it.

The day I was here they had a very talented singer / guitarist playing folky type music. Very nice touch for us stressed out travelers.
Got the Italian with everything. Super filling- remember youre in an airport. $9.50 for a large sandwhich and bottle of water.

The highlight of many layovers in midway. What I love: they toast all their sandwiches. Yes! This just makes sense. Who doesn't want a warm bread with crispy roasted edges but a study chewy center? 

Also, love that they serve intelligentsia coffee. A small regular coffee is just right for me, and only $1.80. Bright cup of coffee with sour notes, a hint of chocolate and no bitterness. Just the way I like it.

Best airport food I've ever had. Ordered a regular (6in) A Wreck on white bread, which comes toasted with salami, roast beef, turkey, ham and Swiss cheese, with all the fixings (mayo, brown deli mustard, hot peppers, lettuce, onion, tomatoes, pickle, oil and Italian seasoning). Perfect snack before my flight. Also ordered a small (12oz) soy vanilla latte. They serve intelligentsia coffee!

Midway airport definitely has a good thing going here with Potbelly in the terminal.  It is always a struggle to find decent food in an airport and Potbelly does it up right.  

My last layover in Midway I was not looking forward too.  Travel weary, I was tired and had just gotten off a plane with a ton of crabby kids and families who had just finished their vacations at Disney World.  I was hungry so I figured I'd grab a quick Wreck Salad at Potbelly.  The line was so LONG!  But Potbelly was on it!  They were expediting orders by having a server take orders on a ipad which communicated to their kitchen.  By the time you were up to the counter your order was in process.  This appeared to be working quickly and efficiently.  
I had not complaints and the staff was doing a great job of keeping up with the rush.  There was even one super cranky, rude guy who's order had somehow gotten missed.  He was so nasty but the staff just kept smiling and tried to get his order prepared and to him quickly. 

Potbelly, I'm a fan.  Keep up the good work & good product!

Cup of Chicken Noodle soup "To Go" ~ found one, yes "1" tiny little piece of chicken on the bottom  $3.20 for broth & noodles? Bummer.

While well known for their sandwiches, this item was very disappointing. 

It was rather tasteless and watered down and chocked FULL of noodles. 

So my recommendation? Get the Wreck sandwich or salad and don't venture into the soup realm. 

Next time? "No Soup For Me!"

Sandwiches here are the same price as they are in the city. I find that surprising. The cue can get pretty long but they move fairly quick. I got the Lucky 7, one of the off menu items. It's basically "A Wreck" and an addition of the Italian meats. Their sandwiches are delicious. The toasted bread along with the large amount of meat perfectly balance the spicy peppers that are included. 

Need mind you, I ate this sandwich hours after I ordered it and it still tasted great.

I always love Potbelly. From the sandwiches to the salads to the shakes! Even though the line looked long it actually moves pretty quickly due to the inline order taker. I love the way this place is decorated. Potbelly stays true to it's roots even in the airport.

I only came here for the coffee and the live performance. The music was nice and the coffee is priced and tastes like Starbucks. Once the live performance was done, the background music is not too loud, which is nice.

Like I said, I didn't try the sandwiches, but they do look and smell delicious. There isn't a lot of space to sit down, so you might have a problem there.

The departure info screens are right outside, perfect place to sit down and wait for boarding!

After being put in a bad mood by the usual frustrations of airport security, this place made me happy again. 

Good sandwich at a decent price. Had the Italian sandwich - meats nicely flavored, but what I really loved was the bread! Bread was perfectly toasted on the outside but had that nice slight chewiness inside. 

Service was great - after standing in many long slow lines in Chicago prior to getting to the airport, it was nice to see a place that had their act together. They had one worker taking orders in the line, so by the time you reached the front, your sandwich was ready for you to pick your other toppings, pay, and get out there. 

Great place, especially if you're in a rush but still want something better than a convenience store sandwich. Despite being full from my sandwich, I was very tempted to buy another before my flight took off. 
Quick, painless, and yummy experience.

I admit, it's a step up from Subway but it's no Ike's (CA natives should know what I mean). 

Potbelly Sandwich Shop is located in the food court of Gate B... The opposite end of where my B22 gate was but I was determined to try this place with only 30 mins! It was about 8:30 when I got there & not much of a line. 

First step, look at the menu for what you want. Step up to the first counter in the corner & tell them what kind of sandwich your belly desires. Walk a few steps & wait for your hot sandwich to come out so you can tell a different person what kind of toppings you want. Toppings include mayo, mustard, hot peppers, lettuce, tomato, onion, pickle, oil & Italian seasoning. Finally, walk to the register to pay & your sandwich will meet you there.

I heard their policy is to get you through the process in 8 mins so that's pretty good especially since Chicago's layovers are known to be a pain in the ass. I had the 6 inch "a wreck" sandwich w/o cheese. For $4.95, it wasn't bad... I was just hoping for much more meat!

First time visiting Potbelly's and I was happily impressed my their wide selection of salads, sandwiches and sides. I had an early morning flight and was looking for a good breakfast. Potbelly's definitely delivered! 

I ordered the sausage, egg and cheese sandwich. Added hot peppers and onions on multigrain bread. I love that they run their sandwiches through the oven, allowing the cheese goodness to spread throughout the entirety of the sandwich. 

My food was prepared very quickly and was wrapped nice and neat. The woman taking the orders and the man adding the veggies and sauces were very friendly. Upon going to the cashier, my experience went downhill. The cashier was barely audible, speaking on a very low tone and failing to make any eye contact whatsoever. Jessica didn't even offer me a drink, so I had to grab a water that was located right next to her cash register myself. I also purchased a banana to go with my sandwich. Jessica didn't ask if I needed a bag, so I asked for one myself. She then proceeded to hand me a bag and make me put my own items in there! Is this Potbelly's policy? I was shocked. I understand it's 7 in the morning and we'd ALL rather be at home watching Netflix, but my goodness, if you're going to be rude and don't want to be at your job, which you are blessed to have, btw, at least pack my food in a bag. 

So 5 stars for their food and speed. -3 stars for rude employee.
The food was great but when they take your order at the front it does not always get to the service counter. They should either update their software or service practices.

Not my first time trying a Potbelly shop.  I am so pleased that Potbelly Sandwich Shop has a location at Chicago's Midway Airport.  They provide the best value for your dollar here among all the dining choices.  The place does get super busy, but the staff is super efficient and quick.

Grilled Chicken and Cheddar was my sandwich choice.  Ordered the Bigs size for a little more money.  Got it with almost all the available toppings.  Tasted good.  Will try something else next time.

I have yet to try any sandwich at Potbelly's which makes me say "WOW!!!". My favorite food here has been their delicious Chocolate Chip cookies.

As I mentioned earlier, I am so pleased to have. Potbelly's here!  They may not make the best sandwiches, but they are still good.  For the price you pay at an airport, this Potbelly Sandwich Shop is worth 4 stars to me!  I am a fan of this branch!

Line was long, but moved fairly quickly.

Had the pizza sandwich on the flatbread; was heated, but center ingredients were cold. Wasn't the freshest tasting either. Grabbed a Chai, also, and it was overly watered down.

Quick service and friendly staff. I like that they offer real avocado as a topping instead of just guacamole or avocado paste. Ingredients taste fresh and the bread is not too thick that you can't eat the sandwich or taste the meat. 

Love the Dream Bars.... Like really close to being addicted. If they had this in liquid form I would hook it up via IV and push it right into my veins. Maybe an exaggeration but you cannot beat a chocolate chip cookie mixed with oatmeal and caramel.
Delicious, speedy and best place to eat at midway. Try the pizza sandwich! Don't be afraid of a line it goes fast.
I had the pizza sandwich, my husband had the Italian sandwich and they were both great!

Im not usually enthused about sandwich shops but this one deserves a mention. Airport food has always been for me a glum affair . Over priced and underwhelming at best . This one far exceeded expectations . The sandwich that I had (some maniacal name suggesting that I ate a whole pig or something ... I forget) had heft , flavor, perfect seasoning and gobs and gobs of great meat on a decent loaf of bread. I'm not alone on this assessment since the line was out the door! And they have great customer service . The first time they made my Sammy they dropped it by mistake but apologized, made me another and offered me a seriously delicious warm chewy cookie as a good will gesture . How can you beat that ?!

Now I'm looking forward to going through midway .

There's a long line but it moves quickly. It feels like you're walking into a cabin of great sandwiches than actually being in an airport. You almost expect some Disney ride ready to go at the end of the line.

The Grilled Chicken and Cheddar sandwich was dry and warm. Somehow, this was exactly what I was looking for in this sandwich. The 6" doesn't really feel you up so make sure you ask for all the toppings. It comes with it. The price is also reasonable for an airport. 

My sandwich was good but I don't see how it's any better than one of the good deli sandwiches I've had back in California. I would still ultimately pick this place over the other gloomy options at Midway. Maybe I didn't ask for enough mayonnaise..

Protip - call as soon as you get off your plane. The line here can extend to marvelous lengths.

It gets 5 stars because it's the only thing in Midway that doesn't make me hate myself (more than usual).

[Out of Towner Review]

I don't ever expect much from an airport restaurant.

Especially when I'm there for breakfast. I had no idea what this spot was about, but it was right in front of me, so I went for it. I also saw they were brewing Intelligentsia coffee, so that sold me too ;)

I didn't realize it was basically a sandwich shop. When I walked in a little guy with an iPad/tablet took our order. I was a little off guard and not ready to order, but who could go wrong with a bacon, egg, and cheese breakfast sandwich? I was hesitant, because breakfast eggs at these types of spots generally freak me out - rubbery and faux egg tasting.

After I gave him my order, I proceeded to the Disney-esque line to where I told the nice glad what I wanted on my sandwich. Since it was for breaky, I passed on all additional toppings. She wrapped up the sandwich and handed it to me. At the register I ordered my soy mocha, paid, and was on my way to the terminal.

When I finally got to my gate, thanks to five of those walking escalator things, it was time to devour my breaky. You know what? It wasn't half bad at all. It was actually really good. The bacon wasn't limp and crappy, it was thick, crispy, and a nice cut. The egg wasn't as faux as usual, so its texture didn't creep me out. You'd have thought I was dying of hunger, how fast I ate it. Don't judge but I also ate some sun chips with it, they were too tempting to pass up.

Moral of my story is don't judge a restaurant in an airport, just assume you'll pay and arm and a leg for whatever you delight in! 

I believe in breakfast at the airport, again...

This was my last meal before leaving Chicago. I kept seeing potbelly everywhere in Chicago and just had to try it. Potbelly is located right after the security checkpoint. The MDW airport has one security checkpoint for the entire airport. The line was crazy long. As I waited for about 45 minutes all I could see was the Potbelly sign at the finish line.

I ordered 'A Wreck' in the 'Bigs' size. As my last meal before a long flight, why not? The Bigs is 30% larger for less than adding 30% the cost. This comes with Salami, Roast Beef, Turkey, Ham & Swiss Cheese. I got this with everything on. The greatest bargain is it just cost me $6. What a steal for airport food!

Definitely worth the stop if you have time before a flight.

Every time I have a transfer flight through Midway, I always swing by an grab a sandwich! Their sandwiches are solid and delicious... nothing better than a toasted sandwich to fill your tummy during a layover... The line may seem long, but it goes by pretty fast. Even I am surprised to see the sign that says that they are guaranteed to get your sandwich to you within 7 or 8 minutes. I wonder how they can control for that. 
I recommend the mediterranean (with added chicken). They're generous with the hummus and all the veggies. It's also pretty filling!
Great food. Not what you'd expect in an airport. Made our layover a dining delight. Topped it off with dessert at Ben and Jerry's around the corner. Don't miss it.

A better choice than Subway, that's for sure.  Bread is uniquely flat and toasty.  I usually ask for extra toasty.   Ordered the big Wreck which is salami, turkey, roast beef, and Swiss.   I usually always get the turkey so I wanted to try something new.  Fillings are slim for the price, but the sandwich is pretty yummy.   Service is very quick at this airport location.

During peak times like lunch time, I am always dismayed seeing the long lines that form outside of Potbelly's at Midway Airport. However, if I want something known, safe and fast I still enter that long line because I am confident that I'll have my order within 10 minutes. Whenever there is a long line, someone will be out with an tablet to take your order to expedite the process. No complaints other than higher airport prices for everything but then again that's every airport. #America.

Great value. $10 got me a fantastic "a Wreck" sandwich AND a drink and chips. I for one am used to being ripped off at the airport. This wasn't the case. The live music made it easily the best place at Midway.

Delicious and affordable airport food is not a mirage. 

I was kicking myself for flying out of midway at 6:30a.m. but a potbelly b.e.l.t. (bacon egg lettuce tomato) breakfast sandwich lightened my mood. 

All the ingredients were delicious and fresh, especially the not too greasy bacon. When I added avocado slices (+ $1) they didn't skimp. 

With tasty food and the Intelligensia coffee, you can't expect much more from fast food.

Had my flight delay by an hour and thought I'd get something to eat before the 4 hour flight. I kept seeing Potbelly Sandwich stops in the city so I thought I'd give it a shot. I am glad I did. One of the better airport foods that I've had. They have a variety of sandwiches as well as build your own mac and cheese. I chose the large A Wreck sandwich. It has salami, roast beef, turkey, ham, and swiss cheese. You can also choose what veggies you want on it. I enjoyed this sandwich very much. The meat and cheese is toasted and full of flavor. For only $8 bucks I got the large sandwich with a bag of chips. Really good deal IMHO. Overall, if you are looking to for a quick bite to eat at the airport or even in the city, I recommend Potbelly Sandwiches.

Good food at an airport?!?!  What a concept. This place delivers. 
The coffee is great. 
I got a bacon, egg & cheese flat with tomatoes & avacado. It was delicious. 
Did I mention that the coffee was really good?
Very pleasant surprise.

Post is for Intelligentsia Cafe within this Potbelly's...

Ordered a medium cappuccino and was so so disappointed. The lady handed me a 16oz cup that had a shot of espresso at the bottom and then topped with foam. TOPPED...with FOAM.  So when I took a sip from my cup of foam, hot, bitter espresso burned my tongue. 

I was almost complained about the cup of foam and espresso but the line was too long and there was another lady complaining about her drink.

I want my $4.15 back.

We came by here for dinner during our layover at Midway Airport before heading home to SF. My bf has frequented Potbelly's in the past during his college days, so our dinner spot was a no-brainer. There was a massive line when we went, but it moved quickly. It was like In-N-Out, where they have someone with an iPad at the end of the line taking peoples' orders ahead of time so that the starting materials would be ready to go once they got to the counter.

I ordered The Wreck on wheat bread with everything, but no mayo. For less than $5, my 6 inch sandwich was pretty good (especially considering this was at an airport where prices are usually double!). The wheat bread was soft and slightly sweet. I loved the combination of meats and the spiciness of the peppers. However, whoever put together my sandwich got a little over zealous with the oil and the first half of my sandwich was dripping in oil. My boyfriend's sandwich was nowhere near as oily. 

Tasty sandwiches at affordable prices! It's like higher quality Subway.

My husband is a huge fan of PotBelly and I've been a couple times. When in Chicago Midway this is usually our stop. The sandwiches are really good - but the salads leave much to be desired. However, they do have a decent coffee station though.
Five stars, really?! Yes, they're a Potbelly, but they're a Potbelly that delivers with lightning-fast accuracy at the highest-volume location in the country. Props!

This is the Midway Potbelly so  you don't really expect a lot, but as airport food goes they were quite good.

They had someone going down the huge line of people taking your order as you stood there, which was quite nice as by the time you got to the head of the line your sandwich was already there for you and you just have to add the toppings.

Pot belly, first i thought this is just like quizno's until i bit into the sandwich and i still thought it was like quizno's just a better tasting flavor. Good sandwich spot for the airport. I usually get a sandwich from her and eat it in the plane. Everytime I open up my sandwich everyone around me on the plane can smelly the goodyness of it. The bread remains good even after several hours wrapped up. I like the chicken cheddar, it fills me up just right,

I route my flights in purpose to MDW just to eat here. It's that good. When I fly from LAX to MCO, I would fly all the way up here just to eat at Potbelly's. 

The lines are long but moves fast so you have to know what you want. All of their sandwiches are hot and good value. Two sizes, wheat or white or flatbread. People are nice. Sandwiches are amazing... Way better than Quiznos or Subway. 

Come to Potbelly's and fill your belly!!! 

I love sandwiches.

Best choice in Midway. Two other good choices are Pegasus for gyros and getting a Chicago style hot dog.

Best coffee. (They brew intelligentsia). Warning - it is boiling hot, and if you want room for cream you have to tell them.

Breakfast sandwiches are amazing and the best value in Midway. I recommend the bacon, egg, and cheese on white bread with mayo/onions.

For dinner, Potbelly has the best salads in Midway. The grilled chicken and cranberry salad is amazing.

I nice Potbelly that happens to be in an airport.  The same tasty sandwiches and friendly service, but now you can take it on the plane with you!  

I personally love the Roast Beef with the peppers.  Plus the Hotter than Hot Jalapeno chips (they could be hotter, but whatever) are delish too.  

It is a great option before a flight.  Some seating inside the restaurant, but tons more in the main dining area.

If you haven't had Potbellys you gotta go!  The airport location is open till 10 when the rest of the places close around 9.  I ordered the meatball with hot peppers and pickles on white bread.  The meatballs were pretty standard but the peppers were the real ticket!  My girl got the Italian and I'd let you know how that tasted if she had given me a bite!  Must've been good!  The staff was friendly and helpful!  Can't wait for another layover so I can enjoy some more from this Chicago-born sandwich shop!

The service was quite good for airport food. The servers were really attentive to people coming in and approached pretty quickly once they saw I had something in mind. The food itself was okay. I ordered a flat bread chicken and cheddar sandwich. For the toppings, I asked for hot peppers, tomato, and lettuce. The cheese went all the way to the bottom, so I ended with a goop of cheese chunk at the end. Not sure if it was the way it was wrapped, but the end of my sandwich was also dripping with oiliness, an inconvenient situation in the seat of the plane. Oh my glob, what a messy situation. But overall, I think it was pretty decent food considering its circumstance. Might try something else on the menu next time, though.

This is a good place to try if you need to grab a quick bite before your next flight. I got their "A Wreck" sandwich with salami, roast beef, turkey, ham and swiss cheese was good. Added some lettuce, tomatoes, and mayo and found I enjoyed this combination. 

I can't say it was amazing since I have an amazing sandwich place in California that I always compare sandwiches to but it did was a decent. I got the 6" and it wasn't enough to fill me so I'm glad I grabbed a bag of chips. Although there was a long line, it went by fairly quickly since they got a system going to get everyone moving.

After paying $18 for two plain steamed hot dogs, fries, and a drink at Goldcoast, I ventured over to Potbelly's. Thankfully, it was only $4.70 a sandwich. 

Food at the airport is overpriced but it's still better than plane food. Save your money for your trip and pass on overpriced hot dogs, pizza, Chinese food, and McDonalds. Go to Potbelly's for the best value and a delicious sandwich.

Service attitude is abysmal. I clearly delineate what I'd like. Receipt doesn't jibe so I reiterate it nicely to the girl making my latte. I taste the drink which is supposed to be a vanilla latte for which I paid for additional syrup but no hint of vanilla. Tell the girl making the drink I can't taste the vanilla and she said that'll cost more. I show her the receipt and explain that I already paid for more. Instead of just appeasing the customer, she wants to debate it with me. I didn't like her pissy attitude so I told her to just cancel it and refund my money. Being on the secure side must give them the right to offer crap service to monopolized customers. I can wait until I get to MSP for a Starbucks with inherently better attitude.
Great food for great price! Had the roast beef sandwich with everything on it, was really good.

For a solid airport food option, look no further. Line was out the door, but a friendly employee put in our sandwich order on an iPad to speed the process up. Got to the counter, specified my toppings, paid and outta there in no time. Great tasting 9" sandwich for under $7 in an airport is hard to beat.

225 reviews for Potbelly!? That's more like it. Thanks to Anthony U., the DUKE himself for the heads-up! (There is another listing for PB w/no reviews and is the one I've been checking into for awhile now apparently.)

I've chowed here many a time and it's quick- amazingly quick- friendly & it's standard yummy Potbelly. 

Regular for $5.50 (6"), just a buck more gets you a big (9"). Your only choice of bread: white or wheat. Or they can do a "less bread" version for the same price. 

All the standard stuff - meat, cheese, lettuce, tomato etc. Giant fat pickle stick available at a price. Cookies, coffee, chips, soda (bottled) too. (No way I'm paying $2.24 for 20 oz of bottled soda though - which really isn't that bad a price for an airport, but no.) 

There's counter and table seating - some outlets scattered here n there. They are also kind enough to hand out a free small cup for water (even to non-customers.)

When you are undertaking an adventure at any airport it's best to do so on a full stomach and to be relaxed. A sandwich from here is the best idea. 

I believe the key to five stars and great customer service here is the fact many of their employees have worked at busy downtown locations and weren't just hired to work at this location. I have found many chain restaurants at most airports operate like an island with little connection to other stores. 

Even if there is a long line they move fast. The employees are super efficient and generally have a smile and friendly disposition. It also helps to know what you want BEFORE you get to the order spot. If you want one of their shakes or malts you order that before you start your sandwich order. This helps the malt to be ready when your sandwich is and gets you on the way faster. 

I almost always get the wreck sandwich on a wheat roll, a chocolate malt, and a bag of chocolate chip oatmeal cookies. This runs about $13 with tax and seems fairly reasonable considering food in airports is more expensive and the service here exceeds most other shops at Midway. 

On occasion I've had breakfast here and it's truly a gem considering some of the other breakfast options at Midway. There is a ham, egg, mushroom, and cheese sandwich that is super good. I wish they offered breakfast sandwiches later in the day too but I guess to remain efficient they have to limit it to mornings. 

I've not had any of the salads here so I can't really comment on those but sometimes I've had the tomato soup and it's thick and rich. 

If you've never had Potbelly before they have a spot on their website for new customers and understanding the menu and fast ordering process. You won't be disappointed here.

Pizza sub with everything but mayo and mustard. 
Italian with everything except mayo mustard and pickles
Hot peppers are no joke peeps!!!
This is our second visit to Chicago Airport's Potbelly Sandwich Shop.  It's good and fast, but nothing too exciting.  Next time we're back, we'll probably try another one of the restaurants.

I've been coming to this Potbelly's for many years now.  Definitely my favorite sandwich spot. The Midway location was the first place I tried them and now I make it a point to always stop in when connecting thru Chicago. The 9" Turkey is packed with meat and loaded with all the toppings you want. Even if there is a huge line, you can get in and out of there in 5min. They have someone walking down the line taking orders on a iPad (smart).  Very impressed with their efficient and friendly customer service.

One of the top selections in Midway Airport for quick, convenient fast food. The management manages the movement of the ordering line and it is always staffed to handle the rush. It also has a separate coffe/tea and pastry station for those not grabing a sandwich. Well done!

Decent food and quick service. For breakfast they offer several sandwiches. There was a moderate-length line, but a woman with a computer tablet came down the line taking orders, to expedite things.

Food was good. Nice that they offer multigrain bread.

The only ding is that the holder in the cup of hot coffee does not really insulate; so. It was difficult to hold the cup very long.

Pros: it's fast (they promise 8 minutes through the line and have employees monitoring the line taking orders with an iPad to speed things up), it's Potbelly so it's delicious, and it's from Chicago so you can pretend you "ate local" in the airport.

Cons: the dine in area is really filthy. Like I could see hairs and old crumbs all around on my table. Also the employees on the toppings line couldn't move as fast as the people taking meat orders from the iPad, so they had a backlog of sandwiches that created a little bit of inefficiency.

Still, it's Midway, and it might be the best you can do.

Just had the "wreck" on wheat - fantastic taste; line moved quickly; loved the toasted bread and the spice to the sandwich was great.  Great for a sandwich place but a pleasant surprise for an airport food place.
It just doesn't seem to matter which Potbelly you go to, the food is just great!  The Mediterranean is my go to.  Sandwiches are big so if you watching your waistline like me, get the small one.

I wrote a pretty negative review of this place based on a bad customer service experience, but after that a manager sent me a message and explained the grumpy turdburgular I dealt with was anomaly: not how they expect their employees to treat customers, and now I feel bad for judging the entire restaurant on one bad employee.  

So...to update my review: this place takes customer service very seriously--which I sincerely appreciate--and they are a Potbellys so the sandwiches are good, and it's probably healthier food than everything else at the airport, so I honestly do recommend this place.

While Potbelly's is already delicious as is for a sandwich chain, this particular location at MDW is a godsend, achieving the trifecta of airport food perfection: 

1. It's cheap. A large 9-inch sub will run you about $6-7 while the regular 6-inch size is even cheaper at $5-6.
2. It's fast. The service is both friendly and no nonsense. Line up, place your order, wait for it to be put together/toasted along the assembly line, customize it with the next person, pay, and done.
3. It's tasty. If you haven't had it yet, the Wreck is the way to go for first timers--it has the kitchen sink of all delicious sandwich meats: salami, roast beef, ham, and turkey. Get it with the veggies of your choice (I recommend everything, including the peppers--don't skimp), and wolf if down while it's still warm and toasty.

Thanks for making my MDW layovers and having to deal with the excruciatingly stingy airport Wi-Fi (a whopping free 15 minutes, really? What year is this?) go by so much more pleasantly with your deliciousness, Potbelly!
top notch airport sandwich. had a 9" wreck. i'd eat this sandwich even if it wasn't airport food.

I LOVE Potbelly. I do have an issue with this location. No milkshakes!!!! I love their milkshakes! So sad every time I come through, no milkshakes. That would give them a 3.5 stars but I round them up because I love them that much.

Be sure to get hot peppers on your sandwich. I normally get the skinny turkey, no cheese. Now the "skinny" is called thin cut. It's less bread. I've also had the PB&J, Meatball, A Wreck, Italian, and breakfast sandwiches...all SO GOOD. You can order a "big" and they give you more meat.

Don't let the line scare you away. They go fast. You order your bread, meat, and cheese first. Then once it's toasted you ask for your toppings. 

The line can get crazy/confusing when it is busy. Don't be startled if the person behind you gets to the register before you. I jumped ahead of someone once because my sandwich was done fast and I got called to the register. They looked at me like I was the most awful person in the world. The staff there does what they can to move you through fast!

Don't forget to grab a jar of the hot peppers to take home!

I was leaving Chicago to go home to my beloved land of fruits and nuts when I saw that MDW had a Potbelly in the airport so naturally I got excited and got one last sandwich. (Potbellies don't exist in my parts of the US)

They are one of the better options at Midway.  I was surprised by the quality of their sandwiches since this is such a busy location.  I always get a Wreck and hate myself after, but they are so good and don't exist CA.  The chili at this location didn't seem as good as the other locations though.  I also had an ice mocha from them because my terminal didn't have a Starbucks in it.. (wtf how uncivilized...how am I supposed to perpetuate the basic bitch behavior?)

I would definitely recommend them for a quick bite to eat before your flight out of MDW.

I love when my adventures in or through Chicago take me to Midway instead of O'Hare because there are actually options like this place for a quality vegan/vegetarian-friendly lunch at the airport!

This is pretty decent-sized branch of the "antique store"-themed sandwich chain, located on the far South end of the airport and directly across from terminal B1. Service is fast because of their assembly line set-up.

I always order the Mediterranean, lose the feta, and add "everything" except for pickles and mayo, finishing it off with bottled water and a bag of tasty, minimal-guilt Pop Chips!

I wanted to hate absolutely everything about it, but nothing went wrong.  The food was good, and it came out fast.  So despite myself I was ready to three-star this ubiquitous airport chain, but you know what happened?  It ended up not costing me very much.  Good food, good service, and inexpensive.

Who knew?

Right minute line promise and decent sandwiches. What is not to like about that in an airport?!
The Wreck doors the trick for me.
The only thing I wish they had were more soft drink choices.

The food is delicious!  They have a mix of Mexican and Puerto Rican food with amazing flavors!

The owner is super nice, I highly recommend it and I will be back next time I'm in Chicago!

Update: Just ordered here for a 4th time and it was great!! Will continue to order from here! Took one star off for their slight inconsistency, and because their chips are sometimes too overcooked. Order the chorizo!!!!!

I've ordered from here 3 times. The first time was incredible and I vowed to never order from anywhere else ever again. The second time was fine... And the last time I ordered, it was just okay. I'll give it another try because their guacamole is usually on point! The steak is bland, so skip that, but their chorizo is great!

Perfect place to eat! Great Mexican food. This is also a Puerto Rican authentically owned restaurant. 

Go here if you're a local! If you're passing through make sure to stop by. 

The ambiance is good!

This clean, unassuming taco stand on the corner of a residential community has had an uphill battle to open. After three years, the owners have finally moved from their previous location to bring top quality meat tacos to the neighborhood.

The tacos are king. Simply prepared with slow cooked meats, I tried a three taco plate with lengua, al pastor, and guisado. All were on double corn tortillas and finished with a sprinkling of fresh onion and cilantro. My favorite was definitely the guisado, a pork taco finished in mole sauce. Portions were generous and the meal comes with a side of rice and beans (also very good) for $9.50.

A plate of homemade chips and hot red and mild green salsas came to the table gratis as I sat down. That's always a nice touch during these days of charging extra for chips and salsa.

It was quiet this Sunday afternoon. I was the only guy in the restaurant at 7:30PM. My server was also the cook and she was super friendly.

There were quite a few other options for taco fillings including steak, chicken, and veggies. El Nuevo Taco Loco is no nonsense, high on flavor, family owned, and a great value.

When I first moved to Ravenswood I was excited to see that a taco place was opening soon around the corner from my new place. Well, that was three years ago and the "opening soon" sign quickly became a joke to residents of the neighborhood. I never thought it would actually open but a few weeks ago it did and last night I finally got to try the taco place that enticed me to move to the area.

I was not disappointed. It was definitely worth the wait but I wish they'd opened sooner. I had the three taco dinner and my husband had the suizo burrito with carne asada. My three tacos were the picadillo, pollo and carne asada. It's hard to decide which taco I liked best because they were all delicious but I think I'll have to go with the carne asada. It was really flavorful and the beef was very tender. The pollo and picadillo were also some of the best I've had in Chicago. I teach international students so I've had picadillo prepared by people from Mexico before and Nuevo Taco Loco's is very authentic. My husband loved his burrito so much he ate it all without even offering me a bite. I guess I'll have to go back and try it for myself.

Seriously, I will be back. It's definitely going to be my new taco place. The food was excellent and the woman who served us (my husband said she was the owner because he overheard her talking in Spanish but I don't speak Spanish and we'd had some wine so I don't know if I trust his translation) was extremely friendly and greeted every customer with a warm smile. This place is a truly welcome addition to the neighborhood. I can't wait to go back.

As we were coming back from the Cubs parade yesterday we decided to check out El Nuevo Taco Loco as Garcia's was not opened yet. At first I was more than thrilled due to the overall reviews......
My husband, friend and myself entered the restaurant at 1:40pm, wanting to catch the 2:48pm train. There was one guest in the restaurant, Gilmore Girls blaring in the background and our server, whom was less than thrilled to wait on us. We soon found out besides her less than lackluster table side manor, she was also the counter help and the cook. She took her time to help us, and acted unapproachable whenever we asked for something as well. She was  probably one of the worst/unprofessional servers I have ever encountered in my life. Also, since I have been in the restaurant business for 29 years, that is a very hard title to claim. 
At one point a customer came in to order at the counter and she had to stop, I assume, preparing our food to help him, which took over 10 minutes alone. When she resumed cooking she slammed the microwave door several times, which didn't leave me very excited for my food. Anytime I see a kitchen use their microwave for other than employee left overs, I don't have much faith in the food. 
We realized that we would soon be late for our train, due to the length of time the food was taking to prepare so we asked her if we could have our food "to go". Her poor, irritated response.... "It's already on plates." 
After a polite urging, we got the food to go and as she rang me up she charged me for the complimentary chips and salsa. I asked her why and she said as rude as you can imagine, "because you didn't dine in." I didn't have the time to argue with her that the very reason we didn't dine in is because she was understaffed, didn't show the least bit of hustle or concern for us as customers what so ever. With that comment I paid almost $45.00 worth of microwaved food and bad service. What is funnier still is had she been more understanding I had every intention of leaving her a very nice tip. Needless to say we ate while we waited for the train and to be honest the food didn't make up for the bad experience. 
*I hope the owner takes this review very serious because as a manager of a restaurant in the north shore, I would never allow my staff to treat a guest or guests so poorly. She was the blond with pink highlights, although you can't miss the bad attitude. 
*As someone reading this review, walk a block west to Garcia's and get fantastic service along with great Margaritas!

Honestly it was so meh that I forgot about it for the longest time. Why are the pork tacos a pink/orange color? Not going back ever. Waste of time. I think most of the reviews are written by friends or family of the owners because it's just below average quality.

How rude, I spent $17.00 on a delivery and my food was dropped. The beans and rice were all over the place. I called to speak to someone and the lady hung up on me and was extremely rude. Nice customer service.  I will never order from here again.  You are the ones who dropped my food and then delivered it all sloppy. Nobody would be happy about that.

This place opened only a few months ago.  There are tons of taquerias up and down this block, so I hope this mother-daughter team can stand the test of time.   

The food is delicious.  We ordered the pico de gallo, guacamole, combination fajitas, and horchata and sides of beans and rice for the little guy.  The pico de gallo was super tasty - made with a ton of raw onions and lime juice, with a little cilantro, jalapenos, and tomatoes. The guacamole was creamy and delicious, but the portion was a bit smaller than I expected based on the price.  The combination fajitas had chicken, steak strips, shrimp, peppers and onions.  Perfectly cooked, well seasoned.  Came with warm corn tortillas, rice, beans, tomato slice, lettuce, guacamole, and sour cream.  Enough food for 2!

As we were paying, the woman mentioned that the flan that she had just made was delicious. So of course we had to try a piece.  It was great!   Cinnamon flavor without overpowering the sweet, creamy egg-yness of the dish.  My friend said it was the best flan she had ever tasted!

I hope this place gets busy enough to hire a dedicated waitress.  Our only complaints were having to ask for napkins, water, plates, etc. 

The place was never empty, even though we came between the lunch and dinner rushes.  I am looking forward to trying their tortas and of course more flan.

The best refried beans I have ever had! No joke. I always like the rice and beans on the side with Mexican food but always end up leaving most of  the beans behind. However they prepare them here made me finish all of mine and my dads. And my moms. The rest of our food was great. I had chicken flautas and they were crispy and flavorful. The guacamole was fresh and tasty. Food prep was quick and service was friendly. This will 100% be our go to Mexican restaurant in the neighborhood.

Absolutely delicious and definitely the place to be for Puerto Rican and Mexican fusion....they have something for everyone even our vegetarian people....super friendly service..two very sweet ladies ....I hope your blessings multiple and success smiles upon you and your business...I will definitely bring my family back to this place time and time again

I ate here with my family and the food was phenomenal!!  I had the taco dinner and if you go you gotta try the guisado de puerco taco. So good!!    Treat yourself to this joint. You won't be disappointed!

I heard about El Nuevo Taco Loco through a friend & was excited to try it out. So excited, I actually drove down from work (32 miles... yes, I said 32) to check it out. I'm really pleased to say I wasn't disappointed at all. 

I came in on a Thursday night and it wasn't very busy. I know it's relatively new, so I wasn't surprised. I was greeted & seated promptly. Fresh chips & two different salsas (roja & verde) were brought out right away. I was already impressed. The chips were nice and crispy and the salsas complimented them perfectly. Everything was fresh. 

The first thing I ordered was Horchata. I love it and love trying it everywhere I go just to compare. Their Horchata was different... in a GOOD way. It was a little darker than I'm used to and was full of flavor. I REALLY liked it. 

Next up was my actual meal... Hmmmm.... what to order? I hate going into a new place and ordering tacos or burritos. I wanted something different and I found it, Guisado de Puerco. I truthfully didn't know what to expect, but it sounded good, so I went for it. I LOVED it. The pork was so tender, perfectly seasoned. The flavor was outstanding. Not to salty at all, which is a pet peeve of mine. It was served with rice, refried beans, lettuce & tomato on the side, along with piping hot tortillas to complete the meal. This is a weird thing to say, but it didn't taste like "restaurant" food. It tasted like I was eating in someone's home, which made it even more special. I really, really like this dish! My only suggestion would be more lettuce & tomato on the plate, as I ran out when I was filling my tortillas, but trust me, you won't be disappointed at all. I highly recommend this one!

I finished my meal and couldn't move. My tummy was happy & I was really full. Of course I was offered dessert and of course I said yes, but I had to take it to go! Carmel custard, with a squirt or whip cream. I won't lie.... I didn't eat right when I got home, but when I finally popped it open, WOW... SO good! I love the flavor, great texture and it didn't get watery like so many of the others I had before. You may want to grab a piece to go. If you decide to eat there, you might want another one! 

All I can say is this is exactly the kind of food I love. Simple preparation & simply delicious. I'm not "in the neighborhood", but I will definitely be back.  Lots more to try!

I am so happy for having The Nuevo Taco Loco in our hood, my friend and I went to have lunch yesterday. We had a great experience, food is so tasty, the restaurant is so clean and organized, Emily provides such a great experience as soon as you step in. El Nuevo Taco loco has a great menu, you do not get overwhelmed as you usually do in those smalls Mexicans restaurants. Food has a succulent homemade flavor, perfect portions, cozy place and overall great service. The Caldo De Res is highly recommend !!!!!!  I am sending my friends there, and I am coming back soon.

AKA EL GALEANO
Food was great!! Emily gave me fast and speedy service. Loved the homemade style chips!!

Picked up some caldo de pollo and it was wonderful. Similar to Arturo's but using better ingredients. Going back next week when I'm in the area for that huge burrito suizo that I saw. Looks so good. I've always went to Garcias when I go up north but that looks like it might change. 

As for the guy below who wrote a whole page complaining about commercial grade salsa lol
I'd put my money that he works at or owns a local competitor and is throwing shade. No normal person evaluates food or their experience like that.

Just a great addition to the neighborhood...everything is made in house. I had a torta with chicken and it was dang good. I was addicted to the verde salsa that came with the chips. The red salsa had a nice kick to it (which is a good thing). The place is byob and I will be going again. 
**I saw on yelp it was cash only, but saw a square on the ipad when I paid...so maybe soon they will be taking credit cards.

Hands down!!! All hail the queen of freshness. Great ingredients and wonderful service hand-made chips and the best flan I've tasted in the city. The atmosphere is artistic and family oriented warm and inviting. And the food was worth traveling all the way from the south side. Far south and I will still be back for more. Our friends are experiencing a real life chain reaction do your friends a favor and put them on to this great spot for some of the best Mexican cuisine in the city

I had a really great experience here. I came here off of a recommendation from a friend and I'm glad I did. I passed the place up on my way there and from the outside, it looks like your regular taco spot. However, once checking out the menu and tasting my food, it def sets the bar. It's byob so that's a nice addition. The chips are freshly made in house and the salsa was nice and spicy. I ordered the steak fajitas. It was served with a bowl of beans, guac and sour cream. The steak was really juicy and tender. I don't eat refried beans on their own but the ones served there were really good, so much so that I was eating spoonfuls of it alone. The portions were perfect and the price was even better, especially considering spidering the quality of the food. I'm definitely Italy planning to go back.

¡Deliciouso! My husband and I came here for dinner and it was excellent! He had the carne asada burrito and carne asado taco. I enjoyed 3 al pastor tacos...omg, the best I've ever had, no shit! Great service and atmosphere too! A must try! :-)

The food here is outstanding!!! The salsa verde is the absolute best I've ever had. It's served with fresh made chips...yum! I ordered the pork marinated in red mole. The mole was amaze and the pork was super tender. Our server Emily was really helpful in picking the best meal for our tastes. She said the burrito was the top seller, so I'll for sure be bringing my boyfriend back soon!

Really genuine food and genuine owner/family. I felt like I was at home with a friend's family for dinner. The food was perfectly done and really fantastic. I did the burrito suizo per other yelper's recommendations and LOVED IT. Can't wait to go back soon and try the nachos and other items. Definitely recommend for quality and fair priced Mexican food from an amazingly nice owner /staff.

Just went here today with a friend of mine! Both had amazing meals! Beans and rice tasted really good, tacos were steak and guisado de puerco, both tasted delicious. New place, so check it out before they get too busy and you a have to wait for a seat!
I am not normally a fan of salsa verde but theirs is amazing! I could not stop eating it with their homemade chips! Will be back for more!

This place is great! I came in with my friend the other day and it was our first time. I ordered 2 carne asada tacos and it was delicious! The price was great for what I ordered. I love how they have 2 corn tortillas per taco and they're packed with meat, onions and cilantro. B.Y.O.B. and free chips and salsa are a plus :). Their green and red sauce was pretty flavorful too. Warning (in a good way ;) ) the red sauce has just the right kick! I believe we met the owner and she was very nice and made sure we were taken care of. Definitely will come back. :).
Loved the fusion of Mexican and Puerto Rican food. Chef Emily whipped up some tasty new menu items and perfected the classics. Be back soon!

I signed up with yelp just so I could review this place. 
El nuevo taco loco is muy loco!!! If I could give this place zero stars I wouldn't waste a second. I came in one evening and the restaurant was vacant. The owner was there and greeted and served us like it was such an inconvenience to have our business. She had the worst attitude. The food is NOT cooked fresh. She went into the kitchen for 2 minutes and came out with what I believe was microwaved food. I don't think meat could be prepared fresh in 2 min. We ordered to go, so we didn't look at our food until we were half way home.  When I opened the box everything was completely soggy, and the liquid from the "stewed chicken" had seeped through the tortilla, the styrofoam, and the plastic bag! When we came back to complain and ask for a refund, the lady flatly refused and said that we could have done anything to it because we left the premise. Ummm that's what you do when you order something to go...you leave the premise. She even said some BS about us not knowing what authentic Mexican food was, because if we did, we would know that the "stewed chicken" in burritos gets your food wet. Thanks for the lame excuse and your lazy cooking. Not to mention the worst service I've ever had.

Mother and daughter dynamic duo!!! This little gem has it all.  The chips and salsa for starters were amazing. The salsa's are made in house and are perfect with just the right amount of heat. I ordered the fajitas with beef and shrimp, wow !!!!!shrimp cooked perfect and the beef was lean and seasoned with love !!! Emily and Millie thank you for an amazing meal ... People , if you want food made with passion , this is the place to be !!!  It's also BYOB ... Phenomenal!!

The food was amazing and the service was top notch but the best thing about El Nuevo Taco Loco was the salsa verde. I literally crossed state lines for that salsa and I will gladly do it again next weekend and the weekend after that! The restaurant is also BYOB, prefect for a date night or just a girls night! Whatever the occasion make sure to check the place (and the salsa verde) out! You'll thank me later!

I am so glad they reopened after all these years! I went in today to try one of my favorite tortas from them (carne asada) and it tasted the same! It was such a great feeling to know they kept their food just as good as it was before! I cannot wait to come back and eat  their burrito suizo because I remember their cheese being the best! Great to have a local business to support with an incredible story leading back to their return! :)
We had dinner there tonight and really enjoyed the tacos and guacamole. Word is they may add some Puerto Rican jibaritos to the menu. That'll bring us back for sure!
I had the bisteco (?) Skirt steak taco. Tastes like its home made. So good! I love the look of the restaurant. Super clean. Can't wait to come again! :)
Everyone needs to go here. Everything is super fresh and amazingly delicious. Being a cook, I can recognize quality cooking. They nail it. By far the best Mexican food in the neighborhood.

Just picked up a steak burrito and horchata from le Nuevo taco loco and it was fantastic! Better than I remembered from when they were in the other location. The burrito was stuffed with so much steak, perfectly cooked, not over cooked like you can sometimes find at a taqueria, but no! It was flavorful and delish! The order was ready as stated by the individual on the phone so it was hot ready when I arrived. I will definitely return!  If I have one comment I would like a HUGE horchata. Theirs is really delicious and I wanted more!

Great selection of Mexican food that is made to order.  Everything was fresh and delicious.  Its dine in or carry out. They have soft drinks or its BYOB and theres a liquor store across the street.  Very friendly service.  So glad it has opened.

I've been waiting patiently (or maybe not so patiently) for this restaurant to open since I moved to the neighbor hood, and it was definitely worth the wait! I had been keeping such close tabs on their Facebook page for news about an official opening that I was their first official customer! I've been back several time since.The restaurant is clean, and everyone working there is super nice. 

By far my favorite thing to order there is the horchata - it's so smooth, creamy, and delicious - I even prefer theirs over Garcia's (which was my old standby). Home made tortilla chips are brought out to your table whenever you're dining in, and they are amazing! Nice and crunchy but not oily from being fried. They serve the chips with two different salsas (red and green), both home made, which are delicious. I'm not a big fan of salsa on my chips but the green one was great. I haven't tried too many of their main dishes yet but everything  has been very tasty and keeps me coming back to try more (their rice and beans!!! so good!!!!). They also have desserts, some are made in house and some are from a local bakery, they're all good. Every single one.

Right now they're cash only, but they will be accepting cards soon. One of the best things, in my opinion, is that you can pay up at the register. This makes splitting the bill with large groups so easy!

BEST GUACAMOLE IN CHICAGO!!! I have finally found you!!! How you do get it to be so delicious?!?!?! The homemade chips that accompany it are outstanding! You can tell that they are super fresh and I loved the fact that they weren't smothered in salt, but plain and lovely. One more time- BEST GUAC EVER!!!

I also tried the awesome posole at El Nuevo Taco Loco. With so much hominy and chunks of meats, it was almost like a winter stew. The posole also came with some nice sides, which was a great touch. 

Emily took care of me during my visit at El Nuevo Taco Loco. She was super friendly and professional. She definitely accommodated special requests for my order. I will definitely be back soon for more fantastic food. Now that I know it's BYOB, I'll be bringing something a little extra with me. I highly recommend this restaurant!

Love this neighborhood restaurant.  The family used to have a location down the street years ago.  The food has always been good.  In the past month, we have probably come 6 times.  The caldo de pollo is my husband's favorite and I just love the best tacos.  Sadly, we are moving out of Chicago.  We will missed this place.  Truly a gem in the neighborhood.
Gotta try the burrito, this place rocks!

Visted El Nuevo Taco Loco with friends to celebrate my birthday.  WoW!  The food and service were amazing. Emily, the owner and head cook prepared and served with love and it  showed in the food which was seasoned and cooked perfectly. BYOB - was a big bonus we took good advantage of. Looking forward to the next visit...

Second time eating there. Ordered steak tacos both times it's fantastic! My girlfriend got skirt steak this time and hands down the best around - tender and so flavorful. Pork al pastor also incredible and delicious. Highly highly recommend. Women working there are great as well and it's BYOB which is always fun! :) crazy new taco soon they are going to have to change the name to crazy best taco?

The Rundown: Cheap eats, cheap drinks, & lots of tables and TVs in a very casual environment. Why not?

Overall: I'm a fan!

Oh Billy Goat... Where do I start? Location wise I'm surprised this place even exists. I seem to have this notion that everything in and around the loop is pricey until I stumble on spots like this. We stopped by last Friday for a snack for the lady and a whiskey soda for me. They offer everything from hot dogs to burgers to Italian beefs and all under $10. Woohoo! As for me, just a Maker's Mark and soda... ONLY $6! What a deal!

Anyways, aside from the affordable eats & drinks, loads of history behind the Billy Goat name which is cool to learn about. Be sure to read up on it! Reverse the Curve! Go cubs go!

'Til next time, cheers!

Cheap eats and good beer is the place to be when you want to just hang out with friends and shoot the breeze. They have a bar with $3.50 beers and they have of course burgers and fries and everything nice. It's good decent honest food and afford able bar. The place is causal we can eat and drink and be loud. It is a sport's bar there are t.v's everywhere.

I also like how the bathrooms are really clean and nice I love that! Amazing and I would recommend this place for an after party or a happy hour. It is clean good service and you can just relax and enjoy the time.

Lollapaloza post 

So Billy Goat had a booth at Lollapaloza and this post is based on the food from the event. 

*****Worst Sandwich I have ever had********

Got the prime rib sandwich for $9 and it had one thin slice of some type of meat that I could not figure out its origin. I have had some ok and bad festival food but this was by far the most disgusting sandwich I have ever had. Way to make a gross money sucking sandwich. And they hide it in wrapper so you don't know what your getting.

Do no but there food at Lollapaloza it's a waste of your money.

Yes this place is SNL famous so I HAD to go.  Albeit the spin off of the original I quiet enjoyed the food. The staff not as ruthless as the SNL skit because you CAN order breakfast!  It was early sunday AM but I ordered a double cheezborger, cheeps and COKE for breakfast. You get to add all your own toppings (except tomatoes). I looked around and everything was clean and neat.  Billy Goat has a small area in the back that looks like you could reserve for a game party (had a huge TV).  A few other patrons were also eating burgers before 9am.  

This location is around the corner from the Virgin and the Monaco hotels and if I stayed there again I would definitely eat at Billy Goat again.
I came early in the afternoon. It was quiet and the service was excellent. This is a good place to visit, take some pics, grab a few beers. But the beer selection is a bit limited.

Wow this is the BEST place to go after a late night of drinking. The burgers are fast, juicy and so satisfying. They come on the worlds softest bun and the toppings area lets you get creative with your burger. Everything is under $5. Whats not to like?!?!?!

I've had a burger at Billy Goat's Tavern in the past, but I don't remember it being so flat and dry. The French fries outshined the burger and my draft beer tasted flat. Sadly disappointed in my "post RNRCHI" lunch today. The young lady at the register took our order and money without even a smile and was so soft spoken we could hardly hear or understand her. I guess I should have just gone to Shake Shack like I originally wanted to.

One of my favorite places to visit when I'm nearby at the Chicago Theater for a show. It's far enough that it doesn't get packed with the show crowd, but still close enough to be there in a jiffy. And  I so appreciate that they stay open late, until 1am on a weekday!

I've never been a fan of their burgers - the bread is too hard & chewy. But the Italian beef was delicious, bread dipped in juice and all. Plus, you can't beat the full bar.

Seriously, terrible service.  The guys running the food counter were rude and acted like we were inconveniencing them.  The bartender was no where to be found and when he did show he took his time serving his buddies who had shown up AFTER us, before even acknowledging us, despite another person at the bar pointing out to him that we had been there for several minutes WAITING and that he should serve us first.

The food was basic but good and cheap.  I really hate wasting my time on jerks.

Planned our day to go to breakfast here at 9:15am before heading to Bears game. We walked in and was told they do not open till 10. However there was one table in there eating which I normally would have questioned but didn't because I figured  it might be family. Looked later on website and said they opened at 8. I was pretty upset as we are visiting from Florida and was really looking forward to trying this place

We had a quick breakfast at this place, cheese omelet and pancakes. Everything was delicious, portions are big and prices are reasonable! No people, there were just two of us. We got our order in 2 minutes, everything was fresh and just cooked! I think it's a great place when you need to eat something good, kinda homemade and cheap.

I love this Billy Goat and go here all the time. Located conveniently by the L, it's one of the few places you can still get a 3.50 draft beer in the area and get really cheap, yet quality food. They have a much wider food menu (polish, salami) and beer menu (revolution, argus others) than the lower michigan location. You can even get fries here (Shocking, sacrilege! but screw it, they're good and hit the spot) And honestly the staff is much nicer here. And they accept credit cards unlike the lower michigan location. Service is always quick, and always room to sit down. I'll definitely be returning often

My family and I came here for a quick lunch after touring downtown. This is fast food, very casual sit-down restaurant where you order at the front and take  your food as your number gets called out. Food was pretty greasy, but it was decent. I had a chicken sandwich but I thought it was just okay - nothing special about it. Salad was just a blend of veggies, nothing particular. Husband ordered a burger, but he said it was average.

This place is great!! Not sure what the negative reviews are all about .. Are they expecting fine dining from a fast food burger joint?? 
We were visiting from Boston and the bartender Ben was GREAT!! He recommended a double bacon cheeseburger with a fried egg on top ... Yum!!! 
We had fun chatting with him as well and he gave us some Chicago sports history while we were there!!! 
He only busted my chops a little bit for wearing a Red Sox shirt!!  
They have a ton of pictures all over the wall of the celebrities who've visited there ...and there are A LOT!! 
I give 2 thumbs up to The Billy Goat Tavern!! 
Hoping for a reversal of the "curse" some time soon!!

We came here because it had an average of 4 stars on Yelp. Boy, were we mislead. I had the cheeseburger with fries and my husband had the Italian sausage sandwich with fries. First of all, the fries were extra. The burger was just a naked burger with cheese on a plain bun and nothing else. No lettuce, tomato, pickle, onion...zilch, nothing, nada, end of story. My husbands sausage sandwich was just as plain.
The food here is nothing special. The prices were reasonable, but we left there feeling dissatisfied. A couple of hotdogs from a street vendor would have been money better spent.
This place is definitely overrated.

Very typical of Billy Goat - greasy food, quick service, self-serve pickles, onions, other condiments.

However, i love that this is a cheaper bar alternative in the loop. With limited bar locations in the loop (mostly $$-$$$ pricing), a $ is reason for a sigh of relief!

Also, whip out your student discount and you're looking at a 15% discount :)

Very casual, plenty of seating.  Friendly employees and a good cook.

I have been here for breakfast, didn't get the cheeseborger yet.  I got a perfectly cooked 3 egg feta cheese omelet with a generous amount of cheese, hash browns, and toast.  I finished off the whole 3 egg omelet.  Dining companion got fried eggs, bacon and toast, which looked like it was perfectly cooked. You can see the cook make them to order on the grill.  I also saw them make someone a gorgeous Denver omelet, which I will try in the future.  Today they had chili for 2.95.  I ordered some to take home. It was thick, well seasoned and a generous portion and they had also tossed in 3 packets of saltine crackers. I hope they have chili again. It seemed like it was a special today.

Also, unlike the SNL skit, and the original Billy Goat on lower Michigan, they have fries. Haven't tried them yet. The chips are Vitner's, which I consider a plus. 

If you do get a hamborger or a cheeseborger, they do have condiments, they are off to the side by the cash register and you add them yourself.
