I just stopped by today and the menu have a few changes and their prices went up quite a bit. Also, I was going too pay with my American Express, but they don't accept it any longer despite the fact that they still have the sign of the card is accepted.

Well, where do I begin? Let me first go over each item I sampled. 

Burrito Fusion (Beef w/Mandarin)  ***
Tasty and quite good. The down part was the rice and the amount of it versus the meat. Very filling, but needs more protein, especially for the price.

Kung Pau Chicken. **
Okay, but really not that great. I wouldn't order it again. I really wasn't happy to see the pre-cooked rice come out of a big bag, instead fresh out of a rice cooker. If you want to cook Asian, then cook Asian. The meal was just okay, nothing special. It tasted like a packet you'd get at the grocery store. 

Korean BBQ Steak Taco ****
Outstanding! Very flavorful and well made. Although a bit small and lacking a goodly amount of meat, it was delicious. If I had stopped with just this, my overall rating would have been different.

Atmosphere  *
Very small, with seating inside of only 4 very small round tables. No AC made it extremely  hot inside. It was 81 degrees outside and with no AC or ventilation, I was sweating like a BBQ'd pig! At least they should invest in a fan to get some circulation. After the taco, I got the rest to go just so I wouldn't pass out due to heat exhaustion. 

Location  *
Right next to a VERY busy road. Be careful on the sidewalk.

Staff & Friendliness  *****
Outstanding! Very friendly and helpful. It was nice to be able to watch the chef cook. He is obviously very dedicated and loves his work. 

Overall  ***

Suggestion: Drop the fusion and do what you do best, Mexican. While what I had was okay, it is not truly a fusion and they're better off sticking to one method. At least get the spelling right  (See photo)

I'm not sure why such high Yelp reviews...the food is kind of pricey for what you get. $50 for a meal for 2 people? It's a neat concept, but I'm in no hurry to go back for food that wasn't bad but wasn't great either. Try to eat there instead of doing a carry out,..I only had a 10 min drive after I picked up the order and both orders of egg rolls were cold and chewy :/

This place is really quite surprising. Total dive and on a busy/horrible road, but the food is fantastic. The chipotle chicken tacos and Korean BBQ tacos were AMAZING!! The egg rolls are not good, they used to have very good dumplings but no longer have them on the menu?? The Mexican coke (made with real sugar and not high fructose corn syrup) was a nice touch. 5 tacos and a coke, $15.
Spicy Pork pineapple Tacos ..... yummmy! I ordered the dinner which included rice and beans. Beans where tasty. The rice bland, like white rice with food coloring.

Honestly, I believe that the high ratings are from the people near Midway that eat up all the food!!!.. OK, I had the BBQ Korean Taco. It was alright.. I had a Chicken Burrito. It was very good. I've never had a burrito that had a little Sweet element to it!! It was interesting, and quite tasty. The service was OK...ya know... there. It wasn't BAD ...just there.  I guess I can't complain. It could've been worse. All in all the experience was alright.  The burrito was interesting and tasted good..

AMAZING- A Diamond Amongst A Multitude Of Sub Par Eating Establishments In The Clearing,Stickney And Garfield Ridge Area.
Do Not Pass The Chance To Eat Here ,You Will Not Be Disappointed.
Order The Fried WanTon -Its,Crisp,Light Breading Encases A Mixture Of Crab And Peppers And It's Complimented By A Sweet Chili Glaze Sauce.
Then Get The Fusion Burrito.I Had The Steak Seasoned With Teriyaki Sauce.
You Know Good Food When You Can Taste The Multiple Ingredients That Come Together In Fusion. Every Bite Beat The Last Especially If You Done The In House Salsa Sauce.This Dish Does Not Disappoint.
Steak,Rice With A Semi Spicy Mayonnaise Sauce.Awesome.
Then Try A Best Seller Here,The Korean Barbecue Taco-Steak. Its Seasoned With Barbecue And Complimented With Cheese & Topped With Siracha Sauce.
DELICIOUS!!!
Very Clean,Decent Seating For Quick Dine In Experience And Omar & Isaac Will Be Prompt As Well As Professional With Your Order.
I'll Definitely Be Back

The owner is offended that I didn't like his food. To bad so sad food is subjective and I'm not the only one who thinks your business is a candy factory instead of a culinary experience. 

Fact, most people from out of town talk about how gross and over priced your food really is....

Like I said I'm a south side native with a travel companion pass because my spouse works for the airlines and avid businesses traveler. 

As a matter if fact I flew 155 times last year. My expense account has allowed me to try all kinds off food all over the U.S. I'm not rich just have a road warrior job that allows me those spoils. 

No matter how you spin it your food is gross to me and many other people. When your client base is primary Mexican and the only Chinese food they ever had comes from their local "Chop Suey" grease spoon your food taste good. 

Relax.... Your not the only Chef that has ever been criticized. There is entire TV shows, magazines and  web sites were food is criticized. Nothing personal, you think your food is awesome and I think it's garbage let's just agree to disagree. 

You are nowhere near 5 starts it's your location and fusion that makes you popular. Your food is gimmick there is no culinary talent attached to your dishes. 

It's nothing personal I just don't agree that your food is any good and so do many more people. 

I hope there is never a shortage of teriyaki sauce because you will be in big trouble.
Don't judge a book by it's cover.  This place is awesome!!!  Great tacos and salads.  They blend Asian and Mexican well.  Very unique menu.

I heard so many good things about this place, and found a groupon, so I was definitely in to come here. To be honest though, I just wasn't blown away. I'd give it 3.5 stars if I could. 

The place is tiny and hot inside, with only one picnic table outside along Cicero Ave. I was OK with dealing with this, but you have been warned!

Food- after reading reviews, I ordered avocado egg rolls, chicken jalapeno pad thai, and the pineapple lemonade. The egg rolls were good- decent (medium) size, loaded with avocado and lettuce, but without the spicy aioli (which was amahzing!), they were pretty bland. Cost was around $5.50. If you are against mayo-type dressings, you may want to skip this. The pad thai was good, but offered ZERO spice. I found pieces of jalapeno in mine, but all seeds were removed so it was nothing more than pad thai with a pepper in it. I rated it a 0.5/10 on the heat scale. I can get pad thai that is even better a lot closer to home. The pineapple lemonade was fantastic though. I thought it was a perfect balance of lemon and pineapple flavors; no flavor won. I would definitely want that again!

My guy got the Asian wings and steak pad thai.  He said the meat was not really like steak, more of a beef cut. He enjoyed his wings. The total for both of us was about $27 before using the groupon. 

I enjoyed what I ate, but again, it's a little far for just good.
Love love LOVE this place!!! The avocado egg rolls and pineapple lemonade are amazing!!!

I placed a phone order with a menu we had at work. Ordered the fusion burrito with shrimp and teriyaki sauce. I also ordered the wontons. The person at the restaurant quoted me what sounded like $17.10 but I figured I misheard since the menu had these items priced at $8 and $3.99 respectively. Well, I get to the establishment and the wall menu showed $9.10 and $6.10 each. Obviously I had an old menu but even the take out menu in the restaurant had lower prices than the updated wall. I explained to them that the menu I had didn't have the wontons for that much and asked them to remove the wontons from my order (I can't see paying over $1.25 for 1). I expected that they would possibly honor the price on the menu they had but they didn't offer. So they lose stars for what I consider poor customer service.

Now as far the burrito, it wasn't bad. But it tastes more like teriyaki rice. It was rare when I bit into a shrimp. So they lose stars for that.

I won't be back...

Went here with my coworkers and we were all very disappointed. The reviews are nuts and it does not add up.

The food took forever
It was ridiculously expensive for the amount of food we got
The chicken wings were disgusting, it looked worst than McDonald's chicken - I don't see why they have a sign claiming their Thai chicken wings have an award.

Nothing impressed me, probably wouldn't return unless I was starving and in the mood to spend lots of money on cold food made with little effort to impress customers.

Service wasn't all that either.

This place is merely awesome!

The location is very close the Midway Airport, about two (2)-minute driving distance south of the airport.  However, walking to this place from Midway is feasible.  

Be careful while you're driving because you most likely will miss it!  The exterior is extremely nondescript.  They do have a private parking lot; there are two (2) vehicle spaces available.  Nevertheless, the rest of the parking lot is up to you at what position you would like to park.  Thus it's a free-style parking, like a long program in figure skating.  

Once you've overcome all of the difficulties prior entering into the restaurant, you will experience one of the most amazing fusion dishes you would ever find in the city of Chicago limit.  We ordered the avocado rolls, two (2) fried bean tacos, and two (2) orders of horchata.  Let me tell you.  You have to try all of them if you get a chance.  The horchata was super on point!  It's one of the best I've had, comparing to the ones I've had in Logan Square and Albany Park.  The avocado rolls were crunchy (very creative use of the wonton wrappers), and the avocado paste was rich and creamy.  By the way, the southwestern dipping sauce for the avocado rolls was so delicious.  We dipped the tacos with it as well.  The bean tacos were filling even though there was no meat in there whatsoever.

Vegetarians will enjoy themselves in this joint.  Some items on the menu have the "VF" as the indicators that they can accommodate your vegetarian requests if you desire.  The service was friendly.  The young man behind the counter knows all of his regulars.  This place is a GEM in the neighborhood.  

Forget the generic airport food.  Get your orders to-go since you get these gourmet-quality items at very reasonable prices.  If you have time, there are a few tables to sit down and chill.

The service at Dos Ricco's was friendly and thoughtful, and the fusion inspired menu is fun. This place boasts Mexican and Thai food on their signage. But, I'm pretty sure the Korean bbq steak tacos were inspired by Korean food. Nevertheless, there are many good things to try. My friends and I ordered the chicken wings (sticky, sweet with some heat), avocado egg rolls (could have used more avocados than lettuce) with a spicy sriracha aioli, and an oversized crab rangoon (overflows with melty cream cheese, lobster and crab meat goodness) to share. 

Then we each dove into our entrees. The tempura shrimp taco was good but could have used actual tempura batter to make it less heavy. The Korean bbq steak in the taco could have been marinated with the sauce before grilling instead of tossing the meat in the sauce after it was cooked which made the sauce taste like an afterthought. The pickled onions on the taco were a nice touch though. My friends raved about the Korean bbq steak burrito bowls (ask for sauce on the side or no sauce at all if you don't know if you can take the heat), and the orange chicken rice bowl.

The horchata was good. A couple of us upgraded to add white chocolate to the drink. While tasty, I'm not sure how much it added to the overall drink ... let alone calories, but I digress. 

The dining room is small, with a few café style rounds. Al fresco dining is available. While there, the restaurant was consistently busy which is great. On my next trip, I may consider ordering the pad Thai burrito bowl. It looked delicious!

We ordered the avocado egg rolls and split the Korean BBQ tacos and burritos. The avocado egg rolls came with some sort of siracha mayo for dipping. The sauce does have a little spice to it! The burrito is a good size while the taco lacked a little in size. Just because I've had tacos in the past where they have been stacked high!  the more the merrier right? Flavor wise definitely a nice mix between Korean and Mexican...

This place was an absolutely fabulous find near Chicago Midway airport.  I was staying at the Holiday Inn near the airport and I thought my only options for food would be hotel bars.  I consulted my trusty Yelp app and was elated to find Dos Ricco's was an easy walk across the street.  If you blink, you may miss this place.  Look for the auto body shop; it's right next door.  You won't want to eat inside because it's really small and hot, so be prepared to make a take out order. 

I ordered a Korean barbeque taco and the chicken pad thai.  I was not expecting the portions to be so huge!  The pad thai was two meals worth for me and it was filled with huge chicken chunks and tasty cilantro.  The Korean barbeque taco was juicy steak, bbq sauce, onions and cilantro.  Everything melded nicely and the onions were a great contrast to the sweet bbq sauce. 

If you have the misfortune of having to stay in one of the hotels next to Midway airport, do yourself a favor and make lemons into lemonade (Pineapple lemonade in Ricco's case!) and walk on over to Ricco's!

Whoa!

We had a layover at the Midway Airport and the Uber here was worth every cent! We had the steak nachos... So good! My husband got the steak burrito fusion with sweet n sour sauce that was so stinking good I'll have dreams about it! I tried one steak and one Teriyaki chicken taco and I never wanted them to end. 

If you are in the area, you have to check it out!

I can't say enough positive comments about this place!

The food is unique and full of flavor combinations I've never experienced before. We came here because of its proximity to Midway Airport and its high Yelp reviews.

We had :
Ceviche - bright and light, subtle seafood flavors, with refreshing citrus
Dumplings - fried just right, with nice taste of scallions and a sweet dipping sauce
Korean BBQ Tacos - charred for smoky flavor with kick of cilantro and just the right amount of spice to make you feel it
Horchata - offered with white chocolate or caramel, but the original was sweet on its own

What really stood out was the service we experienced. We had our two children with us and we were sitting around a small table, when the owner (I presume), came out of the back to kindly ask some other patrons to move a bit so he could slide another table over to us! He, along with the other chef came out a few times to ask us how our food was, and offer desserts.

This was not what I was expecting from a small, shack-like (no disrespect), intimate venue like this. Ricardo and the team here deserve the praise and accolades they've received.

I highly recommend this place for a unique take on Mexican/Asian fusion. If I didn't live 40 miles away, I would be duke!

Okay, here is the deal...this place is a whole in the wall.  A real dump.  However, it is clean inside.  The food is amazing.  Everything is full of flavor.  The Mexican food has a hint of Asian influence and vice-versa.  If you went to a haute cuisine restaurant and were served this food, you would gladly pay ten times the price they charge.

Love this small place, it is cheap and yummy! Had the avocado rolls which I could have ordered so many more because it is that good. Had the chipotle chicken taco which was so tasty and the korean bbq beef taco which was also tasty, yet spicy for all you spicy lovers.

This has to be my 5th time here and I get something different every time. So now it's time for a review
This place may not look to appealing from a distance but let me tell you this. You have never seen or tasted burritos like this following more of a Asian style with there ingredients.

Let me start with there drinks from there coconut kiss to there pineapple lemonade.They are  all perfect not to sweet nor to watered down. There appetizer as well are  appealing from there avocado tools to there Thai wings(not to meaty) but the flaver is all there. Now for there main course. I personally love there chipotle chicken and there Korean bbq steak. 
That being said I hope you give this greatly combined Mex and Asian style food joint a try.. there owners are just simply the best very attentive and friendly.

Food great. Atmosphere not so much. The food prices are reasonable, especially considering the quality of flavor. I enjoyed the shrimp tempura burrito and DH enjoyed chicken Chipotle tacos. However, it is small and loud. And by small, I mean small like a tiny house restaurant small. Would go back to try other food but would take it to go.

First time trying this place and it definitely lived up to expectations. I had the Japanese lemonade after having a sample and it was amazing! Highly recommend trying it. For the appetizer we tried the avocado rolls which were unique and tasty and the steak salad which was surprisingly filling. The best part about the place is how nice the owner was. After we ate he came out to ask how the food was and offered us dessert. Definitely will be coming back

This place has absolutely fantastic food. Yes it's small in size but big on everything else. They have a different take Mexican tacos and tortas. They offer so much in there menu. I recommend the avocado rolls.

Hidden spot that has yummy food. The steak and shrimp tacos were flavorful and great size. I tried the pineapple lemonade and I think it goes great with vodka, although they do not sell liquor. They provided great service and were extremely friendly.

I don't even know where to begin. I never knew how badly I needed a restaurant like this in my life, until I found Dos Riccos. Asian and Mexican fusion? My husband and I were sold on that alone, I mean what could that possibly entail?

The food was OUTSTANDING! I now know where I will be eating at the end of every trip from Midway. You are led to believe the avocado rolls are the best, because of all the pictures on this yelp page, and you'd be correct. If you order anything order them, then order the Mexican egg rolls, because you can never have too many egg rolls. Then please order the Jalapeño pad Thai, because it will put most Thai restaurants to shame it's so good! Lastly, put an end to your dream like meal experience with their beverages, either the mangonada or pineapple lemonade. 

Do it. You will not regret it!

We saw Dos Ricco's on Chicago's Best and decided to give it a try before heading out of town at Midway. We tried the Korean BBQ burrito and the Shrimp burrito with ancho pepper aioli. Both were outstanding. We enjoyed the uniqueness of the Mexican / Asian fusion. It's not too close for us but I think this might be a regular place to visit whenever we have to go to MDW.

Really fresh, really fast! I would recommend. 

Chicken - steak - shrimp taco are killer. I had the burrito fusion.  You wouldn't think these 2 taste mix well but I was wrong. 

The burrito fusion is legit! :)

Great avocado rolls ! 
The ceviche I liked but it has a little hint of bbq infusion to it.
You have to have the tea and lemonade !

We had the avocado roll appetizer. ...very fresh and tasty. ..the shrimp tacos were delicious! ...and my honey ordered the fried tilapia on rice. ...two drinks....the tab was $38 dollars. 
The staff was very attentive and helpful when trying to choose from the menu. ..we'll come back for sure.

Can I type great 50 times and let that be the review. Had the Korean tacos which are excellent , meat is juicy ,spicy with the right amount of sarachi.  Next time I'm there I'm getting the infusion burrito that was recommended to me by the guy in line with me.

In my pervious review I praised this restaurant. The Mexican Asian fusion was delicious. It was unlike anything I have ever tasted. Recently went it in to grab some more grub and some delicious pineapple lemonade and was disappointed. The price of all items increased but the taste and quality of the food decreased immensely. My wife ordered Mandarin Chicken and it was uninspiring. My sweet and sour chicken burrito was bland and I regretted the choice. Sadly the pineapple lemonade did not save the meal either. The wantons were the best part I just wish they were bigger and had more filling.

I had passed this place and always wondered about their food. Mexican and Asian fusion?? I don't know, it could work but never made it there.

I have been there a couple of times and they were very different experiences. The first one was complete chaos. Phone was not working so could not order for pick up. When I got there, the line was huge and had to wait for a really long time, wouldn't have been such a big deal had I not been on lunch, but I was so...  

Second time around totally different story, ordered over the phone for pick up, get there no line, parking space available.

I have tried their steak, chicken and Korean tacos, all were great. I also had a pineapple lemonade, it is great. I can/t wait to go back and explore their menu a little bit more.

Parking here is a big deal, their parking lot is kinda small and there is no street parking. 

Dos Ricco's, a must if in the hood
They have a delicious Korean tacos and the lemonade are two things you must try. I gave it four stars because it's getting more expensive, but definitely worth trying those two things.

Stopped by there today after purchasing a groupon. First off the staff was pleasant, answered any and all questions and even made recommendations. The owner I'm assuming was a tall Hispanic man who frequently asked if we needed anything else, we dined inside since they have about 4 small tables. I had seen on another yelpers review the spicy Hawaiian pork tacos but they were not on the menu, when I asked for them they happily made them for me. All together we got the Hawaiian spicy tacos, Thai chicken wings, jalapeño pad Thai, avocado rolls, pork egg rolls, and a coconut drink...amazing!!! I will definitely be returning!

While waiting for a family members flight to arrive we ended up at this little place thanks to yelp.  First of all the service was good we weren't sure what to get and they were friendly and helpful.  However once we got our food it went downhill,  we ordered the fusion burritos one steak and one chicken teriyaki. It was the sweetest teriyaki I've ever had, and it was more of a rice burrito with a garnish of meat.  For $9 burrito I would hope for more meat so disappointing.  The only plus was the lemonade and the mango lemonade but very disappointing meal overall for $35 bucks.

Everytime I drove on Cicero to get to Midway, I spied Dos Ricco's with the Asian/Mexican sign out in front. Having moved from Orange County California, I'm familiar with the combination from some of the best food trucks around - two of my favorites are Dos Chinos (shout out to Hop) and Kogi BBQ. So when I tried Dos Ricco's the standard is high. 

I tried the burrito with bulgogi (Korean beef), rice, cabbage and cheese, and sriracha sauce. Overall, it was very good! My only suggestion would be to give it a bit of the vinegary kimchi "taste" to give it a nice contrast. But overall it was solid and I plan to return to try a few more items on the menu!

I had a Koren BBQ, Chicken Chipolte and Hawiian Chicken taco....Just the Tacos, no need for the rice and beans with me......$9.  Absolutely Delicious!  Wish I got 3 more!  Please, drive by McDonalds and check this place out.  We need more places like this.

I went to Dos Ricco's last evening with four other people, and we practically filled up the joint.  It's a somewhat nondescript little hole-in-the-wall on Cicero Avenue a few blocks south of Midway Airport.  If you are staying in one of the nearby hotels, you are in for a treat if you eat here (or take it to go).  The simply decorated seating area is pleasant enough, but can get warm and smoky once they start cooking in the kitchen.  While the menu stresses Mexican and Asian cuisine, for the most part they keep the two tastes separate.  

We ordered a bunch of items from their menu and passed them around.  Perhaps the stars were the Thai chicken wings (spicy and crunchy) and the bowl of jalapeno pad thai noodles.  The beef Korean BBQ  taco was not available this evening for some reason (was the Korean chef out??), but the steak and chipotle chicken tacos were good, as was the grilled steak burrito.  They do not serve booze (sorry - no margaritas) but the horchata was pretty tasty.

I love Korean barbecue tacos. The mixture of cuisines is perfect. Dos Ricco's makes a great one. The Regular taco comes on a corn tortilla, while the Korean version comes on a flour tortilla. However I would ask for the corn tortilla with their Korean selection. 

The service is super helpful, which really makes it a joy to visit the place. Be aware that it's not really a sit down restaurant, as there are only stools for about 10 people in the small ordering and eating space.

Great, quick, delicious, well priced. I'd give it 5 but the Korean BBQ tacos have room for a larger helping of meat. No qualms with the flavor however they were perfect. I tried a chicken taco as well just to compare and contrast and it was exactly like any good taco should be, full, flavorful, and hearty in helping. 

All in all I'd recommend.

I saw this place on one of those late night food venture shows a few months back. I think it might have been Chicago's Best. Somehow the idea of Mexican/Asian Fusion both intrigued and disgusted me. But having tried it, I can honestly say it's not gross at all. In fact, it's not bad at all.

When we entered we were greeted by Andy Dick's twin brother, a super friendly dude who explained every aspect of the menu. After much deliberation, we decided on two types of tacos, the avocado egg rolls and the jalapeño pad thai. 

They were kind enough to let us sit outside and brought us each dish as it was prepared, tapas-style. Meanwhile, my wife sipped on a Coconut Kiss signature drink that was much too sweet for me. And I had the pineapple lemonade, which tasted more like a cleaning product than a beverage. 

The avocado egg rolls were tasty, but nothing special or original about them. They're done at several other places just as well. But the avocado was fresh, and in large chunks.

The Korean BBQ tacos tasted like any other pulled beef barbecue you get anywhere else, but put into a nice taco tortilla and garnished. The chipotle chicken tacos were SUPER salty, and not as flavorful as I'd expected. I would not order those again.

They said something about the pad thai being rated #1 in the city. And y'know what? I see why. It was really good. And the jalapeño really added a nice kick to it. But unfortunately we went with just the chicken kind, and the chicken pieces were dry and salty from being over-seasoned and cooked too fast. I've made that mistake with white meat chicken a lot, so I'm kind of a pro and f*cking it up. 

All in all the food was just okay. I wouldn't revisit it. But the service was outstanding and that takes my review up from 3 stars to 4.

I drive past this place twice a day - and you will miss it if you blink!   Then I saw all the 5-star reviews on Yelp and knew I had to check it out.

Stopped in today for some takeout.   The owner/chef and his sister were behind the counter - absolutely the friendliest people I have come across in a long time.   Real genuine people.  

He talked to me about their menu and suggested the torta special they had that day.   I also got the crab wontons, kung pao chicken and a pineapple lemonade.   They food was made fresh, right in front of me - in under 10 minutes.    I wanted to try an assortment - and happy that I did.  I now have lots of leftovers, portions are big.   

I love crab rangoon, but their wontons were amazing!   I've never had anything that good!    The torta was made on a flat bread, with red peppers. tomatoes, lots of chicken, cheese, and a wonderful sauce.    Kung Pao was good, not spicy enough for me, but still good - lots of veggies, chicken, and rice.

I usualy never order a drink when doing takeout, but they mentioned a pineapple-lemonade, and I had to try it.   It was so refreshing! 

This is a BYOB restaurant.  They do not have tables, but about 10 stools and a counter.    I can't wait to go back - the food is amazing!!!

I was lucky to sample one of the new menu items about to be added - the Hawaiian Pork Sandwich (Torta/flatbread).  It's sweet and VERY SPICY.  I was so blown away by it, I had to buy one and rush it over to my cousin for him to try.  Same result.

It was *explicit* good, so *explicit* good I was like holy *explicit* this just blew my *explicit* mind!

Those few reviews that are ripping Dos Riccos are either on crack or are setting expectations to what they have experienced as "fusion" at other restaurants.  Listen:  DOS RICCOS is UNIQUE.  The ONE and ONLY.  He's the only one doing this kind of food and making it THIS way.  It's truly ORIGINAL.

Expect the unexpected!

Great drink menu! No alcohol.  the avocado appetizer could use a little bit of salt. The shrimp taco is better than the beef taco but both of them are very good.
This is a excellent place to hang out with friends. Small, cozy , & large selection of different tastes of food:Mexican or Asian.

I good friend told me about this place recently, and I instantly became obsessed! I NEEDED to try this place! The only problem is that it's so gosh darn far from me. 

So, since my co worker lives in the area, she was nice enough to pick us up some takeout for lunch on her way in one day. I ordered the infamous avocado rolls, and a mandarin orange fusion burrito. 

They were both great! The aioli sauce that came with the rolls was literally my dream come true. I loved it so much that at one point I was dipping my burrito in there as well. 

The burrito also didn't disappoint. I think what got me hooked was the quality of the chicken. It was so tender and juicy, the mandarin sauce was the perfect pairing. My only regret was not asking them for some Sriracha sauce on the side. Being Mexican myself, it almost felt morally wrong to eat a burrito with no hot sauce. Even if it was 'Asian fusion'.

Dos Ricco's is quite an experience. The restaurant itself is tiny, with only a couple of tables. During the summer months, there is a table outside. It is right next to Cicero, so the outside isn't great for kids. If it hadn't been for Yelp reviews, I certainly never would have given Dos Ricco's a second glance as I drove by.

But the food!

I love good asian cuisine (having lived in Asia for a number of years), but have never experienced the style of latin-asian fusion that Dos Ricco's puts out. The avocado spring rolls are divine, and the burritos and tacos are also delicious. Kimchi really lends itself to tacos, but I've only seen such tacos at a few places.

Dos Ricco's is an experience, and I would strongly recommend anyone with a few minutes before/after their flight to drop in.

Interesting combos. Asian and Mexican infusion. I tried the Korean steak bbq torta, two of my favorites combined. It was amazing. I also tried the egg rolls and found them to be good but nothing special. However their pineapple lemonade is outstanding. The place is a hole in the wall, hard to see at night and very small dining area. You're served behind a glass window. There seemed to be locals who frequented the place there eating. I got mine to go.

My friends who live in Oak Lawn turned me on to this place, and I don't know whether to be upset or thrilled. Why, Dos Ricco's? Why must you be so far away from me? I have had their tempura steak fusion burrito with teriyaki sauce twice. I have also had their chipotle chicken burrito twice. Both are GLORIOUS and to die for! I would imagine that their tacos are just as splendid. I am typically not a fan of burritos but I downright crave the ones that are made here. Most of all, the prices are so affordable. 

I cannot comment on the ambiance since I have never dined-in. From what I understand, it's a hole-in-wall joint. It's one of those gems that have great quality food for low prices. I could swear everything on the menu is under $9. Dos Ricco's, please expand onto the north side of Chicago. You guys would put other places out of business.

I can't say anything bad about this place because I haven't found anything wrong with it. Food is delicious!  The people are so nice and helpful! I love the pineapple limonada! The burritos are so good! I need to try more items on the menu....I have a feeling I won't be disappointed!

I read most of the reviews and was excited to buy the Groupon for this place($12 for $20 worth of food) today.  The place is small; too small.  The parking is confusing: they share it with AAMCO Repair Shop next door; not sure which side is which.  Entered restaurant which was presentable, nothing to brag about; it was small, seating was tight.  Reviewed menu, lots of typos and what I thought would be tasty meals.  I placed ordered with cashier who was also the cook....wondered if she washed her hands between handling money & cooking????   I should have checked.  There was a guy serving and packing food; a young male, who didn't cook....The lady was nice; took order; spoke Spanish at first but went into English since I'm non-Latino and the menu is as well.  Everything sounded good on the menu.  I ordered avocado rolls, asian fusion burrito, 2 steak tacos & a bowl of rice plus a horchata.   The horchata wasn't bad; it taste like a standard horchata infused with ginger.  Different, but I liked it.  The rolls are not impressive at all.  Just fried dough stuffed with avocado plus a dipping sauce; nothing impressive, greasy, tasteless....The burrito was made like this(my guess)....a burrito taco shell, some pizza cheese, 2 day old rice, and frozen Asian styled chicken(I tasted more breading than chicken)...it was supposed to be tempured styled w/mandarin sauce?????   I ordered my partner the tacos and he said it tasted like beef jerky, definitely not steak and the rice was bland......my assumption is that the 2 employees that worked there once worked in an Asian buffet restaurant and since they are Mexican thought the 2 ethnicities blended together and decided to open this place...hmmmmmm no...I believe in racial mixing; i'm a product of it, but not food.  These 2 cultures have distinguished tastes and they should be kept apart....I will never ever go here again....Sorry guys.

My husband  and I wanted to try something different that was close by. We saw the good reviews and decided to come here. It was great once we came in a young man greeted us he was very friendly he gave us some suggestions on what to try. We got the avocado roll the burrito with shrimp and it was all very delicious and different I love the mixture of spices. Definitely we will be coming back!

Thanks to Yelp, a buddy and I stopped by here when we had a few extra minutes on our way to Midway. Yelp, you did not lead us wrong. 

The fried avocado rolls were on the spot, even more so when dipped in the Sriracha aoli. The Korean BBQ burrito was just the right mixture of tangy and spicy, and the shrimp tasted fresh. Couple all that with the homemade horchata and pineapple lemonade and this is five stars.

We were looking for the tastiest most interesting food near the airport as possible and Dos Ricos nailed it. Their Hawaiian pork tacos were so amazing and my boyfriends chicken pad tai was spicy enough for us even (we've been hitting the ghost peppers these days). Would absolutely go back and recommend!

This place is tiny and the parking is scarce, but we luckily went during a slow time.  It was worth it.  My girlfriend had beef, chicken, and fried shrimp tacos, which were delicious.  My favorite was the burrito with Korean BBQ beef- not a flavor that I would normally associate with a burrito, but it really works.  I'm definitely coming back here.

Shrimp tacos hit the spot again ladies and gentlemen!! Two spicy shrimp tacos and a regular shrimp taco! The trimmings are plentiful and flavorful-not as spicy as you would think though. Wifey and I attacked the food like there was no tomorrow n took these bad boys down!!!

Ohh! Ohhhh! That tilapia burger!!!! Lightly breaded with just the right amount of condiments-it's freakin orgasmic... melts in yo mouth!

We washed it all down with the pineapple lemonade...heaven!

It's good for a shack. But if you're not looking for a deep fried high calorie foods, then stay away. 

Thai chicken wings - I personally thought they were kind of gross even though they were labeled a customer favorite. It was just way too much sauce. I can see why other people like them since I don't particularly enjoy wings due to lack of meat. 

Avocado rolls - the item I most enjoyed, but a very oily food

Pork dumplings - Meat inside exceeded expectations, but I still wished it wasn't such a fried food

Korean BBQ taco - it was okay, but not anything impressive

Last thing I'd say is that I wished I avoided the appetizers altogether and got a burrito. Just keep that in find. My curiosity around the appetizers personally didn't pay off.

What the heck just happened?? 

I was initially intrigued by the Asian/Mexican fusion concept...how can that possibly work?  Egg-foo-youngritos?  Kitty-catacos?  I imagined walking out of there with an oddly-filled burrito and some Kikkoman soy sauce packets.  

Instead, Ricardo served up the most savory steak burrito I've ever tasted!  His steak Torpita does a much better job of soaking up all the delicious meat juices as you eat your way through it - but it is ok to lick your plate clean anyway, right?

My old hood has a very talented and passionate young chef running an unexpected joint you should visit right now.  Good work sir!!  I respect the direction you've taken and I'm sure you'll be serving a lot of that complimentary aromatic coffee soon!

The only downside to this place is it's too small (and often busy) and the hours can be a bit erratic - especially on Sundays. That said, the food is great and definitely try the Korean BBQ tacos and pineapple lemonade - you won't regret it.
Tasty, fast food!  We enjoyed the dumplings, mango lemonade, and burritos.  The eating area is small, bit who cares?  We'll definitely go again.

I have to say, from the outside, the place does not look like much and the inside doesn't get much better. The food on the other hand makes the review worth every star it is getting. The food is amazing. Now they can take a bit long to cook the food compared to other Mexican or even Asian restaurants, but its because they are cooking everything fresh. I have tried almost everything on the menu, and have not found anything that does not taste amazing. Do your self a favor and stop by this place. I would say my favorite food is their burritos. The burritos are almost like Chipotles but mixed with a little bit more of Mexican. You can not go wrong if you are looking for some great take out food.
I came in with a groupon and I loved it,, I love there Food , I love the Coco kiss Drink , and the workers are very hospitable . I will be returning with my family  :)

Great little find near Midway Airport.  I had the avocado rolls appetizer and the Korean BBQ tacos.  The rolls were creamy smooth with a crunchy exterior, great combination of texture and flavor.  Tacos were excellent as well with tender steak, sweet BBQ flavor, and tangy spice was a tasty combination.  Built for carry outs but has a small seating section that is very clean.  The staff is very friendly and helpful, give this place a try!

Decided to try this place out since we were driving pass it. The place is small and gets a bit smokey once they start cooking. They were friendly.

Horchata - This was good. It was sweet, but not overly sweet. Also, didn't have a strong cinnamon flavor like most horchatas.

Korean BBQ Taco - This was good. I just couldn't put my finger on this distinctive taste. It wasn't that greasy either.

Poblano Mozzarella Burger - This was pretty good. Had a unique taste and it was cooked nicely. We thought it would have more of a kick, but it didn't.

Kung Pao Chicken - We didn't really care for this. My guy thought it had too much MSG or something and didn't really care for it. I didn't really care for the chicken being deep fried and maybe I'm not use to it this way.

I would like to come back to give the Pad Thai and some other items a try.

We joked where else can you get Chinese, Korean and American/Mexican in one place. Give it a try if you are in the area. There is a small parking lot so that helps.

Phenomenal fusion food! The perfect combination of Asian and mexican food.

Definitely recommend the chipotle chicken tacos, they are my favorite
This is a nice out of the way place to eat something different. Worthwhile to seek it out. Service was great and the food was tasty.

This place is awesome and so highly reviewed for a reason

Love the concept, go check it out!
Great food!! This place is very small and would not have expected the quality of food from the outside.
Great food. I had the Korean BBQ beef tacos, Thai Wings, and Shrimp Tacos on my visit. All were top notch!

Honeymoon is over. In the beginning I was rooting for this place given that it was a different and ingenious idea. I've bought from this place at least 8-10 times but on the most recent visits I've had these issues:

Bought a yelp deal and they wouldn't honor it because only the owner knew how to redeem it and he wasn't there at the time so I ended up paying for the deal and the meal...go figure, so I decided to give it another try.

The following visit wasn't any better, I paid for my order which included 1 poblano burger, 3 tacos and a pad thai, about $38 total so the owner asks how many sauces I need and I said 2 of each (green,red) so he says to me, I've included two so you have to pay for the additional ones, I said ok but I don't want to use my credit card to pay 50 cents for the extra sauces, he pauses as if to let me know that I have two choices, take 2 or pay for the 2 extra ones, so after the long pause he says "Ok, I'll give you the extra sauces but I'll charge you next time you come"...Are you kidding? Making a big deal about the tiny sauce cups after I spent close to $40? Ok so I tell myself it's okay it's a business so every little bit of money counts for them. When I get home with my dinner I realize that the steak tacos have are missing the grilled onions and bell peppers they usually come with, only cabbage and cilantro in them, that bothers me a little because it's shows there's no consistency on how they make their meals, if he had mentioned that they were out of onion/peppers I would have been okay with substituting those ingredients but the fact that they swap the ingredients hoping you won't notice just makes me mad...

So about a week later I decided to pick up 3 poblano burgers since they were pretty awesome, when I get there I noticed they were getting ready to prepare some sauces, I saw a large clear container filled with boiled/cooked tomatoes which they were using to make the sauce...fast forward to when I get home and discovered that instead of the normal raw tomato slices they put in the burgers I see that the owner put 2 large wedges of the cooked tomatoes in each one of the burgers...I could not believe my eyes, why would he cheat me like that..."oh we're out of tomatoes, no problem I'l just throw in a few of these hot and disgusting cooked tomatoes in there and no one will notice, cooked tomato is still tomato isn't it?"...

That was it for me, I gave this place too many chances to get things right but each time I tried they kept proving that they are not consistent with their recipes, they don't care about customer satisfaction (I'm not even a picky/whiny customer) and they almost rather lose a customer than give away 50 cents worth of sauce to keep that customer happy. 

Food is good but not good enough for me to put up with the annoyances.

Love this hole in the wall place. It may be small, but the food is amazing. Everything we tried had intense flavors that went so well together. My favorite was the korean tacos and the sopas. The drinks were all refreshing and delicious. Best horchata I've ever had in my life! The chef came out and talked to us. He's a very friendly guy and we could tell he truly wanted to improve on his already amazing culinary dishes. This place makes going to the Midway-area worh it.

Mexican / Asian fusion may be a new trend but that's a good thing. I've been to this place a few times.

I usually have tacos or the burritos. But I've tried some of the other items on the menu. I had the chile de arbol fried rice which was good but I thought it was kind of bland. The avocado roll is actually deep fried - I was expecting something akin to a sushi roll.

I had the different burritos on occasion. The Korean one is tasty. It is made with rice a la Chipotle. 

Bottom line; good solid Mexican food with an Asian twist.

It took me several visit to Chicago to finally convince someone to try this.  Well, the best crab ragon I have ever had.  We also had the  pork egg rolls and the avocado egg rolls and they hit the spot. Also had the infusion burrito(chicken) and it was so fresh and spot on.  They have very few main stream drinks.  But the y make a pineapple lemonade that was crazy good.  Had the flan it was good but a little pricey.  Overall, we would return and try other great looking things on the menu.

While Dos Ricos may have a questionable exterior, this food is not to be questioned. I have eaten more than my fair share of Kung Pao chicken and this restaurant slings up some tasty Kung Pao. It was awesome! Will definitely be heading back to this place (probably not at night though, just sayin').
Good food but really slow service make sure you place your order before you arrive or you'll be spending 30+ min for your dish.

I wasn't sure quite what to expect from Dos Riccos, but the reviews were decent and they were in walking distance of the Midway Hampton Inn, so I went for it.

I really enjoyed the bulgogi (Korean BBQ) burrito, and their spicy asian wings had a tasty burn to go with the crispy breading. I went for a aqua fresca to complement the meal, and left entirely satisfied.

The place is a bit small, and you'll miss it if you blink, but it's worth taking a look.

Honest review its not good the food is so overrated to the max like youll eat here n be like wtf thats what the hypes about n btw it is expensive n portions are small its jus like a normal taco place nothing special i would go to tio luis instead that place is great
Been a fan of Ricardo and his food since he opened. Unfortunately I learned two valuable lessons today. 1. Don't go there when he's not there. 2. Plan on waiting a long time for your food.

I can't stress this enough: THIS IS THE BEST RESTAURANT I HAVE EVER EATEN AT...EVER!!! Every single bite of every single item I tried was the best version of that dish I've ever tried. The pad thai, tortas, tacos, horchata, all the most amazing fresh handmade foods, even down to the sauces and hot chilies! I'm at a loss for words...no amount of money I've ever spent at a restaurant even comes close to the quality of this food. If you're lucky enough to eat here you've found the holy grail!!!

This is a take out place, unless you like eating elbow to elbow at a counter. 

Chipotle chicken tacos- These have layer upon layer of savory mouth watering deliciousness. THESE tacos are show stoppers!! ..and I'm not even a chicken taco fan but these babies have won me over!! If I could rate each food item, I'd give these 5 stars. 

Korean Tacos- Eh. The meat is soft but you will run into unpleasant chewy gummy stuff. The flavor is ok, really not that special. (2stars)

Steak Tacos- Terrible. Seriously. The meat is tough, chewy, flavorless, and dry. (Fallen star)
Orange Chicken- Very tasty! Lightly battered with a sweet/savory/citrusy sauce, came with white rice.  (4.5 stars)

Kung Pao Chicken- Extremely salty. Lightly battered. We're talking can't take more than one bite type salty. (Fallen, salty star)

Avocado Rolls- Delicious! Savory mix of flavors and the accompanying sauce is delish as well. (4.5 stars)

Coco drink- Good, nothing outta this world. Actually seems like they poured open a Goya coco water n put it in a plastic glass with a squirt of red food coloring. I don't understand what the red was supposed to be for, it only added color but no flavor. At $3, I'd skip this drink. (2 stars)

Pineapple drink- Yummy, strong citrus flavor, tangy and sweet. Very good. (3.5 stars)
--
Clean. No bathrooms. Service is a bit slow. 

I'll definitely be coming back for only the select items that are the bomb. 

In closing..

tacos=

Great food!
Great food!
Great food!
Minimal seating
Minimal parking

Did I say
Great food?

Love this place! I went here because of the yelp reviews I saw, thank you to all who do the reviews. Love the avocado rolls, they're a must when we go! We've (the family) have had the tacos, burrito and my husband had the burger. Everything vegan for us. We also have had the coconut kiss drink, yummy!

Flew into Chicago Midway and had an unexpected 2-hour wait for our baggage...  Just enough time to pick up our rental car and grab a quick lunch.  

Thanks to Yelp, we discovered Dos Ricco's within a mile or so of the airport.  Who knew that Mexican & Asian fusion could be such a treat. 

We started with the Avocado Rolls (fantastic), then sampled the Shrimp and Chipotle Chicken Tacos (subtle and wonderful...with a bit of sriracha for kick)... Then we went for seconds! 

Also had a fabulous salad I can't recall the name of.  Topped it off with their homemade horchata which was exceptional thanks to the unexpected hint of anise.

Even though it's an order-at-the-counter place, the service was excellent...positive vibes all around, and these guys' pride in the business they're building is evident.  One of their employees came in on his day off to get lunch and immediately began pitching in to help serve us and share his enthusiasm for his favorite dishes.

The majority of other patrons we met were flight attendants for Frontier Airlines who have discovered this tasty treat just down the street from the hotel where they stay during layovers. It's a humble little gem with innovative dishes worthy of a major chef.   

And a bargain, of course.
5 stars for a great idea and even better execution. Recommend veggie burrito - explosion of flavors.

This is one of Chicago's hidden gems ! Amazing food food you just wont find anywhere else !!!

   I stumbled upon this hidden gem long before they were featured on Chicago Best  as a picky eater i was a more then happy to see the kitchen and the cleanliness practiced in the establishment! 

top pics : 
 1)Korean bbq  Tacos - so tender and delicious 
2)Avocado egg rolls  - an amazing concept i wasn't sure what to expect  but ended up being the best thing i pretty much ever ate!
3)thai chicken wings - one order just isnt enough let me warn you these suckers are so delicious you will be coming back for more guaranteed

Poblano Mozzarella burger was amazing! Fusion Steak burrito was perfectly seasoned and a refreshing change to the same old same old. My husband loved it! 

Customer service was amazing and very quick. This will definitely become our new go to spot

They initially bring out bread and orange stuff (who knows the name of it) and it tastes excellent. 

We ordered a donor kebab and it tastes similar to the ones in istanbul.

I write this review four hours after eating here, and I'm still full.  I ate so much...but it was so good.

I had the soup of the day (a tomato and butter purée), the kale salad, the combo plate, and the bread with carrot spread.  All of the dishes were flavorful, well-prepared, and (seemed) healthy.

This was also my kids' first experience with Turkish food.  They all enjoyed the bread, hummus, and kebabs.

The only unfortunate part is that we're from out of town and likely won't be back.

No, no, no!!! I am definitely not going back. 
I have never had a lahmacun for $10 and which is not the best! They "invented" something like double sized lahmacun, which is not. Making the dough extremely thin and longer doesn't mean it is doubled. It is tricking people. I am glad that it is not my first lahmacun experience  and so I can make the judgement and my judgement tells me not to go somewhere cares about money more than honesty. It is not the best food. It is ok food, nothing special. Service is not great. I don't know how many times my order came wrong. 
There are a lot of Turkish restaurant/cafe in Chicago, tastier, and better.

This is my go to spot, I love zizi and how friendly he is. They make their own bread, and how many places these days actually do that. The bread is phenomenal, and the carrot spread they give with it is a perfect balance of sweet, creamy, and crunchy.

Everything I have eaten has been delicious. Lentil soup I great on a cold day. Chicken doner sandwich has huge chunks of tender juicy chicken that has been roasting for probably forever. The BEST thing is the pide. It's like a 100000 times better version of a pizza. Super thin crust and stuffed with lamb and cheese. A must try.
After a full day of CUBS celebration we found this place through other reviews and wow were they right.  Everything was fresh and authentic.  I can't wait to come back.
Great food and service!  This was my first time here, and first time having Turkish cuisine, but I will definitely be back in the future.

I'm really glad I got to try this place since I've been having a craving for Turkish/Mediterranean food since coming back from Turkey. I ordered Zizi's favorite wrap and the portion size is quite tremendous. While it was satisfying and I liked the meat, it fell quite short of what I had in Turkey (look up Durumzade - a shrine should be made for that restaurant). It was savory but I wished there was more vegetables and flavor inside the wrap. 
The fries are average and could have used more seasoning. 

Still, it's a nice environment and it would be a great place for a quick lunch. They were relatively empty when I came in the early afternoon.

This place is a real gem. There's a lot of love, talent, and years of experience in this food. The ingredients are fresh, the spices are a symphony without becoming overbearing. The homemade bread is so good, you will feel a profound pity for the gluten-intolerant. 

Be adventurous with the menu, I'm still working my way through it, and with each experience I become more of a believer. The service and hospitality of the staff is really warm, and it's a place you feel comfortable and attended to - not rushed in and out. Turkish people take meals leisurely.

The doner is amazing. For those unfamiliar it's a Turkish gyro. If you like meat, if you on a paleo diet, if you wanna avoid carbs, this place has lots of great options if you can avoid that bread.

Love Zizi's! I work down the block and their food is great! Sometimes the food takes a while, but that is because everything is made to order!! No heat lamps here, everything comes fresh from an oven or pan of some sort! The owners are super sweet and hospitable. They support a lot of young people, such as students by giving them jobs, so sometimes they aren't the best career waitress ever, but I think its great that Zizi gives opportunities to people like these. 

Some of the negative reviews here read very much like people who own competing Turkish restaurants, or friends/family of such people. 

Zizi's is also vegetarians and gluten-free friendly. I personally love the veggie moussaka, the ezme, the fresh salads with falafel. If you like Turish/Mediterranean food definitely give Zizi a try!

What an amazing meal. One of the Best lamb donör (gyros) and kefta I have had period. Eat here.

Immediate reaction after eating a delicious meal,
I really loved everything - this place is the real deal,
We came for lunch right when they opened it,
It was empty so we didn't know what was expected,
We sat down and it started to get the lunch crowd too,
And it looked like they had a lot of take out and delivery on queue,
The server she was kind and as we looked through the menu,
She brought out homemade bread and a carrot, yogurt garlic dipping sauce for me and you know who,
As we ate the bread in the sauce fireworks went off in my mouth,
I knew that I was living that low carb life but to the window that went out,
It was amazing bread that should be in all the high end spots,
But it is the type of homemade food that they would no nothing about,
We got the lamb donör (gyros) and the kefta platters, with a choice of rice only or rice n couscous mix,
We waited with baited breath for the food I was hungry so I really wanted it,
And when it arrived and we took the first bite,
For that moment (and the entire meal) I felt like everything in the world would be alright,
The kefta was grilled to perfection and the lamb donör was beautifully sliced,
I was so glad this food and this moment of perfection finally came into my life,
Served with some grilled veggies and a yogurt sauce, the owner came by with a smile ear to ear that showed me he loved his job,
I could not decide what was more lovely, the food, the waitress, or the fresh flowers on every table, 
And last but not least was a dessert only written about in fables,
It is the national Turkish dessert I can't remember the name but it was wild,
like a tiramisu and a panna cotta had a torrid love affair which resulted in a beautiful child,
As I left headed home on the brown el track,
I already daydream of the moment when I get to go back,

Really good, fast Turkish food. I usually get take out, but the restaurant and patio look quite nice. 

The kind of big sandwiches that you can't put down once you've picked them up. Unfortunately, the fries are always limp and soggy.

Dissatisfaction and Disappointment! 

The tables were dirty and the space cadet waitress didn't even bother to clean them. the owner had to run over and set her straight.  I've Never seen such lazy service. 
The Turkish bread with sesame seeds was under cooked. The chicken Doner was Over salted, the rice was under cooked. The entrée stated that it included 
Veggies as well. unfortunately 90%of the veggies were potatoes with No flavor.
I asked the server for more veggies instead of potatoes because I didn't want to Overdose on carbs. Mind you ; Bread, rice and then potatoes. .
the server comes back and Guest what ?
She brings More potatoes.  I told her again that I wanted veggies and she just stood there and smiled clueless to what I was talking about.
Im Not coming back to a place where the owner doesn't care how his 1st time patrons get treated.

Fresh and friendly. Really yummy and unique pita bread. Hummus is a little lumpy-- not bad, just FYI. Really nice presentation, even for take out. Huge portions. Good fries. 

Looking forward to trying their full menu! Some neat items--- like carrot spread.

We ordered chicken wraps and a salad to go. Broccoli and carrots for side dish. We weren't able to just purchase the wraps, they come with side dishes whether you want them or not.  Our meals were packaged in a way that spilt everything, but fortunately there was a plastic bag on the outside, paper on the inside. 

The broccoli/carrot side dish was excellent. The chicken was spiced tastily in the wraps, and the chicken salad was okay.  It was just spring mix from Kroger, nothing special.  But they did cook the chicken when we placed our order. 

It appears to be a neighborhood favorite place, there were a lot of post-exercise young moms having lunch here.
I tried pide with sucuk and cheese, and it was delicious. Cigar borek with feta cheese was amazing. Doner was also good, and I liked the baklava and kunefe. Definitely deserves a five star!

ZiZi's serves excellent Turkish cuisine at a great value! 

Whether you're hungry for lunch or dinner, you are going to leave ZiZi's feeling very satisfied. When dining in, you are served complimentary bread with carrot spread. The spread is made of julienned carrots, garlic, and yogurt. It is so good that we've ordered it as an appetizer before. The bread is also remarkable and is the best tool for soaking up the delicious carrot spread. 

I have had the chicken kebab, chicken doner kebab, the kofte wrap--all meals that I would definitely order again. The portions are hearty and the food is always super flavorful! I really loved the fresh french fries and the seasoned bulgur! 

The prices are affordable and the restaurant is BYOB. However, there is a corkage fee ($2 per person). ZiZi's is family-owned and definitely worth supporting. This is a great place to eat and drink in LakeView.

Stopped by for dinner with some friends. Complimentary carrot appetizer and homemade bread. The carrot dish is a cold shaved carrot salad with non-acidic dressing. I couldn't figure out what the carrot dish was but it was great especially when eaten with the bread. I ordered Zizi's kale salad with a side of chicken. The salad was made up of chopped kale, garbanzo beans, pickled beets and portobello mushroom and tossed in a red wine vinaigrette. The salad was fresh and crisp and the chicken had a ton of flavor. My only complaint was the dressing was a tad too acidic for me. Nonetheless I finished the entire salad. My friends ordered a variety of dishes and they all enjoyed their dishes and complimented the taste and flavor. 

Overall, nice place for casual meal and to catchup with friends. The entire meal took nearly two hours and we never felt rushed. We had about 7 people in our party and even though they couldn't provide individual checks they allowed us to pay individually at the register. It's BYOB, affordable, and steps from Beercade and Diversey Brown Line.

I tried the kebab sandwich.... what a mediocre job... 1 skewer of minced meat ( kofta) a little bit of lettuce and a little bit of onion wrapped in large tortilla wrap .... with greasy fries on the side ... for $12. This is ridiculous ... i truly wished at least the flavor is amazing but it is not... i am sure i wont be back again.

We had a very delicious dinner tonight.
I ordered a full plate of doner. It was delicious. As a desert, kunefe. Amazing food...

 The deserts are worth of gaining the calories.
 
Kunefe, baklava and kazandibi are my favorites.

There are several different mediterranean restaurants I go to, in town. But I loved this place for 3 reasons:

1.Location is very easy, right by the redline.
2.Delicious and well cooked food.
3.Sympatethic, friendly and honest customer service.

Also I'd like to thank Zizi and service team for their hospitality tonight and they always have smiling face which I like the most.
 
Hopefully will be back soon with more friends!

Ever since going to Germany many years go and stopping at a doner stand to partake in one of the best late night treats I've ever eaten, I've searched throughout Chicago to find a great doner place; I never did.  Then a friend, who has never had doner, recommended I try this place and I thought it'd be another dead end.  Luckily for me I was wrong, and for that I came out of Yelp retirement.

I went to the unassuming storefront with few outdoor tables and walked into a pretty large space.  After being seated I was greeted with an unexpected starter of some sort of carrot spread and bread.  The bread was oven fresh and the spread went great with it.  The amount of carrot spread they provided was portioned perfectly for the basket of bread.

Now if there's one thing that I learned that truly makes a doner great, it's the bread.  When that doner came out sandwiched between two beautiful pieces of warm bread I knew it was going to be good.  The first bite was a symphony of spiced lamb, creamy sauce, and that splendidly soft and chewy bread that reminded me of that night in Germany.  This doner is legit.  It had the right amount of onions and cabbage so that everything complimented each other nicely.  This is what I've been searching for.

The fries seemed fresh cut and were lightly salted.  When the very kind waitress asked if I wanted ketchup or hot sauce, I was pleasantly surprised to get sriracha.  It went well with the fries and the doner.  Though it's not like the doner needed anything more.

I will definitely go back because the doner was spectacular. I'll bring others with me so I can try other things on the menu, particularly the lahmacun. But really is the doner on that wonderful bread that lures me back. Lastly, the wait staff was attentive and really nice, and that's always a huge plus.

For a first-timer, Turkish food is full of unfamiliar names, but you already know everything that's on your plate. Yogurt. Eggplant. Tomatoes. Loads of olive oil. These are ingredients we all know and love. The Turks just do it better.

The menu is vegetable-rich, grill-friendly, gently-spiced-yet-full-flavored. And once you taste the extra depth and creaminess in a bowl of yogurty cacık, there's no going back to tzatziki. Best tabouli I've ever had!

Meh.

Everything was fine, nothing special. I ordered the combo. Salmon though wasn't to my liking; weird extra fishy/deep see spoiled fish taste.

This was my first meal here in Chicago. Very cozy and cute family run business, and the staff members were so friendly. The Eggplant Tower was good and flavorful, although slightly on the greasy side and made me quite thirsty. My friend got the quinoa salad which was massive and looked very healthy. They were so friendly to us and they gave us a rice pudding on the house! It reminded me of my mom's rice pudding and really had a good ending to the meal.
Good place.  The food is always fresh and delicious.  The owner is friendly and so is the rest of the staff.  Lamb and chicken are my top choice.  Good bread too!

Good hearty bread abounds at Zizi's Cafe, from the pita and spiced carrot-yogurt spread that came first to the cubes of crusty bread lining our Iskender Kebab platter. The storefront on Sheffield is unassuming but the restaurant is actually quite spacious and we were staffed by a kindly young woman who dealt with our indecision with good grace. We eventually got the starter combo platter - an impressive array of textures and flavors - and the Iskender platter which I was a little disappointed by - the lamb and beef was good but not as lively in either flavor or texture as I would have hoped for from something supposedly freshly grilled. I also couldn't taste the contribution of the spicy walnut butter. Nonetheless, this was a nice quiet place with good food to have a late afternoon lunch on Saturday and I would come back to try other items on the menu.

The best restaurant in the area! If the menu looks like your type of food, you will be grateful you visited Zizi's. The service is unparalleled and authentic; the customer is always valued. Cannot say enough great things!

Food-------4.5
Ambience--2.5

I would have given it 5 stars, had it not been for the soggy french fries served with my amazingly delicious Chicken Doner sandwich.  (Just FYI, Zizi's french fries are made from "real"  potatoes.)  Too bad they weren't served hot , right out of the fryer. The chicken, was perfectly seasoned and cooked .  The veggie garnishes were fresh & crisp. The Lebanese bread it was served on was to die for.    

Unfortunately, as one astute Yelper put it, " they haven't spent much ....on the decor".  But that's OK.  I'm here for the food, not the decor.  A simple bud vase with a few fresh  flowers is always a nice touch, but when every table has  a vase of drooping flowers, that's not cool.  It would be better to have just a napkin, silverware & salt/pepper shaker.  86 the flower idea!  

The solution is an easy fix. With food as good as this, order online for delivery or pick up.

Zizi's is amazing. 

Pretty much every Sunday night I order a caesar salad with chicken for take out. It's always available right when I walk in to pay and the salad is one of the best I've had. The croutons are absolutely amazing, dunno if they're tossed with garlic, parmesan, or what, but they're superb. The caesar dressing is homemade and it's fantastic, definitely distinguishes itself from most other dressings. 
But the highlight - the chicken. Whoever thought of taking chicken doner and putting it on a caesar salad was a genius...a mad genius. It's superb. I could eat that chicken forever.

I've also had their kebab plates which were very good. Pretty much got the sample platter the first time that had all their meats  - the chicken, doner, meatball, kebabs, and even salmon. Everything was very good. Sizable portion as well so I took maybe 1/3 of it home. I'd definitely get it again. Some of the doner was pretty greasy, but that's the only complaint and it's a minor one.

The bread deserves a mention as well, not entirely sure what the bread is, it's like a pita but stuffed and more fluffy on the inside. It's great and the hummus they have pairs with it perfectly.

Highly recommend Zizis

I like this place. It has some really good Turkish food. I do want to give a comment about the ventilation of the restaurant. Unfortunately, it is not ventilated well at all. Every time I go there, me and my clothes smell like restaurant (meat and fried stuff). This isn't pleasant and it makes me hesitate to come here. Please fix the ventilation of this place so people don't leave smelling like the restaurant.

For a first-timer, Turkish food is full of unfamiliar names, but you already know everything that's on your plate. Yogurt. Eggplant. Tomatoes. Loads of olive oil. These are ingredients we all know and love. The Turks just do it better.

The menu is vegetable-rich, grill-friendly, gently-spiced-yet-full-flavored. And once you taste the extra depth and creaminess in a bowl of yogurty cacık, there's no going back to tzatziki. Best tabouli I've ever had!

Everything was fine, nothing special. I ordered the combo. Salmon though wasn't to my liking; weird extra fishy/deep see spoiled fish taste.
