We went around 1:30 on Monday Sep 28 and were seated immediately.  There were a few tables but the downtown lunch rush was over.  The place was really clean and decorated nicely.  The seating was comfortable and the environment was quite.  We could talk normally and were not competing with other tables to hear each other.  

The food was AMAZING.   Everyone had something different but my BLT was off the chain!  I had mashed potatoes with it that were very bland but the experience was good.  The waitress was nice but a little slow with refills  The food took a while to come out of the kitchen but I was okay waiting for it because it was tasty.  I recommend going here when visiting Chicago and I will go back because the food was great.

Modern decor, with surprisingly delicious food.   I had the red snapper entre and asked to substitute vegetables for the other sides - the kitchen accommodated me with a mixed vegetable saute of asparagus, broccoli, and brussels sprouts that was almost the star of the show, upstaged only by the perfectly cooked  snapper (the skin wasn't crispy, but the actual filet was so good that I gladly pulled it off to get to the meat).

The wine, cocktail, and beer list is comprehensive and delicious.  Service is informal and very good - there when you want someone, not when you don't.  Strongly recommended.

I wish I could write zero stars. This place used to be great and used to advertise late night food. As a local resident this was a reliable place. Then out of random they decided to change their food hours and when we sat at the bar looked at us such as "how did you not know?" This is no way to run business and this explains why you need to cut staff late at night to survive. No wonder you're about to fail. Close your doors so you can bring a good establishment in to run a proper late night business in an area that would kill the revenue needed to survive.

We were staying right across the street at a hotel so this restaurant was very convenient. There were four of us and we wanted to sit at the bar. We ordered mimosas and bloody Mary's. The bloody Mary's were excellent. The mimosas were warm.  Our bartender was great. 

I had the chiliquiles. Absolutely the worst. No flavor no depth and no originality. 

We ordered a cup of chili and it was terrible. 

The bagel and salmon plate was equally terrible. Dry salmon. 

They were out of buiscuts n gravy. Really? Flour, milk and sausage. There is a Whole Foods Market right across the street. Take a $20 out of the till and go buy some!

The Decour was nice and it is in a good location.

I came here last night after seeing the fireworks at the navy pier. This place was one of the only restaurants open late. We ordered buffalo spring rolls and truffle fries to share. Both appetizers were good. I ordered a beet arugula salad with skirt steak, goat cheese and pistachios. It was very good, the steak was cooked medium rare. My friend ordered a chicken wrap and another friend ordered the bacon macaroni and cheese. Everyone liked the food and the service was ok. Overall, I would return.

I stopped in here for a quick nightcap before heading to my parents' place right around the corner. 

It was ok. I definitely felt like it was pricey for a well drink and a beer, but it's Streeterville so that's to be expected I guess.

Place was pretty dead for a Sunday evening but our bartender was super nice!

Convenient, large seating capacity, interesting decor, moderately noisey, food good, hot.
Here's the bad.   Service was awful,  once we got initially waited on we couldn't get a refill on our drink,  had to ask the manager for desserts,  which when delivered we asked for the check,  which was given to us but then we couldn't get them to pick it up.

Stopped in for a couple after work drinks on a Friday. Decent option for drinks as there aren't too many bars right in this area. Good sized crowd on a Friday evening, nice atmosphere. Service was pretty good, liked the wine, pretty standard. We were initially sitting at the bar, but had to move bc there was like a really bad sewage smell coming from somewhere...so yeah they should look into that. But all in all nice option for drinks in this area.

We tried this place because it is in the hotel where we were staying.  The atmosphere was very nice but the music was a little loud.   They were very busy but we were seated right away.  The service was very good and the food was great as well.  We will try it again when we come back to Chicago.

It is really just an hotel restaurant, but one that we found to be very tasty - though the service was a bit slow.  I would not really go out of my way to eat here, but if I were staying here or walking to Navy Pier, I would not hesitate to stop in again.
Great late night bar. Good service and drinks! Will be on my list of bars to hit on a regular basis!

So this place down the street from my apartment and it looks pleasant inside.  But...

Tonight I learned to never order a cocktail here.  The bartenders have no idea how to make one, nor does the establishment stock the bar with the ingredients that you'd expect from cocktails in the bar's price range.  Hopefully you will not make the same $15 mistake I did.  It was the worst Manhattan I can remember.  It tasted like flavored syrup without even a hint of whiskey.  A Manhattan doesn't have flavored (or unflavored) syrup as an ingredient, and it should be almost entirely whiskey.  Moreover, high-end Manhattans (which is the price range of this establishment) should not come with low-end  Maraschino cherries, get Luxardo at a minimum!  Yeah, I paid them $15 to serve me this nasty-syrup swill, but they couldn't have paid me anything to drink it.

The pulled pork sandwich was ok.  I wouldn't ever order it again, but I did finish it.

Website said casual, we were both dressed a bit too casual.

Hostess was very funny when I used the words "We have a Reservation"; it was obvious they get a lot of street traffic with the theatre right next door.  Funnier was how she offered us our selection of 2-tops and 4-tops because "we had a reservation".

Ambiance and noise level were perfect, unfortunately from that point forward things started to go downhill.  Our server did not seem new or even overwhelmed, yet drink service was slow, glasses were empty before offering a refill, and I don't even recall him coming to ask how everything tasted.

We started with the Oysters, yes if you are following me, or rather stalking me, that is 2 nights in a row of Oysters.  Then we both ordered the Salmon on a bed of kale salad and pine nuts.  I added a beet salad as a side.  The Salmon, cooked medium was PERFECT!, although I could have eaten 3.  The bed of kale salad was tasty, yet the portion seemed rather large.  The beet salad, should have read Mile High pile of Arugula with beets thrown on top as an after thought.  Again Tasty, but not what I want in a "Beet Salad".

I rarely do desert, but I'm in chaos mode, so it's time I dirty up my eating a little bit.

Server simply presents the check by standing it on the table.  "Um, we'd like a desert menu please."  No apology, or anything.

I had the Chocolate Mouse, tasty although it had been piped DAYS before.  While my companion had the Pecan pie something or other, it was really more like a torte, served with spoons, we had to ask for forks.

Only NOW, do we see a member of management enter the front of the house, we're well over 2 hours into this, long past our movie time.  Yet we need not worry.  We did not pre-order tickets, and already had a backup plan should the need arise.

Food was tasty, but nothing to write home about.  Long and Short, after an hour of bowling I was HUNGRY again, and had to order food at Lucky Strike.

Nice place; reservations are good to have. I was here with a group of 4 but 5 people ended up coming. The waitstaff was helpful in providing another seat for us. I had the kale salad with chicken and it was good. And a nice glass of wine. A friend ordered a burger and fries - and they gave LOTS of fries, so be warned. The music was groovy and sounded like it came from the soundtrack of Triplets of Belleville.
This place saved my life. I arrived at my hotel at 10 pm and they close at 4am. The service was great, the spinach salad was just what I needed. Great spot with great drinks.

My timing is really off when I'm on vacations. Between nursing school and Chicago being an hour behind New York time, I was sleeping and waking up at weird times during the day. With that said, on my second night in Chicago, I took a "nap" at 7pm and woke up at midnight. I then realized I had nothing to eat since brunch. We were starving and were disappointed that everything closed around 9pm-2am. We also had to factor in walking and we didn't want to be rushed out of the restaurant. We stumbled across Bellwether because it was the only restaurant opened till 4am (which I take granted for in New York). The restaurant was beautiful and was on the other side of the river from our hotel. Food wise, it was okay. The calamaris were very chewy for whatever reason, the chipotle chicken spring rolls tasted like things you get at Costco, and the beef sliders were okay. I think the best was the truffle fries that came with the burger. However, I appreciate them being open at odd hours during the night for starving people like us. Service was great too!
The French onion soup here is amazing-- one of the best. Kameryn is a great bartender and super friendly. We got our beers fast every time. Come here and sit at the bar!

Went there for early dinner yesterday. Now I am a regular to this restaurant and normal have Diana as a server but was greeted by a male server that looked new. I asked where Diana was and was bluntly told she was no longer working there. They even went as far as to talk negatively about her. Needless to say I continued to order but the server just left a sour taste in my mouth. The reason why I visited the restaurant was because of Diana's service. To here another one of Bellwethers employees talk negatively about this server turned me off. Not only was the service "regular" but just uncomfortable .

Great service, reasonably priced food, and great drink options. In addition to their daily specials they also have a happy hour. There late night hours are also great if you work late in the service industry.
We only had fries and sangria at the bar. The bartenders were super nice. Even answered our silly tourist questions. I would have ordered more but I was feeling great off the Sangria!

Stopped in for dinner while staying at the Embassy Suites because we didn't want to venture out in bad weather. It was a pleasant surprise as to quality of food & service. The portions were large. The Greek salad with skirt steak was exceptional. The club sandwich & burgers were also good.

Service was fantastic-attentive, prompt, and knowledgeable. Food was great-slightly unique without being too "out there." Very good quality food. I had the pork belly po'boy-which does have pork belly on it, in addition to the ingredients listed. ;) Great, once I removed the pork belly. The French fries may be the best I've ever had.

Came here for a YPNP Chicago Happy Hour and had a ton of fun! My one $6 beer on tap (I don't remember the name) was large and lasted me the entire evening. Ha! I am a lightweight.

Our group had the upstairs area, which was nice. The venue is classy and the servers were relatively helpful for our large group. I don't know how everything else is food-wise, but I'd come back to check it out!

Had a great experience. A hotel bar/ restaurant is always a gamble but this gamble payed off. The steak tacos were delicious and the service was great! Chris is a fantastic server who went above and beyond to find me a cider when they were out at the bar. The atmosphere was super pleasant and the music was great. Totally exceeded my expectations!

Inundated with hundreds of Coldwell Banker confectioners at noon, this place handled it with aplomb and quick service. Food was fantastic. 4 of us had Cobb salad, Bellwether BLT, pulled pork sandwich & kale salad w/salmon... all delicious! Friendly & professional staff, great ambiance. Full bar, too!
Nice club music and ambiance. Would be fun if you were drinking, we werent. Food was ok nothing special. We got the seafood platter and stuffed chicken. Seafood was good chicken was ok.

Well I can't say I don't miss my old PJ Clarkes which once was housed at this location.  Something about that place had charm and character that this new place is lacking.  The best way I can describe it is this place lacks soul.  Or maybe it's got a bit of an identity crisis as it still figures out what it wants to be.

So while parts of it still remind me of the old corner pub that it once was, today there are sparkling chandeliers twinkling overhead, white table cloths  but coupled with a menu that still feels more bar-esque.

We went before a show at the AMC theater next door.  We sat at a high top in the front room which again felt more casual but a bit odd as I looked at the people around me at the linen draped tables.

We started with the oysters which were quite good.  And my martini?  Perfection in a glass.  For my entrée I just went with a burger and my friend had the fish tacos.  Both came up quickly and were also pretty good.

Service was friendly and functional and we were able to get in and out in time to make our movie.

All in all a solid experience.  I guess I just miss the charm of the old place!

This place has mediocre food. I ordered the chicken strips as an appetizer and they were good. I then ordered the shrimp scampi which came with a side of spaghetti noodles and all I can say is if you like lemon flavored spaghetti and over cooked shrimp, this is the dish for you. I asked the waiter if the pasta was suppose to be super sour and he said yes we put lemon juice on top of the dish.... It was more than on on top, it was all throughout.  Our waiter was nonchalant and really didn't care that I had to eat sour spaghetti. My dish was not shrimp scampi. You couldn't taste a bit of garlic or butter. I think they should rename this dish sour spaghetti topped with shrimp My husband on the other hand ordered the smothered chicken breast and risotto and that was very good. So for the $$ not worth it! I will say that the restaurant decor was gorgeous and some guy kept our glass filled with water. I mean he replenished our glass after every sip almost.
Good food, average drinks. Services terrible. Lunch took 1:30. At one point I saw the waiter standing frozen for 8 minutes.

Christina at Bellwether is amazing!   Not only did she have killer recommendations, but was incredibly attentive as a server.  And hysterically funny!   Will definitely go back for Christina's service and the prosciutto wrapped asparagus!!!

If there was EVER a chance to give ZERO stars, this would be it! Actually the food was ok. Where they lack is direction. The waitstaff is overwhelmed and understaffed. "George" "the owner/manager" has no clue how to run an establishment. When we approached him regarding concerns, it's hard to address someone that greets you with "What's Up?" When we addressed our concern how service was divided and unattended, "George" laughed. Not only did he laugh but acted unprofessional and stated "you do not run a restaurant business"!. Thanks but no thanks, "George", we will NOT be back...STAY FAR AWAY!!! There are too many great restaurants in Chicago that excel in proper customer service!

This is a place with a lot of potential, but it needs some fine tuning. I went around noon on a Sunday and there was about 4 total tables being served.  The menu was very diverse with a lot of really good options. I blame myself for picking the BLT, which was good, but not very original on my part.  I bypassed the lobster Benedict for no good reason, other than being hungry and not thinking straight. The kitchen staff forgot to put avocado on my BLT, which is a basic ingredient for the dish according to the menu.  My friend ordered a coffee which arrived warm, but nowhere near hot.  The server, who was friendly, was going to bring another fresh cup, but apparently forgot and we had to ask the bus boy, who was clearly the hardest worker in the place.  It also took quite a while for the food to arrive after we ordered it and our server didn't come around to check on us very often. I'd still like to give the bellweather another chance the next time I'm in Chicago.  Overall, the food was good, but the service lacked.

We just wanted to take a minute to say Ms. Kristina was one of the best waiteres we have every had. She was very attentive, my co-worker and I while we were in town on business. She was also very knowledgeable with the menu and offered great ideas on what to eat. When we return to Chicago, IL we will diffinetly stop in for the GREAT service and GREAT food. 

Andre and Rufus Jr.
Cassondra was great. Wonderful server, she recommended the Buffalo spring rolls, definitely a must try.
Loved the food and drinks here. Ask for Cassandra as your server!! Very attentive and helpful with the menu.

Had a nice Pino Grigio with blackened cod tacos. Colleagues had veggie pasta, smoked salmon on a bagel and tacos with fried cod. Plates were emptied and wine bottle too. Everyone said how good the food is. Would have a half more star because of the increasing noise level. Worth trying again if you are a former customer.
Kristina was awesome! She was very friendly and attentive! She went above and beyond to take care of us and I will be back any time I'm in Chicago!

The first time I went to this place I thought the food was just okay.  We had the buffalo spring rolls, a black bean burger and shrimp tacos.  The bell boy gave my left overs to my friend and hers to me so when I got home I was disappointed.  I don't mind that the bell boys do not speak English but they also do not understand it so when we gave them instructions on how to pack the food they did not understand I so they will pack it incorrectly.

I went here this past Friday, October 16, 2005, and they sat us in a table all the way in the back of the restaurant which was really distracting because that is where the kitchen is and the register where the servers enter the orders so there was too much traffic.  Our waiter an older slim man with a heavy accent possibly European but I am not sure was horrible.  He took forever to take our order in fact the people seated in front of us who arrived 15-20 minutes later and were a party of 4 got their food before me and my girlfriend.  We asked for suggestions for a tropical cocktail and he had no suggestions.  He was also very short and rude and for the cherry on top when we paid he came over to our table and demanded his pen back which I had in my hand.  It was a restaurant pen for crying out loud I was in absolute shock!  I will not be going here again I need to feel comfortable and welcomed and I did not.  The restaurant is very beautiful too bad the customer service does not match up.
Cassandra was a great server, the food was delicious and the drink specials were great for watching the super bowl!

Loved the environment tatted server owner in jeans clean cool vibe what's not to love! Had the buffalo spring rolls ... Stop It amazing! Shrimp tacos ... Get Out DELISH!My party had the Sliders  will be having Somme of that the next time!

Bellwether's has such an amazing and luxurious atmosphere without the fuss. Our server Andreas was great and so attentive to our needs. We loved the lunch that we had, especially our shirley temples were the perfect mocktails to get us through our day. We highly recommend eating here again!
Food was delicious. I have no complaints. Its unfortunate to see other bad experiences in reviews because I had a great one. Very attentive staff. Thank you!

We came here during brunch time on a weekend. I got the veggie burger and my partner got shrimp tacos, both dishes were good (although I have had a better veggie burger in Chicago.) Fries were bland. The inside of the place is very nice, liked the decor and openness of the restaurant. Server had an accent and was bit hard to understand but she was ok, nothing special. We would come back sometime but are not in a rush to do so. Satisfactory overall.

Ryan the bartender and Kristina the server always provide the most excellent service. I go in sometimes by myself or with my family member and we are always taken care of with the upmost best service. Ryan stirs the best cocktails I have ever tasted and Kristina never leaves us thirsty our drinks are always filled promptly. Great restaurant with amazing drinks. I highly recommend it.

Bellwether hosted our holiday party, which had 150 people. We were able to rent out the entire space for the party. The food and drinks were absolutely delicious. The space was beautiful- they had it all lit up with lights, which gave it a nice holiday theme. We were able to bring in our own DJ too which was a nice option! 

The staff was AMAZING!! Rachel helped me coordinate the event, and was extremely helpful! She helped me pick out menu items and made the process extremely easy.

The general Manager, Vincent, was also amazing! He grabbed all of our guests coats as they entered the event, and made sure that the people entering were our guests only. He kept checking up on us throughout the event, to make sure that everything was going smoothly.

I was so happy with how the event turned out, and all of our guests had such a great time. If you are ever looking for a space to rent out to have a party, definitely check out Bellwether!

I started to give Bellwether a 4-star review, but there are so many cookie-cutter places around that this place deserves an extra star for being a little different.  Upscale casual seating, with a full bar on one side and large street-level windows on the other, the whole thing comes together in an off-beat way that doesn't seem forced.  The waitstaff was eclectic, but efficient, a little too much so with the waiter that obsessed over keeping the water glass full: completely full, but he was good.  We started with the pretzels and jalapeno beer cheese, and I've gotta recommend this!  The pretzels are a fluffier dough with a butter-soaked outside browned to perfection, and the beer cheese jalapeno fusion was just spicy enough without becoming just plain hot.  I got the Stuffed Chicken Breast with risotto, and while it had more garlic and less fennel than I wanted, it was still very good.  Prices aren't bad for the location, and what you get.  I recommend you give it a try.

Loved the service and the atmosphere was really nice. We went on Halloween all dressed up and met really cool people there also they are open really late. Great location as well. Totally will go again

Hoping for a fun, funky, upscale burger place, we were extremely disappointed. The hostess seated us with food menus, but no drink menu. The place was empty, but even so, our waiter didn't come by for over 10 minutes. We asked for a drink menu and he disappeared again and didn't return again for even longer so we put in our orders with another waitress. Our server came over and asked about the food but did so while walking by our table and didn't even stop to hear an answer. This was absolutely some of the worst service we've ever had. On top of it, the food was mediocre and the drinks were rather bad. The whole time we were there a manager kept walking around but never stopped at a single table to ask how things were going. None of it made sense. Absolutely do not recommend anyone goes there.

I suggest staying away from this place. Ordered the daily special, Angus meatloaf with chipotle ketchup plus mashed potatoes & green beans. The meatloaf had been put on the grill was burnt on one side & served that side down. Needless to say it tasted burnt. The mashed potatoes were tasteless & lukewarm. Green beans were mostly under cooked & unseasoned. My wife had shrimp scampi over pasta. It wasn't seasoned & I thought the pasta was overcooked.

Went here on a Monday night  for a late, leisurely business/pleasure dinner with a large group of work colleagues. I loved the decor - very spacious, modern, clean, sophisticated, engaging with a little bit of fun. We were in the upper level, which was not overly noisy that we couldn't have good conversation. But it didn't seem overly noisy downstairs either. Our server George was absolutely GREAT. He was fun with banter as well as knowledgeable about the menu and patient and accommodating with our large group. I had a stuffed meatball on linguini with sauce. The meatball had a captivating grilled/smokey taste.  It has haunted me ever since. In a good way. I keep ordering Italian food here and there to try and copy the experience, but all falls short. I intend to finagle a way to get back there. I WANT MY MEATBALL.

What great customer service! The other nite, friends and I went to Bellether for dinner. When it seemed like we were waiting too long for our food, the manager informed us that there had been a glitch in the system that communicates between servers and the kitchen. I apologized profusely and bought us a round of drinks and took a significant discount off of our final bill. Yeah Bellwether. This is great customer service. And the food was terrific! We will be back and back and back! Thanks!
Drinks are tasty but Calamari is not. Way too chewy and overpriced. Wouldn't recommend coming back except for drinks.

I am happy to report that the Bellwether fills the post-movie-noshing and imbibing void left behind by Fox & Obel (RIP). Located in striking distance of my preferred theater (AMC 21), I stopped in here around 1 pm after taking in the Saturday am viewing of Monuments Men. What can I say, all that wartime violence made me work up an appetite. 

I decided to perch up at the bar. The cocktail list is definitely on the terse side, but I knew that I wanted a Bloody Mary. The drink came out promptly, which gave me more than enough time to look at the menu. Having done a reconnaissance online, I already had some idea of the food offerings. I went with the pulled pork sandwich, which came with a side of fries. The portions are substantial, with even enough for leftovers. The service itself was attentive, and it seemed like the bartender warmed up to me as a customer as time went on--doubtless, my generous tip and the fact that the place was not packed helped on that score. From looking online, it seems like the happy hour (half-priced hot appetizers from 3-6 pm on weekdays) is a well-kept secret. I will definitely be back here and am hoping this establishment remains viable for the foreseeable future.
Awesome food w/great drinks! I had the 13oz filet w/garlic potatoes and enjoyed every bite of it. I will definitely make repeated trips here for a great meal and atmosphere.
On a whim we went here and was surprisingly nice. Good service...good food. Went for lunch and it didn't disappoint.

Yes, I did enjoyed P.J. Clarkes, however, it's no longer there.  Now it's Bellwether Meeting House & Eatery.  Please note... this is an over due review....

The owners certainly did an amazing job of decorating the restaurant with the hanging of the crystals from the ceiling to the brightness of the room to the bar area.  I will say, the only negative item are the "booths".  The booths are a little uncomfortable.  The booth seating will be a little hard to explain so here goes.... the bench is shared between and the guest behind you.  When that person moves, you can really feel it.  Same with the backing of the booth.  The seating  can be a little frustrating.

I was greeted by the hostess and was sat promptly.  The server was very prompt.  He went over the menu and took the drink order.  When he returned with my beverage, he took my order.  I had ordered the cheeseburger (medium).

Within the appropriate time, my meal was delivered.  The burger was just right.  I was surprised how juicy the burger was.  No complaints here.  The serve did check in without being bothersome.

Based on my experience, I would return.

The place is great, the food delicious.
We had ropa vieja and chiles rellenos, very nice and authentic flavor.

Highly recommend

Miami, you've finally come to me with the wonderfully memorable flavors of my childhood that I can't forget and haven't found here until now! I don't know what took me so long to find you, (as I'm kicking myself for missing your Cuban delights), but it's never too late. First, and this is no offense to anyone, certainly not the restaurant, but we had no interest in any of the wildly fusionized Spanish delights and made as quick as possible a beeline to the Cuban delights.

Ambiance is cool and sleek and Miami near the water modern, reminding diners of a swanky supper on Biscayne Bay or an old nostalgic favorite spot on SW 8th Street. Ah, the memories! 

To say the least, the Ropa Vieja is simply wonderful! Every bite of shredded flank steak has just the right amount of garlic, peppers, tomato deliciousness. The rice and black beans were so wonderful, cooked to perfection - just like it was always done in Miami...I was tempted to lick the plate, especially with the outstanding sweet plantains, prepared perfectly, just the way they turn out every time in Miami. 

The yummy coconut rum flan - did not disappoint, either. The Guava cheesecake is Miami-style awesome as well. While I would probably remove the Latin specialties from the menu and make it entirely Cuban, I can't say other customers would feel this way. At least next time, we won't hyperventilate over the menu with worry that we won't find anything authentically Cuban on the menu. You do, unfortunately, have to sift past a whole bunch of apps and mains that are not Cuban variety whatsoever. 

Forget that 3 hour nuisance of a flight with passengers packed in sardine can style and come to Havana instead!!

I vow to return to Havana until I have tried every dang thing on their menu. I tried their Ropa Vieja the first time I was there in May, and was instantly hooked. I've been back twice since, each thing I've tried has been excellent... and I have a long way to go. 

They do plantains better than anywhere. Get an extra side order. (You'll thank me.)

This was the best meal I had in Chicago!! It was phenomenal! We started with Passion Fruit Mojitos and Caipirinhas. Yum!!! Get the Empanada Trio. It will change your life. It was some of the best that I have ever had. The Cilantro sauce was to die for. The Tostones were delicious. For the entrees we had the Ropa Vieja and Cuban Roast Pork. Both were equally as amazing. The flavors were so good. The roasted plaintains were fabulous. If you are even thinking about going to this place, Do It!!

Outstanding cocktails (jalapeño margarita), savory food, killer service, cool surroundings.A very good choice for dinner if you're headed to the House of Blues (as we were). Looking forward to going back soon.

I met up with my bf here after work for some drinks. We sat in their little outdoor area and tried their sangria which was just okay but decided their guava mojito was the best most refreshing thing ever!!

I had a great time at Havana Grill - I was in town for a museum exhibit, and saw it walking by, thought I'd give it a shot.

Glad I did! We had lunch jibaritos, like steak sandwiches where the bread is a fried plantain patty. They even had chicken jibaritos, which I'd never even heard of! Great time :) The coffee was also spot on, which I love.

All told, it was reasonably priced, practically vacant at lunch hours on a Saturday, and great food. Couldn't like a place better than that :)

I wish I could give this place another 5 stars. Wow. I'm on a Cuban kick right now and this place is off the charts.

I was able to get in right away with open table. The place was packed by 730 with a wait outside.

They have a place for private parties and a fun atmosphere.

The food was excellent. We had the carne asada. The waiter nicely recommended the sauce on the side, which we appreciated. The guacamole was nice on the steak and the sauce was good to dip.

I had the caipirinha (yummmm) and the coffee. 

Our service was really what stood out. The waiter and the hostess we accommodating and were sooooooo sweet to my mother, whom had never had Cuban food before. They were patient and were very kind with their recommendations. 

The dress was casual but I wouldn't feel comfortable coming in with yoga pants. The prices were very fair for the food. I'll be back!

Found his place at random looking for dinner. Knowing my home doesn't have a lot of Cuban food it was a perfect choice. While service as a bit slow, the food was good. I had the enchiladas, two steak and one mushroom. The black beans they came with were great, there is no need for spiced or flavored beans and rice with a dish that has something with such good flavor. My dining partner had the ropa vieja, which was any far the better of the two meals. Such amazing flavor. If order that again!

I haven't really explored much of this menu outside of their empanadas and steak sandwich.....both of which are bomb AF.  The mojitos and sangria are wonderful as well.

I like going here for dinner, and you wont be disappointed at all. For me, once the live music gets going...that's my cue to leave.  That's just a personal preference.
Went for drinks. Very nice bartender and great wine list. Husband had two well made Cubs Libres. Great stop!

Havana never seems to disappoint. The prices and pitcher deals are fantastic for River North. Plus- it's Cuban! Most authentic Cuban taste in the world? NO. Those are food trucks or restaurants not in the area, but close enough. 

If you don't make a reservation- you should be fine. There was a private party upstairs, so we were seated in the downstairs dining room which felt like we were in a basement party. A loud chatter restaurant and our waiter could care less that he was there but he was friendly and just asked us what we wanted to order. Service was a bit slow. 

FOOD! Amazing. My friend got a cuban sandwich and i got the steak jibarito. For 13.95 it was a great portion, perfectly cooked steak in my sandwich between two crispy plantains. I have no complaints. 

If you are looking for someone to explain the menu- don't come. But if you are looking for good bites for a good price- and even have a good group-come! The drinks are strong and fantastic. A friendly environment and cute place.
Great place and ambiance.  The paella is amazing! The mojitos are superb.  I had the mango and coconut mojitos and they are highly recommended.  Great service as well!

Food was good. But disappointing service. Took them ages to take our order. We asked if we could get extra salsa to go along with our plantain chips. But they said they'll charge us for it! (Who does that?!) . Again they took ages to get the extra salsa, after our dinner was almost done! AND they made a mistake in our check by adding an extra cocktail. 
Their guava flan dessert was excellent though.

Very solid place, we've been coming here for several years now and the food is always spot on. Some of our favorites are the Havana Pulled Pork and the Carne Asada. 

The mojitos and sangria are great and very nicely priced for the neighborhood.

We came here randomly on a Tues night. 

Things were generally sub par throughout the meal. For example, our waiter didn't explain anything on the menu and he left to give us a few minutes to decide. It took a while as we waited for him to return. when he didn't, we had to flag other waiters to send the message that we were ready to order. 

We ordered the ceviche which was refreshing and tasty with the plantain chips. The ropa vieja was generally good...the rice was flavorful. The seafood paella was frankly kinda bad. the seafood itself tasted ok but the rice was soggy and the flavors just didn't seem fresh.

I loved the ambience of this place, which looks and feels exactly like a cafe in old Havana.

Unfortunately, that's where the love stopped. As someone who lives much of the year in Florida, I've had a lot of Cuban food at many different restaurants, and I've never encountered anything like what is served here.

First off, the lunch menu has been taken over in part by Tex-Mex items such as quesadillas, not a good sign. Perhaps foolishly, I stuck with something that sounded authentically Cuban, and had the Pollo from the dinner menu, along with a cup of black bean soup.

Good black bean soup is smooth, with plenty of whole beans and crispy bits of onion. This gritty slurry had none of those characteristics. 

Traditional Cuban chicken is roasted, with a crisp, garlic coated skin and moist interior, exactly as described on the menu. What showed up, though was a soggy mess covered in a weird salty white gravy that had almost no flavor.

It had more flavor than the "congri," it was served with, though. That mixture of rice and black beans was dry and utterly flavorless. Fried yucca was similarly flavorless, but had a nice crisp exterior.

The saving grace on the plate were the ripe plantains, which were perfectly caramelized and still hot from the sauce pan. Sadly, one out of five is not enough to get me to ever return.

It's a shame because the service was efficient, and the place looks great. They just need major adjustments in the kitchen.

Me and my boys rolled over for lunch as I don't think any of us have been here. The thought of Latin American food was quite enticing so thats why we went with it. Since there was a TV behind the bar, the 3 of us grabbed a seat. Was here for lunch so we couldn't grab a drink even though I see on some of the reviews the guava mojito is whats up here!

I went with the jibarito and it was pretty good. Better than some of the versions I've had at some other latin joints. The steak was quite tender and packed with flavor along with the two fried twice green plantains made for a good lunch. I need to get back here for the mojito though!
Great Mojitos and Pisco Sours. Great atmosphere. They have outdoor seating available, too. Haven't tried the food yet.

I had the paella, my date had the ropa vieja. I love Cuban food but this place was not what I'm used to. The rice in the paella was extremely salty, I woke up feeling sick for the next two days. My date had the ropa vieja and the meat was obviously frozen and reheated. Service was poor, waiter took forever to bring drinks, refills and the check. Don't waste your time here...too many fantastic restaurants in Chicago to spend your time and money here!
Craving Cuban food, I made everyone come here. My benchmark is the Cuban roast pork, and here it is not a signature dish. Everyone enjoyed their food otherwise, and it was good overall.

I came here for a date night on a Thursday and it was exactly what my boyfriend and I were looking for! The restaurant itself is small, cozy, and dimly lit and the food was hearty, satisfying yet affordable. To start, we ordered a pitcher of mojitos and it was strong, refreshing and transported me back home to sunny Florida. I will definitely be returning for their half off pitchers on Fridays and try other flavors as well. We also shared the ceviche mixto, half order of guac and chips, and a cup of the sopa tortilla as appetizers. The tortilla soup had a bean-y texture, which was not what I expected, but still tasty nonetheless. The guac and ceviche were also good and generous portions. 

For our main dishes, I ordered the Havana roasted pulled pork and my boyfriend got the carne con tequila. My boyfriend loved his steak and said it was super flavorful. I kept stealing his Latin fries that were tossed in a delicious chimichurri sauce and would definitely recommend getting a side of these fries. I also really liked the pulled pork dish (even as leftovers the next day), but my one gripe was that the roasted cream corn sauce that it came with was a bit too sweet to me for this savory dish.

Overall, Havana is a great place if you're looking for a casual place with strong drinks, flavorful food, and a varied menu. Will be returning to try their other tasty sounding dishes and drinks sometime soon!

The food was delicious the waitress was so attentive funny and friendly. The overall atmosphere was very welcoming and I hear on Fridays after 10 they move the tables creating a dance floor for live Latin music. I definitely plan to revisit! If you are in the area and have the taste for Cuban/Latin American food definitely visit this place.

OMG!!! this place is soooooo delicous! (Free dessert when you check-in).

Anyways Waz suggested we eat here to try the Jibarito sandwich.  We ordered the Steak Jibarito - not knowing what to expect... the food arrives and its a flat steak in between a flat fried banana!!!! OMG so goooood! It also comes with dipping sauce, not sure whats in it, who cares the sandwich was yummy! Its about $13 bucks and def worth it. 

We also ordered chips and guac... delicious. 

The rumors are true... chicago does have better food in town.

Now im on a mission to find me a Jibarito sandwich in San Diego!

This place has some really good Cuban food! Loved the chicken in plantain leaves so full of flavor. We went there as a big group and ordered a bunch of things and except for the beef (Ropa Veija) that was a little rubbery according to the hubby every one seemed pretty happy with their dishes. The entrees are pretty large in size so we skipped the appetizers. 
The cocktails kept following and had a good amount of alcohol in them. The service was quick inspite of the place being jam packed on a Friday night. 

Coming to the best part, the music!! Love Latin music and they seemed to mix it with English songs from time to time. Our group had a great evening! Will definitely be going there again!

I have nothing negative to say about my dinner experience here! We went for a 30th birthday party with a group of 9, they had our table ready for us when we arrived. Our server was quick to get drink orders in, kept our water glasses full, and was even quick when we had a late guest arrive. On top of the great service the food was AMAZING. We all passed plates around and I did not try one thing I disliked. On top of all that we had plenty of their $20 mojito pitchers to keep us happy. An easy 5 out of 5 for this restaurant.

The food was excellent.  Had a chicken with cheese dish that made me feel like I was in another country for sure.  Mojito was very drinkable, but if I had the right stuff perhaps I could make the same at home.  I would come for the food again though.

I was hoping dinner at Havana would bring me back to my (part) Cuban roots. It certainly delivered! The tostones were perfectly fried. And while I'm used to eating them with just a sprinkle of salt, the accompanying dips were packed with flavor!

My friend and I split the shrimp skewer appetizer and Cuban pork plate. The shrimp dish stole the show, the pork was just ok. I was expecting a slow roasted, fall off the bone cut of meat rather than slices of pork. 

Great mojitos to wash the meal down. The restaurant was packed all night. It's no secret that Havana is full of energy and delicious cuisine.

Went there to with our best bud to celebrate my husband  getting into grad school. Had another amazing time. Ate way too much. Loved the server. He was great. The food was fantastic as well and they had way too many mojitos.

This is my second time trying Havana and the food is decent! The first time I tried Cuban from a different establishment (which I won't name lol) and it was terrible. Havana has definitely changed my opinion on Cuban food! This restaurant have good Latin Fries (which came with my grilled Cuban steak sandwich) and delicious bread for their sandwiches. I will have to try some more dishes from this establishment, but it is definitely great food.....

Just happened in this place after going to  a show. It was about 10 on a Saturday and we were easily seated. The food was delicious and came out pretty quickly. We're ordered a margarita pitcher for 35$ and I'll say it was pretty strong. Parking is tough but that's Chicago. Very nice! 

They cleared the middle tables and at about 11:30 it became a dance club with a live band and DJ. The band playing was very cool and me and my girl danced the night away. Definitely will be back. This is a good option to take a date or it seemed like there were plenty of available women for the single guys.

Alright, so I checked in here for my birthday last night.  This is a gem of a joint right downtown.  There are several places around it so I will have to visit this street again.  I will be returning to Havana for several reasons.

Just to let you know, Havana is a very intimate restaurant (small).  There are only a few booths and a line of tables in the center.  It is dimly lit beautifully and is a date night showstopper.  From the front door to the bathrooms everything is clean and exceptionally kept.  The decor is romantic and classy but not stuffy and pretentious.  So on appearance, from the charming outward appearance to the quaint seating area, this place is wonderful.

I had a reservation, I showed up about 10 minutes early and was seated at my reservation time so thumbs up for not making me wait as it was packed in there.  I was waiting on 2 people in my party anyway.  The host had a pleasant and professional demeanor which I appreciated  My cousin and I had a drink at the bar while we waited and the bartender was polite and cheery and again professional.

All the staff is well trained because I also loved our waiter Eddie.  He was honestly suggestive on drinks and meal choice and seemed genuinely concerned that we had a great experience.  We didn't wait long for anything and he checked on the table properly.

2 people in my party aren't big eaters so after appetizers and drinks they couldn't finish their entrees and they are not the type that brings home leftovers so they had a lot on their plate.  Eddie was concerned and asked if they were satisfied with their meal.  He was assured that they were, it's just that they were full and don't do leftovers, But I feel that the fact that he asked was excellent behavior.  A genuine concern again for our experience.

I enjoyed the live Latin band after 11:00 and the music that played throughout.  Some people were even dancing in the front.  This is an enjoyable atmosphere.

If all that isn't enough, the food was fantastic.  We all loved the chimichungas, and the guacamole and salsa for the chips were flavorful and well seasoned.  I had a chicken dish with poblano pepper cream sauce and it was on point.  The portion on the paella is over the top and delicious.  The chocolate cake brought out for my birthday with a candle on it was a nice touch from our waiter and it was fudge deliciousness, we all shared a bite and it was a great dessert. Everything we ate tasted great and authentic.  I wasn't disappointed in anything at Havana.  I seriously have not one complaint.  I will return.

Visit 1: September '10 
Banana leaf wrapped pork and a pitcher of mojitos to myself. Left happy. 

Visit 2: November '15
Carne asada and three pitchers of mojitos. Left happier. Went back five years later off the fond memory I had of the first visit. 

Visit 3: This coming Friday
Can't tell you how much I'm looking forward to it. 

Not sure why reviews range the way they do on this place. I'm thinking guest education. The food's delicious. It's consistent, on my drawn out ass timeline. It opens to a dance floor on Friday nights. And $15 pitchers of mojitos!? And this coming from a guy who keeps a recipe on-hand for subpar occasions. You owe it yourself to go. 

If it's your first time, and especially on a Friday or weekend, give yourself ample time. Or bring company. And order from the especialidades. With the exception of the jibarito. Save that for Cafecito-on E Congress.

I really enjoy this place and feel and the food.  I always order Ropa Vieja which was great, my leftovers tasted even better.  Bae ordered Costillas con Barbeque aka Ribs and they were super tenders and the sauce was tasteful. I tried a spicy Margarita and it was yumster!!!!!!!!!

Once a month we order lunch in for my whole department and today it was Havana again! I was going to try something different but I loved the jibarito so much last time that I got it again. And again, it did not disappoint. 

The plantains were fried to perfection and while the steak was a bit thinner than I recalled, the total sandwich was perfect for lunch and again, I love the sauce that it comes with. Delicious! The sandwich also comes with fries and chimichurri dipping sauce, which was tasty, but I couldn't eat many of the fries without being too full.

Eating lunch at my desk is not so bad when it's awesome Cuban from Havana!

Great place, good to go to for both lunch and dinner.  I love love love Cuban food so I've been a few times and have enjoyed it each time.  Good seafood dishes. 

I've had a mojito here before which could've been stronger but was good.

I stopped by here for a quick dinner one night, after cocktails nearby. The ambience was not very lively and the service left something to be desired and the food was unimpressive. I've heard better things about this restaurant, so I wonder if my experience was just a one-off...

What a great Thursday special!! $20 margarita pitchers is EXACTLY what my friends and I needed to celebrate being done with medical board exams. We probably didn't need FOUR of them but they sure went down easy. The chips, guac and salsa were super tasty and the grilled calamari salad was yummy too. The calamari wasn't super chewy and the citrusy dressing was perfect for summer. My friends' mojitos were spot on too. As our party grew in size, the place started to feel a little cramped, but this was definitely a good place to kick off our celebratory weekend.

Hands down, my favorite restaurant from our Chicago trip.  We saw this restaurant by chance, it was near our hotel.  We were seated right away, luckily we arrived right after the lunch hour rush.  The food was delicious and portion size was large.  Staff was very friendly and accommodating.  We couldn't have picked a better spot to start off our trip!

Grilled calamari and arugula salad. The salad was a large, filling portion. And I eat a lot. I eat more than my husband. 

The grilled calamari was super tender. I've never had grilled but I like it more than fried!! They also have pitchers of mojito. We didn't get one but it looked good and every table had one.
Great food, great service, and reasonable prices. It's a little on the loud side, though, and the bathroom could have been a little cleaner.
Decent chile relleno, good empanadas, very good mojitos. The place is a bit on the loud side.

This place was not very busy when we arrived. It looked like only 1 server for about 6/8 tables ( server was nice but seemed a little off) the food was good drinks were nice and strong! The only thing I would complain about is service lacked!

This place is very good . It is clean and was quiet . The drink were great. The food was excellent. We all tried something different and we were all very satisfied. I would eat there again and again if I lived close.

Our experience at Havana was exactly what one should expect when going to dinner in the city. Havana is a Cuban restaurant on the southern tip of River North. It is very small - about 10 tables or so on the inside. They also have an area out on the sidewalk with another four tables. There is a large wooden bar that takes up much of the interior space. 

We were immediately greeted and seated - we had an early dinner, around 5 PM. The sidewalk seats were all taken but it was wide open inside. We had a very nice table by the window so we could watch the foot traffic outside.

The waiter asked if we had any questions on the menu or Cuban food in general. Since Cuban is one of our favorite foods, we really did not have any questions. We ordered their large guacamole platter while we decided. My wife and I both ordered caipirinhas. They were tart and excellent. The guacamole platter came with tri-color chips with three salsas - the guacamole itself, fresh pico de gallo and a VERY spicy salsa.

I was really torn on what to get. I absolutely love Cuban sandwiches, but we were celebrating, so I ordered Carne con Tequila - a chargrilled skirt steak served with tequila-infused sauce and Latin fries tossed with homemade chimichurri. It was fantastic. In talking to the waiter later in the meal, I asked about Pisco, a South American Liquor I'd never tried. He brought me a shot. It was very good, very similar to white tequila.

After dinner, and all of the drinks, I had a Cuban coffee to finish out the meal. 

There were some earlier reviews that mentioned slow service. I agree, but it was not unbearably slow and we were not in a hurry. The service allowed us a relaxing meal where we could enjoy the decor, the food and the company.

This was a great experience, one I am eager to share with others.

Great Cuban place! I went with my cousins and ordered the empanadas and ceviche for starters. The empanadas were amazing! Seriously!!! We ordered ropa vieja (pulled steak in tomato and garlic and onion sauce, that comes with rice, beans and tajadas) and pollo a la cacerola (chicken in a green sauce topped with guac and served with rice. Food was delicious. Service was ok. The decoration is beautiful and the music is very legit Cuban music. Would definitely recommend it.

Great food
Empanades to die for, moist and flavorful
Like the Latin insipred calamari 
She enjoyed the pulled pork and I had the 
Jalea De Mariscos, great slightly creamy seafood dish, mussels muy bien
the Latin music adding a warm ambiance to the meal. Hard to beat the excellent mojitos flight... Original, coconut and guava... kinda what they're known for.  Enjoyed the house Carmel Rum Flan, and the coffee..
Definitely a do again.  The wait staff was very well informed about the menu... If there was one shortcoming I would say no breads
The worst crab cakes I ever had tried in my life. I guess they made it from canned fish. The texture was far from crab meat. Very disappointed. The Mojito is too sweet. To much sugar, syrup etc.

I haven't ordered much food here so my review is for their drink menu and service. My girlfriends and I have been coming here for two years for their $20 mojito pitchers! We love it! Such a great deal and the staff is so friendly as well. 12/10 recommend!

I've been to Havana 3 or 4 times and have learned to stick with my favorites. Portions are very generous, and I like the dark, modern decor that's cozy at the same time.

Chimichangas ($9) were terrific, perfectly crisp and filled with moist chicken in an addictively good poblano cream sauce.

Empanadas ($11) were just ok, the manchego was the best by far while the chicken and ground beef weren't that interesting.

Carne con tequila ($18) wasn't great, the steak was slightly overcooked and I wasn't a huge fan of the tequila sauce. The chimichurri was good, but tasted a little weird alongside the tequila.

Pulled pork ($17) was a little underwhelming, the pork was tender but not very moist, and the potatoes and creamed corn were good but also added a lot of carb-y, creamy heaviness that wasn't balanced by any sort of acidity.

Seafood paella ($21) was a mixed bag. The seafood was plentiful and the chorizo was great with the pineapple, but the dish was a little dry overall and the rice wasn't crusty/crispy.

BBQ ribs ($19) were amazing. The ribs were incredibly flavorful and fall-off-the-bone tender, and the guava-infused BBQ sauce was tangy and unusual. 

Jalea de mariscos ($22) was also a fantastic choice, a lot of fresh shellfish including scallops and shrimp in a creamy coconut sauce over rice, I guess it's sort of like Cuban curry. Definitely recommend.

Havana has its share of hits and misses, but get the empanadas and either the ribs or jalea de mariscos and you'll leave full and extremely satisfied. I will be back for those.

Squeezed in for lunch this past Wednesday with a friend to use up my lunch-for-two Gilt City deal.  Generally, this was a great meal.  We tried both soups on the menu; I thought both were great, but my friend thought that the black bean might have had a slight edge.  I tried the Torta Cubana and was very satisfied...the ketchup had a little spice to it, which served the perfectly-cooked fries very well, and the bread the sammie was served on was excellent, as were the fillings.  My friend tried the Ropa Vieja...she thought it was good, but "not as good as the spots I used to hit in Miami", whatever that's worth!

The only negative was service/food delivery speed...we arrived at about five before noon for our noon reservation, but we didn't get out until just after 1.  For soups and sammies over the work day lunch hour, things moved a little slow for my taste.  Otherwise, I would come back here; menu prices seem fair and you get a ton of food for the price, at least off the lunch sammie menu.

The food is super mediocre at best. I got the Cuban sandwich which was 13$ and it had about one slice of dried out turkey. I could tell it just sat under the warmers for god knows how long. Our waitress was so rude it was unreal. Like I'm sorry to bother you and ask you to do something. It took her like 20 minutes to come see if we wanted anything to begin with. It was super disorganized. And my number one biggest pet peeve is restaurants that don't split checks I'm mean it's 2015 it's not that hard.
Delicious food. Quantity is sized so that you can enjoy the appetizers and desserts. Only complaint is that it is LOUD!

Great place for food and drinks. I'd say Cohiba in Lakeview maybe be more authentic but this is good too, and definitely has a great. ambiance. It's especially wonderful when it starts getting warmer and you can sit outside. Haven't had them in a while, but I believe the mojitos there are pretty good too, and of course good music always playing...you may or may not end up dancing while eating.

I thought this was a great place. I went on Friday night because I'd been on the road and wanted to eat. So my buddy chose this place, neither one of us had ever been. It's rather small, yet has a restaurant/bar atmosphere. We sat outside, it was just really loud inside plus the weather was great. It was great to people watch. The staff was super nice, very cordial, extremely attentive. There wasn't a moment where my glass was empty (always a plus!). The owner/manager came by and spoke with us, which I thought was great. Our waitress, I don't remember her name, was very attentive while busy at the same time. Really nice lady. The food was great. I ordered the flank steak w/black beans and rice. I don't remember it's actual name, but I was expecting something different, nevertheless it was really good. Their plantains I would say are absolutely the best!!!!!!! They were sweet, a little gooey, and soft with a slight edge of crisp. I know, you would think "how did they do that", if I could only tell you, I'm still trying to figure it out myself. I really wanted to go back the next day but they weren't open when I checked out of my amazing hotel! While at the restaurant, I also checked in with yelp and they offered a free dessert only on Monday - Thursday, so I was a little sad. I addressed it with my waitress who then asked the manager and the honored it.The little things like that made my experience really worth going there. I chose the Key Lime Pie. The dessert menu was small, they offered 2 types of Flan and a few other things, but my Key Lime Pie was just right. The graham cracker crust was perfectly matched with the sweet and tart of the key lime. They drizzled a puree of lime on the left side, and whipped cream on the right, with a twisted lime slice, it was really good. I wish I would've tried the Mojito Pitcher, but I was driving so I couldn't do such...but it looked great. The next time I go to Chicago, I'm ordering a pitcher just so I could try it out. Another thing I appreciated was the waitress. She was kind enough to inform us on the time it takes to cook certain foods, just in case if we had to hurry. She had great recommendations and a great sense of humor. I will definitely go back!!!

My husband and I stumbled upon Havana in route to another restaurant. The music outside caught my attention as I love Latin American culture. The food here was very good. We had ceviche, yuca, and shared the chile relleno. The customer service was great. They even split the dish for us. In general I would recommend this restaurant but also feel there are many other delicious restaurants nearby that may be even better. It was kind of pricy for a weeknight meal that was intended to be more casual.

This place is the mojito capital of Chicago, great selection of cocktails.  I had the roasted plantains and roasted vegetables which were too die for with a nice glass of sangria.  This place was very nice, you can run in and eat when there are lines at other chain reataurants.
Great atmosphere and the food was delicious.  Had some Mojito's with the owner, great guy!  Will def be back again
We are from out of town and every time we come to Chicago, we eat here. The chimichanga's, mojito's, ceviche and Rollins manchegos are delicious. Sauces are great and flavorful!

I went here last night with my dad and I probably never would have dined here if it wasn't for a Gilt City coupon. After reading some of the yelp reviews I was hesitant, but let me tell you-this place is amazing! We started off with a classic mojito, and it was perfect. Not too sweet, not too minty, just the right amount of everything. We ordered the ceviche appetizer and it was really good, especially with the plantains! For my entrée I had the salmon and oh man the flavors were everything. It had a BBQ flavor while tasting fresh and had a kick to it, which I thoroughly enjoyed since I tend to douse my food in hot sauce. 

The service was perfect, we were enjoying drinks and conversation and were not looking to get in and out. Personally, I think enjoying a meal for a long period time is one of the most relaxing things. Definitely recommend this place as it is provides different flavors than you'll find around River North!

This was a wonderful experience for all of us. We were surprised by the experience, the atmosphere, the service and the food. The Salmon a la Parilla was so delicious and succulent and the mixture of flavors on one plate were the perfect concoction of tastes. I will be back. I will be back again soon. My friends and I stopped in without a reservation and we received the service as if we were family. We all ate off of each others plays and we all were doing the happy dance as the flavors tickled our tastebuds. From the appetizers to desserts we were all happily surprised.

The last few times I've been here have been a major let-down in terms of service. 

We brought family here on our last visit, and I was a little embarrassed. I'd been raving about this place, and then our server didn't stop by until we'd been at our table for 15 minutes. Then he didn't greet us; just kind of a "Ok, what are we ordering?" He was absent for most of the meal. This isn't the first time it's happened to me here. And they're never busy, so I don't know what's going on.

The food is good, but honestly a bit overpriced for what you get.

The food is pretty authentic and I enjoyed the drinks I ordered. Unfortunately, the slow and inattentive service will ruin any good experience you have with the food. We went on a Saturday night and were seated in the basement. It was really, really loud. A small space with way too many people packed in.  Also, the restrooms were disgusting. When a restaurant has unkempt restrooms, it always makes you think how clean their kitchen could be. I would pass on this place if you have a choice.
Best mojitos ever / great food with real cuban flavor / and the crew and owner are the best of the Havana

Went with a group of 4 for dinner last week. For appetizers, the empenadas were not that good, but the chimichangas were delicious. 

For dinner we got the enchiladas which were your standard enchiladas. We asked for sour cream on the side which made it taste a lot better.

The sweet plantains were cooked perfectly. My favorite part of the meal by far. I have been to plenty of Cuban restaurants before, and this is an average one, but probably one of the better ones I have been to in the Chicagoland area.
Delicious food. My favorite dish is the Pollo Horneado con Platano. Love the atmosphere, music and location as well. Would definitely recommend.

I ordered Ropa Vieja and got a free desert Guava Cheesecake (by checking on Yelp, you can actually choose your favorite one)... They were very delicious!! This is the restaurant with great food and friendly service :-)

For starters...
Tostaditos de Platano = a simple recipe that was executed perfectly! The sauces were great!!

For dinner
* Pollo a la Caserola = perfectly crispy chicken with a sauce that complemented it perfectly!!
* Carne Asada = perfect grill time and the sauce was great!! 

We will be back!!

Good drinks and food for the most part. 

The first time I came the chicken I got was really dry but everything else I got was good. Upon returning, I got a sandwich and my fiancé got the other one so I had the chance to try them both. They were both very good and I would recommend them. Along with that, the sweet plantains are so good! 

The chips and guac appetizer is big so I would suggest getting a half portion. 

They have a lot of mojito flavors which is awesome!! 

The service is alright... not spectacular though.

I stopped here for lunch on a Monday through a colleague's recommendation because XOCO is closed on Mondays.  Wow!  This place is incredible!  The Chimichangas are phenomenal!  Who doesnt like fried, chicken-filled tortillas in poblano cream sauce, with cilantro sour cream and pico!

I had trouble deciding between the Havana Steak Sandwich (Tender slices of skirt steak with melted cheese, lettuce, grilled onions, and spicy mayonnaise served on onion ciabatta bread) or the Jibarito (which is basically the same as the steak sandwich with the difference being twice-fried green plaintains instead of the ciabatta bread).  The Havana Steak Sandwich is OUTSTANDING!  I could eat this everyday!  

I have to come back for dinner when music and dancing is the norm here.  I cant wait to try their house drinks!

Service was really good, but it was lunch and their were only 4-5 tables occupied.
Steak sandwich and pulled pork with sweet corn was great. Ropa  vieja was just ok.  Gets loud at dinner time.
Love this place, the only inconvenience is the fact that they do not separate checks. It gets hectic specially with big parties.

So our second time back and it turned out to be a party for 32 people. Their private party packages are awesome! Everything was smooth and organized. We stuck mainly with Mojito Pitchers for to keep things easy.

Ok drinks, not-good food. 

My friend and I had two mojitos each and shared the yuca con mojo. The mojitos were ok, tasted good but nothing spectacular. The yuca, though, not good at all. Fried yuca should be crispy on the outside, tender on the inside; this was just tough, no crunch, like it had been fried and reheated. The mojo (garlic sauce) didn't taste like garlic, and had this strange sweetness. Their chocolate cake was good though, not amazing, but good. 

The place itself is really nice and the music was good. It was a very nice night but I wish the food and drinks had been better.

LOVE Havana.  I live and work in LP, but will make a special trip down to eat at Havana.  

The Friday mojito pitcher deal for $20 is amazing.  As is their mini chimichangas.  Just writing about it is making my mouth salivate. 

By now, I think I have tried everything on their menu and there's nothing I haven't loved.  The service is usually a bit slow - and not overly friendly.  But for me, the food and drinks make up for it all! 

In the summer, they have a small patio that you can't beat!
Yum!!! Can't go wrong with Cuban food and the Mojitos!! So yummy. Got the Cuban sandwich and chicken quesadilla they were amazing. Definitely recommend!!

Loved this place way back when it was Mambo Grill and love this place now as Havana. Fridays are 1/2 price mojito pitchers and they make a pretty mean mojito. The chimichangas are my absolute favorite thing on the menu and I often just order these as my main dish, as does my husband. We also really love their guacamole and salsa starter as well as the Roasted Pulled Pork with jalapeño mashed potatoes and creamed corn...I wish they'd add a little more of the creamed corn but it is still delicious!

I've also been to Havana for a bachelorette party and they do a really great job accommodating larger groups. The booking is super easy and everyone that attended was super impressed with the menu options. Definitely busy on the weekends so I highly recommend reservations for a guaranteed table!

After coworkers mentioned that the food at this place was worth the terrible service, I decided to try it and I am so glad I did because now I know to never come back and tell others to not waste their money here. 

The food was okay, but the service was horrendous. Our server was just the worst, he came to our table once and when we told him we weren't huge fans of what we ordered, he did not care. We asked for a side of lemons, and he brought us 3 tiny pieces of limes that looked totally dry. The mojitos were so watered down, and they didn't come out until after our food did. We left so angry. 


Do not come here please, it's not worth it.

Second time Ive been here and both times have been great.  The chicken tacos were out of this world.  The only reason this doesn't get 5 stars, Is the ice tea tasted a bit off, like it was made with tap water.

Fantastic restaurant right by hotel.  I found this little gem on Yelp and I went to check it out.  The restaurant has a very nice ambience and good food.  For starters we ordered a guava mojito.  I heard so many great reviews about mojitos here, but I was a bit disappointed with my mojito because it tasted a bit watered down.  Not bad, but not what I was expecting in mojitos that have rave reviews.

For an appetizer, I ordered the fried plantain chips with warm black bean sauce and salsa - Platanos Maduros.  Wow!  The chips were perfect - crispy and crunchy coated with a spice that gave it the right kick.  The black bean sauce and salsa were perfect choice to eat these chips with.  Highly recommended!

I ordered the black bean soup - Sopa De Frijol, for starters.  A wonderful soup that is very flavorful and just yummy.

For the main course, I ordered the Chiles Rellenos.  Just perfect.  Highly recommended if you are a vegetarian.  The dishes were amazing with fresh flavors and ingredients.

If you are a dessert fan, don't forget to try out the Coconut Rum Flan.  All in all, this is a great restaurant and a great dining experience.

i ended up here on a fluke after the symphony and have mixed emotions about this place. there was a birthday party going on and it was quite busy when me and my guest went inside. we had appetizers and drinks to start off with. i ordered a pork dish and so did my guest. attentive staff! the meat was a bit dry but the flavor of the dishes was great. then the restaurant got dark and i was unable to finish my dinner until a waiter brought a small tea light candle to light the table. the candle didn't do much to light the table which is very frustrating considering i was hungry and was looking forward to my meal.  a dj provided great music for a bit, then a knockoff mana singer came on and sang loudly on stage. wasn't my cup of tea. i would've been content with the dj who was playing top 40. all in all this place isn't horrible, just needs to fix some of the small details to make the next time a great dining experience!

We walked past this place and noticed the amazing Cuban music Playing.  

After walking in we noticed it was $20 pitchers of mojitos on Friday.  The pitcher was amazing.  Hand muddled limes with mint.  Absolutely delicious.  

We got the apps and they were great too.  The place was dead though with us being the only ones in there. 

The sopa de tortilla was great same with the friend plantains.  

Good place to stop to.  Smaller and not packed at all.

I very much enjoyed my lunch at this cozy spot. They have a lunch menu which has many varieties and is very afford-ably priced which is super great for the nicer restaurants. I ordered the 3 Enchiladas with steak. They were nice and moist with strips of beef and covered with both a red & cheese sauce. This also came with white rice and black beans. I finished 1.5 enchildas and took the rest to-go.
I would totally come back and try more from this tasty adorable place.
Did I mention that the staff rocks! They are all about enhancing your dining experience at Havana. So refreshing! :)

The beat of the Gypsy Kings cover band brought us in. Can't remember the actual name of the band but we were swirling around dancing, and clapping so it didn't matter. Bad ass band!  

Mojito Friday special ($20) ended at 11pm. Great mojitos that sent me to to my happy place!!! 

The place is small and with the band playing and everyone dancing,  we stayed in our little corner near the front and danced. 

Mixed ages but we noticed a more older crowd, which was fine with us.  After leaving other bars with the 20 year olds this was a little more of what we were looking for. 

Solid.

Enjoyed the empanadas, caipirinhas, and skirt steak.  Fun, lively atmosphere.  A neighborhood staple.  Service is good and I have to comment that the older busser was busting his a** and doing a great job. He never stopped and moved at a fast pace and it was already 10:30 and long into his evening.  Don't know where he was getting his energy.  Management if you are listening, give this guy a raise!

My husband and I came for drinks and stayed for dinner!  We stayed at the bar and the bartender Shannon was very nicer and we couldn't beat the $20 for a pitcher of mojitos!  These were delicious! We decided to order food because the ambience was fun and loud! Just like we are used to! Not a great place for kids at night at least but it was just what we were looking for! My husband ordered the Ropa Vieja it was delicious.  Although he is Dominican and would have preferred a little more rice.  I ordered the Steak Jibarito.  It was delicious! Just as we thought our night was coming to an end, they brought in a live band.  So see stayed a little longer! We will definitely come back again!

Was there Saturday July 23, 2016 the waitress and hostess I had was great, my wife took me to this establishment to hear some live Cuban/ Salsa music.... Well they were about 1 1/2 hours late so we kept on drinking their extremely watered down drinks had about 7 mojitos 9 dollars a piece (not even a light buzz)and decided to order the chips and guacamole which were just okay, when they started to play live music but here is my issue they played a couple of  Latin songs then the rest were English versions then came some sort of Middle Eastern music at that point asked for my check and paid it in the dark added a 20% tip and left.This morning I realized the had already added a a healthy tip to the bill and there was only two of us! Needless to say I will not go back or recommend this place to my enemy.

Do you like screaming across a table? Do you like bland over-priced food? If yes, then this place is for you.

Loud
Meh, food.
Meh, service.

My wife and I just moved to the neighborhood from Rogers Park and there are so many options. But my wife being the mojito lover she is decided she wanted to try this place. She loved the drinks! (And so did I) we had the halibut and the salmon and both were just ok. Great atmosphere though!

What's not to like about Havana. It's easy to miss if you're not paying close attention but once inside the food and service is excellent. It's a nice relaxed vibe in the early evening and as the night goes on it becomes livelier.  So a little something for everyone. On my last visit, I decided to skip a full meal and go for appetizers. My choice was the Empanada trio and the Chimichags. Both dishes were flavorful, priced well and more than enough. I even took advantage of the Mojito special. (Pitcher for $20 on Fridays) enough for two people to easily share, which I did. The Mojito was as good as the food and I look forward to going back for the Capriahna special soon. Havana is good for date night, and after work drinks. Can't wait to try the dancing sometime.

Went here for a friends birthday dinner. To start our experience, they didn't have our reservation in their book... rough start. Off the bar we went to wait. Drinks are amazing, great mixed drinks and a good tequila list. Onto the food... Good creamy guac and a great smoky salsa with the chips and guac app. I got the slow roasted pork entree and was very excited for tender juicy meaty goodness with a side of sweet plantains and rice and beans. Well, my meat was overcooked, rice was undercooked but the sweet plantains were great. It's not hard to make sweet plantains delicious though. The service was fine but nothing amazing. They did bring the birthday boy a complimentary flan for dessert which was nice. Similar to the service, it was fine. Go here for great drinks and guac but skip the slow roasted pork.

Food was great, but half of our food wasn't delivered as ordered. When we called, we were refunded for the food that was missing and were specifically told that they would not "re-deliver" the rest of our food. What was the point of ordering?!

Mexican-Cuban fusion. Not a true Cuban restaurant. Dishes were overly salted and very oily. I would never recommend this to anyone.

We had the Tostones as an app, which were incredibly salty - more so than what you would find at any Cuban restaurant in Miami, Chicago, or NYC. And, the Lechon (roast pork) dish was very greasy. This was really weird because someone else in our party had the Ropa Vieja and found it to be dry as a bone.
I love spanish food . This was a nice intimate setting . Perfect for a first date ! I ordered a seafood dish that was amazing . He ordered the Carne Asada and it was seasoned to perfection.

If you have ever been to Miami and eaten Cuban food then I DO NOT recommend this place. You can literally see the writing on the wall, turn around and walk out. When you look around at the crown molding in the restaurant, there are different words for the foods they offer. Two stood out immediately, Marquitas (should be Mariquitas) and Plantanos (more like Platanos). If you claim to be a Latin restaurant at least spell the words correctly.

Moving on to the food. I was beyond disappointed with my food and service. I ordered Ropa Vieja and had 2 bites of the meat and that was enough for me. I admit I am spoiled by my Cuban mother-in-law, but this is ridiculous. Super fatty, chewy and totally the wrong flavor. The beans were just soaked in water with no salt and no sofrito. 

According to the group, the Cuban sandwich was good and the pork dish was ok. However, no one would return. Except maybe for the flan and Cuban sandwich.
