I also thought the cocktail sauce was a bit too sweet for my liking. Not enough bite (horseradish). I also didn't receive fries at all, and realized this as I was too far away to turn back. Oh well, next time, Gadget.

I'm trying to figure out what's the hype?   The food is just okay.  It's just fried shrimp.  There are places that do shrimp better.  Bob's shrimp in Hammond tastes fresher and is just as expensive.  Or Troha's.  Heine's, which is literally around the corner, is just a step down from this for a fraction of the price.  The smoked fish here is good, but it's really expensive. I spent like $60 on smoked fish, and then my family was still hungry afterwards.  The best part is the location.  They are right on the water and you get to eat outside at uncovered  picnic tables.  It's nice eating fresh fish with the sun on your back.  It's a real treat to watch the bridge go up.   I get the impression that a lot of people saw this on  television, drove "all the way" to the southside, and the biggest part of their review is based on their adventure to the southside as opposed to the actual food.

This place is good!!! We got fried shrimp, smoked shrimp, fried oysters, fried scallops, and smoked salmon. My husband likes the fried shrimp, I'm not a big fried shrimp person so it as just okay to me! The fried oyster wasn't that good either, I think because it was kinda soggy I don't know. But like earlier reviews the smoked salmon and smoked shrimp is to die for! SERIOUSLY! It's that good! I want to try the black pepper and garlic smoked salmon now and other smoked stuff. The fried stuff is just okay but the smoked seafood here is where it's at!

This place is just a little join on the side of the bridge. You order and you get out! But you need to try it, it's good!

I didn't even want to give this place a half a star. Prices are too high for the poor quality of shrimp. The shrimp were so small and was over cooked, but don't let me get on the under cooked onion rings that was so soggy. I rather go to Bobs Shrimp in Hammond because there medium shrimp looks like jumbo shrimp.

Awesome smoked salmon & smoked shrimps!!!

Not a fan of their fried oysters, though! But overall, it was great food! :)

Fantastic divey little fish stand on the far south side. 

Stellar smokey selection of pretty much anything that swims in the Great Lakes.  And somethings that don't.  I.e. my favorite: Smoked Shrimp

Boating Tip: you can dock for free at Crowley's across the river and walk across the bridge.

Zomg. What everybody says is true. Just go. Nice location too, something about the bridge, the tracks, the elevated freeway, the train drawbridge, the old industrial silos, is kind of romantic. Not even joking.

This place is definitely a experience to have in a life time. Fresh smoked fish and couple good fry items and wow. I had the salmon steak smoked and some smelts and they were to die for amazing and smokey just they way I thought it to be after watching the Anthony bourdain episode about this place. This is a must try spot for all Chicagoans and out of towners.

It's hard to go wrong here...the big thing was just committing to make the drive here, but once I got in, I could see why the reviews here are so great.

Tried the fried perch, fried catfish, fried clam strips, and the fried shrimp, while others in my party also got the fried oysters.  Besides the fact that I'm surprised I'm still alive and able to write this review, the food was amazing and all of the dinners come with fries so you'll find a way to leave full here for sure.  The space is small and not sexy, and there's nowhere to sit, and it's cash only.  But if you are in the market for smoked fish of almost any type, this is the place to go and between Bourdain showing up here and Calumet being a Beard award finalist a few years ago for being an historic eatery, you know it's legit!

Remember this place when I was real young. My dad and his best friend next door neighbor and his son (my best friend), and my brothers and even mom, use to fish near here on Wolf Lake...fun times! Brought back memories! Best Fried shrimp that I have had in a long time! Just the right amount of breading and seasoning. Service is quick and food is always freshly hot. Be careful...parking just on the side of a busy road but worth it! During the summer time, it i nice place to just eat at the outdoor table and watch boats go by and view the river/lake! This place has been here for a long time and still doing it right! They are truly famous for their smoked fish...a must try! Many famous/television chefs have visited this spot and rave over it!

Can someone who is a chicago native tell me if there is a way to get from downtown to this place without paying the toll? because we really didn't go on the bridge we passed the toll, drove like 3 steps ordered our food and U turned to get back to down town... such a waste of a toll. I did my research on yelp before coming here so i had an idea of what i wanted to order, there is no dining inside but there was a few seats outside (chicago is way too cold to eat outdoors in late october eary november imo) the fragrant of smoked fish consumes you as soon as you open the door, this is a small shop with lots of options. As per my fellow yelpers recommendations i ordered the fried scallops, the shrimp and the smoked salmon. The salmon was sooo good! you get a big portion for just a few bucks, i thought it was totally worth it! the smokiness is in every bite and i never had smoked fish before but i am now a fan! The scallops were small but juicy and they don't go cheap on it either, you get alot (they were a bit pricey if you asked me but i am glad i got to try it) the shrimps were HUGE i swear it was like they were on steroids but hey i am NOT complaining.... i am just amazed. There was so much meat in each of these delicious shrimp, i could eat these all day. If i had to come back i would definitely get MORE shrimp and try some of their other smoked pieces of fish... If i was only allowed to chose one item i'd go with SHRIMP!

It would be a 5 star review if it was food alone BUT the score got knocked down bc of the location (so far south), their cash only policy, and no place to eat (everyone in line at the same time also ate in their car).

But we loved what we ordered:

Fried scallops - the best and really hearty pieces
Calamari - delicious
Smoked salmon with garlic and peppers - great flavor
Fried oysters - good to try but probably sticking with cold oysters

First time here after getting fed by others from this gem of a find! This place is addicting with the fine smoked fish to choose from as well as the great dinner items! The location eclectic, the food great, the adventure fun!!!! Worth the trip!

Although the location is a bit odd and out of the way from most of downtown, it's well worth making your journey out. The smoked salmon was amazing and the place just feels like a historical and cultural gem. I can't fully recommend the fish dinner as it's not the salmon and the price was high for what it was. But if you're looking for the best smoked salmon in Chicago, look no further.

After reading about how Anthony Bourdaine has sponsored this place, I knew I had to stop by. 

This place is a 30 minute drive from downtown Chicago, so I would not suggest you take a taxi. If you decide to drive here, there is a $7 toll to get there and $7 to back into Chicago. The tolls can be pricey. I decided to stop by on my way home back to Michigan. You can park on the street or turn right into the fishery. 

Recently, Mark, the owner told me you do not need to take the skyway to get there. You can stay on 94 south.  When it splits with 57, get off on the first exit that will take you right to 95th street turn right and drive 3 miles and your at our door steps. Good tip for us tourist (;

The food is completely delicious. I really can not tell you how good this place is. I am still drooling when I think about their smoked pepper garlic salmon & smoked shrimp. Prices can be a bit pricey at $15 per lb for smoked salmon & $22 per lb for smoked shrimp, but it was definitely worth it. The flavors were on point. It was the best smoked fish I have ever had. The shrimp was just amazing! You can truly taste the true flavor of the shrimp. You can even smell the smoke from the shrimp. They do not have cocktail sauce. They have hot sauce and have an amazing tartar sauce. 

A few flaws are that they do not have a restroom, only take cash, and have only two tables to eat outside. Overall, I cannot wait to come back!

Great little fish shack! No pretension, just good food. There was a line (which I like to see), but it moved quickly. 

Had the fried shrimp and scallops, which were ok, but the star is definitely the smoked fish. Got the smoked salmon and trout and both were excellent. Would go back to try the smoked shrimp

Still on my barbecue bucket list is a trip to Kansas City, where the fine folks smoke anything under the sun. Given my Texas bias, which means brisket sits on the Iron Throne, ribs and sausage are Baratheons-in-waiting, and every thing else are declared usurpers of Westeros, I'm hesitant to think of things like smoked fish as barbecue.

To that end, my recent trip to Calumet Fisheries was like a visit from the lord of light, sponsored by Anthony Bourdain. The "pit" at Calumet looks like a free-standing, ironclad meat locker, but the smoke is legit. It wafts out and hits you like a proper BBQ joint should, and the output that the Calumet pitmasters pull from the smoke is pure gold.

First, some logistics. This is not an easy place to get to, as you have to drive far south on 90 or derail the trip off Lakeshore. Calumet is also truly a shack. It's to-go counter service only. On nice days when winter isn't coming or already frozen over, you can eat outside on a grass patch or on the few plastic picnic tables set up. Dogs are allowed outside the shack, and a bring your own soda or red solo cup policy is recommended. Ordering, as mentioned, is counter service. Anything smoked in the trays is ordered on the left, anything fried on the right. Got it? Good.

Now, onto the smoked fish. It's wonderfully delicious. The highlight of our self-made trio sampler platter was the sable, otherwise known as black cod. It's succulent, buttery, and amazing, kind of like eating a brisket cookie sliced off the point end, dripping in fat. Our second fish, the pepper salmon, tasted like the flat with a flavorful char and a firm, slightly dry, meat. To each his own. I prefer the buttery, melt in your mouth texture. 

We ended with smoked shrimp, easy to peel, easy to eat, easy to enjoy. Along for the ride (because as a Texas ex and Louisiana neighbor, I'm a sucker for fried seafood) was a small order of fried oysters, strewn in a Chinese take-out box, piping hot, and also incredibly tasty. Dipping those suckers, and frankly, any of the seafood, in Calumet's hot sauce is a recommend.

On that note, if I had but one complaint, it's that Calumet doesn't serve its seafood straight from the smoker. The smoked food isn't hot, but instead cooled and served at chilled temperatures. The pitmaster recommended waiting for room temperature before eating to bring out the flavor. He also provided by wife with ample samples right out the smoker. If my jealousy shows, it's because I was inside, in line, when these shenanigans occurred. Reheating isn't recommended, and so I'm just left wondering what a freshly completed, hot off the presses smoked fish tastes like. I'm guessing it would be in contention for the best smoked meat outside Texas.

"You guys are driving through the hood? Do you want to borrow my gun?" 
 
Our friend in Chicago thought we were nuts to drive all the way there for some smoked fish, but we know it's gonna be so worth it.

Salmon with garlic and pepper: so oily yet so tasty! Favorite!
White fish: actually our second favorite. Really good flavor.
Trout: pretty amazing fish, each section has its own distinct flavor and texture.
Smoked Shrimp: awesome.
Chubs: FAVORITE!!! But they are seasonal so we didn't have them this visit. We had it 5 years ago, amazing.

Very, very good scallops  and shrimp!  I finally tried the smoked salmon,  it was too die for!  The location is small, but the memorabilia  on the wall  keeps you entertained  while they prepare  your order. 

It is cash only, so come prepared.

I have visited this place countless times and I was always the fried shrimp girl but I ventured into the smoked fish and shrimp and there is just no going back. I went there on a Saturday and they had just brought in some Sable and Salmon from the smoke house so I picked up a piece of each. I must say I was blown away with how good both pieces of fish were. I personally liked the sable more but my husband enjoyed the salmon either one we were hooked. I really like when the fish is fresh out of the smoke house and it hasn't been refrigerated, you can call and ask they will tell you when they have a batch coming out.

It took me toooooooo long to get here and I am only kicking myself!! GREAT no the BEST.... smoked fish I have ever had : )!! YUM. Go now and try it all... bring a cooler and fill it up, trust me!!! Smoked salmon was my favorite. the peel and eat shrimp were also great! Bring Cash...

Went there recently for catfish, smelled good until I realized the food was under cooked.  We'll be calling the location to see how they respond, but I took a chance and visited this place regardless of my mind saying NO because of the appearance!  Goes to show you about going with your first thoughts. Eat at you own risk!!!

I'm from New York.  Fried shrimp was never something that was a big thing growing up for me.  

However.  I am now a "real Chicago broad", as my husband likes to call me.  And fried shrimp are F*&$-ing delicious.

Calumet was my first fried shrimp experience.  It did not disappoint.  Sitting in the back of my buddy's car, eating greasy shrimp and fries with my fingers--perfection.  The ice cold Dr. Pepper was the perfect complement.  

You've gotta check this place out.  Seriously.  My husband brought home a smoked salmon and a smoked trout.  Can't wait to eat that next :)

p.s. CASH ONLY

Calumet Fisheries is in the middle of nowhere.   Like nowhere so bad that it's almost Indiana.  And it's next to a bridge.  And it's super dystopian everywhere and there's lots of metal and concrete.  In fact, it's so fcked up looking that Anthony Bourdain dragged his arse out here one time to film an episode of his show and was all like "OMG, be a traveler not a tourist..blah blah blah, live life to the fullest etc etc."  

So now, all these dudes trying to live life to the fullest come out here in hopes of experiencing something new.   I don't know what exactly. They probably don't know either but the hope is that it'll be new or interesting in some way.  In terms of the food, part of the hook is that the fish here is smoked on premises in a shack behind the restaurant.  According to the proprietors this is super rare these days.  So there's that.

For me, it was mostly for the bike ride and to see the area.  This place seemed like a good end point.  On arrival, after admiring the signed Anthony B poster,  I ordered deep fried catfish + fries.  And I put a to-go order in for some smoked shrimp and smoked (garlic and pepper) trout.    The catfish meal was exactly what I would have expected..deep fried and catfish.  Okay by me.  Nothing special.

I put the smoked fish/shrimp in the fridge and tried it a couple days later.  A bit of a  surprise ensued.  The smoked shrimp was partially rotten.  Some was edible, other parts were mushy and I had to spit out.  The smoked trout while not rotten was surprisingly terrible.  I had a few bites and threw it out too.  And I buy smoked fish sometimes, so I know what I'm talking about.

Back when I visited the restaurant, there were a few dudes standing outside (there's no seating inside) who ordered the whole menu.  You know..to live life to the fullest.  Anyways, they beered me a deep fried frog leg to try.  In an adventurous spirit I had a go.  Actually I only had a couple of small bites.  Not that great.  Which is what I'd say about this Calumet Fisheries place.

Aesthetically abhorring (almost), heavenly to the tongue. 

We found out about this place from Mr. Bourdain. Therefore, expectations were very high. The smoked salmon exceeded our expectations. We also ordered other "dinner" items, fried shrimp and oysters. They were, well, fried. But this place is definitely worth it for smoked fish (salmon).

Pros: 
1. Smoked fish: the best that I have ever tried.

Cons:
1. Location: it is in the middle of nowhere, very small and there are no restrooms.
2. Cash only: there is an ATM inside though
3. No seating available :(

I recently heard about Calumet Fisheries and really wanted to check it out.  This Saturday proved to be the perfect opportunity to drive down from where I work on the South Side and have lunch outdoors.  The place definitely looks like a shack on the side of the road, and I wouldn't have ever stopped inside if it weren't for the rave reviews.  We ordered fried oysters, clam strips, smoked salmon, and a few smoked shrimp.  They forgot a couple of things that we ordered, but we were ordering pretty sporadically between the one counter for fried food and the other for smoked seafood.

I love, love, love seafood and especially smoked salmon.  It was pretty amazing!  The shrimp were great as well.  I wasn't a huge fan of the fried oysters, but I bet there are someone else's jam.

I'm happy I got to check this place out!
Smoked fish (smoked on the premises), who even does that any more? Don't miss this place! I heard they use natural wood and no artifical flavoring. All i know is their fish is delicious.

The fried clam strips and smoked shrimp were awesome. The smoked salmon was good... but I much prefer it to be filleted with the bones removed instead of steak cut. It was quite the hike from the western suburbs so I don't see myself going back out there unless I'm super craving those awesome smoked shrimp.
I know most people are fans of this place but I did not care for it.  We tried many of the fried items and only really enjoyed the friend shrimp.  I don't plan of stopping here again.

We usually drive past this place very often and I never stopped until one day we had a hankering for some shrimp. We seen this place on Anthony Bourdain's show and decided it was time. We ordered the fried shrimp and the chicken nuggets for our little one. The food was ok. I thought the cocktail sauce they used really complimented the food. Next time I go, I will have to remember to bring cash and also to try the smoked fish. This place is often crowded as well on Fridays, so be mindful of that.

Welp! Not what I was expecting. I have to stop putting faith in seafood that is located in the city and at a low cost. This is mediocre at best. The scallops are not fresh and very chewy. The shrimp are clearly store brought and not fresh. The smoked fish is good, but to be honest. I can get the same quality out of a can of tin fish from the grocery store. The best thing was the cheese bites and that is very sad. If I am in the area and craving some cheese bites and smoked trout. I will make the stop, but other then that. I will stick to Pappadeaux out in the burbs for quality seafood.

I'll keep this one short and sweet.

Just go here and get anything smoked.

You can't find anything like this anywhere on the south side.

Fried shrimp very delicious.

Skip the fries. 

Cash only.
Amazing seafood! However, during winter, plan to take out (or eat in the car) because there is no table where to eat.

We've been wanting to come here ever since seeing it on Anthony Bordain's show and it was great! I had the smoked salmon (very good) and fried catfish (excellent). It is a little pricy but the quality merits the price. 4 starts for a lot of not-homemade items like the coleslaw, potato salad, and sauces.I would happily go back!

I came back here after not eating there for a long time, but I was in the middle of running errands and stopped through for a bite. My only issue with them is they don't accept credit cards and they have an ATM machine (strongly advise not using because the owners of the ATM will assess a fee and you'll get charged by you bank also for using the machine). They really do need to get with the the times in terms of how people pay for things. So until they get their payment methods updated where they accept credit cards is to bring cash. I ordered some fish chips and they were pretty good tasting almost identical to the way Lawrences makes their fish chips. Also this place has had the same owner and remained in the same location since 1948. Again they do need to come with the times because Lawrence's Fisheries used to look like Calumet Fisheries, but the family that owns Lawrence's have gotten a website with their menu and the restaurant's history on it and even going as far as taking orders via the site and  expanded by remodeling the restaurant and even expanding with a second location. It's a cute little divey place and will get crowded on certain days preferably Friday and Saturday nights. Everything is cooked fresh to order which is what I like because I like freshly prepared food and not some mess under a hot lamp. There is only one picnic table outside so prepare to eat standing up, in your car or wait until someone leaves to use the table (weather pending). Overall the food is pretty good :-)

What do i say about a place that everything had been said. Gr8 food. Froglegs & smelt are a personal fav! Light breading, fast service. Place is a dump but who cares! Its got it baby! Ambience, the river & style! Cheap prices, i love them. Please go u wont be dissapointed! Its a chicago icon & a mom & pop place.  Shrimp is killer!

Great to go fish place, its just by the 95th street bridge, there's really only street parking so just be aware, (well there's a gravel lot just west, but idk if that's an actual parking lot) it's also real small and cramped inside, with just some picnic tables outside to sit at, but don't let that take away from the quality of the fish, it's a chicago staple, almost 70 years old, from the fried selection we got scallops, fish nuggets, calamari and stuffed shrimp, (scallops and shrimp were best imo) and then the smoked salmon, the smoked options are just more expensive so thats why we couldnt get much, tho it was def good, and then potato salad and french fries sides, which were standard, id for sure go back and try some of the more exotic fish on hand
Tried the smoked shrimp, & I loved it!! :) I cannot wait to come back and try the smoked salmon and lake perch!  Everyone should check Calumet Fisheries out. You won't be disappointed!

Pros- 
- wide selection of fish
- tasty selection of side dishes including dessert
- reasonable prices
- friendly staff

Cons-
- takeout only - no dining in

- if you have a shellfish allergy, but still eat fish beware this can be a death trap! I'm allergic to shellfish, but I've been eating fish from this place since, I was a kid. A few months ago, I order the usual fish order and my shellfish allergy kicked in. My face started to swell and etc.  I did NOT order shellfish, but my order came in contact with something that touched shellfish. I'm guessing they reused their frying oil, because there's no other reason for my allergic reaction. Whatever the case this is a great place, but avoid it if you have shellfish allergies. No food is ever really "to die for".

Wow. So, the bridge was up and we had time to kill so we decided to try this local legend out. So glad we did. We opted for the fried stuff because we were in the mood for it. The smelt and clams were amazing. Absolutely amazing. Definitely going back for the lemon pepper smoked fish. Fresh smoked fish on Fridays or Saturdays so plan accordingly. Honestly worth the short drive. Cash only but there's an atm there.

I can't wait to come back!
The smoke salmon and shrimp were by far my favorites. For a very decent price we had a feast, from the smoked section we also had the white fish and from the fried side we had oysters
Not easy to recommend a specific item because everything is delicious and worth trying.

Great fried seafood in a family run spot. The location is in the most unlikely of places and finding it is half the fun. No tables, takeout only, so be prepared to eat in your car or outdoors if the weather permits. I haven't tried any of the smoked offerings but definitely plan to on my next visit!

nothing beats smoked fish like this place...a small hole in the wall in the middle of nowhere but my oh my, the fish is delicious and fresh.. I wish we had a place like this back home. I could buy by the pound for my weekly sandwiches. No more am I going to be able to enjoy store bought smoked salmon.. Calumet fisheries has raised the bar! By the way, no restrooms.. relieve your duties before coming here..

Fried shrimp and smoked salmon are incredible, made even more so by eating it from a cardboard box by the bridge (or in your car if you don't mind the smell of fried food in your car for the next month). Will definitely return.

Ordering and service is a bit like Black Friday, but once you get past all that, it's all up from there.  They basically have the stuff to eat now like fried fish and clams, then the smoked stuff to take home for later.  The fried catfish was pretty great, especially with some mild bbq sauce. The fried clams were good, a touch to chewey, but some of the better clams I've had outside of New England. The smoked salmon with pepper was amazing. Its truly a destination food to come and have.  Awesome place.

So I have been meaning to go here for a number of years after seeing it on an episode of No Reservations. I went on President's Day as this place seemed perfect for a workweek adventure. It is definitely a bit of a trek and in no man's land. Be warned that there is no place to eat outside of in your car. I ordered fried pickles and fried oysters. The fried oysters were to die for and so crispy yet juicey. The fried pickles were good but they were spears and I would have liked pickle chips more. My friend got the catfish with fries. The catfish tasted great but the fries were the standard steak fries found everywhere. I will definitely go back and may consider doing it during a bike ride in the summer.

It's all about the smoked seafood items here, such as the smoked salmon. If you don't get at least one smoked item, you're doing your visit wrong in my opinion, as that's always been their specialty. There's probably a reason that's the main thing I recall really liking here, and that the rest of what I ordered was good to not bad, but not sure if I'd say go out of your way unless you're on the south side. It's worth a trip at least once IMO, just for how darn good I really liked the smoked salmon here. I hope to do a visit when the weather warms up later in 2015, to see how the rest of the smoked seafood compares to the smoked salmon.

BTW if you don't have a car, it's just a short walk(or bike ride) south from the 93rd Street(South Chicago Metra Electric branch) Metra station, to here. Go west from the station on 93rd St. to Baltimore Ave, Baltimore south to South Chicago Ave(major southeast/northwest road), South Chicago to 95th Street, then 95th east to the bridge. With this route, you won't have any delays between Metra and here if by some chance the drawbridge goes up, like it did at least on one past visit. And yes, this is the exact one seen in the 1980 Blues Brothers movie. No seating inside, except for a few tables outside, eating inside your car, or walk a few blocks east to Calumet Park and Beach to eat your food. Parking(no meters, and free btw) is mainly along 95th Street inbetween the South Chicago/95th traffic light and bridge, and at least one vacant lot immediately west of here has no parking signs, so be advised of this if you drive here.

Nearly forgot to note this place is CASH ONLY, btw.

I really liked the food from Calumet.  My friends and I all piled into a car, bought a whole boatload of food, and ate at Calumet park, as others have suggested.  It was a chilly day, so I think the food will taste even better on a sunny, warm one.  We sampled both the fried food and the smoked fish, though I was disappointed that someone had apparently bought their entire supply of smoked sable for the day, so I'll have to try that next time.  I really liked the pepper-garlic salmon.  It was so moist and flavorful!  Perfect with cream cheese )brought from home) and hot sauce.  The smoked shrimp were really big and moist also.  Like Johnny T, I really prefer cleaned shrimp, but I do understand that the shells probably need to be intact in order for the shrimp to stay moist through the smoking process.

The fried things we tried (clam strips, smelts, shrimp) were also good, but I think I liked the smoked stuff better.  Of the fried things, I think my favorite were the smelts.  I kind of wished the clam strips had been more big pieces instead of small--lots of small bits.

I would skip the potato and macaroni salads--not my cup of tea.  Next time I'd make and bring my own.

The folks at the counter were really nice and accommodating, especially since we were taking a while to strategize and put our order in.  They happily gave us extra paper boats and other fixings.  It's not necessarily the cheapest place, but the fish is really good, so you get what you pay for.  It's worth the trip!
Great food, just pricey and doesn't take debit/credit. Smoked shrimp was amazing. Take out only.

I love the smoked fish here.  But I don't care for their fried items.  I've been going here for years.

@Annie N. from Brooklyn...Chicago natives avoid the tollway. You can get here easily via highway 41 (Lake Shore Drive)
What a find!!  This is a store for buying amazing fish. I went out with friends on a bike ride from downtown Chicago. It's a great destination for riding.
Its always a pleasure to get smoked fish from this place!
The full order of fries shrimp was on point. I've also tried the smoked salmon, which was also very good.
This place is awesome they have young kids working there that have the best attitudes i have ever encountered in a restaurant great food and great service it has such a home feeling.
The smoked salmon is good. But their catfish must be an acquired taste, because it was horrible to me.

There is always a line in this little jewel but it is so worth the wait!  I remember eating from this restaurant when I was just a little girl - many, many years ago! The fish was always freshly prepared on the spot, hot & delicious. My mom would buy the smelts back then & it would be a special treat.  The food seldom made it home.  It is just as good now as I remember back then.
Highly recommended!
Smoked shrimp and pepper garlic salmon was awesome.  Hard to find place but we'll worth the drive.

On my daily commute back home, I'm always tempted to make a quick pit stop by the Fisheries and make use of the emergency stash of cash I keep in my car for this purpose alone. I've had many of the smoked variety - salmon, sable, trout, shrimp - and a couple of the fried options as dinners to go - catfish and oysters. The anticipation of ripping open that white paper package kills me on my drive home.

You can't go wrong. Though, I will say the sable isn't always available and, to be honest, it's not as good as the salmon (too fatty). My personal favorites are the salmon and shrimp, which have an almost buttery taste with its natural oils kept heavily concentrated inside through the smoking process. Not to mention, the smoked salmon almost feels like a steal at ~$15/lb. The fried oysters are also surprisingly delicious.

For those who aren't fortunate enough to work in the beautiful NW Indiana area, make the trip. It's worth it. The Fisheries are an institution that doesn't fail to live up to its reputation.

They smoke their fish in-house, and it's where Anthony Bourdain went to get some good fish in Chicago.  Need I say more?  Well, I probably should:  This place is not close to you...it's probably in a part of the city you didn't know existed, even though the Blues Brothers car jumping bridge scene was shot here.  It's very far south and very far east, but if you're anywhere near the neighborhood it's a must.  

They have an assortment of sea food smoked in different ways and even their fried catfish, shrimp, etc. are good.  They are cash-only and there's no where to eat inside, so pack up some wet wipes, and plan to eat outside in your car.

Happy I finally made a point to drive down here. What a unique place! My family did the smoked salmon, pepper and garlic smoked salmon, and smoked whitefish. The p&g salmon and the whitefish were both standout. We also did the smoked shrimp which were interesting to try (have never had) and were good as well. My brother likes slaw and wasn't impressed by theirs. Good experience though. Happy I've gone at least once and if am in the vicinity will definitely come back

This place will quench your fried seafood craving.
I had the fried shrimp, oysters, and fish. Everything was fried perfectly. 

The shrimp was awesome and retained a lot of the shrimp flavor for being fried. 

The oysters are on the pungent side (not because it was going bad, just the type of oyster it was), but I didn't mind this because I like pungent foods. The consistency of the oyster kept most of its raw form, which I also liked, but it's a little weird to bite into a crispy fried batter and have something mushy/boogery flood into your mouth. This isn't a complaint, though. Still pretty tasty. 

The fish was good. Nothing special, but delicious nonetheless.

Fries were just ok. Typical fries. The cole slaw is 80% mayonnaise. 

The guy gave us a sample of the smoked fish and shrimp. Oh my goodness, did that fish melt in my mouth. They smoke it and retain a lot of the fat content, which is hard to do since smoking dries out meat. Next time I go, I'm going to get a steak of smoked salmon. It was pretty amazing and the smoke flavor was great! The smoked shrimp doesn't retain as much of the smoke flavor due to the shell, but it was still good.

There is no seating. You eat in your car, or outside on the curb if it's not winter.

The food here is decent, but nothing I would go out of the way to find.  The guys that work here are friendly and fast.  I tried the following:

FRY FISH - I'm not sure what kind of fish, but $7 got me a pretty good amount of fried fish pieces and they were pretty good.  The tarter sauce went well, as tarter sauces and fish go.  I would try the smoked salmon next time around.

FRY SHRIMP - $5 got me half order of friend shrimp, which at first I thought were the fish when I ate them.  The texture was more fish-like than shrimp like.  I dipped them in both tarter sauce and the hot sauce, but felt like neither sauce did the shrimps justice.  

Notes:
-Cash only
-Plenty of street parking
-There's no place to sit and eat, plan on taking it to go

Simple yet most effective way to write this review, this place can be summed up five words and here we go, best shrimp in the city.  Whether you eat it in your car or lucky enough to get one of the picnic tables you will not be disappointed, this is easily a must have, the shrimp is so fresh lightly breaded and just plain awesome, the fries are the perfect complement and the choice of sauces just add to the perfect meal.

We dropped by last Friday afternoon and all the guys were very friendly. All were helpful and gave us a sample of the salmon. Boy, we were in for a treat! One of the guys (regret not asking his name) explained the sections of the salmon that taste best. He also suggested the eye but we declined; we're not that cool.  Since we had purchased other food before the sample, we did not buy the smoked fish. On Saturday afternoon, my man suggested smoked fish for dinner so here we go again. We ordered the pepper and garlic salmon and the smallest piece of sturgeon. Once we got home, we began with the sturgeon.  We regret buying the smallest sturgeon piece. The sturgeon was perfect! It was not flaky like other fish, it was very soft, flavorful and boneless (at least the section we bought). We bought a bigger piece of salmon and it was delightful. I expected to taste the garlic but I did not; however, we enjoyed it. Frankly, between the sturgeon and salmon, I prefer the sturgeon. 
The service during both visits was exceptional and we waited a few minutes to place our orders during both visits because there were several people ahead of us.   Knowing my man's eating habits, we will be frequent customers. We've already determined that when family visits in a few weeks, we will be having smoked sturgeon for dinner.

If you enjoy smoked fish, go here because it's quite delicious. Good smoked trout, salmon, sturgeon, shrimp, with a variety of sides to choose from. I loved the fried pickles, fried pickle spears to be exact, some of the best I've had.

If you like the Blues Brothers and want to see where the bridge scene was filmed, go here.

If you follow Anthony Bourdain wherever he goes, go here.

This is kind of far from anywhere so find a car to drive here. It is cash only. There is no seating inside or outside so you either eat in your car and stink it up big time, or better option - drive down a little further and go sit and eat on a bench by the lake.

Cash only, does not take bills over 100, so I was extremely limited in what I could purchase w $10, so I got 1/2 order of fried shrimp, which was solid. Will have to come back soon for more...and with more cash.
Great food and fast service. The fried shimps are to die for. I have neen going there for years and I was never disappointed.

I've just got back from Calumet Fisheries East 95th Chicago ILL.                        I ordered Stuffed Fried Shrimp/ Fried Frog Legs /Smoked Salmon/ Smoked Cat Fish/  Smoked  Shrimps.     It has been well over 14 years since I've eaten stuffed shrimps and it was well worth it and the drive I had three just sitting there in the car mum-mum mum good.....two or three frog legs there mum mum good.........on the drive back my hand was in the bag again for another stuffed shrimp..........................the smoked catfish/ salmon and shrimps were just as good......I'm out south from time to time and will be dropping in for more.  Maybe it's good I didn't know Calumets was there when I lived out south. But I know now.......yes yes yes ............... Boy the Stuffed Shrimps..............
Been going there since I was a kid. Love the fish and chips and shrimp. Don't forget the fries. Mix the hot and mild sauce for the best. They used to have a medium but got rid of it years ago.

So I wasn't a huge fan of this place.  I drove alllll the way down here with high expectations, but I'm going to have to disagree with my fellow Yelpers.  This place was nothing special.  We ordered a ton of food - fried clams, fried fish, fries, smoked fish, shrimp, etc. and all of it was meh.  There was absolutely nothing special about it at all.  The breading on everything was bland and the fish was of so-so quality.  In addition, the place was extremely slow and smells disgusting.  This place was definitely not worth the trip.  I've had much better fried everything downtown.
Fried shrimp wasn't the greatest. Breading wasn't great and very greasy. The smoked fish and shrimp was super good! Would go back just don't have the deep fried shrimp, could've been better.

Who comes to a pizza place and orders salad? This girl, right here. In my defense, I'd had a big lunch!

Service: attentive enough. Both the bartender and waitress were pleasant, and there wasn't a whole lot of wait time for our orders. We went on a weekday though, so I can't vouch for weekend service.

Food: Decent. I had the kale cobb and as a person who normally doesn't care for salad, it was pretty good. The salad comes in two sizes: "quite small" and "good lord, that's a whole lot of salad!" If you go for the latter, split it with a friend. I tried a bit of pizza, as it smelled so yummy...that tasted pretty good too. 

Drinks: I probably had four drinks and didn't feel much of anything. Maybe my tolerance is evolving. Maybe not. 

Misc: The chairs at those high tables are uncomfortable as a mofo. Fair warning. 


Overall decent restaurant. I'd return in a heartbeat if I was in the area.

Service sucks. 

The artichoke dip comes with a lot of dip but 1/2 the amount of bread you need.. so the server came right away asking if we wanted more bread for 2$. Rip off. 

Our table for 2 is too small, even for 1. Asked for a 4 top since there were 4 open. The host said they were "for reservations."

 I wouldn't waste my time.

If you're looking for a fun place to eat average food and drink mid-priced alcohol, Parlor provides a nice ambience with their outdoor patio and rooftop. 

None of the food was exceptional, including the pizza sadly, except for the crazy bread. The Craziest Bread with Warm Marinara, to be exact, is basically cheesy garlic bread with shallots, pepperoni, and sesame seeds. It's delicious. All in all a fun place to meet friends but I don't plan to go back anytime soon.

May be one of the best pizzas I have had! Personally I'm not a fan of the deep dish pizza, it's too much cheese for me! Parlor pizzas are perfect for me. I ordered the "burratta be kidding me" which had arugula and truffle oil, so yummy! The bread was delicious! I was so full afterwards and me and a friend split the pizza between us. Definitely need to come back for another trip. I've been upstairs to their rooftop also, it was a fun place to grab drinks and hangout. We had some Moscow mules, which were good, although next time I'd like to check out their other drinks. If you come here for a meal, you won't be disappointed.
Great food, great atmosphere, great location.

Great place to day drink and snack.   The food isn't really the best but it will do when drinking.  Tried the craziest bread- wasn't crazy about it- a little to greasy for me- but everyone else at the table loved it. My group got a pitcher of white sangria- it was delicious.  We moved onto the red sangria- not as good.  There was a clove-y, cinnamon-y, spice taste to it that was a bit too strong.  We ended up not even drinking half of it.  Overall great hangout spot to drink with friends and people watch.

This place is great for large groups and drinking. Food is not the best but not the worst. Pizza is what they are known for, but I would go elsewhere for it. 

The craziest bread appetizer is BOMB DOT COM. If you come here for food, I would definitely recommend this dish. I had the BLT pizza which was alright. The pizza was soggy on the bottom, and it was slightly greasier than I expected. I know it's pizza, but still. The fries were good, enjoyed the sauces it came with. 

I gave 4 stars because of the atmosphere and the patio. When the temperature is perfect and you're on the patio with a beer/cocktail and your bffs, life is good.

Was there at night. Place was packed, good crowd and good service. I've heard good things about it in the daytime - but haven't been! So, will check it out. Other than that, it seems like a good place for group outings and fun!

We really enjoyed parlor... It was our first time out in west loop for a while and we were impressed. We went as a group on Saturday night around 6. It was packed, but we luckily got a table for reservation.

Our waitress definitely wasn't super attentive-- when I got there I had to wave a bus boy down to ask him for the waitress. We ordered a few drinks and food and were fine with the whole experience. We all really, really liked our pizza choices. Unfortunately, after we were done eating, we couldn't really hang out there because it was so packed. For some reason they didn't have the roof open either.  If not for the staff, I would give 5 stars.

This could be a decent place but the service sucks and so does the seating! For the service when we were first seated we asked if we can move to a booth if one was available and the waitress replied in a snotty way "that's not something I can help with you have to go to the host" and just walked away! Then our second waitress after we were moved barely came to our table and we asked her to split the check 4 ways (menu says you can do up to 4) she replied back with attitude and smirked "yeah". The bust boys had better customer service then our own waitresses!! For the seats, you ether sit in these really uncomfortable high chairs or in a squished booth. 

Few good things, is the food (great crazy bread, good pizza and salads) nice bar area, nice patio and easy parking around the area.

This place gets packed after work on a Thursday! Maybe it was the specific day, but there were multiple events and parties at this fun spot. For good reason too- very spacious with indoor, semi outdoor, fully outdoor, and rooftop patio seating. And who doesn't love pizzas and beer? This is the perfect gem for group events in the west loop.

My party ordered multiple pizzas and apps, and we were all very very happily full by the end of this meal:
Fried mozzarella- very tasty and interesting. I especially liked the balsamic glaze.
Hummus plate- good hummus, you can never really go wrong with such a dish, fresh veggies and toasty bread to accommodate 
Craziest bread- this was the highlight of the appetizers. More like a hearty pizza if anything! 
Nacho bites- spicy! But I loved it
Our pizza selections in order of my favorite to least favorite (but still delicious!): burrata be kidding me, Abe foremans fav, margherita, Sgt. Pepper 

You can't go wrong with any of the pizzas or apps on this menu! The draft selections are great too- our servers kept me coming. The wait staff was very accommodating and continued to make sure everything at our table was tidy and taken care of. Excellent service for a big group on a busy night. Fully impressed!

Cool place with a lively west loop atmosphere.  The attention to detail is great, there are event men, women, and anyone restrooms, kudos for the inclusion. The chairs are really uncomfortable to sit in, literally, I doubt there is anyone who would say its a great comfotable place to lounge.  The woodfired pizzas are great, and the infredients are high quality.  I did not like my pizza call the Burriata be Kidding Me.  The garlic and lemon really overwhelmed the flavors for me, i asked for a side of marinara to use to dip, and i was delivered a generous dish of marinara on the side.  My husband got the Abe Froman, and loved it. I docked one star for the super uncomfortable chairs, and another star for the lack of interest from our server.  But I would give this place another try, and order something different, and maybe ask for the booth seating.

Love the pizza here. Personally not a fan of deep dish pizza so thin crust pizza here was perfect for me. There is a good selection of beers/liquor on offer here if you just wanted to go in for a drink. Plenty of space both inside and outside so great for large groups aswell as small parties. Super relaxed vibe, sports on the TV's. Food was delivered quickly after ordering which was good and the servers don't seem to rush you to order (some people may not like this obviously) which adds to the relaxed atmosphere. I went on a Sunday, it was not overly busy and bar service was surprisingly slow. I was there a while before any bar server acknowledged me. Generally though the food is really good here, I would really recommend the nacho bites as an appetiser!

I've been here a few times for drinks, but haven't had their pizza yet! Some friends and I came here one rainy Sunday to check out the Bloody Mary bar. For $9 (prices depend on the vodka) you get a big ol cup of vodka and ice and can fill it to your heart's desire with bloody mixes and garnishes. They had a few different types of tomato juice and a great selection of pickled veggies, meat, cheeses etc. I regret not adding more skewers! They don't mess around with their vodka pour, either! 

We snacked on the nacho bites which were delicious. In our minds, the black beans and avocado made it healthy! One friend is vegetarian and the waitress was cool about having the meat on the side.

Service was good but the bus boys were too much! The place was busy, but not super packed so maybe they were just over staffed, but the bus boys were constantly hovering. Any time I put my napkin or utensil down it was quickly snatched away. wtf?!

This place is pretty big and has a nice out door patio for the summer. I need to come back for pizza!

I have mixed feelings on this place. On one hand, the location in the West Loop is great, the dining room is huge, and they have have two patios. On the other, it can get VERY loud on the inside, and there are better pizza places in the city. I mean, it's Chicago for crying out loud! The pizza can be skipped, but what I will recommend is the Craziest Bread. Chock full of garlic, mozzarella, parmesan, pepperoni, and more, it's the best kind of food coma you could ask for.

It's pizza, you really can't screw it up. They have some good/unique recipes, prices are fair. But ultimately its a cool place to have beers and pizza for any reason. I went for work but would have gone with friends as well. It is huge, can handle large groups. has the sport bar feel, TV's everywhere so that can be distracting. Service was great, ordered and minutes later our pizza's were there. One of my colleagues ordered salad and had a little longer wait, apparently they have a separate kitchen for non pizza. Additionally one of her tomatoes had the sticker still on it. She said it tasted fine but I would stick to pizza.

This place is huge. Huge inside. Huge outside beer garden and roof top patio. Though the roof top was closed the day I went. 

I ordered the calamari fried of course. It was huge good for 4 people plus has a little kick because of the peppers mixed in. Love it this way. 

Ordered the craziest bread. Holy crap. It's huge and filling. So much so we didn't even order pizza because of how full we were after. 

Bummed I missed out on the pizza but the entire time we were there we were so uncomfortable. The high top table stools are sooooo bad. The backs make me feel like I'm slipping off the entire time. 

I'm sure I'll be back. Next time booth.

I finally decided to go back nearly two years later in the small hopes that it would have been better than my first experience...sadly NOPE.

Same issues as last time. It's very LOUD, disorganized, and very BRO-y. I swear most of the dudes that come here are still reliving their frat house days. 

Anyway, my girlfriends and I came here on a Friday after work a couple of weeks ago. I arrived first and the outdoor patio was jammed packed. When I first walked in, I asked how long the wait was for outside and the hostess directed me to another hostess for the outdoor seating area. Okay.

I ask the other two hostesses how long the wait was, and she said about an hour. Meanwhile I ordered a cocktail at the bar. The bar was also jammed packed and I couldn't find a seat. I had my cocktail in hand when my friends arrived and we just decided to sit indoors since there was zero wait. 

We just decided to go with some appetizers: Brussel Sprouts and the Craziest Bread. The Brussel Sprouts were the SALTIEST thing I've ever tasted. There's nothing healthy about these sprouts. The craziest bread was appropriately named. It was hella greasy and heavy. Just not good. Soggy bread is not my idea of good food. 

We stayed for a couple more cocktails, but as the day wore on, it was becoming increasingly louder and more crowded. Nooooo thank you.

Yeah you're not missing out on anything at Parlor, especially with so many other great places in the West Loop.

If you book and event and sell tickets and then see that you could make more money by selling tables for the World Series, just say that. Don't give people BS about security when you're located in the West Loop not wrigley! I guess people should be used to people lying to them all the time. But not me I would rather not give you my business ever again!

Ugh- another place that I wish I could give more stars but found I'm being generous with three. 

Parlor was the first restaurant my party went to in Chicago, which started us off on the wrong foot. We did get seated right away which was impressive for dinner time on a Friday night. 

Besides it being over crowded and loud, our service was just miserable. Our waitress would only speak to one of us and not acknowledge anyone else at our table of 8, then we wouldn't see her for another 40 mins or so after we had to pull her away from talking to her friends. 

The food was mediocre and extremely over priced for what you get- a 13" pizza that was literally paper thing was $15-$18 and had little to no flavor. 

I might be a grump about this place cause I was looking forward to having some deep dish pizza, which wasn't served here, but I wouldn't recommend coming here for anything other than the $55 margarita bowl that our table consumed two of.

Do you have to at least be an 8/10 to be employed here?!  Seriously.  Granted a lot of the girls had 8 lbs of makeup on but you really can't slap lipstick on a pig and make it beautiful.  

We wanted to enjoy outdoor seating regardless of the 93 degree temperature.  As we were being seated, I noticed a few tables with stripes of sunshine so I requested for a table completely covered in shade.  I will give the hostess the benefit of the doubt and assume she did not hear me asking to be seated in shade.  She took us to a table where there was patches of sun and rather than being whiny we convinced ourselves it would be fine.  

Immediately after sitting, our waitress came by and briefly asked us if we wanted anything to drink.  We asked for a little more time.  

After a few minutes at our table we realized the heat and sun were unbearable.   We packed our items and moved to the initial table (completely covered in shade).  Personally it didn't bother me much because I have dark skin, but for my poor white fiancé, well he burns.  I understand that shifting tables is not ideal as I used to waitress many years ago, but I didn't want to be considerate at the cost of my fiancé.  I noticed the waitress walking pass and kindly informed her we moved.  With a look of dismay, and not even stopping, she responded with "you're not mines anymore."  Someone had a little bit too much bi... You know the rest of the 3 letters juice.

Moving tables was the best because we ended up with the sweetest waitress.  She came to our table quickly and not only asked us what we wanted to drink but also asked if we had been to the downtown Parlor location.  We said no and she thoroughly went through the menu highlighting some popular items and some of her favorites.

The pizza here is AMAZING!  We had the Sgt Pepper pizza (the most popular according to the waitress). Oh my god.  I don't know if all of their pizzas are thin but this was a thin wood fired pizza with the perfect amount of sauce, cheese, and spiciness!  I can't wait to go back and try more pizza from their menu!  (FYI, I'm not a huge pizza fan, yes I'm human, so this says a lot!)  We also ordered the breakfast burrito and my choice of meat was the pork belly.  Wow!  Of course it's not your traditional Mexican burrito so it can't claim "the best" title, but it was really really really good!  The pork was perfectly cooked and the chimichurri sauce!  The chimichurri sauce!  It was sweet.  I never had sweet chimichurri.  It was ahmmmazzzzing!  And the build your own Bloody Mary.  What the heck!  You had three types of vodka to choose from (which the waitress will bring), then you go the the Bloody Mary bar and choose from 4 mixers, lots of hot sauce, pickles, cheeses, meats, olives, peppers, lemons, etc etc.  You can grab extra skewers and literally make a charcuterie skewer!

I hope the service stays great because the downtown location has only three stars, not a lot of complaints on the food but countless complaints on service.  Leave the snob attitude at home because this is an industry where you put on a fake smile and suck it up and occasionally spit (just kidding).

Can't wait to go back!!!

I went here with some work colleagues for the sole purpose of drinking a few beers.  This review does not address the food, which I have never tried.  The beer selection is adequate for a restaurant this size and the prices are average. 

But The service here is unfortunate.  Specifically, the staff is not friendly.  The host sat us at an outside picnic bench at which there were 5-6 of us racking up a decent bar tab.  At some point the sun became too much and some in our group decided to move one table over to get out of the sun.  This was not a choice I made and I get that it can be annoying, but paying customers sometimes do this and restaurants have to be able to handle it.  The move caused such a major problem that you would think someone in our party had ordered broiled puppy.

The host, same guy who seated us, rushed over and told us our party was too small for the table, which was exactly the same picnic table as the original table.  The outdoor seating area was not crowded.  Maybe half of the tables were occupied.  Instead of dealing with a group moving over one table, which people do all the time, it became a major issue.  We had to pay the original server and were assigned to a new one. 

Then, despite the complete absence of wind, we were told that the umbrella on our picnic table had to be folded up because of the non-existent wind.  We had to argue with management to keep the umbrella raised, which is apparently what one has to do if one wants to drink a few beers here.

Parlor Pizza Bar is one of my favorite West Loop spots.  They do it all, and so well.

I love the atmosphere here, the service and the pizza of course is a winner too.  I've been after work for pizza and drinks - and recently experienced brunch.  The two times I've been now, I've left loving it more than the time before.  A huge shout out to Maddie who served us this past Sunday - she had a great sense of humor and took amazing care of our party of 3.

The space here is cozy, rustic and good for hanging out and drinking.  The brunch Bloody Mary bar is spot on with great cheeses, meats, and peppers... you can't go wrong with the peppers.  The brunch birthday cake waffles were amazing - think confetti cake batter in a waffle iron that we shared as a table as sort of a dessert.  

A few works to sum it up - tasty, fun, lively.

Go here, you're going to be happy you did!

I went to this place this past Thursday since I wanted to try it due to the way it looks, so I said let's go it's warm out and let's seat at the patio. When we got there the place was packed and it is huge. I approached the hostess and asked for a table she just asked me if everyone was there and I said yes then she talked to the manager I'm assuming is the manager because he had a Bluetooth and was ordering people to do things. So, after a few seconds I decided to ask if we could seat at the patio and she said that there was a hostess there, so I decided to ask my friends first if they wanted to seat there, but since we noticed it was packed we decided to seat inside. But while we were deciding I noticed the hostess and the manager were talking, I'm very intuitive and I knew they were talking about us in a negative way, I mean I didn't hear anything, but I could tell. 

Anyways, she took us to our table we ordered the nachos and calamari and a pizza. I didn't try the pizza, but I did try the calamari and this dish was amazing I liked the textured, taste , flavor, everything, it was really good. The nachos were a let down for me personally, the taste wasn't right for some reason. 

Overall the atmosphere it's ok, typical west loop restaurant kind of pretentious, service was OK. Maybe the front of the house can be more outgoing, so people don't think you are talking about them... May be?

Love sitting outside on a nice summer day/evening and enjoying people watching, while eating some pizza and sipping on a cocktail! I had a Friday off this past summer and I had lunch here in the afternoon and it was so welcoming and lively!

I came here Friday night having booked through Open Table.  We only had to wait a few minutes and were sat at a table near the window by the bar.  The space is great, the food is good but it is so loud I couldn't hear a word our server was saying.  She was literally screaming to be heard and we still couldn't understand.  It almost seems like its become more of a bar than a restaurant which is fine just not my cup of tea.  I'll be back but probably not until the patio is open over the summer- that's what really makes this place special!

Our favorite place. We come here often!!! First time we have had an issue today. A person named Aman came by claimed to be the GM. We order 2 cheese pizza when we actually though we were ordering two cheesus pizzas!!! We asked the gentleman to remake one of the pizzas to be the chesus and he said No!!! This pizza cost them $3.00 in ingredients!!! We did not touch any of the pizzas!!! The completely does not care!!!

Very disappointed!!!!

Zero start!!!

And we are restauranteur ourselves!!!



Just talk to the guy who now claims to be the GM, Mike. 
Said I am more than welcome to tell all my friends about our experience! They said they do not care! They make enough$$$ from everyone else. Said the also care less about yelp or if I write a review or not!!!

The nachos are a must appetizer. Best I have had in a long time. I hate when restaurant shave nachos and they are so loaded that they become soggy. Gross. These bad amazing flavors and were crunchy perfectness. We also started with the spinach and artichoke dip which I personally found way too creamy. 

For dinner, we got 4 pizzas to try. The barata, arugula and truffle oil pizza was delicious. As ways the margarita pizza. The brussels sprouts pizza personally was not my favorite. Really couldn't stand that one. 

Finally the atmosphere and drinks were perfection. After having dinner downstairs, I had more drinks upstairs on the rooftop. What an awesome spot and it even has a ping pong table.

I have been hearing people talk about this place for a few months now and got the chance to check it out the other day finally. We got the last available table as the joint was packed at 7:30 on a Wednesday night. The menu had some interesting pizza on there and our server Sydney was very good at breaking down what some of the best pizzas were. Was definitely a hard choice but we went with the Cheesus, Mary & Joseph. This delicious pizza contains whipped ricotta, white cheddar, smoked mozzarella, minced garlic and oregano....added some pepperoni to it as well. The pizza came out pretty quick, but it was a delicious pizza for 2! They have a nice beer selection as I made the mistake (not really) of getting the perennial sump coffee stout which is 10% alcohol content...very nice! 

I like this place as I mentioned they have lots of delicious looking pies. The setup slightly reminds me of Piece in Wicker Park with the communal high tops. TVs on every angle to watch some good ol ball games. Coming for the delicious looking/sounding Sgt Peppers pizza next time.

Great spot. The space itself is huge and the patio is awesome. Inside, they could do with a few fewer tables. Seemed overly packed in and the two tops were very small. I know my sister and I ate like fat kids but the table was so crowded when our food arrived that it was verging on uncomfortable.

The food was a+ though! We started with the craziest bread which was so yummy and stuffed with the most delicious goodies. It was like a Pinterest project gone super right! We opted for the I Feel Like Bacon Love pizza. The potatoes were a great addition. We got a side of Brussels sprouts and they were a perfect addition. Vinegary with just enough lemon the cut some of the cheesy bacony pizza goodness.

Will most definitely be back to try more of these stupid delicious sounding pies!

This is a pretty cool place, and I'm glad my friend took me here. It's got a big open atmosphere, awesome beer selection, and great pizza.

Service is just meh. They were packed on a Wednesday evening, and I suspect that it's pretty popular throughout the week judging by the number of people who were here on a weeknight. I'm surprised the management hasn't staffed up to meet the high demand of people. 

Also, one weird thing to mention is that one of our friends showed up in gym shorts and they wouldn't let him in! Like come on, give some leniency to your patrons! This is a pizza place on a weeknight, not an up-town bar on a weekend. Our friend had to go home and change! 

We got the mozzarella sticks for an app, the brussel sprout pizza, and the pizza with the jalepeno sauce. The brussel sprout pizza was excellent, with no shortage of greenage. It made you feel like you were eating healthy! The jalepeno pizza was disappointing though, as I couldn't even taste the jalepeno flavor. It was not spicy at all and surprisingly bland for the description. 

Beer was pretty expensive- $7-$9 for your typical Chicago drafts like Goose Island and Two Brothers. Really? Considering the number of people that runs through, you'd expect the customers to be able to catch a break. 

I love the restaurant inside though, the physical layout that is. The atmosphere is kind of loud, but the super tall cielings and open wood-fired pizza area is a very fun set-up. I also really enjoyed all the brick on the interior, and perfect dimness of lighting. 

I would return for the ambiance and "cool" factor for the interesting wood-fired pizza, but I wouldn't be hopping to go to Parlor. Kind of expensive, and kind of snooty staff.

I like Parlor for the atmosphere & great outdoor space in the summer. But I would never order delivery again! This is the kind of pizza that needs to be eaten straight out of the oven, which is totally fine! Just don't attempt delivery if your product isn't going to be comparable to getting it fresh. 
This is EXACTLY how my pizzas showed up today. I didn't tip the box, and how gross they left the ticket in the box. How many hands touched that one before it laid across my food?

Oh man! This place has gotten some rough reviews!! 

Maybe it's good I'm in Chicago visiting a friend and just following her around, otherwise I probably wouldn't have come here based on the 3 star review and complaints. But she took me here and I really enjoyed it!! 

We got the Burrata pizza, which comes with a TON of arugula. It wasn't dry though, they had a nice dressing on it that took a lot of the bitterness away. Not a lot of burrata or cheese, which was my one constructive complaint. But I really enjoyed it. We also split a GIGANTIC hummus appetizer. Seriously gigantic - we took a bunch home. 

I loved the beer list and the decor. Very urban and fun. Would definitely be back if I lived in the area.

There were LOTS of people. Other than the challenge we had finding a table, it is a pretty cool place for after work hangout. I really enjoyed my time here even though I am not fan of eating pizza nor drinking bear. 

I came here for our happy hours after work. By the time, we found a few others from our group through the crowd, we realized none of us made the reservation. We were sent upstairs to get a table for 6 of us after the serious security guy (with those ear plugs you'd see on the body guards of important people) stopped us then asked seemed a million questions. A few more folk joined to us a few minutes later. They had a hard time to come upstairs too even we send one of us to get there. 

I went for the Stiegl Radler (Grapefruit) beer and margarita pizza. Both are exellent. I loved the wood oven burns on the very thin crust of my pizza. We shared the craziest bread which was quite different and interesting. This bread is very heavy so share it with 6 people instead of 2. Gyro pizza was pretty tasty too. 

Sitting on the roof top was very pleasant during a summer afternoon. The relaxing atmosphere was exact thing I was looking for after a long day at work. I liked they have the choices for me who doesn't drink beer.

I love this place.  Every time I come here its a good atmosphere.  My favorite things on the menu, the pizza...YUM.  The beet salad, holy wow.  Brussel sprouts...so good.  The service is usually pretty good although I have had a couple times the servers were rude.

Great place for a group and watching the games on TV. The bread appetizer was out of this world. Could have just had that and I would have been satisfied. Also ordered a pizza for the group and it was good. Atmosphere was fun! Will want to visit in the summer when the patio is open.

I'm torn between 3 & 4 stars here... Since I can't do 3.5, decided to go with the 4, as its hard to fault a place for things you were well aware of before walking in the door!  Is it 'fratty'? Well yes, a little, but luckily that group of guys in the corner just left. We spent the past hour or so trying to figure out which sporting event they were cheering on until we finally realized whatever they were celebrating had nothing to do with what was on the tv... Nice. 

Ok so the food was good, not great but definitely deserves an 'ok decent' at the price point. We would come back, esp for the people watching - HA!  Now, must mention that we wanted to order the chilaquiles, but I did a quick check on Yelp (2 of 2 reviews mentioning this dish were not positive) and decided to ask the server. Her response/facial expression said enough. I am so glad we asked and she gave an honest response. So we ordered the nacho bites (pretty good) and then the kale & artichoke dip (very good - we asked for tortilla chips instead of bread). I was stuffed after these so I didn't partake in the pizza but my husband and brother shared the 'Abe Froman's Fave' (w/ the spicy sauce) and said it was alright. 

It was too hot today to sit outside but looks like it would be a fun time.

Okay Parlor, I have a few questions for you: 1) Are you a restaurant posing as a sports bar or a sports bar posing as a restaurant? 2) You have a dress code that specifically enforces a "no jersey" rule -- why?

Chicago is the wrong city for you. I cannot tell you how ridiculous I find it that my girlfriend and I were turned away at the door at 4 o'clock on a Friday after just leaving a cubs game, simply because we had jerseys on. I have been to your establishment a number of times before, truthfully never thought of it as special, but just enjoyed your patio space. I will never return and will not encourage a single person to either. You are not a fine dining establishment. You are not even an mid-upscale restaurant. Your name is "Parlor Pizza" for god's sake. 

I have to mention that the guy working the door who wouldn't let us in was very polite. He even apologized and said he hates working this door because he consistently has to turn people away with jerseys on. Does that sound like lost business? 

Chicago is a sports city; you are a pizza parlor. Figure it out.

Update : pizza parlor bar is now upset over this review , apparently brutal honesty isn't welcome.   They attempted to accuse me of "embellishment"- are you kidding me????!?  It was pretty bad.  Excuse me for having a less than mediocre experience and giving a damn about food safety and racism. Below is my review that got pizza parlor's panties in a bunch.  If you wanted a better review, then maybe the service should have been up to par.  The thing is,
when there is a problem, and many at that, fix it, don't get offended and blame others, change your actions for positive change.  There's always tomorrow. &wait, I forgot to mention, the fries were good  :

The pizza was mediocre for being on the chicago playing field.  It took a long time too, all for a pube to be in it(haha ewww i
picked off someonelse's plate and figured a Yelp review was better than closing the whole restaurant down for business in that moment-yes a restaurant can shutdown for the day of there is hair in food).  I forgot to mention the chicken sandwich when originally posting.   My bf's "chicken sandwich" was so undercooked, raw, and pink on the inside that a good vet could bring it back to life.  That certainly does not follow health codes.  I would know since I have my food handlers license like most people should in the industry. 

But what was even worse than the food and lack of checking it before it is served is their classist dress code, and evident racism.   What a turn off.  Wake up, it's just pizza and it's 2016(get it together, that's unacceptable behavior and people are catching on).  Besides, as a company, is that really what you want to communicate.   "Here come be bigots with us and eat our pizza and have a bigot fest, but if you don't look or dress like us- to hell with you."  So basically everything from their attitudes, to the unnecessary idiotic dress code, to the food, to the racism, I can assure you parlor pizza was absolutely gross and it tasted so awful, I wouldn't serve it to my dead grandmother because she would toss it back.

o_O p.s- I have lived in chicago for a decade and Italy for several years.   I can attest to the fact that this pizza and their "customer service" actually do suck. Lol & not everyone sucked----there was one friendly female employee there-thanks for that breath of fresh air.

Never been to this part of West Loop, it's kinda hidden by Greektown! But man this place is sweet and an easy walk from UIC. It was pretty busy on Sunday afternoon with the outdoor seating area jam packed and the inside about 30% full. 

You can have large groups here, but we came in a group of 6 and their was no wait for the inside, but their was for outside. With the amount of seating they have, and how quickly people filter in and out, I doubt you would ever have to wait for indoor seating on a nice sunny day. 

Anyways, we got a pizza with jalapeños! and o my goodness those things were super spicy! We all eventually had to peel some off and hide away our Indian pride for the sake of our bathroom trip the next morning. I do think the pizzas are overpriced for the portions they give. But the coolness of the place makes up for it. They have a ping pong table in the restaurant, so you can burn your calories as soon as you're done eating. How considerate of the owner! 

They messed up our appetizers though, we didn't bother sending it back due to hunger. It's expensive for the portions they give, that's why I couldn't give it 5 stars. 

Free parking around the block!!!

Parlor is great, when it is not busy. I mention this because if you decide to visit during a prime time or day of the week, it will be impossible to hear the person next to you. It is very loud. Loud music or whatever game is on is blaring. If you have the opportunity definitely sit outside. It is the best seat in the house. My favorite is the Srgt. Pepper pizza. You cannot go wrong. 

Watch out for the drunk crowd on Friday and Saturday nights. I was walking my two dogs with my husband north on Green Street one evening and four drunk men and woman came running towards our animals, startled them, and wanted to touch them. Unfortunately for me, my dogs do not bite. I wish they did. 

The jury is out on weather I will dine in again. I read in another review that they do not allow strollers in the restaurant or on the patio. Um, this is the West Loop - home to strollers, dogs, Mom's with Lulu outfits, and expensive diaper bags. Every stereotype I intend to portray. Looks like I have about five weeks to decide if I want to try dining here again. After that, it is carry out!

After having a cake taken away for a friends birthday, they claimed they would keep it in the refrigerator. At the end of the night when I went to pick up the cake, the lid was off and someone had dug their fingers into my homemade cake! After my apparent frustration, the manager continued to say "we gave the cake to the wrong guy, what do you want me to do?" I would NEVER give them my business again!!! If I could give them 0 stars I would!

Went there for lunch with my cousin who was interning down the street and he wanted to check out the place.  As soon as we got there, we proceeded to the outdoor host and asked to be seated.  The young, unfriendly and seemingly annoyed host sat us instantly.  No mention of a server being right with us or even "enjoy your meal".  Not one word was spoken.  When we sat down a bus boy brought us water, it was like 90, so that was a huge plus.  

When our waitress came, she did not introduce herself to us.  She asked if we wanted any drinks or apps.  I ordered a Shirley temple and the nachos for an app. Then ordered Aunt Chilada's Chicken Pizza with a side of ranch.  The carbonation in my drink was out, when I flagged her down stating so, she seemed overly annoyed that I was asking for a different drink. About 5 minutes later she brought me another one.  Wasn't much better, but due to the semi attitude I received, I decided to drink it anyways.  

Once the nachos arrived they were like heaven in my mouth.  Seriously, one of the best things I've ever eaten.  The pizza arrived shortly after, no ranch. The pizza was pretty good, not the best I've ever had, but I had just eaten the nachos; so it had big shoes to fill.  I could not get the waitresses attention to save my life, so I asked a bus boy for a side of ranch. He instantly brought me some and was constantly refilling our water and clearing our table.  When the waitress brought our check again there was not a hint of friendliness to her.  Working in the service industry you would think she and the host might smile a bit.....  

Seriously, if not for the bus boys this rating would have been lower.  Give those hard working men a raise.

I love the space here and the pizza is good! They have a rooftop but it's not always open. Indoor and outdoor space is great...best time is when the sun is shining!!! The white pizza is my favorite. My only request would be to have a better cocktail list. The decision location is pretty awesome too.

Came here for a lunch with my coworkers, and parlor pizza was suggested. 

First impression: it's really dark inside.
Second impression: these chairs are way too hard, I think my butt is going to go numb.

(If you wanna know, my butt did indeed go numb. Be forewarned, y'all.)

We ordered a bunch of pizzas, an enchilada inspired one, pepperoni pizza with truffle oil and egg, and a sausage and pepperoni. 

The sausage was good quality, I usually hate sausage but this was delicious. The enchilada pizza was a bit too spicy for a pizza in my opinion but it was unique. I didn't try the pepperoni and truffle one but everyone else liked it.

I think the real star was the craziest bread. It was not what I expected (it's basically a rolled up pizza cut into slices) and it was delicious. The pizza was mediocre, especially for the price. The crust is too thin and soggy and cannot support the ingredients. it's not firm enough to pick up and too soggy to use a fork a knife... it's an awkward situation.

The bus boys are way too hype to fill your water. They came around too often and were careless with reaching across you. One of their arms were right on the side of my head.
