I just sat there awkwardly till they finished. I also didn't like that they let the pitchers make contact with the rim of everyone's glass...not sanitary.

If it weren't for their stupid dress code (it's just pizza, calm down) i would probably come back just for the craziest bread and a drink or two.

I won't be back, especially when there are more delicious places right around the corner.
This review is only for the drink selection and the outdoor patio -- both of which are pretty great. Ample seating during the workweek, too, which is quite the commodity!

We were here on a Saturday evening enjoying the patio and watching a football game. They began closing the outdoor drapes, blocking our view of the game. We nicely asked them to keep them open so we could watch, or at least ask us before closing the drapes. The bouncers became belligerent. My friend took a picture of the situation but was not being antagonistic in any way. Once they saw him taking a picture, they subsequently kicked him out (literally carried him out) without discussion.  Our waitress and other staff were amazing but the bouncers and managers here are out of line. They have no guidelines as to how to manage their customers and act without consequence. I live a few blocks away and would hesitant to ever return here. I will certainly not recommend this place to my friends. Would rather go to Bar Siena, Federales, Soho house or any of bars on Madison.

FLAVORS (5 Stars)
Here are some personal favorites, tips & tricks-
1. If you're in a group order a punch bowl. It'll go a long way!
2. Don't order the salad. Get the pizza. I have yet to encounter one that I don't like.
3. Go with friends or a group. You'll have a lot of fun. Trust me!

SERVICE (5 Stars)
The staff here is rather nice and provides good recommendations. 

ATMOSPHERE (5 stars)
This place is adorable all year round but becomes magical during the summer. The outdoor garden lights, TVs, ping pong table, and people make Parlor Pizza oh so lively. In the winter, this place is just as lively but the party is indoors. 

ACCESSIBILITY (5 Stars)
Parlor Pizza is a block south of Randolph  so you're right off the main hotpot of West Loop

Honestly it was chill, just kinda casual and hot with the open garage style doors.  We had a group of about 8 and mingled at the bar for hours. Ordered the pizza pep and grilled calamari. Bit too heavy on the truffle oil but the pizza was a show stopper at the end of the night. Cool bartenders who work hard. Appreciate it and will return.

Some guy got wasted and pepper sprayed everyone in the bar and there was no security there to slam his face into the ground. 

The place is not impressive in its appearance, comfort, or menu. Another place trying to capitalize on this new style of "authentic pizza".

Really dug this place today. Got here on a weekday afternoon for a beer and a pizza and really enjoyed. Wildfire oven pizza comes thru. Charred yet chewy crust, great sauce, fresh ingredients. We had the margarita pizza and Abe Froman sausage pizza. Both exceptional and both came with either a cecear salad or house. Kudos to this too since they were very good actually  

Outdoor patio is amazing. I could hang out here all day. When it's cold, I can stay inside and sit at the bar by the wood ovens. That's the place to be dude. 

Service is ok and mostly friendly, but could see how it could turn bad when it gets full. 

Will come back for sure.

Parlor is at its very best mediocre. 

The pizza itself is pretty bad, the service is every bit as bad as the pizza, and the management is among the least friendly and inhospitable I've encountered in the city. It's an odd place--it's a sports bar that thinks it's a lot nicer than it actually is. But really, Parlor is just some Wrigleyville fratboy hangout in disguise.

The patio is nice though, and the beer list is decent. If you want to hang out on the patio and drink a few beers, it's alright. But if you want good pizza and good service, Parlor isn't even worth considering. In that case, just head down the street to Forno Rosso or Pizzeria del Mercato.

Came here with a few friends (including a pizza snob) who I haven't seen in awhile. Extensive draft list, however only a few seem to actually be being poured at any time. Waitress was extremely friendly and helpful, but came back so many times that I felt that she was trying to turn over the table ASAP. One guy didn't even have his coat off before she asked him what his drink order was. A few other reviews mentioned the noise- it was extremely loud. Definitely not a first date location if you want to have a conversation (unless you're concerned about having things to talk about-- lots of people watching, etc is available). They do take reservations (Open Table) which is a huge plus in my book. 

Pizza snob approved of the pizza (and that`s saying a lot). I`m not a huge pizza fan but I enjoyed mine. We couldn't decide on which ones to split so 3 of us got our own (everyone had leftovers to take home- the pizzas are 13", 6 large pieces each, thin crust). Everyone liked it. The last member of our group got the roasted chicken. It looked/smelled DELICOUS and he said it tasted amazing as well- but it was soaked in butter so if you're ordering the chicken to be healthy, don't. (Not to mention the waitress told us that it is cooked in feta as well).

Would I come back? Yes. Would I rush back? Eh.

Food is usually good but ordered delivery and was told it was against their policy to do cheese on half the pizza...wtf? in Italy many places drop one ball of handmade mozzarella in on a pie...manager says they absolutely can't do it and won't ...because of the temp of the ovens and getting the perfect product (though not what I wanted to order); then this is delivered a pizza with burnt crust and a dollops of crappy tasting ricotta or farm cheese WTF?

Worst Brussels sprouts ever.

And! 

They don't have tecates.

What a joke, best beer in the world multiple years running.

Get with 2016.

This is my second time coming to this west loop restaurant. First time was for drinks on a Friday night post dinner down the street on Randolph. I had some fruity mixed drink and was delicious. We ordered the nachos that day! Amazinggg.

Second experience was on a Sunday and a 40 minute wait for the patio, which we didn't mind because the bartender was attentive and helped me pick out an IPA on draft! We were seated and staff came around and asked if how things were, if we needed anything and kept refilling our water and of course beer! 

Environmental is great. Sunday Funday spot for early dinner is what we did and enjoyed it so much.

L O U D. This place is so loud. With, in my opinion, pretty mediocre food.

Ordered the craziest bread (after reading Yelp reviews), the margherita pizza, and the Cheesus, Mary, and Joseph pizza. The Cheesus was a little much for me... if you LOVE truffle, this is the pizza for you. But I thought the use of truffle was super overpowering. The margherita was good, not great. Sauce was delicious, but the crust was chewy and too charred. 

Overall, not my favorite and probably will not be going back.

This place was pretty busy for a September Tuesday evening which means it was really noisy. Pizza wasn't too bad - it didn't take a long time to get to us either, I was actually kind of surprised how fast it came. The server was attentive, not overbearing. She was friendly, not super chatty which was nice. The bus men do an excellent job at keeping the tables clean. Overall, it was a good experience and I loved how spacious the establishment is.

Cool Bar - Terrible Service.

It's a shame the service is so poor because Pizza Parlor itself is a cool place. Nice vibe, reasonably good food and a great outside area. The service however, is terrible. I live close to Parlor and have been there many times so I'm basing this review off a number of experiences.

Firstly - they have a crazy rule that you cannot be seated at a table if you're alone. If you require a "table for one" your only option is to sit at the bar. A few weeks ago I went to Parlor to meet my girlfriend but she was caught up at work and running late. I explained to the host that she would be there in an hour but I was planning on eating first and meeting her after. I therefore requested a table so I could eat. I was told it's their policy to not seat individual parties and my only option would be sit at the bar. The bar was completely full at the time so I had to wait awkwardly for someone to leave, then cram myself into the busy bar to eat my dinner when multiple other tables lay vacant in the bar.

On a similar note - myself and a few colleagues went there for lunch yesterday and spent the afternoon completing a business meeting in Parlor. We were there for a number of hours and spent over $500. A few members of our party departed leaving my colleague and I sat at our table for 6 people. The second they left, the manager then came over and demanded (mid-drink) that we leave our table by the window for a smaller 2-person table at the back of the dark bar. I explained to him that four more people would be joining us shortly and we therefore wanted to keep the table for six but he said this was not an option and refused to serve us until we moved. Result = we moved to a table for 2 people at the back of the bar and our four friends had to float nearby when they arrived 10 minutes later.

Finally - I'm all for "attentive service" but Parlor's service is incredibly over the top. They employ about 1,000 people responsible for filling up your water glass and cleaning your table and they check in on you roughly every 8 seconds. I ordered a small salad for lunch and I was asked 4 times in 15 minutes if I'd finished by 4 different people. I also had to prevent someone taking my drink away before I was finished 3 times that afternoon. I appreciate their diligence in making sure their patrons are happy but during our meal we were ask by our server (twice), three different busboys and the manager if our meal was OK. Conversation was therefore impossible.

Advice to management - remember you work in the service industry. You need to be flexible and accommodating for your customers.

I have been here on three separate occasions and although not terrible it's not ever been great.  The 1st time we set on the roof during the summer for happy hour on a Friday night. It was a great atmosphere but extremely busy and took some time to get drinks and the such.  2nd time my wife and I went for brunch.  When looking at the menu I thought it would be good but it was blah and caused major heartburn.  Lastly we went with a group of friends on a random Saturday night. We waited 40 min for a table of 8 (so it was expected to wait). The place was crowded and overly obnoxious. It felt like a college bar that allows 20 yr old kids one.  With a city that provides plenty of pizza joints I would recommend elsewhere. If you are looking a an overly packed bar with below average food and booze then this is your stop.  Good luck!

9/3 Brunch - The experience started interestingly enough with being lied to about outdoor seating. I was brought to the section thats between outside and inside where 4 tables were empty (all same size, 4 tops) and was pointed to the available table (under a tv) i wasnt interested in this table and pointed to two of the other 3 that were open... each one i pointed to was "reserved for a bigger party" funny, they were the same size as the one i was being made sit at ;) 

Egg white omelette was delicious (hence the 2nd star) to add to that the heirloom tomato salad was a pleasant surprise, also delicious! however this is where Parlor gets pretty funny. You guys are catering to a west loop (semi-educated, rich-ish crowd that knows whats up) on my plate i had jam for the toast.. the jam was straight up Smuckers... for real? Denny's can do me with Smuckers :) dont be like Denny's.

I confronted the host after the meal, he tried to bs me about reserved seating outside, caught him lying to which he replied with "ill sit you where-ever you want me to sit you" thanks I already ate.

Work on your service guys, pizza alone wont save you.

Great patio, beer was well priced.  We went on a Monday afternoon, and there was no wait.  Craziest bread is a great appetizer to split with several people.  Service was good, but we had to flag our waitress down a few times.  Would like to come back and try out their pizza. Overall a pleasant experience.

This place gets five stars for exceptional service, great wait staff and management, and really good food.

Came here the night that the Blackhawks won the Stanley Cup on Monday. We had a reservation, thank god because it was beyond packed, but every bar that night was. They had always accommodated our party prior to Monday, which is why we watched the four games before the cup here. They were also honoring all reservations to the point where if you didn't have a reservation, you were told you wouldn't be seated, they cut the line off outside when the game started, and parties without reservations weren't allowed to stand next to or in front of your table. We greatly appreciated this as we had made our reservations the day the schedule for the playoff series came out, just in case the Blackhawks made it to a game 5 or 6

This place is probably one of my top three favorite pizza places I've been to. We ordered the Cheesus, Mary and Joseph pizza after glancing over some yelp reviews, as well as the cobb salad (switching out kale for romaine), Pork-Q-Pie pizza, Sgt. Pepper pizza, chicken wings with ponzu and maple bacon sauce, and the Parlor chicken sandwich. Drinks ordered included the Debutante, gin gimlet, and assorted beers.

Our food came out very quickly. Everyone sampled the salad, the regular size was large enough to be a side salad for around 4-5 people. Everyone commented on how delicious the dressing was, and how filling but light the salad was at the same time. I loved the Sgt. Pepper pizza, my friend said the truffle oil was overpowering for her but everyone else seemed to enjoy it. My favorite pizza however was the Cheesus, Mary and Joseph. Whipped ricotta, white cheddar, D.O.P, parmesan, smoked mozzarella, minced garlic and fresh oregano on a light chewy and charred crust. The perfect blend of garlic, herbs, creamy texture with a great crust. This is my new go to here. 

I was told the wings were good, the sauces were both great. I tried a bite of the chicken sandwich, very generous with the avocado and the house giardiniera was different but tasty. Cocktails were also great- my friend's gimlet she said was on point, and the debutante was the perfect light, crispy refreshing drink I needed on a hot and  humid Chicago summer night.

I only have 2 complaints:

1. very dark, to the point where we were using our flashlights on our iphones to read the menu- we didn't mind however
2. somewhat of a small wine selection and I wish they had more reasonable wine prices- they carry a very generous beer selection (a whole menu of beer and spirits) and offer some beers for 5$, but a majority of the wines are 10-14$ a glass, wish they offered more affordable glasses

All in all our waitress was great and very accommodating despite the mob scene of hawks fans, we consider ourselves regulars now and will definitely be returning!

Popular pizza place with spacious bar and tons of big screen tvs. The corner joint is massive, with a seemingly always crowded outdoor patio and open-air bar just inside the door. Since the weather has warmed up, this place is packed at all hours. It's fun and loud and a great atmosphere for watching a game.

Food: wide variety of appetizers, like nachos, kale and artichoke dip, calamari, crazy bread with marinara and Brussel sprouts, all of which were fair sizes. The pizzas are a little pricey for the portion, ranging from $12-$16. The Sgt. Pepper and Cheesus, Mary and Joseph pizzas are safe bets, but there are more adventurous options available. A nice selection of craft beers make this a more unique dining experience.

Review from February re: service- My coworkers and I went for a happy hour event on a Friday at 4:00pm. We had called in advance to reserve a space for 10 people, which was readily available. However, the hostess would not seat us until all members had arrived. We changed our reservation to 6 to accommodate the people present, and then were seated in a far corner near the brick ovens and restroom corridor. The two tall tables were fine for the 6 of us, but became quickly crowded when the rest of our group arrived. Since it was early enough in the afternoon, we easily could have been seated at a larger table without inconveniencing other diners, but ended up in a corner with people standing around the table. Long story short: make sure everyone is present when you check in.

Get the crazy bread.

 I've been here twice mainly to drink and try the crazy bread. Drink menu has a wide selection to all taste buds. Place is surprisingly huge. I still have yet to experience the patio which looks like it'd be a great time. Parlor has been bustling the two times I've gone. Good people watching..(creepy voice). The star of the show is the crazy bread though...did I mention to get the crazy bread? Just look at the pictures...the inside is plump filled with pepperoni, garlic, and heaven. Then they top it off with cheese and provide a simple but tasty marinara sauce to dip your crazy bread in....mmm...

My only thought when walking into Parlor Pizza was this, "I am definitely not cool enough to be in this place."  Everyone there was super cool and trendy looking.  I was wearing a Disney's Frozen tank top.  True, I did just come from Disney on Ice but regardless it was like being reverted back to grammar school.  Aside from that, Parlor Pizza was ah-maz-ing.  We ordered the craziest bread which I wasn't really crazy about (Ha! get it?) and a couple pizzas to share as a group.  My favorite was the Feel like Bacon Love.  Not only did it have a clever name but combination of the bacon and potatoes and green onions on top was heavenly.  Another favorite with a clever name was the Cheesus, Mary and Joseph.  It was cheesy heaven but I think it could of used a little something extra.  Maybe some marinara for dipping?

I really expected more out of this place. When we got here, we had a choice to wait for a few hours or sit at the bar. This place is loud with music and people who are trying to get attention by speaking loudly. The pizza was okay, but everything is overpriced. If I would have waited a long time, I would have been very disappointed. If I was with a bunch of friends, this place would have been a lot more fun though.

This place is a gem in the area.  Only negative is the wait but that's to be expected for a weekend in Chicago.  This entire area is so much fun.  The weather was perfect on Saturday and they had all the outside patio and rooftop full.  We ate at the bar and everything was quite nice.  The cocktails were really good and the crazy bread was also amazing.

The service behind the bar was top notch and we could have camped out there much longer.  Looks like this place might have an issue with overall table service but it is a very large place and might need to improve that aspect of the business.

Also looks like they are opening in Wicker Park area which will also be fun!

Came here on a Monday. Honestly loved the vibe, big open doors where you can see the city and feel the summer breeze. I ordered the parlor paloma and it was delicious. For food we got the Cheesus, Mary + Joseph and it had a sickening amount of olive oil on it. Like, they tried to gingerly pour out a dab and the top fell off and the bottle was poured out. That being said, I would return. I just wasn't a fan of all the olive oil. Also, the fries were good.

Saturday early afternoon - place was busy, but with no wait. We sat outside under the shade and it was nice. Waitress was a little strange (I hate when they give me the check, I say "thanks" and they say "no problem" instead of "thank you" in return... Strange demeanor in general - but cute and skinny so I'm sure that's why she was hired). I had chilequiles and they were really good and different than other places in the neighborhood. The chicken, tortillas, and onions were more of a casserole. This place is massive and using the space better than Moonshine did. It will be a good alternative to mediocre Smoke Daddy's.

We got to sit outside in the sun and there were a lot of cute dogs on the patio. Other than that, disappointed. Watched the servers physically pick up and snuggle some of the dogs at the tables, letting them lick their faces, etc. I hope all of you like dog all over your food, because I'm not sure a handwashing covers all of that. 

Beer menu is confusing; it's meant to show you what they have and will have next, but between what's crossed out because it's empty and the few checkmarks, it's mainly padding 50 beer names to disguise the dozen they actually have. The cocktail pricing was absurd. My friend ordered a margarita, for which they charged her separately for a shot of tequila and then another $3 for mix and ice. I asked for a vodka lemonade and similarly came up with a $14 drink charged for the whole shot and the mixer. I have never seen that crap in all my 30 years. At what place have you ever been charged separately for cranberry juice and a shot of vodka or a whole glass of coke and a shot of rum? Call me crazy and cheap then but $10 for a shot and you couldn't throw in the mix? That's Violet Hour cocktail pricing right there, and these are NOT craft cocktails commanding that price. Helllll to the no. Rip off. Will not return.

Not sure what all the fuss is about bad service.  The place is super busy...ALL the time.  The fact that they even take reservations is amazing so I would say this is a place you come on a whim...enjoy beers or drinks and chill out til there is a table available.  The staff was super friendly and accommodating.  I sat at the bar and despite how crowded it was, felt very welcome.  The pizza was solid.  I had the Abe Froman's Fave and it was really good.  Loved the crust.  The sausage was nice and spicy and the flavor rich.

Moving on to the beer.  Chicago has some really terrific local beers and I am totally about supporting them but I am a San Diego girl that will NEVER stop holding Stone Brewing IPA's close to her heart.  My heart skipped a beat when I saw Ruination 2.0 on the beer list and this place bumped up two octaves on the scale because of it.  So many bars and restaurants here have "issues" with how decisions are made on what beer makes it on tap so the fact that Ruination and other Stone beers are available here tells me that the dirty games must not be in play here.  Stone does not #paytoplay

I live in this neighborhood.  I am not tragically hip.  On the contrary, I am middle aged and boring but I know my way around the food, beer and cocktail scene.  I might not enjoy Parlor Pizza Bar on a Friday night but on a steamy Saturday afternoon, I found it to be pretty darn good.

walked by a few times during dinner time and it looked packed inside, was walking by during lunch break once and it seems not so busy and we walked in

the environment is nice, very chill and good for relaxing and conversations, the food tasted so-so with big portion

Oh how I love Parlor...I've never been let down when venturing to this fun, energetic West Loop joint.  

The food at Parlor is on point--delicious artisan pizzas, creative appetizers, and custom options too.  Try the I Feel Like Bacon Love pizza...think a baked potato on pizza form.  Nom.  

I'm a huge fan of Parlors cocktail list as well.  You'll find something for everyone in your group!   The rotating beer menu is great too,with choices sorted by type. The bartenders are always efficient and helpful when it comes to choosing the perfect drink to start (or end--ha!) your night. 

I'm always a huge fan of places that take reservations and Parlor does that!  They'll call to confirm the day of and accommodate any last minute changes as well. 

Looking forward to my next visit!

I went with a group of four for a Friday afternoon happy hour.  We tried a variety of their abundant beer selection, and some apps and a pizza.

Service was prompt and drinks came out quickly.  I found the appetizer choices a bit limiting -- I think there were six options on the appetizer list -- but of the three we tried they were quite good.  The nacho bites were very shareable: individually-topped chips that were easy to grab and eat.  That works out better than a pile of nachos that eventually reveal a pile of soggy chips that are only consumable with utensils, at other happy hour spots.  The artichoke dip was good and the bread that came with it was great.  The bacon-lovers pizza (I don't remember the exact name) was tasty, with a clever combination that included sweet potatoes.

It gets a little loud, a bit tough to carry on a conversation, but I can't expect anything different on a busy Friday afternoon happy hour.

I would definitely come back again.

The food is very pricey and overall average. The nachos were a bit bitter, the krazy bread didn't mesh well with the flavor and the chesus crust was very bland. However, the cheese on the chesus was amazing!

This place is undeservedly getting ripped on by Yelpers.

The draft list is great, only potential flaw would be that it's so comprehensive and structured that you don't know what's actually on tap currently (not a problem for a degenerate repeat customer like myself). Also not obnoxious $8+ prices for IPA pints. You can get 3 Floyds, etc for $6-7.

Excellent wings! Buffalo (maple sub-flavored) and the Habanero-Pineapple are great. They're not double-breaded/fried, just a solid size w/ good coating of sauce.

Burrata pizza is the best they have, and arguably one of the top Neapolitan pizzas in the area.

Ambience is great for groups and summertime. Primo location w/ large patio, far less concentrated w/ bimbos than River North, yet not hipstery by any stretch of the imagination. It would be no-brainer 5 stars if they were top-to-bottom as good as the wings, burrata and draft list (ie. don't order the nacho bites).

I came here with my friends and my kids on a Sunday afternoon around noon and they were already quoting an hour and a half wait so I was like, wow I can't imagine why this place is so busy considering it is pretty large in size. It has an indoor bar area, an outside patio and another rooftop patio so they definitely have some nice area to seat people. The hostess was pretty nice and I told her we had two toddlers with us if it was possible to get us sat a little faster and she did do her best which I appreciated. They don't allow strollers outside so you have to check those in which we did and got some high chairs for my girls. Our server was very nice and told us about their very cool bloody mary bar with all the extra fix ins, that looked pretty cool if you ask me. We had wanted to order their calamari as an appetizer but unfortunately it's only on the dinner menu. Bummer! I then proceeded to order the craziest bread for the table and all I have to say is, don't be crazy and pass this up! I'm still craving about it and it gets 3 stars alone for being so delicious. My toddlers who are very picky gobbled it right up. It had tons of flavor, tons of pepperoni, gooey cheese all over and it didn't even need the marinara sauce that came with it because it was that good. It's also a pretty large portion so it's very good to share with your friends or toddlers, whatever.

Then came the pizzas, so they recommended about one pizza for two people and they all looked so good but I decided since we had a heavier appetizer we would go with the veggie version burrata pizza with arugula and OH EM GEE, seriously, it was one of the best pizzas I've ever had. Unreal, like the cheese was so delicate and delicious and honestly after 2 slices I was full, but I probably could have kept going.

I'm honestly shocked at the low reviews as the only negative here is that they don't take reservations and no one likes to do the long waits if you ask me. But, the food was terrific, gotta come back in the evening sometime for that calamari, the atmosphere is super fun especially if you come and sit outside with your friends and I can't brag more about the pizzas, they were terrific. I will be back, but hoping the wait time will be a little shorter but now that summer is almost here, I can't imagine that happening anytime soon.

My friend and I had been craving pizza for the longest time, and the weather was near perfect this past weekend for some patio grub. We chose to eat at 6 and found out that patio seating is first come first serve. They need to add "club" to the name of this restaurant--I don't think I've ever seen so many huge dudes with earpieces at a restaurant meant to contain a crowd. 

The place was super busy, but we looked to be only the second party of 6+ waiting for a table, so we were confident a table would open up soon. 30 minutes go by and my party is getting anxious and hungry so we ask how long the wait is and were given the response, "as soon as a table opens up." 15 minutes goes by and I notice large parties arriving later than we did being seated before us. Apparently they honor indoor reservations when they are at capacity by placing them outside. So much for first come first serve for outdoor seating. A whole hour and a half goes by. By this time my party was both pretty pissed and starving, but finally our name was called. They placed us on the second floor which made up a bit for the insane wait (elevated surfaces are always better). 

We got right down to business and ordered food and drinks. At the waitress' recommendation, our party ordered a brussel truffle with added bacon, a sgt pepper, and a crazy bread. I mention the brussel truffle first because it was so damn good. The combo of crispy bacon, pancetta, and brussel sprouts was an explosion of happiness. I can see why it's a favorite. The sgt. pepper was a pretty standard pepperoni pizza that was overly oily as I looked at my oozing pizza--still tasty though. The crazy bread is essentially a loaf of bread stuffed and topped with cheese, pepperoni, and peppers. It was as good as it sounded, but I think it could be recreated fairly easily.

There are many things to love and hate about parlor pizza. Waiting for an hour and a half was unpleasant when there was no warning that my party would be doing so--I expected an hour at most since we were the only party standing in line. But with the place of this size, I guess you need to expect some hiccups with how things are run. 

In regard to their drinks, their punch bowl is essentially a massive bowl of ice, with a side of punch sitting at the bottom of the bowl. It's not the best way to spend $65. The bad stuff aside, on a nice and sunny day, this place is a can't miss spot with some pretty good eats. A firm 3.5 stars.

We went here after the goose island block party. Great patio, great atmosphere, great location.  Got a guac to remember which is kinda a flatbread more than a pizza with guacamole, onions, and cilantro.  Very unique and very delicious! I had read a bunch of reviews of the craziest bread so was super excited to try that but it was only okay.  Not bad but not all that great either.  Your typical bread smothered in cheese and oil.
Menu is for sure interesting though, lots of unique pizzas, so will likely to be back to try!

Rip off. 

$16 for one tiny Manhattan in a plastic cup! Then if there's a problem with the order, the manager (Mark) just tells you that you're the problem and walks away! 

WOW. Haven't seen management this bad in a LONG time. 

Parlor Pizza Owners: Are you listening????

Let me start by we walked by this place looking for a place to drink. We're not from here so this place isn't something we heard of. 
The servers at the bar all had resting bitch faces. She didn't even say hi, just said what would you like to drink. I've notice in Chicago they have quit an array of drinks from beer to alcoholic beverages. 
My BF got goose island beer on draft, I had a mother punch and so did my friend  and my other friend had the white sangria. 

Sangria, too sweet yuck, the two mother punches both tastes like two totally different drinks. 
When we decided to leave I asked the bartender if we could keep the plastic cups and she said yes. So i dumped the three cups of ice in to anther glass. Took the EMPTY cups with me. I was chased outside by a manager, tall younger guy, who grabbed my cup to see if I had alcohol in it. Rude! Didn't even say sorry! I yelled back saying thanks for chasing me down ass hole. 
Over all guys don't go here, rude service, over priced drinks and wasted of a great location.

4 stars for the waitress and food, 0 for the hostess and their stroller policy.

The good:  Our waitress was awesome, brought us some oranges for Kid to gum to death, we had some beers, service was spot-on, beet salad and pizza was good.  Several other waitresses said our kid was cute, so you know, bonus.

The bad:  Nada.  Goes straight to ugly here.

The ugly:  Their stroller policy.  Seriously, what sort of pompous douchebaggery is it that inspires a restaurant in WEST frickin' LOOP to have a "no strollers" policy on their patio AND in their dining room?  Dogs on the patio?  No problem.  A single stroller in a mostly empty dining room at 1 p.m. on  Easter?  WON'T SOMEBODY PLEASE THINK OF THE umm...uuhhhh....  Well they're clearly not thinking of the children that are a large portion of the West Loop population.  No doubles, sure.  No strollers which block the aisle?  Yup, I'm cool with that.  Fire codes exist for our safety.

Also, hostesses...if someone says their child is 5 months old and can't sit up yet, a high chair is not a solution.  High chairs are a solution for children who can sit, or who are currently in a car seat and can utilize the old "upside down chair" trick.  Please stop offering it to me after I've said that's not going to work.

Excellent brunch spot with a pretty decent Bloody Mary bar setup (even though the drink could use a tad more vodka). I've had two types of pizza here and the craziest bread! All delicious. The atmosphere is vibrant, fun and unique! You will see groups getting champagne bottle service at brunch in the booths on one side of the room and people enjoying the patio in a casual dining experience vibe on the other! Always packed on the weekends but worth it!

Loved it. Some of the best pizza I've had in a while. Only downside to this place was when I had gone- the power was out! Therefore, I couldn't try most of the menu (thankfully their pizzas are woodfire) I was really hyped up to try that cheesy bread they had but unfortunately it wasn't possible. The pizza options are great- a lot of them contain pork as an FYI but you can always substitute it for chicken or such like I did. Size wise, it's def a shareable item. My brother and I shared one pizza and granted I did wish there was more of it but I'm sure if you're planning on sharing getting an appetizer before will do the trick. I do wish the service was a bit quicker (pizza baking wise), we waited for quite a bit but I'm not sure if that was due to the power outage they were having or at the fact that the place was PACKED. They provide great texting service to text you when your table is available and offer valet (although there is street parking available close by). I do wish I got the chance to try out some appetizers but maybe next time (fingers crossed no power outage this time!)

Yet another good patio find in the West Loop, just in time for winter! The location and atmosphere is really what makes this restaurant! Large outdoor patio with covered and uncovered seating, which is open to the inside bar/dining room.

Service:  Our server was really good actually, which was not expected (having read some other Yelp reviews prior to going). She was attentive, split our checks and our food came out really quickly! Our bartender, however, was NOT. 

Drinks: They have quite an extensive draft and bottle/cans list and some pricier cocktails ($12-13 for a Moscow Mule) 

Food:  Can't argue with the Craziest Bread! It's meaty, garlicky and cheesy, which is basically the recipe for delicious. I really did enjoy it! The pizza is not top notch pizza by any means, but I did enjoy the Burrata Be Kidding Me. Nice combo of Burrata cheese and greens (tricks you into think you're eating healthy!) The Aunt Chilada's Chicken pizza was good and spicy, but I didn't like it as much as the Burrata.. Probably wouldn't order it again. 

All and all, it's great for summer drinks and maybe late night snacks!

Came here last Sunday afternoon. The weather was nice, so there was alot of people outside. The vibe here is pretty chill, theres even a ping pong table outside. They have a decent beer list, and simple menu. We got the artichoke dip which was really good. The Margarita pizza with spicy sauce was blah, expected better. Overall the food is okay, but the highlights of this place is the atmosphere and vibe here. Great for summer nights and sunday brunches.

I came here with a group of 9 people for dinner in the middle of the week. This place is huge. Large interior, just as large outdoor patio and a rooftop deck. They have a large beer selection that they serve in plastic disposable cups, it's that kind of place. I was not too enthused about having to sit outside in low 60 degree weather without any outdoor heaters. I had the chills all evening. Maybe they use it as a tactic to make people dine quicker and get out.

We had the brussels sprouts for an app, which was a good sized portion and also tasty. We shared 5 pizzas among all of us. This was a good amount of food, but don't expect to be stuffed. We had the abe froman's fave, i feel like bacon love, don't be a gyro, cheesus mary & joseph, and hawaii pie-o. I liked the cheesus the most. The gyro tasted just like a gyro. The bacon love was a little too heavy for me with the cream and bacon grease. Someone said the hawaii pie-o tasted like a pina colada, no thanks. The crust was thin and crispy, neopolitan style. Some pizzas were a little too charred. We shared the smores pizza for dessert. This was ooey gooey goodness.

Overall, the pizza is okay. Crust is decent, but I prefer more traditional toppings. The best part about this place is that it can sit large groups pretty quickly, unlike most other trendy pizza places. I'm sure it will be harder to get a table in the winter when they will have to close all their outdoor sections.

Pizza Parlor is great - it's a huge space with a great atmosphere. Even better is the sizable patio and great rooftop bar. It's amazing just how large this place is and how different the sections can be.

I've only ever gotten food at Pizza Parlor once, but it was great food. We started with the monkey bread which was almost like a sliced up calzone. It was a bit garlicky but I loved that there were massive slices of pepperoni tossed in between each slice of bread.

I also got the Aunt Chilada's pizza with no mushrooms which has a great chipotle mayo spread on top of adobo chicken and a really unique chipotle marinara. It was superb. I would get it again in a heartbeat - although a number of the other pizza options looked very good as well. 

Whether you're looking for a happy hour or a Saturday dinner or whatever, Pizza Parlor is a great option. I definitely look forward to returning.

Closer to three-and-a-half.

The crazy bread was so good, and the pizza was great!  I had the "burrata be kidding me" pizza with lemony arugula on top.  Everyone said that my pizza was the best.  It was so good!  There's a great pizza menu.

That said, the environment wasn't really my scene.  It's got lots of TVs for sports-watching, and it's noisy and crowded.  That's par for the course in the West Loop, though.

We had a large group event at Parlor yesterday and it was up on the rooftop. Beautiful evening for a rooftop party. It was a lot of fun. Great rooftop, I must say. In terms of the food, it was OK. We had ordered plenty of veggie options - some of them were OK and some were decent. You know it's difficult to judge the place on food, service, etc. given the large group party. I mean the pizzas were cold by the time we were eating them. The appetizers before that weren't really being filled up regularly enough. But again, difficult to say. I would have to go back and really try out the experience more. Until next time...

This is a vast pizza parlor situated at a corner in the West Loop in striking distance of the vaunted Soho House. In addition to the indoor area and patio, there is also a rooftop patio, which is where I found myself one sweltering July evening. I had come for an event, and was surprised by the selection of open bar items available. Usually it is strictly beer/wine/well drinks at this type of an event, but no, it appeared the entire cocktail menu was on offer...everything from a sweating can of Guinness to Coronas with limes in their necks in a bucket of ice that looked worthy of a photoshoot. I went with the White Wine Sangria (basically  sugar water in a plastic cup with no fruity bits in sight). After just a few sips, I opted for a glass of the Rose wine. I was pleasantly surprised to find the brand is Starmont, a pour that I know and love. At the end of the evening I sampled one of the pizzas that appeared to have some kind of pesto topping. It is a good idea to imbibe carefully as the stairs to navigate to the rooftop area are vertiginous. I clung to the railing and was able to make my way downstairs without incident. Probably I won't be making a return trip unless there is another event but I enjoyed the opportunity to scope out a new-to-me space.

This place is always packed. I work nearby and no matter what day or time I walk by, it's always crowded. 

We come here for Happy Hour frequently, and they've got a great selection of beer, cocktails, etc. The food is also surprisingly good. I brought my pizza snob roommate who was born and raised in NY here, and she actually had no complaints. The atmosphere is fun and loud, and the outdoor patio is perfect when it's nice out. Service is decent especially considering the volume of people.

I work near Parlor and have driven by a million times. It's always packed with people both indoors and on their roof top patio. For whatever reason, maybe it's because there are so many wonderful pizza options in Chicago, I've never thought to give it a try.

Recently my company was invited by another company for a lunch date, and Logan was suggested as the place to meet. Boy oh boy I'm really glad we made it happen because Parlor has some seriously awesome pies.

First up, my complaints. The seating indoors puts you on very very uncomfortable bar stools. The tables and stools are high enough that you'll find yourself dangling your feet trying to find somewhere comfortable. I was constantly adjusting. Not a huge deal but definitely a distraction. Also the atmosphere is a little too sports bar for my tastes. But speaking of tastes, we were there for the pizza so not a big deal.

The physical menu itself is a little confusing to sort out. The names of the pizza are trying way to hard to be funny. The general layout of the menu makes it confusing as to how one should order, and our server didn't do a very good job sorting that out for us.

Service was a little hands off, except for when the random hands of the busboys would reach in and attempt to grab the plates off the table. Parlor runs a tight ship, and clearly looks to get you in and out as quickly as possible. That's great for a midday lunch but I would find it irritating if I was there on a dinner date.

As for the pizza? It was incredibly good. Because we had a large group of diners, we ordered several different varieties and passed them around the table. The crust is perfectly foldable and the toppings were generous. 

My least favorite pizza was the "Abe Freman's Favorite" which was just a bit too saucy and kind of weakly seasoned compared to the others I tried. Still, it was quite good.

My favorite was the "Burrata Be Kidding Me" (oof) which was covered in a tangy dressed cold arugula salad with a hint of truffle. There was a great play in textures, temps and flavors with that one. Warm melted cheeses with cold peppery arugula is a great combination.

I also absolutely loved the "Little Stinker" and the "Cheesus, Mary & Joseph" (double oof!) which both had a SOLID cheese game going on. Just thinking about the CM&J is making me hungry.

Parlor is now on my go-to list for Chicago pizza places to recommend to friends. Awesome.

AWESOME beer selection. I lIke that it changes every time I'm there. Atmosphere is fantastic- big bar, big outdoor patio with a ping pong table, tons of seating. 

The food is great! I've had the loaded nachos twice and they are to die for. also had a pizza which was good (but not the best I've ever had). 

Also... Mike Dunleavey was there

Believe the ratings everyone is giving Parlor. The short summary of this joint is that that have decent food and poor service. I don't mean our server was the problem, she actually seemed really nice. The problem was she was rarely around. The only thing worse than a nonexistent server is that they brought the food out as it was ready and not as a whole. Basically they brought out one plate every 10 minutes, and I'll give you one guess whose plate came out last. The first person to get their meal waited till it was cold, and by the time I got my pizza everyone was waiting on me to finish. It just seems like a really stupid way to serve a group of people food.

As for the food itself, it was good, I'll give them that. But it wasn't really good, it definitely wasn't "I'll put up with poor service good". As I understand it, that's what most people said in their ratings and I'll say the same thing. 

Was Parlor worth a try? It definitely was. Will I make a trip to the near west side to go back? Probably not.

I haven't been to the restaurant but we do order from here. Here are the highlights:

AMAZING carne asada tacos. They have so much meat in them we really enjoy them
The salsas are really delicious
The price isn't too bad considering the amount of food you get
The delivery has been early each time

The not so good:

The chips weren't very good, although we did enjoy the salsa
The guacamole was very thin and felt like it was more of a liquid sauce than the usual guacamole
The pastor tacos were okay, but not great

We'll definitely be ordering from here again.

My boyfriend, roommate, and I have frequently ordered from this place consistently for the past year and a half. We ordered a torta, tostadas, tacos, and horchata from them. The delivery guy gave us our food, but without the horchata so we called the delivery guy, but he didnt pick up. Of course, we called the restaurant directly and told them our situation. 

The woman who picked up the phone said that she would speak to the manager and call us back. After 20 minutes of not hearing from them, we called again and the same woman picked up the phone. She said the delivery guy gave us the horchata and did not believe us when we said we didn't get it. They even said they would send another one if we paid for delivery. But we didnt even receive it in the first place. We told them that this was ridiculous and her words were "yeah this is ridiculous because you got two bags." Yea, she pretty much told us we were liars. The delivery guy will probably just find the horchata in the car, drink it, and hide it. Never felt so unfair and never ordering here ever ever again!! All i wanted was the horchata that i paid and ordered for. :(

Tl;dr, TERRIBLE customer service. Find a different taco place that gives you your horchata!

Typical taqueria. Our intention was to hit Nana at the corner but it was a Tuesday and they were closed. We had already paid for street parking so let's make it count. 
Stepped into San Jose and sat ourselves. It was clean enough, not very busy, and the waitress hooked us up with some fresh chips and a pretty bland red salsa. We put our orders in, steak burrito dinner (no lettuce please) and wifey ordered tacos. Our food arrived a short time later... A couple things about my burrito. 1) DO NOT CUT MY BURRITO IN-HALF. I'm a big boy and should I not be able to handle it, I'll have my wife cut it in-half for me. 2) I'M DINING IN YOUR RESTAURANT - NO NEED TO TIGHTLY WRAP MY BURRITO IN FOIL. I get it... If I were taking my burrito for a walk, this would make perfect sense - However, I'm sitting at a table and it just looks stupid for a burrito to show up wearing foil for a sit-down dinner. Once I undressed the burrito I realized it was oozing refried beans like everywhere. It was a HOT mess. I grabbed my first bite of it's steamy goodness but came up empty for anything remotely textured as steak in mi boca. Tasted fine so I went for the next bite...  Again, no real subsistence or steakiness to it. I finished up and was left feeling robbed of steak. I think it was in there because I tasted it - However, the seem to pulverize the steak to a point where someone with no teeth would be able to suck it down a straw (in combination with the fact that the burrito was tooooo OVER-BEANED). None the less, they do not steak burrito very well here. I would think they're trying to cut corners and save money - I never really saw a piece of steak fall from my burrito, just mushy beans dripping out.  My wife's stated her tacos al pastor were average but nothing to get giddy over.  
We probably won't return to San Jose... until I'm 85 and can no longer chew my own steak. 
Clean place and friendly service earned them 2 stars.

This place is hit and miss. You might have good service if you go on a night when the more mature gals are working. Some nights the service is questionable (as in, how is this place operating?). As far as ordering through a delivery/pickup service.. There always seems to be some chaos. The food is great but you have to know what to order. Chicken anything is delicious here! The nachos, burritos, enchiladas... I read another review that said it was dry and as many times as we've been here never experienced that. No "vegan" choices but you can make almost anything vegetarian. They also serve fresh juice at a great price but only a few folks know how to clean and operate it.

I waited over an hour for my food and finally gave them a called. The receptionist was very rude and told me to call eat 24. I tried calling Eat24 but they never pick up. Next I called the restaurant back and she hang up on me! Do not come here.

Very good food and they really do give you a lot! I enjoy that unlike most places they give you not only salsa but also an array of spicy pickled vegetables. I also enjoyed the steak burrito. service was good and they are open pretty late too which is nice! But for the third time in a row my order was wrong or something was missing....
The food was flavorful and tasty and it was a sizable order that's the reason why I always come here they also have real fruit drinks

Mediocre, expensive ($5.00 delivery charge??),skimpy with their asada. I've had better, real Mexican food and Horchata. 

Disappointed. Never ordering from here again.

Don't waste you time or money! First of all it took 20 mins until me and my 3 friends to get a cup of water, mind you it was not busy at all and we had to ask the waitess for a glass a water. Then they get our order wrong and when my friend told them that she did not want cheese on her torta or beans the lady simply scrapped off the cheese and handed the plate right back to her. The only positive was their Jamaica agua but we will not being coming back.

Food is good but the service is horrible.
Placed an order and waited over an hour until I decided to call them and find out that they didn't bother to make the food even when I had already pre paid for it.  Then I get told that it was now too late to deliver.

Pizza or Mexican? 

That's always the question, isn't it?!?! Well, let me just start with this I LOVE FOOD AND FOOD LOVES ME. I am a constant YELPER when it comes to trying new food. Running around hungry after the NLC-National FBLA conference award ceremony tonight I figured what would be open at 10:30 PM? 
I looked on YELP and remembered that I had bookmarked a Mexican Restaurant due to the reviews. When I called and asked if they delivered to the Hyatt Regency McCormick she checked with someone and affirmed that they did. She was very very helpful and knowledgable of the food items. She then made a few suggestions based on my food restrictions (no shellfish or red meat), just cheese and chicken. She quickly accommodated me with one of the cheese filled potato MASA quesadillas and a chicken tostada which were bomb.com insanely delicious! 

Now you have to understand something...I am from California and I am VERY spoiled with my mother's Argentine cuisine and the local Mexican restaurant where I live. Like I said I know food, so you can understand when I say food is good here I mean it is OUTSTANDING! The pico de gallo and guacamole were like no other Mexican restaurant I have ever been to. CHUNKY AND FRESH!!
By the time I got to the lobby the driver was there at the concierge desk--he was quick concise and to the point. It was very nice. I've been to quite a few cities-- London, Buenos Aires, and San Francisco--and I can say that I truly love Chicago for visiting this first time and this restaurant added the cherry on the top!  

Take my advice go for the Mexican if you're debating and forget about the pizza! Oh, all of it including tip and the BEST horchata I have ever had was $25.00. Can't speak for the dine in experience but man, this place ROCKS! See you soon, Taquería José!

It's pretty much become my go to mexican place, granted i did just move literally 1 block away, but it's good and quick and cheap, i usually just get one (or many) of their $2 tacos, ive had tripe, lengua, chorizo, carne asada and pastor, all good, and perfect for a quick snack, and also the chicken quesadilla is very good, and its BYOB! tho i havent had time to eat there yet, also the horchata wasnt bad either, im sure i will be returning often in the future!

So the one time I decide to order delivery online I had the worst experience. Ordered around 10:20pm and waited past the 45 min-60 min wait time. Attempted to call the restaurant several times only to hear a busy tone on the other end. Contacted Yelp to get a update and they told me to wait another 10 mins. 20 mins later the food Finally arrives. While I finally got my order. It was missing my drink item it was a little upsetting after waiting almost an hour and a half. The food was mediocre. Have had better authentic Mexican at other spots. 

Ordered 4 tacos 
Intestine was bland
Ground beef and pork were the only tacos to taste decent
And chicken taco tasted really dry

Also ordered a steak burrito with intestines for my girlfriend and she only ate half and said it was mediocre. 

Ordered a horchata as well but they forgot that. 


Side note: been about 40 mins since I ate the food and my stomach is bubbling now.. Sorry but I will not be ordering here ever again. 

I distinctly remember the food being better in the past.

Overall, not good.  Homemade chips were good.  Guacamole had too much lime and really no avocado flavor.  Queso fundido was oily as hell to the point where it almost instantly separated.  Tostadas showed potential.  Shells weren't doubled, and the grease saturated the single shell they provided quickly, too gross to even bother with.  I had no choice but to scrape all of the toppings off, tossing the tomato that I specifically requested they not include in the first place.  Asada and pastor had great flavor but the heaping pile I was left to eat them from left little to be desired visually.   The chilies rellanos tacos were a mistake, but for reasons I can't even begin to understand for such a straight forward dish.  Salsa was unmemorable.  Take a pass.
It wasn't good bad we had the tacos. I had the al pastor and chicken taco. I think their fair.

I always come here! Literally always. I don't know why I've never checked in. This place is amazing. The food here is very good especially the tacos. I will definitely be checking in more often ( I should have at least 15 check ins here LOL).

Dined here a couple times and ordered the chilequiles with chicken and green sauce at the first visit and steak tacos at the next. The chilequiles weren't the best I've had but they were still very good and very filling. The serving was huge! The steak tacos were very tasty and you could tell that the steak had been marinated very well. I love a Mexican restaurant that has pickled carrots and cauliflower in a big container right beside you. I've also tried one of their juices; I forgot which one it was, but it was very good and fresh. For cheap and delicious Mexican cuisine that's open late night, go to Taqueria San Jose!

This place is so cheap and has great food. I went here today for a quick bite. They were fast and tasty. I got three pastor tacos and guac and chips. It costed $11.70. So much food. My girlfriend and I split it all and were full for hours. Granted this isnt my favorite mexican place but it is a great pit stop if you are in the Bridgeport area [and looking to save some coin].

The food at this restaurant is about average.  My family ordered dinner through grubhub.com. My husband wanted a burrito suizo but we did not get any sauce with his order. I ordered a chocolate shake but the restaurant put cinnamon on top. I wish I would have known prior to ordering the shake, I would have opt-out on the cinnamon. Basically I am saying all of the menu items do not have details. However my steak torta was delicious. It would have been even better if it was not a little soggy around the edges.
It has very less options for vegans !
The rice had Lima beans in it. Kinda odd. Everything else was just alright, nothing special.

I would give the food four stars, but the customer service zero or a negative amount if that was an option. I ordered from here a few times until they messed up multiple parts of my order. I ordered their nachos and they have just basic nachos and ones that have more toppings. I also wanted cheese on my vegetarian tacos. I called over the phone and specifically asked the girl working if they came with cheese. She told me yes but then realized she was wrong. I had said many times I will pay extra if necessary but I don't like them without cheese but she insisted since she made the mistake the cheese would be free. Well how nice of her. ...except when I received my food a lot of the toppings were missing, including the cheese on my tacos and every item was wrong. I figured I'd call and they'd simply replace anything they had messed up. Wrong again. I spoke to a manager who proceeded to say he'd bring the toppings only and only if I paid extra for the cheese. What? First of all, the food would get cold by then. Any self-respecting restaurant would replace the wrongly made items. So I ended up on the phone with this guy for a half hour while he told me how replacing my food was not in his power. I got so frustrated I threatened to wheel my butt down there (because I was in a wheelchair at the time) to complain and if I had to I'd call an authority or my bank to have them forced to refund us. He kept insisting his chef would never make so many mistakes, but he definitely did. It was at this point that he finally called the store owner and agreed to replace the food as long as we hadn't eaten it yet. Problem solved, but not without extreme frustration and the decision to never purchase anything from here again and to inform my friends and family to do the same. Oh and I hadn't even noticed the missing guacamole on my nachos till way later but it wasn't worth the oxygen.

This was myFirst time trying this place, and i went thru yelp. My first experience was good. I tried the steak tacos & chicken tacos, with steak & chicken flantas. They both were good, but I enjoyed the chicken tacos & chicken flantas, because it had more flavor. There guacamole & chips was a perfect taste as well. They close late & will go again.

This is my go to Mexican place for home delivery. Their shrimp fajitas are delicious!

My dine in experience wasn't so great. It was cinco de mayo and there was a ton of delivery orders it was hard to get the attention of the staff although there were only 2 other tables with customers.

It took over 1 hour and 20 minutes to receive our order. I even watched while the driver struggled, with what it appeared to be over 15 orders, to find our order. The food was more than cold; it was almost like taken out of the refrigerator. After we spent several minutes warning up our food, the taste was not even good, nor appropriate for a restaurant. If I wanted to have this kind of experience, I would have gone to a supermarket and grab something from the frozen food section. My advise, if you have a choice, dio not even think about ordering delivery from this people. I know, I will never order delivery again from them. Yes, the driver was educated and perhaps the experience at the restaurant may be better; but, delivery is horrible no matter how you look at it. Sad, very sad. I'm glad I don't own this restaurant.

I just ordered a taco dinner from here. For a  taco dinner and delivery was $16.00. The food came cold, and they poured hot sauce all over the food when I got it. I do not like hot sauce. The meat was sub par, and didnt have any flavor to it, and came cold. I was not happy with their food and would never order from them again. There delivery charge was 3.50 which i think is very high when most places are $2.00.

I would love to give San Jose five stars... but their service sucks. 

Pick-up and delivery definitely take priority (this would probably be the way to go if you want to try their food), but if you choose to dine-in, be prepared to wait way too long for your food. The wait staff is inattentive and sometimes rude, and your order may even be forgotten. 

My last visit was surprisingly less accommodating than any other. The madness of deliveries and pick-up orders toward the front of the restaurant was unpleasant and actually distracted my waitress enough to leave my food waiting at the counter for about ten minutes (we had already been waiting 30+ minutes after ordering). My chicken fajita (usually to die for) had burnt onto the sizzling pan because it didn't get to my table in time for me to stir it up a bit. The two previous times I had ordered this dish, the serving size was double the amount, not burnt, and was served with a side of beans, rice, lettuce and some avocado. This time, though, the serving was pretty skimpy, burnt, and only served with the beans and rice (which are consistently amazing). When I asked the waitress about the lettuce and avocado, she just kept saying "Extra, it's extra," as if I was bothering her (probably from taking her away from figuring out what the heck was happening with the deliveries). 

Needless to say, I only tipped about 5% this visit. Although the food was abnormally horrible, it's usually fantastic and definitely worth the lack of service this place has to offer. I won't give up on it yet.

Food is amazing. The burrito is one of the best I've had. The tacos are pretty good too. I would highly recommend getting the tres leches cake on the side. 
Staff is very friendly.

The food is delicious and very authentic. I have tried the ceviche tostada, the guacamole, the tacos. Their portions are pretty big. They also squeeze fresh juice. I've tried the strawberry one and it was refreshing. The service is very slow though. You'll be waiting for 45 to an hour for your food. Don't be expecting a short lunch break.

Their steak tacos taste like your below average taqueria.  taste like oil and is drenched in oil. My tortilla was soggy  from oil after 10 minutes. 
This really ruined steak tacos for me and i won't be eating them for a long while.
Aside from that, their customer service is terrible! I told them i did not want guacamole on the side of my rice and the girl had a problem with it. She twas hesitant about taking it back and told me that guac is on the menu which i ordered over the telephone so there was no menu. she wanted to charge me for limes because she said they cost money, I asked her why limes are not on the menu like she said the guac was and she had no answer. she didnt even know how much they cost and NO TAQUERIA CHARGES FOR LIMES EVER! They purely wanted to rip me off. 
If you want good tacos try El Norte or Flash Tacos, not here.

I like this place - good steak tacos. But every time I order off grub hub they screw up my order. The first time, they left out one dinner all together, and the second time they actually have my order to someone else. I came in to get my food and they said "you just came in to get it?" Obviously my presence there showed that I did not come to get it... So I had to sit and wait for them to remake the whole order . Also, it scares me that they have health code violations..

I'm giving this place 5 stars for a few reasons. They have your typical run of the mill food, buuuuuuut they also have some unique items. The masa quesadillas are something I've never seen before, simply delicious and inventive. Even better that they are made fresh and you can choose your filling. As a vegetarian, I'm always looking for Mexican restaurants to go beyond the zucchini taco. This place has potatoes, rajas and a few other things. They also have a fantastic juice bar and desserts. Will definitely come back.

I'd say that there are many better places to go for Mexican food, but my stars are for the fresh juice.  Pressed on order, choose one of their combos or make your own.  Very tasty. 

Staff is very nice, too.

Since I've  been on an Al pastor binge I read the reviews and wondered what was up...I read the good and bad reviews and I try to disregard the bad to still try it.

Ordered 3 al pastor tacos with cilantro onions lettuce and tomato by far the greasiest Al pastor I've tried so far AND there also was a bug crawling around in my food (like a fruit fly or gnat) the two bites I ate before the bug citing was pretty decent but the bug threw everything off 

Prolly won't go back
The food was good but I didn't get my tres leche when I ordered and I paid for everything before it was delivered

Late night food fare, tasty and filling just the way I like it. I didn't find it to be greasy as some people reviewed. I was very nervous after reading reviews. It was late and we had already sat down. It was priced pretty decently and I left very full. The waitress was very nice and very attentive. I think the only issue we had was that it was roasting like a fire put in there!! The waitress was roasting too and kept apologizing!

i've ordered with them 3 times and each time there was some odd shenanigan with the order process. first time I was far outside the delivery zone (was notified after I processed the order) and I would need to give the driver an additional tip, second time same thing but they didnt require the delivery premium,

the third time and last time I ever order from them, the order didnt come at all, I called the restaurant an hour and thirty minutes after ordering food to find out that my order was marked as delivered. TSJ reached out to the driver and said the food was delirvered to a woman (not a woman) and that there was nothing that could be done about it.

I contacted the web portal I ordered with (eat24) and they refunded me my money because TSJ refused to do anything more that give me the drivers number (wtf?) so I could speak with the driver about who he gave my food to (again, wtf?) I will never, ever order from there and I would recommend no one else either unless you like receiving terrible service.

Went here at 2 am after a few drinks. I ordered just one al pastor taco with cilantro and onion because of the generous offering of chips and dip upon dining in. Don't think the waitress/cashier was too happy about that. Given my tiny order, service wasn't exceptionally prompt. Everything was drenched in oil, especially the tortilla and chips. However, the taco filling was delicious and fresh tasting, though greasy as well. What can you expect for $2...

Bottom line: great prices, not so great food, and I won't be returning unless I've had a few.

We dropped by here one late night after a recommendation from a friend to fill a mexican craving. This was located in Bridgeport Chicago and parking was pretty easy to find. The Mexican food was delicious and authentic. They were super busy even on a late night and their service was mediocre. They were very busy with just takeout. Would return again!

The food was just ok.  The service was slow and pretty inattentive. Major points off for having a TV on broadcasting garbage talk shows. Isn't there a soccer game on somewhere in the world?  Did I go to San Jose on one of its off days??  Honestly, thought Taqueria Mexicana was so much better in terms of service and ambience--which isn't really saying a lot.

Way to go, Indian waiter who works there illegally and the waitress on duty Saturday night for giggling at me and then offending me by asking my age. You guys should be ashamed of yourself for not having been taught something about customer service. I was uncomfortable throughout sitting there watching them giggle as I was alone, on phone, speaking to a friend about her serious issues. I used to come to this restaurant because Bronzeville is where my journey started in Chicago 3 years ago and this Taqueria was the first restaurant I ever visited. They had a fabulous, dedicated manager back then. Where is she????? I moved elsewhere but I made it a point to stop by whenever I am passing by the area, and no, not for the food because it's become really trashy and hurts your stomach -- I went there for the Tres Leches cake which they order from outside. This was my last time. Shame on you both weirdos.

I hope I don't start ranting because I am so annoyed right now. Okay, I ordered three vegetarian tacos, no rice and I asked if they had the thinly shredded white Mexican cheese, I told them I didn't know it's proper name but where I've gotten it before that's what they call it and I gave them an extremely detailed description. 

There was no language barrier because this girl speaks English just as well as me! She tried to put some like...nacho cheese type crap on my taco but thankfully I came in and showed the other waitress what I wanted and she fixed it. This was a call in order BTW. I'm so annoyed I'm telling this out of order. 

Okay back to the taco itself, after I placed the order I realized she didn't specify if the taco was hard shell or not and I despise soft shell tacos so I called back like 8 minutes later. I asked were they hard shell or not and she said, "They're soft shell like you asked for." *death glare* I hate when people tell me I said something I know I did not say. 

I hate soft shell tacos and I would never order a GD soft shell taco. Anyway, so I'm like, "Um, no I did not say SOFT SHELL, I said taco, but I didn't specify and you didn't ask. Are they made already?? She says yeah, and since I'm such a nice person I said, "Well, I'll pay for them since they're made already but I don't want them because I don't eat soft shell tacos and I have no one to give them to. I want to order and additional order of HARD SHELL TACOS." 

*out of order due to anger* Also, I ordered salsa of which I got three prices for, the first person said it was $2.50 the second person said it was free and the third person said it was 3.30 so I have no idea how much this mystery salsa is. I really try not to argue with people that are making my food because we all know what happens when you argue with them, that's half of the reason I agreed to pay for the tacos I WASN'T GOING TO TAKE. 

So I get there, we go through the cheese thing, she says to the other lady, "No she said the queso *somethinginspanish* and I'm standing there like...........alright now....with that "she said" crap. So she comes up with my order, in the smallest bag, with this extremely small package in it and I'm like.......maybe they wrap it tight? So my order comes out to $15.07. I'm thinking... hmm... 15? Well, I'll check it out when I get home...

This whole ordeal took about 40 minutes and now I'm sure that first batch of tacos wasn't even ready because I stood in there waiting on the second batch for like 15 minutes. So I'm ready to gtfo of there. I go home, open my tacos, no they are not tightly wrapped. They are the smallest baby tacos I have ever seen in my life. I ate the first two so fast if I hadn't taken the picture for Yelp before I ate them I would have sworn I only had two. 

So I'm stewing in this anger now, I'm looking through my wallet for the receipt and I'm like.....*eye roll* Where TF is it?! So I call them and ask and she's like, "Oh we don't give out receipts, we need them for the books at the end of the day"....I am trying so hard not to swear in this review but what in the actual F-word?! You don't "give out" receipts?! 

So I explain and she's adding it up and she's like, "Your total should've been around $12.60" and I'm like "Yeah...........but it was $15.07" So she says she'll call the manager and call me back. So she calls back *shocker* and the manager confirms this price. She said I was charged .35 cent for cheese per taco *Even the three I didn't get*....the .35 cent I did not know about until hours later because I would have never ordered them in the first place.

So we add it up and it does come out to $15 dollars if the salsa was 3.30....... but then she says "Yeah...the salsa is free but you paid for chips"...... I didn't even fu***** get chips. I like to eat the salsa with my own chips "Doritoes". I couldn't stay on the phone with her anymore so I hung up. I'm going in there tomorrow and somebody better explain to me why I paid $15.07.

Random stop the other night while walking bars in the area.  Many of their late night patrons were also at the bars nearby.  It took about twenty minutes waiting on ordered burritos.  Two in hand and they were heavy!  In a drunken state, the burritos were pretty good.  The following day my cousin texts to tell me the burrito was excellent.  I wasn't as sure but you see my cousin (is the type that) doesn't believe there is a such thing as bad pizza.  If I say it's cardboard with cheese, he says it was okay.

first of all I cannot go 5 stars. That would be the best Mexican restaurant around.  2nd I can not go 4 because I feel this place can be better. I do love the burritos.  Good size, steak is cooked well.  But when I ask for one with extra veggies they never seem to understand what that means.  Extra lettuce and tomato ect ect... 
They seem to always give me extra meat. For some people that's not a complaint.  But not this guy, sorry.

Worst service ever. They're so unorganized. I called for a pickup order for a couple tacos. I waited 15 minutes to leave my house. When I got there I still had to wait 15 minutes. It takes a half hour to make two tacos?? If it wasn't so late I would've gone somewhere else. And when you get there, they act like they don't know what you're talking about when you say you have a pickup order. Horrible service and their bathroom was disgusting the last time I went there.

Their chips and salsa are to die for!!! I absolutely love their tacos, burritos, and horchata. The only thing that I dislike about this place is that they have a credit/debit minimum, but overall, this is the only place that I go to for Mexican food. Nothing can compare to the way they flavor and season their meat. Open later hours is a plus for times when its midnight and you don't want to cook and your stomach is grumbling.

I ordered for delivery around dinner time. It took forever to arrive( around an hour) and when the food got here it was cold. I ordered several tacos (al pastor and steak) and they were soggy and just not very tasty anyways. In addition, i ordered a tostada de ceviche de camaron and it's supposed to be ceviche. I've ordered this before and it was something totally different. what i got was a gross mass of sour cream, lettuce, and plain shrimp. Also from my experiences prior to this one, i always ordered for pickup at least 15 minutes before. A lot of the times i would get there and I would have to wait another 10 minutes. What's the point of me ordering over the phone then? I will never come here again. There are better places than this.

My absolute favorite thing here is the al pastor tacos. So good. 
The prices are great and the horchata is huge and tasty. My husband and I often (ok, always) order the nachos especiales with carne asada. It is so unhealthy but so tasty. I don't think I have ever had anything here that I didn't like. Ok, maybe not the torta--the bread seems like a very stale jumbo hamburger bun, and I've had it several times. But it's not inedible, I've just had better. 
The table service is just ok but I don't normally have high expectations for places where you have to walk to the register to pay. Basically, I love this place. Al Pastor!

This place is cheap and located very close to my house. The food is good. Service is great and the waitress are friendly. Come here for the burrito and horchata, plus this place is open late! 

There large horchata are huge! Great place to get a Rumchata party started!

Pros: Cheap, open late, nice staff, online ordering

Cons: Lackluster food. The vegetarian burrito was basically a tortilla filled with bland rice. The interior has an interesting and slightly unpleasant aroma like mildew.

Maybe it's due to growing up on the west coast and living in Arizona for a few years but I'd call this mediocre Mexican at best.

This place is cool. I been here several times. It's not the best quality ingredients and the meat is usually fatty. But the food is always consistent and available, with good seasoning. They are always my go to Mexican place when I don't want to travel any further to Pilsen or the Little Village. 

The horchata here is yummy. And the fruit/vege drinks are fresh and yummy!!

Went here late one night, just expecting a drunken burrito fix, but it ended up being so much more! The burritos were delicious, and the guacamole was the best restaurant guacamole I've had in the city, no exaggeration. The house-made chips were PERFECT as well. Not too thick, and fried at just the right temperature to get flaky and not greasy. Well done, San Jose.

***returned about a month later, not on a drunken burrito spree, and the guacamole was still absolutely delicious, and I really enjoyed my vegetarian burrito, which, as many vegetarians know, can be hit or miss. I'll be back!
Best burritos in Bridgeport! Love the vegetarian burrito and milkshakes.

TSJ usually does the trick for me if I'm looking for a quick fix at lunch.  While it's definitely not high brow, I have no complaints about anything here.  It's a small place, but bright and inviting.
