The pork belly put a nice spin on the gyro and their flatbread was awesome. Also tried the kale side and white rabbit salad, which was a very generous plate of greens and curds. It was so good I didn't stop to take a photo before inhaling. Def a highlight so far on my eating trip!

Lunch with a work colleague. Green chile sausage sandwich with a side of pickled cauliflower. I can't believe it has taken me so much time to visit this fine establishment. Loved it! Absolutely delicious.  Service was excellent. a bit pricy but worth it!

Adore this place. Their sandwiches (which often rotate) were a staple of my lunch orders when I worked in the Loop this past year. I was particularly fond of the Turkey Piri-Piri Pavo - which hit the spot better than most things I have ever eaten. 

A must for any quick lunch...or long one depending on your mood.

I had lunch with my two friends here and it was amazing! From the fresh meat to the overall interior , this place is awesome. In fact it was so good, I have been looking for similar places in the San Francisco Bay Area :) Must haves include the charcuterie plate , the Big E and the Butcher's Breakfast . Each of the meats and cheeses were absolutely delicious. I could hardly pick a favorite

Publican Quality Meats, you are my kind of deli!

I love trying unique cuts of meat, and PQM does not disappoint...I mean, heart, liver, and snail sausage (yeah, you read that correctly), to name a few unusually delicious standouts.

You know that distinctive *smell* that most butcher shops have...yeah, not so pleasant, right? I think it is telling that PQM does not have that smell at all and the place is impeccably clean. Beyond that, the staff is friendly and knowledgeable, and more than willing to answer questions and give out samples. It makes the experience of going to the butcher less intimidating for a novice like me.

Besides the meat, I love their olive focaccia bread, which pleasantly coats your fingers and mouth with olive oil as you eat it. Of course, no review of PQM is complete without mentioning the sandwiches. Their menu changes periodically, but I love the Penelope Cruz which has lamb sausage. My favorite sandwich here, and dare I say, in the city (gasp!) is the Fish and Chips, which is an open face sandwich with smoked fish, greens, crispy chips, and a delicious creamy sauce. All the sandwiches come with a smoky potato salad and a pickle.

If you are looking for a modern style deli and with cool vibe and awesome food, PQM is your spot!

First part is for meals at the deli:
Hubs and I went for lunch sandwiches out on the terrace in the summer. Delicious, creative sandwiches, very fresh. 
Hubs and I also went for brunch on NYD. The menu and the portions were small, but it tasted very good, and in terms of dishes and ingredients (as well as pricing) it's definitely on the classier side for brunch, despite sitting in a deli. The $6 small orange juice felt a bit like a rip off, we'd hoped for a fresh squeezed one, but I guess cold-pressed bottled brands are just very expensive while they can still ride the fad wave that they're on?

Second part is for groceries at the deli:
It can get quite busy on weekends, and thus pretty tight inside. You may have to wait a little for service as a result. We've always gotten friendly service and good advice, and were offered to sample a cheese or two when trying to decide which one to go for. 

Ranking these three types of experiences, I'd say this is best for lunch, second best for deli meats/cheeses, and third best for brunch.

A fancy deli with a array display of deli meat and aged steak. THey also sell local organic produce (milk, yogurt, ice cream) in the refrigerator. I came here on a weekday for lunch and it was not crowded. I sat in the communal tablet and was well served. The menu appeared limited and just okay. I ordered a vegetable soup (forgot the name), which was homemade and delightful.  The carrot salad may sound bland and average, but there was variety of carrots and brocolini. By far, it's one of my favorite salad. I also shared the pork belly wrap with my husband. The wrap was warm and not too thick. the pork belly was lean and well-seasoned. For a pork belly dish, it was quite light and not greasy.  Will defintely come back and try other deli sandwich. this is not your typical deli joint.

amazing deli (meat, cheese, bread) counter and great specialty dry pastas/condiment and wine selection. porchetta only on Saturdays. long queues for the eat-in tables. great coffee, old school but trendy feel. wonderful service. organized chaos when it's busy, but it works! great sandwiches.

Publican Quality Meats has such friendly staff. I almost want to say YES when one of them asked me if I am joining them for lunch even I just ate at The Publican next door.

Here you can find condiments, sauces, marinades, cured meat, fresh cut and more, ingredients for you can prepare something similar at home.

Get place to have a quick meal or just browse around and pick up whatever you need. 

Some unique condiments:

Bluegrass Bourbon Soy Sauce ($7.75) Micro brewed in small batches using only whole Kentucky grown non-GMO soybeans, soft red winter wheat and the purest limestone filtered Kentucky spring water. Fermented and aged soybean mash in re-purposed bourbon barrels. It's smoky and brothy with hints of oak and a mild sweetness reminiscent of fine Kentucky bourbon

I think I need one of those! :)

This place has the most annoying staff of any place I've been in west loop.  My experiences the last two times I've been there:

1) I went by myself for breakfast and was promptly seated inside and then ignored for 15 minutes while they served 4 groups that came in after me.  I was the only black person there, but I'm sure that my being ignored by their Becky server was totally random.  I got up and left.  We can imagine what kind of scene would have been caused if she ignored the old white dudes sitting next to me instead.

2) I shouldn't have but I tried to come back again today, with a white person this time, raising my odds of getting service.  I also had my 14 pound dog with me.  And their hostess gives me some nonsense about how the dogs can't be in the patio area and told me I'd have to tie him to a random tree.  A couple of things: a) literally every west loop patio has dogs in it, many much larger than mine b) we have eaten at publicans patio within the past couple weeks with our dog and it was a no-issue. So basically this is totally bs.

The food at this place is good but definitely not anything special and the staff is too irritating.  I'm not coming back here or publican.

One of my favorite places to eat! Went here for a lunch date, he and I both enjoyed the small patio over the summer. We both have definitely been back a few times since, still on our favorite spots in the city for a quick sandwich :-)

Excellent service, out of the ordinary food selection and cool vibes. I love the community style seating, though there's not a lot of room in the place in the place so you'll bump elbows quite frequently. Superb latte and a selection of bottled brews and sodas. Nice alternative to the Publican which is a bit more formal.

Came here for lunch on a Saturday.  They only have the porchetta on Saturdays. For my money the Porchetta at Roli Roti In San Fran still remains supreme:
http://www.yelp.com/biz/roli-roti-gourmet-rotisserie-san-francisco

There was a line - they said it would be 1/2 hours, it was about 15 minutes, and my friend got a bloody mary (see photo it had a sausage garnish!) to pass the time. It was big and good, came with a side pony of beer (Rickenbocker I think).

The tables are tight - just long tables to share. The chacuterie platter next to us was drool-worthy- but how much can two gals eat?  

We got the Porchetta sammy - served with chips, and the chicken Parm - That chicken parm sandwich will haunt my dreams, the roll was the stand out- almost like savory french toast...I would bet the mozzarella was made in house- it was creamy and rich.

DELISH! - 

Tip - if you are eyeing the desserts while waiting for your table. Order it immediately and don't  wait until after your meal. ON the way in there were about 6 or seven dessert selections, on the way out there were 2 - I missed getting a peanut butter oatmeal sandwich cookie that I had my eye on.

This was my second visit to quality meats and after giving it a second try, I have to voice my disappointment. 

On this visit I had the PIRI-PIRI PAVO smoked turkey for $12 (!!!, really??) and found it to be a small upgrade to what would be the experience of a what if Trader Joes had a "to go" sandwich business. The flavors were uneventful, and the sandwich size represented two smaller sized pieces of bread only a few notches away from being the heel. 

I gave it two stars since I was eating with some of my closest friends that I never get to see, and I was able to finish my sandwich. 

I really don't get it, I love Publican's original restaurant venture, but Quality Meats is more like Publican't.

Verrrrryyyyy good sandwiches! I love the flavors and don't mind paying for such high quality. I would have given five stars if the service was better. I've taken sandwiches to go and have had such unpleasant experiences at the register its made me not wanna return for them tasty grubs.

PQM is as good as it gets.  If you've never been, you have to.

As soon as you walk in you will see why everyone loves this place.  You are greeted immediately by all the amazing cured meats, cheeses and fresh baked bread.  Bam! You had me right away.

So far I have been here for lunch and have enjoyed sandwiches accompanied by a fine brew from a local brewery.  I have to say that I am yet to be disappointed.  

The location is small and cozy, there is seating inside but it is communal seating so be prepared to rub elbows with strangers.  In all honesty, i don't mind it here.  Everyone is so focused on the delicious food, everyone is in their own world.  During the nicer seasons you can sit outside and enjoy lunch out there.

PQM has an excellent beer selection with rotating drafts, mostly local.  You also have various ginger beers and other soft drinks available.

The greatest thing about this place is that if you're there at the right time, you will see a big old pig roll through there ready to be butchered. They do all of the butchering on site in the basement.  Take a gander next time you're there and head to the washroom downstairs.

Today I had the pleasure of enjoying "The Great Escape" consisting of morcilla sausage (blood sausage) sliced, avocado crema, aji costeno, marinated onion and ezra feta on yogurt naan.  I accompanied it with marinated kale salad.  It was so amazing delicious.  I am a huge fan of their morcilla.  It is so flavorful tastes amazing.  The feta is a perfect pairing to the sausage.  I also picked up a nice pumpkin loaf to bring to Thanksgiving dinner.  I also had to try their house-made jerky, i picked up 3oz.  It is amazing, you can tell it is some top quality beef and is covered in amazing  spices.

If you have not been here yet, I highly recommend you get your butt over there! 

Do it!

*** This review is for the takeaway butcher shop only. ***

This was the last stop on my very ambitious Chicago foodie crawl weekend in mid-Sept.  Friend and I came here after brunch in order to squeeze in one last spot en route to the airport and take some goodies home to our beloved ones.  After a quick assessment at the deli, I choose 3 items-- a lamb salami (uncut), the house Italian coppa (sliced), and La Quercia's spallacia (sliced) which is a shoulder cut from an acorn-fed pig.

Hubby was incredibly happy with the spoils of my travels-- with some good bread, cheese, and wine the following weekend, he declared it the best Chicago souvenir EVER!

And since I needed to use the restroom downstairs, I got to peep into the full-on working butcher shop which was quite awesome to see!

My only caution (in case anyone else is in my situation of needing to get to the airport) is that the butchers are quite slow in slicing.  It took much longer than I expected given that it wasn't that busy as opposed to by the time we left when things were picking up.  I'm not sure if it was because they were slicing meats to-order for sandwiches in between our orders, but it might be nicer to have separate areas/ functions for to-go vs. eat-in.

Next time I am in Chicago, I would love to eat-in, as their sandwiches and soups looked impressive, esp given the quality of meat I tried much much later at home :)

Their pâté game is on point! Wide variety of meat and cheese, specially sodas, beer, and sauces/spices. 

Picked up a board for office lunch and it was easily the best way to spend lunch at work. Highly recommend!
Any comments on hosting a private event there?  I'm intrigued by there offerings after hours?

These are the best sandwiches in Chicago, and at any given time one of their new temporary menu additions is as good as any sandwich in the world. Yes, that good! Chicken parm and gyro never leave the menu and you must have them to understand how good PQM is at making sandwiches of any kind. Meatheads will love them but veggie folk will be thrilled as well. Amazing salads (side of kale is perfect) big and small...and their fish or meat platters are nothing short of phenomenal. Go downstairs to the bathroom as well to see how the sausage is made. That sounds weird but it's real. Oh and their liquor selection is very curated so don't pass up a hot toddy or cold one such as the bloody. There's a good reason I go here pretty much every weekend. It's world class!

Amazing sandwich and soup , went for Friday lunch with friends great ambience for a beer with meat filled sandwich.
Great place for meat lovers.

I've been here multiple times for a variety of reasons. The first time was to pick up a wine order and while I was there I couldn't help but order a turkey sandwich from the counter and have a cup of tea while I waited.

The last 3 times I've been here have been for brunch or lunch. The food here is good and the market side has some great things to buy. So far I've bought honey, burgers, sausage, wine, and mustard from the shop.

One thing to note is that the menu changes a lot, in addition, there are events that take place here from time to time so you might want to call or check the menu online in advance. The menu isn't too big so picky eaters might be put off a bit. I also don't like the fact that the only egg options with the brunch plates are fried eggs- I'm a poached egg kind of girl.

Don't forget to check the market on the other side of the restaurant where you can find Pleasant House pasties and Jeni's ice cream among other things!

Okay guys, let's talk about PQM here. I've put off going for a long while, for too long I realized last week when I went there for the first time. Well hot dog, get that roast beef sandwich. I mean really: it has roast beast (beef), crunchy shallots and a mayo that is literally to die for piled on top of fab bread. I wanted to eat a second one immediately after I devoured the first. I am a PQM-aholic. I vow to go back this weekend to bring my husband and toddler there to experience the greatness. The first step is admitting to having a problem... 

I saw cookies that I have to try, an amazing selection of wine, beer and condiments. AND 12 other sandwiches on the menu that I could not quite fit into my mouth. This is a winner, my friends.

Stopped by after getting a coffee and donut at glazed. Came in with my two ur old son in my arms and figured I'd get a ciabatta...just be in and out. That didn't happen. I waited in line patiently as it was packed and staff didn't look like they were organized. I figured its my turn in line and I'm in front of the cashier and she ignores me while taking everyone else's orders. So I ask how long does it take if I just want a ciabatta. She finally realizes I'm in front of her and says with a smile...let me get one more customer. Not even an attempt to go out of her way or be nice or just understand that I have a kid and just need a ciabatta. To be blunt..customer service sucks here if they do not know you or if you are not white. Plain and simple. And to think I see the owner on TV all the time and have always wanted to try his restaurants as I live in the west loop. As I always say...customer service can make you or brake you and it turned away a potential customer. Next time I want no hassle for bread I'll go to Mariano's.
You go here to not watch your calories or worry about a gluten free meal. You go here to get some legendary south side eating.

Found this place on yelp while visiting Chicago and the pictures of the Philly Cheesesteak looked too good to resist. When I arrived the friendly guy behind the glass recommended the DEEP FRIED Philly Cheesesteak. BEST DECISION I've ever made! Meat, peppers, cheese and onion *drools* wrapped in a crispy deep fried tortilla. It comes with sour cream, fries and lettuce. The sour cream is perfect to cut through all the richness in that sandwhich. It also comes with lemonade and they have different flavours to pick from. The portion is huge I couldn't finish all the food by myself. Overall great concept, executed well. The only reason I didn't give this place 5 stars is because the fries suck I didn't even eat them and they could clean the place up a bit. Windex the widows and stuff. Other then that I love cheap eats and this is one of them. You can follow my food journey @britanysbites

After attending a concert we were starving but notice most places around the area closed at 10. We saw Baba's closed at 11:30 so we headed here. Now this is definitely a place where your going for the food and not the ambience. First off there's no tables. I also think it adds character paying for your meal through the bullet proof glass, the police car parked in front, and the beautiful blue lights that adorn the neighborhood. Okay I'll stop...  :)

Now onto the food...reasonably priced! I ordered the gyro, but they were out so had to go with the chicken gyro combo instead. Pretty decent sandwich and I like the lemon pepper on the fries. My friend ordered the 10 piece wings. He said they were greasy, but delicious! My favorite part is you get to pick between like 10 flavors of lemonade to go with your combo meal (taste like a slushy) I chose the piña colada and OMG delicious!! If I am back out this way I wouldn't mind stopping in to try other food items. That Philly Cheese Steak is calling my name :)

For a late night greasy treat on the South Side, Baba's is the place. Right off the Dan Ryan east on 51st Street. Complete with bullet-proof lazy-susans to order and pick up your food. Only thing they are missing is milk shakes.

P.S. Absolutely no valet parking, or tables for that matter.

For a humid day , get in here for their frozen lemonade! So cold with a slice of fruit on top, its good. . The steak sandwich is really good too, seasoned right with great bread. Classic Chicago , order thru glass. You know , I grew up with the order thru glass - so it's no big deal.

Despite the area, customer service was on point. Wait time was to be expected, 20 mins which is cool for what I ordered. Crispy philly is a bucket list item I kid you not. No tables, no chairs. Just a counter to watch the food being cooked behind bulletproof glass. Mix your lemonade flavors, I believe you can do up to three. I like pineapple and fruit punch together, it's great. If you're in the hood, try it. You will not be disappointed!

It's a total dive, with its dim fluorescent lighting and its bulletproof glass.  Ahhh...

You gotta love the South Side right?

But guess what? The food makes it all worth it. I order their Philly Steak religiously. It's customizable and always cooked fresh. In fact, everything's cooked fresh because they cook it right in front of you. No guess work here, Baba's is legit. Their combos usually come with fries and a "lemonade" which is arguably more syrup than anything...but still pretty delicious if you aren't watching your insulin levels. 

Word to the wise, don't come here if you're watching your weight. Bad idea.
And hey, don't linger.

South side Chicago! Where the food soul food is at! 

Now this is a steak sandwich! Fresh meat cooked right in front of you, perfectly seasoned, moist, and nice soft bun! They don't skimp on the ingredients. 
It came with fries and a choice of lemonade (I got the fruit punch) all for under $10! Now that's a deal! Fries weren't that good, the lemonade, just straight sugar and ice. 

The neighborhood ain't that great as you'll see the staff behind a bulletproof glass and only a rotating box that allows any transaction between the customer and them! 

If you around here do yourself a favor get the #1 but if your health permits there's a deep fried crispy cheese steak! I'll get that when I don't want to live anymore.

drove by this place a few times and decided to give it a try..there is a glass window divider and a spinning door for you to pay and get your food.. so you know you are not is the greatest neighborhood haha... and i always see a lot of cops driving around and patroling haha.. 

been here a few times already and ive ordered...

super mix philly - super mix is chicken and steak mixed together instead of the usually just chicken or steak philly.. it was good! probably one of my favorite phillys ive tried.. tons of meat and well seasoned! 

crispy mix - it's similar to the super mix philly.. well it's actually exactly the same as the super mix philly except the crispy mix doesnt use a bun.. the crispy is wrapped and deep fried.. almost like a pizza puff but a lot bigger! again.. it was pretty good and i liked it but however i do prefer the original super mix philly over this..

wings - i always order my wings fried hard with lemon pepper and mild sauce! the wings is a bit small.. it was just alright.. didnt really like their mild sauce .. 

gyro cheese burger - i feel the burger patty needs more seasoning on it.. other then that.. it was decent..

i also had the strawberry lemonade and green apple lemonade .. thought it was just ok.. its really sweet..
Amazing food. I highly recommend the philly steak or chicken philly. Food is made to order and cooked right in front of you. great service and great prices

Baba's is fye!  I was feining for one of their steak sandwiches so I stopped by last night.  The steak is seasoned to perfection and the peppers onions and mushrooms play perfectly with the meat.  They put cheese and mayo on top at the last minute and flip it on to the bread.  Its a perfect bite.  The fries are only okay and the lemonade is good too,  they have a bunch of flavors.  I drink some and mix vodka with the rest. I was so hungry I forgot to take pictures

The food is consistently hot and good. I suggest going during the day because the neighborhood is sketchy and there are always crackheads bobbin around the place, but there's normally a squad car outside as well.

Best Crispy Steaks Ever!!! All of the food gets cooked right in front of you. All of the ingredients are fresh, fish and chicken get cooked to order. You might have to wait about 10 minutes for them buy at least you know it wasn't sitting under a heat lamp for an hour. The same staff has been there for years and everyone if friendly and helpful.

Two Words: Halal Menu!

I am forever on a journey to find delicious halal cuisine..I can not believe that the entire menu is halal! This is music to my ears! It is so odd to tell people that I have never had am authentic roast beef sandwich, lol..but dangggg! I asked the owner where they purchase the meat and he told me and he didn't take it personal. Several times shop owners take such offense to you asking them about he validity of the halal meat!

Environment - Very cute little shop that is full of students! It is packed with assortments of tea, beverages, a huge menu (beef, chicken, turkey, and fish), dessert, and they also serve gelato! This shop also has a PRINTER! (If you have or are in school at the moment, you know the importance of a working printer!) That is deff a added bonus and what a great way to bring back more customers? Awesome!

Food - I had the Roast Beef Artichoke Sandwich which had massive amounts of roast beef, lettuce, tomatoes, artichokes, dipped in asian dressing and cheddar cheese! This was just delicious! The bread was firm for the purpose of the sandwich, but soft to the last bite! I paired this with Pomegranate Ginger Ale! I can not wait to return to this little place! The price was great..you will leave satisfied!

http://www.cafe-53.com/

There are many cafés to choose from in Hyde Park, but one of my favorites is Café 53. They have a full halal/vegetarian menu, which I had never seen before in this neighborhood. They have a very large tea selection right on the counter, so you can actually get a closer look at what you're picking. Plus there's gelato! I have many times come in for just a sandwich and found myself unable to resist those sweet and colorful temptations.

Out back there is an enclosed garden with ample space. It is a tranquil respite from the busy city streets. 
Other than that, Café 53 provides the standard menu of salad/sandwich/coffee with plenty of seating areas for socializing, snacking and studying.

The desserts are pretty mediocre; the mini macaroons are cute but not super delicious and the blueberry muffin top was average. 

I rank 4 stars because of the abundant patio seating and huge sandwiches around me. I'll come back to try one for my own and can update my thoughts then!
Always excellent customer service and prices are very reasonable. They have great apple cider and caramel macchiatos.

Updated review ! the chicken sandwiches are a delight !! I gave this place another chance as per my friends recommendations and it was great ! The chicken sumac has just the right amount of seasoning and it's so good . I have also tried the buffalo chicken which is awesome as well. I would recommend this place !!

I worked at a pita shop in college and thought the best pitas of my life were in the rear view mirror. My pita hankerings still run deep though, so when I'm feeling hopeful I hop in the driver's seat and see what's around the corner. Today that road led me to Café 53, and one of the best pitas of my life. The falafel and hummus pita was perfectly done. The combination of light vegetables, tahini sauce and spicy peppers (3/5 peppers on my scale) was the perfect combination. I will be returning for another, and probably soon.

My go-to place in Hyde Park to sit down and get homework done. They have such a large variety of vegan options to halal sandwiches. The owner of the place is incredibly nice and super accommodating with whatever you need. I like to sit on the back porch and work on all of my stuff; it's secluded and quiet and you can still run in and get whatever coffee/food you like. Definitely recommend!!!

Sooo many unique sandwich options that it's hard to pick just one! I she the Honey BBQ chicken sandwich and it was simply delicious. You may have to wait for your sandwich but that's how you know they are actually making the sandwich fresh. I know that I'll be coming back here to try the other sandwiches....that are zabihah!
Delicious sandwiches, good service, nice ambience.  Nice to find a unique Halal option with Turkey:)

Very nice sandwiches, very nice gelato and espresso!
...also very nice bakery!
Check out the patio, hidden behind the shop: it's lovely!

Recently discovered this place after going for a run. I wanted something healthy but tasty. I've been here twice so far and I really like the sandwiches! And I love the fact that they have lettuce wraps since I'm on a low carb diet. And if I ever feeling like treating myself they have great bakery items and gelato. The sandwiches are fresh made and oven baked so overall this is a great healthy eating place if you ask me. Next time I will try their vegan options.
I can't believe that I've walked passed this place a million times. I decided to try the vegan buffalo sandwich and absolutely love it.  The bread was warm and chewy just like I like it.
So many tea options!! The food menu looks pretty solid.

The Hummus: 
Decadent, creamy, sumac and oil sprinkled goodness.
The Turkish Coffee: 
Sweet caffeinated elixir so hard to find but oh so delicious-eat your heart out Starbucks!
The Vegan Chik'n Sumac Sandwich
A robust flavorful hearty departure from the standard vegan norm and OMG where has this creamy soy based sauce been my whole life?!?!

Great food, great staff and great menu.
Can't wait to try another of the dozen plus vegan sandwich offerings!

I was told that this café was one of the biggest ones in Hyde Park and that surprised me because it seem kinda of small to me but it wasn't a problem.

I came here just for a meeting so I didn't really have any food but I did have a Tea Latte' which I had never had before it was okay and it was reasonable in price.  

There was a steady stream of people that came through the door and many of them the man behind the counter seemed to know.

It had such a welcoming feel and even as my Pastor and I prayed after our meeting as we sat at the table no one in the Café seemed put off or as if they were surprised in fact they were smiling.  That was the Cherry on the top of this visit.

I will be coming back to taste some of their food and pastries.

I will update my review when I do.

Enjoy!

Absolutely love this place. I tried the vegan Sumac sandwhich It was great! I dont typically eat vegan but decided to try it... its one of the best vegan sandwhichs I have tried. I will definately go back here!
I enjoy the back yard seating. Food taste great. The ice cream is a Rock. I will come again

I love this place! In addition to great food and ice cream, not to mention the coffee,  they play good music courtesy of a French Internet radio station. This adds up to many a many-splendored experience right in the heart of Hyde Park.

I ordered a chai and had to remind the server of my order after waiting about 15 mins. My tea was overly sweet and generally not appetizing. The free wifi makes it a good workspace but they really need to work on the beverage quality and the service.

Great place for tea. You can also get your sandwiches wrapped in lettuce if you are low-carb or gluten free. 

If the weather is nice, be sure to check out the patio in the back.

Cute little cafe with various pastries, sandwiches and quiches. I tried the little desserts, veggie panini, and mint lemonade drink. The food was great and the desserts are even better. Definitely try this place in you're in the area. They have an open patio in the summer so it's perfect for a nice summer day or evening.

Did I not write a review for this place?  Shame on me!  It's a bit of a whole in the wall with chipped paint and tile and some worn, wobbly tables and chairs.  But oh my sweet Baby Jesus is the food here good.  The sumac chicken sandwich on Dutch crunch bread is my new habit.  Good thing I have many reasons to get to Hyde Park all the way from Lakeview!

And the owner/manage?  Dude couldn't be more friendly or helpful.  Even though he wasn't going to make as much money from my desired order, he convinced me not to get the hummus plate along with the sandwich, saying it was too big.  "I'll make it for you if you want.  But it'll be too much food.  I want you to be happy."  I took his advice and he was so right.  The sandwich, at $6.00, was as big as my head.  I ate at 11:30 and had to force myself to think about what to make for dinner at 5pm.

Meet your new crack!
The Turkish coffee here is great and all the sandwiches I've tried have been so flavorful. My favorite is the garlic chicken.

A friend and I decided to get some gelato after lunch today and Cafe 53 was right there, looking like an adorable northside cafe. Neither of us had been there before and we went up to the gelato counter and the pastry counter....where we had plenty of time to admire the wares, since the three employees completely ignored us for several minutes. Finally my friend asked if we could get some gelato. The guy behind the counter turned to another man who was on the phone and then turned back to us and said "No, sorry." No? Seriously?! Isn't that their restaurant byline?! I asked why and was told because it wasn't uncovered. By that, I guess they meant that the gelato had plastic covers over each of the tubs. They couldn't take off the covers to serve us? O-Kaaaay. Obviously they didn't want our business.... So, I guess we won't be back!
Their tea selection is heaven. I really enjoyed my experience there and their food is excellent as well!!! I'd highly recommend Café 53
Great vegetarian options with decent coffee. I came in for breakfast and had the egg and veggie sandwich which was excellent.  There is a beautiful courtyard out back to enjoy on nice days

Smelled a little funky, but the girl working there was so nice, the iced coffee was great and the blueberry muffin was delicious as well. Sat in one of the soft chairs and sank two inches, and judging from the reviews I should have tried a sandwich, but the vibes here were really great and I give it two very enthusiastic thumbs up - fine holiday fun.

My wife and I love places like this.  You get friendly counter-service ordering.   Food is delivered to your table with friendly, casual attitude.  Low-moderate pricing.  Modest accommodations inside and outside (in the back). The food is fresh and flavorful.  Upscale student fare.
Great place to study or meet with friends! Delicious food and great coffee. Overall great place.

A bright cute place. It's always low-key here, most people are working and minding their own. A great place to meet with a friend. Pleasant atmosphere. The backyard porch is a beautiful, more intimate setting. But, don't tell anyone because we have to keep it that way.  It was also a setting in one episode of the reality show Chicagoland (on Netflix). The front seats offer a nice perspective of the cafe and passerby's on the sidewalk.

Only drawback - I order drinks with soy milk because of a lactose intolerance and on several occasions I've gotten cow milk.

Some of the best vegan sandwiches ever. Fast delivery. The soy-based cream sauce is THE shit.

Ok so the ambience needs a little work, but this place has turned into one of my favorite spots. It's part coffee shop, part gelateria, and part restaurant that delivers! They do everything.. And for the most part they do it well.  The food options vary from the boring (grilled chicken salad) to unique international (I had some middle eastern chicken sandwich that was AMAZING). The gelato is pretty good as well. So..if you need a place to chill AND eat something on 53rd that's not deep fried, smothered, or just plain unhealthy....this is a good option.

Tons of great vegan options for sandwiches that can be tricky in other places where you'd just walk away with lots of lettuce, tomatoes and maybe a cucumber with some dressing slathered on - this place gives you OPTIONS for goodness! I recommend eating there so you can get it delivered to you fresh after preparation as (especially the vegetarian/vegan ones) some of the sandwiches get a bit sloppy quickly with the dressings and such soaking into the bread. I, personally, love their eggplant sandwiches. They are quite large and very filling. No real options for sides for those who want some fries or something with their order, but you can get some chips. 

If you're in the mood for gelato... oh man! They have some great, original flavor options. I tried a scoop of basil with a scoop of ricotta - which had a great cheesecake taste to it when combined. The server just kept providing me sample after sample with various combos to see what I might like. So many yummy options - I could hardly decide.

Cafe 53 to me means coffee, gelato and pastries. Coffee can be inconsistent -- I'll usually have  runs of good espresso-based drinks punctuated by one that's not so good. Gelato is always fine and lots of flavors, and there's a good variety of pastries that are specific to this place (plus vegan options for those interested). Free wifi, kind of small but there's also a backyard area too.

Most underrated cafe in Hyde Park. Got a ton of food through the Yelp deal and was psyched about all of them: amazing sandwiches in taste and size and a sweet apple crumble. I'll be back as soon as possible.

We stumbled along this joint as we were looking at houses. We thought we were just gonna grab a quick coffee but we couldn't resist the awesome menu.... Vegan too! The food was phenomenal. By far the best sandwich I've ever had. I would highly recommend stopping by for a quick bite. We will be back!

I've gone here for a while now. Their back patio is wonderful and open year round. The prices are reasonable. The tea selection is great, and I'm eating their carrot cake now and it's delicious. And even though they use the Square service, the employees don't ask for tips through it, which I find to be really honest.

The owner, who is almost always there, is very personable, and will knock himself out to make you happy. The coffee is way better than Starbucks and way way better than DD. Recently, the menu was expanded. Meat lovers, as well as veggies will be happy. I like the Eggplant Meatball, as well as their "Café 53 Sandwich" - which is a simple bagel with egg whites, covered in delicious Turkish olive oil, and sprinkled with mint. 

One note for those used to going to Starbucks... Café 53 does not have sugar-free syrup and a few other fancy things like that. 

Finally, the WiFi is reliable and extremely fast!
Garlic Chicken sandwich!! 'nough said. Seriously, it's really good. I just randomly stopped by, wasn't expecting awesomeness!!

Awesum began sandwiches.... Great service.. Great food... Great prices...

Had a vegan avocado artichoke sandwich - real nice
Vegan Buffalo chicken sandwich - not bad

Began marshmallow brownie - heavenly...

See u again... Soon.....
always excellent customer service and prices are very reasonable. They have great apple cider and caramel macchiatos.

Had lunch here today. Can't recall the name of the sandwich but it was toasted with chicken and gardenare (sp?). Absolutely delicious. The atmosphere was quaint. The chairs were worn-that would be my only complaint. Plenty of options for vegetarians.
Favorite spot in Hyde park. Absolutely love this place. Sumac chicken sandwich is always amazing.

Good coffee (and nice large mugs available if you're staying there). A few vegan offerings in the pastry case, including delicious gluten-free brownies. 
The real highlight here is the back patio -- a rare find in the area. Several tables & chairs, shade from lots of trees, and no street noise! It also tends to be a quieter crowd on the patio than inside, which is ideal for enjoying a coffee and reading.

Turkey avocado pita wrap was excellent. Toasty and very tasty. The coffee is quite good. The deserts are delicious. A wide selection of gelato and they also have Vegan options. Very nice cozy coffee shop with good eats.
sandwiches here are excellent. delivery is fast. hummus was very good but portion was a little on the small side. Great place for lunch

I've stopped by this cafe over the years off-and-on but was never overly impressed or unimpressed.  However, that all changed today!  While walking by I saw that a variety of sandwiches are now on the menu, including many vegetarian/vegan, and decided to try one out.  I had the vegan buffalo "chicken" sandwich and it was absolutely out if this world!!!  Everything about it was fantastic!!!  Can't wait to try other options in the future!
A cute little coffee shop.  I've only been there once, but the coffee was good.  There's Wi-Fi, students!

This place was a bit run down and the food was extremely ordinary. So so gelato, and one of the worst iced coffees I've ever had. Unfortunately that went in the trash halfway through. 

The back patio area was nice and very peaceful, so I enjoyed that. It's like a small oasis in the city and I can see why people would like to study here. The interior just seemed cramped and cluttered. 

I can't say that I would stop in again.

Good coffee, good service & great outdoor patio space covered by trees. Very peaceful and quiet & a great place to sit & chat with a friend or study/do work. 

I'll definitely go back.
Highly recommend their vegan options! Love this cafe

All the Sandwiches are very generous in size and delicious. Wifi is free.  They made good coffee too. The only downside is that  the store is small, it can get very crowded during the weekends and there is not sufficient room for people waiting for take-out (given that there is usually a bit of the wait for sandwich)

Decent study spot, good selection of teas, and blah coffee. My friends say the sandwiches are pretty good; I have yet to try them. Service is hit or miss, but works for the most part. 

It's a good place to study for a bit, the coffee is a little tasteless, but the teas are plentiful (though kinda pricey honestly). $3 credit limit. Good place to stop if you are in the area, but I wouldn't seek it out.

Came here once over the summer.

Very friendly staff, I can tell the lady definitely has her share of regulars. I had a blueberry smoothie (was not a fan, I found it extremely sweet). On the positive side, I ordered an "everything" cookie (some kind of nut, oats, chocolate chunks, raisins, some other things). I enjoyed that.

I'm sure the rest of the food is good, but I have not tried it. Definitely come here if you're in a rush to get to the Metra.
Came here for the first time today,  loved it,  definitely coming back to try the vegan food... But for now, I'll just say the service is great and tea selection rocks!
Very chill quiet place. A lot of people use there lap tops in there. The workers there are really cool and nice. The food is good

The service in this establishment is horrible the owner/manager shows a total disregard for his customers, he is beyond rude, and seems to have a problem with diversity.  I stopped into this cafe, which is around the corner from my rental unit, to get a breakfast sandwich and a drink while waiting to meet with a perspective tenant.  While placing my order I was unsure of the options available for a breakfast meal, being that it was my first time in this establishment,  upon questioning the manager about any available options or combos he look at me as if I was speaking a foriegn language.  Despite the rude service I placed my order and patiently waited with the two women who ordered before me as a number of other customers were processed and served.   To make what is obviously a long story short, the manager either forgot my order or gave it to someone else then gave me some lame excuse stating that some items take longer than others to prepare. He soon doubled down and told the ladies who ordered before the same thing after they questioned if there order was ready. Now maybe our experience was due to the fact that we were new customers however we all also happened to be of a different race than the customers who were immediately severed after ordering after us.  Regardless of the reasons for this bad customer experience I will never spend another dime in this location, barring a change in management/ownership and will encourage all my friends and family members to do the same.

There's a really great patio in the back! Signs for it aren't obvious inside the cafe and a lot of people don't know about it but the back patio is really what makes this place. The coffee and food are pretty standard, though the option of sandwiches or gelato gives you a lot of diversity, but being able to enjoy them in a nice garden is the real selling point and why I'm giving Cafe 53 four stars.

I went here yesterday for coffee with a friend, and ended up getting an early lunch. They have a nice assortment of Mideastern sandwiches, as well as vegan versions of some of these. My mocha was quite good, sandwich was tasty, but what really sets this place apart are: 1) the large and lovely rear patio, and 2) the very kind and gentle staff.

This place is a much needed addition to the area.  After dinner on Sunday we wanted to have an ice cream cone while taking a stroll.  Since Baskin Robbins is gone, there isn't really an ice cream shop in Hyde Park anymore.  This place is a cute cafe that can also try to fill the void of the missing ice cream parlor.

I tried a couple of the sorbets, and they were both great.  I thought the pastries looked amazing.  I'll have to stop in some time and get my brother a vegan brownie.

The staff was so friendly.  They really just seem like genuinely happy people.

Went here in the AM to pick up any fun baked goods to bring to the office.
It was more expensive that I thought.
I took a few cannolis (pre-made by some third-party company apparently).
Yuck. It was more like a candy bar.

Was not a fan.
Perhaps their other items are better, but everything looked old and dry.
I would've assumed they'd have their new baked items out in the morning, but guess not.

If I could give this place negative stars I would. Terrible, terrible customer service! I placed an order that never arrived. I called the restaurant three times and the manager was very rude and hung up on me after making excuses and saying it's "not their problem because I ordered through GrubHub". I wanted to cancel my order and they refused. They told me to call the cops and hung up again. Luckily GrubHub was able to refund me. Save yourself the trouble and never order from this awful place.

Good coffee, good service, good wifi, good selection of baked goods.

I would give this place 5 stars if the tables were rectangular, rather than round.

I come here for coffee all the time. Fresh and different everyday, Cafe 53 offers a customer card that rewards you after 10 purchases. They also offer a stellar and diverse assortment of pastries and cakes to go along with your coffee (and if you run out of coffee, the refill is only 75 cents!). 

As soon as you enter you'll see dozens of students studying. Their tables are long and wide and comfortable enough to stay reading or writing for a whole afternoon. But wait, it gets better: if you're in the mood to have a conversation outside, Cafe 53 has its own patio. It's pleasant and large enough to accomodate up to 6 tables! 

With the close of Third World Cafe earlier this year, there is no better place to read, study or conversate than Cafe 53. Check it out if you're in Hyde Park!

This place is a popular study spot, and it's often difficult to get a table. The coffee itself is good, but a few cents more expensive than it should be. The gelato is good, and comes in flavors like basil and lavender. The baked goods are standard, cafe staples in decent sized portions. I've not tried the food from the menu, but it claims to be halal. Free wifi. As a final note: service can be slow, so don't go if you don't have a few minutes to wait for your drinks.

I live in Hyde Park and this is one of my favorite restaurants here. The sandwiches are extremely filling and they use high quality ingredients. Definitely stop by if you are in the area you won't be sorry!! The roast beef and turkey avocado are my favorites. Go!!

loved the gelato and the simple fact that the Cafe is there!

Yeye Lynvonne
Cafe Yeye: WCSU iHeart radio

I like the way this place fills up with people and their laptops by 1pm, but the owner is completely chill with it and lets everyone stay as long as they like. The cappuccinos are surprisingly good (I note that other reviewers find them weak, and I should say I always ask for an extra shot of espresso), and the ginger cream scone is probably the only reason I got out of bed today. The decor is a little bit off, but in a way that makes everything feel somehow less trendy and more diner-y without harming the ideal-study-spot configuration.
This place and Z&H are the only 2 places in Hyde Park that know how to make good sandwiches!! Excellent customer service here. And really amazing food!

Very clean, brightly lit, free reliable wifi, plenty of seating, and a wonderful staff! The last time I was there we were a group of 5+, and the girl behind the counter was as sweet as could be about letting us sample lots and lots of different gelato flavors. Less than $2 for a scoop on a cone is pretty cheap in my books! I had the chai gelato which was deeeelicious, I loved how thick and creamy it was. Other tasty flavors include the strawberry chocolate chip and oreo. The baked goods (esp the scones) looked very tempting as well. A cute little place in Hyde Park, the neighborhood needs more like it!
The best little hideaway on 53rd! Great coffee and pastries, especially the carrot cake! Awesome service!

Cafe 53 DOES have outdoor seating.  It was too hot outside the day I came to sit back there, but from what I saw it's beautiful.  There is wifi, a ton of outlets, and it is relatively uncrowded.  I wasn't a big fan of the decor or the music, but i's a convenient place to work.  I enjoyed my visit.

The garlic chicken sandwich is awesome!  Café 53 is a great hideaway for the University of Chicago crowd.  Free Wi-Fi and a peaceful patio in the back that takes you away from the 53rd street traffic.

For a while when I moved into my new apartment I had no Internet. Since this was right after finals week and I had effectively just moved out of the library, I was determined to find somewhere with free wifi outside of the stony confines of the Regenstein.

Cafe 53 has tasty baked goods, a large selection of teas, and enormous tables with plushy chairs. Their chairs are really, really, really comfortable. Among all of the coffeeshops in the Hyde Park area, I'd probably say that this is the best place to study. I do hope it stays open.
That Croque Madame.. its better than the ones in Paris.  Nice little coffee house that reminds me of France in a lot of ways (but not every way!).
Great atmosphere. Hummus and Falafel sandwich was right.

A friend and I decided to head over to Cafe 53 on Sunday to get some studying done. We snagged a table right inside the door, which they had propped open. We decided to sit and chat for a bit before ordering our drinks and getting to work. As we were sitting there, it started to rain outside and blow through the open door, right onto our laptops that were on the table. I got up and closed the door. 

At this point we had only been there for 10 minutes. Soon after I closed the door to avoid getting rained on, the woman working came over and propped the door back open even after we explained to her that we were getting wet. She then snidely asked us if we had ordered anything yet. We had literally been there for 10 minutes and were going to order shortly thereafter. 

Needless to say we left. I didn't want to be rained on or give my money to someone who so rudely demanded it. Terrible service. I will not try and study here again.

Tasty desserts. Miserable people. Rude and clearly offended that we were mixed race and mixed aged. Forst girl took our order. Did not totally listen. And then walked off  saying the other girl would help us but did not pass us off  and others were then served ahead of us. I mentioned this was rude that she walked off but was told , " i dont know about that and what do u want." rele uptight for a place with hardly anyone in it. I wont be back.....and i have been in hp since 1989. The people here suck.

Didn't see any gluten free options -- but I really only came for a good cold coffee drink, and I was very pleased with it.

Had a iced vanilla latte & it was made perfectly. My only major complaint was there was no outdoor seating, even when lots of other restaurants, cafes, have outdoor seating on 53rd street. If they opened up some seating outdoors it would have jumped to 4 stars.
egg n feta bagel, five bucks. simple enough, right? no. it's too hard of a task for these guys. you get some eggshells in your eggs too! are you kidding me? what a joke.

have gone to this place 3 times to get gelato and all 3 times i have been RUDELY  told," we have gelato, but we can't serve it to you" ... nothing else.
will never go back to this place... and its a shame, i really like gelato!
now the fro yo place across the street is where its at!

WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER.

This is one of the places I miss most in Hyde Park. I used to stop by every morning and order a hot scone until I gained a few pounds and decided to stop. But after learning a little discipline I would go there on the weekends and treat myself to a scone and coffee and a hummus & falafel sandwich. In the summertime I would read outside on the outdoor patio. It is a beautiful little spot with overhanging trees and sunlight trickling through. Most importantly, it is quiet, and conducive to reading. I miss this cafe dearly and haven't been able to find one like it on the north side.

I'm a U of C student who would come here because one of my profs held his office hours here. What impressed me was the vast selection of drinks and food items. Both times I came, I just ordered tea, but my friends who came with me the first time loved their seasonal pumpkin and peppermint lattes and vegetarian sandwiches. They have these "brownie balls" that I think are totally emblematic of America's culinary ingenuity. All the sweets and baked goods in the case looked delicious, and they even have gluten-free items.

This is a good place to study. Like Starbucks, you could bring your laptop and copy of Plato or The Iliad here and chug away at your work for a few hours, if you wanted a change of scenery from the libraries on campus.

Service is friendly, too. In fact, you can request a card that you give to the cashier guy every time you buy a drink; on the tenth visit, your drink is free. 

Aside from Cafe 57, this is probably my favorite off-campus coffee shop.

I give them two stars just for their amazing baked goods... Despite the flies I have seen in the case.  No atmosphere here. Awkward chairs for the tables, booths are crooked and falling apart, all the tables lop sided.  Crabby employees, one worker on her cell phone before ringing me.  Internet does not work.  Either freezing in here or 5 billion degrees.  Average coffee drinks.  The only thing it has over Starbucks on 52nd is that it has a bathroom.

Got a panini to go on a Wednesday for lunch.  Asked for a beef panini with no tomatoes.  When I got the sandwich home (a quick rush in pouring rain), opened it, only to discover that it had tomatoe in it.  It's not as if the place was all that busy.  Also, the panini took a very long time to cook--which would seem to indicate that they had not turned on the panini maker (which you'd think they would have by 11:30AM).  Another customer looked at foods in the display cabinet several times, but it took a third visit to the area until someone asked if they could help her.  While this place is a welcome addition to Hyde Park, the attention to detail and service leave a lot to be desired.

I have been eyeing their brownies in the pastry case ever since coming here...just had it. Dang. The best pastry case in Hyde Park. The best brownie I have EVER had. Yes. That's right. THE BEST brownie ever. I think I may have had my chocolate quota for the year in one brownie. So satisfied. Tummy is happy!

I very nearly gave this place four stars ... but they HAVE TO get rid of the horrible radio station music they play- the music itself is okay (mostly classic rock) but it's played way too loudly and the commercials every few minutes drive me crazy because they're even louder than the music is.  It's impossible to carry on a good conversation or have any sort of meeting, because of the music situation.  Everyone I know who comes here brings ear plugs ... With their WiFi, they could easily have satellite radio, so I don't understand why they're still playing awful old-school blaring broadcast radio.

Now the good stuff: they've got WiFi, they don't mind if you hang out for an afternoon with your laptop, and they've got a wealth of different kinds of sweet and savory treats, many of which are vegan.  The baked goods and gelato are okay- not amazing, but not terrible- and the coffee is good.  The staff is super friendly (and this makes up for the length of time it takes them to carry out your order).  It's only been open a month, so I expect things will smooth out over the months to come!
Nice atmoshere, they don't overcharge for their gelato, got a single scoop of cookies and cream on a sugar cone for $2.75. Service was great, very friendly.

I have been to Cafe 53 a couple of times and I love it. It is beautiful inside, the food is good and the lady behind the counter was AWESOME! They have free wifi! I haven't tried their coffee but I will soon.
I love this place! The coffee is amazing and the veggie panini is delectable. The staff definitely knows the names of regulars and suggests awesome vegan and gluten - free snacks.

I am a fan of this place. The staff is always friendly, and they let you taste as many flavors of gelato as you'd like before you commit to one (or two). I also like that they have an outdoor patio where you can sit and enjoy your treats. Good stuff.

Quiet, peaceful atmosphere with great coffee, yummy baked goods and amazing gelato.  I only wish Hyde Park had more places like this.  This has replaced Starbucks as my morning procrastination stop.  I highly recommend this place for a coffee, sugar pick-me-up or afternoon gelato.

i love this place. best sandwiches in hyde park (sumac chicken and kufta are my favorites, so good and GIANT proportions. i can never finish more than half!) the owner is really nice, they play good music, have wifi, and have really good pastries too--especially the cheesecake brownie. they also have gelato in really interesting flavors, like basil and green tea. coffee is also good, which is rare in hyde park. they also have a back patio which is awesome in nice weather. all around, my favorite cafe in hyde park.
Haven't had any pastries or gelato, but the coffee is decent, there is a lot of seating (compared to other cafes in Hyde Park), and there is free wi-fi.

The pros: rich gelato in which you can taste (and sometimes detect the texture of) genuine ingredients--I've tried the pumpkin, macadamia nut, and ginger, all of which were superb. The counter staff is super friendly and often bring you your order while you're sitting down. Plus, free WiFi and at least a few outlets available. 

The cons: tables feel a bit rickety, lighting is a tad harsh at night, the service can be slow (but friendly!!) and they don't have cafe au lait.

This is a wonderful place. There are great vegan and regular sweet- starch options (and really great instant oatmeal) and sandwiches are coming; the seats are *really* comfortable.  And, the coffee is great.  It's perfect except for the oldies soundtrack.

The only thing that could improve this cute place would be increased capacity. It's hard to get reservations so I would suggest visiting during the week. 

The fish is so fresh, the sashimi sliced perfectly, and the broths in every ramyun have just the right amount of seasoning. 

It's an ideal spot for a romantic night out or intimate dinner with a friend. 
Alcohol is served on site and they have a wide selection of sake, beer, and wine to choose from. 

I love the owners Sarah and John. They make dining there feel like home, which is nice considering home for me is over three thousand miles away.

I come here at least once a week. The servers are so sweet, but the sushi. THE SUSHI. It's so good. Every time. 

Start with the cheese balls for an app, sweeter and lighter than your average crab rangoon. Then get the jalapeño spicy tuna cheese. I know cream cheese in sushi is so Americanized, but that's because it's delicious :)

The white ocean roll is great, and you can't go wrong with the sashimi. So fresh! I've yet to try the ramen but I'll be back next week to give it a shot.

Thanks, Kameya, for always being on point!

This is my favorite sushi restaurant in Lincoln Park! The restaurant itself is clean and adorable - very small, about 6 tables so make a reservation - and the hostess is so warm and welcoming. She does a great job recommending sushi and entrees based on what you're looking for and what pieces are especially fresh that day. The chef is nice and cute as well. 

Kameya has some of the best nigiri pieces in the city. The salmon toro and unagi are delicious and very fresh. The rolls are also very good - Sushi Paradise is a favorite. Definitely ask about the ramen too - the Kameya Ramen with BBQ pork belly is outstanding! And they now serve ramen all day. Some of the sushi pieces may cost slightly on the higher end but that is because the quality and freshness of the fish is that high. 

This hidden spot is not one to miss if you're looking for great sushi and a casual, quiet dinner. It also now has 2 outdoor tables for summer!

We tried a lot of different things here and the highlight has to be the tuna tartar appetizer. The tuna with the spicy sauce along with the sprout were fantastic. And the chips added a delectable crunch to the whole thing. The other things we tried like the bibimbop and sushi were good but not outstanding. I would say skip on the ramen because it tasted plain and just does not compete with all the high-quality ramen joints out there.

This is my favorite sushi spot in Lincoln Park. This is our go to sushi restaurant on most weekends.
The sushi is always fresh. They have lots of different rolls to choose from. I've also had the ramen and it is delicious. I highly recommend checking this place out.

we ordered the tuna tartar tower to start with. we loved the presentation, the tower is made with layers of avocado, tuna tartare, and salsa sauce, feels a bit fusion, but it tasted good, very flavorful. The chips that come with is oily, but tastes good

we ordered the 911 salmon roll as we were curious to see what this 911 sauce is, but it is pretty much just like sriracha sauce

the house special roll and the ninja turtle roll is nothing special, ingredients are fresh, flavor is nothing exceptional

the ramen is such small portion, but we loved the broth!! and i love how they have a lot of different veggie in it, healthy!

we ordered 1 appetizer, 3 rolls and 2 ramens to split among the 4 of us...but it was not nearly enough...if it weren't for the small portion, i would give this place a 4 star
This place has the best sushi I've had in the city! Great food and even better customer service! Will be coming here often!

Nice cute little tiny spot!! The service is fast and very very welcoming! 

The food is good although I feel that you can find better ramen and better sushi in Chicago but  overall it is a nice spot if you want a quiet environment and no loud music.

I found interesting that they had this 10$ ramen "appetizers" which are way larger than an appetizer size. 

The plating is really cute. The portions overall are not very big, they are quite small actually but they are nicely plated and the fish tastes good! 

The drinks list is perhaps the worst thing. I tried a white wine which was really bad... I felt it was a cheap 5$ store wine... and I still paid a glass 9$. I think that for the caliber of this restaurant it would be better if it was BYOB. 

Overall, a good experience and I will definitely go back if I am in the neighborhood!

Really don't want to share this place with anyone, but it's our new favorite sushi spot in Chicago!! We ordered 3 rolls, ended up loving them all so we ordered a 4th and each was better than the last. Service made us feel like we were regulars even though it was our first time. Prices are pretty standard for a premium sushi restaurant. This place is tiny so make sure to make a reso but you won't regret it!!

Pretty amazing, very small place. The sushi is so delicious and they have a big selection of Sake. The people here are very nice. 
Definitely recommend it! The atmosphere is so pleasant!

Delicious! I stopover multiples times and this quaint little Japanese/Korean restaurant is as good as it gets and I love it more every time. 
First, I'd recommend the tuna tartar tower, Jalapeño spicy tuna cheese, and the Kameya BBQ pork buns (they're a must!) for appetizers. Then, for the entrees the hot stone bibimbop and Kameya Ramen (both served either veggie, pork, beef, or chicken) are the most popularly sought after (and in agreement they are my favorite); however, only promoted on Tuesdays, Wednesdays, Thrusdays, and Sundays (but there are no restrictions on delivery). 
Regardless of any flaws one might find, I find this restaurants to be one of my all time favorite places and one of the most recommended restaurants.

Re-rated: Kameya is a stellar neighborhood spot that dishes up amazing food.

The only reason I gave this place four stars before was because of the long wait and prices, but I went again and saw things slightly different. First, there was no wait on a Saturday. Perfect service with complementary dessert. Second, the prices weren't quite so bad when my girlfriend doesn't get the $20 app.

Seriously good eats and great service!

Best sushi in Lincoln Park. Intimate atmosphere offering unique/flavorful rolls. Dynamite, 911 tuna, and fiesta rolls are top choices as well as out of this world. Hand prepared with fresh ingredients. Sarah and John run this hidden gem that any sushi fan cannot pass up. Great hosts, wonderful owners, and a top chef.

I love this quiet little establishment tucked in the corner of Lincoln Park.  The decor is very minimal and inviting.  The service is friendly and warm, by a local family that lives in the neighborhood.  I've gone to Kameya 5 times now and totally love it! 

For starters, definitely try the Kameya balls.  They're these lightly sautéed cheese balls filled with cream cheese (check the picture). They're soooo amazing.  Definitely try the Tuna Tartare Tower.  The bread sticks and the sauce it's served with is absolutely fantastic~ I always ask for an additional side of the sauce to mix into my ramen.  


Everytime I've eaten here it's to get ramen.  The seafood ramen is to die for, it's $17 bucks and literally worth every penny.  It's jam packed with clams, oysters, plenty of shrimp and even a generous cut of some very tender salmon.  

Some key notes:
**If you're going on a weekend, definitely make reservations.
**Kameya ramen is miso based, which makes it light by nature.
**definitely get a side of the sauce that comes with the tuna tartare tower with your meal!

Kameya is a cozy little sushi restaurant right off of Oz Park. The sushi was super fresh and flavorful and portions were decent. I had to try the Tuna Tower based off other recommendations, and it was definitely a great dish to split for two. The tuna + avocado tasted great, and my favorite part was actually the soft lightly fried tortilla strips. 

We went on a Saturday at 6 and called for a reservation. I would definitely call ahead since there are only about 6-7 tables. The spot definitely seemed family owned and the two servers seemed to be Korean moms, whom were very nice. 

The prices are a little high, but typical for Lincoln Park. I will definitely be back for fresh flavorful sushi!

NOTE: They are NO longer BYOB

This place is hands down so fresh and so clean. 
All you need to know is...

A. Be friendly and ask questions and they will tell you directly what to do. 
B. Be ready to taste the most fresh and buttery fish.
C. Enjoy a cute neighborhood atmosphere with great surroundings and people. 
D. If you know your wines - KILLER wine pairings. 

The menu is huge in a great way. Caters to diverse taste. The service is warm and family - like. They want to give you good food so eat it! 

Thanks Sarah (our server) and kameya for an amazing date night. We will be back soon!

My friends and I were looking for a restaurant to grab some dinner one night and we came upon Kameya.  It states that they are a Japanese and Korean fusion restaurant, but it's more like they offer Japanese and Korean food (nothing fusion between the two cuisines).  The restaurant is extremely small with only about 6 tables, so I would highly recommend making a reservation.

For food, we decided to order a bunch of different items to share:

Tuna-Tar Tar Tower: spicy tuna, masago, and avocado served with flour chips and sweet chichim sauce.  This was one of the best tuna tartare I have eaten in a while.  It had the right amount of spiciness, but what put it over the top were the homemade flour chips.  The chips were light and airy, but still really crispy.

Gyoza - Japanese style pork and vegetable dumpling.  These dumplings were small, but still full of flavor.  The exterior of the dumplings were fried perfectly to give it a slight crisp, but the interior was still soft and chewy. 

Kameya Ramen - bbq pork and vegetables with Japanese style noodles.  If you are looking for authentic Japanese ramen, this is not the dish for you.  Japanese ramen is usually hearty and full of flavor; this ramen was light and "healthy" tasting.  This is not saying this was a bad dish.  I appreciated this ramen for what it was: light taste, lean pork, and not so oily broth.

Beef Bibimbob - beef, rice and vegetables with hmaya soy dressing and spicy sauce.  The flavors of this dish worked really well with each other, but I thought the rice was a tad bit mushy for my liking.  Especially after I put the sauce on, I felt like I was eating wet rice which in my culture is a huge no no.

We ordered three different makis to share: orange moon (unagi, tempera, avocado, and cucumber topped with salmon, green tobiko, wasabi mayo, and unagi sauce), salmon avocado (salmon, cucumber, avocado, and mayo topped with masago), and Godzilla (cream cheese, unagi, shrimp, cucumber, and avocado with tuna, wasabi mayo, and unagi sauce on top).  These were probably one of the worst rolls I have ever eaten.  Yes, even worse than buffet style makis.  The fish in each roll were extremely salty that it overpowered the whole roll.  What were they trying to mask with the heavy hand of salt?  Maybe the fish wasn't fresh.

Overall, the food was split.  We enjoyed the appetizers and the ramen, but everything else was a huge disappointment.  The service wasn't extremely on par either.  They were nice, but not really attentive.  I don't really recommend you to come here unless you want to only snack on appetizers and have mediocre service.  Also, since the place is so small, everything felt cramp and you can hear conversations from other tables.

I've been to this place several times and it keeps on impressing me. The sushi is phenomenal and fresh. The ramen is really tasty with great broth. Given the number of sushi establishments in the area, to be a standout in the crowd is tough but Kameya stands out every time. On top of the great food, the service is quick and attentive. One of those places where you water glass is never half empty before it is topped off.

Great service~ prompt, friendly, polite. 

Really cute, tiiiiiny restaurant in a great location. 

Sushi was weirdly sweet~ even the ones that were supposed to be spicy. It was exactly what three stars means, A-OK; not bad, but will probably look elsewhere for sushi.

Ooooof Kameya. Since my first visit, I've had many opportunities to revisit their food, and... I actually have no idea why it's always packed. They are no longer BYOB, too!

That tuna tartare tower is still my favorite thing here. And really delicious each time.

But this is probably the worst bibimbop I've had in Chicago... and for like 2x the price of literally every other Korean place around town. Normally, bibimbop has a variety of vegetables, each seasoned and maybe cooked to create a harmony of flavors and textures when everything is mixed together. At Kameya, none of their vegetables have flavor, and their proteins are always dry. Maybe you're supposed to drown it in sauce.

Their sushi is pretty fresh. The rolls are really tiny. I have gotten the bulgogi a few times since then too, and it's the same problems every time (see previous review). At last they're consistent.

Friends of LP, I swear there's better Korean/Japanese food in this city :(
16.95 for Ramen? 19.95 for bibimbap? No thank you. Nice atmosphere but these prices are unrealistic. I really hope people are aware they are getting ripped off.

I really wanted to like this place... My first time here was with my husband and couple of friends. We had a great time there. Service was great and everything we ordered were so good. No disappointment at all. 

Second time I called for to go and wanted to bring it over to my cousin's house. I ordered a beef ramen, pork ramen, bibimbap, cheesy balls, and 4 different rolls. With traffic going back, it took me about 30 mins to sit down and enjoy the meal. 

Unlike other ramen that I picked up from other restaurants before, kameya putted the broth and the noodle in the same container, when I got home, it was all saggy and mushy.... Just doesn't look nor taste good at all. 

Then comes to the bibimbap, it was so salty... And I don't think it's that authentic... For $17 I don't think it's worth it at all... I'll rather go to Korean restaurant for better and cheaper bibimbap.  

Didn't have too much expectation on the cheesy balls since its fried and they put them in an air tight container, so they all got mushy and soft after I opened the box. Maybe they should consider changing the way they pack their to go food. 

Then the rolls... They were so sweet... The orange moon and dynamite were the same rolls I ordered during my first visit. But this time they were just gross, so much sauce on the bottom. In fact, I think those were some of the worst sushi rolls I tried in many years. 

Finally.... Sanitation... After eating that meal, my cousin, my sis and I all ended up having upset stomach and ended up going to the bathroom all night. 

I still give it two stars, just cuz I liked it so much during my first visit. Maybe they are only good for dine in. I'll never order to go from this again.
I have been there several times and I love it. The sushi are out of this world and the service is always very nice.

We came here because it has 4.5 star on Yelp, but we were extremely disappointed.
First, this place is extremely small! There are only 5-6 tables and You will basically sit back to back to people at the other table. Kinda suffocating. 
Second, the food was just ok. We had tuna tartar for appetizer. The tuna didn't taste fresh and the chips coming with it were extremely oily. The sushimi pieces didn't taste that fresh either and lacks variety. The red dragon roll was just an average...
Third, the waitress was not friendly at all. There was a misunderstanding during ordering. So we didn't get the dish we wanted at first. That was ok, but the waitress's face turned really angry and  sounded blaming. That doesn't feel good. to be fair, the chef was friendly and redid our dish. However we would have felt more appreciated as customer if the waitress could responded in a more peaceful and friendly way at first.

If you are heading here, plan to bring your wallet, or two wallets.  Yikes!    I walked in here on an impromptu date with my future wife and I was in total sticker shock with the sushi prices.   $14-$17 for 8 piece roll?  Seriously?   No thanks.    

I begrudgingly went ahead with the dinner and I was seriously not impressed at all with the quality or quantity of these $15 rolls.  If you are going to charge $5-$6 more per roll than other places, the fish better be darn good.  Welp, Yelp, it wasn't.  I've had the opportunity to enjoy sushi all over the world, and the fish here at Kameya is on par with the Walgreees on Michigan Ave.  The rolls weren't even that special - sort of the same old humdrum stuff you see all over the place.  Don't tell me a damn shrimp tempura roll should cost you $16 - that's just ridiculous.  Rolls are not special - I can't even understand how they justify the prices considering how small they were, they were so tiny!.  

I didn't try any of the other food options, just the sushi.  Dont come here for sushi, else save your pennies. I'm honestly shocked by all the GREAT reviews of this place.  I was expecting to be blown away, but I came up limp.   I won't be back, that's for sure.   

PS. The people working here at just so sweet that I hate to write this review.  The service was great and so nice.

This place is amazing (aside from the interiors/seating) strictly service and food. We spaced our food out, ordering one item at a time and everything came out perfect and quickly. We started with oysters paired with sake. Then the tuna tower, it was amazing and this is coming from someone who has tuna tar tar almost everywhere it's offered. We had hirofish in ponzui sauce, the fish was excellent! next was the spicy tuna salad. It has a great kick with amazing flavor and we paired that with pinot grigio. We also tried bulgogi whichj did not disappoint. The server and busser where nice, efficient and attentive. They overheard us discussing the cheese balls and gave us each one for free. By the time we were done we were so full and had to pass on their famous house made ice cream....They brought it anyway, FOR FREE!
I would suggest this place to anyone with a pallet for seafood and/or spicy flavors, or willing to think outside the box.

By far one of the best sushi restaurants I have ever been to. Spectacular service and food. Recommend the tuna tower and the almond ice cream. Made another reservation for the following day before the check even came.

Went here for dinner tonight, and it was an excellent choice!  My friend and I tried the Bibimbap because the sign listed it as a top 25 must-try from Huffington Post, and it was superb.  I had mine with brown rice and tofu, and the sunny-side up egg on top made the dish even more delicious.  The serving size was plentiful.  The dish was $18 but worth it, in my opinion.  The restaurant is a little small and can only seat maybe 30 people total, so it's cozy but still a fun atmosphere.  The serving staff was also friendly.  I'd recommend this restaurant to friends.

I'm hesitant to write an honest review, because this gem deserves to have patrons lining up outside for its yummy treats. And I selfishly don't want to have crowds at our beloved hole-in-the-wall. That said, there are probably only 16 seats in the place, so make a reservation on peak-days. 

There are very few restaurants that create unique dishes that earn a spot on my cravings hitlist--the Tuna Tower is one of them. When the hankering comes it must be satiated. We've never been disappointed with the rolls, and the bibimbop is tops!

Only a family-owned business is with this level of hospitality and care. After only a couple of visits, we were recognized and treated with a new saki on the menu. They have been known to giggle when I inevitably hit my head on one of the paper lamps, like old neighbors. I forgive them :)

Simply put, the dishes at Kameya are fantastic, and Ive never been disappointed  by the food or service. The family run restaurant offers a friendly environment with experienced workers to create an excellent dining experience.
