Admittedly, I have never been one for fusion style dishes, but the owner/head chef (John) has created a menu that offers a pleasing blend of dishes allowing each ingredient to serve its purpose. All of his ingredients are of high-quality, and the dishes are always presented with a clean and graceful arrangement.

Recommendations:

Chicken Ramen with garlic sauce
Tuna Tar Tar Tower
BBQ Pork Belly
911 Salmon Roll
House Kameya Roll.

We ordered beef ramen. It's not on the menu but they still make it. It's only appetizer portion so everything looks squeezed, but it's actually quite delicious. Although $10 for that small portion is a little bit expensive

This place is INCREDIBLE! Food is great but the service is even better. The owner Sarah is the most hospitable, humble and gracious restaurant owners I've ever met. It's like having a meal with your family. Give this place a shot and it may turn into your favorite place to eat in Chicago!

I just moved into the area and was in search of my new go-to sushi spot. Stumbled upon Kameya and so glad I did! The fish is really fresh and the rice is always cooked perfectly. The waitstaff is super friendly and sometimes give you a free bowl of their homemade almond ice cream.  They always carry interesting specials so be sure to check out the board. I had the veggie ramen which was good but I think that I need to go back and try one that is made in a meat broth, instead.  I'd recommend the Shrimp Shumae and the Orange Moon roll.

We came here on a snowy 15F Valentine's Day because Yelp recommended it for Ramen (Ramen to the Rescue 2/10/2016 Weekly Yelp) but they had no ramen for dinner (only Saturday lunch) but they could make you ramen to go (??!! How weird...) But we decided to stay and try since it has 4.5 star reviews on Yelp.

Miso soup was OK. We got Galbi for appetizer, it was well seasoned but under cooked so it tasted really fatty and meat sticking to the bone. The sauce for Kameya Cheese Balls was good but the batter had no flavor. We also got the Salmon Paradais, which came with too much spicy mayo. The worst was the Spicy Salmon salad, which came last (?!). The lettuce looked like it came out of a bag, and the salmon tasted really fishy even with all the spicy mayo on it and made me feel like throwing up. We didn't eat the rest of the dish.

Maybe we came on a bad day. What's saving me from giving a one star is that the people working there were very nice. The lady took the salmon salad off our bill after we said we didn't like it, but sorry I don't think I'm going back.
This place is no longer BYOB, but you can bring your dog for the sidewalk seating.  That is all.

Tuna tartare tower= amazing
Kameya ramen= fantastic
Beef ramen= mk
Service and ambience= delightful

:)

I originally came here because I was craving ramen but once I got there saw all the amazing sushi rolls. Our party of 5 really enjoyed the following: app; tuna tartare rolls; Ninja Turtle, Lava Roll, Red Moon Roll.
We were so full by the end we passed on dessert but after we paid the check they brought out to us homemade almond and coffee ice cream. 

Great service & food!

I can here for a super early dinner bc I had a flight to catch.  Came here with my friend straight from the aquarium - each carrying a stuffed penguin. 

That being said, everyone that worked here was extremely sweet and courteous. They even let use place one of the stuffed animals in an empty seat/ table. Service was great, efficient and non-intrusive.

Food was 4/5. The pork bun appetizers were delicious. The food looked too good to be eaten. The Kameya ramen was very good. We got the American deluxe sushi which was okay - not at the top of my list of sushi but nothing to complain about.

All in all, a very positive experience here. If I'm back in Chicago, I would def visit this cute little place again.

This place is great. It feels like a mom and pop sushi place. The service is excellent and the rolls are always fresh. I was surprised with how quickly we got out food. 

 It is a cozy place so it is better for dates instead of group dinners. I would recommend calling ahead for recommendation so you do not have to wait. I called ahead the same day on a Saturday. I love the california crunch rolls, spicy tuna, and tempura rolls.

I like to start every review at an even 3 stars and work from there.  Here it goes:

- The ramen was very good.  With that said, I have never had real ramen (of the NOT Top variety) before, so I have no frame of reference how good it actually was.  But it wasn't bad.  +0 stars.

- The ambiance was lovely and the lighting was romantic.  +1 star.

- My mom came to dinner late and inconvenienced everyone.  It was somewhat annoying.  -1 star.

- The rolls and edamame we had for appetizers were delicious and satisfying. +1 star.

- When we were fighting with politeness over who was going to pay the bill, the waitress was confused and didn't know what to do.  -1 star.

- There is a possibility that I may end up marrying said waitress at some point in the future.  In order to avoid future tension, and let her know how much I love her, +1 star.

TOTAL STAR COUNT:  4 Stars out of 4

Food:
Pork belly buns- moist bun, super tender and grilled meat and sweet sauce. Korean pickles adds a refreshing and tangy flavour, great idea. Verdict: would order again

Kameya ramen - soy, miso broth not too salty and overwhelming, same pork belly as the buns I think but just as good. Bamboo shoots were surprisingly soft. Only drawback was the hardboiled egg (-1 star) not up to the traditional ramen standard (the egg was just a typical hardboiled one). Noodles tasted standard but good. 

Homemade almond ice cream - definitely had a unique taste not found in store bought kinds, good balance of sweetness and creaminess. Change flavours daily! 

Service: exceeded expectations, friendly, made conversation with us as we waited for the food. Allowed the buns (normally a dish of 2) to be modified to 3 so we all got one. Regularly checked in to see if the food was okay. Offered complimentary Kim chi. 

Environment: very intimate and perfect for a date with Christmas lights on a dark ceiling (so perfect for 3 guys Lol). Small place though! Probably only fits about 15 people comfortably. 

Verdict: if you tried Wasabi already and want something new and a different kind of good, have a visit. Slightly on the pricier side but I believe it was worth it (20$ before tip) 

Note : no longer byob

My boyfriend and I came in tonight for date night. The place is small, dark and yet very intimate and cozy. We sat by the window, which had a nice view. We got a few smaller things and shared. I got the pork ramen and he got the beef ramen. It was pretty good, but a little bland for my taste and the pork in mine was a little dry. We also got the pork buns, which were super yummy!! And we split the salmon nigiri, and the spicy tuna roll. The sushi was delicious, and fresh. That was a perfect sound of food for two people since the ramen bowl was half the size of regular restaurants since it was an appetizer portion. The service was great! Our server was very friendly and smiled the whole time, and Ina strange way she just genuinely seemed happy. It's a cute little place, perfect for date night.

Oh and FYI.. IT IS NOT BYOB anymore!!

I was there by myself and wanted to try their ramen due to such good reviews. Coz of the wait i just told the lady that I might consider takeout but if theres a table coming out soon, i would sit down. Shortly a tables became available and meantime 2 customers walked in, the lady didnt ask me if i wanted to sit and just instead sat the two. I didnt feel that upset and asked her to do my to go order. And the ramen came out very standard, no matter the soup base or chashu pork. So, guess it was overrated.

This restaurant is definitely a five-star restaurant. The service was impeccable and the entire staff is nothing but friendly. The Kameya Ramen is to die for and is definitely a dish you have to try. The kalbi was cooked perfectly and highly recommended. I've ordered the Lava Roll and the Dynamite Roll and both were excellent. Honestly, you can't go wrong with ordering from this restaurant. It's perfect for a date night whether you are craving Japanese or Korean cuisine. I will definitely be back to try more dishes!

We tried three different rolls from here and they were all delicious in their own way! We had the dynamite roll, the fiesta roll, and the 911 Tuna roll. Each roll was unique and we had an amazing date night. The service was quick and friendly. Sarah was our waitress and she was wonderful and brought us everything we needed to enjoy our dinner. It's also open late which is nice!

I have tried out this restaurant before 2 years ago and it was very awesome. I have just tried this place again recently and I ordered galbi, nigiri, and miso soup. The food was amazing and very delicious. The waitress was very friendly. The next time I visit Chicago, I will come here again.

This place has really good ramen, and thats the main reason I go here. Only thing is there is no more entree size ramen, and for the prices of this place I wouldn't normally eat here. Bring the entree ramen back.

There tuna tartar was a bomb !!!!!  Spicy sesame dressing was so great. We had bibimbop and kameya ramen.  Just to be aware that their portion is pretty big.  Yes this place is small but not packed all the time.

I came here for my birthday, and the chef was nice enough to give my table a free order of the 911 roll... Which was fantastic!

I ordered the BBQ pork Ramen which was $15. The ramen was pretty good, not great, but it was good. This place should definitely be remembered for its sushi...

The sushi here is some of the best I have ever had... Every sushi order had a VERY pleasant surprise and left us craving more. 

All in all, I'll definitely come back here, but pretty much only for the sushi. The ramen was pretty good, but for $15 a bowl there are better places. Kameya SUSHI!!!

I have been to Japan twice, both times eating my way through the country from end to end and this restaurant is a phenomenal representation of casual Japanese cuisine and hospitality. From the server who remembered us after only one previous visit to the fresher than fresh sushi and perfectly-prepared succulent ramen, this is a little slice of Japan heaven right here in Lincoln Park.

The wife and I stopped in last night for an impromptu date night. We'd checked for the best sushi joints on Yelp, and this one was closest.

It's a great find!

Kameya is such a charming little neighborhood joint. It's very small--only 6 or so tables--and is really better for couples than groups. Though, a group of 6 came in while we were there--without a reservation--and the hostess happily arranged tables so that they could be comfortable.

The atmosphere is almost--dare I say--romantic? Not usual for a sushi joint!

The service and food were great. The miso soup was really fresh and flavorful--didn't taste like the run-of-the-mill stuff you'd expect at every Japanese restaurant.

We got a few rolls and some nigiri. All was fresh and delicious. I want to try the ramen next, as it sounded very good.

The only reason I'm giving a 4 instead of a 5 is because I wish there was a little more variety on the menu. They had 12-15 rolls, but they almost all had salmon, tuna, shrimp, or crab. I would've liked to have seen some other fish options, but maybe that'll come later.

Oh! And this was the cheapest sushi dinner we've had in the city. Came in under $50 for 3 rolls, 4 pieces of nigiri, 2 miso soups, and an edamame. Not bad for the city.

Definitely would recommend this spot, especially if you're in the area.
My go to place in Lincoln park. I love the food and the service. It's a small place, cozy. Roman is good. Sushi is great and okay priced. Top small neighborhood place.

This place is really cute small spot. Very happy to have stumbled across it. Their nigiri was top notch - delicious, flavorful sushi rice; big cuts of fish; and all very fresh tasting. The chefs were so quick and efficient and even gave us a few free tastes. Loved the tuna tartar too. Couldn't get enough of the sauce that comes with it. Can't wait to come back here and try the Korean food too.
Really good, fresh sushi.  Just wish they had some more interesting maki options.  And this place is SUPER small.  Like, 6 tables small.  Great thing is that they take reservations.
Cute tiny little Korean-owned sushi fusion place. Friendly. Many types of toro on menu, which I love. 2 piece toro was huge portion but unremarkable and 15 bucks!

Excellent value for $$ (6 soup noodles, 11 rolls below $10).  The only place in the neighborhood for decent noodles.

Beef Ramen -- plentiful of add-ins (see photo).  Thumbs up for thicker slice of fish cake.  Beef needs to be consume with noodles and broth for maximum flavor.  Serves 2.

Service is pleasant with a neighborhood vibe (especially when noodle bowls are returned from next door).  Delivery service available.

BYOB

I wish Kameya doesn't close between lunch and dinner service.

Will be back for more noodle tasting.  One down, 5 more to go.

Amazing food as always at this little hidden gem! Whether you feel like soup or sushi, the quality is far better than most sushi places.  Love the cozy feel and always warm service from the chefs and staff. Looking forward to next time! Thank you!

The ramen was delicious. They asked if I wanted it spicy, which I did want but I'm glad they asked because I know for many people the amount of spice would have been too much if not warned. I'm vegetarian and the ramen came with lots of veggies which I really enjoy. Unfortunately, I did specifically ask for an egg, which for some reason wasn't brought with my ramen. I'm willing to overlook this though becaue the staff was so friendly and even stayed open for us when we came 15 minutes before closing time. The restaurant isn't very large but it's cute. Great for a casual date or an outing with friends. Food was prepared quickly, although that could have been because we were the only ones in the restaurant and the staff likely wanted to go home. Although honestly they didn't act like it, they seemed happy to have us. The restaurant is nearby and I'm likely to go again if I need ramen especially after 10 PM when other ramen restaurants are closed.

I'm not exactly sure why people rave about the ramen here. The sushi was good, but the ramen was...mediocre at best. I went here last night with my boyfriend and I was excited because I had heard that this place was really good. We split the dynamite roll and each ordered the Kameya ramen. We also ordered a bottle of Malbec wine. The sushi was actually pretty good and you could really taste the shrimp and crab that was in it. The wine was also pretty good and I felt like it was a decent price ($32 for a bottle). The ramen though...I don't know. It tasted smoky, but really plain. The broth was bland, and the veggies didn't add much flavor either. The pork wasn't bad, but not great either. The egg was good though and it was cooked perfectly. Other than that, the ramen was neither delicious or memorable.

The service was really good though and they were very kind.

Overall, I don't think I'd come back for the ramen, but I'd like to come back to try the buns and I'd come back again for the sushi.

Kameya is a cute tiny restaurant tuck away in Lincoln Park, and on my try list for after seeing a review for their ramen.

The restaurant is really small, almost claustrophobic, if that's not your thing then don't go! However, if you do decide to try it. The restaurant has a variety of sushi and sashimi choices which while I didn't try any, my friend said it was yummy.

The ramen was definitely only mediocre. The broth was a simple clear broth, not the usual creamy tonkotsu I prefer. There were a lot of noodles. The pork belly was smokey, but not flavored completely. Definitely a light-er tasting ramen. I don't think I would come all the way to Lincoln Park for it ever again, but if I were in the neighborhood, it's a great place on a cold night.

I love this place. The owners Sarah and John are lovely. This is a family operation and they get to know you and your family. Daily specials are presented beautifully. Primarily Japanese but with a few Korean dishes thrown in. Fantastic ramen and bi bum bop. Tuna tower and fresh nigiri specials are great. Price point very reasonable. And service is lightening fast. Lots of little touches- Dishes and glasses come out cold. They have a few outdoor tables. Saw Grant Atchaz there the other day- I read that this is a favorite place chefs like to go on their day off. Highly recommend.

Holy $&@% this ramen was amazing.

I stopped in to grab a quick dinner while waiting for an alderman debate to start across the street and was incredibly pleased.  Was about to get the pork belly ramen but asked the waitress what the most popular item was, and she said the beef ramen.  The beef was incredibly tender and flavorful and once the ramen was gone I played "find the beef" until I'd extracted every single scrap left.  

So delicious it completely offset the shame of eating dinner alone on a Tuesday :-/

OM NOM NOM, such yummy sushi! I placed an order to go last night for my family and couldn't have been happier. Kameya is a great, tiny little sushi place. On busy nights, I can definitely see myself just getting something to go because the space only holds about 7-8 tables. Our order was done super quickly and the portion sizes were very reasonable. 

We ordered the 911 shrimp roll, the mango martini roll, the red moon roll, gyoza, and some of the best miso soup I've ever had. We only ordered one soup for my sister and I was PISSED i missed out on one for myself. Won't make that same mistake and neither should you. Gyoza was also perfect and I'd order it again. 

I loved the 911 shrimp but that shit is hot. I love spicy so that's fine, but it was hot even without wasabi. The red moon roll was good, but I don't think I'd order it again. The mango martini is sweet, but in a good way. A different take on sushi than I've had but I appreciated the creativity. I saw a bunch of people with the tuna tartar special and it looked amazing. If I'd know about it ahead of time, I'd have gotten one of those too.
Love this sushi spot !!! My husband and I go here often and they never disappoint! Highly recommended

Came here on a cold day for ramen and was at first very bummed out that there were none on the menu. Went for some sushi instead and got to say it was absolutely delicious. Very, very good sushi. One or two pieces may have been a bit heavy on the wasabi, but otherwise fantastic. Service was great too.

Fantastic food. The owners are wonderful, kind, and attentive. There is a great mix of Korean and Japanese food on the menu. I had a fantastic fatty tuna platter and a great bowl of ramen. The atmosphere is upscale and the prices are very affordable for the quality of the food. I will definitely come back!

The food was amazing. Really hot and tasty seafood ramen noodles and great sushi. That said the owner/waiter  could use more training. 

In all fairness, It was a busy night, we had reservations but we still had to wait for about 20 minutes for a table for 2. It took a bit for the food to come but as I said before it was delicious. 

The owner clearly needed the table and tried to take the food from us before we were done, twice. That's the reason for the 3 star rating. Bottom line, great food bad service.

I've never raved about food on Yelp before, but today, Kameya gave me a reason to. Hands down BEST ramen I have EVER had. Oh myyy goodness. My friend and I got the Kameya Ramen and Beef Ramen, and they were both so delicious. The bbq pork in the Kameya Ramen was so creamy and buttery and the bulgogi in the beef ramen was so flavorful and tender. The soup was simply the best broth and was so flavorful, but not salty. It is around $15 for each bowl, and IT IS WORTH EVERY PENNY because of its extremely high-quality and generous portion (the bowl is seriously huge). They also have a wide selection of other foods including special rolls, but we weren't able to try them. If you eat here, you must try the ramen!!

Wow! The food and service were both incredible. Ramen - delicious. Gyoza - crispy and flavorful. Sushi - fresh and creative. Tuna tartare tower - well, it's a tower of tuna tartare, yum. Plum wine - some kind of almondy explosion inside your face. Homemade complimentary almond ice cream dessert - amazing pairing with the wine and such a friendly touch. There are about six tables with little wobbly chairs, I'm a big boy and felt like a bull in a china shop but other than that a top notch experience. We will definitely go back.

Just finished a fantastic sushi experience here. We had the udon noodles, white ocean roll, and orange roll. Everything was delicious, fresh, and very unique. 

The restaurant is very small, so make sure to go at an off day/time. They are also BYOB so we picked up a bottle of wine from down the street.

I was in the mood for ramen, so my husband and I came here for dinner while we were in town. This place wasn't far from our hotel and we like neighborhoody restaurants. After reading all the great reviews, I figured we couldn't go wrong. This place is cozy and small and had a nice vibe.

I got the Kameya Ramen and my husband ordered the Nabeyaki Udon. We both loved our soups. The pork in my ramen was perfect. It really hit the spot. On the menu, I noticed that my husband's udon was supposed to have chicken in it, but when it came out, it had tofu in it instead. I told him he should complain, but fortunately, he really likes tofu a lot. I think it's a misprint in the menu. They should fix that. I really wanted to say something, but my husband told me not to say anything because he was happy with his soup.

For dessert, we got almond and mango ice cream. They were both excellent, but I thought the almond was better. They were so so good!

I would definitely come back again the next time I'm in Chicago. I want to try some sushi rolls and other dishes on their menu. Everything sounded good.

Such a fan of this place. My boyfriend and I come here often. The pork buns are one of my favorite things to eat in Chicago. The ramen is also wonderful and we like the white ocean roll and the lava roll. 

Also, the service is fantastic. So fast and friendly. It's a tiny place so I really enjoy the atmosphere as well.

It's a tiny restaurant and it's easy to miss if you don't know what you're looking for. There are probably only ten seats so plan accordingly. 

Tempura shrimp appetizer (2/5) - batter was not as crunchy as I like, a little oily, but the shrimp was good. The dipping sauce was a little watery and could have been more bold. 

Pork bbq ramen (~$11 & 3/5) - really good broth, not too salty. Noodles and veggies had a good flavor and consistency. It's a pretty big portion. I'm still not on the ramen bandwagon though. I might be over trying to figure out what all the hype is about. 

Bulgogi (~$13 & 5/5) - yummmmmmmmmm. The flavor explodes in your mouth. All of the veggies are soaked in the sauce but is perfect with a spoonful of rice. Yum yum yum.

A little pricy. I'd come back for the bulgogi but probably not the ramen. Service is friendly.

I ordered Kameya Ramen and it was astonishing. The reflection of the light on the surface of the soup almost blinded me. Ha just kidding. The presentation of it was great and made me want to start eating even before instagramming it. noodle was perfectly boiled. And it's a mild dish for people who do not enjoy spicy dishes. I am guessing the beef was grilled with some kind of sauce? But it was just delicious. I finished everything including the soup by the end. I also had some rolls along with the ramen. The portion was perfect and the taste kept up with my high expectation of rolls in general. Despite many dishes on the menu, every dish I've had was overall good. The restaurant is cute because of its small size and neatness. I really liked the interior design. I totally recommend this place to go with another person due to its small size. 

P.s. I'm writing this before writing my essay due tomorrow. Yeah, it was that good.

Delish! We went last night and had a great dinner!! My fiancée is hard to impress when it comes to asian food and he loves it!  

Get the tuna tower! It's amazing now I could eat the entire thing (which is large!) by myself!!

The cheese balls are like their take on crab Rangoon and they DO NOT disappoint!!!  There is actual crab in them and so fresh and yummy!!!

The shasimi platter was good but not outstanding. 

Kaymeya ramen was delish!! The pork belly had great flavor and the broth was delish!

911 shrimp tempura roll was great the kaymeya special spicy sauce was yummy!!!!

The only draw back is I wish they were Byob. They don't have a good wine list and I would love to take my own fabulous bottle!!!!

Just in terms of ramen, I think this place is phenomenal. Everything from the texture of the noodles, to the light and clean-tasting but warming broth, to the charred smoky succulent slivers of pork belly is just spot on. It is a bit on the pricier side - about $13 for a bowl - but considering the quality of the dish and the portion size (it'll fill you up for sure) it's well worth the price. I say this cautiously, but this place serves up some of the best ramen I've had.

But ramen is not all. The menu at Kameya boasts a fair selection of other dishes you can choose from. If you couldn't get enough pork belly from the signature ramen, there's always the pork buns - the closest we can get to Momofuku here I guess - which come with a crisp refreshing cucumber salad and a sweet and savory hoisin sauce. Absolutely delicious. 

Then there's the "cheese balls" which I suppose is their take on a crab rangoon, which is rich and sweet but umami at the same time with the creamy interior but crisp casing fried to perfection. But honestly, my favorite part of this dish is the citrus sauce they drizzle over it. I'm still trying to figure out what it is - they simply call it "french sauce" - but it has notes of that honey citron tea you can get from Korean markets. Gotta figure out how to recreate it. 

If I had time to go over all of their menu items I would, but I will just say that I have never ordered anything that didn't taste delicious. My only complaint about this place is that it closes way too early. It would be the perfect place for a late-night ramen run with the GF. We can still hope though. 

 If you are in the area, stop by! A bowl of ramen is always what the doctor ordered.

I was expecting great sushi when we went to Kameya last Saturday, and I was not disappointed. We ordered the beef ramen along with 3 rolls between the two of us: the Dragon roll, the Red Moon, and the Italian Roll.  Everything was delicious and the sushi tasted fresh, but I hesitated to give it a 5 star  review because I wasn't blown away, so to speak. I will go back for sure, and may update my review again after we try some more rolls!! 

One note- I was primarily expecting to be blown away by the dragon roll, as it is usually a favorite of mine, and while it was good, it only had 5 (too large to fit in your mouth whole) pieces- two of which were GINORMOUS fried end pieces stuffed with cream cheese (see photo).  I only bring this up because we tend to go to sushi with another couple of friends, and this odd number (and weird end pieces) makes it tough to share without having to buy two expensive rolls that are the same...

Overall, still some good quality food.

P.s. The place is tiny, so make a reservation!

Came back again and got a few old favorites plus the beef ramen this time. I love ramen but I think the udon here is a much better choice.. For it's authenticity, quality and value. Orange moon roll was also a great alternative to their White Ocean for those that like salmon more than white tuna.

This place is so small and can easily be missed when walking by. Walking in you first notice the chalk boards with lots of colorful writing. Recommendations, specials, and my favorite the Yelp reviews! Our server was very nice and attentive. We went at lunch and they have lunch deal where you can pick a couple different rolls from a lunch menu for only $6!!!! I got the shrimp tempura and a Cali roll. Pretty simple and they were both great! I would highly recommend this place especially for lunch because I'm assuming it can get very busy for dinner.
OMG! You have to order the tuna tartar!!! 5 stars! It's small but warm feeling restaurant! Great place to try!!!

I almost never leave reviews but am leaving one for Kameya because I truly love their food. It's a small, quaint restaurant with spectacular Korean and Japanese food. Their fish is the freshest in town and the sushi rolls are the ones I measure all other sushi places by. The Korean menu is limited but truly exceptional as well. Every time I come by I have to order the vegetable ramen. Other favorites include bulgolgi and bibimbap.

This is a small restaurant but I've never had more than a 10-20 min wait and its a great date spot. They take reservations so just call ahead a bit. Its family owned and the family is super friendly. Hope you enjoy it as much as I do.

This place is SMALL. When I say small I mean 5 tables. 
So this whole place is pretty cramped, and the bathroom does not have heat, so for those who plan on spending a while in the bathroom, be forewarned especially in the bitter Chicago Winter.
Ordered the Kameya ramen, we basically came here because we wanted Ramen. There was a different ramen place we wanted to go to but we were already at the Warby Parker on W Arimitage and this place is only .9 mi away so we deicded to walk here and not lose our good parking spot. 
The ramen was slightly above average, but nothing jaw droppingly special. The broth was not spectacular, which as we all know, the broth is what sets ramen apart. No tempura or fish balls or anything. Just some seaweed, half of an egg and some grilled pork. The ramen was ok, nothing special either. 
The waiter was slightly rude, when we asked to have our check separated, she ask us to put our cards down and she will separate it for us. Which made it kind of hard to do if 1 person were to pay with cash and another with card. 
Bottom line, it's ok if you live closeby and want some sushi or ramne, though ironically everyone who dined at that restaurant during our stay ordered ramen, so I can't testify to how good their sushi is.

Lovely new addition to Lincoln Park. This place has great food and great service in a tiny space. The Ramen and Bibimbob were both delicious and authentic. The big winner of the night was the Tuna Tar Tar Tower (Tuna Tartare). This is the best tuna tartare I have had in Chicago. Really fresh and packed with great flavor. I highly recommend it. 
This is a fairly new dining spot and I hope it sticks around. The owner couldn't be more sweeter. When i spoke what little Korean I know they were very receptive and kind. After our meal, my girlfriend and I hadn't finished our wine and instead of rushing us they gave us a plate of cheese on the house to enjoy while we finished our wine. I will definitely be coming back here.
This place is great. The food is delicious, the service is spot on. The waitress and chef are incredibly nice. Try the 911 and Orange Moon rolls, they are out of this world.

For what it is Kameya gets 5 stars.  I mean first off its BYOB.  & second the food is great & service is fast & friendly.  

Can't wait to go back and try the noodle bowls.

Definitely coming back here. The staff is so personable and the chef aims to please! White ocean roll, dynamite roll, beef and veg ramen all five stars! 
A great intimate setting for any night. Can't wait to try more of their menu!

My boyfriend and I came here when we searched places that served Korean food past 9:30 or so as I was craving it and a lot of places were closed so we chose this one, and I am so glad we did. It is an adorable, small, charming place. The atmosphere and the food are so aesthetically pleasing, the service was friendly, and the food was prepared extremely quickly and tasted amazing. I had bulgogi and it came on a hot plate with a wood holder for it, which is exactly how bulgogi tastes best. It had a lighter taste, not as fermented, so I just felt satisfied and not weighed-down by the food after eating it. My boyfriend had the crunch roll and loved it, especially the price of it. I'll be back here often!

I came Kameya for the noodles, but it was the sushi that left me wanting more!  The restaurant only has a handful of tables, so we were lucky to get one on a Saturday night.  We started the meal with spicy tuna and salmon avocado rolls as appetizer, and it was super fresh and tasty.  For my meal, I went with the nabeyaki udon, and my boyfriend had the beef ramen.  Both were excellent with complex flavors, but I preferred the udon because the ramen broth was over-salted.  I've been looking forward to return for more sushi, but the location is busy so parking can be tough.  Great date place, but the limited seating makes it tricky for groups.

Went here last night with a friend. It was previously another restaurant but was completely remodeled and is across from the Athenian Room on Webster. It is really nice inside but very small, like maybe 12-14 seats so I expect it fills up quick on a weekend. Since it is so small, it no good for large groups or kids.

We had tempura shrimp and the their version of pot stickers, both were excellent and the shrimp very large. We had three rolls which ranged from 6 pieces to 10. All were excellent and reasonably priced. Definitely will come back.

This is BYOB so let loose!

Actually chose this place after checking out its Yelp reviews while looking for Ramen near-ish to Edgewater. Wowza. 

Went with a girl friend to this tiny Lincoln Park gem on a rainy evening. We each got delicious ramen - me pork, her chicken - and split two signature rolls (don't remember which ones, exactly, I want to say Lava and Dragon, but they were amazing).

Service was attentive and friendly. Food was quick and beautifully prepared (and the ramen not as expensive as it lists on Chicago Menu Pages, which was a pleasant surprise).

Overall, most definitely worth a visit!
Great food, great experience. Ate here several times, would recommend the tuna tartar tower.

Excellent little sushi and ramen spot.  I have been to Kameya several times since I discovered it (thanks to yelp!) back in January! The owners are so nice and the food is really good. I love ramen and sushi, so when I found a spot that does both (and does them well) I was so excited.

I am a big fan of the nabekayi udon. I had never had such a good udon soup before trying this! I have wanted to try the ramens they offer but have continued to order the nabeyaki udon because it is so good!!! My other two favorite items- the lava roll and the dynamite roll. Amazing.  Definitely a hidden gem.
their food is way over priced. if you want to pay $17 for a 5 pieces roll that falls apart, go for it. otherwise, this place is a total ripoff. food quality doesnt justify the price at all.

I ordered the vegetable ramen for pick up. The food was ready within 20 minutes and the hostess was helpful when I went to pick it up. The ramen came in a 64 oz. to go container which explains the hefty price of almost $18. I had to add hot sauce to cover the bland flavor but otherwise I would order the ramen again. The only bummer is the expensive price and large quantity. I would rather pay less for a smaller portion.
came here w/ some friends to celebrate a birthday. the food and service was great. esp luv their tuna tartar tower. would luv to come back here again n would def recommend to a friend.

Came here for lunch yesterday. 1. I had no idea that this place existed 2. Woah! What a hidden gem 3. Good food. Good prices 

The service was meh but I was pretty impressed with the quality of food. I got matzo ball soup and it was really good. Tasted like home and not salty at all! I also got the blt club- super fresh, the turkey looked and tasted like real turkey vs cold cut and the bacon was not greasy at all. My brother got a soup as well and a gyro plate. Although the pieces were cut a bit too thick for his liking it was really good and not greasy either. I will for sure be back here for a weekday lunch

Good local diner with offering real value.

Late breakfast and lunch diner located in the loop. Located inside the Pittsfield Building (and not from the street), so look for the signage.

I had the Gyro Skillet. Excellent. TVs to watch the payoff games. Good service. Good iced tea.

$17 dollars later including a $3 tip this review follows.

Location: great place to start your day in Chicago if you are visiting- literally a block away from Millennium Park!  The building is cool.  No windows to look outside but that didn't bother us.
Service:  it was great, 10 minute wait to be seated and that is on a Saturday morning.   Prompt wait staff and friendly.
Food: good diner food- hit the spot!  My son had the French toast and I had the eggs Benedict.  Wish I would have ordered the avocado benedict- next time.  I don't think the eggs were poached but the yolk was PERFECT.  Hard to get that nowadays with Benedict!  We ate everything on the plate.  Bonus they have alcohol.  I imagine it would be good for hangover days to eat here.  
Tip:  ask for the key to bathroom first.

I'm visiting Chicago from California and decided first on Wayberry, but the wait was too long so, we decided on this breakfast spot and I am so glad we did! Easily 5 stars for location, service!!, food, everything, really!! Perfect place to beat the heat in the Midwest. 

We ordered the sampler (hash browns, sausage, eggs, and French toast) and French toast plate. 


Pro tip: because of all the renovations going on in the building the men's restroom is on the 6th floor and women's restroom is down a floor. You'll need a key for each of these that any employee will gladly hand you.

Eh , pretty average breakfast. Nothing really wowed me about their food or menu. Everything was pretty traditional. Went here after Wildberry had an hour and a half wait. Kinda wished we waited though because I really wanted to try their cinnamon roll pancakes ... 
The atmosphere is very cozy, definitely can see us having one at home. 
Would I come back again? Probably not unfortunately. It wasn't horrible but it wasn't awesome either. 
Service was just ok too.

Ended up here after finding out another place had over an hour wait and am so thankful we stumbled upon this little joint!  It is a diner and was warm and cozy on a chilly, dreary, rainy morning. We were waited on as soon as we were seated and within minutes we all had a nice, HOT cup of coffee! The prices were incredibly reasonable and the staff were very attentive! All of our meals were cooked perfectly and tasted great! Our expextations were exceeded!

I wouldn't return. The customer service felt obligatory, and the communication between the waitress and the kitchen staff was totally off.

I ordered a breakfast croissant, but what I got was the "Le Croissant" which is a different sandwich all together (the latter has Carmelites onion and Gouda, whereas the former has American cheese and bacon). Notwithstanding that I ordered a "breakfast croissant" the waitress turned to the cook and said "she meant to order the breakfast croissant." Basically, she tried to make it seem as though it was my mistake and not hers. Not ok. 

In addition to the sandwich I ordered some hash browns. They were so bland, undercooked and flimsy. I ate a spoonful and was over it. 

The customer service and mediocre food mean I won't be returning here.

On our last morning in Chicago we suddenly decided to have a second breakfast and happened to be in the neighborhood of Pittsfield Café. After a quick yelp search, Pittsfield seemed to be our winner. Now I may have judged this restaurant harshly, but compared to our other breakfasts/brunches in Chicago, this place just did not stand up. It's located inside of the Pittsfield Building, so no windows or good views. The atmosphere is very diner and cozy and the staff was attentive, but the breakfast was just completely average. The food didn't wow me for the price. If you are in the neighborhood, go for it, but I wouldn't waste a meal here if you are traveling in Chicago.

This is the sort of place I live for when I visit the States! A real traditional diner serving good honest food (and every type of food there is) around the clock with minimal fuss and effort of being there. 

Pulling up a seat at the counter (another thing I don't do loads of in the UK...) the waitress settled me in whilst I went for another non British start to the day - Steak and eggs for breakfast! Served with hashbrowns and a side of avocado, it really sorted me out and set me up for the day - really well cooked and great value for $20 with loads of coffee. 

Really great experience - perfect for breakfast - Love it!
Nothing special I think for what u pay its worth it the bacon was cold which sucks it wasn't edible very hard I say save ur money

This place is definitely not bad but it's not too good either. We stopped by at this place after wild berry had a long line. The service was okay, 
I ordered the Greek skillet which was pretty decent. ALSO the orange juice here is a must try although it was a little pricy ( just for the juice )

Pittsfield cafe is located inside a building in the middle of the lobby. My friend and I stopped by here after being told that the wait at Wildberrys was over an hour. We were seated immediately. 
They have a lot of items on the menu but I opted for the greek skillet which came with lots of veggies on a big mound of hash browns topped with 3 fluffy scrambled eggs. I HIGHLY recommend ordering this! The prices were reasonable and service was quick. I would definitely come back when in the area!
Very fast service, usual diner food. Prices on Yelp definitely WRONG. Add $2-$3. If I'd known this, I would've stayed closer to the hotel and eaten at Dunkin donuts.

What a strange, yet great place for brunch!  Right downtown, yet priced like it's in the burbs.  We came here because we didn't want to spend $25 a person, nor did we want to wait more than 5 minutes for a table.  We did neither of those things at Pittsfield Cafe :)

The chocolate chip Belgian waffle was delicious, and the bacon was super crispy (a little too crispy for my taste, but my boyfriend was loving it).  I do agree with the person who mentioned that it was a little off-putting to get little cups of Smuckers syrup, though... a mini pitcher thing of syrup at the table instead would have gone a long way.

This place is inside this super old office building, and I loved that they asked us if we wanted to sit "inside" or "outside".  Inside meaning in the cafe itself, and outside meaning at a little bistro table in the foyer of the building, just outside the cafe but still very much indoors.  We ate "outside", of course!  Overall, a great little tucked away place.

The food and service were on point.

I ordered a Coke and a pastrami skillet and it literally was a perfect lunch. Got my food so quickly, I was a bit surprised how fast it was. My Coke was always filled without asking.

I wish more places had this kind of food and service. It's truly a hidden gem in the Loop.

I will definitely keep coming back :)
Hamburger meat steak, rock hard biscuits, frozen fries. The drinks are the only saving grace. Gross, will not return.

Soooo the restaurant is inside this really old building called the Pittsfield building. Lol. 
The door lady is really nice! So feel free to chat her up. Went inside, sat at the bar and ordered a skillet. Interesting item. Get eggs cooked however you want them and then underneath that you get an assortment of items. Very delicious. 

Also the Le croissant is splendid. 

Enjoy!

I have pretty high standards when it comes to breakfast and brunch; this place is a solid 3 stars in my book. 

The restaurant is located inside the historic Pittsfield Building which makes for a fun setting. The restaurant has a counter area and booths, but no windows or outdoor patio.  

We came here because we were too hungry to wait 90 minutes to be seated at Wildberry. The food at Pittsfield Cafe was good and reasonably priced, but nothing special or fancy. 

Chicagoans don't mess around when it comes to brunch and the restaurants are always overflowing with hungry tourists, so be prepared for staff to be running around everywhere trying to keep up.
Food was great, hot chocolate was a bit disappointing.  The outside environmental felt great.

Instead of waiting 1.5 hours for breakfast at 
Wild berry which is overrated we came here and had an excellent hot breakfast. We were seated immediately. Our food was served within 10 minutes of placing the order and the serving staff were very attentive. I recommend coming here for a great breakfast in a quiet clean quaint cafe.

Good food, good service! Offerings are basic Americana mixed with Greek. We had the breakfast and arrived before the crowds on a busy Saturday. 
Coffee is better than most places, with a good flavor and large cups. I had the Greek skillet, which was delicious! We definitely plan on returning.

Hidden inside a building in downtown Chicago, it was a bit hard to find, but very cute! Eating here makes you feel like you're having a meal in the 1970s.

We came here for a late breakfast/lunch. The coffee was decent, and the food was pretty standard diner food, maybe slightly better than your neighborhood diner might be.

Service was okay, nothing outstanding.

Pretty good place for food if you're craving an American breakfast but nothing too wonderful.

This place is hidden in an awesome building in downtown Chicago. We ended up going when the wait for Wildberry Cafe was really long. We are also transplants from NYC, so it was nice to find a place that is like an old school diner. The food was good, came up fast and we were out of there in under an hour. It's close to work, so I will definitely be back.

They screwed up our names on the wait list. A 20 minute wait turned into an hour. Took forever to order. Food was mediocre. They made us wait for 20 minutes before they told us that the credit card machine was broken.

Next time, I'm just going to Toni, which is right next door.
This simple cafe offers Vienna all beef hotdogs in the atrium of a venerable old building. It's a nice place to stop for a bite while enjoying the ornate trim of the historic building.

Fantastic off the grid of downtown place. You have to look for this place but when you get there it is worth it. We were heading to Wildberry and there was a 90 minute wait. Too touristy for us so we check out the reviews and found this place. Great cafe with staple food. The biscuits and gravy some of the best I have ever had. I definitely would go back. The building that the restaurant is located in is a great piece of history and architecture in Chicago. This is a must see when downtown.
Vegiie lovers will love this place. Good Saturday breakfast before the city tour. At around 10 am the line is getting long you should come at around 9am

We came here based off of the reviews we read and we were not disappointed. Our server Donna was extremely friendly. The atmosphere reminded me of a down home diner from the 80's, warm and welcoming where everyone knows your name. My husband ordered the Steak Skillet and I ordered the American Skillet. It was very filling and tasty.
Been here a couple of times when I travel through Chicago. Friendly, casual dining atmosphere. Food is delicious and well-priced. Will definitely come again if I am in the area. A wonderful spot!
Fantastic service and food is great. Plus in a beautiful setting inside the Pittsfield  building.

A surprisingly charming breakfast spot downtown. Conveniently located, and situated inside the Pittsfield Building, this cafe is a great place to meet a friend for breakfast in the loop.  The tables are set out in the lobby of the building, which takes on the air of a little Italian courtyard, only without the open air.  (In Chicago, the fact that it's not in the open air means that it's usable year-round, so consider that a plus.)

And the food is diner food, but above par for the city of Chicago.  The coffee is strong, the southwestern omelet had noticeable character (including genuinely fresh jalapeno peppers in it), the service is quick and undramatic.  

This place just became my go-to spot for Loop breakfast meetings.

My go-to when brunch places around the area are too crowded because there is never a wait time for this place.

Not big inside, so don't expect luxury because you'll be squeezed next to people in the neighboring tables.

Food is ok, staff is ok. Not rude but also not super attentive/responsive either. The place has never done me wrong, but I wouldn't say the food is exceptional. 

There are better places in the city to try, but again this is a pretty solid Plan B!

Very disappointing. I am a breakfast person, so I am picky. This place is just ok, the food is nothing special at all but a least the portions were a good size. I had the veggie omelet and my husband has the corned beef hash & eggs. Both were ok. I would expect more garnishment and pico de gallo or salsa or avocado or something to dress the omelet and make it look better and compliment the flavors. The hash browns were good and corned beef was homemade but really tasted average. My biggest complaint is the service. It took three request to get coffee. We finally got it after our meal was over. Our server had about 25 tables. That is ridiculous - management should have enough people on staff to handle a Saturday morning crowd. I wouldn't go back, in fact, I would go wait for an hour  to get a table at Wild Berry cafe. Yes, Wild Berry is that much better.

Pittsfield cafe is a great looking place to eat with great food, great ambiance in a beautiful old building. Stopped here after spending time at Millennium Park. You cant beat this place that offers great food and service. This cafe might be hard to find because the cafe is within another building. Follow the address go through revolving door and inside is the cafe. If you love architecture you'll love the building that houses this cafe!

Small but cozy, if only they would make the quality consistent. I ordered Eggs Florentine one biscuit was very hard and egg a little under cooked the other egg was well-done and biscuit was perfect. Little disappointed, walked by this place a thousand times and I'm afraid this will be my one and only time I'm eating here.

Food was ok, average things you can find pancakes omelets eggs fresh orange juice and Cafe BUT was is different is the so unpolite and bad waitress. Found strange why Yelp ranked well, the rating should indicate food and service levels not just an overall grade.  The reason i didn't give 2 was because the Gourmet sandwich had cucumbers wich was interesting combination.
Awesome food and ambiance, the place is not visible from streets so you have to look carefully.

This was my second visit and I'll return - had brunch with a girlfriend - Mediterranean omelette and Bloody Mary (which was a delicious meal in a glass by itself) waitstaff was very friendly and accommodating  especially since we couldn't make up our minds on which table to sit at- they had a 'no big deal' attitude when we switched to an exterior table in the atrium seating area.  My brunch was was $19 plus tip. Great experience and terrific menu. Pleasantly decorated with flowers.

Great place for breakfast, I had the French toast which was amazing. The fresh squeezed orange juice is also sweet and good balance. The service was FAST!!!! I think it took less than 10 min to get my food. Just don't get lost this place is inside a building surrounded by lots of construction.

Small, quaint diner inside what I'm assuming is a hotel? Yelp kind of steered me in the wrong direction trying to find this place, but I got there just fine. The breakfast food is like any other type of diner food, gets the job done. I'm giving it a 2 stars because of the cost of their dishes. I know it's smack dab in the middle of downtown, but I could have taken the bus a few minutes outside the city and found the same thing for less.

The place is a hidden gem. Unless you're specifically looking for it there's no way you would see it. We were in Chicago for a few days and tried this place out for breakfast one morning. It was really busy but we didn't have to wait long to be seated. I ordered a guacamole burrito that came with a tasty spicy sauce. My husband had a breakfast platter that was also pretty good. Highly recommend this place.

Great, friendly service. But, its the type of place where the pancake syrup comes in single serving packets, which is fine for some restaurants, but the prices would have to justify that. I wouldn't expect real maple syrup from a Deluxe Breakfast Platter from McD's, for example. 

But it's not just about the syrup. Overall, seems overpriced for what you get. Sausage links (breakfast) tasted generic. As did everything else really. Just generic. So prices should've been generic too, but they weren't. 

Public restroom for the building was gross, I should add.

This place was great for a quick, no fuss breakfast. We were headed to the Art Institute and just needed some fuel. The service was quick and courteous, and the food (especially the eggs) was perfectly executed. Their Bloody Mary was good too! I would totally come back.

Super hidden but well worth the search. Inside a building with construction going on but be patient and find this place. 1/3 the price of the restaurants by the park, but food quality is on point. No wait because it's hidden, but watch out for the Mexican Coffee! Nice heavy pour, you'll get your monies worth. Corner of Wabash and Washington, by the jewelry store. Victoria helped us and she was very informative and full of smiles.

My boyfriend and I came here for breakfast since it had a decently high rating and the wait was not that bad. This was one of the biggest mistakes we've made this year, and here's why:

The food.
My boyfriend ordered the steak and eggs, since it was one of their specials there. When the food arrived, I could see the look of disappointment in his eyes. There on his plate was no steak and eggs, but rather an extra large hamburger patty with a pile of mush on the side. I could see that he was dying a little inside with each bite. I tried a small piece of his "steak" and what I could taste was a blend of cardboard and water. I'm surprised he was able to get through half of it.

I ordered the original benedict and it was a chefs recommendation plate. Not sure if the chef tastes the food before they decide to recommend it, but I recommend they should. After a while the hollendaise sauce got all gooey and hard to digest. The hash browns was also a pile of mush on the side. I asked for poached eggs. Not half poached and half boiled eggs. I was unable to get through much.

The service.
How do I describe the service? Imagine a sack of unpleasant-ness suffocating itself with its unpleasant attitude. Now imagine it getting run over and over again by an angry truck. The result? Our "lovely" waitress. Unfortunately I didn't bother remembering her name. She was nothing but horrible. Gave us attitude as we were just trying to order food. When we asked for the check, we had to wait roughly 20 minutes for god knows what. (There were only 3-4 tables left when we were trying to leave). When she did come with the check, it was just thrown at us. I've never got bitch slapped in my life, but I imagine this is what it would feel like. Thank god we made it out of here.


TL;DR:
The food and service is garbage. If you want a cheap breakfast, you're better off with McDonald's served to you by a local hobo.

Thank you for reading.

A great place to go too when you want to cure your hangover with a huge bloody mary. My hungover friends and I came here on a Saturday afternoon. It's hidden in the back of a vintage lobby. Really cute breakfast dinner with old school Grease-style decor. Our waitress was great with a refreshing down to earth and funny personality, 

The bloody Mary is a meal in it self~ its friggin good. 

The santa fe burrito was delicious and reasonably price (thank god).


Come here for breakfast if you want a reasonably priced meal and drink in the expensive downtown city of chicago.

Food is amazing (forgot to take a picture before I started eating). Just visiting Chicago for the week and I'm glad I stopped here. Affordable and quick. 
I got scrambled eggs and French toast with sausage links. So great.

WOW!!!!!! The Le Croissant sandwich with bacon was absolutely PHENOMENAL! Pretty much the best breakfast sandwich I have ever had. The bacon was so crisp. THE ONION JAM!!!!!! And smokes Gouda?! You can neeeeeever go wrong with smoked Gouda. Too bad I'm from California otherwise I'd be here every morning for this heavenly breakfast sandwich.

Food is absolutely delicious and the service was great! My husband and I went for breakfast/brunch. I ordered the Le croissant sandwich with bacon and American cheese (pick what cheese you want) and caramelized onion jam and a side of hash browns. Can't describe how delicious the croissant sandwich was, probably the best I've ever had! Now, I'm a lover of hash browns, have to be honest these definitely weren't the best they were just a tad under cooked for my taste but still yummy! Service was awesome and food came out ridiculously fast, 5 stars all the way!

My wife and I experienced terrible customer service here. It started off well enough. We were seated promptly, handed menus, and given waters right away. 

We looked at the menu for a couple minutes and decided on what to eat. We put the menus together (usual signal to waiters that we're ready). 

We waited for 3-4 minutes for someone to come to take our order but no one even acknowledged us after the water. We figured it might be busy so we cut them some slack. We made our rental car reservations while we waited. 

After finishing that, still nobody came to talk to us. I flagged down a waitress who told me that someone else would be helping us shortly. After another minute, I made eye contact with the manager, smiled, and told him that we were ready to order. He looked at me, SHOOK HIS HEAD, and turned away.

When I have enough time to make a car reservation and look up directions to Wrigleyville, that's much too long of a wait for someone to acknowledge our existence.

This place is a hidden casual-gem. It's actually located inside a hotel.

I got the west coast and it is amazing! The avocado, cheese, peppers and eggs blended very well. Add some black pepper and salt and this becomes perfection. 

Would recommend.

Delicious food ! Party of five had our food within just a couple minutes of ordering.  One in our party mentioned the sausage links were cold.  I had original Benedict it was great !   House coffee was really good.  Other downside would be bathroom access is a pain having to get a key and take a bit of a hike to the basement of the building. 

To find this place , keep an eye on the alcoves as you walk down the sidewalk. It's on the south side of the road you will see a menu by the door.  Also building is discretely stamped "The Pittsfield building"

What an amazing brunch spot. It was a little confusing to find until we realized it was in a hotel lobby. Actually they have tables set out in the foyer of the hotel, which we opted to sit at. So we only got a quick glance at the inside of the cafe. 

The food was really delicious. I got one corned beef skillet with scrambled eggs and another with eggs over-easy. I would recommend sticking with scrambled eggs - the yolk from the over-easy eggs kind of overpowered the taste of the corned beef. Didn't get any drinks, we were trying to recover from the night before. It wasn't too crowded so our food was served really fast and our waitress was really attentive. 

The prices here are unbelievable, especially for being located in the Loop. 

Overall: great brunch spot. Nice environment and good experience. Definitely will be back.

Teresa is a gem! We stumbled in looking like death and she took care of us. 

Great place to start your morning! Affordable, quick. And yummy! It is a hidden cafe in the Pittsfield building. 

Ps- the Bloody marys will make your hairs tingle
The food here is about as dry and bland as good could possibly be. The people are quite nice, though!

My wife and I ate breakfast on a Saturday morning at Pittsfield Cafe for our first time. The wait was 15 minutes. She had the ribeye skillet and I had the meat lovers scrambler.  I had coffee and ahe had ice water. 

We did not talk much during the meal because we were ravenous.  It was more like sounds of "mmmmmm" and  "so glad I ordered this."  Our bill total was about $24. We will breakfast here again!

Average diner in my book. Setting is also a little dismal since this place is tucked away in a lobby where there are NO, ZERO, NIL windows allowing for outdoor light to come in. 

Had their Florentine benedict. Nice sauce, hash browns could have been better. Coffee was constantly refilled. Pay up front when you get your check. Decent breakfast joint.
Hidden little gem of a spot. We scarfed down a breakfast and it was so delicious. The coffee is also really good - icing on the breakfast cake. Efficient and friendly service.

Diamond in the rough! What a great breakfast and brunch place!  The Bloody Mary's are the that I've had homemade in a long time. The service is awesome too especially Teresa...smiling and funny! If you can find it , I highly recommend it!

Pretty good little hidden treasure! Classic dinner food in a beautiful historic building and no wait because it's tucked away. When I make it back to Chicago I'll definitely make my way back!! Eggs Benedict was great.

As a previous reviewer mentioned this is a tricky place to find but you enter the building ( just past Toni's patisserie). Really cool inside a really old hotel style with a big chandelier hanging. There is indoor and outdoor seating. We sat outdoors( really inside but outside ) I had fresh squeezed orange juice and the Greek skillet 3 scrambled eggs with mushrooms feta tomatoes on top of hash browns came with toast too. You must try the pecan role insanely good. Fast service and a friendly waitress and reasonably priced too. I would recommend this place

Kind of difficult to find this place, but very cool once you get there. It is inside an old building so you walk in and walk forward a bit into a dimly lit lobby and it is on your left. There is "outdoor" seating that is inside the lobby but just outside the restaurant itself.

Interesting diner type of feel with friendly and speedy service. The menu has lots of options including interesting scrambles and skillets. I had the Greek skillet which had onions, mushrooms, feta and hash browns with three eggs on top, cooked however you'd like. Quite good and definitely very filling. It also came with toast. 

If I come back I will try their breakfast burrito which looked really good.

Wonderful diner in the middle of it all! There is no sign outside so look for the address and enjoy the old-school building in which its housed. 

I got the biscuits and gravy and a fresh squeezed orange juice. The juice was indeed fresh squeezed and worth every penny. Gravy was piled high on several biscuits - and I added two eggs for only a dollar extra each. 

I've been in Chicago all week and wish I knew about this place sooner. Touristy location but very fair pricing. Go here and you will not be disappointed.

They were busy and not prepared to handle the service.  However, the food was very good and that made up for it.  Three of us had the Santa Fe breakfast burrito and I had the chicken melt sandwich. Food was great and it's in a cool building.

A diner in the Loop?  Thank you!  This place was here way before Wildberry came to be.  I think it pretty much could kick Wildberry's ass.  The Pittsfield building this diner resides in is way cool.  Tons of character in the space, neat stuff to look at while you eat.

Breakfasts shine here, lunches are OK but I recommend breakie over lunch.  And, really the prices for the loop are excellent.  I recommend their breakfast burrito with fresh avocado slices on top, all of their skillets and omelets are good too.  I always ask for my hash brown crispy and they oblige.  Not sure about the pancakes since I've never had them.  Decent coffee but if you are a coffee snob/hipster you won't think so.

Oh, and do a liquid breakfast just for fun and get a bloody.  Their version is great, accompanied by awesome and salty garnishes.  Have two or three and then text your boss and say you can't make it today because you are feeling a bit dizzy.  I dare you!

This place is absolutely amazing. It is located in an old; historical building. You would't notice it if you walk in the street, you must know it's here in order to find it.
The place is usually busy. I like having brunch on a terrace, enjoying sun light, so I was a little bit disappointed by the fact that they are only inside... but the disappointment was short.
We were seated quickly even though it was a rainy Saturday morning... then we had a wonderful brunch!!!
It started with a freshly squeezed orange juice, shortly followed by the 2-2-2 combo, the croissant breakfast sandwich and a huge stack of pancakes. Food was delicious, portions large enough for my huge appetite. I had a wonderful time there!
Also, the staff is very friendly and efficient; even though they are under-numbered.

Who cares how the syrup is served, the food was delicious and very quickly served. My first time here and I'll definitely come back next time I'm in town. I had the 2-2-2 which was 2 eggs, 2 pancakes and 2 bacon (at least that's what I choose).

The gf and I were in the area and needed to fuel up for the day. Well this place was a great place to do it at. 

First off it can be a little tricky to find if you aren't looking for it seeing you have to walk into the building and head down to the center of it and the cafe is on your left. 

Nice little place and not overly crowded on a Saturday around 10. My girlfriend got the meat omelet and I got the steak skillet. Both were great and honestly half of it would have been filling enough. 

The quickness of the service however was unreal. Seriously, it maybe took 5-8 mins to get our food and it was piping hot! 

The price also was great for downtown Chicago. Both meals for around 20 bucks is more than worth it!

Super sweet Italian owner makes you feel at home in this little diner style café. The food is comforting and while not outstanding, it is definitely satisfying and diner-like. 

Giant portions and a very busy atmosphere really add a little bit of Italian style eating to your meal. Guaranteed to fulfill your hunger needs every time.

Was fortunate enough to talk to the owner and exchange a joke, and he is an absolute sweetheart. He even threw in a few York patties with our to-go boxes and honestly made my day.

It does get a bit crowded around breakfast and brunch hours so make sure you beat the crowds!definitely satisfied my hunger.

Very nice classic American diner inside an old Chicago  building. Friendly staff. Their OJ is amazing! Eggs were a little moist but still good. Only had 2 strips of bacon and toast came with no butter, but it was still a pretty good breakfast. Would return. Conveniently next to the loop.

Great breakfast. I got the breakfast burrito and the chipotle hollandaise makes it perfect. My boyfriend wanted benedicts but they stop serving them after 11 am so they recommend an avocado skillet (not listed on the menu) and got the chipotle hollandaise on the side. He said "WOW". So we were both happy campers! Plus it's inside an older building and you can sit in a lobby setting. It's quite nice with lots great architecture.

We hard a hard time finding it because part of building is under construction.  When we did, we were seated right away. We opted for inside because outside was very hot. Turns out inside wasn't much cooler, but we still enjoyed the meal. It also turns out that outside is not truly outside, but in a vaulted indoor courtyard. We had a good breakfast - service was quick and food was fresh and not greasy. Fresh OJ was especially delightful!
Okay food and good service. Only 3*s because it's just your normal diner food. While nothing was bad, I wasn't overly impressed.

Really impressive place for the prices you pay! It's a busy down to earth diner. The food was really good. Avocado Eggs Benedict was surprisingly good and the Le croissant came in a close second. Only downside was that it's pretty crowded (so you know it's good :) and the order took forever to come out! Still, this is a great first impression of Chicago!

After walking to a couple other breakfast shops we found this Lille off the beat place. That was amazing.  Thersa made us feel welcome in this great little spot.  The food was amazing and fast.  I highly recommend

Used Yelp AGAIN to find this place. Long waits and short menus meant finding another option. This place looked close so we started the hunt. As other reviews mention, it's difficult to find. Its called the Pittsfield Cafe because of the building its in. Haha who would think of that?!
Food was good and priced right. Waitstaff was on point. Nice sized $7 omelette with hash browns and toast. Coffee is hot and fresh for $2. Plenty of options for breakfast or brunch. Eggs, skillets, huge homemade waffles, pancakes, omelettes, fruit and juices. More stuff on the lunch and dinner part of the menu, but I didn't look at it because I was there for breakfast.
Super cool old building with lots of brass fixtures. Definitely worth a look.

So...after reading how this place is a hidden gem I kust had to stop by for breakfast. Its not the easiest to find but if you find the Pittsfield Building just let your nose take you to the cafe. 

The servers here seem to have been doing this forever and a day! The orange juice was fantastic. My skillet was superb. Pancakes were delish. I will be coming back to try out the lunch items. This place was excellent. Do yourself a favor and just go!!! *this is a hole-in-the-wall type of place so if you like posh places this is not it.

I ordered the Sampler which consisted of french toast, hash-brown, eggs & bacon (I chose scrambled eggs & pork bacon). Food was semi warm, but it wasn't bad. The best part about the meal was actually the french toast & super crispy bacon ... the rest I wasn't able to finish. Found a used bandage stuck on the menu and a short strand of hair in the food prior to eating -- that contributed to losing my appetite. 

The overall experience could have been better. However, service was subpar. They came to check up on us, but the attitude the staff gave off wasn't the friendliest. 

Regardless I'd give this place 3 stars due to the reasonable price, awesome french toast, crispy bacon and the unique location.
Expect about a 15 minute wait but man do they move fast! Prices are fair and the building it's in is beautiful.

This little gem is a great value!! First of all we were not willing to wait for  over an hour at Wildberry.  So we came here instead and walked away very satisfied.  

I had a great huge breakfast of two eggs, hash browns, French toast and two sausage links for under $8.00.  My hubbie had a great looking omelet that he said was terrific. And my son had French toast and eggs and he also enjoyed his food. 

Eat here. It's fairly priced - great food and attentive service.

Very basic breakfast.  Food quality wasn't bad except for what they call biscuits.  Those biscuits were not biscuits, more like a roll.  Get an omelet or another egg breakfast and you will be fine.  It is kind of hard to find, as there is no sign on the street.  It is located inside an office building.  The service was fine, and no wait for a table.

I would give this experience 0stars if I could!  We went here in search of breakfast after not wanting to wait at wildberry for breakfast.  Our girls ordered hot chocolate and when they poored a creamer from the table in the hot chocolate it was completely curdled!  We brought it to the waitresses attention and asked her to throw out the bowl and she and another exchanged a conversation and decided to leave it on the table!  We said we would not order if they were not willing to throw them out and they said okay.  On the way out the door I expressed my concern to the owner and he asked me what the problem was with that!???!  Really if that's the way you run your kitchen you are asking for illness!!!!stay away!!!

After reading all the reviews, I was excited about checking this place out! After eating there, I'm totally disappointed! I had the avocado benedict with a side of bacon and a mimosa.   The flavor of the food, at best was average. The bacon had no flavor, the hash browns were not cooked, and the mimosa was expensive OJ. The lady who waited on me was nice but the others were not! Definitely do not recommend this place! You might be better off trying the cafe next door!
Classic location, basic traditional American breakfast. Not open on Sundays. Simple and good, very nice atmosphere. Affordable.
Burnt beyond recognition bacon, watery poached eggs and terrible French toast which was just fried bread. Having come all the way from Scotland I would not recommend
Good selections and timely service but they should really stop serving this poor excuse of syrup (Smuckers breakfast syrup). The first two ingredients: corn syrup and high fructose corn syrup.

Average breakfast but quick service in a weird (and on the day we visited HOT) cafe inside the atrium of an old building. I would not rush to visit again but it served its purpose since we also refused to wait the 2h to eat at Wildberry.

Yuuuuuuum! The skillet was chock full of flavorful veggies, but the Bloody Mary was definitely where it was at! It came with a skewer full of goodies, and the spicy variation was the perfect amount of flavor and spice. The location right next to Millennium Park was perfect, and it was very reasonably priced. I'll definitely be back on my next trip to Chicago!

Let me explain my negative grade: 
We are long-time fans of Pancake House and we love it. 
Today we wanted to give a shot at something different. Headed to Wildberry, we had to find an alternative because of a 200+ minutes wait. 
This place is in an interesting location, but something is wrong in general. 
1) tables in the patio are cold now in December, just imagine in Jan/Feb
2) more important, all the 4 eggs of our benedicts were way too overcooked (hard): no good!!
3) hollandaise felt little too greasy
4) breakfast syrup for the pancakes is served cold 
5) pancakes are nothing special at all
6) French toast is too chewy
7) scrambled eggs for my baby were overcooked and resembled an omelette instead 

So, I can't understand the average of 4 full stars. 
I would have given it a 3 if it weren't for the overcooked eggs. 
Prices are good.

Perfect breakfast spot!  Does all the 'diner' stuff well (coffee and cocoa served quickly), and continual light check ins...but he real reason for 5 stars is the food!  Silver dollar pancakes were perfect and the West Coast Omelette was flawless!!  LOVE THIS SPOT!!

Wait was very short.  Our waitress Theresa was amazing.  The food came out quickly and was very good.

Recommend this place.

This is THE place to grab breakfast in downtown.  Food was incredible, service was great and the architecture of he lobby made it a cool place.  My son and I try different breakfast places when we travel.  This is a favorite.  The Chef Recommends is the best on the menu.  Skip the overpriced brunch spots and dig into this for a real breakfast.

I came here (by myself) twice on my recent trip to Chicago (with slightly different experiences, but the food was consistent).  

First trip was on a weekday and I sat at a small table in the back and my food came out quicker than anywhere I've ever been.  Bacon, eggs and pancakes.  The fluffiest scrambled eggs I've ever had anywhere.  Amazing.  

Second trip was on a Saturday morning.  Much busier.  They suggested the counter, but I asked for a table, so they then ushered me out into the hotter lobby (even though I saw small tables inside and knew I'd be quick, since I was by myself).  I opted for the counter, but it's not comfortable (stools are too far from the counter or too low or something.  My back felt arched over the counter, but it was just breakfast, so I sucked it up).  My waitress was running around obviously overwhelmed, so I sat there, with another waitress standing right in front of me, for about 5-6 mins.  I heard her say to someone else "I'm bored, and when I'm bored, I get tired..." Yet I was not a foot from her.  Finally a busser asked if he could get me anything.  I said yes, a waitress and a menu.  (I got the bored one).  I opted for bacon, eggs and french toast this time.  Again, the scrambled eggs were amazing and so was the french toast.  Even better than the pancakes.

A hidden gem and I would definitely go back.  I just hope they figure out slightly better customer service and a better flow on a Saturday.  It didn't have to be a cluster.  That being said, I'm still giving them 5 stars because of the food!

Absolutely spectacular. We got off the south shore line and were going to try Wildberry but it was a 45min wait and it seemed like it would be a glorified IHOP. We were looking for a delicious brunch hole in the wall authentic Chicago food and we found it at Pittsfield!! No wait, expedient and friendly service and the food was exactly what we were craving. French toast perfectly cooked, I had Turkey sausage patties that were the perfect side of protein to my carb loaded breakfast! Coffee was right on point and we were eating within minutes of sitting down. Server was friendly and quick and witty all the things I love about hometown diners. I would come here again in a heartbeat, the exact thing we needed for a quick breakfast before heading off to the airport. Its hidden away inside a building and you might miss it with all the construction around but trust us it's worth searching for and stopping in. Wish we had a spot like this in Utah! Thanks for a stellar brunch Pittsfield! See you on our next pit stop to Chicago!

Went her for breakfast on our first morning in Chicago and it didn't disappoint. In a cool location, with quick and friendly service, and great food. The steak and egg breakfast was spot on! Was with a friend with a gluten allergy and they had good knowledge of the menu and were able to advise. Would definitely go back.

Seriously some really good Mexican food. Seriously.

Our neighborhood go-to, we will eat in or carry out. When we do dine in, the waitresses are lovely and hang with our little guy. Margaritas are cheap and delicious (good size) and they have sweet PBR specials for about $2.
