Moving on to food, the menu is large, but I stick to their delicious steak tacos or one of the combo plates that gives you a little bit of everything from chile relleno, to a chicken enchilada (yum!) and a taco. Also on point? The queso fundido with chorizo. . . so. . . good.

Don't let the junky green awning fool you; the food at Tacos Garcia is legit!

The. Best. Tacos. 

As befits an establishment with "tacos" in its name, the tacos at Tacos Garcia are scrumptious. My quest for Chicago's best tacos has taken me far and wide: from Gage Park, Little Village and Pilsen to Avondale and Albany Park. I've paid anywhere from $1.50 (served from a front yard at Pulaski and 26th St) to $4 and more. Nothing's equaled TG's two dollar flavor-filled tacos. One of these days I'll break down and try something else on the menu, but for now, it's tacos from Tacos Garcia!
Was crazing Menudo on a Sunday. I got to say this place has the best menudo in town. The spicy taste, the fat triple, and the broth. Highly recommend for a hangover Sunday!

Must have been an off night we ordered (?) Delivery was horrible. Food was gross. Steak was nothing but fat. Went in garbage. My first 1 star review ever in Chicago. 
Don't want anything free. . Just never want this again.

This pace is super authentic, being of Hispanic dissent myself. You can tell that they put love and quality into their food. I went with a friend of mine and got 2 pollo tacos and some beans and rice. One of my absolute favorites! The pollo was seasoned perfectly. Real depth of flavors, spicy, cumin, red pepper, and plenty of cilantro (YUM)! The beans and rice were perfect, not too heavy on the seasoning on the rice which I like and no peas and carrots like you see at their places (gross). And the beans were crazy good, creamy and thick with a dash of queso blanco on top! All in all spent $9 and left more than satisfied.

Used to be my favorite taco spot in the city, but things have obviously changed. Yes, you have more hipsters in the neighborhood, but that doesn't mean you have to sell out.

- Less meat
- No more pico when dining in
- Fraudulent pricing (tacos and other items on the menu are 40% higher after being rung up)
- Bad attitude (from the newer girl - the middle-aged lady who's been there forever is really nice)

Short walking distance from my son's new apartment.  Large menu.  Prices are very reasonable.  They have a dance floor in an adjacent room.  Full service bar.

All four of us ate there and enjoyed out meals.

I always order delivery, and delivery always arrives earlier than predicted by GrubHub.  Food arrives hot, orders are correct, and the food is delicious.  Only once I received the wrong order, and when I called to inform them of the error, the owner/manager apologized, refunded my money, AND personally delivered the correct order to me within 10 minutes of my call.  This place is awesome!

I'm here again cause love Mexican food and way too tired to cook. I again got a steal burrito hold the beans and sour cream add rice. My feelings toward this place are strange. This time my burrito was correct, however the skin on the burrito was coming off. It was flaking, weirdest thing.  The burrito had little taste but with the meat and cheese and rice you don't really notice. The burrito is really big but I wish the cheese was melted inside. I also got rice water which was good as well ask for no ice, its better. I have to point out the service as well. The girls there are nice but you will be ignored for a while as they talk and giggle like little school girls.  This is my third experience here and I can say I will go back but I'll male sure to check my order fully before I leave. Oh they also serve alcohol and have a pool table so its more than a just eat spot.

I just had a killer steak burrito from this place.  The restaurant itself isn't much to look at.  There's chipped paint, cracked tiles, and wear on the seats.  I was displeased with how mild the green sauce was.  It was no hotter than a bell pepper.  But you're allowed to get away with that stuff when you make a killer product.

The al pastor tacos really stood out along with the chicken enchiladas suizas. Most authentic salsa roja I've had in a while. Nachos were plentiful, more than enough for 4. Will definitely be returning for more.

Acceptable Mexican cuisine located down the street from me. Prices are reasonable and the food is decent. 

However, one time I did order a meal that came with a side of beans that were cold; wasn't an enjoyable experience that time. But out of the handful of times I have eaten here that is my only complaint.

The burritos are a good size and usually I can't even finish the whole thing. 

Inside of the restaurant is nice; lots of tables and nifty decorations.  

It isn't my first choice for mexican food but I will order from here again in the future.
They wouldn't honor my groupon. Said I had to pay 20 when it says that nowhere on the groupon. Terrible customer service

Love this spot- Best veggie burrito in town! Light and crispy- you never feel weighed down after this burrito. A perfect combination of beans and rice with a heavy portion of avocado. Friendly and welcoming staff. Hard not to eat here every day of the week.

Around the corner from.  Really good and really inexpensive.  Amazing pico de gallo.  Really good burritos.  Pretty darn good queso fundido with chorizo flowing over.  If you're in the neighborhood, this place is worth a stop in.
I order from here all the time and everything is really good!

Ehh not to impressed with their food. I ordered tacos and they were very bland and their tortillas BLAND! I think the tortilla makes the Tacos! My server two thumbs down. I came in here on a slow night.I was the only one in the restaurant and she acted like I was bothering her. If you look that bothered and annoyed you should quit! Take your ass home or don't work in the service industry!!!

I won't waste my money and return to this place.

Looked shady from the outside but is totally fine inside. Service is friendly and fast. Don't be fooled by the grandpa-cafe look. 
Huge portions, incredible pico de gallo salsa, cheap prices and fresh ingredients.
Good, yummy late night mexican food. Just wish they delivered.

Favorite Mexican Food in Logan Square!! Free chips and salsa when you dine-in, fast and friendly service, huge portions, and Mexican bottled Coke!

Recommendations: Pastor Tacos(Onion & Cilantro, add cheese!), Shrimp Cocktail, Steak Burrito, Pork Tamales.

Cons: Chips are a bit stale on rare occasions. Decor is ridiculous and they sometimes play music too loud.

My girlfriend and I love the Mexican food choices in our neighborhood! We're spoiled rotten, and we know it. Tacos Garcia was an enjoyable experience! The free chips were home made. The three different salsas provided were each unique unto themselves and tasted like nothing i've ever had before. That alone is saying something about the place. It's the little details like that which will be bring me back anywhere! 

As we had a party the night before, and were still feeling the pinch of brain deadidity, a burrito was really the only cure. We went with their Vegetarian Burrito with avocado.  It was simple and beautiful. We walked out satisfied and only $6 damage. I don't get the comments on "expensive"....i guess it all depends on what you have!

Our server was very nice and we had a nice interaction. We'll definitely be back and probably with friends.

I love dive-like Mexican places -- I find they have the best food.  This place was sort of middle of the road.  No where near my favorite, but in a pinch it was fine.  I doubt I'll go out of my way to go back, but if you're looking for Mexican later at night it's passable (although oddly pricey in comparison to many similar-type places I've been to).

I will note that we got a lot of chips were stale and the avocado on my date's plate was a little brownish, which I didn't like and dropped it from a 3 star to a 2 star rating.
I leave this joint more crunk than a nightclub. Tacos, cheap ass beer, pool table, whaddya want.

This is pretty much your average late night Mexican restaurant, but with a full bar, a pool table, and black lights in one room. The food is mediocre at best and borderline terrible at worst.

Their hours? Who knows? It seems that they close at arbitrary times, and while regulars can stay late and eat in, others can only get takeout. The sign may say that it's open, but you can't count on much more than that. And even takeout is governed by the caprice of the manager. Maybe they flip a coin. You might get a burrito to go if you're a betting person.

If you're drunk and hungry then give this place a try. Otherwise why bother?

This is a great establishment. I'm only upset that I discovered it a month before moving out of the area. The food is great, the beer is cheap, the salsa is outstanding, and they don't upcharge for extra chips and salsa. Service is friendly and not over bearing. They have a pool table and a bar and it's kind of dated. Overall great.

This place is kinda a little bit of a dive on the inside but the food is awesome. I have tried their tacos, tamales and nachos so far and can't wait to make my way through the menu next time(s) I stop in for lunch or dinner. The taco's are cooked perfectly and my favorite so far is the chorizo taco. It's pretty much the best chorizo one I have ever had at any taco place. The nachos were served up on a large plate and overflowing with (quality) cheese, re-fried beans, sour cream and guacamole. I had the pork tamales and they were seasoned and cooked to perfection. The tamales were a little deceiving at first because they looked dry but once I bit into one it was just right. There again the inside of this restaurant leaves a lot to be desired but the quality of mexican food more than makes up for it.

Went here after a search for chicken soup in this area to cure a bit of sickness. This place came up and the soup reviews were great. I called and placed a pick up order. The soup was AMAZING. Homemade, with potatoes and carrots and huge chunks of real chicken. the container was HUGE (easily 2 meals worth) and they gave onions, cilantro, salsa, rice and tortillas on the side. All for $8. Overall a great meal and I look forward to dining in next time!

Before last night, I would have given Tacos Garcias a 3.5 or 4 star rating. All these little Mexican restaurants are the same, right?

WRONG! Last night, elsewhere in the city, I had the worst cheese enchiladas EVER- with sodium-flavored sauce and half-melted cheese- for $2 more than Tacos Garcias charges for their enchiladas!

I realized that I had been taking Tacos Garcias superior enchiladas and reasonable prices for granted-and man, am I paying for it! Not only did I have to cough up hard-earned cash for crappy food last night, but I'm going to have to get myself some Tacos Garcias enchiladas today, in order to cleanse myself from consuming an abomination to my favorite Mexican dish!
Fast and friendly Mexican.  Portions are generous.  Loved the al pastor tacos...burrito was huge!  Will definitely return.

I've only gone here for take-out, but this place looks very cute inside. 

I've had tacos, burritos and tortas here. Originally I would have given this place 3 stars, but today I had a torta al pastor and it was Fantastic. Like mouth-wateringly great. 

They have pretty good horchata and a bar, also Mexican (real sugar) Coca-cola.

Taco's Garcia has been there for years. I ate there twenty five years ago.
It looks the same, but the prices are not the same.

VERY expensive, but it tasted fine. Only one waitress and she was working hard. Again, very expensive.

Right down the street from my favorite blues club, Rosa's Lounge, is this hole-in-the-wall taco place that is open late and never disappoints. That place is Tacos Garcias. 

I have never had much beyond their chicken tacos, rice and beans, and margaritas, but all are consistently delicious. Their tortillas always taste super fresh, and you can't really beat the prices. 

The only drawback is that if you go on the weekend, or even later on at night, you will be accosted by extraordinarily loud music from the adjoining full bar room and jukebox. Other than that, a solid experience.

All in all, a place I try to hit up whenever I'm in this hood.

I've been to Tacos Garcias probably 10-15 times, and all I've ever had is the burrito. Is that sad? Their burritos present me with a classic food quandary--once you've found something amazing, must you still endeavor to keep trying new things? experience more? expand your knowledge of the universe? 

Their burrito makes a good case for never, ever trying anything new, ever. ...not ever. While I'm not committed to adopting that as a life philosophy, or to all of my culinary experiences, while I am at Tacos Garcias, that is the way it is. It's just too dang good, and it's something stupidly awesome like $4.50.  It's quite large, and available filled with a variety of tasty meats, though I stick to steak or chorizo. I don't want to butcher the other ingredients, but I believe it's beans, cheese, sour cream, lettuce and tomato.

That is literally the only thing I ever get. It is quite filling, and I just have never felt that I NEEDED anything else.

The only other things I can comment on are:

Horchata: 
Tasty recipe, served in a huge cup....but no refills. So for those keeping track at home, that's HAVE horchata, tastes great, give you a lot....but not an unlimited quantity. Overall, this is a plus.

Bottled Mexican Coke:
As someone mentioned below, they've got the good stuff. Mexican coke, in glass, with real sugar. Even if you never go to Tacos Garcias, if you like coke, you should really keep an eye out for this. I love all coca cola, but the mexican variety is the best.

Chips and Salsa:
They give you free chips and salsa (normal). The chips are unremarkable, but they give you a variety of salsas (3 types, I think), and they're all really quite good.

The Decor:
When last I was there, everything was covered in some rubbery, sparkly material. Sort of "napoleon dynamite"-esque. I'll call that a plus.

The ambiance:
Slightly dim, slightly vintage feeling. I mainly created this category to chuckle about how there is an additional room adjacent to the main dining room that often has music. Sometimes they're playing mexican jams at a punishingly loud volume, that, for me, just makes me laugh pretty much the entire time.  Can't hate that! haha!

Love neighborhood Mexican places and this one wins big time. Great prices to start with. The pork burrito (al pastor) is fantastic, so flavorful. And they make it so quick! Also love the chicken enchiladas, among the best I've bad, especially for the price. Love the waitresses, so nice. Sit at the counter and enjoy tasty tasty Mexican food.

After living in Louisiana for 2 years and being deprived of quality Mexican food, I came here one of my first nights in Chicago. Let's just say I feel at home and will probably be back weekly. They do dine-in, take-out, and have a ton of space inside- good for small or big groups. My server was very kind and my food was delicious. Delicious may be an understatement, actually. I got a chicken burrito and it was so big I made 2 meals out of it! It's also inexpensive for the quality. I've never reviewed anything on Yelp until this place. It's that good.

It was around 7:30 pm, but no customers. Noticed the place smelled like something not clean, plus smell of bleach. I was disappointed until I tried my order. This place is amazing! Food is fantastic!!!
Just got a steak burrito that was pretty solid from here. I definitely will be going back.

MMMM is all I can say to describe this place.
The tacos here are seriously fantastic! I always get the steak and the tacos are perfect every time! This place is very cozy and relaxed. They also do take out and are very quick. The price is also spot on.
Bottom line is that you get great authentic Mexican food for a great price. The staff have always been courteous and quick with your order.
If you're looking for great Mexican, go here!!!!
This place is amazing.  The food is great and you cannot beat the price.  Unfortunately for my waist line, this place is less than a block from my boyfriend's apt.  All around awesome.

I didn't even get what I wanted and they still garner 4 stars: this place has promise!

Pretty crowded at 2 PM on a Saturday, and one critic said their guac was great. Ordered two guac tostadas and a horchata. (They have pina coladas and margs, but I wasn't in the mood.) Horchata was fab, not too cinnamon-y (gross) and not watery, but pure oatmeal-ish. Tostadas ended up being aguacate instead of guacamole, with side of rice and beans. I cleaned my plate and will fer sure be back to try the guac (hopefully).

Really cheap, really good food that hits the spot.  Service was great and really nice.  I loved the banana licuado.  It doesn't seem to be in the location, but the food is simply too good to say no to.

A friend from college came in this weekend to show off his new fiance and got to a cubbies game.

At around 12am we went home from Wrigleyville.  Lukes fiance fell asleep in the cab and he had to carry her inside.  Then he and I went to this little Mexican joint on the corner of Armitage and Kimball and bought two giant burritos and two coronas and played a couple games of pool.  It was a really good end to the night.  Funny as hell b/c we were drunk, I had to order in Spanish and ask for quarters and shit... we took Bailey (my Chocolate Lab)  in with us.  Horrible pool playing, I was calling everybody in the place "Cabron" (means buddy or friend to Mexicans... don't say it to Puerto Ricans (it has a totally different meaning)) and high 5ing.  It was fun and filling.

Very very good food.  The prices here are also dirt cheap! The tostada's are excellent and a great spot to get chilaquiles for breakfast to fight off a hangover.  

The ground beef, chorizo, and al pastor are delicious.  The steak is good and better then most places, but I firmly believe that La Palapita has the best steak in Chicago.
Yeah I haven't been there

It's cheap, very.  And yummy, mostly... depeeends on when you go, either they fry you up some scrumdidddlyumptious mexigoodness, or some burned mush stuff.  The guac is either to die for, or will kill you!  The pico di gallo is the best salsa there, as you eat up it's nummy chunks the heat builds to a crazy crescendo!

Get the gordita, ton of food for very little; make sure it's steak though.  Otherwise, stick with the pork, it's the most consistently delicious.  If you wants something to stick to your stomach lining like a love struck gargantuan sloth from space, get the chorizo breakfast, the grease will become your best friend!

STAY AWAY ON TUESDAYS!! THAT's WHEN THE CRAZY's COME OUT!!!

oh, and the spanish language channel will be playing the whole time hidden in the back corner... being ignored by the people sitting at the little bar playing super loud music on the state of the art juke box, complete with metal and random mexican pop.
This is my Sunday hangover place: ground beef burrito and fries to go.  Curly fries, yeah!  Yeah, no, don't compare to La Pasadita; TG's burrito's are good...
Blows La Pasadita out of the water. Great tacos and authentic ambiance.  The tab was less than 15$ for 2.

Delicious, rather authentic Mexican food, must try the lomo with chile de arbol sauce. The mole is very very good too. Don't be scurred to venture out here and try this place! The disco/bar in the adjoining room starts up on weekend nights.

some of the best Mexican food in the city, not very expansive at all!!! I always go there for chicken soup, some of the best chicken soup i had in my life is there, it not just soup before meal a huge bowl of soup with two pieces of chicken, Spanish rice,  chips and salsa  make one great healthy meal that is way under $10, i give this place all five stars!

i live down the street from this place so im here on the regular when i dont feel like cooking. there are a few taco place in the area, but this one is the best. im a fan of the steak burrito. i eat here way too much so the waitresses are starting to recognize me and some know my name now. 
all the food ive had has been tasty with one exception. i was really drunk one night and told my bf i wanted beef taco( i meant beef as in steak not chicken or pork) i didn't realize they have a ground beef burrito. it was pretty bad. i took a couple of bites and gave up. other then that everything else is tasty. they even have a breakfast platter for those hung over mornings for 4.75.

Cubbies! Busy week but Meatheads did not fail to deliver quality food and customer service. Big shoutout to the cashier, Tasha! Even though the place was really packed, she was very polite, patient and knowledgeable when helping me make a decision on which meal to get. This was my first time at Meatheads but with this type of customer service and food I'm surely coming back and bringing some friends along! Thank you Tasha & Meatheads staff!
'Friendly and delicious' declare my children. I like the spicy cajun fries, which I take a few of as a Daddy Tax. Yeah!

This place is pretty amazing.  The fries are so good (and probably my favorite thing on the menu).  Their burgers are good as well and since the service is pretty quick this place is a trusty lunch hour go-to.

The best part about this place?  1) They are incredibly invested in the community showcasing local school information.  2) The SERVICE!!! Everyone here is so friendly and is always smiling and asking you if you need anything.  Sometimes if we're in the area and we want quick food this place wins because of their friendly demeanor and smiling faces.  Thanks guys!

Super clean establishment, a lot like the Lincolnwood location. No waiting food and service is top notch. I am not sure why I have not been coming here more. This place is amazing. See my other review of the Lincolnwood location to get a better description of the food. This review is about the level of order and easy flow of the entire staff. Its like nothing else I have seen, these guys are so on point. Glad to see this trend of higher end burger places, aren't all hype, this place tops the others for me, M Burger, DMK Burger Bar, Burger Joint, etc. Pencils down class, Meatheads got an A.

It's a regional chain; I can see their footprints in the city of Chicago, Chicagoland, some other parts of Illinois, and even northern Indiana.  

Rosa J. normally tries to refrain from going to a national or regional chain because she strongly upholds her "dine local, shop local" philosophy everyday of her life.  Nevertheless, she has noticed some great yelp reviews on many Meatheads locations and could not resist herself but to check it out what all that rave was about.  

I chose the location that is most convenient to where I work, in terms of public transportation.  Thus, the Roscoe Village location was selected for this study (sorry, don't want sound scientific, but couldn't help it with seven (7) years of science/criminal justice background on my belt).  

The service was very friendly, for a fast-food restaurant standard.  I had the Cajun sunrise burger, a regular-order of Cajun fries, and a fountain drink.  

Did I mention that they have the Coca-cola free-style pop machines?  Yes, they do!  

They seem to have free wifi as well, even though it was a bit slow.  But come on!  You're at a burger place, so please concentrate on eating your burger, children.  

The Cajun sunrise burger wasn't disappointing, but it wasn't that amazing like other yelpers have described in their reviews and pictures.  They have a fried egg (my absolute favorite topping in a burger), bacons, tomatoes, lettuce, and jalapeños.  Honestly, the three (3) bold-flavored toppings: fried egg, bacons and jalapeños make the entire burger lose the "focus."  For some reason, I just couldn't taste the uniqueness of a gourmet burger and didn't have a wow-factor.  

My only suggestion is that if they fried the egg to be done as "over-easy," it would help to hold the "burger" together instead becoming crumbly after a few bites.  

On the other hand, the Cajun fries were quite delicious.  The portion was generously large, and the seasoning was also on point.  

There were two (2) special unit CPD officers onsite and having a burger date with me.  I felt safe!  By the way, pay attention to where police officers are going to eat and follow along (DO NOT STALK THEM THOUGH...let them do what they are supposed to do).  They knew the local restaurants, and some are real foodies.  

Anyways, I still like this place and try something else next time.

it's a nice burger place . I got the fried chicken burger and fries . They give you a lot of fries ! The  chicken burger was very good and the chicken was real chicken . 
One of the nicest customer services .

Stopped here to grab a burger for my fiancé. As soon as I walked thru the door, I was greeted with genuine kindness. I mentioned this was my first time & they patiently walked me thru the menu giving great recommendations for combos.  After I placed my order they offered me a complimentary cup of water while I waited. The chicken is a close second to Chick-fil-A and the bistro sauce is super delish!

I love this place. I order food togo nearly every saturday. The people at the door are always very nice and accurate. What I really like is over the last 2 years I always see the same faces. They must treat their people well, because their people certainly take care of not only the guests but also the place. The place is always very clean. The food is great! Try the cajun fries! I can't say enough. Nice burger spot.

It's not just the great food they have here, but the customer service is above excellent! I love great customer service. It just makes your day! And this guy we had today was the nicest ever, and signed us up for points too. Just a small incentive for fries and such, but it's just nice to hear people explain everything and help you to your benefit, not their own. 

And the eggnog milkshake, OMG. To die for. And of course I asked the guy if it was good and he gave me an honest answer that it was good, but instead he had it made while we were waiting for our food and told me to try it and if I don't like it I could change it!? Wow, that really brings the level of standard much higher for restaurants of any kind! 

they take their motto very strong, and you can tell its sincere- thoughtful food for caring people :)

This was the beginning of "BurgerQuest Chicago 2015" where I try all sorts of burger places from upscale to counter service - but no national chains - and since I'm by here all the time shopping at Mariano's, I made it Stop #1.

First off, it's a regional counter service place. Knowing that, I wasn't expecting anything gourmet. The menu states that the meat is "Certified Angus," some of their topping choices were interesting and when I read "Cajun Fries," I was sold on going. I should have eaten someplace else.

It's VERY clean in there and they have the absolute coolest fountain drink system, but they seriously abused that poor Angus beef. I ordered mine with grilled mushrooms and Swiss cheese - my "standard." I had to stop eating halfway into it - it was rather bland and the greasiness was SO overwhelming. I like to chew my burger - this was nearly "chewing optional," that's how greasy it was. The fries were decent, but if you go, just get the plain. This is the 3rd place I've been to in Chicago that has "Cajun fries," and I'm starting to think no one knows what Cajun means here. All they seem to do is just sprinkle cayenne pepper on fries. Cajun has a complex medley of flavors, not just one note. When I stood up to leave, I felt it hit my system so hard, I ended up only "renting" my lunch.

Overall, it's just too expensive for what it tastes like: a glorified McDonald's. I'd only go back to play with their fountain drink system all... day... long. It's the PlayStation of drink systems!

A similar small-chain burger place with the same values of locally sourced, mindful food is Epic Burger - go there instead and for about the same price.

Gave meatheads a second try today- perhaps I ordered the wrong thing the first time. Liked it a lot more today! I had the Cajun burger, and a side of Cajun fries. Definitely more flavor with this! Loved the egg and jalapeño on the burger, and just the right amount of seasoning on the fries. You can tell the meat is good quality here. Service is good too- friendly and quick. Will be back.
The restaurant is always clean... Service is fast and friendly. And their burgers are awesomely tasty, and delicious!
Five Guys on steroids...good  variety of food...milk shakes are delicious...chilli cheese fries were ok not the best but if you have a craving it will do.
There burgers are delicious and there season fries taste so wonderful. I love eatting here. You should really check it out its mmmmmm mmmmmm mmmmmm kind of food.
Delicious food and great atmosphere and great atmosphere. Great Neighborhood Place with friendly staff Nicole is a wonderful hostess and it's almost like going to a friend's house for lunch

I LOVE THIS PLACE!! I came in a few days ago and the food was delicious, the service was even better..an employee Cris was very polite and made sure me and my family had a good experience. I don't usually leave reviews but i was very satisfied with the entire service. Will definitely be going back.

Well this is one of my uncle's favorite burger joints and he happen to take me there for lunch today. I had their chicken sandwich and a order of french fries. They both tasted very delicious! I haven't had a good chicken sandwich since I left New York City and I think this spot is it. I will be back to try their burgers and maybe a chocolate shake. I will definitely recommend them to my family members when they visit me over the summer.

Ordered a cheeseburger with avocado, jalapeño, and giardiniera on it.  Out of all the restaurants that I have ever been to, Meatheads is the most generous with avocado portions.  Meatheads slathered on at least 4 thick slices of avocado- and that made my cheeseburger a 9 out of 10 (one cannot order a hamburger rare at this location.)

The french fry portions are large, they have jalapeño-ketchup, and hot sauce.  These additions help the french fries immensely.  Its not that the french fries are bad, but they do need a little nudge in the right direction.  Recommended: cheeseburger with many toppings.

Since I went to Meatheads for the first time about 1.5 months ago, I'm happy to say I've returned several times since.

As you may expect, Meatheads does something extremely well:  meat! I've had everything from the beef to the chicken to the hot dog and have rarely been disappointed. The menu at Meatheads is similar to the menu at FiveGuys where you customize what you want on your burger but the difference (to me at least) is the ingredients used are of a higher quality. There isn't much more I can say of the fried chicken sandwich besides that it is my go-to place for a fast casual food. Finally, the "New-England" style hot dog isn't for everyone; while it does taste pretty good, I'm going to stick with my Chicago Style Vienna Beef dogs.

Severely underrated are the fries, more specifically the fries with the Cajun seasoning. There are enough in one order to be split between two people and the Cajun seasoning adds a nice kick to what is already a great fry.

My first visit to Meatheads was a pretty good one.  I visited here because I was attemping to visit Hot Doug's at lunchtime (bad plan) and saw the line down the block and around the corner.  Therefore, I had to think fast (my dad was hungry and I had promised him lunch).  

I remembered that there was a Meatheads nearby and we headed directly there.  I was happy to see that they had other options besides burgers, but I forgot that they were similar to Five Guys in the fact that they had HUGE double pattie burgers.  Oops!  I ordered a burger and fries for my dad and a grilled chicken sandwich for me.

I waited at a small counter for the food and it came relatively quickly.  They also came over with a tray of ketchup, mayo and mustard for me to choose in case I needed more condiments (nice touch) since the food was a to-go order.

I have to say that the food was tasty and fresh (though, I will say that the buns got pretty soggy quickly - perhaps since everything was so juicy - but on the chicken??).  The regular order or fries was too much for both of us, but they were nicely cooked with the right amount of soft inside and crunchy outside.  I also had a side of buffalo ranch which was delicious (not sure it's worth an extra 75 cents, but had to try it).

All in all, it was a good visit.  I'm not sure it's quite as good as it's counterparts, but it is fast.  Extra points to the t-shirts that say 'girls can be meatheads, too'.  

One thing that did slightly annoy me was that the girl ordering ahead of me clearly knew the cashier and they were just chatting while a line formed.  I think they could have taken this off-line so as to help the line move a bit quicker.  I am not one to say that talking isn't allowed, but it was the middle of a busy lunch hour and probably not the best time for that.

That was disgusting. So greasy and not much flavor. Fries are decent. 

Do yourself a favor and go somewhere else.

I should mention that the staff was friendly and helpful, and the atmosphere clean and welcoming.  My only complaint is the burgers...at a burger chain.

Congratulations to the whole Meathead crew! My family thinks they have the best burger in Chicago!  The fries are freshly made!  They also have 2 cool design your own Coke machines! 
The place is immaculately clean!! The menus easy to understand and they are also big supporters of local kids sports teams.

 I applaud the ownership for whatever they're doing for training! They are fast fresh food with great service! 

 They are also very family friendly! 

Another tip try the chicken strips!

I'm not a fan of suburban burger chains, but this restaurant serves some really, really good food.  Judging by the umpteen moms and dads with numerous babes in arms, I get this is a popular family chain.  It's a short walk north from the intersection of Western and Belmont (for those of us public transiting it).

A friend tried a couple different hamburgers in the two visits we've made so far, and liked them, though the patties are smashed a la Steak n Shake.  Ordering a double or a triple helps to make a rather paltry burger into a decently sized meal.

The same could almost be said for my chicken sandwich.  Without any additional ingredients, it would've been just a grilled chicken breast on a bun.  So you'll want to order stuff like grilled onions, a slice of tomato, lettuce, sauerkraut (sauerkraut? yeah...don't judge).  They have a long list of stuff you can throw on sandwiches for free, and you can add cheese and a couple other things for a premium.

The fries are wonderful.  Cajun fries, regular fries, chili-cheese fries.  You get the idea.

Shakes.  Haven't tried them, but I imagine they're decent though this is no Steak n Shake.

Clean?  Oh, yeah.

Nice employees?  I saw lots of smiles, and someone came around and asked how we were doing and if there was anything they could get for us.  One employee even brought out different sauces for us to try.

Quick?  Very.  Ordering is easy, and our food came out in about five minutes.

Unlimited sodas?  You betcha.  There are two of those fancy Coke product self-serve machines--the kind with the video monitor and limitless Coke products and flavor additives.  Are there really people who want Ginger-tinged grape soda?  I guess so.

I really like this restaurant.  It's in a hard-to-notice spot in a strip mall (it's wrapped around the south end of the strip mall that can't be seen from the Mariano's parking lot) that's really upgraded itself over the years.  It's about a 10-minute walk south from Lane Tech High School.

Wow really expensive for what you get. Should be called Bigbuns instead, not enough meat for me. I can get a better burger at Hardee's Meh.
Fries are just okay.
Some of the best Cajun fries I've had to date. Went here often while in high school. Offers discounts to students, and the staff is really nice overall

This was my first visit to meatheads and I gotta say, they are way better than 5 guys. They have a similar menu, but a little more to choose from. I got a 1/3 lb burger with American cheese, bacon, mayo and avocado slices. The overall taste of the burger was very delicious. I didn't want it to end! The fries are a million times better than 5 guys too. They aren't soggy or borderline burnt. They are very flavorful and crispy on the outside. I saw that they also have vanilla or chocolate shakes on the menu. I was too full to try that this time, but I would love to try one next time. The kids menu is great. A lot to choose from and the toy that comes with the meal is pretty cool. The cashier made sure other staff had our table ready, clean and with a high chair set up for our toddler.  All of the staff is very friendly and considerate. This is my new go to burger place.
Staff is great and always enjoy the food. Service is fast and always seems really clean.

So, for two straight days, I've made the trip to MeatHeads. It's super close to where I'm working this week and it offers me a chance to take a walk at lunch time. 

Now, the food: Yesterday, I tried the Texas Ranch Burger and the Tenders. Both were pretty good. You can definitely tell that their meat is fresh. The Tenders were also great. 

Today, I wanted to see about the fish. (Fish Fridays). The fish and chips were really good. The fries were amazing too. 

There's a guy here. He has this long hair and he's amazingly funny. Seems like he loves his job a lot. I look forward to running into him the next time I'm here. 

With all that being said, check this place out. Great food.

This was a good treat. Nicole helped us and was very helpful and peraonable. The food was very good and the portions were moderate, didn't leave us too full. We ordered Chicken Reuben and the Cajun Sunrise very good! Our friends had the Hawaiian burger. All were really good. The place is clean with urban decor. Good first lunch stop...

I'm a repeat customer, I didn't like that my grill chicken breast sandwich looked like if it was cut off in half, very thin and nearly noticeable in sandwich.. Not the quality that I usually get in chicken breast.

Sorry Five Guys, but I probably won't be making any trips back to your restaurants in the future.

Not only do Meatheads burgers taste better,  but the burger itself is about 3x bigger. Not to mention the Cajun Fries are some of the best batches of Cajun fries I've ever had. 

Just the overall experience here is great, they bring you your food, they have a Coke Freestyle Machine, and there's always cool music bumpin' in the background. A+ !

Solid burgers- for fast food, quite good.
Chicken sandwich- again, good taste.
Get the regular fries- not Cajun otherwise they are too salty at least for my taste.
Chill cheese dog was good.
Strawberry shake was excellent!

All in all- you'll enjoy the flavorful fast food...and that's a rarity!

Customer service is on point! Everyone is super friendly,  helpful and genuine.  The chicken anything  is delicious and the burgers are juicy but not greasy. I've been here a handful of times as I live down the street and have never been disappointed.

Meatheads has some of the best chicken fingers/tenders in town. Seriously, I consider myself to be an expert in the chicken finger area. This is very fortunate for me, because when it comes to burgers here, I always panic at all the different options and combinations I could make that I usually end up ordering one of the chef-inspired burger. That, or my brain would probably explode. The chef-inspired burgers are excellent though, and one day I will take an hour before I come here and plan to make my own creation, and it will be gloriously meaty and messy. This girl likes her toppings.

And then, wash all of that cow and/or chicken down with some fresh freestylin' Diet Orange Coke from their machine (trust me, it's so bubbly and refreshing and delicious), and treat yourself to a milkshake too. The seasonal banana split I had last week was ridiculous. 

On top of all this (I know, right?), the staff are usually walking around and checking up to see how you're doing. Everyone has been very courteous and friendly. It's pretty rare to see this kind of attentive service at a quick-serve restaurant. And I kind of dig it - makes me feel like a chicken finger huffing princess.

Maybe I was too harsh in my previous review. Stopped in recently for lunch and decided to have a burger. It was really good! The people working behind the counter were also nice. Seems to draw a large crowd on Sunday.

Been to this location many times and always have an amazing experience! Nicole always makes our experience fantastic, she's always friendly and accommodating. I'm usually there with kids and she makes it much less hectic by helping out with whatever we may need!

My first time in a meatheads, and I am very impressed. Not just by the food, which was quick and exactly to order. But I was extremely happy with the service we relieved. 

From the cashier helping us through our orders, another member of the staff running our food out and checking up on is 2 times. Removing our trash when we were finished. And the manager coming to check on us which you would only expect from a higher end restaurant. 

Very impressed that they give back to the community as well. We will be coming back here for sure.

Decent prices for great burgers. Fries taste fresh and not over seasoned. They have different types of specialty burgers that I have not tried yet but will eventually. I usually get the 1/3 lb burger and choose my own toppings. 

There's a set list of "included"/free toppings and a list of toppings for $1 each like avocado, fried egg, etc.

I would compare this to Five Guys but better and cheaper!

The food here is so fresh. I order from here quite often and never had a mess up on the order. The customer service is great and you can customize everything. I found my perfect customized burger, but I did concoct a doozy once. I highly recommend the salad and burgers. The 1/3 burger is thin, but perfect for me since I don't need a huge patty.

My friend and I were at babies r us buying baby shower gifts and wanted something to eat. I didn't know there was a Meatheads in the same plaza and told my friend we should try it. I've heard very good things about this place. I ordered the Cajun surprise and Cajun seasoned fries. My friend ordered the patty melt. Mine was so delicious, I've always wanted to try a burger with a fried egg, and I liked it. My friend really liked her patty melt. The service was outstanding. They bring the food to your table. You can customize your own burger or choose one from a list. They have like 5 or 6 to choose from. I would go there again and try the Texas burger (forgot the exact name). I highly recommend Meatheads.
Double loyalty points on Mondays

My review is base on just one visit so I'll need a few more visits to have a more solid review. That's been said and based on my first visit here are the verdict:
Customer service: Great. The manager addressed my questions regarding the menu and followed up with me while I was eating.
Food: delish and based on their moto and values statement is Angus beef, grass fed Midwestern origin so it have to be good. In fact it was fresh and I can taste the freshness. 
Simple menu based on fresh unpretentious food, but very good. Sometimes simple is better. Will come back definitively.

Wow  I had never had a burger that tasted this good, greasy, and cooked to perfection I mean well-done. For me the French fries in a pie pan also your hamburger comes on a Kraft paper like in a pie pan. How clever now I know what to do with my old pie pans from Baker's Square. Serve lunch in them.   These fries are homecut,fried . The burger  I tried for my first visit was the Texas Ranch- instead of raw onions mine were
 grilled onion's ,lettuce,tomato,cheddar cheese, ranch dressing. & a pickle. The COOLEST pop machine  that looks like a juke box . I had Vanilla Ginger Ale Pop. How cool is that. I would go back again to try there other burgers & more. We went there on 
3-3-14 at 6:00 PM.
Really clean and open restaurant. The staff was super friendly and helpful. I had a Cajun sunrise burger and it was delicious (and messy!) the fries are made fresh and you can tell!!

Just a quick update..
I received such a great message from the manager of
Meatheads, Joe Sanders this morning!

Joe thanked me for writing a positive review..
And.. honestly, I called my visit to Meatheads as I saw it..
And.. it was definitely 5 star worthy!
Great food, A Great Staff, and obviously Meatheads cares
very much about Customer Feedback!

And..okay.. I will be getting a Meatheads T-Shirt sent to me
in the mail from Joe Sanders..:)
Thank You Joe.. and Thanks to everyone over at the Roscoe Village Location..
You have left a great impression on this girl..:)
On my most recent visit I think this place moves ahead of Smashburger on the strength of the blue cheese sauce.  Just excellent burger and fries.

It looks like Five Guys and the menu is presented and priced like Five Guys. The only difference is: It's better than Five Guys. This place surprised the heck out of me, but in a good way. I'm not kidding when I say this place is so similar to Five Guys that I felt like I was in a Parallel Universe. But I can't complain. It my look similar, but the food was a step above. 

 Meatheads offers a variety of delicious Burger Options. I elected to go with the Cajun Sunrise. It was a 1/3 lb Burger covered with Pepper Jack, Jalapeno peppers and a Fried Egg. It may clogged my arteries and taken a few years off my life, but it was well worth it. 

Here's the bottom line: Variety is the spice of life and Meatheads offers something for everybody. The portions are generous, the Burger and ingredients are deliciously fresh and the service was fantastic. It was a wonderful, casual dining experience.

If you have not been to meatheads yet....GO... literally right now! It kicks five guys' ass! Why? 
1. They have CHEESE fries (and chili cheese fries) and theirs do not require ringing out the grease before eating.
2. They have ketchupeno (made in chicago) if you haven't had real jalapeño ketchup be ready bc heinz will never be sufficient again.
3. Everyone is crazy NICE! Especially Chris the manager (?). Sweetest thing ever, he actually cares!
4. You can choose any type of protein like CHICKEN, veggie patties, chicken tenders, ect. But they dont stop there they also have a million toppings and house made sauces to personalize your burger/sandwich.
5. Their meat is 100% all natural and are truly made to order. 
6. It is less expensive than five guys and they have the same amazing soda machines. 
7. They support students and the militaryand we are beyond grateful! 
The only thing I'm upset about is that we've lived here the 3 years this location has been open and we just found out about it today. 
We are already ready to go back tomorrow and Thank you again Chris for your kindness and the amazing customer service you provide, which seems like it's just who you are and you really are that genuine.

As you may have already ascertained from other reviews, it's kind of its own take on Five Guys. You order as you walk in, take a number and then go have a seat. The burgers are large and you can get just about any topping (within reason) added for no extra charge. 
       Lets be honest its pretty easy to get a good burger quickly and on the cheap, in this fair city. However, Meatheads (at least at this locations) does a good job paying attention to the details that make a difference in the competitive semi fast food environment.  
      Firstly, the employees up front are very upbeat which is refreshing. A lot of time when you go to fast food places the employees seem somewhere between indifferent and border line suicidal, not the case with Meatheads. Also, the manager always comes around and checks on you. I've never had any issue, but I get the feeling if I did, he would fix it and not have me fill out a complaint card or something. Lastly, despite the fact that there are a lot of kids here, the room is open enough, that a loud or crying child probably won't drive you crazy. Meathead is an excellent burger option or a good selection for a relatively inexpensive family meal.

Well let's just say this was amazing . I was sitting in my bathroom thinking hmmm what would make my year. Well It Poped in my HEAD let me get something so mouth watering that it brings a tear to your eyes. I hope on my Flinstones bicycle and put on my jean shorts and my HE -MAN jacket and pedaled right over to this kingdom of goodness ,But I first took a deep breath and said THANK YOU JESUS I am at my Kingdom of food. I walked inside and the staff was so nice they said " How can we help you Buddy I was amazed I made a friend. Well then I put my order in and I said give me Burger so JUICY it will make me write a letter to all my friends. My burger came and WOW did it have the FLAVOR explosion that I have been looking for all these years. I Had to take 2 breaks from eating it cause the food was so OUT OF THIS WORLD YUMMY.

Eh, it's ok I guess. The dreaded "A-OK".

Another fast-casual burger joint more in the image of Five Guys has popped up in Chicago.  When I try a place for the first time I usually go for what they're famous for, so I got their take on the classic burger - the Meathead. It was fine. Nothing great, kinda bland.  Wasn't too messy which I enjoyed.  I liked seeing the option of raw onions on the menu.  The cajun fries were pretty good, I would order those over the original ones.

I always enjoy places with futuristic soda machines, good work Meatheads.  Nice nod to the neighborhood with the schedule of high school football games on the wall.

Plenty of parking, as it's in a pretty hidden and empty part of the strip mall.  Now to wait on what will go in the former Blockbuster space.
Awesome food!! Although this is primarily a burger place they do also have some very delicious juicy chicken sandwiches

Great Food for a great price.  I had the Hawaiian burger and it was excellent!  I had a hard time making up my mind on what to get because it all sounds good.  The fries a just okay.  The place was packed on a Tuesday for lunch because there are a lot of high school kids there getting a bit to eat.  If you don't mind that I highly recommend checking this place out.

Retried the sesoned fries, and they finally got it right! Of course, I could not go for only fries. Up to date, I have tried all their specialty burgers and dream about them every now and then. I am sooooo lucky to be five minutes away, YAYYYYY!

Calling all Meatheads!  

Meatheads is now open in Roscoe Village!  And they serve... Meatheads... 

Stopped in for some meat-eats and everything was pretty tasty.  Orders are placed at the counter, and the grub is brought to your table a relatively short time after that.  The space is quick-burger-casual.  

I tried the chicken meathead with mushrooms + pepperjack.  It was a pretty standard, but good, grilled chx sandwich - juicy chx, adequate toppings, plain white bun.  We also ordered some of the cajun fries (with cheese sauce on the side) - I recommend that combo.  Loved the cheese sauce. 

I was disappointed that - despite their name, Meatheads - they do not serve a veggie or turkey burger.  It's clear what their focus is here, but come on... show some love to the veg, and semi-veg patrons.

Fries: decent. Better at other similar burger places. Needed salt or another seasoning perhaps 

Service: pretty great, very friendly.

Burger: umm delicious! Better than other comparable burger type places. The Californian burger is amazing. Loved the wasabi sauce and avocado slices. I had a bite of the burger with pineapple and it was also really great. 

Soda machine: thousands of choices, fun as always.

Dipping sauces: ketchipotle and ketchipeño. Yummy. Chipotle is better in my opinion.

I would give this place 5 stars for the service alone! Everyone who works there is so friendly, and the manager walks around all the time checking on tables. The shop is extremely clean and modern, and the high-tech soda fountain is awesome. There is no blaring metal like at that biker burger bar down the road and the burgers aren't going to cost you $12+, so if quiet conversation is what you're into while you're eating, this is a good place for it. 

The Californian is a favorite and the Cajun fries are must-haves. Being city-dwellers with no yard for grilling, we love that Meatheads is so close for when we want great burgers any time of the year.

This is the place we seem to always stop at right before we go grocery shopping in the Mariano's plaza. You are not supposed to go grocery shopping on an empty stomach, that is just the rules. This is why it is imperative we stop here when we go grocery shopping. Am I right or am I right? I think I am right because all you have to do is try one meal here and I will guarantee you that you will be hooked.

I try to switch up my burger when I eat here (the options seem to be endless). I have not had a bad burger or bad fries! However the coffee shake will ALWAYS be on my order! This is one outstanding accompaniment with any burger and fries combination that you could choose. The price you will pay for a delicious, filling, and satisfying meal is a very good value. I highly doubt that you will dissappointed

I like this place to take the kids for lunch on the weekends. The folks there are super friendly and are constantly working the room to see if you need anything. Every visit a Mgr stops by to see how everything is. They always seem happy too.

Burgerwise, my kids and husband tell me the burgers are great and not too heavy. I go for chicken and the sandwiches are pretty tasty. Great addition to Roscoe Village .

Went here randomly while in the area - will definitely be back.

Burger: A+
All the fixins you need, great quality beef, excellent bread, and fresh. 

Fries: B
The Cajun fries aren't really spicy at all, just seasoned.  Not bad, not amazing.

Shake: B
Although it says hand dipped, the taste reminded me more of McDonalds, and Stake N'Shake puts together a much better milkshake.

Kids Meal: C
The $5.50 kids hot dog meal comes with a foot-long dog - great taste but x3 more than my kid could ever eat.  It's also $1 more to get milk instead of pop, so by the end I looked at the bill and my 3-year-olds meal was the same cost as mine.

So overall- great burgers and hot dogs.  I'd pass on the shakes, and pricing adds up fast.

My third visit in 5 days!  This place is fresh and delicious.  The burgers are so good.  The fries, fantastic!   The staff is so friendly and helpful.  Nothing but smiles at this Meatheads.  Thanks again Meatheads for another awesome visit.

The food here is so good, and the prices are very reasonable. The staff here is wonderful and are always so friendly.  Everyone that works here is so attentive and make such a nice atmosphere. I've always had very positive experiences here. I definitely recommend this place!

The bun wasn't up to the challenge. Toppings slid out and the bun tasted under done.

Really well decorated and great concept. I just found the burger itself to be whatevs.

I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of Meatheads. Their burgers are as good as Five Guys and their location is a lot more convenient. I had a cheeseburger with the works. Next time I will skip the cheese. I doubt I will miss it. 

What most impressed me however was their fries. The litmus test for great fries (and pizza and sake) is whether they are good cold. You can down some crappy fries as long as their hot and you douse them with enough ketchup. But, when lunch was over  and I noticed a handful of cold fries at the bottom of the bag. They were just as good as when they were fresh hot out of the fryer.

Customer service was outstanding. Service was fast and friendly. The restaurant was clean and inviting. 

I'll definitely be back.

As a student of Lane, this place is a gem and is perfect for those days where you have an activity after school and you need a good meal to hold you over. This place is perfect to grab a bite to eat with friends. It is clean, great service, and great food. I LOVE their fries, very generous servings and good meat. Good prices for what you receive.

Meatheads made me cry, literally.  After taking a few bites of the cajun sunrise (sprinkled with hella hot jalapenos), my eyes were watering, and this mildly lactose intolerant girl was screaming for some milk.  So yeah, the jalapenos were at fault, not meatheads, but nonetheless, the burger was just meh.  The 1/3 lb burger consists of two thin patties - just squish 'em together and make it THICK!  Sure, there are a lot of toppings, but it felt like a McDonald's burger dressed up for Halloween - just a pretty costume, but nothing special inside.  On the plus side, cashiers and servers are super friendly.  Also, the regular sized fries are plentiful, and come with cajun seasoning if your tastebuds can handle it.  For me, it was just adding to the jalapeno pain.

Took my kids there the other night and was upset we had not come before! The fact that they have a coke freestyle machine made my kids love it even more. The fries were a huge order, so I said, good thing we didn't order more than one. The server said, I wouldn't have let you order a second. Love that honesty and the fries were crispy and yummy. The hamburgers were delicious, but the name definitely made us wonder exactly what was on the menu. You can also get a hot dog, chicken and salads, so maybe it should have their tagline, more than just hamburgers! We'll be back.
Good patty melt and buffalo chicken. Little pricey maybe for a corner burger place but worth hit'n once in a while. I would come back if in the area.

I ordered a cheeseburger with cajun fries which ran about $9 and really enjoyed my meal.  I didnt think it was awesome though.  They use quality meat and cook the burgers right.  The cajun fries left me longing for more seasoning but they were also cooked right and of the thin-style which I prefer and very good portion size.  Condiment options such as ketchipotle really went well with them.  Service was excellent and free wi-fi is provided.  All in all, a worthy option and I will be back.
The meat is delicious, the place is spotless, and the employees are super friendly. Keep up the good work! I'm thrilled to have this restaurant so close to my house.
Ordered the ranch burger it was delicious!  Service was fast and staff was super friendly! I would definitely recommend this restaurant!

I love coming here! My order was only messed up once, I was given the wrong to go order. When I called to speak to the manager he apologized and it was veey nice. It was a sunday I understood,  he asked for my address and sent me a giftcard! It was nice and we will keep coming again and again.

Consciously I have been avoiding burger places.  Burgers are bad right?  Beef = clogged arteries, bigger pants, maybe even sweat pants.

But Meatheads is walking distance to my house.  I had to try it.

My wife and the boys have been there before.  The self-select drink machines drives my 5 year old mad.  He does a little dance when we are filling his drink.

I liked it.  Burgers were fresh, fries were fresh cut.  A nice alternative to those moments when you guiltily go through the drive-thru at McDonalds, hoping not to see someone you know, someone in better shape... Jogging past you as you pay for $25 worth of food there.

I had a regular burger but want to try some of the more creative options at some point.  I'll still try to avoid burgers with all my will, but eventually I'll go again.

Finally a Burger that compares to Portillo's!!  Fresh, perfectly cooked and juicy.  

Service is great as well.  The manager seems to be really on his game as he checked on everyone to make sure they were happy...Which is very unusual in fast food-type place.  In addition, we arrived right in the middle of school lunch break.  The order still came out fast and the whole restaurant was surprisingly clean.

Looking forward to making this a regular stop.

I enjoyed the food at Meatheads.  The menus was less confusing than Five Guys which can be overwhelming.

I got the 1/3 pound burger with the works and cheddar cheese.  It was nice and juicy.  The burger fell apart as I was trying to eat it.  My brother was really excited to see that they had fresh jalapeños as a topping.  I got an order of the cajun fries which was regular fries covered in season salt.

I love the décor.  Even though Meatheads is a chain they have nice touches to remind you that you are in Roscoe Village.  They have a wall with the basketball scores from the local high school teams.  I also love the collage of pictures from around the neighborhood.  It gives Meatheads a local touch.

Meatheads is new on the block, but already a favorite! I really enjoyed the 1/3lb Texas ranch burger but would probably opt for a larger patty next time. The burger was fresh and well made- Meaning it wasn't falling apart and all of the toppings were placed with care. You can tell that the kitchen takes pride in their food. I also really liked the fries they serve. Go for the Cajun fries!!

They also serve other menu items, not just burgers. I am definitely going to try their chicken sandwich next time I visit. I only drank water on my visit, but i noticed that they had two Coca-cola freestyle machines where you can create like 100 different varieties of soft drink. 

Go to Meatheads. You're going to like it!

Now they have a great salad for $5. This salad is perfect, fresh and has several dressings. I like the bacon ranch. It comes with blue cheese but you can have it made with cheddar or several other cheeses. This is the perfect lunch salad and the price makes it extra good. In, out, and consistently fresh. Best $5 salad in the city.

mmm yummy burgers, you gotta love it.  To me, Meatheads is comparable to Five Guys style.  Nice and messy burgers with the works.  The fries were good too.

This spot also had that cool soda machine where you can 'make your own' soda flavors with Coke products.

Clean and casual restaurant with fast service and a friendly, helpful staff!

Great neighborhood burger option.  Most similar to 5 guys but the space is more upscale which also echo's the "just a bit" higher prices.  

Tried the regular 1/3 lb burger with cheese + grilled onions.  Double thing patty and very fresh ingredients.  Size is bigger than M Burger downtown and about the same size as 5 guys, maybe a tad bigger.  Taste = delicious!!!

We also tried the Texas style ranch burger which was a great alternative.  We liked that they had pre-set burgers with fun combinations.

We also tried a side of cajun fries which are thin-cut and crispy with a side of cheese.  The cheese was alright, a bit watered down but I don't know if there are many cheese sauces I haven't loved.  

Def returning to this great burger spot.  A great alternative to the "gourmet" burger and definitely a cut above your standard McD's

Just an initial cause I've only tried it once..First Off, great customer service!! They take care of their customers, that's for sure!  I got it "to go" near closing so maybe that had something to do with my order?  Got Original Meathead with everything & Fries to go.. everything was prepared as ordered but for some reason the burger just lacked flavor?  On the other hand, the fries were really good! Must Try Item.. I'll def go back and update this review at a later date--GTFJD

This was my first visit, went wit my buddy Luis! We both tried signature burgers and truly enjoyed them!! they use fresh fresh ingredients especially the sliced jalapenos!!!
VERY FRIENDLY STAFF!! We were approached several times to see if all was good and boy was it!!! If you have questions about the menu they are very knowledgeable about each and every sandwich and ingredient!!
A step up from fast food and an economical place to bring kids. A good value with clean facilities and free re frills on drinks.

This was the first time I have been to Meatheads and it overwhelmingly reminded me of Five Guys.  It's not necessarily a bad thing, but the comparison is made more easily.  I would say that they beat Five Guys on the burger, especially on presentation and topping variety.  I wish they had taken a different direction with the fries, since the Cajun seasoning is very similar and the fries seemed less substantial.  The Freestyle Coke machine here was pretty fun and is a big reason why I would return.  I'd also like to try the milkshakes next time.

A tip if you're coming here at lunch, you should probably avoid coming between 11:45am and 1:00pm since it's likely to be bombarded by Lane Tech students during the school year.  The interior is really nice otherwise with lots of room for seating, especially large groups.  Also, there are no open boxes of peanuts lying around for those worrying about that. :)

Update: I came in again, this time at 12:15pm Tuesday and the students had cleared out by that point.  I guess it's random on when they are busy, but the grand opening traffic has probably died down enough to not worry about what time to come in.  Also had a banana split milkshake this time, which was great!

Nothing extremely "wrong" with this place...staff were nice, it was clean, food cooked ok, BUT food tasted blah. It should have been like a cross between epic burger and five guys but was just bland. Very greasy. Wouldn't go back. Seemed popular amongst the family/soccer team genre.

Decided to try this new location today.  I've been to the location at the Streets of Woodfield and was excited when I found out one was opening in Roscoe Village.  We ordered our burgers, fries, & shakes upon walking in and were given a number to put at our table so that our order could be brought out to us.  I did ask if they cook their burgers well done and was told they cook them medium well to make sure they're juicy but that there is no pink left in them.  That's exactly what I got so I was happy.  My burger was tasty and my shake was yummy.  The fries were okay... just a little too skinny for my taste.  I really enjoyed it and will be back.
Difficult to find since it's hidden but so worth the little extra effort.  Good burgers with large portions of fries, very nice decor.

Good things:
- The location is so weird at the very end of the shopping plaza, but plenty of parking! 
- Dead on a Sunday night, so no waiting in line and food came out super fast
- Pretty decent tasting burgers
- Clean
- Friendly 

Bad things:
- Price for the amount you actually get - 2 specialty burgers, 1 Regular fry (the guy said you could split one btwn 2 people, not true if you are hungry!) and 2 sodas = $21!! The burger itself wasn't worth $8 for a fast food burger. 
- I'm not a fan of those fancy new 100 different ways to drink your soda machines. They just make everything taste off. I got a regular coke and it had a fruity flavor. 
-Dead on a Sunday night - might be a sign it's overpriced or not worth it. 

I might come back if I'm in the area, but if I want a fast burger, fry and coke I'll go somewhere else.

Disappointing. I had the Californian, it's over priced, bland, and the patties were really thin. With so many good burger places and with the price being 7.50 for JUST the burger I would recommend another burger joint. I won't be back.

"If I didn't want to be fat all the time, I would eat here all the time."  
(First thing to come out of my mouth after my Meatheads experience).

I love Meatheads. Great service--and quick. Custom Burgers made to order. Really, what more can you want?

I had a customized Meatheads burger--angus beef patty, ketchup, mustard, and mayo, lettuce, pickles, American cheese, and onions (I ordered my onions raw, but ended up with grilled--no biggie for me).  I did 1/3 pound (2 patties) as opposed to 1/2 (3 patties...that's just crazy talk).  This is my perfect burger. 

I split an order of REGULAR (regular feeds two--large feeds 4) cajun fries and cheese sauce with the hubs. The cajun fries were delicious and the cheese sauce was a little spicy--the combination was amazing. 

Did I mention that they have a Freestyle coke machine? SCORE! Cherry Vanilla Coke Zero with my burger? Heck yes. Usually I can only use a Freestyle machine at the theater on Western...I was practically in heaven. 

On another note, the place is incredibly clean and the bathrooms are very nice. Go to the bathroom--the sink faucet water "pleasantly pours over your hands"  (yep, that's a direct quote as well).

In summary, an awesome, wonderful, and super cute girl once said, "If I didn't want to be fat all the time, I would eat here all the time."

I regress.  Earlier, I wrote a so-so review on Meatheads.  I was given a comp card to retry my experience and it was fantastic.  Burger wasn't messy or greasy (but juicy) and it all held together nicely.  The Hawaiian was very tasty and the jalapenos were a nice, spicy touch.  You actually do have a good selection of toppings to customize your burger and I recommend the specialty ones.

Kudos MH's.  Your customer service is second only to your great food.

I was pleasantly surprised by this place. Very clean, incredibly helpful and friendly staff, simple menu, nice layout, easy parking, and the food was very good. It's not the best tasting or most creative burger in the world, but that's not what it's aiming for. It's just all-around really solid food if you're craving a cheeseburger (which is pretty much every other day for me) but you don't want either fast-food or a bar. I also like that it was very family-friendly, there were a lot of kids there. I'll be back.

I was not impressed with this place. The half pound burger was not one thick juice burger, it was three thinner pieces of meat on one bun. For 2 burgers, 2 fries, and 2 medium cokes it was $25.00. To me it is just an over priced steak and shake. I will say it was clean restaurant and friendly staff, but was disappointed with the burger being 3 pieces.

Had the Texas Ranch Burger which was presented perfectly and quite heavenly the way it just melted in your mouth. I loved the different take on fresh cut fries... they were shoe string and not soggy at all :)  atmosphere was great and the staff were friendly. We will definitely be back!

I think this is one of my favorite places in Chicago. The food is fresh and the service is amazing. The manager is always walking around or bringing food out and checking on his customers. Being from California, I always hear people complaining about how they miss In-N-Out (which I think is lame, but whatever). I always explain this place as an In-N-Out meets Five Guys. The fries are fresh cut and on the skinny side, and there is a large selection of free toppings that you can add to your burger. I wish it was just a little cheaper, but it normally comes out to about the same as going to a chain sit down restaurant, but MUCH better! SO worth it!

Things have certainly improved since my last visit.  It turns out that after asking one of the staff, I was told that they take reviews seriously and make adjustments to their methods.  Interesting.....

Seriously, this place! It's killing me. I attempted to visit Bang Bang in Logan, but to my dismay it was closed when I went. Now, I have had Bang Bang's biscuits....at Honey Butter Fried Chicken. It was for a collaboration they did and it was frucking delicious. I have also had Bang Bang pie....at Parson's. Hmmmm. I am just now seeing the pattern myself. Anyhow....

So you see, I was familiar with Bang Bang's delicious offerings. I've just never enjoyed them at their actual brick & mortar....until today. This location opened not too long ago. It's a lot closer to me than Logan Square so SCORE! 

I met my pal for lunch and I have to say, this could be new favorite lunch spot. They had some acoustic guitar action going on, which was quite nice. I like the mix of cafe tables, casual couch seating and communal picnic table seating. 

But the biscuit specials! Whoa. They all sounded wonderful. I woofed down my biscuit sandwich which consisted of candied bacon, collard green, poached egg and hot sauce. I'm also declaring the best hash browns ever. A slice of butterscotch meringue pie to-go rounded out my order. 

Clearly, it was carb day today. But everyday is carb day at Bang Bang and I will be back to represent!

I have made the trek out to the Logan Square shop twice; it was worth the wait, but one helluva of a ride on public transit - 65 minutes! When I found out they opened a second location closer to me, I was through the moon. Now it only takes me a brief walk and a bus ride - a trip totaling 25-30 minutes - to get my hands on those delectable biscuits. Plus, the lines at the Logan Square shop can get ridiculously long, while the Ravenswood shop has the perfect balance of busy, but a shorter wait time. 

Since white carbs are my favorite food group, it's no surprise that Bang Bang's infamous biscuits have landed on my list of top eats in Chicago. They are soft, buttery and melt-in-your-mouth levels of deliciousness! Plus, I love the rotating selection of flavored butters and seasonal jams that accompany the biscuits.

Bang Bang does offer a quality pie selection, but I admit that nothing I have had so far has jumped out at me or caught my attention the way their biscuits have. I think First Slice and Mama Hoosier's are equally as good - if not better in some areas - hence why I cannot give Bang Bang the full five stars. 

But the real star at Bang Bang are those biscuits. Dare I say the best in Chicago?

Really good biscuits and pies, paired with the worst coffee known to man. 

Will come back. But will bring my own café.

Love this place! A little out the way for us but so glad we made the trip.

What we ordered: 
Harvest Grits - The best way I can describe this is "fall in a dish". Anything and everything that reminds you of fall you can experience with this.  highly recommend.

Avocado biscuit - meh! skip this. I actually enjoyed eating these separately.  I ended up separating the avocado and had the biscuits after asking for some jam and butter on the side. 

brisket biscuit - GET THIS! hubs' order.  very tasty and he was happy with it.  He also stated that the pickle that it came with is was one of the best he's had. 

Service was excellent here.  You basically order, take a seat and they bring the food for you.  They were still very attentive even though they didn't have to be!  One of the waiters even made a list of recommended restaurants for us with the few days we had left.

Just wow, the food here and the casual communal environment here is great. 

My favorites are the "Chicken Pot Pie" and the "Biscuits and Gravy". I highly recommend you try this place if you're in the neighborhood, I have never been to the original Pie and Biscuit location, but if this little shop is any reflection of it, then it must taste amazing.

I would definitely come again for a casual meal with friends.

*This is more like 4.5 and probably will be a 5 after one more visit.

Being a bang bang aficionado there is no question I had to come to a place with "Bang Bang" in their name and boy oh boy am I glad that I did (for those unaware of the glory that is a bang bang, I recommend Googling "Louis CK bang bang" for further education on the subject). I was hoping to go to their original location first since I prefer trying the first spot to open for an establishment before checking out additional locations, but I was running out of time in Chi and was within walking distance from here so this location had to do. Man oh man, it was so freaking good!

I walked in and was greeted by the smells of freshly baked biscuits and I already felt I was in store for something special. Their sausage biscuit with lavender blue berry jam, plus an added egg, was ridiculously good. You know those moments when you first taste something and it's just undeniably good. This was one of those moments. It brought smiles to my face with each bite. I would like to try their other biscuits which sound fantastic too, but I would have to get this one again first next time.

Unfortunately, I was not the biggest fan of their chocolate pecan pie, which sounded great. It was very moist, but way too sweet and molasses-y for my liking. Aside from that and in addition to the stupendous sausage biscuit, the staff was really nice and the space had a warm, funky, and inviting feel to it. Can't wait to come back next time I'm in town!

Small and cozy hipster-esque nook in Lincoln Square...

What I did enjoy-

-Very friendly staff that made a point of greeting everyone that walked in the shop.  We were even greeted with free samples upon arrival.
-Cute leather couch and fireplace in the middle of the café that gave it a "homey feel".
-You do not have to bus your own table at the end.
-Biscuits were delicious...imagine a McDonalds breakfast biscuit only on a gourmet level.  The jelly and butter that accompanied it were very tasty.

Why I gave it only 3 stars-
-The menu was pretty small and I found the food to be pretty bland overall.
-The grits had no seasoning.  I found myself adding quite a few shakes of salt.
-I really cannot speak on the pie as I didn't try it.  There was no way for me to see the pies before ordering so I wasn't going to chance it.

This place was amazing. We came in just before closing time and they let us stay. We asked for them to guide us through the menu and make recommendations since it was our first time.

We had the avocado and ham biscuit sandwiches, fancy grits, pecan pie, honey pie, and peach pie. 

All of it was amazing. Come hungry, add egg, add bacon, enjoy.

I was so excited to see that they opened a bang bang in Ravenswood! 

The restaurant is bigger than the Logan Square location, but without the outdoor seating. 

There is one large communal table, a couch area that could fit about 4-5 and then a few small tables in the front. 

The restaurant is clean, but I don't think they have a/c, it was pretty hot in there. I wish they had longer hours, they close so early!

This place is located right next to a popular breakfast and brunch spot called Over Easy. We stopped by this place as the wait for Over Easy was approximately an hour. This place was cute and the ingredients in their food was fresh. 

We ordered the candy bacon and gravy. The gravy came in tin to-go container consisting of two biscuits with their gravy smothered in top and sausage sprinkled all around the biscuits. The candy bacon was good. Not too sweet either and it made the flavor of the bacon pop! The gravy was delicious as well combined with the biscuit and sausage. It was hard to keep that all food on the fork. We washed it down with strawberry lemonade. It was tart but still good. You can add sugar to it as well if it is too tart for you.

To clarify, this review is only for their coffee. The food is phenomenal!
