I just have the hardest time justifying $4.50 for a cup of large Iced Coffee...Yikes!

Yum!  Came here with 2 friends for a late lunch on a Saturday.  We had the brisket biscuit, ham biscuit, and the chicken pot pie as our meals.  Their biscuits are so good, I didn't even really need the sandwich fillings.  My brisket biscuit had a lot of meat...like...maybe too much.  And I like meat...but hey, too much is better than too little, so I'll just stop there.  Then, we shared 2 slices of pie - the butterscotch meringue, and the special which was a chocolate vanilla malt pie.  OMG.  Both were so good!  I took a slice of the chocolate vanilla malt home to my husband and shared it with him.  I like this location - no wait, more inside seating, and much more comfortable than the Logan Square spot.

What a delicious addition to the neighborhood.  The environment is casual yet inviting and friendly. My bacon biscuit (with added avocado) was amazing.  The service was friendly and efficient. I'll be back to try a pot pie or another biscuit for sure!

What an adorable place to get a slice of good 'ol pie.

First of all the decor is adorbs. Secondly the people who work there are also adorbs (hellooo hipsters). Most importantly their pie is delish, although on the sweet side. My friend and I shared a slice of the lemon chess pie with pistachio and the passion fruit. Passion fruit is BOMB guys, gotta get it! Definitely wanna go back and try their biscuits.

I have a few complaints though: why am I paying $5 to $6 for a sliver of pie? I mean it's good for my waste line but how can you deny people the joy of pie? Also, why are you closed at 4pm on the weekends? I want dessert after dinner, damn it!

Oh well, guess I can't complain because their pies are pretty damn good :P

What can I say that hasn't already been said about the bang bang pie franchise? It's just plain delicious.

Went in after a trip on the brown line (never realized there was one closer to us) and couldn't wait to get everything... 

Problem is, you can order a lot not realizing your eyes are too big for your stomach.  We fell victim of this circumstance during this run unfortunately.

Ordered the "Smokin Chix" and the "fancy grits". Never realized blueberries could complement the cheesy concoction, but it was a nice marriage of salty and sweet. Add some hot sauce, and you have nirvana. 

Chicken was cooked perfectly. Super juicy with a crispy skin.

DAMN that is some GOOD BISCUITS-n-PIE!  You can get just a biscuit with the regular stuff like jam/butter/honey or get one with more interesting toppings. The Hubs & I each tried a different biscuit topping and loved them both.  Their biscuits are often described as being like pound-cake but not as sweet and I'd say that is a good description but I'd just go with HEAVENLY PERFECTION in biscuit form.  We also planned on sharing a piece of pie, and did, but lucky us we got a slice for free which was nice.  The lady who brought it over said it was because it was our first time there but I think it was a combo of that & the fact that we had just walked many blocks in an absolute downpour thunderstorm to try them for breakfast.  Whatever the reason it was a much appreciated and promptly devoured slice of Key Lime Pie.

The only thing holding me back from giving them 5 stars is the communal seating.  Sorry, not a fan of that type of seating, especially when it's a place that is popular and often busy/crowded.  Yes, you can cram a few more bodies in with the communal seating but my misanthrope self doesn't want to get chummy with the other diners or listen in on whatever gossip/drama the gals next to us are discussing.  Oh well.  The deliciousness of the food temporarily distracted me from the sardine seating. ;)

Went on a beautiful weekday morning. Plenty of seating and a friendly face at the counter who walked us through some recommendations.  $35 later we received our food. That's when I understood the divided yelp comments on this place. 

We had the biscuit w/ sausage and egg. It was easily enough for two regular appetites. The biscuit was very good and very dense. The sharp cheese on the sausage was a nice flavor hit, but all together it was surprisingly bland. Ditto on the "not so fancy cheddar cheese grits". Even with a dousing of the supplied hot sauce, they were just okay. 

Then we bussed our table. 

Overall impression: solid, but not stand-out, food. And about 25% too pricey for what you receive. Nice neighborly ambiance.

My friend lives close by so we decided to come by for brunch. Several biscuit varieties available. The sausage biscuit is ok. Biscuit itself is nice consistency and soft. Sausage patty was a little hard. The maple bourbon pecan pie was phenomenal. Such a great balance of flavors, with a nice crunch!
Love the biscuit concept, worth the wait

I commend Bang Bang's service team this a.m. 

I already knew the food was going to be excellent, having purchased a to-go pie a few months ago. My boyfriend and I came in this a.m. hoping for a quick, in and out breakfast. As anticipated it was busy, but the lack of seating was due to customers lingering and socializing. The staff members kept track of our position in "cue" to be seated, and rather than rushing loitering custumers, they secured us get priority seating, then awarded our patience with a slice of their excellent pie.

My boyfriend isn't a fan of restaurants whose procedures call for customer purchase, then seating, but due to this service team's dilligence and consideration, this was pleasant experience and we will be guaranteed regulars.

Thanks again for the wonderful experience, staff!

Bang bang, delicious.

Small, cozy spot dishing out mad biscuits. Try a daily special to spice things up. There's not much more to say about this spot that hasn't already been said. Tasty, filling (this is a 'special treat' kinda place for me), decently priced. Maybe a little more ventilation would do them good, cause I walked out smelling like bacon biscuits?

Great staff, to boot.

Cashier was very happy and just brings a smile to my face. I like that you can see the cooks working. If you're familiar with software development, you can say it's open sourced (ha ha). 

I ordered the key lime pie due to others recommendation. Very tasty. Unfortunately the serving size is quite small for the $5 price. Nonetheless it's still very tasty. I had a previous meal, so for dessert it's very satisfying.

Not really. Place to work, but more for groups. Quite loud.
In for breakfast this morning  and the Gravy and sausage biscuit with everything was delicious. Had a bite if the cheezy grits as well, yum.

"Please sir I want some more." (Charles Dickens, 1837) This is what you will be saying after a visit to BBP&B shop.

There is more than a whiff of the deep South here. Biscuits and gravy are delicious. The gravy is the creamy kind you find on chicken fried steak and is said to be vegetarian. It has a peppery kick and is served over a soft biscuit, with a hard biscuit on the side. Cheesy grits are delicious. The grits have bite and substance and the cheese smooths the dish out. Rhubarb pie has icing, something I haven't seen before, but when it comes to desserts, pile it on. The crust is crispy and there is some tartness left in the pie from the rhubarb (but not a lot; it's very very sweet, almost too sweet).

Service is very friendly, the kind that calls you by name. The shop is small but has a number of nice features, like a sofa, fireplace, communal table, and a chandelier. It will be extremely cozy during the long Chicago winter. In the meantime, I am sure Bang Bang will make a splash, in Ravenswood or wherever it chooses to open a new location.

Let me get this out of the way: FIRST FIRST FIRST FIRST FIRST

Imagine that goes on for awhile, also that I'm chanting it triumphantly on my couch. Couch is long and blue. I'm wearing some new jeans that have really energized me.

7:50 a.m. In bathtub. Boyfriend is creaking around, up earlier than usual. He pokes his head in. He says he has an idea. Me: Bang Bang Pie? Him: Well...Me: yes! 

Actually, he wants ME to go to Bang Bang, collect savory breakfast items ("one savory AND one sweet."), and return. I get dressed. 

8 a.m. Small unrelated fight. I refuse to get breakfast out of principle.

8:10 a.m. We hug it out. 

8:30 a.m. Not unreasonable line at Bang Bang. Many baby carriages. The wind is colder than normal, colder than May. I relax outside, unconcerned by the line. Various neighborhood residents shuffle the strollers around, snap them closed. 

8:35 a.m. Inside Bang Bang. Unlike Over Easy, the atmosphere is surprisingly relaxed. Since Dolce closed, I missed the tin ceiling here and the subway tile to the ceiling. Even though there is a line, it is moving quickly and efficiently. This is not their first rodeo (or location.) Their staff is trained, friendly and efficient. The neighborhood has missed this café. We are happy to have a new coffee shop, excited it also has food, cautious it might all be taken away at any moment. Credit cards are being swiped with no complaints.

8:40 a.m. Taking in the menu, the food is a lot less portable then I had hoped. Other than the chicken pot pie, I don't see any vegetarian savory pies. I hope for more portable savory options in the future. But I'm happy to see carry-out packing is on point: paper bags with handles, they have made it what seems to not be portable food very convenient and easy to transport.

8:45 a.m. Already ordering! the owner (or manager) is super friendly and relaxed, makes a point of introducing himself and asking if I live in the hood. I scooped a yogurt and granola from the fridge, don't miss this bonus material. Otherwise you'll notice the food is leaning on the heavier side, appropriate for the concept ...Got the fancy grits and chicken and biscuit to go. They have cleared out the space in an intelligent way to make room for waiting and foot traffic. One long farm table mostly occupied by families with many small children, addition to some traditional two tops and the fireplace lounge area. So glad they kept that. The only design decision I don't really agree with is building a wood facade up to the ceiling around the fireplace. A lot of money for no good reason, covering up the beautiful brick chimney. 

8:47 a.m. Self-serve coffee? Is this heaven? Also love that they have one huge thing of whole milk. They even have a little carafe of almond milk, acknowledging whatever that means for you. 

9 a.m. Eating at home, the grits are great - substantial in portion size, I would get some extra hot sauce to go next time, it's delicious! the collard greens are lovely but I could've used a few more veggies. I love poached eggs so I'm glad that is the standard option here. I didn't try the chicken and biscuits so I can't speak to that, but I love pimento cheese. 

9:25 a.m. Excited to try bang bang again, next time I'm just going to go for the classic biscuit and jam, only three dollars, and maybe supplement with an egg. 

Welcome to Ravenswood, Bang Bang, the most polite neighborhood in Chicago.

Disappointed since this is really a cute hipster stop in Lincoln Square and I love pie & biscuits.  

Service was fine but the pie and biscuits were just not that great for the price.  There is so much hype surrounding BBP that I guess I had higher expectations.  Biscuits had a nice texture and size but they were way to salty and accompanied by a less than stellar runny flavorless jam.  Pie was good but not great especially with a $5 price per slice.  

I've just had much better pie at a lower cost elsewhere in the city.

All of it. Amazing. Fantastic. Have never eaten (since the first time at the original bang bang) such amazing and delicious biscuits. We had the amazing BLT with candied bacon and fresh tomatoes. We had a pie flight of every kind of pie they were serving that day.  We had the grits of the day.  Oh my gosh I've never eaten pickled blueberries which were on top of the grits! Along with corn fresh off the cob and some feta cheese. Oh my gosh so delicious. And the staff from the manager to the chef who was busy teaching his next assistant they all rock. Love this location. Bigger. Love the decor. Love the food. Love the people who work there. Loved our experience. Can't wait to go again.

I heard so many great things about the Logan Square location, so when this location opened up down the street from my place I HAD to check it out. It definitely lives up to the hype. 

I got the avocado buiscut - amazing! The buiscut is so fluffy and buttery, the avocado is smooth and the bites of pepper really add a freshness to it. I was worried the cheese would overpower it, but it really blends nicely. Absolutely recommend this. Can't wait to go back and try everything else on the menu!

Brought my daughter here, and we liked everything about it.  We ordered Avocado Biscuits and they were delicious, and shared a slice of Chocolate Chess Pie for desert.  The staff is very friendly, and the place lends itself to being social with family style seating, and the Velvet Underground softly playing in the background.  Can't wait to go back.

i am soooo happy that Bang Bang opened up another location AND it's not too far from my place.
We arrived on a sunday morning, it was a bit nerve wracking seeing all the people outside but it is next to a breakfast place and everyone outside was waiting for that place.

We waited in line for a few minutes and settled on the bacon biscuit sandwich and i got chicken pot pie.
Both were so delicious!! I usually don't like chicken pot pie but you can tell that their pie is made with quality ingredients and love.

I can't wait to come back and try everything else!

So so good. If you live anywhere close, or not even if you live close go here. Today I had the Wedge Biscuit and holy cow. The combination of flavors made this the best thing I've eaten in a long while. 

Also, don't skip an order without the hashbrown. It's a bit of goodness that everyone should try.

A very cool find! I've lived in Chicago for two years, but had never heard of Bang Bang Pie & Biscuits. My sister (visiting from NC) and I came in after reading about this place's s'mores pie on Buzzfeed. Go figure! We had a great experience.

When we came in, we got a good look at the super simple menu, were greeted and bantered with by the fun cashier, and we got to set up our own little table and chairs area near the self-serve water/silverware station.

Food was awesome. Biscuits were heavy and big, like a buttery, melty pound cake consistency but less sweet. Strawberry jam (my favorite!) was in season. I had the candied bacon too which was pretty great. I would've liked it crispier, but it was my first time having candied bacon, so I'm not sure if it's ever served that way.

The pie was every bit as good as Buzzfeed said it would be. My sister, a known chocoholic, got the s'mores, and I got the tart, creamy key lime. Both were smash hits for us.

Can't wait to visit this place again in the fall and winter to try out the rotating flavors... I'm hoping for a pumpkin pie or an apple pie. Too cool! Will definitely recommend to locals and tourists.

Overpriced. Their chicken sandwich was way too much for the size it was- it wouldn't even fill a toddler up. Grits were ok but again overpriced. I will say their pie is tasty and their service is good- but definitely not a bang for your buck.

I've been here twice now and love their pies! I've had the chocolate chess, chocolate pecan and Boston banana cream. All were delicious. My son loves the snicker doodle cookies. Service is great as well as the layout and decor.

So this review is based on the food, service and overall experience at this place of business. The service staff seems knowledgeable and very friendly.  The food that was ordered. Which consisted of a wedge and biscuit and a gravy and biscuit we're good. Although the amount of lettuce could not be considered a wedge. It was more like a one by 4 inch section of a head of lettuce. It did taste good. Just didn't feel like the value for the money. My dining companion ordered the biscuits and gravy. Which was tasty, although a little bit over spiced with the pepper and I'm guessing the worlds smallest egg on top.

The orange juice was fresh. The black flavored iced tea was good although a tad bitter. 

As for the space. It's a very charming and very hipster farm concept. The large communal table although very cute. Honestly does not utilize the amount of space they have to offer for people to sit down and enjoy their product . People with laptops , papers. People saving spaces. Another problem with the lack of seating is no fault of the restaurant , but , with the way you order and then go sit down to have your food brought to you. The problem that was happening was that one person would arrive early from their party. Order a drink. Then go sit down at an open seat. And hold the table space until their friends got there to get in line and order what they wanted. The only problem with this is people that were ahead of them in line their food was coming out and they had nowhere to sit. I only noticed it happen twice. And both parties seemed only slightly miffed.

So overall. For me three stars. If I lived in the neighborhood. Didn't have to wait 25 minutes just to order. And I could find a seat when I came in. I probably wouldn't give it a higher rating.  The food was good. Nothing to write up in a paper about. Just honest good food

I may give it another shot during the week. When the weekend brunch crowd is not overwhelming the restaurant

I moved to the neighborhood recently, and was super excited to see the new Bang Bang just around the corner. The shop is very cute, and the staff was super friendly and helpful each time I visited, but in my experience so far, the food has been... not good. Not good at all.

Over the last month I have tried 4 items: 2 chicken pot pies, a slice of peach pie, and a slice of orange dreamsicle pie. The first pot pie was truly bad. It was smaller than I had expected for $9, the chicken filling was almost pure white -- no flavor whatsoever -- and there were hardly any veggie bits to help mitigate. I thought the chicken was wildly overcooked. The crust was fine.

The second pot pie (I assumed the first was a fluke, that is how bad it was) was marginally better. The filling had a bit of color this time, more veggies, and even a hint of some type of herby seasoning. It tasted like a completely different recipe. The crust was fine again, but man does not live on crust alone.

There will be no third pot pie :( and I am legitimately sad about this because two of my greatest joys in life are pot pies and spending way too much money on things.

The sweet pies were both too sugary, and lacking the kind of deep or complex flavor I would expect for the price point. Next time I will just eat a poptart.

I have not tried the biscuits or the coffee, and I doubt I will any time soon.
Try the honey pie and fancy grits. You will NOT be disappointed. Excellent and welcoming staff. Top restaurant in Chicago.

The biscuit plain is amazing. The biscuit with gravy was wholy black pepper. It was overwhelming peppery which was a turn off for me but if you love black pepper this is the biscuit for you. Now I do like the bacon. The not fancy grit were ok. The ice coffee  was really good and the cinnamon roll was really good, it was moist, and the cream cheese was light and went with the whole fluffiness of the roll.

This place was delicious!  You have to wait in line outside to order at the counter, but they bring the food to your table. Lots of options of different biscuits with toppings and pies. I have lots of food allergies, so I went the simple route of a biscuit and a piece of the milk chocolate pie. Both were delicious and well worth the wait. I had wanted scrambled eggs with mine, but they only have one type of egg (can't remember offhand, sorry)!  I'd say that was the biggest downfall. You can eat inside or outside. The outdoors area is much nicer and has a ton of space...as long as you don't mind eating in benches. But it's rustic and fun and definitely worth it to try. They also just opened one in ravenswood.

I never got around trying out their Logan square location, but this one is better because within footsteps of home. Their biscuits is soft and moist unlike any other biscuit I've ever had. Almost like a cake but much more body to it. 

I had the hot chix biscuit sandwich- spicy full of mexican spice flare. Pickles added a nice balance with acidity sweetness, and mouthy lubrication to the biscuit and chicken.

For dessert I got a slice of their rhubarb pie. Delicate flakey pie crust with a rhubarb filling that had a preserve consistency to it. If it got served to me without knowing what it was I would have said that this was the best peach cobbler I've ever eaten. 

Definitely worth stopping in for a quick bite.

Great little space but no outdoor seating.

The Logan Square location is much closer to me but I traveled to try some items they don't have in Logan Square.

Hot Chix Biscuit - Hard to hold as a chicken sandwich but still very good!
Pie a la mode - So good!  I've been waiting for them to serve pie a la mode and it's even better than imagined with Black Dog Gelato!!!

I hope they have these additions soon at the Logan Square location!

I think the reason it's named Bang Bang Pie Shop is because it's the bomb!  Though I'd heard great things about the original location, I never made the trip to Logan Square.  As a dedicated pie fiend, I couldn't wait to check out the Damen location.  

One evening, getting off the bus with two bags of Trader Joe's provisions, I couldn't wait to get home, but then I saw Bang Bang was open.  Of course, I trotted right over.  It happened to be the opening day, and the owner graciously greeted me.  

On this glorious morning, I ventured across the park to finally try their famous biscuits.  Though the place was bustling, the service was off the charts.  Though there were two people ahead of me, the line moved quickly, yet without feeling rushed.  The owner was at the register, and I was stunned that he remembered my name.  I placed my order - two slices of pie, biscuit, coffee - and my order was ready before i'd finished filling my coffee.  The biscuit was even better than reported.  I particularly appreciated the little cups of butter and fresh seasonal jam - not little pats like at a diner, but more than enough for my large biscuit.  The coffee is the best in the neighborhood.  I could easily head to Bang Bang just for a java fix.  In fact, I see a new weekend morning routine!
Best biscuits I have had since I was a kid in Texas! It has taken me 50 years to find them. Yum, yum!

Amazing pie, biscuits and grits, just like the Logan Square location. 

The new location in Ravenswood is next door to Over Easy. They have more interior space than the Logan Square location, but I don't think that they have the cute garden set up. However, there are some two tops at the front looking out onto Damen, a cozy couch and chairs in front of a fireplace, a communal table and then bar style seating towards the back.

I was there at 11:30 am on a Saturday, there was a line to the door (6 people in front of me), but I got through the line and left with pie in hand in under 10 minutes. Their menu of pies is slightly different than the Logan Square location, but that's not a bad thing, check the website and see what kind of pie you want and go to the location that soothes your pie craving. 

Since I live in Uptown, I am thrilled that there is a location much closer to me so I don't have to deal with California traffic to get my pie on.

I went here for lunch with friends yesterday and loved it! I had the Bacon Biscuit with an egg on top. Absolutely delicious and their homemade biscuit was one of the best I've had. For dessert, I had strawberry rhubarb pie which was just tart enough and the crust was delicious. My friends shared a chicken pot pie and said it was really good. One had key lime pie and said it was perfect. The place probably can't hold more than 25 people or so, so I would imagine it's a bit hard to find seating on weekends. You might want to carry out your order at those times.

I've known that this place was coming for a few months and was excited to have another spot in the neighborhood to have in the mix whenever I need a bite. Sadly after coming here I know this isn't going to be one of my regular spots.

The thing that killed it for me is how little value you get for what they charge. 

I ordered their hot chix sandwich and gladly paid nearly $10 for it because I've paid as much for other awesome chicken sandwiches before (the roost & honey butter fried chicken) and have been satisfied. I was expecting the same here, but when my sandwich came out I was seriously shocked at how small it was. The piece of chicken was the size of two chicken nuggets put together. Yeah the ingredients are high quality and it had flavor but I finished the chicken in two bites and was pretty much left with half the biscuit. 

I also had the grits and you would have to be crazy to think that's worth $8. 

The pie is great, I'll give them that, and I may come back for that even at $5 a slice but you couldn't force me to $10 on a sandwich that small again.

Come on. I don't get the hype. This is just a review for the pie, nothing else. 

I just came back from European trip and saw this opened across the street. I like desserts and decide to give a try. After paying almost 6 dollar after tax for a pie of key lime pie, my first bite makes me wanna spit it out. It's very very very sweet. But I guess that's just how American desserts are.I don't want to be mean but after having all kinds of desserts in Asia and Europe. Nowhere else makes desserts as sweet as in America and this pie is even at the top of American dessert sweetness level. 

Price. This is definitely overpriced. People are just overpaying for the hipster atmosphere. 5-6 dollar a piece? This is what I pay for world class pastries. In Paris, a piece from top pastry shops is about 5-6 euros, which given exchange right now, it almost the same as 5-6 dollars. If you don't know Pierre Herme and Sadaharu Aoki, google them. That's how I want exchange  my 6 dollar for.

I had heard bang bang had opened up a second location close to me but I couldn't figure out exactly where it was. 

We were waiting for a table at over easy cafe next door and saw this long line outside so we decided to check it out. Soooo glad we did because I've been wanting to try bang bang forever!!

We got a slice of their key lime pie  to go for later in the day and all I have to say is WOW! I'm not a huge fan of key lime pie so I usually only take a bite of my boyfriends, but this time I was upset I didn't get my own slice. It was REALLY good. He loves key lime pie and orders it from anywhere that has it and he couldn't believe how good it was from bang bang. 

My friend ordered the chocolate pecan pie  for later and she texted me later that evening with a million exclamation points, haha! She's a baker herself so when she says it's good, it's REALLY good.

I am a huge pie fan, so I was eagerly awaiting the opening of this place.  I would say this place has the best pie I have had south of the Nook in Osseo.   I have gone twice for takeout.  The key lime and the rhubarb were both excellent.   I was especially pleased with the crusts.  I am just sad we will have to wait a whole year for more of that rhubarb.
The biscuits here and at the other locations are the best in town.  Pies are good too but prefer hoosier mama...

Absolutely amazing. First time here, and the breakfast was something to die for. We split the farmers and the avocado, with added candies bacon. So different, and so good. Topped it off with a key lime pie.... also, the staff is ridiculously nice. Really attentive and made sure we felt at home. you have to come here!!!

My husband and I visited for the first time today. We wish the food had been as good as the warm, friendly welcome we received from the lovely young woman at the counter. Since we don't eat meat we were happy to discover the non-meat options. We were very disappointed with the biscuits and veg gravy, both overly salted and gravy extremely spicy. I was so looking forward to a light, fluffy biscuit. It was dense, almost gummy, overly rich and fatty and very salty! We also shared a yogurt parfait which was very good with their homemade vegan granola, but it was just glopped into a bowl so I'm not sure how it qualified as a parfait. My husband liked his coffee and my iced tea with lavender lemonade was delicious but I was disappointed that it was served in a plastic cup. 

Another thing that really bothered me was the lack of good ventilation! The whole place smelled of bacon and sausage fat. (I guess some people wouldn't have a problem with this.) I will have to return at another time to sample their pie. Hopefully it will be better than the biscuits! I may be a snob, but biscuits should be tender, just like a pie crust or why bother consuming the calories!

I will say that everyone around us seemed happy to be there and pleased with their food.

This is a place to come for pie, biscuits or grits. The cashier and other staff were really nice and helpful.

I liked the plain biscuit with the phenomenal strawberry jam best. The lemonade was very refreshing on a humid day. 

The fancy grits were not quite worth the price. I liked the sausage on the biscuit, but thought it was better just simply eaten with the homemade jam. 

The seating with a giant table in the middle and high bar stools are a little odd. Try to snag one of the little tables in the front if you can. 

It was buzzing at an early lunch hour. Overall, I thought it was a little pricey for what it was. The decor was charming and the staff were pleasant. I'll still go back to try the sweet and savory pie.

Two wedge biscuits, two coffees, and one slice of pie was nearly $40 with tip.  My biscuit was undercooked and doughy, but tasted fine, although I expected a little more egg for a $10 biscuit.  The pie was very good...I didn't order it, so I don't know the name, but it was fluffy and chocolatey.  Iced coffee was just the drip poured over ice, which was totally watered down.  The seating is weird, and I noticed water glasses are put rim down in a reclaimed wood crate...yuck...hope there's not lead paint in there.

Good pies and delicious chicken pot pie. Best I've had in the city so far. Seems to be a little hot inside too often, especially on hot summer days. Might be a bit difficult for more than a few people as well. Overall a nice place to stop in every once and awhile.

The place is really pretty. The service was great. Happy to have them in the hood. Food is good, not great. But really all of that would be fine if they didn't service the WORST coffee I have ever had in a breakfast leaning establishment. I understand they're not a coffee shop, so I'll forgive the lack of espresso. But Chicago has some of the finest coffee roasters and this local business is servicing watered down diner coffee. I talk myself out of going back all the time because what's the point of breakfast or a slice of pie with a nice warm delicious cup of joe?

I'll start off by saying that I miss the Dolce Casa Cafe, but was very pleasantly surprised with the food and atmosphere @ the newest Bang Bang Pie.  I will add that the menu is somewhat limited --- maybe adding a few choice appetizers would be a nice addition. We will be back!!!
Wonderful biscuit sandwiches in a cozy setting. Take time to study the chalkboard because the surprises are endless.
A friendly, southern and amazing place. We tried biscuits and gravy, passion fruit pie and French grits. Everything was so tasty. The grits deserves a special mention. It's the best...

I love the other location of this restaurant and was happy to see they opened a location closer to me. However, after trying it, I would not come back. I ordered a sausage biscuit and a side of cheddar grits. The grits were over salted and tasteless, and the sausage biscuit was supposed to come with jam but I was barely given any. Save your time and go to the location in Logan sq instead.

I guess I'm confused about the hype. I ordered two pies for a 4th of July celebration--the chocolate pecan and a special holiday chess pie with blueberries, honey, and whipped cream. Both pies were very dry and overly sweet, and they stuck to the bottom of the pans so much that it was impossible to cut them into slices.  Very disappointing at $26 each.

Biscuits are delicious, ambience is great! Only thing is (and this is coming from a student who doesn't have very much money), I found it to be overpriced. A piece of pecan pie--just a slice, and a pretty small one at that!--was $6! That's kinda outrageous to me...especially when another establishment not too far away sells delicious pie slices for $3 (and they're a lot bigger). While the food is good, it's nothing that I felt I couldn't make at home. Except for the biscuits. Those are pretty delish!

Like tequila cocktails?? Visit here 
Like employees educated about their cocktail menu?? Visit here again 
Like authentic Mexican cuisine?? Absolutely visit here 


This establishment in Logan Square has become a staple beverage location for my fiancé and I. They have a smaedium (small + medium)  cocktail list that is not overbearing in ingredients or convoluted in verbiage that you either can't pronounce or have  no clue what that word means unless you research it on google for the next 15 minutes. 

My favorite drink is the 'Where there is Smoke' which the most divine concoction of mezcal meets fire from the fresh Serrano chile slices with a more subtle citrus end note. 

My fiancé loves the 'Sierra Madre' which is also a smokey sotal margarita drink that has a front end of a perfect tang from the lime and orange liqueur with a slight peppery finish. 


All the other drinks have yet to disappoint as well as this place. 


The guacamole which has the correct limited ingredient of lime,chile, red onion and cilantro. Also is served with a side of totopos (yes, the correct pronunciation for fried tortilla slices). 

We have also has the Asada, Cochinital Pibil and Puerco tacos.... Phenomenal!! All the tacos were no skimped on meat either. 


Simple. Delicious and authentic Mexican cuisine. 



Fun fact- they'll bring you more chips to scoop your leftover guacamole without having to ask for more

And all their corn tortillas are hand-pressed like your Mexican grandmother would in her kitchen. 


We've also had Kelsey twice as our server and she's great! Well educate and attentive.

Took a detour from Fat Rice's long wait and headed to Masa Azul. And to our delight, it didn't disappoint.  Their cocktails didn't disappoint, hubs got a toasted coconut-tequila blend and it was perfection. We started with esquites, which was like elotes, just not on a cob. Delicious, cheesy, garlicky buttery goodness. 

Than ordered baja shrimp tacos, steak tacos with jalapeño creme sauce, and Main highlights, huaraches con Tinga.  

*tortillas are hand made-small but full of flavor 
*tinga- aka smoked chicken thigh in chipotle saucey goodness 
-*baja shrimp is no joke. Reviews don't disappoint. So fresh, fried goodness and full of flavor. 



Authentic Mexican cuisine.  Regresa para mas !!

I have been coming to Maza Azul for a while with a friend, and we have always had impeccable service,the servers are always nice and courteous.The drinks are always on point and the food always delicious.

We have only tried the appetizers and the drinks so far, but they are the best! 

If you are not sure what drink to pick, get the Pablo, you can never go wrong with it!

I wasn't expecting an intimate dining room when I came here, but it's a nice place for a date. Kenny and I ordered the ceviche and a couple of huaraches to share. Everything was delicious. My absolute favorite was the huaraches de champigñon (masa, ancho-roasted mushrooms, black beans, queso fresco, serrano aioli). The mushrooms were cooked to perfection. I am definitely coming back to try the taco version too.

I just want to add that the "Pablo" is my favorite drink in all of Logan Square. And I've tried 'em all, folks!
Perfect balance of tequila and coconut cream. I could honestly drink five.

We stopped here with our friends that would not stop raving about Masa Azul's amazing beverages. After visiting another disappointing restaurant that night, Masa Azul had the perfect cure in the form of a tequila infused delight. I ordered the heart of the dead - it was superb. Our friend always orders "Where there is smoke...", a drink not meant for the faint-hearted. It includes ingredients such as mescal joven, and serrano chile. The ambience lingers between romance and late-night-social. Our server was Kelsey B, who was very attentive and welcoming. We will definitely be back!

This place is hands down some of the best Mexican food I've ever had! We tried every taco and they were all amazing. The esquites are charred on the outside and perfectly seasoned. I highly recommend this place and can't wait to go back!

Excellent cocktails. The heart of the dead was perfect. My friends enjoyed the smokiness of the when there's smoke there's fire. The esquites corn appetizer was so delicious we ended up getting another order with our entrees. The plantains were great as well with the perfect savory yet subtly sweet flavor. The guac was fresh and had the perfect Serrano pepper spice finish. Chip were fresh and tasty- and I'm not a big fan of tortilla chips as they are often too salty for me. For entrees we got an array of tacos from the Asada which was cooked to perfection, the mushroom and avocado sounded good. My friend loved his chicken thigh one. Overall nice & tasty place.

BEST MARGARITA IN CHICAGO! There, I said it. This alone gives them 5-stars. 
The food has gone thru several transitions between executive chefs, so the food is a 3.5. Not bad, just not to the same level as their drinks. 

Perhaps my vision is blurred- figuratively, because their drink menu is that good. This by far is one of the most underrated drink selection in town.

My advise? Go for the drinks and appetizer s, and stumble on several hours after drinking to another spot to soak up the booze.

I cannot believe it took me years to finally go to Masa Azul. 

Food: Amazing flavorful shirmp tacos. The most delicious Elote (corn)flan I have ever had.

Cocktails: wonderful ! wide selections drinks. Can't fail to mention a I enjoyed a very palatable lime margarita. I Highly recommended.

 Only regrets that I didn't come sooner.

At some point in time Masa Azul switched up to a taco-centric menu, foregoing the duck and other entrees.  Don't be sad it ended, though - be happy it happened, for the new menu is quite good.  

I particularly liked the tortilla soup, with its spicy complex flavors, and the puerco tacos, which were rich, smoky, and full of flavor, some of the best pork tacos in the city.  

The cocktails are still outstanding, particularly the Oaxacan Old Fashioned and Fast Friends, which is simply stellar, one of the best cocktails I've had in past year.

If you are in a drinking mood, the cocktails will run up your bill, but if you just need tacos, carry out is a delicious option that is easy on the wallet.

Nice little Mexican place which is good for an intimate experience. The huarache de tinga was the highlight for us - amazing. The esquites was the other dish that really stuck out to me. The one thing that was lacking was good service. We had a large table so you'd think we would have a lot of attention but half the time people's drinks were empty for much too long.

This place is amazing.  It's a gem.  I don't get here very often because I live on the south side but when I do it never lets me down.  The bartender is amazing and the drinks are even better.  You can't go wrong with anything on the menu.  It is so fresh and you can taste that is made with love.  Please go here.

This place was amazing. I'm surprised it doesn't have 5 stars all around. I highly recommend if you are in the mood for upscale Mexican food and great drinks.

We started off with ordering guacamole and a couple of salsa. The guac was great and very fresh. You could tell it was just made in house and not from those premade contraptions come other places follow. The salsas were pretty darn good as well.

It's hard to pick a favorite but the cocktails were a clear standout while we were there. If you like mezcal, do yourself a favor and order the "where there's smoke" drink as soon as you get it. I can't remember the last time I had such a good mezcal drink.

If I could change one think (and this is extremely nit-picky) I'd ask to get larger water glasses. Small thing - I know- but the used being used resemble shot glasses more than actual table glasses for water. I think all of the people in my group must have refilled their glasses 15 or so times.

Either way, Masa Azul was amazing. I can't wait to go back!

I'm originally from IL but moved to NJ 2 years ago. I always meet up with my friends when I come visit and I tend to pick a different location each time. Well this time it was Masa Azul. So happy I picked this location. From the reservation, to the greeting at the door, the server was on point! The guacamole & totopos were EXCELLENT! I can not stop ranting and raving about the cocktails, THEY ARE SO DELICIOUS. I started off with the Prickly Pear then moved on to Heart of the Dead, and that was the drink of the night. I had a party of 8,  we all pretty much had several refills of this amazing drink.  My friend and I shared tacos she got the Tacos de Cochinita Pibil & she got the Tacos de Asada. The salsa that they came with, SUPERB! Everyone one loved the dish they picked out. Just moaning, eyes rolling back, and food dancing. The food is really really good! I will definitely come back, my guests all said they would come back. MASA AZUL IS JUST A GREAT EXPERIENCE! Best of luck to all of you. Thank you for making our night.

The drinks are "A" mazing!!! The guacamole and ceviche were so tasty and delicious.  I also highly recommend the elote (corn) appetizer.  The drinks were also very good!  Soe drinks had a tasty spice with chilli added and gave it a nice zing!  The waitress and customer services was excellent.  I'll definitely be back again.

Every visit I've made to Masa Azul has been an exceptional experience. This lively spot tucked along a rather sparse stretch of Diversey Ave (between California and Sacramento) raises the bar for what is possible in the realm of Mexican-inspired drink and small-plate food (botanas). 

I can think of no conceivable reason why this place isn't getting 5-star reviews across the board, because few eateries sweat the details with the level of care, attention, and accessibility that Masa Azul brings to the table. And somehow, they do this while remaining rooted in good hospitality (always attentive without being fawning), and obvious love for the rich traditions of Mexican drink/cuisine. (My Puebla-born mamacita would approve, in other words.)

The cocktails are creative, nuanced, and served over proper blocks of ice. If you want to get schooled on mescal, tequila, sotol, bacanora, and raicilla (in all their bewilderingly well-crafted permutations), this is the place. Or, if you just want to saddle up for a palette-tickling variation on an old favorite like a margarita, cuba libre, or old-fashioned, prepare to be pleasantly surprised.

The food is equally well considered, often drizzled or garnished in colors that are as colorful as they are delicious. One favorite: the tostones (fried/flattened plantains), smeared with a fresh green salsa that pairs well with them and provides its own universe of delight.

As for the tacos, the tortillas are made in-house and come in pairs. After trying about half the selection available, I can say that some of them hooked me right away, and even the ones I didn't love completely were intriguing and carefully composed. An example of how brilliant this place is: the aguacate tacos feature batter-dipped, fried chunks of avocado. This is an obvious win for avocado-lovers everywhere.

Even after half a dozen visits, I still haven't properly delved into the rest of the menu.¿Huaraches, tortas, chilaquiles? Damn! But hey, sometimes you have to leave room to explore, right? Let's just say it's become one of my favorite special stops in the neighborhood (and my girlfriend's go-to place for a hot date with me, cheyaaaa).

(I should add that they are also happy to accommodate whatever food sensitivities you might have, so those with worries about spicy food should still find it welcoming. Just ask!)

Excellent drinks and good-to-okay small bites.

Tequila, mezcal and sotol. Desert plant from the agave family makes yummy cocktails. Of all the spirits that are out there, this agrees with me. I really enjoyed my drinks here and a good 10+ selection to choose from ranging  sweet-refreshing, smoky or spicy. 

Food is upscale mexican street food, like tortas and tacos. Most items are under $10, so not terribly pricey, but most portions are a bit small and things starts to add up fast when you're hungry. It's great if you just want a little something to go with your drink or if you like to try a bunch of things.

The food: 2/5. The food was unauthentic and forgettable at best. We started with guac which was good, it came with nice homemade chips. Tacos, on the other hand, were mediocre. They're on the smaller size and I thought were fairly dry. I tried pork shoulder and shrimp, and I wouldn't get those again. Drinks were good.

The service: 5/5. The service was great. Our waitress was very attentive and knew the menu well. 

Overall: 2.5/5. The quality of their food doesn't warrant a trip to the middle of nowhere on Diversey.

Fresh, bright, seasonal ingredients made this elevated Mexican fare to die for. 

We live walking distance away and have found our new go-to Mexican place, in Logan Square, that means a lot. 

We had the ceviche as an appetizer- clean with bursts of citrus, the Where There's Smoke and another delicious specialty cocktail and three types of tacos. 

The cocktails were expertly made and worth the price. The ambiance was perfect for a date, birthday, or even a possible rehearsal dinner and the food and service were just all around amazing. We'll be back VERY soon.

I have mixed feelings about this place...

I've been here a number of times and previously it has always been great. On weeknights when it's not super busy you can chat with the bartenders who are super knowledgable and friendly, enjoy great food and service, have a tequila flight, and have a great time. I walked in last night (a Friday night) expecting to write a 5 star review.

Some things have changed here. The menu seemed entirely different. I heard they have a new chef. Our waitress was not excellent. I'll break it down - margaritas were awesome, salsa and chips were good, ceviche was ok, tacos were small but tasty. The menu is a little confusing. It's broken up into starters, tacos, and tortas en mas. It's not clear how much food you should order. One plate of 2x tacos is not enough, but a torta might be. 

Bottom line - I wish this place was as good last night as it has been in the past.

How have I *not* yet sung the praises of Chicago's best Mexican restaurant? I've been eating -- and drinking -- here for a couple years, and it's easily my most frequented fine-dining restaurant. 

I love Masa Azul because the food is delicious, unique, and affordable. I love Masa Azul because the staff is welcoming, attentive, and flexible. And I love Masa Azul because management hosts events that support charitable work in rural Mexico. But even if none of that were true, I would love Masa Azul simply because they host the best selection of agave and agave-related spirits for at least a 100-mile radius.

Plenty of places offer mezcal cocktails, sure. But the real way to drink mezcal -- and raicilla, bacanora, and sotol, and, yes, even tequila -- is neat, like a fine armagnac, cognac, or scotch. And, no, most places do not have the quality spirits that invite neat tastings. Masa has a wall worth sipping through, and the diversity of flavors derived from the varietals of agave represented on that wall are broader than those offered by any other spirits. So head in, drink up, and have your ride home planned before you're too far into the woods (desert?) to back out.

Wonderful evening. Outdoor space so great. The drinks were so different but not weird.  Had the Gypsy which was a very smooth type of Margarita- yum! We had the corn appetizer -Esquites - which were very flavorful as well as the tostones ( plantains with meat on top) . Very flavorful. The huracha de champignons was delicious. All tacos we good too. Flan for dessert. 
Amazing service too. Don't miss this place. You won't be sorry!

Masa Azul has slightly recreated itself a couple of times and I've loved all their variations.  The cocktails here are unique & amazing.  The food is always fabulous.   I am sooooo happy each time I walk in here and it's crowded.  Love their bar in the window and the rustic decor.
Here's a glimpse into our most recent visit...

Our group of four was both thirsty and hungry - so we did some damage here a couple of weeks ago.  

Botanas / Appetizers : we kicked the night off by indulging in the Sopitos, Esquites, Ceviche & Guacamole.  The sopitos ($8) were warm, oozing with flavor and a really nice start to a fabulous meal.  The shrimp ceviche ($8) was incredibly fresh with a perfect amount of lime & cilantro.  The Esquites ($5) - oh how I love thee!!!  Who would have known that corn could be so good?!?!  I could have eaten bowls of this and been completely content.  I really don't know how corn, cheese & chili powder can be so amazing, but it is.  Really.  Take my word and order two.  Or more.  You won't regret it!

The tacos come two to an order for $5 - 6 per plate and they are loaded!  You will not mind paying $3 per taco here, I promise!  They were out of the Tinga, but I've had it here before and it does not disappoint.  On this adventure, we stuffed ourselves until we couldn't breathe with the following taco fiesta (2 tacos per order!):

Tacos de Champignon $6  (ancho-roasted mushrooms, cilantro, queso) 
Tacos de Jalapeno Relleno $6 (loved the pickled carrot on these)
Tacos de Puerco $6 (braised pork shoulder with some yummy caramelized onion)
Tacos de Chorizo y Papas $5 (oh how I love chorizo)
Tacos de Cochinita Pibil $6 (braised pork with a nice habanero kick)

plus... we had to get the Chile Relleno.  The Chile Relleno was good, but not as fabulous as I remember when they used to serve it as a full entree.  They now serve it with Mexican rice, but they used to plate it with a different rice (white rice with cilantro, I think??) and I really loved it the old way.  So I wouldn't be sad if some time they decide to swap that rice out!

Dessert - we had the flan and a special dessert they had (something with blueberries).  Both were great.

Last, but certainly not least - the cocktails....WOW!

I'm almost embarrassed to admit that my husband and another friend of ours each had 3 - count 'em - THREE Mezcal Last Words each.  Keep in mind, we were there a good couple of hours :)  

I LOVE the kick the serrano gives their 'Where there is smoke...'.  After starting with that, I flipped to the Micheladas.  Despite how simple a beverage this is, there are not a lot of restaurants who make these right, in my humble opinion - but they definitely do here!  Ice cold, spicy and absolutely refreshing.  A perfect match to the fare on their menu.

We've been here about a half dozen times and we'll be back dozens more.  Masa Azul is a solid choice for both drinks & dinner!!

Best margaritas and we have tried all Chicago offers. Masa Azul is the perfect night out - any night.  Everyone is always friendly! Their prices are affordable and we love the owner and staff. A true gem! Try all the drinks and don't forget the guacamole.

I've been back to Masa Azul multiple times and it has become my favorite spot in the city! Drinks are amazing - my favorites are ones that feature mezcal, especially the Where There's Smoke... 

You also must try the flan (ask for it if it's  it on the menu!) - although I am a chocolate addict, the corn and ESPECIALLY the coffee flan are fantastic!

Top notch food and drinks. I was blown away by how well everything was put together. Perfect portion sizes. Kind of a bummer you can't mix and match tacos. Service was great and the atmosphere and food was really top of the line. Will be returning soon!

I heard, for years, that this place had a fantastic tequila menu, and being a tequila lover, I wanted to try it.  We finally made it here after hearing the food menu was recreated and I was not disappointed.  

For cocktails I tried the Heart of the Dead and the Where there is Smoke...Yum.  Completely different flavors, both so good.  If you like sweet drinks Heart of the Dead is perfect, and Where there is Smoke is indeed smoky, yet well-balanced.

The hubby and I split several items:  Esquites, Tostones, and several tacos (rajas, chorizo and papas, champignon).  Loved the esquites and the tacos.  The tostones were okay.  My husband's favorite was the chorizo and papas tacos, I haven't decided.    

Like some other reviewers mentioned, the style is minimalist, which I like.  We came early in the evening so it wasn't noisy.  No complaints about the atmosphere from me.  We'll definitely be back.

I celebrated a birthday here once with my mom and three friends and based on that experience I would have given this place 5 stars. The waitress went above and beyond for us, the food and cocktails were delicious and the bill was more than reasonable for what we ordered. Going for tacos while expecting to have a pretty heavy night of drinking is always a good idea because tacos aren't too heavy and (a plus) cheap. 

Because of this experience, myself and two of the friends I had gone with before wanted to go out to Masa Azul again. But it was almost like we were in a completely different restaurant. A waitress we had had the worst "I hate my job and don't want to be here" attitude. We got sat in the back corner of the restaurant, which were the worst seats but we weren't going to complain. We waited 15 minutes before we even got a glass of WATER and then she ran off before we even got a chance to ask for an appetizer. So I flagged down another waitress, really losing my patience, and asked for guacamole and elote. I wouldn't have been so annoyed if the place was packed, but it's a very small restaurant with at least three waiters working and the seats weren't even full. 

The only time she came to us was to get our order after the other lady took our appetizer order and someone else brought it out to us. So we gave our order to our very unpleasant waitress. The food was ok. My friends were not very pleased with what they ordered and mine was just alright. Nothing like what we experienced the last time we came. 

When we were done, we sat patiently for our non-busy non-existent waitress. We were getting so mad at how long she was taking and how much neglect she had given us the whole night we were so close to just walking out of the restaurant. I flagged the other lady down AGAIN who had been very kind and then our waitress FINALLY brought the bill. We tipped her nothing and we don't plan on returning.

It's a shame because of the first experience we had but I am not willing to take the risk because of how poor the service was the second time around and the food being meh.

I had been wanting to try this place for so long and finally finally got to last weekend! I loved their tacos - how flavorful and yummy! This place is so vegetarian friendly and gluten free friendly, with really good cocktails. The place was busy with a large party of folks celebrating a friend's engagement but the server did a really good job guiding us through our order so we didn't have the wait for food to long. I'll be back soon for sure!

I don't know when I last reviewed a resto, but I am now, because I loved Masa Azul!

House made tortillas on FLEEK, recently confirmed the meaning of FLEeK, if you don't know, it's damn good.

The service was friendly and also quite attentive, but not overbearing.

Everything we ate was excellent, and I'm so excited to find a place that makes such tasty tortillas. I think this gets the #1 spot on the tortilla list, for now, within my experience, these are the GOAT! (Greatest Of All Time)

I am so cool.

How have I never been here before? Delicious food, great service, and creative drinks! 

I highly recommend the Pablo. They have created a super tasty coconut cocktail without making it syrupy sweet. That's so hard to do!

We tried four different tacos, and the table's favorites were the Baja Shrimp and the Aguacate. I could have ordered another round - super tasty.

This place has the finest guacamole and delectable fried & salted chips. I'm a big fan of the baja shrimp tacos and two of my friends seek out the Heart of the Dead drink any time we go there. Decent prices for great food.
I had the heart of the dead. The cocktail menu has great choices.  I had the esquite, and I think the braised pork. It was good portion,  I was surprised to be full with two of those tiny tacos :)

Yum, yum and more yum! So far the two times I've stepped in to Maza Azul the service was outstanding. They were quick to acknowledge me and sat me down despite an incomplete party. Their tortillas taste homemade, including chips. And the drinks are made carefully without having to wait a ridiculous amount of time (Margarita and Primero). Although it is on the northern most part of Logan square, it is worth the trip if you want to go for a walk in this trendy neighborhood.

Update 2/20/16: I've been here multiple times since my last post and I always leave feeling satisfied.

Drinks are great and the apps and tacos are good.
The menu now only has apps, tortas and tacos.  Other yummy looking dishes on the yelp page are gone.
Best shrimp tacos I've ever had. The other tacos I had were also tasty. Amazing homemade chips and guac and their house margarita is also really good.

Awesome tapas style Mexican food! Dishes are small so just keep that in mind when ordering. When my friends and I go there, we order many dishes and just share as most as we can.

Drinks are on point!! Had the opportunity to sit at the bar last time I was there and was chatting with one of the bartenders there (Brian) and he was just so passionate about the drinks he makes. He talked about Mezcal and Whiskey with a great passion and truly recommended good drinks based on liquors I said I enjoyed. Sad thing is he mentioned he was leaving this restaurant at the end of the year which just means I have to come back and try the new bartender drinks!! According to some emails I received there will be new cocktails at the beginning of the year :D

Came here for a friend's birthday dinner and was pleasantly surprised. The food was very good. I had the house made guacamole and salsa with chips to start and the mushroom tacos as my dinner. The greatest part about this place was how accommodating they were. We had a group of 10 people, and our waitress was attentive and patient, and so nice. We even brought in our own chocolate cake with candles so that we could sing happy birthday. They whisked it back to the kitchen, cut it into slices, and served it to the table. Masa Azul is not very big, so make sure to secure a reservation. There were about 12 people standing around near the small bar in front, waiting for tables to open up. Street parking is fairly easy to find as well.
Food was excellent. Drinks were very well crafted. Service was awesome!! For a Friday night it was crowded but no overwhelming. I'll def be back soon!!

Let me start by saying I am not a fan of tequila drinks, until I had the cocktails here! The drinks alone give this place 5 stars. We tried a total of 6 different cocktails and they were all so delicious. I especially love the spicier ones. Literally the best tequila cocktails! Recommend Heart of the Dead and From Dusk Til' Dawn. So delicious!  We also ate chicken and vegetarian tacos, which were also delicious. The restaurant has a great ambiance with darker lighting. We had to wait for a table, which was fine since there were open bar seats and we were happy to have a yummy cocktail before sitting at our table. We will definitely be back!

One of my colleagues likes to say that no matter what when eating out in Chicago, for any given price point, some of the best restaurants are Mexican.  Masa Azul could be a case in point.

The food was just great, through and through.  Shrimp cocktail had flavorful chunks of shrimp and avocado in a flavorful, herby, gazpacho-like tomato broth.  Chile de arbol salsa was thick, deep, and spicy, with excellent extremely fresh chips.  Goat tacos and the pork in pineapple sauce were both flavorful, interesting, and satisfying.  And a roasted-mushroom huarache was the true standout.  There aren't a lot of vegetarian items on the menu, but I would take a vegeterian here just to eat these mushrooms.

But even better than the great food were the cocktails.  I have never had so many uniformly delicious and interesting things done with mezcal.  Mezcal cooked into wood chips, mezcal mixed with campari and hibiscus rimmed with habanero salt, mezcal with a mysteriously intense and unsweetened orange juice.  (The cocktails without mezcal were delicious too.)  Everything we tried -- the make-your-own-cocktail, the tropical cocktails, the flight of wood-aged cocktails -- was a knockout success.

I can't yet say it's better than the Violet Hour, which might win on sheer impeccable variety, but it's better than the best cocktails I've had in almost any other city.
Awesome service. Delicious food. Must try the shrimp torta and steak tacos. The bartender works magic! Guacamole and chips are delicious. Green sauce is good. Tequila selection is out of this world.

Masa Azul has become one of my favorite venues near my new residence. Such a friendly, neighborhood vibe. Came here for the first time as a solo diner while my wife was on a business trip and had so much fun I brought her in the next week - already been back a couple more times since, all in the span of a few weeks.

Masa Azul is not the place if you are looking for inexpensive Mexican food, giant burritos or Americanized ethnic cuisine. While the ambiance is laid back and comfortable the food is upscale, well executed cuisine. Portions are on the small side with the emphasis on quality over quantity. Expect to order multiple small plates of food (my wife and I have found that the two of us sharing six to seven dishes is optimal for a full meal). The ingredients are high end and the food well executed. 

While the food is among the better Mexican venues I have dined at in Chicago, what elevates Masa Azul even further is the people and the cocktail program. The owner (Jason) is often tending bar and is such a warm, down-to-Earth person; the staff we have met are also such genuine, friendly people. While the dining room looks beautiful, my wife and I have really enjoyed sitting up to the bar and chatting with Jason, the other bartenders as well as other patrons bellying up to he bar (Masa Azul really seems to attract a friendly bunch of fellow diners).

Jason's cocktail program is as good as most cocktail bars in Chicago. As one might expect , the emphasis is on tequila and mezcal based concoctions. The drinks are well balanced and utilize quality spirits; definitely an elevated cocktail program - in fact so good that it is worth coming in just for cocktails (though you'd be wise ordering some bites too since the cuisine is so delicious and pairs well with the beverages). Expect upscale versions of classic tequila based drinks (i.e. margaritas) and riffs on other classic beverages (such as negronis, manhattans etc. subbing tequila or mezcal as the base spirit). Two of our four visits have been for full meals whereas two were mainly for the drinks and snacks (you can order from the full menu while seated at the bar). 

Food wise definitely order a couple different tacos; some of the best I have consumed. My favorite so far is the tinga (smoky chicken thighs) but I have sampled several across my visits and all have been fantastic. The esquites ( a sweet, savory, spicy and tangy corn based dish with cheese, garlic and chili) is our favorite appetizer and is amazing - so delicious, definitely a must order. The tortilla soup is also a great starter, especially on a chilly Chicago evening. For something a bit more hearty the flank steak torta hits the spot and the chilaquiles are also ridiculously good (I recommend adding chorizo to take it up even another notch). What is nice is so much of the cuisine is made from scratch, i.e. the tortillas - even the chips for the guacamole.The only dishes I have not been crazy about were the ceviche and the plantain tostones - not bad by any means, just not quite as dazzling as the other dishes. 

Beverage wise if you like some heat in your drink the China Poblana (featuring Ancho Reyes, Cynar and Mezcal Joven) is one of my top five favorite cocktails in the city. So amazing that I am craving one now! The Oaxacan Old Fashioned is my second favorite and if in the mood for something less boozy the Where there is smoke... (like a margarita but with a kick). Jason is also adept at creating some off menu beverages based on feedback you provide as to your preferences/aversions - and has been spot on when doing this. 

Very happy to have found this venue; as someone really appreciates Chicago's vast dining scene and loves trying new places, it is not easy to win me over as a regular, but this is a restaurant I plan on returning to frequently.

Being Mexican myself I always have high expectations for Mexican food here in the U.S...this is as close as the real deal!!! And trust me when I say I know the real deal traveling to Mexico twice a year and parents being born there. Me and my girlfriend had 3 different orders of tacos, carne asada, puerco, and shrimp!! Amazing! Seasoning was perfect, tortillas made by hand which every real Mexican knows if the tortilla is shit then the taco is shit!! Drinks are made with mescal straight from Mexico!!! Oh man, words can't even describe the experience! First and definitely not our last time here!! GO TRY!!

We had Dinner here last night,  I had called earlier in the day and left a vm for reservations the same night and was pleased when I received a call back around 2pm to confirm reservations at 9.  When we arrived, we were immediately seated in the only two top left open since the place was jumpin'! 
I agree with others that the decor is minimal but I liked it and my boyfriend even commented that it was similar to the decor in our house, simple, sleek.  

After receiving the menu, which is tiny. ..  I was excited since typically, a small menu indicates to me that anything you choose will be awesome...  Unfortunately,  I learned that is not always the case.  We started with drinks, I had the explorador which was inventive and delicious and my boyfriend had the velador (sp?) It was essentially a $8+ shot, he said it wasn't bad but he also opted for a solid modelo negro on the next round. 

On to the food, let me preface this by saying that we're Latin food snobs, not only because we both mexican but also because we've tried restaurants all around the world and still nothing compares to my favorite (hacienda y cocina- cabo san lucas).  

For appetizers we did the guac and salsa and they were both solid, chips were just how I like them, fresh and crispy. The salsa could have used a bit of spice since it had no heat but great flavor.  For entrees, I had the puerco and my boyfriend a chicken dish that he said was just ok, since the meat was layered over a soggy sope or plantain.   My pork was the larger disappointment.  Although cooked really well and super tender, the dish itself was one note, I could barely decipher the pork from the potatoes it was mixed with.   I think something as small as being served with fresh tortillas would have made a world of difference. 

 Alas, I like the overall vibe of the place and with so many other great reviews we will probably give it another shot since its very close to our house and the server said the menu is in constant rotation, which is a plus. Lastly, price is a bit on the high side.  While I don't have a problem paying for quality I think the portion sizes didn't warrant the prices. For two people each having two drinks, two entrees and chips, salsa and guacamole, our tab before tip was $80.00.
Excellent food and service!   Really enjoyed this scratch food Mexican find.   Great drinks and tacos and the server was very attentive.   Would most definitely return!

Small intimate upscale Mexican Joint at Francisco/Diversey.. Great Date Spot!  What I didn't like was the bar setup in the very front near the entrance/ way too small and awkward.  Great drinks & Beer List!  The menu is actually kinda small... as are the portions/ think "Small Plates" here.  Tried the "Goat Tacos".. small, great flavor, a tad dry.  Tried Carne Asada Torta which was good and packed some major HEAT!!  As everyone else implied, small portions kinda pricey.  Service was great/ cool patio! Get Dat Did

Visiting from Phoenix where I have lived for over 20 years where there are plenty of ways to experience authentic homemade Mexican food. We ordered just about every taco on the menu and none of them disappointed. Our favorite were the rajas and chile relleno tacos. Service and vibes were great too. Masa Azul definitely ranks as one of the best Mexican establishments in the country and a must try in Chicago!

I don't understand the 2 and 3-star reviews for this restaurant.  Masa Azul is incredible in every way.

Food, service, presentation, and drinks were all excellent.  I liked it so much that I'm going again two days later.

This place was less than okay.  We had a reservation for 8pm and had to wait around 20 or 30 minutes for a table when we arrived at 8pm.  The tacos are tiny--the size of silver dollars.  They have braised meat or vegetables on top of very thick corn tortillas; some come with a minuscule sprinkle of cheese or pickled vegetables (carrots, red onion).  None of the components were very well seasoned, however.  If the tortilla contains no salt and your meat is under seasoned like it was last Saturday night, you're in for a bland meal like ours.  Even the pickled onions were unbalanced--they tasted just of vinegar, no sugar or spices that we could taste.  We tried the pork, chicken, steak, mushroom, and chile rellenos tacos.  The best of the bunch was the mushroom which actually had some flavor.  

The ceviche that my friends shared was also good, though served with two massive fried corn tortillas (about 2-3 times the size of the tacos), making the ceviche very awkward to eat, even when breaking the fried tortillas apart.  

Also, in addition to the food being mediocre, the music was very loud and it was crowded.  Usually that means the food is amazing but in this case, it just meant you're seated close enough to your neighbors at any nearby table to hear every bit of their conversation.  This is why I wager the music was blaring but it worked against them in our estimation of the restaurant.  

In the end we weren't mad enough to complain or send the tiny plates back.  We just won't come back, can't recommend it, and would go to just about any nearby Mexican restaurant instead next time we're in the mood for Mexican.

Went here on a whim with a couple friends Friday night after being turned away from a couple other restaurants near by. They were full too, but right away the hostess started arranging for us to get a seat. After 10 minutes we were seated and ordering drinks! The bartenders were very friendly and the food and drinks were both excellent. I am picky about the chips at Mexican restaurants and theirs were amazing! This was my first time to Mass Azul and regret that it's taken me so long to try it out.

This is one of those restaurants that showed to me how different Chicago & Seattle are.  My boyfriend and I came around 5:30 for an early dinner and found out they didn't open till 6pm.  Though this isn't abnormal in Chicago -- its quite the opposite from my home.  After a nice walk exploring Logan square we came back about 6:15pm.  There were a couple people already seated when we arrived.  I loved the dark lighting of the place.

The dishes here are perfect sizes to try different things and share with your party.   The staff was very attentive and recommended great dishes and drinks.  Everything was so good we ordered one more plate before we were finished.   I loved that even though we took our sweet time they didn't rush us to get out.  

From what I am told they are known for their craft drinks -- so make sure to order at least one!

I want to start by saying that I had to try Masa Azul twice to make sure that my asessment was spot-on.  I am a huge fan of anything located a few blocks from my house and I wanted to make sure that I wasn't just viewing it through rose colored glasses.  After my second meal there, I can say with 100% certainty that this place kicks a lot of a$$.  We have gone there pretty early on Sundays so it hasn't been busy, but I've heard that it buzzes on other nights.  THe dining room is small and intimate and the smells coming out of the kitchen are intoxicating.  The owner, Jason, has been skillfully handling the bar while the chef, Jonathan, has been crushing it in the kitchen  when we've been there.  

We have been there twice and been impressed with the service.  One of these times was for my birthday dinner with a party of 9. On both occasions, they have been warm, friendly, knowledgeable, and efficient, which is a recipe for a great service experience.

They only serve tequila and mezcal here, so I thought I thought I would just be having margs.  I went to school in New Mexico so many years of drinking bad tequila have completely turned me off to any libation containing it, but they have made me a believer.  They have taken many classics and adapted them to tequila and mezcal and some of the flavors that they have created are stunning.  I recommend the Heart of the Dead or the Mexican FIring Squad for those who like their drinks a little sweeter or fruity.  For those who like a little more bite, try the Oaxacan Old Fashioned or the Latin Manhattan, but my best recommendation is to just tell Jason what you like and let him or his staff do their magic.  

The food...  oh lord, the food.  I feel that they make the best chilaquiles that I have had in the city.  They can be ordered with or without chorizo and they have the perfect amount of citrus to make them heavenly.  Aside from stating that everything on the menu is amazing, I can recommend the Huaraches.  Again, just toss out some flavors that you like and they can recommend something awesome.  ORDER THE CHURRO DONUT HOLES WITH THE LIGHTLY SPICY CHOCOLATE SAUCE.  Sweet baby Jesus...  I can't even talk about them.

Final verdict: another example of the burgeoning Logan Square culinary scene, one of the many reasons why I am happy to call it home.  The food will make you mmmmm and the bill won't make you cringe!

I've walked by Masa Azul several times with my pup and I avoided it because it looked like a stark, trendy little joint that likely had decent margaritas but slacked on their eats.  

My...I'm not sure if he's my boyfriend, and I decided to give it a shot last night.  We were seated easily, it's not a huge place but it's extremely loud.  The menu is fairly small but we ordered the guacamole right away, we were starving.
*side note - the only offer Mexican Coke, Sprite, and a lemon-lime concoction the bartender will make at your request should you want a non-alcoholic beverage.
The appetizer came and it was super fresh, not overly done as most restaurants tend to do with their guac, but it was missing something...

I ordered the Carnitas tacos and he ordered the Asada tacos and a torta (he was a lot hungrier than I).  We swapped tacos (they come two to an order) and dug in...

We both started with the same taco, the Asada, and while the meat itself was extremely tender, easy to bite into, it was missing something, too.  The taco itself had a ton of meat so we didn't feel like that was the missing link...the meat itself was just missing something.

Onto the Carnitas....the exact same review as the Asada.  A ton of meat but the pork was missing something.  We couldn't quite put our finger on it.

I was stuffed and he slowly nibbled on his Torta...which yielded the same review as the tacos.  It was ok but it was missing something.  We did sit and talk for quite a while after we were done eating, we weren't drinking, we just sat and talked and talked until we noticed we were one of two parties still in the restaurant.  No one tried to hurry us out, they simply refilled our waters when they noticed they were low and monitored from afar so we didn't feel like we were keeping them there...I would like to thank our server and the rest of those working for that...

Overall, this Masa Azul was ok.  The tacos are hefty, however, they seem to fall just a bit short.  We were initially looking to hit L'Pastor but they're closed on Tuesdays and Masa Azul was a decent back-up but I don't think we'll be returning.

Where do I start? Everything we ate was delicious. Sampled many of their signature coctails and would try them all again. We did endulge in the food before the drinks though and the chips they serve with the guac are one of a kind. The 4 kinds of tacos were stellar! Although you can find a better steak taco down the street this is second best ever! The other tacos are one of kind. Braised pork, awesome! Tinga, delicious! The sopitos were also great!

Went to Masa Azul for the first time on a friday night. We walked in with no reservation and were seated right away which was great! Our waitress was attentive and fast.

We ordered the Guacamole, Esquites and Tostones as apps. The Guacamole was pretty basic, not the greatest one I've had but not bad either. The Esquites on the other hand were REMARKABLE, great combination of flavors too bad it was a small portion. The tostones were just alright.

We decided to do tacos all around, and ended up ordering several times because the tacos are so small. I ordered the Carne Asada and Baja Shrimp Tacos and they were amazing! It didn't matter that  they were so small because they were delicious. My friend ordered the Chilaquiles and she was not impressed, I tried them and they were not that great. She had to order herself an order of Baja Shrimp Tacos to make up for the chilaquiles. 

For dessert we had the chocoflan and it was delightful. The drinks were very well made, we had the Batanga, Michelada and Heart of the Dead, all delicious and strong. 

Overall, I enjoyed the atmosphere, food and drinks. I will be back eventually but next time I will order myself 3 orders of tacos for myself.
