Delicious food and cocktails. I highly recommend the Heart of the Dead cocktail and the Baja Shrimp tacos. The service was great, though a bit slow at first. And if you're into tequila, they are very knowledgable.

The Pablo cocktail was out of this world.

Excellent service.

One of my favorite spots Jason and Jonathan Thank you.

Went to this place on an early Friday and it was moderately busy, which quickly changed as the night progressed.  

SERVICE: Our server Ashley was great and attentive.  As it got busier, she did a great job considering the number of tables that had patrons.

AMBIANCE: As others have mentioned, it's a fairly intimate place and somewhat minimalistic.  Nothing to rave about but they do have some cool masks that, in retrospect, I wish I had gotten some pictures of.

FOOD: We ordered the guacamole to start.  It was just OK and I think it was overdone with lime but that may just be a personal preference.  I've never been a big fan of lime on my food but it is considered a must in typical Mexican fare.  We ordered the Torta de Carne Asada as the main entree and this packed some major heat. My Irish/German fiancee could hardly finish half of hers.  I would recommend to the owners that they put some type of warning on the menu.  Personally, I thought it was just right but I handle spicy food.

My first thoughts about Azul are that it's a pretty classy place in an area off Diversey that is still defining itself and that they are still experimenting a lot with the menu. I could not find the chicken wings and goat tacos that everyoone was raving about.  Aside from that the place itself is very well put together. I think it could use some more wall treatments as it was kind of bare but nice space. The bar is directly up front and I get a kick out of seeing the young lady mixing drinks since she's on key and makes it look like a production. 

As for the food I had the guacamole for starters. Very good and close to natural with nice avocado chunks and fresh chips.  I also had the scallops which were pan fried perfectly but combined with flavors that interested me. I know there were pineapples and a puree that seemed like it was squash but can't remember. The huarache de tinga was just alright to me. Just a fancy sounding taco. 

I feel like this place is very contemporary from serving size to presentation but I was glad to at least try it. I think one more visit and I wouldn't really have to come back after that.

If anything I have to go back for the ghost pepper salsa.

decent Mexican-style street food at sit-down prices with frigid service; every time. 

I won't give a walk through of the menu. do yourself a favor tho, avoid the tortilla soup; it's more a bowl of hot enchilada sauce (large bowl, little soup at that)

on this last (last) visit I ordered the torta de asada, a $12 sandwich. It's a large very basic sandwich of asada, tomatoes, avocado (maybe lettuce). it's by no means a bad torta, just that you can find better tasting tortas for $8 literally a block away. it's not clear why the menu is over priced. it certainly isn't for the service, I mean unless you value frigid interpersonal skills, a limited knowledge of the menu (apathy I'm guessing), and for fuck-alls sake the inability to pronounce the menu. Example: the waitress told me they were not serving a particular dish that night. well, they were indeed serving that dish, she just didn't understand the name of the dish as it was pronounced correctly....uhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh are you f*cking serious...

also, there's the aesthetic bit. I know this is picky and I'm actually super down for an experience to be no more than paying for food and putting food in mouth, but if you're marketing yourself as a dimly lit dine-in/tequila bar with $$ menu....yeah there's more to the experience cuz that's why we're there! and not at L'Patron (where we should have been haha)
the presentation of the dishes were amiss, take the large torta for example, it's placed on a large white dinner plate, when it should easily be in a basket (gastropub style) or cut in half and plated on an appropriate sized rectangular plate (dude we're talking about Mexican street food here) also they serve their food...with the stupidest steak knife I've seen - it's completely stainless steel, with an exaggerated ergonomic grip, and it weighs considerably less than the dinner fork which itself is noticeable and annoying.  **i mentioned the tortilla soup earlier...it's served in a f*cking vat and in small portion. 

"Masa Azul is like sex with that one Ex; tired, uninspired, and enjoyed begrudgingly"

-cs

Masa Azul?  I thought you were going to be a nice neighborhood place.  But you wooed me with your sophistication of tequilas and memorable foods creating you as a destination in my mind whether I am in this neck of the woods or not.

But let's reflect on where the romance began.  Was it when I pulled open your unassuming front door and found myself in a contemporary dining room . . .so unexpected for this stretch of Diversey?  The clean lines, comfortable seating area and wonderful servers (thanks Jen) just made me feel immediately comfortable and welcome.

The drink list was beckoning to me with names of drinks like "Mexican Firing Squad" and " Latin Manhattan" which had my dining partner and me saying yes to tequila in ways we had never thought we would!

And that food?  You had me at hello with your rich, fresh guacamole and ceviche served with crispy chips.  But when I tasted the sopitos de panza with that crispy pork belly ,my fate was sealed.

But you didn't stop your wooing there.  Oh no.  You went on with your tacos . . .letting me choose my fate from birria (one of my favs) to braised pork to the shrimp tacos which my dining companion still raves about!  

And then on to the entrees of grilled flatiron steak which was perfectly prepared to the chicken breast which came with some amazing mole and corn all combining to an amazing taste which is usually hard to say about mere chicken!!

Dinner for two with plenty of drinks ran about $120 which was perfect for the quality and quantity of food that we had.  And if you drive- there is street parking readily available.  And if you go in the Summer- check out their patio which is the perfect place to enjoy the delights of the food.

Yes . . I admit it.  I have fallen hard for this place.  But then again . .I am a girl who likes to be "wooed".  And that is just what the food and service will do here.

The food is delicious and reasonably priced. Plenty of vegetarian offerings. Finally, a chicken-free spicy tortilla soup! My friend said the tostones were the best he's had since living in the Dominican. 
The cocktails are all winners and the owner incredibly knowledgeable and passionate about tequila. Quiet music allows for lingering conversation. Clean bathrooms, clean bar, great for groups or romantic dates.  
Line ridiculously long at Longman or the over-hyped L' Patron? Walk the 2 blocks and hang out here instead :-)

This place took me by surprise with how good it is!  I read about it being good, but wow were my taste buds pleased!!  Such a cute little restaurant for the area too.  And drinks were tasty and refreshing!

The shrimp appetizer is a must!!  The pork belly was delish also, but the fish entrée blew us away!  It was a perfect spot for a catch up session with my bestie!!  I will definitely be coming back!

Upscale Mexican cuisine done delicious!

Sure you could go to any number of other Mexican restaurants in the area and get a pretty tasty meal at a fraction of the price. What you get at Maza Azul is an overall dining experience. You walk into a beautiful establishment, with fancy cocktails, inventive food and good looking patrons. 

They have tequila flights served in tall champagne glasses which sets this restaurant apart. Of the several flights to choose from, my favorite was the Ode to Enrique Fonseca. Of the cocktails, I read about the Pablo which was great but definitely a dessert drink. If I had a do over, I would have preferred the Gypsy and ordered the Pablo toward the end of the meal.

We ate family style and everything we had was fantastic but the stand outs were the scallops and the chilaquiles. I could eat the tempura avocado forever. My meat eating dinner dates preferred the goat over the pork shoulder tacos.

A nice place to bring a dinner date you are trying to impress or out of town friends/family.

If you like eating amazing, fresh food in a simple, clean and warm environment, Masa Azul should be next on your list.

My husband discovered it during an online search for Chicago's best guacamole, as it's become our latest food obsession.

When we walked in, I was immediately taken by the soft candlelight that illuminates the room just enough for you to see where you're going. The music playing in the background wasn't too loud but very cool.

Of course, we started with the guacamole, and I PROMISE IT'S THE BEST WE'VE HAD IN CHICAGO. A smoky kick, a hint of lime and amazingly chunky texture. I almost licked the bowl.

Also amazing: the pork shoulder tacos. The meat was fall-apart tender and flavorful.

Also amazing: the fried shrimp torta. The shrimp were plump and not overly-battered. The cheese on this sandwich packs a punch, and the avocado spread provides a perfect balance to the spiciness of the shrimp.

Warning: My husband ordered the carne asada torta, and while the meat looked perfectly cooked, he literally burned his lips off, it was that spicy. This sandwich is not for the faint of heart, so if you don't like spicy, order something else.

We will definitely return to Masa Azul as soon as we can, though I'm hoping this review makes it harder and harder to get in! They deserve the business, no doubt about it.

The cocktails are amazing (esp if you like Mezcal) - Veladora is the best. Ask your waiter/tress - they are knowledgeable.

Tostones are loaded with flavor and have great sauce.

Avacado Taco is outstanding. Not the best chile relleno I have had but very good.

I ate here with my veg girlfriend and we really enjoyed it. 

Please open up a location in NYC!!! 

I am going here as much as I can.

The first time I heard about Masa Azul, I heard about the food and was excited to try it. The second time was for their lengthy tequila list, which meant I'd have no trouble convincing my partner in crime to dine here. When the opportunity presented itself for a double date with some friends, one of whom is a sucker for good tequila, I didn't hesitate to suggest Masa Azul.

Picking a place that none of us has tried always makes me me a little nervous; my hesitation was quickly put at ease when I saw how packed the place was. You really don't want to try coming here without a reservation, there isn't much room to wait. We waited briefly for our table and used the time to figure out what drinks we'd get. If I had one complaint about the overall experience it's that it gets loud; fortunately, we snagged a semi-secluded table, which helped buffer some of the noise.

We started out with a round of cocktails; I went with the Black Betty, my friend the Audrey Horne and the guys each got the You Don't See this Everyday flight. I liked both of the cocktails and was happy to trade with my friend who wasn't enamored with hers. For my second, I got the Heart of the Dead, which was the standout of the three. The guys were impressed with their flights and from what I tried, it was tasty and unusual - aptly named. Our server was very knowledgeable of the drink menu, laying down some serious info on the tequilas and recommending which order to consume the flight. She also helped steer them to a good palate-cleansing beer before they resumed their tequila consumption. Considering how lengthy the tequila menu is (longer than many wine lists), this is no small feat.

The food menu is small; divided into three sections - small plates, soup/salad, and entrees. My biggest complaint about many small plates places is that they put too much on the menu; here, the menu was well curated and executed perfectly. We started with the cochinita, baja shrimp, and birria tacos, the octopus tostada and the Mexican scotch egg. I tried the tostada and shrimp tacos, the latter being my favorite. The tostada was good, the arbol chile gave it the right amount of heat, but I felt the octopus flavor was a bit eclipsed by the avocado. I also tried the habanero salsa that accompanied the cochinita tacos; it was amazing how they were able to cut the heat and make it so flavorful. All in all, the starters won high praise.

For our entrees, the guys ordered the bistec with ancho potatoes and the ladies, the camarones with cotija grits. Again, these plates won rave reviews. The shrimp dish was excellent; nice heat from the chipotle peppers, great garlicky flavor from the pesto both balanced the rich, creaminess of the grits. Unexpectedly, the guys agreed the ancho potatoes were some of the best mashed potatoes they've had. To cap it off we had the churros with a chile chocolate sauce; good, but a think the spice to sweetness was slightly out of balance - too much spice, in my opinion.

We left Masa Azul quite happy. Great drinks, great food, attentive and knowledgeable service made it an all-around win.

When friends recommended this place it was a no brainer. My husband loves tequila and we all love food. We made a reservation for 8 on a Saturday. I'm glad we did- the place was packed! We were seated a little  after a reservation.The restaurant was packed and loud. This is not an intimate or romantic setting. Luckily we were able to sit in the back and the noise was a bit contained. 

We naturally started off with cocktails. I ordered the Audrey Horne and luckily for me, my friend liked it. I did not. It turns out I did not like the tequila/mezcal liquor that was in it. To be candid, I am not a huge tequila fan and their other selection is limiting (I had wine next). The others liked their drinks and were impressed at the depth and range of the tequila list. The waitress was knowledgable about the tequilas and was able to explain a lot of the details. I will note that service was a bit slow, but they were busy.

The food was fantastic. We started off with the small plates first. We ordered the shrimp, pork and goat tacos. They were all delicious- I liked the shrimp and the goat the best. The meat was so tender and juicy. The accompanying salsas were good- some heat but not overpowering.  We also got a Mexican scotch egg salad- it had nice chorizo around a soft boiled egg. It was different but delicious.

My friend and I also split the octopus tostada. It was my least favorite thing we ate and the only thing I wouldn't order again. It was not balanced at all.  My first bite was a chunk of chile arbol. I can't comment on the octopus itself because all I could taste was the chile. I may have had more chile because the other half seemed to be enjoyed.  

The entrees were a hit. My shrimp and grits entree was executed with perfection. The shrimp were cooked beautifully and marinated in a nice chipotle sauce. The grits were creamy and paired well. The boys got the steak - and boy was it good! Not only was the steak tender, but it had a nice marinade and was served with really good cheesy mashed potatoes. Yummy! It's a really good thing my husband didn't mind my wandering fork! 

Even though we were full, I had been eyeing the churro that the table next to us had. They looked so good that I was tempted to take their leftovers (resisted thankfully). The churro itself did not disappoint. Crispy outside with a warm soft inside that exploded with cinnamon. I loved it on its own. The spicy chocolate sauce was a good concept but it should have been sweeter with less of a kick. Overall, it was very good.

Went here again with a party of four and the food and service was still great.
I really with the tacos were either a dollar more and came with 3 since they are small or were 1-2 dollars less so they reflected the size.
I also think that drinks here are quite expensive, in this kind of neighborhood there are great places like the whistler and scofflaw where you can get amazing cocktails for even less than they are charging here. The only drinks I can understand having such a high price are the sotol and bacanora drinks since they are rare.
At a table of four with two drinks per person our bill ended up being over 200 dollars which is quite a lot. The restaurant is a $$$ price range but is getting close to a $$$$ price range.
Great tacos, good service and very nice bar with a lot of good cocktails and tequila options :)

Really delicious higher end Mexican food, plus some cool cocktails. I can recommend the Oaxacan Old Fashion, but a lot of them looked very interesting. We got chips with somewhat spicy guacamole, and a couple of different tortas (steak was my favorite, but the shrimp one was really good too). The ambiance is simple but sleek, definitely fancier than a standard Mexican restaurant. I'd come back any time and try other cocktails and the wide range of tacos.

Masa Azul has one of the greatest selections in the country of tequilas, mezcals, and other spirits made from cousins of the agave plant (sotol, bacanora, raicilla, etc). Unlike most gimmicky tequila bars, owner Jason is personally passionate and incredibly knowledgeable about agave spirits and takes great care to offer customers only the authentic products highly regarded by the traditional Mexican growers and distillers, and at very reasonable prices at that. None of the factory mass-produced stuff marketed by corporate America and Las Vegas clubs like Patron or Don Julio. The cocktails are also eminently drinkable and tasty.

Jason is also one of the friendliest guys ever, and will treat you like family no matter what. That is personally what keeps me going back over and over, and bringing all my friends. I had no knowledge of tequilas or mezcals before one of my Mexican friends took me to Masa Azul, and Jason got me hooked with incredible hospitality, staying into the wee hours of the night (totally beyond his duties) pouring me different types of tequilas and explaining each and every one of them and sharing personal stories.

Food is also great and totally affordable. They've gone through a few different chefs over the years, but they consistently try to do food that stays true to its Mexican roots and retains traditional flavors but does something creative with them.

What a cute little gem! My girlfriends and I celebrated Valentine's Day, aka, single's awareness day at Masa Azul last night.  I loved the music and dim lighting, perfect atmosphere for a date or girls' night out.

I had the Pablo cocktail, actually three of them throughout the course of the night.  It was that good!  Loved the natural flavor of the coconut, but wasn't too sweet which is how I prefer my cocktails.

We shared the guacamole, shrimp tacos, Huarache de Tinga, and Tostada de Pulpo.  Everything was great and I especially loved the spicy kick each dish had, but servings were smaller than I expected for the price point.

I also have to add that service was great.  I forgot who our waitress was, but she was awesome. I'd love to come back here again, especially to hang with Pablo! :-)

Myself and a shitty friend were headed to Chilapan for dinner after viewing their oh so sexy food porn photos.  Alas, Chilapan had a private party happening which left us frantically searching for a new (late) dinner place to try.

Enter: Mas Azul.

We both kind of agreed on it, since we both looked up local reviews of Spanish or Tapas in the area via our android phones using the Yelp app. (Shameless plug, yes.)

I remembered a review which read " try them all".  I remembered a friend told me, "trying them all is pricey".  

My advice to you newbies.  Try them all and forget about the cost of it but know that the  cost will be somewhere in the neighborhood of $125 with drinks.  Bring hungry hippos, eager beavers or just willing-to-try-them-all friends.  Every offering on their current menu is worth it.  Every friggin' last tapas offered including the veg ones are bangin'!  Me thinks I have to do this visit again, maybe with a hot date and definitely with more (heavily poured) drinks.

Cheers!

This place is fantastic! Cocktails are inventive and extremely well balanced, and if none of the drinks appeal to you, the bartender will gladly make whatever you'd like.

As for the food....SO good. Here are the deets of what we had on their current menu, which seems to change pretty frequently:

Tostones - perfectly crunchy and chewy, complimented well by the aioli and mojo.
Coctel de Camaron - very good, may be a tad too sweet for some
Both Huarache options (chicken and mushroom) - delish!
Birria - solid dish, albeit a little messy

Will be back soon!!

We had a great time here last night.  The owner was really accommodating with our reservation and the food was really good. Finally a mexican restaurant that actually makes their own tortillas.  Cocktails were pretty delicious too.  Nice selection of mezcal.

Uriel M Cano -- 5 starMaza Azul delivers a small menu but done right!! I was there with my wife today for her birthday and the food was phenomenal. I heard of this restaurant because I actually tried out to work there unfortunately I was offered another position. But the food is just as creative as i remeber and hands down best I have had in a long time in regards to upscale Mexican food.

Excellent food.

I went with the tacos, ceviche, torta and charro negro.

Tacos - 3 of them, veggie, sea, and swine. Handmade tortillas, very good

Ceviche - mild and fresh. perfect

Torta - carnita and pickled onion with some blazing hot sauce. My favorite

Charro Negro - mexican coke and tequila with a chile rimmed glass.

Check it out.

My only complaint about this restaurant is that it isn't open more often!  They aren't open for lunch, aren't open on Monday's, don't stay open very late, and don't open until 6pm each day.  I don't get it!  For someone like myself, with a very odd schedule, this makes it difficult for me to frequent... but if I can get through the doors, I'm happy!

Regardless, the drinks are fantastic - they have an amazing selection of tequila and make creative use of it in their delightful cocktails.  If they were open later, I'd come here for a nightcap or appetizer on my way home as often as possible.  The food is of a very high standard, especially for the price, and the decor is lovely.

My favorite thing on the menu is their avocado and green chile soup, which sounds strange, but is an amazing combination of flavors.  All of the seafood dishes are also very good, and I enjoy the tapas-style size of the dishes, so that you can share many dishes and get a full appreciation of the menu.

They also offer tequila flights, so that is another plus!   Finally, I'm pretty sure this is a small business, and it's in a bit of an awkward location, so support this restaurant guys!
Fresh interesting Mexican food that's not too Americanized. Really enjoyed the ceviche and arbol chile salsa.

This must be one of the most amazing restaurants in Chicago. Is small and kept simple, but the food is incredibly good and their selection of mezcales and tequilas is unbelievable. Service is great and they make you enjoy every minute you spend there. We will be back
Very soon

I was just there this past Saturday. I thought the place was cute and I love supporting my local restaurants in the area.  They were able to accommodate my large group which I appreciated. My friends and  I were looking forward to tasting the carne asada and the mezcal drinks.  Unfornately, they ran out of carne asada and a few of their drinks.  I don't understand how this could happen, I'm sure the steak is one of the main sellers which is why I don't understand how this could happen. The appetizers where okay but I felt that the waitress was trying to make us order 2 of everything instead of one which is what we did, the same with the drink we ordered for the group. The restaurant is small but very cute, the only problem is that it's extremely loud. It was hard to carry a conversation. 

I thought the waitress was just okay, I don't know what her name was since she never mentioned it to us.  I asked her for cocktail recommendations and she just told us what the menu said but never recommended anything, she also mentioned the 2 drinks they ran out of. At one point my friend and I spoke to her at the same time and she raises her hand saying "Aww, wait their is 2 of you talking at the same time", I'm sure this could had been handled differently.  I also asked for salt for my carnitas tacos that were extremely greasy. She then brings me the salt in a small dipping plate and makes sure to tell the reason why it's in a small plate is because nobody ever asks for salt.  My friends and I just looked at her and when she left we said that was unnecessary and rude.  

I really wanted to like this place but due to these issues, I probably will not be coming back. I've had better food and drinks in Logan Square to come back to this restaurant.

The ambiance at Masa Azul is relatively low key; however, the food is incredibly flavorful and the cocktails are unique.  

My friend and I started w/ the Pablo...and had 2 more each after that.  If you like coconut, you have to try the Pablo - it isn't too sweet or heavy.  A perfect drink.

We started with the guacamole which had a hint of lime and spice.  The portion is relatively small, but the guac is delicious and the tortilla chips are light and fresh tasting.  For our main entrees - we split two platos and each had a taco.  I had the pork taco (carnitas) since it was the only gluten free taco available.  The taco was a bit spicy, but in a great way.  We also split the Tostada de Pulpo and Huarache de Tinga.  The tostada had lots of avocados and baby octopus.  The octopus was cold, which was surprising, but overall the dish was good.  The huarache was really unique with pulled chicken thigh, cheese, and beans on top of a fresh corn-like pita (gluten free).  The dish was very flavorful and had a hint of spice.  I would highly recommend the Huarache.

None of the dishes are that large here, so I recommend splitting multiple dishes.  We felt like 1 taco + 1 entree + split app was a good amount of food for one person.
180 degree change from previous concept.  Now featuring just a few simple, traditional items.  Same thing on the drink menu.  We were told the chef  left recently.

My friend and I decided to meet at Masa Azul for dinner at 5:30pm. We were completely unaware that they open at 6pm. I didn't realize this until I walked up to the door and saw their hours. However, who I perceived to be the manager came to the door and said, "come on in - our bar is open" as he unlocked the door rather than having me stand outside the restaurant. The staff was friendly and the bartender, Brian was attentive, welcoming and genuine. I was the only person in the restaurant until my girlfriend arrived and I felt at home as the staff prepared the restaurant for the Friday night rush. The drinks were amazing! The guacamole and chips were great too. Fabulous service!

Very flavorful food, and the drinks are great. However, potions are very small and pricey for what you get. This is definitely not
Your regular Mexican restaurant.

Girlfriend and I sat at the bar and had cocktails.  We started with Horse with No Name and Russell in the Tumbleweeds.  The first was a lavendery tequila cocktail topped with sparkling wine, the second a peppery orangey mezcal drink.  They were both so good.  For the next round we had Gypsy and Tour de Mexico, more in the vein of margaritas but with lots of complexity.  We ate the ceviche of shrimp and scallops which went really well with what we were drinking.  The cocktail list is seasonal, small batch, runs deep and changes often.

This little place is really really good. My wife and I stopped here around 9:30 for an impromptu date night. My wife was on a knee scooter at the time because she has a broken ankle. A guy working there, might be the owner, I don't know, saw us coming and helped open the door and get us inside. It's really dark in there which is fine, helps set the mood. Place wasn't very busy but it looked like everyone was enjoying themselves.

After reading other reviews we decided to get the guac. It was really tasty. Creamy and chunky.

They have a lot of fancy cocktails, a little pricey for me though. My wife had a margarita, that isnt' your standard one. She loved it.

We ordered the special which was a chile relleno with chorizo. It came on a bed of rice. Excellent dish, we shared that.

Also ordered the Shrimp tacos, steak tacos and the pork tacos. They come 2 in an order. They aren't very big, but they are definitely upscale, like at Big Star. These tacos were really good, very fresh and the sauces and toppings complimented them well.

Great place for a date and we will definitely return. It's a little expensive and nicer than most Mexican places I've been too, but that's ok. Great discovery.
We went here on a Friday night and were lucky enough to get the most cozy table in the back of the place.  The food was simple and inventive and absolutely delicious.

Gourmet Mexican street food with a tequila selection that is second to none in the Chicago-land area.  This ain't your average Tex-Mex place trying to masquerade as authentic.  this is the real deal Mexican flavors done with a gourmet flair at a fantastic price.  I had the Sopitos made with pork belly and fried masa and it was exquisite. You can taste the passion and TLC that Chef Jonathan Zaragoza (previously of Birrieria Zaragoza) brings to his food.  Secret ingredient is love and it shows.

Combine that with owner Jason's encyclopedic knowledge of tequila and agave spirits and you have a place that makes fore both a great date night and a chill night out with friends.  Jason is one of the friendliest guys you'll ever meet and one of the most knowledgeable Tequila Sommeliers (Tequilier maybe?) around and is always ready to drop a quick lesson on Tequila 101 for those interested.

Everything from the decor to the service was exceptional.  If you appreciate true culinary craftsmanship paired with artisanal spirits this place is a must try.

After seeing Jonathan Zaragoza on TV and reading numerous articles, including Bon Appetit, i needed try this place. Hey, he's just a kid. 

Luckily, my wife went early on a Saturday, and we were seated promptly. 

The place is not huge, but not tiny either. It has around 20 tables plus seating at the bar. The tables near the wall are close to one another which I don't mind, but the wait staff should take note when walking in between tables, their back side is inches from the other table. which can be somewhat awkward. The place is decorated nicely, but lighting could be a bit brighter.  A little more light results in no issue reading the menus.

Enough about the decor i came here for the food. 

Regarding the food, Jonathan Z knocks it out of the park. This is not your typical Mexican food. Go somewhere else for a $3.50 steak burrito. The sopitos with the pork belly where awesome. Crispy sopes topped with pickled veggies and very flavorful pork belly can't be beat, unless you get 2 orders. 
I suggest getting the chilaquiles as an appetizer which can easily be shared by 2-3 people. 

While the $3.50 steak burrito client may squawk at 3 tacos for $9, I'm telling you, these may be the best tacos i have ever tasted. We tried the pork, shrimp and avocado. You cannot go wrong with either. Nestled in the homemade tortilla each left me wondering how a taco can taste this good.  

I cannot wait to go back. You can tell Jonathan Z is creative and passionate about his product. At such a young age, I'm excited to see where he goes.  

PS. Drinks are unique and the menu descriptions are spot on. The wait staff are friendly and knowledgeable.
Best margaritas in the city.  Service is great, so is the food. Trendy fun atmosphere.. Can't wait to go back.

Drinks - 5 stars.

Smoky tequila mixed with all sorts of fancy liqueurs, extracts, bitters, and peels... delightful. I tried a few. The black betty (per yelp's ravin reviews) was QUITE refreshing. It had a nice tart cherry bite to it, but was an easy drink and had a healthy dose of fine tequila involved. My favorite was that frothy, salty, toasty coconut TREAT. I would never have guessed that coconut + tequila + salty rim would have ever = amazing combo, but the salt was an incredible tie between the flavors of the tequila, and the sweet creaminess of the coconut.

... I mean, I could have been cocochugging those all day long.

The food was good. Not excellent, but very good. I had shrimp tacos, a favorite of mine, and the mushroom tacos. The shrimp tacos had a really nice garlicy/spicy sauce happening that really blended the flavors and cut the greasiness of the battered shrimp.  The mushroom taco was honestly, not my favorite, but I accidentally overdid it (bigtime) with the little sauce accompagnant. It had a bizarre and overpowering flavor that I might not have actually used had I had the foresight to try it before slathering it all over my taco... must've been those coconut cocktails..

Overall I had a great time, I love the vibe, love the drinks, love the shrimp tacos.

So glad I found this place . Ordered lunch today with my coworkers , had it delivered 
Sandwiches arrived hot and our large order was correct 
I had the Little Italy - would definitely recommend it ! Chicken , turkey , cheese, spinach , tomato ,1000 island 
So good!  I got a side of the republic sauce as other Yelp reviewers suggested and so glad I did.. It seems to be a mix of garlic sauce , pesto , an maybe a smoky chipotle sauce . So good !
My boss got the Tuna and loved it! Said it wAs the perfect tuna melt 
The smoothie was great.. Not too sweet - no added sugar  
Everyone said its there new spot to order from delivery was only $3.50. Prices were really reasonable for a substantial sandwich 

Thumbs up

I'm so happy Panini Republic is literally 20 feet from my apartment! I went there a while ago to get a smoothie (The Republic--had a mix of greens and fruit and coconut water). The smoothie was ok but I felt great after drinking it...it's definitely healthy and fresh but not super sweet or thick in consistency.

The real star here was the salad I just got for takeout, the Fresh Market salad. The name definitely captures it, super fresh ingredients and I loved the combo of strawberries pecans and blue cheese! It's pretty big too, I had about half and am satisfied so I'm saving the other half for tomorrow. 2 healthy meals for under $10? Sold

It was a great place for a midday meal. We had:
1) lentil soup: soup made with green lentils was well seasoned, and overall decent. I've had better ones though.
2) Cubano panini: well balanced, juicy and oh so delicious. Highly recommend it!
3) Republic Reuben: it was amazing, but felt a tad bit too salty. But you do get a lot of meat!
4) Bacon bacon panini: simple, and yummy.
All of this cost just under $30, i.e. under 10 bucks per person, so it's a good deal - we were pretty full at the end.
Overall, I would say this is a place worth coming back to!

A fantastic corner spot for a panini and cup of soup. I hate the Little Italy, which was tasty. Nothing was over-powering like some panini makers do - like sauce. This was a perfect balance. I also had a cup of roasted tomato soup, which was some of the best that I have ever had. Don't forget to check in on Yelp for a free drink or bag of chips. The guys working were very friendly and quick with the orders.

I could go on and on about how amazing Panini Republic is.... so I will. 

I was excited to give it a try as I love Panini's and they are located at a cute, clean location in Lincoln Park. The store was honestly spotless. I was greeted by the owner and quite possibly one of the friendliest people I've met in my life. 

He walked me through the menu and also mentioned that you can make your own panini's. I was already sold on the Bacon Bacon, but literally all of them sounded amazing. He put my sandwich together and explained that everything is fresh and everything not used from the day before is not used. Seriously so awesome of them to do.

The best part is, you can honestly taste how fresh it is. Everything from the bread to the vegetables to the meat. It's all so fresh and SO delicious. I've never had a sandwich this fresh and this tasty made by someone so friendly. I was honestly in awe. I will be coming back here frequently and bringing my friends as well!

Lastly,  I'm beyond impressed with the prices. Their food is so good and so fresh they could totally charge way more than they are. I was full for hours and all for $10.50. A total steal! 

TIP: All of their sauces are HOMEMADE and so, SO good. Their Republic Sauce (off-menu) is a mixture of three different sauces and is honestly so out of this world I was even dipping my chips in it!
Wet delicious salads and sandwiches! With a sandwich a side of the house sauce is GREAT! Thanks Yelp reviewers for the advice.

OMG, chicago fire was so good!!! 
I was never a big fan of sanwich, maybe because i am Asian and my stomach can't handle bread well and usually i think sandwich is just meat and vege in between 2 pieces of dry bread! I went there with my hubby because he was craving something like that, so to act as a good wife i followed him. I have to say, this sandwich completely changed my view of Sandwich, it was so good, so tasty and everything was so fresh!!!
Highly commandeered!!

Great little sandwich place with really fresh ingredients.  We got the meat lover sandwiches on pretzel and multi grain breads.  The sandwiches take a few minutes to make on the panini press, but they're worth the wait and pretty cheap. I really liked the chipotle garlic sauce they used.  Normally I prefer pretzel, but the multi grain bread was actually a little better. 

Make sure to check in for a free bag of chips/drink!

If you're looking for an upgrade from your typical Potbelly's sandwich, Panini Republic is a great option. 

We tried the Chicago Fire on multi-grain and the Cubano on white bread. Both sandwiches had great flavors and the bread was toasted nicely. The prices are decent too, at around $6.50- $7 a sandwich. 

Pro tip: get a side of the delicious house sauce (which is a mixture of their garlic, chipotle, and harissa sauces), also check in on Yelp for a free bag o' chips or fountain drank.

Let me start by saying that I've never been a sandwich person, never. 28 years into my sandwichless existence, panini republic came into my life, and ever since then I love paninis. The only reason I give it 4 and not 5 stars is because on my second outing to this place the guy making our meal put his hand into the trash can to take out our bill and confirm our order, which would've been okay unless he went back to making other peoples sandwiches without changing his gloves first!!! This was disappointing, but nonetheless I love the food, the service is great, nice patient people who care about your day, the kind of people who dont get annoyed when a sandwich naive soul like yours truly traipses in and take half an hour to decide what he would have to eat. If you live in the Lakeview region or in Chicago per say don't miss this little jewel.

The Panini Republic located @ 500 W Diversey Ave has been open about 1 year.  I went there and tried their Smoke salmon panini.   They have a choice of 3 breads, pretzel bread regular bread or multi grain.  I chose the multi grain bread w/smoked salmon, red onions, spinach, pesto & garlic sauce on toasted multi grain bread.  They toast this to absolute perfection with just the right crunch.  It was absolutely fabulous.  Based on this one sandwich it's easy to see why this place has a 5 STAR rating on Yelp.  Their menu has 10 sandwiches & 6 salads.  

Their food is reasonably priced.  The smoked salmon panini sandwich I ordered was absolutely delicious. It is very small restaurant that is very clean.  When I went in around 12:30 it wasn't very crowded.  The owner greeted me and took my order and I grabbed a seat and waited.  Every sandwich is made to order on the spot while the customer waits.  

I am very happy that I took the chance to check The Panini Republic out.  Their reviews on Yelp are justified.  This was probably one of the best sandwiches I ever had.  I will absolutely be back again and try some of their other panini's & maybe a salad.

Overall: Good pick for a quick an tasty panini that are a good size.

The good: Great tasting paninis, Good sized, and hot and fresh. The brownies and cookies are good too.

The bad: Slow at times, no bathroom (gotta go to the nasty (but awesome bar) galway bay bathroom). Used to be open late night. Cashier wasn't good.

Atmosphere: 7/10
Service: 7/10
Food: 8/10

Very good sandwich and great guys behind the table.  I stopped in just to grab anything and was very impressed with the panini.  I went splits with a buddy and had the Ruben and the Chicago fire.  Both were great and they give you this sauce on the side.  Reminded me of a schawarma place sauce.  Get it

Very friendly and helpful people. 
I had a Cubano it was barely average. The ingredient quality seemed on par with subway.

I ordered delivery from Panini Republic last weekend, and I was not impressed at all with what I received.

When putting in my online order, I specifically requested pretzel bread for both of the sandwiches on the order.  When it came, I was surprised to see that one sandwich had multigrain bread and the other had regular white bread.  It was very disappointing considering that one of the main reasons that I ordered from Panini Republic was due to the fact that you can have your sandwich on pretzel bread.

My order also seemed a little light on meat.  My sandwich was supposed to have pastrami and roasted chicken on it, but it seemed like I only got maybe a couple of slices of each on the entire 8-9" hoagie.

Other than that, the taste was good and the price was reasonable, but I don't think that I'll be going out of my way to get food from here anytime soon.

Had the veggie panini with a side of spicy sauce - it was delicious!

Also ordered a green smoothie - delicious again!
Delicious Paninis all around. I love the Salmon and the Little Italy. Big portions too. ALWAYS ask for a side of the Republic Dipping Sauce! Makes the panini even better!

It's okay. Really just chiming in to give this place an honest rating. I have been here twice and the sandwiches are fine. This is not anywhere near a 4.5 or 5 star place though. 

Come here for a decently priced, decent sandwich.

I am quite shocked by the 5 star reviews after my experience.  I ordered delivery which was about 20 minutes late, no big deal.  Had a sandwich, sweet potato soup, and ordered some dessert, brownies and some pastry thing.  I got a call back from the restaurant shortly after ordering stating that they were out of the pastry and asked if I wanted another brownie or something, I told them no, just take it off the order.  Since I ordered online, the order was already paid for so this item was never refunded.  I guess I should have taken the offer of 
"something else", but I just wanted the money back, too much to ask for unfortunately.  Now I didn't specifically instruct them to make sure they took it off, but that is something that should be done automatically.  If you don't have something, refund the cost, basic business. On to the food.

The sandwich was ok, nothing outstanding, on the light side as far as meat goes, but good flavor.  The soup was ok, decent flavor but nothing to write home about.  The real kicker was the gas station brownies they put in the bag with my order.  Full of preservatives and whatever else comes in those cellophane wrapped abominations that they sell at convenience stores.  I was truly appalled by this.  I thought, "well maybe they're just f-in awesome, I'll rip it open and give it a try?" I had to spit it out.  Disgusting, chemical laden pile made somewhere in New Jersey, shipped "fresh" to your local restaurant and rushed to your table.  What kind of locally owned restaurant offers brownies and then sells preserved trash from New Jersey?? Unheard of and embarrassing.  

So overall, the food was pretty good despite the small portions of meat, but the non-refunded item that they were out of and the gas station brownies they serve lose 1-2 stars in my book.  Based on the food, 3 stars, the experience + brownie brings them down to 1.5 to 2 stars total for me.  I won't be back and suggest that you take heed if your sweet tooth starts talking to you and you're tempted by the thought of a brownie.  Don't do it!
The place is really small and has little seating, but the service is good and the paninis are great! Everything is affordable too, which is a plus!

A fantastic corner spot for a panini and cup of soup. I hate the Little Italy, which was tasty. Nothing was over-powering like some panini makers do - like sauce. This was a perfect balance. I also had a cup of roasted tomato soup, which was some of the best that I have ever had. Don't forget to check in on Yelp for a free drink or bag of chips. The guys working were very friendly and quick with the orders.

Listen. This place has an average 5 star yelp review. They aren't using haxx, your eyes aren't deceiving you. Its worth every star and then some.

When you first walk in you'll notice how clean and organized the restaurant is, how colorful and well laid out the menu and decor are, and how genuine the owner is. He's right there behind the counter with a smile on his face, asking you how your day is going and offering you suggestions on what to get. His friendly demeanor is infectious. You'll see all of his fresh ingredients and sauces that when put together, make a killer panini. All for 10 bucks or less.

My wife and I came in and split the Smoked Salmon. Pesto, garlic sauce, onion, tomato, and spinach on pretzel bread. The owner asked if we liked spicy things and we said duhh, so he gave us this ridiculous sauce that was part aoili, chutney, and siracha mayo (maybe?). Whatever it was it was amazing. You can really taste the freshness of the ingredients (smoked salmon was fresh AF) and more importantly, you can taste the care the owner puts in his craft. He really wants you to love your food, and we did. 

So listen up business owners. You want to know how to run a successful restaurant? Do what this guy is doing. Come in, see his enthusiasm, sell a great product for a great price, and let the rest take care of itself.

Ok I'm going to cut to the chase. YES you should eat/order from here. Why?

1) bomb salads and paninis
2) I've had three attractive men deliver to me so far
3) they call you right away if something can't be done with your order (for example I tried to have an ingredient taken out of a pre made smoothie)
4) did I mention they have attractive delivery boys?
5) super friendly, and fast delivery
6) cute boys

Variety of selections from Cubano to vege paninis. Very friendly staff and quite close to the Galway Bar so u can take your selections there to munch. They serve 3 soups per day and have a few desserts. Their philosophy is that food eating should be about the food you love. Better than Subway, I think it's my new favorite sandwich shop in Chicago.
Always really solid. The Chicago Fire on a pretzel roll is great.

Come here quiet often and normally the food is pretty good. Pete is a rockstar employee and probably the reason this place even succeeds.+2

Tonight I called in my order near closing. They were very rude on the phone and hung up on me after I placed my order. Contemplated not even picking up my food but I did. -1

When I showed up 2 guys I've never seen working here before. No manners, no personality. -1

The food - not hot and did not complete my order correctly.  2 essentials to cooking food right? -1

If I'm gonna call in my order it should be treated like any other order. I would rather have you not take my order than serve it incorrectly and be rude about the entire process.

I'll come back when Pete is working.
Vacationing here in Chicago and stopped in for lunch. Nice and clean . sandwiches look amazing. Check in and get chip and a drink FREE

Very excited to have this place near my house. I tried to the Little Italy and it was amazing! One of the best panini's I've ever had! The bread is great, the ingredients are fresh, and the way they grill the panini is quite special. 

The staff is very friendly and they seem to be having a good time, which I like to see. 

Just like other people have mentioned: GET THE SPICY SAUCE ON THE SIDE! You'll be happy you did. 

I already can't wait to go back!

Panini Republic has been a great addition to the north Lincoln Park West area.  I've made close to a dozen visits to PR and the best way to sum it up is; tasty, consistent, and variety.  It's hard to pick a favorite however, if I had to it would probably be the Little Italy. I also frequent the El Cubano and the Chicago Fire.  My wife loves the Sweet Potato soup. The PR smoothie or the Green Juice is a great way to round out your meal...always hit the spot.

I actually LOVE this place. The food is delicious and my first experience here was amazing. 

I am now here for a fourth time and I could not be more disgusted. 

-When I was walking in there was a guy outside the door in a panini republic tshirt smoking. Not only was I annoyed that I had to walk in his smoke cloud but I was really upset that my 21 month old niece had to. 

-No one else is in the place, he was inside seconds after but an initial greeting like the first time I had would have been nice. 

-He continues to walk behind the counter and not even attempt to wash his hands.  He did put plastic gloves on, but I had to bite my tongue just to not say anything to him. 

-On top of all of that he was rude, I could have done with out the attitude. At the end of everything his was talking about his horrible slammed day... I didn't need to know about your slammed day, mine was too and I never complain about it to my guests to explain my horrible customer service. 

Needless to say I am now very unexcited to eat my panini. Completely opposite from my drive there. I would have given 5 stars had it not been for this experience.. I really love their food. I'll have to update my post if my food ends up tasting like smoke.
Delicious panini, I tried the veggie and it was definitely fresh and tasty.  Good service and they do a great job at maintaining clean.  Surprisingly  they don't have a bathroom though :(
I love this place and they are delicious! I don't understand why they close so early. Apparently, they don't care about their customers! Horrible business operations!

Let me start by saying I have never written a Yelp review because they are tedious and I feel slightly pretentious. But, oh sweet baby Jesus, I found heaven in my panini today. If you are looking for a reason to keep moving everyday this place is it. You will never find a hot sandwich as satisfying as the ones they have. I'm getting emotional with every bite. Just do it my friends, and make sure you ask for the house sauce, whatever it is, it's amazing. Thank you, Panini Republic, for restoring a cynical millennial's faith in human kind through a hot sandwich.

I was surprised how good the sandwiches are. I'm not a sandwich girl (except for those from the long-closed Zoom Kitchen). The soup is good too. There are often a lot of deals and rewards you can use to discount your purchase.

This restaurant was a gem. They have a wide variety of delicious paninis. I had the Meat Lover, and it didn't disappoint - Chicken, pastrami, turkey and bacon on a pretzel bun (along with a plethora of veggies and sauces). Prices were very reasonable and the owner was very nice and quite inviting. I'll definitely be back in the future!

What an awesome establishment! I just tried this place for the first time and I'm quite impressed! I read their reviews on Yelp before coming in, and by the looks of it, this place is pretty brand new. Well, for being new, they sure got things right the first time! I had an awesome dining experience here.

When I walked in, I was greeted by a super friendly, helpful guy. He told me everything they had to offer and explained the menu to me thoroughly. I went with the Bacon Bacon Panini on a pretzel bun. I've never had a panini on a pretzel bun before. Let me tell you, before THIS place, I was missing out! The pretzel bun was delicious. He even mixed together some sauces to create a house/signature sauce for me to dip my sandwich in. I tried a sample of their sweet potato Mediterranean soup and it was great! 

I got a sandwich and drink for $9.73. Not bad for Lakeview! Everything was tasty and fresh. The place itself was fresh and clean. Almost looks like an Apple store with white being the main color. They were also playing Bob Marley while I was there, so bonus points for that! I could go on and on about this place and their awesome food and their amazing service. But you should just try it yourself. 

I've definitely found my new go-to sandwich spot! It's just a few blocks from my apartment, too! Winning at LIFE right now.

This place is the new brightly shining star glowing over Diversey and Pine Grove.

I watched the place go up and I finally stopped in to try it today.  Ok, I would have tried it sooner, but I am so so so busy at work and traveling so much it's been impossible to really commit to going.  But I am a sucker for a good sandwich and have an even larger appreciation for paninis of late, so it was time to panini myself.  There are two options here: you can build a sandwich to your preference, or you can pick one of the sandwiches on the menu.  Previously, it was kind of a "build-your-own-shop", but has since changed; we spoke to the guy at the counter who explained that the menu was derived statistically, based on the most common order combinations from patrons.  AMAZING!  A place that actually listens to and crafts a menu for its customers?  Right on!  

I went with the Little Italy, mainly because it had pesto and I could eat pesto anytime, anywhere.  A pretzel panini?  Yes please.  Have you ever had a panini on a pretzel roll?  If you haven't, you are missing out, people.  I loved how the panini press burned the pretzel and made it more crusty... kind of like an actual pretzel!  Combined with a bag of chips and a pop I was completely satisfied.

Savior.

And with Galway Bay downstairs, these people are going to bank.  

The proximity to my apartment is clutch and it's good enough to make regular appearances.  This way, I won't have to make shameful walks to 7-11 for late night food anymore.
Great food, high quality, awesome prices, 6-8$. Highly highly recommend. I walked in randomly and I am glad I did! Super friendly staff
The staff is super friendly and the sandwiches are delicious. I got a Chicago Fire and my bf ordered a cubano. Both so good and came out quick.

Solid fast-casual place serving fresh panini's, soups, salads, and smoothies just steps away from Lincoln Park! I recommend stopping here and grabbing a panini to-go on your way to the park. Try the Little Italy on a pretzel bun- yum!

Food tastes mediocre 

Portion sizes and the thinness of their add-ons are small

It has such horrible signage that you forget it's a panini joint. 


For a sandwich place, its okay

Great food and affordable prices.

I've been there twice and loved the food.

I don't know what I can say that hasn't been said about this place but it definitely is fantastic!  The ingredients were fresh and flavorful to make this one of the better sandwich shops around.  It fits in nicely in lakeview east and I hope they open more places in the city.

Great sandwiches , the owner yoav  is a great guy 
Great food great customer service ,this guy will kill it if he open more locations .

I grabbed food from here the other day and loved the Little Italy panini I ordered. The location is kept very clean and it is set up similar to a subway/chipotle where you can see them make your food in front of you. Personally, I wasn't too impressed by the lentil soup, but the panini was awesome.  The prices are super reasonable and service was friendly.

My BF is fairly new to the neighborhood, so we've  been trying out all sorts of places. We'd passed on this option for awhile until today. What were we waiting for?!? Delicious! I had the veggie on multigrain, he had the Little Italy. Both were fantastic. They had delicious, fresh ingredients in perfect balance, and the sandwiches were huge. The decor is super cute, also. Will definitely be back, beats standard sandwich places easily--no contest whatsoever.
Very spacious & delightful environment .. Super casual & a quick place to grab lunch. I enjoyed the veg panini on multigrain bread !
Super fresh veggies and bread. Veggie panini was delicious.The multigrain bread was perfectly toasted yet still soft. My son loved his El Cubano on pretzel bread.

This place was awesome. Hard to find really good sandwiches that are not your classic chains. And, a hot melty panini is hard to beat. The owner was the one making lunch today, he was extremely nice, and makes a great panini! We had the Chicago Fire and Little Italy. One on pretzel and one on multigrain. And, he made the house sauce mix which was an awesome addition. For sure coming back, and glad to support a local place that is actually good. Win win.

This is just a gem of a place. Arguably the best panini I've ever had.. Very friendly staff, great fresh meat and vegetables and the best part is it's open late. 

Just a word of caution... This place is addictive.
This place is decent. The employees are very nice, but they are stingy on toppings. The sandwiches are just ok.
Awesome! Food was fantastic, try the republic sauce! Staff was friendly too, definitely go back again and again.

Stopped in when we were drinking at Galway Bay and needed some grub, and boy, did we get more than we could have expected!! Such good quality paninis. So fresh! Had the Bacon Bacon and it was so good! The place is super clean and decorated uniquely. Service is super friendly too!

Was so happy when something finally opened up in this vacant spot. And even happier when it was a healthy-looking sandwich shop!

Being vegetarian the only option for a sandwich is the Fresh Veggie which they don't really put a lot on. (You know how at Subway when you ask for black olives they give you like, 3? Yeah...think that.) And it's not like they don't have other veggies to add to the sandwich, since they have salads with carrots, cucumbers or beets, so why not allow for a "build your own veggie" sandwich. The sandwich was good but so thin since there was barely anything in it.

Also tried the lentil soup while there, which I have to admit, was amazing! I would go back just for the soup ($3.25) and hold off on the baby sandwich with a big price ($5.75, at which point I'd rather just go to Potbelly for that price, also right down the street).

May come back at some point for more soup and to try a salad, but will stray way from the over-priced veggie sandwich.
Tried this out on a whim because I was craving a panini. Loved it! Tried the Chicago Fire and added garlic sauce. The service was great and the guys were cool.
Basically a Subway but nothing wrong with that! Good grilled cheese; fast service and everyone was super friendly.

This place is WELL WORTH IT!!! Yaov, the owner, is a true gentlemen. He tried to get to know me while I made my sandwich. This place is a legit FIVE STARS, no games.

The food was priced reasonable and the restaurant was VERY clean and nice looking. The service was great and food tasted great.

GO HERE!

I love this place! I typically order the Bacon Bacon sandwich on pretzel and I am never disappointed! A few times I have gotten a salad, which has also been a great choice. This place offers fresh ingredients and an always friendly staff.

Love this amazing paninis !!! Great service incredible food !! This place is super easy on the go great for everyday quick lunch ! Found out about it throw my giftie app and now im addicted to thier delicious paninis and soups !!! Def check it out guys !
Awesome paninis! The guy, Riley I think his name was, was super friendly and made my panini perfectly. Always ask for Riley - he will make it right!

Great food, great value. The serving size of a panini is easily two meals (though I of course couldn't stop once I finished the first half), and for under $7 you can't beat it. When I told the friendly face behind the counter that I like my sandwich spicy, I was pleasantly surprised when he gave me a spicy sauce blend he made to go along with my sandwich. Great service, along with the food and value will definitely bring me back again!

Was originally on my way to Chipotle, but saw this place and decided to stop here instead. I'm very glad I did. 

Customer Service was warm and welcoming. Decided to try the Little Italy ($6.55). Waited only a handful of minutes. They used very fresh ingredients. Got my order to go. Asked me if I wanted the special house sauce on the side. I said yes. They put it in a little plastic container and I was on my way.

Came home and opened up my sandwich. Delicious. Fresh. Seasoning just right. Bread was very good and crisp and toasted to how a panini should be. The special house sauce was also very good. I actually regret not using it on the first half of my sandwich. It's creamy, seasoned, and a nice touch to any sandwich on the menu.

I would bring out-of-town family and friends here. Perfect place for a quick bite, carry-out on the way home, or to satisfy your panini craving.

First thing that the guy said to me when I walked into Panini Republic is that this panini can be addictive, and that it'll be one of the best paninis I've ever had. 

Is that a challenge?!?

I built my panini, picked my bread, then my sauce, then my meats, finally my veggies and cheese. As I watched it get transferred to the panini press, I also decided to order the "Greens" smoothie. Because this place is both new and new to me...had to go all out. 

He may have been right. This panini is delicious. Soft bread with a little crunch and of course, those fresh ingredients. 

But while we're on the subject of fresh, I have to give it up to the MVP, the smoothie. I've craving a smoothie since my closest Jamba Juice closed. But I must tell you, this isn't a smoothie of the sugar in a cup variety. The sweetness of the apple and pineapple is mellowed out by the various veggies, spinach, celery, parsley, cucumber, with a ginger kick. I watched them make the smoothie itself and it's about as fresh as fresh can get! 

All I can say is that I'm glad I didn't bet money. Because a girl could indeed get addicted to such a place.

I got the veggie panini on multigrain bread and it was excellent!

Fresh ingredients, delicious sandwiches, and a good price for what you get! I'll definitely be going back and trying out some more paninis. Also, the smoothies looked really good!
Great spot in east lakeview. The lentil soup and meat lovers panini were both super tasty. The place also has great decor

What a pleasant surprise! Absolutely thrilled with how delicious this place turned out to be. Fantastic for a quick sandwich. I've ordered the Cuban twice in 24 hours, and it's the real deal. Additionally, the house sauce changed my life. 

Definitely would recommend this place if you're looking for inexpensive meal. The portions vs. cost are amazing.

Love this place! 
I came with a classmate and the gentleman there was so nice and welcoming! 
This is def a place I will be frequenting.
Plus my pianini was goooood! 
He took his time and suggested for us what to get since we were first timers. 
I'm officially hooked. 
Great service, clean, and good food. Come here!

In town for vacation..finished up at the zoo and found this place a short walk across the park..really great sammies, wife loved the salmon salad, kids loved the chicken noodle soup. Really friendly staff and clean store. Will definitely eat here again.

I've been here a few times now to finally be able to have a solid opinion and..... Anybody who doesn't find this place amazing is out of their mind. Every single time I come here the food and vibe is just AWESOME. You can really sense the time and thought spent on everything in the restaraunt from the food to the decor. It's nice to see an owner who truly cares about their customers happiness because unfortunately you just do not get that treatment anymore at many places. I would be back everyday if I could! You're truly missing out if you don't get your hands on one of these paninis!

This place is great. The food is fresh, the green shake is delicious. I was on my way to potbelly for a typical sandwich. Really glad I made a turn into Republic. Will now be going to this place on the reg.

I went here in the afternoon cause I had a Giftie and a sandwich sounded mighty tasty. I also like their sign. I walked in and the spot was just your basic sandwich joint with a couple tables and seats by the window. I ordered the Chicago fire on pretzel bread which is always a good choice. The workers were very chill and friendly and my food came out fast. The sandwich was pretty good - just your basic panini. I'd probably go back since I am a fan of paninis in general.
I had an outstanding Cuban on multigrain. The bread and ingredients were top notch. My son had the meat lovers on pretzel bread and loved it for the same reason. Very reasonable pricing.

I'm in Chicago for one night and two days of museums, staying up the street at the Days Inn. We wanted an inexpensive but delicious dinner and this was it. The Bacon Bacon panini was flavorful, full of turkey and bacon, with a delicious sauce. The grilled cheese was crunchy and gooey and we were offered various sauces to include. Sandwiches less than seven bucks and very tasty!

We went in the evening and were the only customers there. Had lentil soup, one veg sandwich and one meaty sandwich. The people behind the counter were very nice, courteous and made everything to our liking.

Maybe we have become so used to gargantuan sizes in the US that the perfectly adequate portions seemed less filling to me. In any case, the flavors were good. I would recommend anyone to at least try this place once.

I was skeptical of this place at first... It's a very clean and nice location, but kind of tucked away in a storefront. After tasting their sandwich, I hope they can one day find their own personal building to move into, because they deserve it. The fresh ingredients, incredibly friendly service and all around variety of the menu has made this a consistent stop. I WHOLEHEARTEDLY RECOMMEND!!!

Just had an online ordering "issue", but the guys that work here could not have been nicer about it, and getting my order ready and out the door, even though they were getting ready to close! THANK YOU!! Food is always fresh and A+, as is the service!!

As of today this place is 5 Stars on Yelp!!  Umm...How bout no.  

I've been here 3 times now and I was not overly impressed either time.  Well, definitely not impressed enough to give it 5 Stars.  Jeez.  What is wrong with you people.  
Fake reviews perhaps? 
Who knows.

I have had the Republic Reuben, Little Italy, and the Chicago Fire.  The sandwiches are long but are very thin on...everything.  Thin on meat...thin on veggies.  You will probably still be a little hungry after eating it.  But that is fine I guess.  I respect restaurants that replace quantity for quality.  But that's the problem here.  The quality of the food isn't there either.  Everything just has a plasticky, rubbery texture to it.  It just doesn't feel good to be eating at all.  I'd actually rather be eating at....here it comes....Potbelly.
Ouch.

Great panini at good prices. 
Veggie was superb. We ordered delivery- came on time and was still warm!
Better option when looking for something other than jimmy johns, Chicago bagel authority etc

Service was great! I had the el cubano, which was a decent sandwich. I felt they could have been a little bit more liberal with the pickles and mustard, as it was lacking in the vinegar flavoring. Other than that, the cold cuts, cheese, and bread were perfect. It was also a great temp!
Quality ingredients and a great menu make this place great but the staff/management is what makes this place amazing.  A great addition to the area.  Highly recommend.

Love this place! I moved into a building down the street the first weekend they were open. There are two brothers that own it and they remember me every time I come in.

Food: I've had many variations on the paninis, smoothies and the lemonade. Everything is fresh, almost as if you made it at home. 

The atmosphere is Eco-chic with a modern flare. If your looking for a sandwich place, stop in here. It's turned into my go-to place.

Friendly service, great food... What more can you ask for.

Love this place!!! The food is so good. And the Greens Smoothie -- I could have it every day. It's best to call ahead and place an order for pick- up, just because it's a little slow but ONLY because the food is literally fresh! And fresh food is always good!
Yum on the Italian Panini. Just the right size too for hungry but don't stuff me. Friendly and fast. Wish I lived here cuz I would be a regular.

I ate here tonight after a long day walking around Lincoln Park. The people working the counter were exceptionally nice. I got the 'bacon bacon' and it was quite good, except for the bread, which was little more than mediocre. My only other complaint was that a couple things were in really awkward places, for example the soda machine was on the other end from where you checked out and the lids and straws were also away from the drinks. Also, they misused an apostrophe on their napkins (see picture)
Bacon Bacon and Little Italy were amazing! *Real* pesto! Great atmosphere and helpful staff :) would definitely recommend it for tasty quick meal on the go!

A simple tasty panini shop is just what was needed in that part of the neighborhood. Very cool owner happy to strike up conversation and ask customers for opinions/suggestions. Heating up the meat prior to placing on the bread was a nice enhancement in my opinion. Clean, simple, and tasty...two thumbs up.

Bacon bacon? Yes yes. Deeeeeeeelicious. 

Delivery for two sammiches took less than 30 minutes. The Panini Republic is doin' it right.

Confession... I get the same thing every time I go here for lunch, so my review is for the veggie panini. The bread is so fresh, as are the ingredients. I love that the panini's are not greasy- no butter or oil when they toast them! Oh, and try the republic sauce if you can handle a little kick!

This place is great. They are very fast and friendly and they have great bread. They give you a side of republic sauce with your sandwich and I don't know what it is buy it rules. They also have a large selection of salads that are fresh. Go buy a hoagie and support local businesses! This place is way better than the generic sandos you can get at Jimmy Jones or subway. Better bread, cheese and veggies. Give it a whirl!
Love this place!! This is our go-to sandwich delivery.  Everything is delicious, every time.
Always fresh and delicious sandwiches. Meat lovers always hits the spot with some jalapeno chips. I'll go here over any fast food sandwich shop.

Went here for the first time the other night right before they closed. We ordered a panini and a salad. Little Italy panini with house sauce was really tasty. Salad was surprisingly fresh for that time of night. Would definitely come back. 

Service was also really nice and helpful.
Quick, healthy food. Had the farmhouse salad and it was fresh and wonderful. Will definitely go back again!

I've been here twice now and both times have been great. First, I had the Reuben on pretzel bread. It took awhile to make but it hit the spot. The second time I came here I had the veggie on multi grain and it is wonderful. Probably the best veggie sandwich I've ever had. The pesto and that garlic sauce are just delicious. Everyone who worked there was also pretty friendly. I'm definitely going back!

I just downloaded yelp to write this review. I just  walked out of this place and the man who was working tonight was SO amazing with his customer service despite being swamped with orders. I don't know how he did it with all the orders but he was so kind to all the people who walked in and was super efficient . Amazing place. The panini's are great.

It's such a crazy little place that literally is on the side of an amazing other place in the west loop of chicago. Gelato made from scratch, chocolate waffle cones and great service made my first trip to BomboBar so amazing! 

I'll definitely be back for that deluxe hot chocolate!

it is a take out place hidden at the back of Bar Siena, they are associated by the way. the bomboloni is really good, loved the one with marshmellow, the donut like thing is hot and melts the marshmellow

the hot chocolate is pretty good too, it's not overly sweet like Mindy's ( i guess mindy's uses real chocolate so it's a bit too sweet), mostly due to not having real chocolate, but just chocolate powders, but we really liked the little donut hang at the side of the cup, makes it look so tasty

This place has become one of my must haves in chicago! The smores hot chocolate is extremely unique, I have never experienced anything like this in Chicago. To be honest, the entire drink is an overdose on sweets but it's worth the calories and cures any sweet tooth!

However, I was surprised because the number one thing I would come back here for is the donuts! I had the vanilla bean donut and cookie dough donut, and they were unbelievable! The texture of the donut was smooth and creamy, and I would definitely rank this place higher than stan's donuts on the donut scale.

I really wanted to like BomboBar. Really, really, really, desperately wanted to. From the amazing Instagram photos to the cute counter and attentive service - what's not to love, right?

Well, the hot chocolate and bombolinis just weren't quite up to par. Dry and cakey donuts just aren't cutting it for me, and while they come out hot and fresh, I don't think the fillings (mixed berry and salted caramel) are anything to go our of your way for. It was messy and gooey, and there's no sink to wash your hands anyway...

The hot chocolate, in particular the s'mores hotter chocolate, was a disaster. This was partially my own fault, because I should have known that a lot of marshmallow fluff could only be excruciatingly sweet. It was overpriced, overkill, and really just not what you want when you want a hot chocolate. Does it make for a beautiful picture? Yes. Does it taste good? Not quite.

I will say, the breakfast sandwiches ($6) get the job done, but the sweets that this counter is known for? Major pass.

The last note I'll make it that because it's so close to the alley behind Bar Sienna, sitting outside often means taking in the scents of the back alley, aka the trash bins. Not much that they can do about it, but... tough.

I did my research.  I sat in 95 degrees in direct sun. It was worth it. 
Bombolino is literally the bomb. 
I WILL be back.

I finally had a chance to try out the very hyped Bombobar.  It can be easily missed if you don't know the area, but it's a small window attached to the side of Bar Siena.  There are only two communal picnic-like tables, so it can be kind of hard to get a place to sit.

My friends and I ordered a half a dozen bombolone (an Italian filled doughnut) to share.  They are cooked to order, so it takes a while for your doughnuts to be ready.  But they are definitely worth the wait because the bombolone are warm, soft and fluffy when being served.  We really enjoyed the original and the peach filled (seasonal) one, but found the other doughnuts (salted caramel, peanut butter and jelly, and Nutella cream) to be either underwhelming or a tad too sweet.  

On another visit, I gave their pistachio gelato a try.  They used crushed pistachio throughout the gelato which gave it a nice crunch and amazing flavor.  I just didn't enjoy the texture of the gelato.  It was extremely soft and almost liquified.  Nothing I would expect a gelato to be.

I wouldn't run back to Bombobar since I only liked their original and seasonal doughnuts.  Also, a huge downside is where they are located.  They are next to the alley, so you can get an overwhelming smell of garbage.  This can hugely impact a person's experience.

I was in West Loop and craving dessert after going out for dinner. I remembered BomboBar was still open so my friend and I decided to check it out. There's a cute window where you order. I ordered the Vanilla Bean Custard Bombolini. It was very filled with custard, piping hot and fresh. It was a little messy to eat with all the sugar, but definitely worth it. There are picnic tables to sit outside. Come to BomboBar for delicious donuts!

This is right around the corner from Bar Siena. It's connected but a separate place with a walk up window.

So I had been stalking this breakfast sandwich on yelp for weeks...just waiting for the right opportunity. Today was THE day. Sky was clear, stomach was empty, on my way to work, so I make my mind up and quickly hang right at Green street! Alas! A parking spot! Parking isn't all that easy or great. More of a walk-up spot, but I digress.

I hop out and I'm greeted by a very friendly guy at the counter. I order a coffee and the breakfast sandwich(9 bucks total). Coffee is pretty solid. So I wait a few minutes+ for my sandwich. It's ready. I grab and go. This is where things go left, As I'm heading down Randolph I glance over at her(my sandwich) and what the!? No eggs!!! Arrrrghhh! So I double back, highly irritated mind you. The guy apologized and starts remaking my sandwich. He gives me a free bombolini for my trouble. Great. Thanks. More calories. But I'll take it because I don't like to see food go to waste. Shoutout to the guy who warned me that the caramel inside of my bombolini was about to runneth over unto my shoes.

So sandwich is finally ready and ohhhhh yeahhhh. This feels like the proper weight and girth my sandwich should be. So I finally make it to work, 20 mins later, and I riiiiip right into it! Oh. My. Word. All my frustrations melt away because this is probably one of the best breakfast sandwiches I have ever had in my life! It's hot egg with gooey cheese, layered with bacon and a sausage pattie w/ a special sauce. All stacked between a plain bombolini( donut like bread). 

So all in all, A 5min stop turned into a 20min stop. I ate more calories than I would have liked this morning. Darn you free caramel bombolini! But then again, I'm at a place that fries dough, for breakfast...why am I interested in calories?? Anywho. Go. Eat. Enjoy. Just make sure they don't forget the egg on your sandwich!

Meh.

This review is for the dessert bombolonis. I was passing through the area on the way home and was craving something screen - I thought this was a really cute find on the side of Bar Siena and decided to treat myself to two bombos. I purchased one with vanilla bean custard and one with salted caramel.
