The texture of the donut made me not a fan of the entire experience. Perhaps this is just how the dough is supposed to taste, but it was very dry and airy (not in a good way). I like my donuts yeasty and chewy. While hot and fresh, it took me a solid 3 bites before I hit the filling of the vanilla bean custard. There wasn't a lot of it and it was quite bland. I was hoping that the salted caramel donut would be better (as it was recommended by the server at the counter) but... there was no filling?? There was a small glop of caramel on the top of the bombo and that was it.

I am a little bit confused by the super positive reviews and I apologize if this is just how bombolinos are supposed to taste. But overall, it was a pretty disappointing dessert.

This place is a hidden gem. Came with friends to try the gelato and bomboloni and both of them were so good and a decent price! For two scoops it was only $6 for two different kinds of gelato your choice! The bomboloni is so perfect, warm and just melts in your mouth. Definitely coming again and trying the hot chocolate next time!

OMG the pistachio gelato here is to die for. The smores and stracciatella gelato was pretty good too. I brought back a dozen assorted bomboloni for my coworkers and some of them raved that it was the best donuts that they've ever had. I guess that's what you get when you get donuts made fresh right in front of you. The salted caramel and PB &J bomboloni were particular favorites. 

I didn't love the cannoli here. The monkey bread could have been more delicate and not so bready for a dessert as well (yes, I know it's bread), but I'm just being picky. But you know, you can't excel at everything. The awesome gelato and bomboloni is enough of a draw for me!

Get the Salted Caramel Bomboloni! It was delicious. Warm....with the caramel oozing out the center. They have other flavors to try, but we were too hooked on this one for now. The Nutella is calling my name next time and I also want to try the gelato. I love that it's a walk up. You don't see too many walk ups in the city.

May I just say that those bombolonis will get you addicted? I thought they had a variety of doughnuts and was about the have coffee only until I decided to sample a bomboloni.

Vanilla custard. Salted caramel.

Of all the artisan doughnut shops there are in Chicago, BomboBar needs to be at the top of the list. There is no sit-down area unless you go to Bar Siena (I think that's the name of the bar/restaurant). The walk-up is still fine for getting bombolonis, gelato, and coffee, though.

Stan's Donuts was in the #1 slot. Sorry, Stan, you need to make room for BomboBar.

Tip: located just around the corner of Bar Siena even though it has the same address. I believe the two are connected on the inside. 

I went to Bombobar to try the bombolinis and got the mixed berry and chocolate fudge. I don't think they were that special and certainly not worth $3 per. When I opened my mixed berry, half the berry filling had exploded to the outside (see picture). The problem with the bombolini's is that when you eat it hot after they just deep fried it, the doughnut tastes super oily. I literally felt oil on my tongue. When you eat it cold, it's not as oily but it doesn't taste as good. I also didn't care for all the sugar on top which basically just dropped all over the place. The fillings were pretty decent though. I preferred the chocolate fudge over the mixed berry. The chocolate fudge had a light but decadent taste to it while the mixed berry, weirdly enough, somehow tasted a bit like alcohol(?) and was just a bit too sweet.  

Overall, not a place where I would go out of my way to visit but perhaps if I was in west loop, it'd be a nice small dessert after dinner.

There were four of us, we don't recommend the gelato. :( we tried caramel, cherry, pistachio and coconut ice cream and none were of our liking, they are like warm whip cream. Wished we had tried the pastries instead.

It's a really neat place to go during the summer time for we had their Italian ice treats that comes in adult size capris sun like bags. It's really cool and they have other desserts like donuts and gelato. It's a new dessert place for us and we were glad to have tried it. BomboBar was real treat to top off a really nice evening out and about the last few days of summer.

I do not like donuts. I love bomboloni. $3 each from the walk-up window. PB & J and the Mixed Berry are the best ones in my opinion, though you can't go wrong with Salted Caramel or Nutella either. You can also get coffee, breakfast sandwiches, and gelato at the window. Punch cards available for buy 10 coffee or bomboloni, get the 11th free, or drop your business card for a chance to win a box of bomboloni. Quick service and great to have a window service option for a snack in the area.

This place has a lot of potential but we didnt leave impressed.  I had the peanut butter and jelly bombolini which is essentially small donut covered in (non-powdered) sugar with a pb&j filling.  The donut and filling were good by themselves but didnt really jive together.  Aubs got a double chocolate gelato which she described as decent.

We were craving something sweet and got lucky with this find. What seems like a pop up shop, BomboBar has gelato and bombolonis. The nutella bomboloni is the bomb. The donut itself is light, airy and best of all, hot! They were very generous with the filling, so by the end I actually ended up leaving some of the filling on the side (a mix of nutella and some sort of cream). The gelato that my friends ordered were ok, nothing that stood out from other gelatos I've had. One thing that would probably make it better is if they didn't melt on the spot (it was 70 degrees out, so not hot enough to explain the melting). All in all, a pleasant dessert spot on a bustling street.

Found this place as we were stumbling out of Chicken & Farm Shop, disappointed in an over-priced, under-flavored meal.

BomboBar to the rescue! This tiny little counter, complete with heaters in the winter, served up some hot, fresh, and filled Italian donuts that were just what we needed. They have about 8-10 filler options: salted caramel, PB&J, maple, fudge, cream, etc. All were yummy.

Their gelato is also stellar. We had the caramelized coconut fudge and the coffee with chocolate crisps. Both were very, very good, but the former was probably the best gelato I've ever eaten!

We also got a malted hot chocolate, served with marshmallow fluff and a disk of chocolate floating on the top.

Everything was impressively satisfying, reasonably priced, and served quickly. Will be back, for sure!

This review is for the italian ice. Which is really not italian ice. More like a snow cone. With fake, non real fruit syrups...

My friend and I got the watermelon and the lemon "italian ice"

My lemon was super sweet, had large chunks of ice, and had absolutely no tartness at all. One normally associates tartness with lemon italian ice. This was just a sugar bomb. And it felt like they just poured in some fake lemon syrup into it.

The watermelon was even worse. It tasted fake, not like how real watermelon tastes at all. Also, after she finished her ice, her lips were stained a bright fluorescent pink...

Really not worth $5 at all. Wouldn't even pay $1 for it.

The guy manning the counter was friendly but I would stay far far away from the overpriced fake Italian Ice.

2.5/5 stars -- rounded up to 3 only because I can't give half stars.

The bombolonies are great, but I had a pretty disappointing experience.

I went on a Sunday afternoon to order a coffee and bomboloni. I ended up waiting about 15 minutes for the coffee and about 10 more minutes for the bomboloni. When I asked about the bomboloni since it didn't come out with my coffee, the lady behind the counter said that they ran out of donuts. Why would you let a customer order bombolonies if there was a shortage of donuts? Or why would you not give your customers a heads up about the wait, or even proactively let them know at some point during the 25-30-minute wait that there would be a wait? When I asked how much longer it would be, she said, "I don't know. It depends on when they get here." And then she just walked away.

Just disappointed and frustrated with the lack of communication and service.

What a cool concept! BomboBar is basically a small ordering counter attached to Bar Siena. If no one is at the counter, then you can ring a bell and someone will come to take your order. There is picnic table seating outdoors. On the menu are coffee drinks, gelato, and bombolonis. So far, I have tried a maple bomboloni, a latte, and a caramelized coconut fudge gelato. 

The bomboloni was big, oozing with maple filling, and delightfully warm. If you have a sweet tooth, you'll go nuts over it! It was almost too overwhelming for me because the sugary filling (which reminded me of frosting) was almost too plentiful. For some people, that may be a great problem to have! The sugary outside is so pleasing in texture and taste. 

The gelato was VERY good. So creamy and smooth. I would absolutely order the caramelized coconut fudge gelato in the future again. But, at the same time, I'm super eager to try out other flavors, as well. The one scoop portion is very generous and I actually shared it (and still felt like I got enough). BomboBar will be the PERFECT stop during the hot summer months. Chicago is supposed to have a very hot summer this year and this will be the perfect antidote to that!

The service here was terrible. My cousin and I came here for the first time to try their bombolini and gelato which were both okay. I would give the food 3 stars and the service 1 star hence 2 stars. 

When we walked up to the window no one welcomed us nor looked happy to see customers. I heard a girl say "you take their orders" and then when a guy came to the window he was completely monotoned and looked like we were bothering him. Very rude attitude. 

I don't think I would come back here.

Attached to Bar Sienna is a little walk-thru window.  A bit too cold out for gelato, but will def come back when it's warmer to try.  I was the only one there (mind you it's a weekday, and the rest of the donuteers are working or elsewhere).  Five minute wait tops.  I have the breakfast sandwich which is a plain bombolini (my iPhone auto correct keeps naming them bimbo bars lol).  The donut plain reminds me of a soft and pillowy fried dough (the kind from the east coast that you get at the fair).  Inside is egg, cheese, a sausage patty, thick sliced bacon, and I think maybe a spicy mayo?  It's warm, it's filling, and it hits the spot.  Next time I'll have the sweet versions and maybe add them to this review.  As I recall, it's priced right as well.  :)

Located in Bar Siena, Bombobar has a walk up window. They have benches to sit and enjoy west loop views. I got the Nutella bomboni (Italian style filled donuts) and coffee chocolate crisp ice cream in a chocolate waffle cone. The donut was so freaking delicious! Loved the ice cream too. The waffle cone was so soft. Location is perfect. You can walk there for dessert or coffee after having dinner and they are open till 11 on weeknights. I'm going to go back to try their coffee and the pb&j bomboloni!

Worth the hype. Sister and I tried half a dozen different flavors and I have to say the mixed berry one was surprisingly my favorite. Perfect jam to dough ratio and the dough was... Perfect. Really am lost for words. Plus that hot jam--UGH--not too sweet not too tart! Peanut butter and jelly was good and caramel was also good. They have ice cream too I really regret not trying it. Highly recommend Bombobar to dessert lovers.

Came across this gem while waiting for a table across the street at Little Goat. This walk-up coffee and pasty window opened in October 2015.

The bomboloni ($3 a piece) are basically stuffed sugared doughnuts.  The dough is list and rich, but does not feel deep fried. I tried the salted caramel, and it was rich and buttery. It also tasted great split among three people and after spending 4 hours shoved in the bottom of my purse. I was licking off the caramel sauce from the paper. The caramel stuffing was great- there was a lot so that it was more like eating a great dessert than a breakfast pastry.

Look forward to trying more flavors here.
The $3 maple buttercream bombolone from this window attached to Bar Siena took a while and was very forgettable.

After a platter of meat on a hot day, we happily came upon this take-away window boasting of coffee, gelato, and doughnuts. We both tried the coffee crisp gelato in a waffle cone and agreed that it was delicious. I will come back to try the doughnuts and also have more gelato for sure.

Whoa. Their breakfast sandwich. Must get it. The sausage has a great kick to it and it's the perfect greasy hangover food. Also don't pass up on their version of a paczki/stuffed donut. We had the salted caramel and the mixed berry. Both amazing. Washed it all down with an intelligentsia coffee. Downside is that this is just a little stand with no chairs or tables. More like a grab and go kind of a stand. They do have a couple heaters inside the small, closed off area to keep you warm while you wait.

Tried the bomboloni - which is an Italian doughnut with your choice of filling. 

I chose to try the mix berry filling. It was good, the filling was just very runny (just like liquified jam) and made it difficult and very messy to eat. The doughnut itself was very light and fluffy and had the perfect amount of sugar on it which is good. The 'original' bomboloni is just the doughnut without the filling which I could imagine being pretty good but not worth it since its the same price with or without the filling.

Downside is that there is no indoor seating unless Bar Sienna has tables available during the cold winter months. They had heaters beside the tables outside but they weren't turned on and the tables were kind of dirty.

I also ordered an earl grey tea and the bottom of the cup was leaking so they gave me a brand new one opposed to just a new cup. That was nice. 

Good doughnut, but not good enough for me to go back for it. If you're in the area, then sure give it a try - but it's not worth travelling to get this doughnut. There's other great doughnut shops in the city.

This place recently popped up on UberEATS so I thought I'd give it a try. I got the breakfast sandwich, maple buttercream bombolini, and smores gelato ice cream thing. 

The bombolini and gelato were amazing. Very sweet, very delicious! Make sure you have milk or coffee or something to go with it. 

The breakfast sandwich is why I'm writing this. The picture didn't look great but I wanted breakfast. This thing came hot and fresh, the bread was crisp, came with sausage, eggs, cheese, AND bacon. It melts in your mouth and leaves your soul ready for anything. 

The EATS delivery was quick too! Took about 35 minutes to order, make, and deliver to Bridgeport. So good. If you're interested in trying UberEATS, my code eats-ddjm6 should get you $20 off your first order.

I really enjoyed the salted caramel bombolini. It wasn't too sweet and had the right texture. I also got the vanilla bean which was also good and had the creme oozing out once you break it in the middle.

Adorable artisan doughnut shop in Chicago! It's a part of Bar Siena, so if you end up at the restaurant, and feel lost, do not despair - walk back out of the restaurant, look to the side street and you'll see the covered window opening for Bombobar, which allows you to order the delicious bombolonis, coffee, and gelato. Be sure to ask for their seasonal specialty (currently the red velvet, and the pistachio cream) as they are as unique as they are delicious. My personal favorites were the salted caramel and the pistachio. Great way to treat yourself before beginning the day or exploring Chicago!
So great! The ladies here were so sweet too, including someone who worked in marketing that was taking pictures. Love this little side window. Will definitely be back.

Chicago is the city of donuts, in all shapes and sizes.  It's official.

Bombobar it a delicious lil window that you can roll up to after drinking a little bit too much at one of the restaurants nearby.  Me and some friends did this fairly recently, and we ordered a half dozen bombolinos to go, with assorted fillings.  It's pretty cute--you can see the server filling the lil doughy balls while you wait.  

The donuts were totally delicious.  Warm and fluffy with delicious, creamy fillings.  Growing up, I always preferred filled donuts, and these were right up my alley.

One of our friends ordered some pistachio gelato and it was REALLY excellent too.  Probably some of the best pistachio gelato I have ever tasted.  You should definitely try that.  

We'll be back!
Amazing! Everything they offer is great! You can't go wrong here. And if your a donut fan, there is no place better!!!
The plan bomboloni is good, the maple buttercream one is decent, but the vanilla custard one makes the trip worthwhile. It's amazingly good.  The $3 price tag seems steep but the bomboloni is huge.

Holy cow this place was amazing. We happened to walk by and figured we needed to get a sweet treat. It's basically just a walk up shop attached to a restaurant but the quality of the desserts were great. Get the s'mores gelato-dark chocolate ice cream with swirls of marshmallows and graham cracker flakes. We will definitely visit again soon!

The maple waffle cone gelato wasn't good.  It tasted vaguely of maple but was salty and had something akin to bread in it. The doughnuts were soggy with grease. I'm not sure why the maple one tasted like lemon and the PB&J one was salty. All of it ended up getting chucked, I didn't even bother to try the 3rd doughnut. That was a great $18 lesson.
All around freaking amazing!!! Short rib lasagna, fireball pepperoni pizza and doughnuts all mind- blowing. Our waiter was awesome, too.
Really wish I lived closer! I love that this place is always coming up with delicious new flavors whether it be for the yummy bombolonis or tasty gelato! Very nice staff too :-)
The gelato here is to die for! Imagine if Coldstone turned gelato, that's Bombo Bar's gelato. Highly recommend the Caramelized Coconut Chip I want to say it is!
This small counter outside Bar Siena is highly overlooked. Easily the best donuts in Chicago. Try the salted caramel bombolini!! Nothing can beat a warm, fresh donut

Super friendly place! 

Johnny O the owner is always there and he makes sure you get your food fast. I work down the block and been coming here for almost six years now. 

If you want cheap fast food, come here!

I don't know how I have lived in Chicago on and off for 8 years and never heard of Johnny O's until now.  Johnny's O's 24 hour walk up window is like a miracle.  I walked up real late and got an egg sandwich with bacon.  It was beyond miraculous.   Next time I'm getting a hotdog.
HOLY COW AMAZING! Burgers are delicious and are loaded with toppings. Such a hidden gem.

Super nice guy at the counter.
Made the sandwich while I waited. 
I had to have the infamous Mother-in-Law. 
Unique sandwich that's for sure. I destroyed it!
Great fries too.
JohnnyO's has never failed our friends and I in our drunken stupor craving dogs and burgers. Greasy heaven. I also really like their pizza puffs. 100

Johnny O's...O how I love you.

Get the chicken nuggets. They're homemade and they're fucking awesome. They also have the best BBQ sauce to go with them.
Hot dogs, fries, and cheese sticks are all great as well. 
And oh yeah, you can get 20 fried shrimp with fries and a pop for about 5 bucks...yeah, they're popcorn shrimp, but delicious nonetheless. 

Their walk up window is open 24/7 and has saved me on many drunken nights. This is just a cool, old school spot that I hope never goes away. Now go give them your money!

Breaded steak sandwich. Who knows what the rest of the menu tastes like, and who cares. This is why I come here. The only other place that could ever compete was called Mama Falcos, and they disappeared. When they closed, I searched high and low for something that came close, but everything fell short. Not even Ricobenes could hit that spot. If there's such a thing as the food gods, they smiled upon me the day I found Johnny O's.

After reading all of the yelp reviews, I decided to hit this joint on the way home from Comiskey. It was cute, really, a reminiscent of the ol' lean to's of days past. The cashier lady was really nice and polite, though the cook looked at me like I slapped his Momma. Speaking of Momma's, I brought mine, since we attended the "Mother Son" Sox game. We agreed that we needed to tackle a couple of MILs, and I wanted to try their regular hot dog and fries. So!
Service was quick and polite.
The MIL was okay. I love the uniqueness of it, but my particular tamale was barely luke warm. I will give it another go sometime after I've had a few more brewskis.
The regular hot dog was disappointing. I'm a sucker for poppy seed buns and celery salt. Theirs has little circle pickle-thingies too, which kind of scared me.
Their fries were hot and fresh!
Overall, I love the ambiance of this little shack. Also, the price is right, this place is cheaaaaaaap. What a welcome relief in this day and age.

While in Chicago we wanted to try Johnny O's! We ordered an Italian beef sub with fries. This was an awesome tasting, messy, finger licking good sandwich! The owner - Johnny O himself came out to say hello and chat with us. What a friendly crew - great service!

So I just ordered here , she was soooo damn happy about her work , but then I got this .... Look at picture , I saved a few buck after the ball game to have some good food . But God I could had died. I've herd of medium rare stakes and what not but pork chops? Might as well ask for a damn raw chicken . I'm actually really upset about it it cause I love this place , I guess they though I was drunk n send me off with this bomb shell . Tsk tsk , food is my life yo

Well this place was a let down!
It has all the hallmarks of a good hot dog place, but when it comes to the product, the hot dog was just average. I asked for celery salt, and got none. There is no cucumber offered like some of my favorite places, and finally the fries were a huge miss. They were pretty much tasteless and way under-cooked. I could do a better job with frozen fries for Oreida. All in all a big disappointment..

JOHNNY O's!!!

This place rules. Truly old school Chicago fast food done right. Gotta get the chicken nuggets they have there! Real pieces of chicken homemade goodness. Me personally, i go with that, a pizza puff meal, and a lil half pint of whiskey from the liquor store. Cant go wrong!!!!
This place is ultra friendly and the food is actually prepared with care. Loved the old school atmosphere and back room area. Def. a reliable place for iconic Chicago eats.

It was just OK but I will happily give them 2 more stars than I intended based upon their phenomenal customer service.... So my husband and I stopped by one night after work and ordered a bunch of food and all of it was good, not amazing, but nonetheless it was good cheap food. We wanted to check it out because they were featured on TLC for having the best sandwich in the country, the "Mother-in-Law" So if you YouTube this segment, you will see customers telling you this sandwich causes pain.... Helllllllo heartburn. I basically chugged a gallon of milk throughout the night trying to sleep. 

Mother-in-Law is a beast of a woman and a sandwich. Not my mother-in-law though, she is amazing. (Ha ha) 

So anyway, the customer service.... this wretched beast of a woman ordered $3 worth of food and left.... She returned about 15 minutes later complaining of cold stale fries and a flavorless Sierra Mist. The guy at the counter made every effort to appease the gal and she acted like he had personally shoved her grandmother down a flight of stairs. Seriously, she was LIVID that she had surely been purposely mistreated due to her race and this guy handled it like a champ! We watched in horror as she threw her fries at his cook and demanded to know if she would eat such disgusting things. You ordered a deep fried pizza puff and french fries, made a huge scene, scared pedestrians walking by, and threatened to call the police over this injustice.... He not only refunded her money, he remade her whole order and smiled THE ENTIRE TIME!!!! 

It. Was. Golden. 

I shall return with Mylanta in tow!

They also serve breakfast!

We ordered a chili cheese dog and burger, and both were pretty darn good! The prices are very reasonable and the people were nice. The only downside is the location, which seemed like a bad neighborhood and we had to drive in circles to find parking. Great #StreetMeat though so I'm happy!

Ohhh, Johnny O's, thank you for being across the street for all my drunken and/or hungover meals. No, this is nothing fancy, but if you want a super cheap deal for pizza puffs, chili dogs, or a bacon egg & cheese, this is the place to go on 35th.  
Also, it's like a bodega.  You can get beer, liquor, and other random corner store items in a pinch.  The staff is also pretty friendly.  
Thanks for always hookin it up!

I love you Johnny O's, and for so much more than just the Mother-In-Law!  If you're from the area, I'm sure you've heard of their famous MIL sandwich featuring a tamale/chili concoction (proudly noted on their sign, "as featured on TLC!").  I highly recommend trying that before anything else here, but oh is the rest of their food good.  

Inside Johnny O's is actually a small food and liquor store where you can load up on snacks and drinks for your crazy night.  This portion of the store closes at 10 PM, but Johnny knows you'll be back at 3 in the morning to the 24-hour takeout window attached to the store!  In the back of this main area is also a very cool, retro dining room, usually showing local sports and news.  Johnny is there during the day, be sure to meet him, he is a real swell guy and a proud owner (started slingin' dogs when he was 12!).  

I can't review this place without mentioning their beef, too.  Dipped beef with hot giardiniera became one of my most eaten foods (unfortunately) after discovering this place.  Throw in a nice 40 oz. of King Cobra from inside and you, sir, have a meal.

Stopped in to the dining room this afternoon for lunch. Double cheeseburger & fries for $3.99 is hard to beat. And while it isn't exactly gourmet fare, it was right for the price.

Thumbs up to the customer service. Because it was my first time there, I had no idea where the "dining room" was or how to order. You have to give your order at the counter in the liquor store, pay, and then go around the corner and up the stairs to where the tables are. The woman at the counter was very nice and polite as she explained what I was supposed to do. And as a bonus, I met whom I assume is Johnny O himself, who was a very nice guy (and if I hadn't been in a hurry to get back to work, I woulda chatted with him some).

What can I say that hasn't already been said. Well, here, it's open 24 hours and serves some of the best dogs and pizza puffs and fries in all of Bridgeport. I walk my dog here and they love him. Their outdoor seating is a great place for a quick bite or to hang while they make your food. The staff are really cool and always remember me when I come by. I am so glad that I finally tried them!

The mother-in-law sandwich was superb as well as the breakfast combos (great portion sizes too) but what really made this place special was the owner and restaurant's namesake, Johnny O. My friends and I were in town for the Taste of Chicago and staying in the Pilsen area. While visiting the attached liquor store, another staff member mentioned that the restaurant next door was great and that the MIL had won several awards and had even been featured on TLC. He invited us back for breakfast or lunch the next day and we are all so glad that we took him up on that offer. After taking our orders, we began to converse with Johnny and learned that one of his staff members had family in the part of Kansas that we're from. He offered us complimentary fountain drinks since we ordered so much food. By the end of our dining experience we had developed such a relationship with Johnny that he gave us all menus signed with our names and a message of "good luck, good health, and safe travels back to Kansas." As a foodie and lover of hole-in-the-wall gems, this place is at the top of my list for the food and hospitality.

My experience here was not very good. We even gave it a try another time and our second experience is not good either. I will say this the best thing about Johnny o's is their zucchini chips they are excellent. 

I had chicken wings from here that were just okay and the fries that came with them were disgusting I don't know if they needed to change the oil but the oil taste was very strange. I also have a cup of soup from here that made me very sick and had me throwing up. I was sick all day long.
Great Chicago Personalities from all of the staff and Great Chicago Food. Go for the Triple Burger!
Good decently priced food. Johnny o is extremely nice and they have been rated all over! Had the Chicago dog and it was delicious!

Decided to come give them a try:

Cheese Fries - These were ok.

Fried Mushrooms - These were nice and cispy.

Mother in Law - I only had a little and thought it was ok, but not really my thing.

Chopped Steak Sandwich - I didn't have this, but I was surprised it looks like a hamburger.

Italian Beef - We got this with sweet/hot giardiniera. My cousin and BIL split this and they both thought it was pretty good.

Breaded Steak - I thought this was more tender than Rico's, but think it needed some sweet pepper or something to give it that extra kick.

Overall, everything was good and the prices are right. Glad they are open 24/7 and not too far from me.
Great for when your ending the night and need some greasy pizza puff or some good Chicago dogs or burgers. Wouldn't recommend as a day time eat though just late night food.

My colleagues and I went to Johnny O's today for the first time today, and it was awesome! I had the famous Mother In Law, he had two chili cheese dogs, and she had the chicken sandwich. Johnny was kind enough to come by and talk to us for a few too. He's a great guy and he has stories for days! You can tell he genuinely cares about his customers too. We will definitely be back in the future.
Would you like a heart attack with your sandwich? Seriously though. Idk how people eat here. The equipment is dirty. The floors are dirty. The store front reeks of cigarette smoke.

The food here is great, and Johnny is a really nice guy to talk to. The location looks sketch, but it gives you a classic, old feel when you go inside the place (there is a restaurant inside). Highly recommended for hotdogs!

What a lovely place.  I just moved in down the street and was looking for a cheap place to get some cheese fries and a dog.  I also had some homemade chicken nuggets.  These nuggets are not the kind where processed, ground up chicken is put into a meat-mold to look like a "nugget" like they do at McDonald's.  They're full chunks of chicken that are hand-breaded.  The owner, Johnny O, was in the restaurant and stopped to chat with me.  Just a genuine, awesome person...told me about the history of the neighborhood, about the process of unwittingly getting mentioned on various TV shows, etc.  Even the clerks in the convenience store portion were friendly when I got a pint of vodka to go!

This place is charming and I will definitely be a regular here.  Next time I'll have to try the infamous "mother-in-law."

Had the mother-in-law today. I learned about this while watching some "10 Ten Food" documentary on Netflix. The documentary had me thinking about the mother-in-law all week. It was pretty good, but a little overrated in my opinion. Very creative though considering I love Tamales! 

One of the owners took my sister and I in the back to chat while we waited for the food. Told use all about the history of the place and that part of Chicago. 

Items Purchased:

Mother-in-law
Cheese Sticks
Italian Beef

The go to place for drunk food in Bridgeport, it's super cheap and you get a lot for your money, Ive had the cheeseburger, hot dog, fries, chicken nuggets and the mother in law (chili on a tamale) all were great and hit the spot, always look forward to going
Jonny was in the restaurant with us and making sure we had a great experience. The mother in law was delicious.

Perfect midnight snack after a long haul flight into MDW. This iconic  piece of Chicago is now my go-to spot for a real Chicago-style hot dog. They even gave me two drinks, a can and a fountain drink! Not sure why but they said to take it. Awesome eats and awesome service.

Had a hot dog special here on Tuesday, October 21 for the princely sum of $3.81, including tax. Hot dog was good with somewhat slim trimming, but the gargantuan amount of fine fries and soft drink made up for it nicely. After walking through a store I made it up some steps behind a counter to sit inside the restaurant seeing news by Fox...It was a very special Bridgeport experience and well worth a stop at 35th and Morgan.

Johnny O's is my main place for drunk food after Maria's or Bernice's, or if I'm too lazy to go buy groceries.  As a liquor store it's pretty poor.  The booze is overpriced compared to CVS, especially if it's refrigerated (yes, they charge more for cold beer.)  But as a greasy food joint it's fantastic.  Cheeseburgers, dogs, fried shrimp, breaded steak - it's all there.  The best part is it's open 24 hours, so no matter how debaucherous your night has been, Johnny O's will be there for you.

Protip: call your order in ahead.  If you order $5 or more they give a free can of pop, $10 nets you 2 cans of pop.  I think if you call in orders over $15 they start throwing in free dogs too, but I'm not entirely sure about that because when I'm at the point that I'm ordering $15+ worth of Johnny O's, I'm definitely not going to remember that night.

Edit: They have discontinued their free pop deal.  Kind of bummed about this.  I gotta drop them down to 4 stars in the hope that they'll see this and reinstitute the policy.
Great breakfast sandwiches and OK coffee. The people are super friendly and you can order ahead to make picking up at the outdoor counter really convenient.

Saw this place on netflix, decided to try it out.  Came here with a few friends on New Year's Day and got "The Mother in Law". It was very delicious. Messy and greasy, it was exactly what I wanted. The Johnny himself was here and made us feel very welcome. Very awesome place, I would recommend!

When it comes to dives, these guys are one of my favorites, namely for the experience more than anything. The food is pretty good, but nothing out of the ordinary. They flaunt their Mother-In-Law tamale, but their real bragging right lies in their breakfast plates. Big portions of your favorite bacon, eggs, toast, etc. combo places, and they're not shy around the frier. 
What makes this place so cool though is the fact that they really do care about their customers. Every time I go in, they seem to remember me, and I always end up having long talks with the manager. He pointed us in the direction of a killer art gallery and some other pretty cool places to check out. If you really get him going he'll even hook it up with some free food every now and then.

Review for occasional late night Breaded Steak sandwich. While I've known the family since a little over knee-high I heard review on WGN late-night and have to agree about regarding Johnnie O's (go to) Breaded Steak with red sauce and like with hot giardiniera.  As a local i would like to Johnnie O's to see John and Sons (Alex and Pete) his sons (5 stars) as Alex's comedic short bits are that making stopping by for convenience(day store) and fun. Thankful to Johnnie O that there's a 24 hr place to grab hot dog special etc and early hours 7ish am til 10pm lotto tickets and conv store/beers/soda staples.  I've read and heard reviews were talking about stand not Greek Islands Drake and Palmer House food nor their prices though JO and Sons and  Crew are quality good people and would be missed by many if they weren't around.  Support local Ma and Pa businesses as it keeps community stronger and their uniqueness is something franchises lack in character.

I love this place and come her at times when I visit my brother in Bridgeport.  The mother-in-law is awesome! And many of nights I keep thinking about that Mother-in-law and want one so bad.  The hotdogs and sausages are very good and their fries are great.  And did I mention they are 24-7!?

I roller-bladed around Bridgeport today, and when we went past Johnny O's the cheap hot dogs caught my fiance's attention.  We stopped for a snack and got 2 hot dogs, 2 fries (maybe 1 set split into 2 packages?) and 2 bottles of water for just about $5.  That is a really great deal.  The hot dogs were good all beef dogs.  The fries were fresh.  All in all the food stand is a really great deal.  I think I will try to avoid this place on future trips, otherwise my fiance will want to stop again.  (And I don't really need to eat fries while I'm out getting some exercise).

Probably my favorite greasy terrible for you double cheeseburger in the city. I work a block away from it and have to restrict myself from going more than once a month as that is the path to an early death but otherwise check these guys out if you pass them by, it's a neighborhood institution.

I just had the breaded steak and I was pleasantly surprised.  I know the polish, dogs and breakfast sandwiches have always been great but I went out on a limb and I'm glad I did. Apparently Johnny O can do anything.

since I'm local and i love greasy food, i just have to try this place out! the kitchen looks really small and kind of dirty from what i see standing by the window.. they have a pretty big menu selection to order from... i have came here a total of 2 times because i was pretty disappointed the first time i came here..  1st time i came i ordered the chopped steak sandwich and it tasted like a cheap quality hamburger... 2nd time i ordered the breaded steak.. the red sauce taste weird, mozzarella didn't look or taste like anything like it , the red sauce was ok...and the meat was weird with a few pieces that i have to spit out because it was very chewy..... i had given this place a chance already and it still disappointed me... i rather drive a little farther and get me some Maxwell's or something...

JOhnny O's is great cheap food. A burger and fries for 2.87? You can't beat that. The staff is always friendly. I like to call in my order ahead of time so it's waiting for me and they throw in free food if you call it in. My advice is to order the fries well done. 

Pro's: Price, Hours
Cons: No poppyseed buns for hot dogs
Much closer to my apartment than CVS. Plus great prices and quick service.

Great place! Stopped in yesterday for the first time. Everything is super cheap! Amazing value.  They have a fairly large menu for a hot dog stand and its open 24hrs! I just moved into the neiboorhood. The employees spent ten minutes pointing out all the great local spots to check out.  I think I found my new liquor store/hot dog stand.
You have to try the house made chicken nuggets!!  Great for breakfast, too...not the nuggets, but their breakfast menu! ;)

This place cracks me up!  I had to try it because I have been told by more than one life long Bridgeport resident that Johnny O can do anything and is the neighborhood resource for all things (security systems, side walks shoveled, hot dogs, liquor, etc.).  I have purchased wine and beer from their convenience store, they have a nice selection; and I stopped by the window counter along 35th Street to order 3 hot dogs with fries for something like 5.99 - crazy cheap.

Another place I make my sister take me to whenever I visit her in Chicago. This place is definitely a great find and the greasy dive thing really works for them. They serve up the classics...chili, hot dogs, burgers, fries and steak sandwiches...they also serve tamales which it is very hard to find a tasty tamale this side of the border. And everything is DIRT CHEAP...so even if you don't like one thing its no big loss...you can go ahead and buy something else and it won't set you back too far. Located in Chicago's south side we have to travel a tiny bit to get there but it is worth EVERY mile we go. The mother in law sandwich is where it's at...and at 2 bucks and some change you just can't go wrong. I leave off the onions(I am not a fan) but the flavors with the chili and the tamale really please my taste buds. My sister got a double cheese burger and I had a bite and they are really juicy and the flavorful as well. But of course if you are going to go to Johnny O's you must get the mother in law. Other places serve it but it's not as good as Johnny O's. It's also a great local, mom and pop place so the atmosphere is friendly and cozy. I make my sister take me here the first time I arrive. Sometimes we go for two meals in a day..I can't really say I know many places I would have multiple meals daily at...Johnny O's is the exception. It's also a liquor store if you need to get your Jack Daniels or Smirnoff refill.

my man working at 3am today was the best. he was telling me about being in the vietnam war, getting ass, bench pressing 575, and some other stories. Good guy. Anyways, I just got a beef taco, not the best, but it was big as hell and cheap.
Good select of beers and awesome guys and gals behind the counter.  Breaded steak sandwich...yum! I also liked their polish.

Good food, cheap. Friendly staff. Work relatively close so I call in my orders and they have it ready within 5-10 minutes depending on how busy they get. Have a ordering window right on the street, so you can walk up and continue on your way. Convience is key when in a hurry.

24 hours, good hotdogs, good fries....depending on who's working that day. Everyone tends to be obsessed with the chicken nuggets, but I wouldn't suggest them if you're picky about your chicken textures. Pretty quick, satisfying, open a lot. Dudes are cool. Yum!

After my first trip to Johnny O's I can confidently say: 'Alex, you will be seeing a lot of us....' My son says this is the best Bridgeport burger yet, and he is already asking when we can come back to eat pancakes at the picnic tables. I am thrilled to have found a place where I can pop in for a bottle of pinot grigio, a six pack of goose island,.AND a giant pickle. Thank god for Johnny O's. I will never have to step foot in the skeezy Bridgeport CVS ever again.

Yum!! Tiny, quick, and easy! Chicago needed more delicious Creperies and this one gets the job done! Awesome location, right off DePaul's Campus. 

I purchased a groupon for 2 crepes and 2 drinks for $15 - great deal but the regular prices are definitely affordable as well!!

I normally stick to just sweet crepes, but decided to try a savory one today as well. 
My boyfriend and I split the Epic and the Nutella Banana Strawberry. 
The Epic was amazing!!! They load it up with prosciutto, tomatoes, and cheese. 
The Nutella Banana Strawberry was very good but a little too heavy for me. The piece I had was filled with lots of Nutella and Banana but not very much strawberry. My boyfriend said his piece had a lot of strawberries so maybe I just got unlucky. 

We also both ordered tea which was delicious and came in cool pitchers. 

The design inside is awesome - cool to see how it's changed from the Deli that was here before.

On a rainy cool Saturday afternoon crepes sounded perfect. We came in and it's a cute spot. Decor is almost childish.

The menu is limited - I wish they had more breakfast options or make your own, or even mini crepes for dessert.

Had tea and the ham cheese crepe - both good.

Plz do not go there ! Waiter is horrible and not welcoming although there are 0 customers there! Stay away!!!!! 

We asked questions and he gave a dirty look with very bad attitude. We ended up left without ordering anything. Will let all my friends know about this and will never go back here.

Great crepe!! It was good for lunch. Savory crepe, Eric was truly epic!

I had Epic, savory crepe. Big portion with great price! I couldn't finish it all. There were lots of prosciutto and spinach! It was great! I love it :p Coffee was ok. Cappuccino was poured not beautifully at all and lack a little bit of flavors. This isn't a speciality coffee place, so it's ok.

Service was just as ok. When I walk in, the guy was busy at cashier and didn't look at me at all (even though there was only one group on the table). I didn't know how this place works and thought pay first at cashier then have a seat. After spending few minutes standing in front of the cashier, the guy told me to sit anywhere without smile or apology. He could say when I walked in. 

The venue was clean, but I hate the decor. Paper decoration made hideous. I would say let's get rid of them immediately. Pictures of Paris on the wall was decorated straight horizontal line. I think it'll be better to placed randomly. 

Also, I didn't like the dish wares. It was plastic and I could tell the silver ware was also cheap. Sad... 

One more problem this place is the bathroom. It's located on the back corner of their kitchen. I hope they are careful about hygiene and dusts when customers walk into their kitchen. 

My favorite crepe place is still Leonidas, but I may come back to try sweet crepes.

I had this today for the first time and it was pretty good!  The staff was super friendly and accommodating.  It was a little more crepe than substance in the turkey/avocado one but overall a good addition to the LP neighborhood!

A cute, low key spot to relax and enjoy a delicious crepe. I stopped in around 10am on a Friday, received a friendly greeting and took a seat at the window. This is a perfect girly place to meet your friends or mom. 

There is a good mix of dessert and "meal" crepes that include meat and veggies. I ordered the ham, egg, and cheese and it came out within five minutes. 

The crepe was a mouthwatering blend of melty butter and cheese and just the right amount of thinly sliced ham to make it a meal while also not being too heavy. 

The restaurant played soft French music (an accordion, of course) in the background and the amazing smell of a cinnamon sugar crepe being made wafted through the air (I'm going back for that one next). 

The only thing that wasn't great was the payment process. It wasn't clear whether a check would be brought to me or if I had to pay at the counter. Not a big deal though. 

Cute place, I'd recommend to others.
Great place to meet friends plus they make outstanding crepes.My favorite one is a lemon crepe..Yuuuum

Creperie de Paris is a cute (think striped wallpaper, charming French music) little spot next to DePaul- the menu consists of savory and sweet crepes, and a pretty good selection of teas and coffees. Be prepared- the only thing on tap here is the crepe. It comes alone on a plate (no salad, no sides...) but the crepes are truly excellent.  And the waitstaff is friendly.  Extra points for allowing diners to choose their own crepe fillings - makes it easier for the picky, the allergic, and the idiosyncratic.

The Best Crepes in Chicago right now hands down! Very authentic crepes. I have had crepes all around the world, Canada, France and it's hard to find crepes that compare but these are identical brings me back and makes me feel like I'm back in France! Thank you Creperie du Paris for the great food and also memories. Will definitely be back soon!

Excellent atmosphere! Brightly colored walls with pictures of Paris and French music playing in the background. Came in with a groupon and didn't know it only applied from 9-2. The manager was accommodating and gave us the same deal in monetary value. And after I screwed up my order, he came to the table and got me a new crepe!!! Above and beyond service. Great place all around, especially for brunch or afternoon pick-me up!
The Nutella crepe is my favorite, and there's a great selection of crepes! The creperie is in a nice location, and its interior is cute. Creperie de Paris is a must visit.

Very cute, very inexpensive very good! A nice change of pace from all of the expensive American brunch places in LP. Came here on a Saturday morning and we were seated right away. I ordered a sweet crêpe and my boyfriend ordered a savory crêpe and they were both delicious! The best deal for breakfast in Lincoln Park.

*GrubHub Order* 

 The best crepes I have ever tasted. 
I've made my own crepes before and they are delicious but I get lazy sometimes to prepare the batter in general. Who needs to prepare the ingredients when you can just order from Creperie de Paris! 

My favorite items from the savory and sweet menu is the Le Club Crepe, and the Lemon Sugar Crepe. It's a must have and you shall not be disappointed; I guaranty it. 

Hopefully soon I will get to experience this crêperie's phenomenal customer service. 

-Bon weekend
I tried the savory margarita crepes while my husband had the "epic" with prosciutto. The service was friendly and our delicious crepes were served quickly. Highly recommended!

As a Francophile who LOVES Paris , I fell in love with nostalgia right as I walked in and heard the French music and smell of crepes. I will definitely be a regular . My ham n cheese crepe tasted as delicious as in Paris.

I had high hopes for this crêpe spot taking over Sal's Deli space in the DePaul area of Lincoln Park. I have dined here twice its opening a few months back, and I am saddened to say this spot does not live up to its name.
Hailing itself as a Crêperie "of Paris", I expected this spot to be authentic, classic, and credible. Instead, it is a tackily orange and hot-pink decorated space, complete with a "photo wall" of black-and-white stock images of Paris (look out for the picture on the far right of the rather plain woman leaning against a fountain, smoking a cigarette- very on brand.)
I know, certainly, that decor cannot be the only thing critiqued in this Yelp review. Unfortunately, I have only had plain food experiences at this location. As someone who has lived in France and lists authentic crêpes as one of her favorite foods, I understand that I have very high expectations for my crêpe experiences. However, both times I have ordered food at Crêperie de Paris, my crêpes took too long and were cold upon being served to me. Certainly not worth the high prices and high expectations given by the restaurant name. It was fine, but if you tout your restaurant to be "Parisian" I highly expect you to live up to your name.
The one gentleman who was working both times I dined here was nice and polite so if kind wait staff is what you're looking for, this would be good for you. But, if you're searching for a reasonable and authentic French dining experience in Lincoln Park, I suggest you look elsewhere. Floriole and La Boulangerie are two exquisite French dining spots within a few blocks of Crêperie de Paris.

From the minute we walked in here, we knew it was going to be a good experience.  The decor is charming and cozy and fun. (I want to come back on a chilly day in winter because I'm sure it will be wonderful).  We came for lunch.  I ordered the Vegetariano (tomato, mushroom, onion, avocado, and mozzarella).  It was superb.  Nice chunks of veggies, the cheese did not overpower and the crepe itself was light and fluffy.  Though not rolled up like a traditional crepe, I loved the way it was fanned out on the plate.  My friend had the chicken and pesto crepe and loved it.  He also had the sweet crepe with fruit and nutella.  LOTS of nutella, whipped cream, and fruit; so pretty he had to take a pic.  We both had mochas-tasty and love that they come in a glass mug.  The owner of the place couldn't have been nicer, coming by to check on us twice and everyone who worked there was extremely friendly.  Reading some of the less than glowing reviews on here I can only imagine that the people looking for the authentic Paris crepe have probably only ever been to Paris, Texas and the guy complaining about his Groupon sounds like a #1 Wrigleyville d-bag.  Get over yourselves people.  This place is a gem and a find!!!!
I ordered the lemon sugar crepe. It was okay, pretty much a flat pancake. I didn't taste any lemon or sugar also no topping. Maybe I'm just not familiar with the "crepe" style but I expected more.

Yum! Heard about this chic petite place through groupon and I'm thrilled by the delicious savory and sweet crepes as well as the friendly service.  Only wish they were closer to me and maybe that they used real silverware, but that's a minor complaint. everything else is wonderful!

This place is a new addition to the Lincoln park neighborhood. Best crepes I've had. I ordered 3 and couldn't stop eating them, they are that good. I got the Chicken Pesto- my favorite, than I had the Le Club, also a must. For desert I had the Dark Chocolate Raspberry, do I even need to say it- delicious!
The crepes were incredible. The Epic is worthy of its name. The staff is friendly and attentive. The ambiance is awesome. Try the lattes too!
Crepes are delicious and the staff is always great.  I  frequent this place - I am a fan of the ham, egg and cheese, the Saucisse, Epic and the Lemon crepe for dessert.

Love this place! My boyfriend and I come here almost every Sunday. The Norwegian salmon crepe is my favorite. The flavors are incredible! Everything tastes very clean and healthy. Great experience every time!

Delicious chicken crepe. I don't understand why they give you plastic silverware that looks like real silverware. That is wasteful and cheap. Just provide us with real silverware and wash it. One use plastic silverware never biodegrades. Nothing plastic does. I highly doubt in a real French crepe shop that they would give plastic silverware. I looked at it when it was presented to me and picked it up expecting it to be heavy and metal but it only looks expensive. This gave me a bad impression that this place is polluting the earth without care of the future. There is also no recycling for plastics that I see in the establishment. Very sad. Please give us real silverware. I will not return until this change is made.

The crepes here are unbelievable!!  My favorites are the Margherita and Vegetarian and my kids go nuts (pun intended) for the Nutella crepes.  Also, the tea is amazing!!  The first time I went there the owner, Savely, recommended the masala and now I'm hooked.  The staff are extremely friendly and welcoming, interior is cheery and cozy. Savely , your new restaurant is batting a thousand. We're lucky to have you in the neighborhood!!
This place was ok. The crepes are good but nothing amazing or super notable. Coffee is ok too. It has a cool theme inside but food was so so.
Had the Nutella banana crepe here with some coffee. It was delicious! Highly recommend this cute little shop on a cold chicago day :)

What a little gem!  We went with a Groupon ~ left full and happy.  The gentleman running it was fabulous, friendly and efficient.  Had the Vegetarian and the butter/sugar options.  Hot chocolate (yummy and made with real milk and choc) and many types of tea to choose from.  Will go back.  Fresh fresh ingredients and quaint atmosphere.

I went to the Creperie De Paris shortly after they opened.

I had their Epic Crepe and it was indeed very epic. Super delicious, and perfectly filling. I tried my friends Nutella Crepe and it was yummy too.

The only thing I didn't like was that the service was almost overly attentive. The man/owner checked in on us a lot, so much so that it got overwhelming and borderline annoying. HOWEVER, this might be because they were still new and wanted to get a feel for it. Who knows. 

Overall, I will definitely be back here because their food is absolutely delicious.

Endulged a couple times cause I manage the great clips a door or two down. Nutella and anything is amazing.
Passed by today, starving, and saw "ham egg and cheese" ..sold.

Now this crepe contained one slice of ham, one egg, a finger pinch of mozzarella, salt, and pepper. It was eerily the greatest thing ever, as simple as it was.

The ONLY reason I give four stars... my ham egg and cheese crepe was a solid 11.00$ after tax. 

....okay come on now. A POUND of reasonable deli ham can be bought for 3 to 4 bucks. A carton of eggs is like 4 and a bag of cheeese is about 3. Sor for around 12 bucks I could have had two weeks of the same crepe....

Still a fan. But I dont think it'll be a very often treat. I work at that particular location, of two, 3 days a week. That would be 33 dollars in a week if I chose breakfast there all three mornings, not including something to drink.

I will reiterate that it was, though, the high point of my day and it was freakin delicious. No complaints other than it seems to be out of my wallets league.
Crepe was okay, they should serve whip cream with sweet crepes.  Or at least have option to do so.

Had the southern crepe and Chocolate fruit Crepe. All were personally made by the owner which is unlike many establishments and was a good touch of service. As far as taste the flavor were on point and fresh, this a hidden gem try it out if you stumble upon this place.

Came in here on a rainy day and was created right away with friendly servers and a cozy atmosphere. I made my own crepe with chicken, avocado, tomatoes, union, and mozzarella cheese. It was brought out to me in less than 2 minutes and was absolutely delicious. Not only was the crêpe one of the best crêpe I've ever tasted, but the presentation was beautiful. 100% would recommend this place and another benefit is that they have great hours! New favorite place.

Very cute cozy place! The food was wonderful. I had the Epic crepe, with egg, prosciutto, mozzarella, basil, spinach. It was delicious and filling. Also had Nutella banana strawberry crepe which was very yummy. The crepe was particularly well made, soft but crisp on the outside. Coffee was very good. The only reason I'm giving 4 stars rather than 5 is because the disposable utensils and plates were a bit difficult to use to cut into the delicious crepes!

Very cute and very friendly. I had the raspberry and dark chocolate crepe which was amazing. My boyfriend had the ham egg and cheese crepe which definitely left something to be desired. It was very basic. We were hoping for some more savory breakfast options. Overall, it was good and we will be returning to try some of their other crepe options.

This is a fantastic addition to the DePaul neighborhood!  The shop is adorable, and the service is excellent.  Most importantly, the crepes are delicious!  I had the Epic, which I would highly recommend.  It was the perfect combination of savory prosciutto and cheese with a tiny bit of sweetness from the crepe and the tomatoes.  As a nutella addict, I couldn't pass up the raspberry nutella crepe for dessert, and it was equally amazing.  Even the presentation here is great.  My only complaint is that I'm 95% sure they gave me regular coffee instead of decaf, since I never have caffeine and have felt jittery ever since lunch; if that was in fact decaf, it's the most caffeinated decaf I've ever had!  (Yes, I know that even decaf has caffeine, but this was way beyond what's normally in even decaf espresso.)

I really hope this lovely little cafe does well, so please check it out!  There's currently a great groupon deal if you need extra incentive!

We were excited to go to our new neighborhood creperie and see what they were about. The minute you walk in you are transported to a little Parisian cafe. The decor was  adorable and the staff were super friendly. We sat at a cute little table and enjoyed the music while deciding what to order. When the crepes arrived, we were very pleased. One bite of dark chocolate strawberry crepes and we knew we made a great choice. The savory options were fantastic too! My husband had the epic and he confirmed that it lived up to its name! I really enjoyed the Saucise (that isn't how it's spelled, but it's #6 on the menu)!  The coffee was fantastic too! Go check it out, you will be happy you did!

I'll keep this short and sweet. Irvin is a phenomenal cook! Crepes are delicious, you can create your own; which is an amazing option because where else can you design your own crepe!!!!! The Epic Crepe is.... well.... EPIC! this is a nice little Gem by Depaul's campus that is a must visit!!

OMG, do I love cheese! I haven't had a bad meal at Cheesie's, and that includes their food truck down in the Loop. Hooray!!

My favorite? The Popper - cheddar, cream cheese, jalapenos, and bacon. Oh my, I'm hungry now. Fries are good. Beer/liquor selection is a little limited.

If you find a place at the bar, they'll take your food order, otherwise you have to stand in line to order and wait for them to bring it to your table. Not a big deal except it gets really crowded on weekends and difficult to move around.

It's a young crowd and LGBT-friendly, and they play fun music too.

3.5. Came on a friend's suggestion and also seeing the line for Halloween! The menu is easy to read and everything sounded amazing! I ordered The Frenchie, which was American, mozzarella, cheddar cheese sauce, thick cut fries, bacon, and chives on sourdough with sour cream dip. I didn't taste a whole bung of bacon in it, but the fries were amazing. The sandwich totaled out to be a little over 8 dollars. While the food was delicious, I don't think it was worth 8 buck. I'd say it was worth closer to 5-6 dollars. 

There are many tv's there, so its a great place to watch games! I would want to go back to try  another sandwich when I'm feeling like wanting a pricey sandwich!

Definitely dig this location a little better than the Wicker Park spot. 

Cheese, 

Cheese, 

Cheese, 

...and more cheese. 

And booze, you can't forget booze. 

I don't think I'm missing anything else here, so pretty much to sum it up, super cheesy deliciousness and booze, need I say anything else? 

Get it, get it!

Cheesie's dressed up as Bob's Burgers for Halloween!!!  I have been to Cheesie's a number of times but last night was the most memorable. The line was out the door all the way to Wilton Avenue. 

My friends and I waited 2 hours, but I gotta say, once we walked in through the door, the staff was incredibly welcoming, energetic and enthusiastic.  I know they had one of the roughest shifts they've ever had last night especially while serving hundreds and hundreds of customers, and their food quality was great, and their service was fast, we made sure to leave a good tip, they did not disappoint.  I got the "Baby You Can Chive My Car" burger, and it was a damn good burger. It was an amazing experience, you don't get to eat from a fictional menu everyday!

You had me at cheese....  Great place located right near the Belmont El Station.  If you are a fan of grilled cheese sandwiches, this is the place for you.  It's definitely a sports bar place, tvs, large central bar, high-top tables and stools.

Order your sandwich and sides at the counter and they'll give you a number to bring it out to you.  No table service here, but the bar is steps away from all the tables to get your refreshments.

I ended up going with the "tenderizer" that had chicken tenders within the grilled cheese and came with ranch on the side for dipping.  That, combined with tots and beer, I was in a food comma for the next couple hours.

The staff was super nice and the inside of the place is this bright orange color (almost like you were inside a huge hunk of cheese).  The walls are adorned with pretty playful murals and paintings.  I like how they recreated some art masterpieces but threw in some grilled cheeses - For example... dogs playing poker turned into dogs eating grilled cheese sandwiches.

This place had a lot of San Francisco sports penants and banners up, so it seems like this would be the place to go if you were a Giants fan or a 49ers fan.

Fried Mac and Cheese Balls Ooze in your mouth!
Holy cow this place is really good. Think of like a Tom and Chee but a lot better.
They have Mac and cheese sandwiches too, which are really good!
We went late in the night and this place has a full bar... I really didn't know the price of the drinks as I had a few too many to not even look at the bill. The important thing to gain from my experience is tequila and Mac and cheese is a great combo!

This place is a fun concept that you'll want once in a blue moon. Or when you're struggling to find a place that is open late at night. 

Tons of grilled cheese options. And a few sides and alcohol. The bread is too thick in my opinion but it tastes good. 

Definitely check this place out if you've never been.

That's all I have to say about that.
Jackée

I've been to Cheesie's a few times in the past and have enjoyed the food, ambience, and prices. However I feel obligated to leave a review of my most recent experience, which was not so good.

I frequented the Cheesie's stand at Lollapalooza, granted it was certainly crowded and the staff was no doubt overwhelmed. I ordered two tenderizers- which I have had several times in the past and enjoyed. However there was not more than two actual bites of chicken per sandwich, instead I was eating barbecue sauce and cheese. I found this to be pretty disappointing as this is not the Cheesie's experience I have grown to expect. Additionally the wait staff was a bit rude and not at all receptive to me when I pointed out the incredible lack of chicken. Must say I understand this was a high trafficked booth at at a music festival, but I think my days of stopping by Cheesie's have come to an end.
Best grilled cheese sandwiches ever. My favorite is the popper but I've tried 3 or 4 different kinds and they were all real good. Definitely recommend this place to anyone.

Definitely not a light meal you order, but if you want something fast, greasy and delicious then this is the place for you. 

I ordered the Tenderizer which was super good but could have used more chicken, my friend ordered The Melt which I actually likes better than my sandwich. The cheese was delicious on both sandwiches. We also got the loaded tots. Tots could have been crispier but the chili they were under was pretty good. 

The servers were super nice, especially the greeter at the door. The other staff was really nice and courteous as well.
 
The place is pretty small, there's a bar area and then some tables. We found seats though. We came on a Friday evening. It's pretty loud, but we expected it. Looks like they have cool drink specials too. Overall will definitely be coming back here to try the other sandwiches!

Ultimate comfort food! My friend from out of town heard about the grilled cheese at Cheesie's and wanted to check it out before leaving. We shared 1 sandwich and tater tots.  We decided to order the sandwich of the month. In between the bread was flank steak, mushrooms, onions, cheese (of course) and chipotle aioli for dipping. It kind of reminded me of a Philly cheesteak. Even though I only ate half the sandwich, I was very full. It was so delicious and satisfying. The cheese was gooey and the proportion of bread to filling was perfect. There is a location closer to me in Evanston so I will definitely have to go there and try more sandwiches!

It breaks my heart to take away a star, because Cheesie's is one of the world's most beautiful restaurants in the world. The amount of hilarious interactions I've had here after 2 AM while extremely drunk is... actually very unhealthy. 

You never plan to go to Cheesie's, you just end up there. And when you end up there, the prospect of a grilled cheese is so beautiful, that when you get that sandwich (after what is, in reality, like 35 minutes on busy weekend nights), it is better than Alinea.

It is 4 stars because I once went there sober, which was a large mistake. Not because the food is bad, it's still a decent grilled cheese, with very fun and delicious assortments of toppings, but that's what it is -- it's decent. Not great. 

That being said, anyone who feels fun sometimes in their heart and considers themselves a drunk food connoisseur should definitely drop by.
The tenderizer has tendered my hardened soul. Thank you.

This is an update on the review that I left on 1/29/16. 

FIrst and foremost let me preface this updated review and say that I still think this makes great drunk food. And by that I mean, because the nature of this food is very heavy on cheese, bread, grease, and calories, one very drunk person would not care too much of the pound you gain from the meals consumed here.

The UPDATE however has everything to do with service. After I left my review, I was sought out via Yelp from the General Manager of Cheesies : Sarah Jean AKA Momma Cheesie. She comped a meal for me. And even had them deliver it to my apartment. Gratis. That spoke VOLUMES to me. That the leadership of the Cheesies franchise is so personable and down to earth...its no wonder that their success has thrived. 

I made sure to try different items from the menu. I skipped the soup and opted for sweet potato fries. They were delicious when eaten with hot sauce! I ordered the Melt and also The Gladys. THE GLADYS IS AMAZING!! Its a chicken and waffles sandwich and unfortunately only offered in February. I think this is a huge mistake. I really think that they need to add this to their regular menu. I would probably eat here weekly if that were the case. 

Surprisingly this meal traveled well with delivery. Probably due to the awkward non-rush hour delivery time I ordered it, but it got here promptly and was still warm when I received the bag. 

THANK YOU SARAH JEAN!

What a fucking joke. Came in tonight and to a basically empty restaurant and grabbed a table. No one bothered to acknowledge us for a good five minutes even though there were four people standing around joking talking eating and ignoring everyone who was there. Eventually the guy who I think was the supervisor came over to ask if we'd been here because we were looking for a server or menu or anything.  We told him we were trying to see the menu across the restaurant.  And he said here you go order at the bar. So we figured out what we wanted at the bar while waiting on another table to get their order in. Meanwhile 4 people are standing around joking and laughing ignoring customers.  Someone came in to start their shift hollering and cursing. The manager just said well bartenders are crazy... So the guy came to take our order and acted like we were a bother to him. 

The food was the only reason for the extra star. When it comes to grilled cheese they make them quick and really good.

While eating though I was watching and saw the bartender sit down crack a beer and check his phone while before heading out. Everyone was eating behind the line and than going to take orders. Cursing galore from the bartender. And then I noticed the register on the other side and that a line was forming. No one behind the bar, no one at the register I look out the window and see the girl who was supposed to be at the register standing outside smoking looking in the window and watching the line build up. 

It felt like the bar was there to serve as a place for the bartenders to go to have fun rather than helping the customers enjoy their time. I would like to come back because I like the food for a quick easy bite to eat but they need to figure out what customer service is and figure out operations.  Felt like the basement of a frat house but even at a frat the people serving drinks are trying to get drinks to you as fast as possible.

No carbs, no problem. They have 4 salad options based off of 4 sandwiches. I went with The Classic which had lettuce, tomatoes, cheese, ham, bacon bits and dressing (ranch or balsamic). Pretty good. About $9.

Seating is tight. Tables have chalk boards, woo yeah creative minds come to life!

Went around 2am on a Saturday and it took about 7 minutes to get through the line. Bar was open until 3am, I believe.

COST:
$8.49 (The Classic)

Coming from Los Angeles aka the land of The Grilled Cheese Truck, I came in with high expectations even though I was probably more inebriated than I could lawfully judge the place, LOL!

After a night of clubbing, we walk into this place and my gosh, it's like we walked in to another bar! It was fantastic! They were playing some late 90s, early 2000s pop music and it was awesome.

The food was great and any entree order comes with regular tots. I will definitely be back for more!

Oh my cheesie gooey goodness! If you ever have a reason to be near the Belmont el stop,  you MUST try Cheesie's. I have visited this location and bought from their food truck,  both equal quality.  As if grilled cheese isn't enough to put you in a happy place,  they add gluttonous extras like fries sour cream and bacon (The Frenchie) ,  or macaroni and cheese (The Mac).  The logical part of your brain will object but the comfort food seeking part of your brain will be in heaven, wrapped in a big warm cheesy hug. The space itself is eclectic and loud.   Seating is limited, but the bar is spacious. Yes a bar, this my friends is the secret to adulthood: grilled cheese and a beer to help forget the day you've had. This IS your happy place 

*side note - The ordering process is kind of odd.  There's a counter to the left of everything to place your order then they bring it out to you.  It is not hidden or anything but as a newcomer it takes a minute to figure out the process.

*Tenderizer-- get it. 
*Mac and cheese grilled sammy-- oh hell yes, get that too. (Don't skip on that tomato soup dip)
*Chicken tenders-- aw man, you better throw those in too. Better than fast food chicken and most restaurants. 
*Sweet potato fries-- oh yessss, if you're looking for that softer, "healthier" potatoy goodness, better throw those in the bag. 

Now find a safe, comfortable spot to slip into your food coma. You may need to loosen up your belt, or better yet, just take off dem pants. 

P.S. If you're coming here a weekend after bar close, expect a long line full of clumsy drunks who like to sing TSwift. Worth it.

P.S.S. Better turn around and run if you're trying to eat healthy.

A restaurant that does not rip you off and specializes in grilled cheese sandwiches? I'm so in. 
Cheesie's has other offerings, like soups and sides. I had a chicken tender grilled cheese and we shared tots, which were so good.

Ordered at the counter and they brought us the food rather qucikly, despite the crowd.

This place is fun if you're not sober. Interesting greasy food options to add to your night of bad decisions. 

Don't get the sweet potato fries though. That's just a disappointment even not sober. I made that mistake. The Caprese sandwich was good though. 

This place is loud, messy, and busy but somehow the line and food is consistent. It's good for what it is.

This place has thee best grilled mac and cheese sandwich! The crazy thing is it didn't seem too greasy at all. Also their fries are the best in town! I would definitely recommend coming in here and sharing a meal with your friend or having your own meal, although the portions are pretty big! Being from California and a Niners fan, I love the fact that they have niners stuff all of their walls!

I have been wanting to go to this place for so long because the concept seemed like nothing but a true winner!

I was underwhelmed by this place and the food!  You would think with everything that was on my sandwich especially the gooey cheese that my tastebuds would have been popping but that was not the case.

My chili was bland and the only way I was able to eat it was to go home and fix it up myself.

I also bought a side order of fries and I couldn't even eat them they were so cold and hard.

I should have complained about them while I was there but I was so over my food experience.

I know I was surprised when I came in it looked like someone had left their entire picked over meal on the table and they were not the only ones on the day that we went...But I didn't think much of it until I got my meal!

The only reason I gave this place 3 stars is because the guy behind the counter was so cool and made the more than dismal experience a little better!

I wouldn't go back even if I had a Groupon again for the food.

The people the atmosphere for a game and a couple of drinks for sure but definitely not the food!

Enjoy!

I flew in to Chicago with my son and brother-in-law to go to the ND game on 10/29, my oldest who lives in Chicago picked us up and took us here, said it was great. He wasn't kidding, I never heard of a place that specialized in grilled cheeses. I opted for the basic on Texas toast, I never heard of dipping it in Tomato soup but I'm game to try anything once as I've had tomato soup and grilled cheese for lunch but never dipped it. I also had the side of Chili, that was real good and had a nice kick to it. My son said its a hot spot after going out at night, I can believe it. As basic as this meal was it was excellent, choice of beers was really good also. I did tell the bartender to try a grilled cheese with grape jelly on it, I said don't knock it til you try it, what have you got to lose. I grew up doing this in my family and have my kids hooked on it.

I absolutely love Cheesie's. In fact, I'm a V.I.Cheesie. However, today my boyfriend and I went to this Cheesie's location and had the worst experience yet. We were third in line when we walked in, and the cashier (Amber), took about 20 minutes to clean up a bunch of tables, and tend to the line with three whole people. The person at the beginning of the line was asking Amber about certain sandwiches and then Amber kept saying "I don't know," and upon the customer's last question, Amber stated "it's only my second day here, okay?" in the worst customer-service type of way possible. The same customer asked if Amber got training, and Amber said "yeah," and the customer asked "did you learn anything?" and Amber said "I only know what they told me." Well, in my opinion, I think asking questions for customers is a great way to learn, and show that you're at least pretending to care. Maybe that's just me. 
When it was finally out turn to order, the cashier walked away for several more minutes to clean more stuff, and by the time we ordered, there was a line nearly out the door. The cashier couldn't hear anything I was saying and kept yelling "HUH?" at me.
The food is generally good here, so I have to give it more than one star. But this experience was truly disappointing. Would recommend going to a different location until Amber learns respectful customer service techniques.

The food is great - just what the doctor ordered when it comes to grilled cheese.
The service is even better.  The counter guy is friendly and helpful, and the last time I went, on two occasions an employee came up and asked how we were doing.  Friendly place!

Been here a couple of times.  At night time for the most part people are super obnoxious and the employees ans management does not know what to do or how to run their business.
