It should not take 30 mins to cook a grilled cheese sandwich. Let alone, for whomever, maybe the supervisor in this case to pull the cashier from taking orders because they're so backed up.  

Nope.  I'm not really sure how this place stays in business.

From previous times the food is not that great.  It takes some effort to mess up a grilled cheese sandwich.

This last time, literally just walked out. 

Yeah... Probably not coming back here. Ever. Again.

Oh Cheesies, what do I say about you? There are so many things to say and feel about Cheesies.  But honestly, there is really only one thing I don't like and that is the atmosphere.  In truth, only part of the atmosphere.  And that's really just because I'm getting older.  That thing is that this place feels like a relative low-quality college bar.  Not that that is bad, but it's not ideal for me.  Maybe a college sports bar where the clientele are broke kids is a better description of the vibe.  Thats fine, until you realize that this is nowhere near a university.  Okay, whatever, let's get to the good stuff.

And there is a lot to like here.  First and foremost is the food.  DO NOT come here if you are: 1) lactose intolerant, 2) on a low-fat diet, 3) fighting high cholesterol, or 4) on a diet.  What I mean is that this is serious comfort food.  Cheesy comfort food.  Yes, good comfort food.  I love cheese.  If you read my reviews, you know that.  You know it's one of my kryptonites (I won't tell you the others - you have to figure it out).  The frilled cheese here is good, and they have a ton of options.  Don't want one of their standards?  Customize it!  Awesome.  Add to that tatter tots and awesome dipping sauces, and you are a winner!

Almost as good, is the beer selection.  I came here once when Cheesies was having a Stone tap takeover.  What?  Yeah.  Awesome.  You can almost definitely find something you like here.  Yes, even my wife and I got good stuff, and our beer tastes couldn't be a lot more different.

The staff?  Well, they are generally good.  Some better than others.  Some will make sure you have fun and get what you want.  Others, well, they seem to think they work in that low-end college bar.  Nothing terrible for them, but definitely nothing great.

When my doctor will let me, and when I have enough cholesterol meds to let me take an extra pill, you'll find me at Cheesies.

Smooth (ft. Rob Thomas)

Man, it's a hot one
Like seven inches from the midday sun
Well, I hear you whisper and the words melt everyone

My muñequita,

Let's don't forget about it (hey hey hey)

Get the Tenderizer.

I love this place. Great grilled cheese, cheap drinks, and friendly service. 

I've gotta try the eating challenge which is 4 pounds of grilled cheese 1pound of fries in 45 minutes. Sounds pretty tough but it will be worth that $35 gift card!

Being one of the few Asians out there that isn't lactose intolerant, I feel the need to take it upon myself to enjoy as much cheese in my life as I can.

Best be known that this is one of the best grilled cheeses I've ever had! I know that it's a simple enough idea slapping cheese between two slices of bread and pressing 'em together, but man, something bout the ones here make me go cahhrazyyyyy.

You order at the cashier and get a number placard as you wait for your sandwich. On a Sunday evening, we waited about 15 minutes for our food to come out. The vibe inside is a bit divey yet modern, with plenty of booze a flowin. We were carded on the way in, so I'm not sure if that's only a night thing or not?

Anyway, I ordered the Melt ($8.99) and a side of tots. With a solid blend of American cheese, chicken, bacon, tomatoes, and 1000 island dressing, one bite into this heavenly sandwich will send you off! My stomach is growling just thinking about how good this really is!

Trust me- you can't go wrong with any of the sandwiches here. Next time I'm up here in Belmont, I am definitely stopping by for another round!

Don't forget to check in on Yelp to get 10% off your sandwich!

Cool concept here. Cool place. Got the caprese and the tomato soup combo for like $8. Good price. However I agree with the other yelpers and have to say the tomato soup was not good. Tasted watered down and kinda flavorless. Ordered here basically just to use the bathroom since there was nowhere to go and we were waiting on a concert across the street all day. I was immediately informed the restrooms are trans friendly. Very nice I like that. Basically just two private toilets but anybody can use whichever one and they have both urinals and toilets. No big deal at all.

Being married to someone who likes to arrive hours (yes, plural) early for concerts, I have learned to expect several pre-concert stops in the near vicinity of the venue. We were seeing Colin Hay live at the Vic Theater, so as soon as we got off the train I started looking for a place to chill until the doors opened. Cheese is one of our favorite foods (with or without other foods -- it's basically awesome no matter what) and the place looked fun from the outside.

It was definitely fun on the inside, too, but so much fun that it was a very bad place to chill. In fact, we could barely hear each other over the music, which was at a dull roar when we entered and got louder every time a moody ballad came on (roughly every other song) as patrons rushed to the sound system to turn it up, and just about everyone in the bar belted along with Adele or Imagine Dragons or whomever else could not EVEN at that moment. 

At one point my husband turned to me and said, "I think we're the oldest people here." Yes, at mid-thirties we had a good decade on just about everyone else. We finished our beers and went in search of food and drink somewhere we didn't feel quite as conspicuous due to our age and demeanor. I'm sure those kids had a great night, and I wish them well, but it was just not our scene!

So one stop that one of our group members wanted to try out was this place. Cheesie's. We came here one night as a part of our travels in Chicago, and what did I think? Pretty awesome. You think that grilled cheese is you know, some processed cheese on a hot pan and then served on some sandwich bread, nothing special right? Wrong. 

Walking in, it's well... a pub. Bar in the middle, with seats on the sides along with tables on elevated picnic seating style of arrangement. You probably won't see this place not busy on any day of the night, at least that's the vibe that I got when I came in here. It was packed. We had to basically claim a spot real quick that we shared with one of the bouncers who was eating before someone else took it. 

What did I order? 
The Tenderizer. Thoughts? Amazing. Should you get it? That depends on if you like spicy food. I mean, the spiciness wasn't quite overpowering, but it still had a kick. From what I remember it tasted on the edge of sort of a buffalo style of spiciness. Now, some of the other sandwiches I wanted to try as well, but after this one grilled cheese I was full. 

Final thoughts?
If you just think grilled cheese is just a boring easy to do yourself correctly, then hey I'm not going to argue with you. However, if you're looking for a new type of grilled cheeses and a new twist, I think this place is definitely a place to try out. I think it would be a great place after a night of drinking as I would have came here if that happened. If you just moved to Chicago, try this place out because me visiting here just makes me think that if I did move to Chicago, this would definitely be on my spot as a default grub spot.

Not the most impressive. But for those living on a budget, it could do. Texas toast buttered to fuck with cheese and some tomato basil dip the size of bird crap, except a lot more watery.  
In my early 20's I would have dug a place like this and may have stopped in for eats and drinks.  However, in my 30s, I'm not as impressed.  
The space can get lively at night and I have to wonder why this neighborhood? I figure a place like this would be better suited for the Rush & Division area. They'd probably do lots in business over there since its a bar and sandwich shop.

The lively colors of the interior, booze on display and fresh smell of urinal cakes reminds me of Nola bars for some odd reason. Odd because, Bourbon street never smelled as nice.

Enjoying our date night out with some big CHEESIE grill sandwiches, thanks Gary for suggesting a wine with our sandwiches, deni and I enjoyed every bite!! Kool atmosphere!! Loved the sweet potatoe fries, deni ate the last

The perfect place to satisfy your grilled cheese craving. I love how they have so many different kinds of grilled cheese, the caprese one with mozzarella and tomatoes is particularly good. Its a great place to go right off of the red line.

The classic and Edgar da best!!!!!!


Well actually the friendly staff da best.....Great cheese sand

Came here late night after the bar a few months ago. Got the tenderizer with chicken fingers bacon, bbq, and ranch. Sandwich was under-cheesed, a few dried out pieces of chicken were thrown in the middle of the sandwich, and cheese wasn't melted all the way. (See first picture.) Was offered a free sandwich next time I came. 

Took them up on the offer today. The manager we met today was extremely awesome and took care of us very well. Customer service here = 5 stars. The sandwiches we got (ordered the same ones as last time) were absolutely filled with toppings and we actually got lots of cheese (see pictures 2 and 3). 

Taking off one star for our bad experience the first time. 

Taking off another star because the bread here isn't really buttered and it's not toasty. I don't know, to me, a grilled cheese sandwich is supposed to toasty and melty and cheesy. That's the only criteria for a grilled cheese, and it's whole the point "grilled" cheese. If you're offering extra toppings on it, that's cool, just don't skimp. And the sandwiches here aren't toasty or very melty, but the toppings are there, so that's good.

Thank you cheesie's for making it up to us!!!! 
Might come back.

I LOVE Cheesie's! If you're looking for a fantastic cheat meal for your 2016 resolution, look no further than "The Mac." It's a grilled cheese stuffed with mac 'n cheese...need I say more? Top that off with their tomato dipping sauce and seasoned fries, and you have the most perfectly delicious diet-killer you could ask for!  

If mac 'n cheese grilled cheeses don't trip your trigger, my fiance loves "The Tradicion," which is a grilled cheese with chihuahua cheese, chorizo and jalapenos. 

It can get a little busy, but dining in is enjoyable, as they have tvs and chalk for doodling on the tables. The kid in you will love it here!

You all, I was pleasantly surprised when my mama and I meandered our way into Cheesie's on New Years day.

It was one of a few places open on 1/1, so we decided to stroll in. My mom had the Frenchie sandwich (currently #4 on the menu) and loved it. I had seasoned fries with red wine because it's my religion. 

The staff was so wonderful and attentive. The fries were fantastic and the ambience was really cozy. They even have really cool cheese-inspired images of classic movies on the wall. I'm glad they opened up and I look forward to them becoming a regular haunt of mine every time I visit home. 

I've become quite the bar aficionado since moving to Boston...but Cheesie's reminds me that there's no place like home.

This place is my new favorite restaurant. 

I moved to Chicago on a Monday, and found that this restaurant was right next to the L stop near my house. I went, tired and starving after a day full of moving, driving a 16 ft uhaul through the tiny city streets, and dealing with the city clerks office. I ordered the sandwich of the month, buffalo chicken (which, coincidentally happens to be my favorite flavor of any food, ever), and it came with a side of ranch. 

Let me tell you. If I had a penis, I would put it in this sandwich. It was so good. The bread was perfectly toasted. My only complaint is that I needed more ranch but I was so busy devouring this practically-Jesus sandwich that I couldn't get up. 

I can't wait to go back.

In short: this is my new favorite restaurant and I wish I could live here.

My sister and I were first introduced to Cheesie's last year at Riot Fest, since they had the food truck there for the concert. I got a grilled cheese from there and it was amazing, and my sister was bitter that she hadn't chosen the same food truck. And then she got a Groupon for the brick and mortar store, so we stopped by one day before THIS year's Riot Fest. It's SO GOOD. 

Our Groupon was $20 for two sandwiches, two beers, and two soups. We both opted for pops instead of beers. There's a note here- get ice. The pop is DIY fountain, and the pop comes out warm. I learned this the hard way. 

My sister ordered the Frenchie, which is American cheese, Mozzarella cheese, cheddar cheese sauce, French fries, bacon, and chives served on sour dough bread ($7.49). It also comes with a dipping cup of sour cream. She absolutely loved it. She also got the French Onion soup, and recommends dipping the Frenchie in it for maximum awesomeness. I ordered the Tenderizer, which is cheddar cheese, mozzarella cheese, hot sauce, bacon, chicken tenders, and BBQ sauce served on Texas Toast ($8.99). This comes with a dipping cup of ranch. Good lord, y'all. This sandwich is amazing. It sounds like it's too much, but it's not. It's perfect sandwich size, and the flavors work together great. The cheese was all browned and coated the outside crust of the sandwich, and you got a little bit of everything in every bite, which I think is like the main goal of a sandwich. I also had ordered tomato soup, which wasn't anything special. It got eclipsed by such an amazing sandwich that it became rather souperfluous. *ba dum tsss* 

There's a bar and tvs. We were here for part of a football game and we loved that they turned the music on during commercials then quickly turned it off when the game came back on. I also love the cheesy orange paint job on the walls, and the proud display of a rainbow flag. Rock on, Cheesie's. This place is literally RIGHT across from the L stop at Belmont, so I will definitely be making quick stops here in the future. Plus, I think this place is open until like 5am, which is awesome. I will definitely be back.

We really enjoyed the food here and the customer service was friendly. The Tenderizer really stood out on the menu so that's what I tried. It didn't disappoint with size or the taste. I would definitely get it again. The fries were good and they do a great job with matching up the sauces they give you with the sandwich you order! Best thing is there is a  Groupon for two sandwiches for $11

So like most people, my friend and I stumbled in after a long night out about 4am. There was a pretty decent line of people but the food comes out quick. This is 100% your guilty pleasure drunk food, and if you have any concern for your health you're probably kicking yourself for getting Cheesie's the next morning. My friend and I split a caprisi and the Mac. They came out super quick and steaming hot. The Mac was loaded with cheese and I think I liked it better although I literally shoved the thing down my throat in a few bites. The sandwiches are really big and filling, so one is enough. They made an extra ham and bacon sandwich on accident so we got that for free but I wasn't a fan of that one, too much meat for my taste. I would definitely have Cheesie's again but definitely not make it a regular thing or else I would die of diabetes or heart attack.

I've tired to come here multiple times and today was the first time that I was able to actually get a seat! 

My friend and I were able to order and sit right away on a Tuesday. We had a Groupon (2 sandwiches, 2 apps, and 2 domestic beers). I ordered the tenderizer and it was delicious. The guy said it was one of their must popular sandwich.

I would definitely skip the loaded tater tots. It comes with cheese and chili and they were awful. They get cold almost immediately. 

Great sandwiches though. And kind of a divey bar feel

I've been here a few times and still don't like it.  Their grilled cheeses are fun combinations made with poor ingredients.  The bread, cheese, and other fillings are all mediocre on their own.  The sandwiches are not "good."  Not culinary masterpieces.  Instead they put together some fun ingredients, slather it in butter, and serve it to drunk people.  Once you get past the immediate shock of "chicken tenders on a grilled cheese.  How fun!"  The sandwich is actually pretty bland if you're sober enough to taste it.  Get some real cheese, good bread, and other well seasoned food and I think this place would be fine.  

My other complaint is that its usually hard to find seating, especially with a group.  I understand this is a bar, but I want to sit down while eating my dinner.  The layout of the whole restaurant is bizarre and doesn't work well.

Went on a late night Sunday. Wasn't crowded at all. Ordered the originator to go. Got home and ended up with a burnt piece of bread with slices of cheese that weren't melted. To top it off it is supposed to come with tomato soup/sauce. They gave me something that looks like ranch dressing. Don't waste your time.

Great place! Been here twice, GF 1st time. We had the caprese & tenderizer sandwiches!!  bathrooms could use a little attention.. "Gourmet" grilled cheese on Texas toast plus a bar..... how can you go wrong??!
Definitely would hit this every time visiting.

I don't think I've tried any sandwich that I wouldn't order again. 
The employees have always been amazing, even when I had an annoying groupon.
I've always sat in the bar area, but the seating and walkways can get a little cramped. I always recommend this place to people and will continue to love Cheesie's.

Definitely has an interesting theme to it.  Who doesn't love a good grilled cheese and tomato soup?  Came here with a group of friends and was surprised to see all the specials that they had to offer. Everything is not expensive and they have lots of 10% off through various offers.

The restaurant is arranged as a sit-down pub with all of its menu items chalked behind the cashier.  The food came quickly and I ordered the chorizo grilled cheese sandwich with a side of chili.  The sandwich fit pretty heavy on my stomach and was very tasty. The chili, on the other hand, was very watery, mushy meat-ed and bland in taste. The chili really brought down my expectations for this place because I honestly preferred having a Wendy's style chili afterwards.

Fun themed and great for groups, but the meal did not meet my expectations.  Disappointed, so I probably will not be coming back.

Cheesie's, Cheesie's, Cheesie's.

This place is amazing.  Great food, great service, great company.  I've made trips all the way from the suburbs just to eat here and it's well worth it especially when I'm really, really craving a grilled cheese sandwich.  My go to is The Mac.  I can't explain to you how heavenly the first bite is, but I'd say it's akin to sinking into a super warm and bubbly bath after a long day.  It combines my two childhood comfort foods, mac & cheese and buttery grilled cheese sandwiches.  It's so soft, and gooey, and ugh... I want some now.  It comes with a little (and I mean LITTLE!) container of their tomato soup for dipping but I still order a full sized cup of it because it's never enough for me.

In the past I've ordered the The Classic, which is classic and good.  I've also tried the fried cheesecake bites, which weren't what I was expecting but I wasn't really sure what it was I was expecting to begin with.  It was still pretty good though.  

I've never been here during the day so I don't know if the ambiance is any different but it is very loud at night, both in terms of the music and the crowd. It's open late so this is my go to if I'm hanging around the bars in the area. You can't tell me a grilled cheese sandwich doesn't sound amazing after a night of drinking.
Who in their right mind pays for a sandwich that my 8 year old can make? Ok place far too expensive and ridiculous wait. Not worth it whatsoever..

Ever since the first time I tried the mac sandwich I've been hooked on Cheesie's.  As a picky eater, this sandwich is a mashup made in heaven that combines 2 of my favorite foods.  I tried the regular grilled cheese but it wasn't anything special.  They have good sides like seasoned fries, tots, chicken fingers, mac & cheese bites, etc.  I usually stop in for lunch but they have a full bar so this would be a fun place to come with a group of friends to watch a game or just grab a bite & some drinks, see you next week Cheesie's!

Mmmm, these guys give grilled cheese a hell of a makeover. Love their sandwiches here. It can get a little crowded here, but it's understandable since it's practically a full blown bar. Never came here under the influence but I imagine that this would be heaven at around 2am after like 5 or 10 beers, a couple of shots, and some bad decisions.

We just had the cutest customer service from an employee in a hello kitty hat and glasses. so positive and pleasant- a perfect model of what employees should be. also, obviously great food. cheeses rocks!!

Maybe it's because I ate at Cheesie's at 3 AM after a night out, but I thought my grilled cheese sandwich was INCREDIBLE. I had decided to split it with my boyfriend, which was a terrible decision because we were fighting over each and every bite of our Mac sandwich, which YES does in fact have Mac N Cheese on it. It's probably one of the least exciting choices on the menu, which is full of really inventive grilled cheese ideas, but I was satisfied. The tater tots were also perfectly crispy and were a great distraction for my boyfriend while I stealthily snuck bites of our sandwich. 

If you don't wanna have strange dreams of grilled cheese sandwiches, don't come immediately before bed....
Any type of grilled cheese you could ever imagine. I had the El Jefe which is a grilled cheese wrapped in a quesadilla filled with beef, salsa, cheeses and jalapenos..... Delicious!

Heard a lot of big talk about this mecca of cheese, and after finally coming here to kick of the night's escapades, I wasn't particularly impressed. Shared the Mac and the Caprese, along with some tomato soup and fries. I was expecting tons of cheese oozing down the sides of perfectly toasty and buttery slices of bread, enough to fulfill all my cardiovascular risk factors for the next 5 years. While the thick pieces of bread were appreciably buttery and crispy, the filling of the sandwiches themselves was actually a little bit disappointing in terms of quantity. Maybe they were just having an off day, idk. As far as the tomato soup dipping sauce goes, it was also just alright; tasted quite good at first but after a few dips It became hard to finish an entire side of tomato soup on its own. The Pesto Mayo that came with the Caprese was pretty tasty though, which made up for the small amount of mozzarella on it. 

That said, with the groupon I wouldn't mind coming back. $20 for two sandwiches, two soups, and two beers? That's a deal if I've ever seen one.

Let me preface by saying I have come to Cheesie's for years now and have always loved it. 

So, what happened? Not only did it take 45 minutes for our food to arrive, but we were missing half of our order and had to ask again before they brought out the remainder of our order.

The staff seems disjointed, and possibly untrained. We have been here many times when it is twice as packed as today and have never had to wait so long, nor have our orders forgotten. 

I'll be back Cheesie's, hoping for the best! I believe in you!
Very good food.  Had a good beer and a great sandwich.  Great service at the bar.  Pretty lively place.

The Tradicion, the Popper and the Melt. You can not go wrong with any of these sandwiches. They are all delicious. As are the chili-cheese tator tots. The French Onion soup is the only thing I really don't like here.

The space is always filled with college age kids at night. It's definitely a good place to watch a game if that is your thing. I prefer to go for lunch during the week, when it is much less busy/crowded. And they also do good delivery.

Their alcoholic rootbeer on tap is delicious. Definitely get one for an after dinner drink. It will make dealing with all the "bros" much more pleasant.

Everything is fried, grilled and cheesy! Fantastic location for night life after the bar, they're open till 3am. The food was spot on and exactly what was needed at the hour. They also serve a wide variety of beer and alcohol, so bring your ID!

Overall: Great option for late night cheesy goodness. Just be prepared to wait.

The good: Lots of amazingly cheesy options with tons of different fillings. It's not gourmet by any means, but it's still great. Good sized sandwiches. Plus, it's a half bar, so you can drink some quality taps too. They play good music as well.

The bad: Even with a short line, the wait for the food took awhile. Even to-go. When it's crowded, that's definitely a longer time. The fries were cold. Not a lot of space to stand and wait and always no tables.

Atmosphere: 7.5/10
Service: 7.5/10
Food: 8/10
What!? Closed down by the health department?!! A friend just called to tell me. Is this true? Who knows the scoop? I can't find anything out about it online.

This is probably the best food for just about any occasion. I celebrated my 21st here for dinner and some drinks and i cannot get over how big these sandwiches are! They are super filling and the perfect hangover helper.

Attention all you dudes and dudettes, Cheesie's is going to steal your heart if you are in fact desperately infatuated with cheese, especially mac n' cheese.  You'll be leaving, saying "Kraft macaroni and cheese, who???"  You will also never look at a grilled cheese quite in the same way.  I do understand that are some really super amazing and pretty original grilled cheese sandwiches out there, but this should definitely be in your top 5; that's not counting your home-made grilled cheeses which arguably, you will all say is "the best".  

My request for cheese, please was adequately filled when me and my fiance had a full on mac n' cheese kind of night.  Neither of us had been to Cheesie's before last night, but we knew that their mac n' cheese balls were envy-worthy.  So, along with ordering the mac n' cheese balls we also decided on the "The Mac" sandwich - a classic, it seems.  They had about 8 different sandwiches that looked intriguing, but I think that in this particular case, simpler was better.  I had absolutely no qualms about eating this much mac n' cheese and I guarantee that once you taste these heavenly pieces of work you won't have any complaints about it either.  As I'm writing this now, I'm wishing that I had a mac n' cheese ball in one hand with a sandwich in the other.  Dammit - my stomach is grumbling!  I will even go so far as to say that both the balls and the sandwich were orgasmic...I mean, seriously orgasmic.  The mac n' cheese balls were fried to perfection and and the sandwich - don't even get me started.  Just stop.  Just stop.  It was so a-m-a-z-i-n-g.  And the sandwich came with this cute little dipper of tomato soup/sauce; honestly I wish we'd gotten more dip, but oh well because the sandwich was super fly all by itself.    The more I'm writing about how delicious the food was the more saddened I am by the fact that I don't have any more of it!!!  As soon as I work off all those calories from the balls and sandwich I'll be going back to add them back on.  IT IS SO GOOD.

Apart from the food, the environment is quite cool too.  For some reason, I think it is totally wickedly awesome that you can relax, eat a grilled cheese without any (well maybe, a little) guilt and have a beer at the bar.  They have a modest selection of beer , some of which I haven't seen in many bars before.  The bar sits in the middle of the restaurant while the stand to order your food sits off to the left side.  Tables surround the restaurant and it's all pretty cozy.  

My fiance and I arrived at Cheesie's near the end of the Blackhawks game so of course the restaurant was filled to the brim with screaming fans - which I'm personally a fan of.  I love a great atmosphere where we are cheering for our home team and eating delicious food.  There's nothing better than that combination to unite a bunch of strangers!  It's a fun atmosphere and I think that you can easily enjoy yourself here whether it's crazy busy or very relaxed.  

Gather together now and say "Cheeeese!"

I usually eat cheesies and its really good. I ordered delivery this past weekend and was extremely disappointed. The Mac and cheese bites were good, however, the rest of my order was horrible. The tenderizer I ordered was cold. The fries with cheese on the side was the worst part. I not only got what seemed like 7 fries. And that's not a joke. But I ordered cheese on the side and they did not even give me that. I contacted the customer service and they still have not responded to me. Very frustrated with them on this delivery.

I tried the fried mac and cheese and the tradicion. The mac and cheese bites were so delicious! The dipping sauce provided makes them so much better. The sandwich was good but a little too salty for me. I wish it was a bit more spicy too - tho the sauce provided helps with this. 

The environment is very chill. I'd love to come back and dine in!
Great gourmet grilled cheese - friend and I split the Caprese - yummy!  Friendly service great people watching place.

A bit overhyped but good drunk people food, for sure. A little overpriced, a literal sandwich with cheese and mac for $7... I would have made it at home if I knew it was just that and no sides. The dipping sauce could be bigger. If you're looking for an upbeat ambiance definitely worth checking out.  I'm looking forward to trying the Edgar here some day.

A MUST-Try for newcomers to Chicago. A bar based around Good food, drinks, and certainly, Cheese. Most all sandwiches are cooked on Texas toast and smothered with butter and cheese. The sandwiches are stuffed with glorious items such as BBQ chicken tenders, tater tots, Mac n cheese and hot sauce. 

The sides are equality as good. Great cheese curds, and fried mac n cheese bites. Even the fries and perfect. 

The beer menu has 6-8 diverse draft selections and plenty of bottles. The bar can make some specialty cocktails but mostly
Just has the materials to make the basics.

Cheesies is open late and is one of the best places to go when you're out on a crazy night and you need a pound of cheesy heaven. Stop by to try to Napoleon, it's my personal favorite.

Well Sunday night and everything is closed. We'll we were hungry and all the restaurants closed way too early so we decided to stop at this place before we went out dancing.

A football game was on and people were actually pretty nice. I hate grilled cheese but my boyfriend loves them, why? God only knows, because grilled cheese is just a punishment! He ordered the macaroni and cheese grilled cheese and I had the tater tots, a side of french fries WITH MAYO!!!! He liked the grilled cheese and my tater and fries were decent. I think this place would be delicious when you are complete hammered and are starving!

After an amazing review and a couple drinks, I decided to bring my friends to Cheesie's for what I thought would be consistently good food and drinks. I saw a deal on grouoon and purchased it a couple weeks prior. 

Although it is stated NOWHERE on the grouoon, they decided to not accept it after midnight. Ok, great! Just screw me over without Vaseline. Even after talking to the manger to give them a chance to to make things right, no one cared. 
 
On top of this, there are security guards who think they are cops, asking me what was in my bags and trying to inspect my purse. Not understanding when this place took such a turn for the worse.

Keep these things in mind next time you purchase a groupon for this plac or decide to pass by. I won't be coming back.

Nothing to rave about, nothing to complain about though either. 
Went here with my roommate post-bars, so as you can imagine we were pretty thrilled to be fed, and of course we can appreciate a place that caters their hours of operation to the less than sober. 
We were both satisfied with our sandwiches and the menu options that were a slight departure from the average grilled cheese. 
I would welcome another visit in my future if it is convenient.

Remember those days of your youth when grandma or mom made you some grilled cheese? Well the folks at Cheesies took those memories and ratcheted them up a notch! Grilled cheese sandwiches will never be the same after eating one of Cheesies funky takes on the classics!

This is the best pub food ever! I mean, who doesn't like grilled cheese? & a beer? I'm in heaven! This place is quite a drive from me but close to Wrigley and not too far from my wife's job. They always have different craft brews available and if you're not a fan, domestics also. You can find a deal on groupon and it's totally worth it. I was here for the third time the other night and have always leave satisfied. Can't wait to come back!

I went to the Grand Opening and it was great! I had the "The OG" Sandwich which means The Original. I also had seasoned fries with that. The "OG" is made with American Cheese and Merkt's Cheddar Cheese on Texas Toast with Tomato Soup as a dipping sauce. They had technical issues with the cash register's but that's part of technology. The owner Chris and staff did a great job.

I first fell in love with Cheesie's at Green Fest this summer.  Hubby and I split The Mac grilled cheese.  It was amazing.  Thick, toasted Texas toast that held in the cheesy mac and cheese.  I wish there was more tomato dipping sauce.

I've also been the the actual store on Belmont.  Very lively bar especially weeknights.  Pretty fast service.  The Mac is still my go-to, but the Frenchie is also good...I mean, who can say no to a sandwich stuffed with French fries, bacon, and chives that comes with a side of sour cream?  Super good comfort food.

I was in Chicago for the day visiting my best friend and let me tell you that when I got home I couldn't stop talking about our trip to Cheesie's Pub & Grill. Much like the rest of the world I have a deep love for Mac & Cheese and Grilled Cheese and having them in one sandwich was like I died and went to heaven. 

We ordered fried mac & cheese bites, cheese curds and loaded tater tots for an appetizer. The mac & bites were the best I've ever had. Mostly when you order them else where you can tell they were frozen and put in a deep fryer, but these were out of this world. The cheese curds were good but they were made better by the tomato dipping sauce. 

For our entrée we ordered 3 sandwiches, The Mac, The Caprese and The Tenderizer. All 3 were simply amazing and gave me more ideas besides tomato and bacon to put in my grilled cheese for when I want to cook at home.

I'm sad I don't live in Chicago because this would be my go to place when I get my cheesy craving. Also for all the food we got it was only 40 dollars! How amazing is that?! The perfect meal!

The sandwiches are amazing. The service is always fast and friendly. What else can I say?

Try the fried mac and cheese bites! I usually order the Caprese or the Frenchie. Both are incredible. Love the pesto mayo that comes with the Caprese. My boyfriend swears by the Tenderizer. I have a girlfriend who never strays from the Mac. They're all fantastic!

Weekend nights tend to get crazy since it's such a small space, so plan to be quick when you spot a table. 

Evanston location is also great, minus the lack of chalkboard tables.

I don't know what was going on. I've been to the other location in wicker- great food. But I just stood in line at this one for about 30 min for no reason it wasn't that busy. Staff just looked lazy as fuck. Left and told the deal to the door guy and the door guy said "yeah, I don't know what's going on, they are even being rude as fuck to us". Um, get it together!

We went to Cheesie's before a Cubs game on a Sunday afternoon. It was delicious! They take something traditional like a grilled cheese and apply creativity to result in taste explosions!

The staff was very friendly and enthusiastic. The atmosphere is casual and fun. The location is very convenient to the red line and about a 10 minute walk to Wrigley.

As an avid lover of all cheese, I am continually flabbergasted when I come across a restaurant that takes this American standard and turns it into an art. Imagine the shockwave that flowed through my body when I discovered Cheesie's; a restaurant that exclusively serves a thrilling and exciting variety of this exquisite sandwich! To boot, Devo the bartender extraordinaire, dishes out a brilliantly friendly cocktail of wit, booze and kindness that exudes the diversity and kindness that Lakeview is known for. Without a doubt, Cheesie's must be a regular stop for all traveling through the Windy City!

The heartiest, most masculine grilled cheese you could find without summoning a genie from a lamp. The Tradicion, with chorizo, chihuahua cheese and the tangy, hot kick dipping sauce is nature's nectar when paired with a stylin' and profilin' PBR tall boy. I highly recommend, but take a doggy bag - these sandwiches have girth.

Have you ever had a food experience where you LITERALLY believed you had a close encounter with God after the first bite? That was my experience yesterday at Cheesie's! 

After the Cubs game and many cervezas later, we hopped on the Red Line and took it to Cheesie's to consume the much needed carb-a-licious Linner. I ordered the 4 cheese mac n' cheese sandwich and added BACON. Yes, you read that right...bacon! Oh .... My.... God. Seriously, like....seriously! Sparks flew in my mouth. Life was seriously the best it could have been for the 10 minutes of my consumption. The taste was spot on. The cheese and bacon combination was deeeeeelish! I cannot tell you what a mouthgasm it was but just know, I'd love to have that sandwich plus a lobster tail as my last meal on earth!

As for the sides -

Cheese curds: A+ as well. 

Sweet potato fries: BLEH. Much better elsewhere. 

Fried mac n cheese balls: Bleh. Average. 

Just go! The experience was life changing. 

Thanks, Angie K., I'm hooked! Let's go there EVERY damn cheat meal. LOL. 

;) happy cheesing!
This was my first time coming to Cheesie's and it won't be my last. I got the sandwich of the month Da Ragin Cajun and it was so good. I definitely gotta come back and try the other sandwiches.

My heart and stomach love this place, but my waist line doesn't! I remember when Cheesie's first opened up and my friends and I came here with a Groupon and pretty much tried every sandwich they had on the menu. The place back then was smaller. 

Over the few short years Cheesie's has become one of my favorite spots. Not just because I love grilled cheese almost as much as I love dogs, but also because of the late hours and awesome staff.

I've been here with my family when I'm as sober as a baby who just came into the world 45 seconds ago and when I've been so drunk with my friends I swear the cheese goodness from my Cheesie sandwich is the only thing that kept my liver from sliding down to my feet from all the pressure of the booze.

Sandwich Recommendations:
-The Tenderizer (cheddar & mozzarella cheese, hot sauce, bacon, fried chicken tenders and Sweet Baby Ray's BBQ sauce on Texas toast...served with a side ranch) is my go to sandwich. Standing ovation for this The Tenderizer!

-The Frenchie (American/mozzarella/cheddar cheese sauce, classic thick cut french fries, bacon and chives on sour dough bread. Served with a side of sour cream) is what I get when I want to switch it up some. You won't be disappointed with this sandwich.

Sides Recommendations
You can't go wrong with either the cheese curds or the fried pickles.

I love all the different grilled cheese options. So delicious! I actually used a groupon deal .The staff is awesome so friendly and welcoming. I was in line to order, but the girl bartender called us over from the line to sit down and order from her to avoid the long lines. She was so nice and got our food out so  quickly . Thank you !!

Wow.  This place impressed me and exceeded my expectations.  PS It's my 100th review!

My wife loves grilled cheese.  Like it's almost a problem.  So of course when we last went to a Cubs game she insisted that we give this place a try.  It's easily in walking distance, but also nicely gets you away from the Wrigleyville crowds.  

I was very hesitant about ordering anything from the cheese-centric menu.  Now don't get me wrong, I love cheese.  I don't care for a sandwich full of cheese, nor do I like Texas toast.  Coming from Oklahoma, I know Texas Toast to be nearly an inch thick and loaded with butter.  

I ordered The Melt (chicken, bacon, cheese, tomato, thousand island, etc.) and my wife orered The Mac (cheese and mac and cheese).  I was very very impressed by this sandwich.  The Texas Toast was not overwhelming, though still qualified as Texas Toast.  There was an exceptional balance between meat, fillings, and cheese and the side flavored mayo was a nice touch.  My wife's sandwich was exactly as described and delicious if you are into that much pasta and cheese.  

Definitely worth a trip if you are in the area.

Show up hungry. These sandwiches are RICH. Sit at the bar and dish with the adorable bartender. Full bar, good selection of beers and *boom* CIDER on tap.

I had the Caprese grilled cheese - mozzarella, tomatoes and basil on sourdough. Dipped in Pesto mayonnaise - wait, WHAT?! Yeah, forget your diet for a bit and indulge a little. You can be good again tomorrow.

It's decadent. Not pricey! Solid, friendly little place. Kind of an unexpected bar, but I really liked it, and will be back again.

I love grilled cheese sandwiches. This place has it but in a more unique way. You can get a grilled cheese sandwich with Mack and cheese and bacon on the inside and other great unique sandwiches started by San Francisco restaurant team. It's a fast food joint just like chipotle or any other's burger place out there but has great quality within itself. Also has a bar in the middle if you're a drinker

I have made an unfortunate return to Cheesies. Friends in town wanted to visit and I obliged. Not only did the register take 20+ minutes to ring up a literal grilled cheese, but the food took 45 minutes to arrive. This is a grilled cheese, not asking to go to the suburbs and find Charlie the chicken to fill my organic chicken needs. Anyone considering coming here should just go to the Walgreens across the street, buy butter, bread, cheese, and go home to make their own grilled cheese in a faster time.

Sorry guys but this just won't do. Gluten free or not, kids and adults agree the grilled cheese at home is much better. Cheese curds were....Ok. The sandwich was dry, not buttery and flakey. The cheese was bountiful, but processed and gooey.
We came, we tried, we left and probably won't return.

This is my favorite casual spot in Chicago. The grilled cheese sandwiches are ridiculously good, it's always hard to decide which one to get although the Tenderizer is the one I get the most. The sandwiches turned into salads are just as delicious! There is a Sunday brunch special from 11 am to 2 pm. The workers are always friendly and help you have a great experience. The beer list is always above par and rotates often. My boyfriend and I visit Cheesie's frequently and the workers helped me plan a surprise get-together for him. I cannot say enough positive things about Cheesie's and the people who work there!!

My friend Danielle (hey girl!) brought me here when I was visiting Chicago for a wedding.  Pearl's Place makes you feel like you're at your grandma Pearl's.  You walk in and grab a table, all of which have white tablecloths and many of which are full of all of your grandmas and grandpas.  I cannot imagine coming here after church lets out.

You go up to the buffet bar, specify what you want, and most of it is cooked to order (or was very recently cooked!).  Super old-school southern flavor.  Then you sit down at the table, and a waiter brings you all the drinks you want.  I was partial to the orange juice.

Luckily we got seated and were able to eat quickly, but I imagine this place gets quite packed during peak periods.  Don't come starving in case you have to wait!

I've had them on my to do list for awhile, so a few of went to check them out. We went on a busy Saturday afternoon at about 330 & there was a 40 minute wait. Well we saw plenty open tables so we couldn't understand why the wait, but ok WHATEVER. 

After 40mins we get seated. We got menus or the option of the buffet. I asked my server what they buffet offered, his reply was he doesnt know & they items can change hourly. So I went to view the buffet food & was VERY skeptical on ordering that. But reluctantly I got the buffet so I could try different items. I tasted the smothered pork chops, greens, yams, dressing, fried chicken, white rice. I also ordered catfish nuggets. Everything was very tasty. The yams weren't done enough. The catfish nuggets were nasty & seemed like frozen fish not fresh fish. SMOTHERED CHOPS WERE DELICIOUS!!!! Fried chicken was good & the food was being replenished quickly. The greens were just ok. 

The buffet costs $20 & for $4 we took some food home too. I really liked that we could do that. I will definitely be back for more! The service we received was pretty good too. The only thing I think they need help with is that buffet line! Also the menu items are a little pricey too. A chitterling plate was $27!!! I can buy 2 buckets for that. Lolbvs

Breakfast Buffett

All you can eat eggs any way I want it?! Yes, please!

The selections was decent.
The food was delicious. Best grits I've ever had.
Service was good.
The music... to die for. A little bit of Michael Jackson, Boys II Men and Whitney Houston. Whaaat? It was awesome.
Excellent food and service.  Everyone is friendly and made sure we had a great first experience here. I'll definitely return!

Came a few days ago to the dinner buffet and it was absolutely delicious.  Everything tasted fresh, hot and made with love.  Our server was nice and very accommodating. I had greens, yams, mac and cheese, dressing,chicken, jerk turkey and smothered steak. Of course I couldn't finish plate 2 so took it with. This is def the spot for soulfood like mama used to make.

I have been wanting to try this place for months and I finally got the chance to last week. I was disappointed. I ordered the turkey meatloaf dinner with yams and greens. The meatloaf was bland. It had absolutely no seasoning. The greens reminded me of the Glory greens that come in the can. The yams were hard, and the peach cobbler that my friend ordered was cold. It was like they made it the day before and stuck it in the fridge; in other words, it wasn't fresh. Soul food restaurants are always hit or miss and this place was definitely a miss for me.

Really great and attentive service from the entire staff. They're tech savvy, too, texting you when you're table is ready. 

My friend and I wanted to try their Southern lunch and we both left liking the food and loving the staff. You can either do their $14 buffet or order off their menu. My appetite in the morning is usually not as beastly as it is later in the day so I opted to just order my grub. 

I ordered the ham & egg sandwich & added some cheese for $8. It came on wheat bread and totally loaded with both ham and egg! So much protein was packed in, it was all falling out and made for a little side breakfast dish. Flavor was all good and the side portion of potatoes was yummy, too. For people who like peppers, it had chunks of red & green throughout with some onion, too. Peppers and onions are two of my least favorite foods so for me, the taste was too overpowering. 

Those biscuits though! Pearl's Place starts everyone out with a couple of fresh, warm and delicious biscuits that you can smother butter or jam on. Oh yessssssh. Those were some tasty buns.

I really wanted to like this place but that didn't happen. I got the 5 Jumbo wings with Mac and cheese and collard greens with a side of peach cobbler. The jumbo chicken was not thoroughly cooked, the collard greens were hard and tasted like they came fresh out the can. The Peach Cobbler Nice And Cold/ Fresh Out The Fridge.. JUST HOW I LIKE IT (Sarcasm). The Mac and cheese was the only decent thing that I had and the delivery was pretty fast l

But I probably wouldn't eat here again!
Went to this restaurant  today thinking that the food would be great,but to my surprise it was horrible,not seasoned,food was bland,not good at all!!!!

Pearl's Place has been my go to for soul food for the last three years. The food is absolutely amazing. I usually order the catfish, macaroni and cheese, sweet potatoes, and greens. It has never disappointed. When I do breakfast, I do have the buffet. Everything on there is delicious. Including the unlimited complimentary biscuits/cornbread that comes to your table. I've done the breakfast buffet twice and the dinner buffet once. The other times I've visited, I ordered from the menu. The owners of the restaurant are present in the day to day operation of the business. They come to your table for general conversation or just to ensure that your food is good and that the service is acceptable. Despite the times I've heard about Pearl's having bad service, I have seriously had nothing but amazing customer service here. At one point, Deidre (who I'm not 100% is even still there) was like my consistent server. Her and her colleagues always did a fantastic job working together to make sure that service was exceptional. Even in the one or two instances where something happened that made my experience less than amazing, I informed one of the owners and the situation was rectified immediately. I highly recommend Pearl's to anyone who is looking to enjoy good food. 

And they have parking too. Which is always a plus.

Where do I begin?! This is the best soul food restaurant that I've ever been to. I've been here twice, both times for the lunch buffet. To start, the buffets are very reasonably priced. $15 for all you can eat goodness!! The jerk and baked chicken is delicious. The Mac and cheese is creamy. The baked sweet potatoes are delightful. EVERYTHING is good, and the waiters are attentive. The best part is that this restaurant just has a wonderful, southern feel. It emanates Black culture, and it is a great place to just chill and feel at home! I can't wait to come back here the next time I'm in Chicago.

WOW this place is amazing.  Don't let the sketchy neighborhood scare you off-- and don't worry if you aren't black.  Just come hungry.  

Everything we had was soooo good!  Pearl's serves breakfast until 2pm, so if you go for lunch, you can actually have breakfast also.  The buffet is all you can eat, $14 for adults, less for kids.  There is absolutely no way you could leave in any condition other than STUFFED.  Standouts: fried chicken, yams, mac and cheese, rib tips, egg dishes which are made-to-order.  They also have pies for sale, the sweet potato is awesome.  

We can't wait to go back!  But I think we need to hit the gym a few times before we return to Pearl's (smile)

The service was,great,   thats the only reason i gave it 3 stars my friends and I had a really nice waitress...however I paid $22 for a pot roast dinner. and had very little meat. but plenty of red/green pepper & onions.  too camouflage the lack of meat.

I went with a friend to their New Year's Day Buffet after reading everyone's positive reviews. Sadly, everything that we ate at the buffet was either over seasoned, salty, or sweet.  Perhaps the food from the buffet is different then when you order from the menu?  

Polite and exceptional service from our waitress and buffet staff.

After Thanksgiving food cravings led me to Pearls! I am so happy to have found this place esp. since it's a short commute from Hyde Park! 

Pros: Food, location, staff

Cons: no parking, currently doesn't sell alcoholic beverages but apparently that's changing soon, also the Jumbo Wings were huge but I steer away from chemically modified meat as I don't think quantity should supersede quality   

Overall I would def. return

The food was VERY good...I got the pot roast dinner with greens and macaroni and cheese and my bf got the blackened catfish and shrimp with red beans and rice.  
The pot roast was a tad dry but very flavorful and good.  The meat itself wasn't that dry, but I'm used to my pot roast having some type of gravy or at least the natural "juice".  They need to let it simmer in gravy for a minute and it would be fire!  The mac and cheese was soooo good and so were the greens, 

Our waiter (Will) was excellent and very attentive and gave us great service.

Once again the food is good and this is something I would drive to the city for to get!

I'm always looking for delicious soul food and I found it at Pearl's.  We didn't get the buffet but next time we'll have to try it.  I am a fan of the cabbage, corn bread and chicken.  My daughter liked the short ribs.  We'll be visiting again soon!

After an disappointing experience at Priscilla's in Hillside, I recalled my encounter with Pearl's Place in the Grand Boulevard neighborhood back in July 2013.  At that time I didn't officially join Yelp.  

You know what?  I want to do Pearl's Place an honor this time because I want to recommend this place to my fellow yelpers.  If you want some southern food that can bless your body, mind, and soul in the city, my pick would be the Pearl's Place on Michigan and Pershing.  

After parking our vehicle at the Amber Inn (a partner business) parking lot, our journey to the best soul food in the city began.  

The entire place ran like a well-oiled machine.  We were taken care by Ms. Liz, who was one of the most professional, easy-going, and systematic servers we have ever met.  We forwent the lunch buffet ($13/person) and ordered a la carte instead.  

My shrimp and cheesy grits with bacons and green onions was soul-fulfilling!  I've been craving for shrimp and grits (one of my favorite southern-food specialities) for quite some time.  The shrimps were cleaned thoroughly and de-tailed; there was a balanced amount of "melt ability" between cheese and grits.  I was so glad that I satiated my crave this afternoon.  

Hubby also had a quality catfish sandwich.  Liz kindly informed him that the Brussels sprouts weren't available, yet he could have a choice of another side.  Hubby then received a cup of rice with gravy.  By the way, their coleslaw and gravy were quite delicious as well.  

The adjacent patrons went with the lunch buffet option.  I would say it's worth the price if you come hungry.  One of the unique features at Pearl's Place is that the chefs behind the buffet bar serve each plate for you.  Trust me, every plate is filled to its full-capacity and will make you "incapacitate" (hopefully in a good way) after several plates from the buffet bar.  

I know some reviewers have mentioned the surroundings and the neighborhood itself.  Yes, it's a "bare-looking" neighborhood, but I feel fine walking on the streets from and to the train station (CTA Indiana Green line station is in a very close proximity) during day-time.  Nevertheless, free parking is more than sufficient at the Amber Inn lot.  

Come as you are!  Overall, we spent $20 (not including tax and tip) and our stomaches were "soul-ly" happy.  Give Pearl's a try, and let me know what you think.

I ate at Pearl's Place about a week ago. The buffet food was mediocre at best. The buffet table was right next to the kitchen door, so we kept dodging the wait staff coming in and out, a female wait staff member actually told me to move as I stood in line by the kitchen door. Where else could I stand? 
    The fried chicken was greasy and the pork chops were tough and tasteless.  Everything else was mediocre.  I will not be returning anytime soon.

Delicious and hot Buffett all you can eat with variety of choices. Bring a empty stomach for you will want to try it all. Presentation not only looks delicious, it tastes like home cooking and hot. I loved hot they kept my chicken hot while they made my fresh waffles. Everyone was so nice especially our waitress Lisa. We came the day before and someone in our party had a white t-shirt which was prohibited. The gentlemen at the counter never offered our friend a shirt that is available so we left. They apologized today for that omission from their worker. Glad we gave this place a second chance for it was worth it.

I'm never going to Pearls place again, I just had the worse experience ever. I went to Pearls to eat today like I've done for years and they have  these cheap signs up with a new dress code that has at least 10 new rules one of which says no white t-shirts. So because it's brunch time and 90 degrees outside I have a white t shirt on. They tried to make me put on a wrinkled shirt that clearly came from the thrift store. This would have almost been acceptable until I noticed a Caucasian woman sitting with a white shirt on that said Levi on it. They are clearly trying to weed out people who have kept them in business for years to attract a new crowd of people. DONE DONE DONE.. Chicago chicken and waffle is right up the street and they allow you to be you.

YAAAAASSSS!!!! The food, the service, the ambiance. Everything is a YAAASSS! This was my 2nd time at Pearl's and it was even better than I remembered. The mac and cheese is slap yo mamma good and the collard greens are cooked to perfection. Sooo flavorful without any meat used to cook them. The guy who made my omelet put his foot in it! I got spinach in the omelet and sometimes that can be a bit overpowering. Not this time. He blended it perfectly with the other ingredients. Even the eggs themselves had great flavor. And then there were the biscuits. Those biscuits spoke to my soul. Get them with honey. It will make your life. 
The only thing that surpassed the food was the service. My waitress was awesome. She kept my glass full and brought me any and everything I'd need in the blink of an eye. She was warm, polite, knowledgeable, and attentive. If you want brunch and soul food is your thing, then Pearl's is your place.

Went to Pearl's Place today. This was my first visit. Everything was going okay until it was time for me to pay my bill. The waitress tells me my card isn't working & she needs to enter it manually but can't read the numbers. She goes back to try again & comes back to rudely tell me my card is declined. At this point I get nervous because I'm thinking something is wrong with my card. I had to ask for the receipt again to pay with cash. Needless to say there was nothing wrong with my card. I checked with my bank & I was able to use it after I left. This restaurant needs to better train their staff on how to use their card machines. I probably won't go back & I'm praying my card has not been compromised by this establishment. Overall the food was fine.

So you know how you give things 3 times before you try to say how something is. Well all 2 out of the 3 times the service I had is terrible. I ate the Buffett and my waiter has no even came to check but once. I order a appetizer and I been to Buffett twice and it came 20 mins later. No use of having it now. Normally when you go someone if they see your glass is not filled with they refill it. I will not be coming back here. Food was ok
Today but when ever I am paying my money to Eat Somewhere I expect good service.

So I wanted some good fried chicken. My other half wanted to go to another spot that has good fried chicken, but the sides we have to order are potato salad, cole slaw, fried okra and fries (when you gone there more than once and you don't eat pork, it can get very boring). So I suggested Pearl's Place.....I love their fried chicken! It's the BEST! We both ordered the buffet and immediately dived in! Let me tell you that we both were soooo happy. We were able to eat all the side dishes (they don't cook with pork) and everything was seasoned well. So if you're looking for a place that offers good fried chicken and sides: PEARL'S PLACE IS IT!

Cornbread: great
Dirty rice: spectacular 
Greens: amazing
Cabbage: absolutely wonderful 
Catfish nuggets: pretty much perfect!
Jerk ribs: mine were a little dry, but sauce was tasty!
Candied Yams: scrumptious 
Mac & cheese: TO DIE FOR!!!!! 

I cannot WAIT to get back!

YAY to biscuits. Neh to the buffett. All you can eat, but there is only a handful of items and you get tired pretty quick. You are better off ordering from the menu and getting one thing you like. The buffet has these things and that is it.

Omelette station
Waffles
Grits
Greens
Sausage patties/links
hotlinks
fried catfish nuggetts
chicken wings
rice and beans
corn beef hash
home fries

Omg can't even get the words out. We just finished celebrating my grandma 75th surprise birthday party at pearls. Our waitress Taylor was phenomenal and very attentive. She catered to my grandma every need. My family loved the food and the atmosphere. The staff helped us sing happy birthday and served cake. I just want to say thank you.

Nice place for a home cooked meal and relaxed atmosphere!  Reminds me of lunch at the 5 and Dine with my grandma!  

First time I stopped here but won't be my last!  Being from North Dakota this is my first true southern style buffet and I loved it......

Selection was huge.

This place is a gem!! I enjoyed the dinner buffet. It includes soul food entrees with many of the sides you would expect at a soul food restaurant. This place has a home feel to it and the owners walk around to make sure everyone one is enjoying their meal. The good part about the dinner buffet is the fact that you can also get breakfast at the same time. The omelets and pancakes are made to order and the last makes sure they are made to perfection. The raspberry tea was decent as well. I will definitely continue to visit this place because it reminds me of the southern cooking in Alabama

The husband and I have been here twice during the week for a late breakfast. We arrived in time for the changeover to the buffet from the breakfast seating.

Pearl's Place has very good grits, good biscuits, good soft scrambled eggs, an egg white option, very good coffee, and very good sweet potato pie with a somewhat tougher crust than my mother made. When you are seated you are given a cute oval very good not too sweet pan cornbread to share. The food offerings appear to be basic own home would food. The buffet had two kinds of greens, omelettes made to order, but was a steeper price at $13 than we wanted to pay not including beverages or all of the wonderful southern dessert options. The husband, in general, is opposed to cafeteria style serving as am I given my experience as a server whilst in undergrad! Something about obviously made ahead food is less appealing to us.

Jasmine G and Vonja give friendly, menu knowledgeable, customer-oriented service.  In general all staff are very helpful and hospitable.

Pearl's Place is undergoing a remodel whilst still in business.  The decor reflects the history of jazz, Bronzeville, and is interestingly eclectic and obviously the items on the walls come from a collection accumulated through the years. I will enjoy seeing what the remodel update brings, but I hope it includes a more aesthetically pleasing display of the artifacts on the walls today with perhaps an expansion of the collection with labels telling the history of each item! I've taken the time to look at them and I like and enjoy them.

Pearl's Place provides good comfort soul food and breakfast in a shabby environment with excellent customer service. I recommend it if you are in the neighborhood, but until after the remodel is complete, cannot suggest making a special trip to try.

Free parking in lot shared with co-located hotel. No validation is required during the week.

My boyfriend LOVES buffets so when I came across this restaurant ,I knew we had to go!

We went on weekday early afternoon  , waited for 10 minutes and was seated . Our waitress explained we had the option to go the buffet or get something off the menu. We of course went to the buffet,they were still having breakfast and lunch was being offered also. We ate waffles with eggs sausage and potatoes and it was yummy! The only thing it took the waitress like 10 minutes to give my boyfriend his syrup, mind you it was not busy AT ALL. But this man who I'm guessing is the owner , must have saw the frustration on my face b/c he came over and asked how everything was going . And like that we got our Syrup..lol 

We also got to try some of the Soul Food from the buffet . We tried the Fried chicken ,Turkey , Dressing and the Delicious Macaroni. Overall out experience was fair . The next time I go I want to try food off the menu.

The people that run this establishment do a great job of  creating a peaceful and harmonious environment that makes everyone feel welcomed and the food is the most delicious food I have tasted east of the Mississippi . I high recommend this place
Really good food, always poor service.  Deal with it, the wait, the lack of attentiveness by servers, sometimes apologies, but don't wait on it. They run out of stuff, deal with it or go elsewhere.

Delicious food, cheap prices, amazing staff. 

*Full disclosure, your homemade mac n cheese is probably better than theirs but you couldn't make it for anywhere near the price. 

I will be back for sure!

I am writing this review on behalf of the non-Yelping people I was with at Pearl's Place. They absolutely LOVED this place, particularly the mac n' cheese, the fried chicken, and the peach cobbler. I have been following a primarily plant-based diet so I cannot comment on the food itself because I didn't eat it.  However, I can and will say that the vibe was really homey and nice, our waiter Jermaine was extremely friendly, quick and attentive, and the other staff we spoke to were really sweet, as well.
Fuck who gets up and decided to Wear Anything But a White Tee Shirt .... If so you won't get in  smh  funny part is a well paid business man  woke up hungry and just want coffee and food

While staying at a bed and breakfast in Chicago, the inn keeper suggested a soul food restaurant a few blocks away. It was like walking back in time. White metal walls, white tables with butcher paper on them. The food was so incredible... We had the buffet. The kind of buffet that you stand in line for sort of like cafeteria style and the workers put food on your plate! The meats include pork ribs, jerk pork, fried chicken, jerk chicken, and jerk turkey. Louisiana style gumbo, red beans, and dirt rice. Collared greens and cooked cabbage and so on... They have a great salad selection including some of the beat potato salad that I have ever had. An egg bar and different soups pretty much rounds out the menu along with a selection of deserts available for purchase. My review is long but I just can't say enough about this place. If you're ever in Chicago near 39th street you have to try this place. Very clean, nice atmosphere, and nice people at a great price. I hope you'll love it as much as we did.

We really enjoyed ourselves. The good was pretty good. Compared to McArthers I would go here for a more authentic try at soul food. (Not saying I won't go back to MA).
The service was good. Our waiter had some good one liners that were very appropriate and made the experience more personalized.!

Quick take: a very solid southern style brunch, will  return. 

Pearls offers lots of yummy foods like biscuits, fluffy pancakes and waffles, and crispy bacon. But the fried chicken is a clear winner - we went back to the breakfast buffet for 5 rounds and left a little chicken graveyard at the table. 

Also, I don't know if comments pertaining to poor service are still relevant (at least for brunch). We've been twice and had great, courteous service both times!

The food quality doesn't match the prices. Way overpriced for "ok" food. Also there were gnats flying around the dining area as if they lived there. A Very uncomfortable place to dine in with gnats flying around your food as you eat. Would've probably considered the Buffett carryout if it wasn't so overpriced $24 (one person). Decided to dine in and that's when I met the occupants of the restaurant "the gnats".......gross

Man I wish I could give this more stars than just 5! Ok so first off I'll let you all know what I got. I got the buffet (so much food and so so good!) the cooks up there are so good and know what they are doing. I suggest the windy city omlet (everything) if you don't like spice just tell them leave off the spicy foods. Then I got coffee. I am a very happy with the coffee! It is strong so warning for the weak hearted! WARNING! get the French toast even though you got the buffet! You'll thank me later! I will come here every single time I am here!

Came in for carryout only as I was woefully underdressed from my workout.
One of the owners greeted us immediately, and took the time to answer questions about the food. He was really great, and even gave a little history leson about the restaurant. Bonus points that he honestly explained what was truly vegetarian and what might not be in the sides i.e. chicken broth.
I tried the yams which were soul food sweet compared to my home cooked ones, but an occasional decadent yam like that is a great treat!
I also tried the red beans and rice. Very flavorful, cooked to perfection with a tasty sprinkling of green onions.
Lastly, I ordered the fried green tomatoes which came with a spicy dipping sauce. Even after taking them home, these were the lightest tastiest best fried green tomatoes I've EVER had. I can only imagine how good they would be fresh out of the kitchen!
Overall a really pleasant 1st trip to a place I've driven by so many times. Glad I finally stopped to try it - next time I'll wear my Sunday best and eat in!

Out of towners looking for great food and we discovered Pearl's Place. We were not disappointed. We arrived late enough for breakfast buffet and early enough that the lunch buffet was fresh and hot. Best of both worlds. The food was amazing! Cook to order omelets and choice of toppings, check! We didn't want to fill up on breakfast so that we'd have room for lunch. And boy did we need room. So many choices. All so very good. My absolute 5 star favorites were the candied yams and macaroni and cheese.  But seriously everything we sampled was to our satisfaction. My only gripe was that our waitress/service was a little slow; we had to ask for silverware, syrup and drink refills. Overall, the restaurant was clean (even though they were doing a little remodeling), the neighborhood was nice/safe and easy to locate. We would definitely go back.  Ps- shout out to one of the buffet servers who accommodated my every time, I said I just wanted a dab/spoonful of something, just so I could taste it. lol

I ordered a simple meal. Grits without butter, scrambled eggs mixed with cheddar cheese and potatoes. The grits I liked. The potatoes were warm then cold. The eggs, well let's just say my taste buds are finicky and one bite was not an enjoyable swallow. 
 I believe this place does well with patrons who enjoy eating fried foods and fried chicken. I don't eat either so I would assume simplicity would be a no brainer. Moving on to customer service: I gave extra stars  for the server Vonja. She was pleasant and explained the process of ordering to me without hesitation or attitude. Would I come back, yes but only if I didn't feel like driving farther for a meal.

This review isn't on the food. The food was great. Amazing buffet style. But the service is sub-par. The atmosphere/vibe in the restaurant is very negative. THE WHOLE STAFF has an attitude. & They play favorites. As my table was leaving.. The hostess asked us Loudly, did we tip our waitress? .... No.
The best I've ever had... I'll be back with my co worker... We had the jerk chicken it was just right... The buffet was on point well worth it

Do not even waste your time. I ate here about a year ago and the food was good, but tonight the food was cold, awkwardly seasoned, and mostly unavailable.  The buffet was without key soul food dishes when we arrived (no macaroni and cheese, fried chicken, jerk rib tips, black eyed peas etc). Also, there was only one woman who was serving food at the buffet (which is actually not a buffet, but an all-you-can eat cafeteria style station with slow service and old looking food). I had to ask the manager to send another person to assist with the serving because there was a line of 8 of us waiting for food without anyone to help us. After making several special requests with management and our waiter for the buffet to be restocked, the fried chicken was cold, the macaroni was watery with overlooked noodles, and the jerk rib tips were mushy and poorly seasoned. The server was polite and apologetic, however I suggest going down the street to Chicago's Home of Chicken and Waffles for consistent, fresh soul food.

My friend and I were searching for a brunch place to go before church and we stumbled upon Pearl's place. I already knew it was going to be good since that's my moms name :)

The space itself is cute and cozy. There were fellow church goers dressed up and quite a few families. The place was packed and as a walk in we had a 20 to 30 minute wait. This isn't the type of place you go when your in a hurry. When we sat down we were given the best biscuits I have ever had. They were warm, buttery, and pretty much melt in your mouth. That had to have been my favorite part of brunch.

The service here was also good. For brunch I ordered Pearl's omelet which came with a side of hashbrowns and pancakes. The food in my opinion was just okay, but for the price point it was excellent. I would go back just for the biscuit, but plan on visiting again to try other items on the menu. They also have a buffet special and desserts i would like to try.

The charm of this restaurant is great as well at their food! Highly recommended if you are looking for home cooked southern food similar to your mom's cooking. We came into Pearl's by recommendation; we had a large party and they were welcoming, friendly and able to accommodate us with no problem. The service is great, you can see that they take pride in the restaurant and their food. Will definitely come back to visit the next time I'm in Chicago!
Good food. I always get the buffet and it's good for less than 20$. The service is not all that grand though.

Although I love the food I cannot support their policies. I've been a guest at this restaraunt numerous times and the past few times have not been pleasant. My most recent visit ended with my family and I leaving to go to another restaraunt due to their "white t-shirt" policy. A family member had on a quality v neck shirt and after waiting 15 minutes to be seated, we were informed he had to wear one of the house shirts or go change. We've visited this place numerous times and he's worn similar shirts; actually he's worn this particular shirt and we've not had any problems. When I explained to one of the owners that we've been here before and he has worn similair shirts and been allowed to eat and his response was to raise his voice, cut me off in mid sentence and point to a sign. I am college degreed (multiple times over) so to point to a sign and speak in a terse manner to a guest is unacceptable. I'm sure this may not stop droves of people from patronizing this establishment it will at least provide people with info about their policies.

Good news first the chicken meal is out of this world delicious! Yams perfect, greens awesome, Mac n cheese - done right! The banana pudding however missed the mark by a mile. They claim it is home made but it tasted like store bought pre made pudding with lemon extract to cover the taste; more lemon than banana flavor. So thumbs up for the meal and thumbs down for the pudding.

The food was good.  I personally wasn't blown away but it was A-OK.  I was impressed with the buffet set-up.  There are servers to fix your plate.  There is a nice germ shield glass that separates the public from the food.  You just tell them what you want and they pile it on. Now this is a buffet I can frequent!
This place is great! Food is great! No complaints. Service was very good. Would definitely recommend.

They have great food, but I was appalled one day when I went in. Most of the time when I visited Pearls Place, I place orders to go. However, this time I was with my mom. My mom wanted to dine in so I wasn't aware of their clothing policy. When I asked for a table for 3, I was told my (3) year old son was not allowed to dine in due to the fact that he had on a white under armor shirt. The guy at the front told us they don't allow people to wear white shirts there. I thought that was ridiculous. Since that day, I have never been back! I completely understand it's their store policy, but for children? That's a bit much.

We arrived on a Sunday and they had about a 30 minute wait.  We deemed this was pretty reasonable for a soul food cafe and the after-church crowd that was gathering.  We were seated within 30 minutes and had a choice of the buffet or entree.  The buffet line was long, so we decided to order.  The buffet had a price of about $20-25 which again is reasonable and you were asked to finish one plate before going back and getting another one.  We went with the entrees and ordered ox tails and neck bones and potatoes.  I've had a taste for neckbones but it's not something my kids eat, so this was perfect.  We also ordered the vegetable sampler for $10 - which is really a sides sampler.  We wanted to sample a few different things.  We had mac and cheese, yams, greens and corn bread dressing.  The mac and cheese and yams were on point!  The greens and corn bread were great once we added hot sauce and gravy, respectively.  However, I like how the waitress put it: this didn't come out of your kitchen so it won't be seasoned to your likings.  We have to make it so it appeals to the vast majority.  We were so stuffed we couldn't order dessert.  Of course, we didn't finish everything we ordered.  We'd definitely go back.

The Smothered Pork Chops Are To Die For, seasoned well and so tender they melt in you mouth. The macaroni and cheese is awesome and the yams are delish. I eat here often and they cater my annual Christmas party for my 55 associates and THEY LOVE IT !!!

I was visiting from out of town and this place was recommended.  I am very happy it was. THE FOOD WAS DELICIOUS AND THE DESSERTS WERE OFF THE CHAIN!!!
I tried the sweet potato pie and Peach Cobbler and They were finger lickin good!  There is enough  variety to satisfy any palate at this Gem in the hood located near the Bronzeville Area.

The food is great...this review is based on the service. The waiters are great...the hostess are great...however the manager (white guy) is horrible.
