Rude...condescending.....and has totally made me never want to come here again. He treats his customers like they are doing you a favor when you dine. Not good business.

My boyfriend and I had a great experience at Pearl's.  The area is definitely sketchy but do not be discouraged. I was initially hesitant after reading the reviews, I went in expecting bad attitudes and a long wait at the omelette station but it was everything but ! Our server was pleasant and kept the water coming. We went on a Friday morning and opted for the breakfast buffet which was $10 and well worth it. My boyfriend was a fan of the biscuits, he ate them with no butter or jelly so it was that good! We will definitely return.

Food was delicious, I had the shrimp and grits then ordered the seafood platter to go, I asked that they bake it. And let me tell you it was wonderful for my sides I had macaroni and cheese and candied yams macaroni and cheese was flavorful it wasn't planned at all and it was absolutely delicious. I drove from Schaumburg just to eat there for the first time and I will definitely be coming back. Next time I will try the buffet. Sorry I didn't get any pictures of the food I think I ate too fast oh and the biscuits or fresh battery and just great.

When I came to Chicago this particular weekend, I was not sure what type of food that I wanted to eat this day. All I knew was that I wanted something authentic to Chicago and that tasted great. Well, I searched Yelp for some suggestions, and this place stuck out because it had Soul Food. Something that I have not had in a while so I decided to give this a try. When I arrived, the host was very friendly. 

Based on the looks on the inside of the restaurant, it looked like it used to be maybe a reception hall or a church, but they had it fixed up pretty nice. The buffet set-up was a little different than what I had expected because all of the food was covered and there were servers who served you the food. The servers were very polite and they did serve you generous portions of the food. That is always a plus! 

Now, for the part that you have been waiting for, the review of the food! The food was delicious!!! It had lots of flavor and really did taste like your grandmother from down south cooked the food! I had macaroni and cheese, neck bones, smothered pork chops, green beans, fried corn, and candied yams. These tasted phenomenal and I did not need to add or take away any seasoning. I even tried dessert. I had the lemon pound cake and it was the best lemon pound cake that I have ever had! 

The price for the food was very reasonable provided that you were going to eat your food in the restaurant. There is an additional fee of $5 if you plan on taking some food home with you. Also, there is a fee if you get more food than you can eat and have to throw it away. However, I can guarantee that you don't want to waste this food because it really is that delicious. You may want to just pay that extra fee in order to take it home with you! 

One more pointer......You can ask to sample a food item(s) before you commit to eating a regular portion of it. That is what I did and that's why I chose the dishes that I told you that were so delicious! I will definitely be coming back to this restaurant and bringing my family!

This is my first time eating here since the dining room renovation. The dining room is still under construction such as the bar area,  but it appears it will be smaller than what it was prior to the renovation. On to the next,  my wait time was no longer than 20 minutes on a Saturday morning which was not bad for dining for two. I opted not to do the breakfast buffet and order from the menu. I ordered the veggie omelet, grits and pancakes. The food was very basic, nothing out the ordinary at all. I was not impressed with the pancakes. They were very flat and dime sized, smaller than the size of a saucer. My grits were a little bit stiff and clumpy and I had to add quite a bit of salt to them for a decent taste. My omelet was loaded with veggies which I like and American cheese. I rate the food three stars but I up'd it one star because the service was good.
Sweet potato pie and biscuits is all I ever order and they are always perfect every time.

They say that good food is supposed to trigger a memory!! That is exactly what happened when my taste buds were blessed with the food from Pearl's Place. I was transported to 1995 at my Grandmother's dinner table in Ohio. The food at Pearl's Place is authentic Southern Soul Food. Everything here is homemade!! Many Soul Food Restaurants have "sold" out, by using can ingredients, and rushing their food (we can tell), but Pearl's Place did neither of the two. This food is amazing!!!!! The service was amazing!!! We had an amazing time!! Thank you Pearl's Place for an amazing dinning experience!

Awesome low-key comfort food. We had the breakfast buffet, well worth the $11. The chef and waitress were genuinely friendly and gave excellent service. The manager helped the chef out when the orders piled up and also went around to each table asking how everyone's breakfast was. The biscuits were the best part!!

When I first walked into Pearl's Place I was a little under whelmed I looked around and said to myself this is going to be a very disappointing experience.

Well, I'm happy to say I was wrong dead wrong!!!  The waiter and I hate I can't remember his name was great!  He explained the menu and the buffet options with a smile on his face the entire time.  He also was very attentive without hovering!  That was a major plus!!!

When you get to your table they bring you a free homemade cornbread and yeast bread with a side of butter!  It was three of us and the two servings they gave us was more than enough!

Now, the food OMG it was so good and flavorful!!! I went for the lunch but after hearing about the breakfast buffet I can't wait to go back!!!

I have gone to other Soul Food Restaurants and leave thinking I could have just stayed home and cooked myself but this place although I could have stayed home and cooked myself; I was glad I didn't because they were the real deal.  The sweet potatoes, the chicken, the collard greens and the Mac n' Cheese.  I swear I can taste it now, but I digress!  They also have a little salad bar and plenty more meats like turkey meatloaf, pork, turkey, and of a host of other veggies!  

Their buffet is a little different then other places; you do not touch the plates or the food!! You tell them what you want and they serve you!  I have to say at first I was like umm I think I know how to get my own food but when the waiter explained it was for health and safety reasons for the customers it did make me conjure up thoughts and times of people not washing their hands, sneezing, etc. at the traditional buffets that made a lot of sense.

You can go up as many times as you like but make sure when you are feeling stuffed don't head back up if you don't think you will finish your plate because they do have in writing that they can charge you for wasted food and/or have an extra charge if you want to bring your leftover homes.

The buffet also includes all you can drink but it is only one dessert per each buffet ordered!!! 

The prices of the buffet varies depending on if you go for breakfast, lunch, a weekday or weekend!!!  When I find out the correct amounts I will update my review!

They also have a regular menu but the buffet is the best value!
Good Food. Great Vibe. Wonderful Breakfast Buffet. But if you plan on Going on a Sunday, you better arrive Early.

You could literally not ask for a better buffet option. It's clean, fresh and made right in front of your eyes. Oh! And everything is delicious. The service is awesome and the owner is so nice! 

It's super inexpensive for the amount of food and service. They'll even give a to-go box for $1. 

Recommendations? The omelets, the rib tips, the fried chicken, the macaroni, the sausages, the bacon, the grits, the homemade biscuits... Oh! Just try everything! Seriously! 

Even though it was early, they put on a birthday celebration for my mom and friend. And they remember us. They remember everybody. A true class act of soul food and character. Go eat here because you know I will. (Sorry for all the exclamation points)

Not to be confused with Pearl's Southern Comfort located on the North Side, Pearl's Place is a hidden gem that "adventurous" Foodies must try!  I've passed by this place numerous times over the past 10 YEARS and in my "Bourgeoise" attitude, I cast this place as an anchor for a low-budget hotel.  I almost changed my mind about the low-budget Motel thing after I was served my scrumptious food!!

I was here today celebrating the 22nd Anniversary Birthday of my BFF and College Roommate and we were not disappointed.  I wanted to pick a spot for Brunch that she could select from Breakfast Special to Lunch Savory and I hit it.  I'm not sure how this place stays in business!  She had the Country Fried Steak w/ Grits, Eggs, AND Pancakes, and I wanted breakfast so I chose the Buffet Option.

First of all, I didn't realize that if you get the BUFFET, you can select from a personally made omelette, waffles, and pancakes [with the normal sides of grits, homemade potatoes, or rice], AND select from the "Soul Food" selection!!!!  I'm in Heaven!!  I got a omelette with veggies, mini-waffles, and CHICKEN from the soul food section!  B'day girl went for her fav - Country Fried Stead without gravy.  When her food arrived [and after my lingering conversation] she was able to cut that meat with little effort with a spoon!!  

Long story short, don't let the ambiance discourage you, this place is IT!!!!

I ate here one Sunday afternoon with a group of 12 because my father in law swore by this place. We didn't make reservations so being we had so many in our party, we had an hour long wait ahead of us. Was slightly frustrating, but it was VERY crowded so I kinda overlooked that. 
Once we were seated, the waitress was very attentive, informative, and personable without being an annoyance. The food was on point, and the ambiance of the joint paid homage to the great jazz and blues artists of the 40s, 50s, and 60s. Did i mention the parking was free? Which is a growing rarity in Chicago for restaurants. The cornbread had actual corn in it and was quite delicious I must say, and they serve breakfast all day which always gets extra points in my book. Location wasn't bad either, being about 2 blocks off the expressway.
My only real gripe was I felt the buffet was a little overpriced. $19 for all you can eat when the portions for the entrees that were off the menu were generous enough to fill you up anyway. For $18, I got an entree AND a dessert and walked outta there stuffed!!
The crowd and the wait was a bit annoying and long so I would suggest that you don't go there with small children or if you're in a rush, or if you're so hungry you have to eat immediately. 
Great spot to catch a bite with old friends or even for a first date.

Went there a couple of weeks ago. The food was good and Mark (our server) was great .  We didn't know what to get so we did the buffet.  It feels like a soul food joint down south. We used "NoWait" (seating app) so we were seated within 5 minutes ... otherwise we would've waited 30-45 minutes (it was a sunday afternoon). My only disappointment was the fried green tomatoes. They were breaded with Panko chips instead of your more traditional corn meal coating... they were ok but not what I expected after everything else being exactly what you'd expect from a good soul food joint. The shrimp and grits were amazing. 

I'd say it's a cool spot to check out. I'll definitely go back
Great food! The people here are very friendly. Nice family atmosphere. I recommend everyone to get the buffet to try all the tasty options.

There are many soul food restaurants in Chicago, but pearles place puts the soul in soul food Pearl Place is a hidden Gem with in the Historic Bronzeville Neighborhood. There service, Hospital, and most of all food is THEBOMB.COM 

When I went I was served by Vonja and she was on point she was sweet yet efficient and all ways anticipated my next need or want. I would ask for her by name. 

I had the Shrimp and grits which was delicious beyond measure.  It was absolutely a plate of Cheesy,  gooie goodness. I highly recommend that dish. They served hot cornbread that taste like it came out my gandma oven. 

All and All this a great establishment. You will love for Brunch. come threw and tell em MR BRONZEVILLE sent you. ;- !

Worst experience I ever had at a restaurant. Waitress offered us a lunch Buffett at the price of $10 then we got to the register and they said it was $15. I spoke with the waitress and she had the worst attitude and said "you know it's $14 right?" And rolled her eyes. I could not believe how I was treated. Then I spoke with the manager who talked to me as if I was a child and did not care to resolve the issue as well. He acted as if I was wrong for believing the price the waitress told me. The other manager made a joke of the whole thing while the staff laughed in our faces at the register. They don't care about customer service at all. I will never go to the place again. The food was bland and the meat was dry. Definitely not worth the trip. Chicago home of chicken and waffles is way better and has excellent customer service.

Went to the Sunday buffet. Took the train to get here and initially the area looks sketchy, but once you get to the restaurant everything changes. The atmosphere was nice, there were many people inside. The food was delicious, coffee was great and so were the servers. Pricing was fair for a flavorful buffet.
The way you get your food is different. You have to ask the chefs what you want, kinda like Chipotle. I didn't mind,  I. think this is to preserve food. Definitely a highlight of my trip to the Chi!

Get there in time for the breakfast buffet.  They shut the breakfast buffet down @ 1000. For $10 it is a hearty spread. I wore my thanksgiving pants & got my eat on! Parking is available in the motel parking lot. Although it may look like your doing the walk of shame, strut ya stuff & smile @ the people staring.

I think of myself as sort of an expert when it comes to soul food.  This place is for real.  Somebody in there has to be from South Carolina or Georgia or something.  This will definitely be a stop for me when I return to Chicago!
Amazing breakfast buffet. I have not had salmon croquettes in years and the ones here did not disappoint. Great atmosphere great food definitely a soul food gem

I am all about customer service, went in and they told us it would be a 15-20 minute wait. If I  may set the scene, there were no other parties waiting and there were about 5 -6 tables with folks eating and 15 free tables. The host had a very nasty condescending tone, will never visit again.
Wow, this place had so many food options! The buffet was hot and tasty. I probably had too much food, but I couldn't help myself. All of the home cooked meals reminded me of being down South.

We are from Florida and really enjoy Southern Food when we can catch it. We went to Bill Winston's church which was awesome and made reservations for lunch, although I am not sure reservations were needed. If you make reservations they charge your card a $50 non-refundable deposit....so please show up. 
The exterior and neighborhood was not as bad as we thought from the reviews. When we arrived everyone was very friendly and showed us to our reserved table. Mark greeted us and had been in the restaurant business for 40 years. He was very attentive to our needs and kept our glasses full of water, although he did forget to get my tartar sauce for my cat fish nuggets. But when I reminded him, he was quick to accommodate.  We chose the buffet instead of the menu . Being from the south we really enjoyed the fried chicken. We were all dissapointed by the dressing as it seemed that either pickles or vinegar was spilled in it. The catfish nuggets were ok, the yams were very good. The cornbread with butter were great texture, even displaying real corn kernels, but there was something missing..probably a little salt, because it did not taste like cornbread. The jerk chicken was good and seasoned well. The collard greens did not taste like greens of the South but they were good. The corn was excellent! The turkey loaf was ok...something a as missing.
For desert we got the chocolate cake with chocolate frosting, peach cobbler, sweet potato pie and the caramel cake. Thumbs up on the chocolate cake and the sweet potato pie (which was not too rich). The caramel cake was not moist and was very granular and hard. The peach cobbler had an overwhelming almond taste. Mark did replace the caramel cake and cobbler with sweet potato. 
Overall, we loved the service, everyone was very attentive. Mark was very nice and provided good service. The food was half and half, some good, some not so good.

Ok, since I enjoyed my food sooo much last time I had to make other trip. 
They really dropped the ball this time! I ordered the same exact food as last time except for the candied yams. Nothing tasted as I remembered it did. The pot roast tasted burnt & oily. The cornbread was hard & cold as if it had been sitting out, the greens also tasted oily & the macaroni was oily! What happened Pearl's??? Waste of $30 & probably will not return anytime soon, sorry

The breakfast buffet is delicious. I came here with a friend while staying at the amber inn and found the buffet style food to be truly comforting. I had an omelette which was made fresh for me on the spot along with some potatoes bacon ham waffles chicken and cornbread. For twelve dollars I was not dissapointed and would recommend this to anybody that needs a nice hardy southern style breakfast. 

Items that were delicious: the chicken and the waffles. Together, I felt joy.

The food is any soul food lovers dream. My spouse and I ended up at this restaurant by chance as another establishment we'd chosen had a wait time of 45mins for a party of 2. Again the food was GREAT as well as our server (her name escapes me); not to mention the rest of our time there. It was so great, I began to reconsider the venue for a dinner I'd host the next weekend for my grandmothers 80th birthday.

 Our current reservations were for an upscale restaurant in Tinley Park for a party of 15, however after my time here I felt my grandmother would appreciate the food here as a soul food connoisseur; most definitely a further drive from Three Oaks, MI but well worth it or so I thought. This place would not receive 5 stars from me with their current reservation policy. I've patronized an extensive amount of restaurants nationally and internationally as a travel agent. To be told by the restaurant mgr. that we'd have to pay everything up front for reservations without a private setting to say the least was absolutely absurd! I've managed 3 restaurants (all 3 stars and above) and what IS customary is to have the table prepped 30-45mins before group arrival and then to release the seats with group absence 30 minutes after no arrival. I neglected to inform him that I was also a restaurant manager but being argumentative wouldn't have changed either mind at this point. 

I will say however, to not tell a client what you believe is customary with opinions of unvalidated grandeur because "we have to be considerate of all of our guests", as he stated. To ask for nonrefundable money upfront sounds like the pitch at a burger joint, NOT at what I wanted to consider a 4 star place in a sketchy neighborhood; a hidden gem. I WILL be back but as a small party of 2-4. If my math serves me right, this establishment will miss out on an easy $325-350. Revisit your operations plan please. I'm sure I'm not the only prospective client to find your policies ridiculous.

What can I not say about Pearl's?!? The biscuits -amazing. Do yourself a favor and get the shrimp and grits (they'll put the bacon on the side if you're not a pork eater). Cheese eggs, French toast that needs NO SYRUP because it's simply delicious the way it comes out to the table. If I lived near here I'd be huge because the food is that good. 

Run, don't walk to Pearl's!

I went to Pearl's on yesterday.  I had the Fried Chicken, which is never a disappointment; the collards, which were okay; the cabbage, which was great, and the candied sweet potatoes for my first plate.   Then I went back for the smothered pork chops, which were cooked to perfection.  The gravy made the pork chops were succulent and tender.  The cornbread dressing was okay.  I had the red velvet cake was moist.  I love the flavor and texture.  It was good.  I, always, have the buffet and have never been disappointed.

OMG. Just simply delicious soul food! There is really no other way to put it. My dad and step mom were in town and wanted to have soul food after church on Sunday. Since it was Mother's Day I explained to them that it would be packed out, so they could expect to wait. My dad being the stickler that he is decides he wanted to wait the hour they'd given him.. I was a little weary because I had only been there one other time and though I was impressed with the food, there was a snafu with the customer service. Anyway, we decided to wait and we were not disappointed. Despite the crowd and the remodeling, everything at the buffet was readily available. Our waiter was extremely knowledgeable of the menu as well as very hospitable. The host/manager was personable and friendly. Overall it was a good experience and once we begin eating we soon forgot the hour long wait.  Me being a bread lover, I wish they gave you more of those rolls. I could buy a slew of them just to take home. Amazingly, ALL of the dishes were appetizing but my personal favorites were the Mac & cheese, the sweet potatoes and the potato salad. The pound cake was also quite tasty. I can't wait to go back and I am excited about what seems to be the makings of a full bar.
Disgusting food and even more disgusting service. Food had a dead bug in it. Called and spoke to owner who hung up on me. I will NEVER go back there. Find somewhere else to eat!!
What better way to start your day than breakfast at Pearls. The breakfast buffett is amazing with southern homestyle cooking in every bite.

Finally went here after a friend recommended it. Valentine's day, party of 2 was  under 35 minutes wait time. The place could use a renovation and update, and the ambiance is no frills at all. However, we were satisfied with the service. We were seated and a host told us how the ordering worked when we asked. My fiance and I had the brunch buffet. However, at 2 p.m. we chose not to wait in the slow line for any breakfast because no one was there cooking it anyway. The breakfast set-up looked like it needed to be cleaned because it had spilled food strewn all other where it was supposed to be prepared. Anywho, the line for food was extra slow. Once I finally made my way to get served, I noticed that some of the bean side dishes were dried out (red beans, and blackeye peas). Good thing I didn't want any anyway, so  I passed on it. Immediately, they sent out a small serving of cornbread that me and my hubby shared. I did get 2 pieces of fried chicken, a small taste of jerk chicken and turkey, a smothered pork chop, dressing, greens, macaroni and cheese, fried corn, catfish nuggets, rib tips and candied yams. I loved the fried corn! The chicken was decent and seasoned but, one piece could've been a little crispier. The catfish was ok, with a light crisp batter. I needed a little salt. The macaroni was decent with salt and pepper, nice and cheesey and browned on the top like I like it, you can taste the butter in it. The yams were good but, a tad too sweet for me but, good with nice flavoring. Greens were just ok, seasoned with sugar, which is not my personal preference. Rib tips, tasted baked with bbq sauce on top. Jerk chicken and turkey tasted baked too with a little jerk sauce, not really impressed. My pork chop was small and a little on the dry side with a thin gravy and no onions. The dressing was a real disappointment for me. I really was hoping it  would shine. It needed some help in the flavor department, it was bland. It needed sage, bell pepper, celery, salt, and onions and mine also had a crust that made it too hard to eat if I wanted to. Cornbread was, just ok. It has corn kernels in it but, I like mine a little sweeter. I left feeling full from fried chicken, macaroni, and fried corn. The buffet was $19, no drink or dessert included. They could use a better system of getting people served food faster. Food is cooked in smaller batches and you don't fix your own plate, it's kinda cafeteria style. A lot of food wasn't brought out that our server mentioned that was supposed to be there.They are a waste not, want not kind of establishment. Staff was friendly enough but, in general the place could use some improving in some areas. Free parking in the cheap motel next door that they share. However, I'd go back for the food but, not too soon.

The waiter's and service staff were incredibly nice and courteous they exhibited some of the best customer service I have experienced in a long time. The decor was a bit to be desired though, but the food was surprisingly good.

GIT ME SOME OF DIS AND SOME UH DAT.....
The food, not the venue, is clearly the draw at Pearl's Place. While the down-and-gritty Southern fare is honest, very delectable and reasonable, it is certainly in line with the all-American southern style of cooking. In 2014, Pearl's Place was voted one of the top 10 southern/soul-food restaurants in Chicago by Thrillist. The food is not an audacious departure from the usual Southern's judiciously sourced, self-righteously ethical ethos, but Pearl's Place feels as authentic as any venerable Dixieland food shack. Yee-haaww! We had some of dis....some uh dat and some more of this and dat! There were six of us from the Chicago Foodie Meet-Up group. Here is what we ordered, sampled and shared: (1) Smothered Short Ribs of Beef, (2) Smothered Fried Chicken (3) Smothered Baked Chicken, (4) Off-da-bone baked ham, (5) Wild fantail jumbo shrimp and (6) Farm-raised catfish. You can order their chicken three different ways: baked, fried or jerked.

They executed the smothered short ribs to perfection, which were succulent and beautifully charred. The meats were beautifully smoky and exceptionally tender with what we detected was a dry rub in copious black pepper. The baked chicken was just as succulent with a great caramel char around the edges delivering a smoky flavor. Sometimes restaurants focus more on the quality of meats or specialty fare, while the sides take a backseat, but this was not the case at Pearl's Place. In fact, the macaroni and cheese made with gobs of velvety cheese is like catnip for neo-rednecks, and 5-star worthy. The lush, creamy sauce clanged to the noodles and had some bite. Yow-zah, yow-zah! The superlative sides are the cheesy-cheddar grits topped off with jumbo fresh shrimp and crumbled real bacon, smothered cabbage, caramelized sweet yams and corn bread dressing with a classic buttery taste and an irresistibly emulsion of honey-butter. As we started eating, I began wondering if I would end up with more "junk in my trunk" than I had when I arrived. I plan to return for their breakfast buffet, and cannot wait to build upon the "junk in my trunk!"  ;D

We all agreed that the food is 4-star worthy, while the sides are awarded 5-stars! The cheesy grits and shrimp, corn bread dressing, macaroni and cheese are worth trying and are ethereal. Our favorite sides were (1) the corn bread dressing (2) the mac n cheese and (3) cheesy grits with shrimp. Pearl's offers breakfast, lunch and dinner buffets for a ridiculously low price. We decided to order off the menu. Buffet sharing is not allowed. The buffet changes daily. This is not your typical chicken and waffles joint. It has a very sparse, simple décor, and is not a pretentious restaurant.

I could swear (no, not the four letter word that starts with "F") that the sides, short ribs, smothered fried chicken and catfish recipes might have been passed down from granny-kins to daughter. The fried chicken is simply brined, floured and fried and is very succulent with a perfectly extra-crispy and nearly greaseless crust. The fried catfish was also exceptional, and coated in an expertly seasoned layer of a light cornmeal (I think). Service was very friendly, ebullient, adequate, but incredibly lackadaisical. Four stars for service. Deprivation is the mother of Chicago restaurant hype, but Pearl's Place is not a restaurant for dare devil diners only. However, familiar comfort foods are represented, too, rescued from ubiquity with a fresh approach. 

Pearl's Place executes moist fatty Southern-style chicken, plus succulent, beautifully charred short ribs exquisitely. If sweets are your jam, save room for dessert! The cobblers are light, fluffy, bright and refreshing. Five people ordered desserts. We tried the Georgia peach and Michigan apple cobblers with an exceptionally flaky crust, but somewhat thick and dense edges. They are all house baked, not overly sweet, surprisingly delicate and delectable. We also ordered the lemon pound cake, "guilt free" chocolate layered cake, and banana bread pudding. Three people rated their desserts with 4-stars while the remaining two rated their desserts with 5-stars. The 5-star desserts were: Georgia peach cobbler, and Banana bread pudding. Some of the desserts are old-fashioned American staples that you can almost picture "Dennis the Menace," with his silly grin and wide-blue eyes, swiping a slice of chocolate cake. Pearl's Place might look like a good place to get sloppy drunk, but the food here tells another story. Now, can I get an AMEN!!!

I don't write many reviews but Pearl's deserve one ..... A very bad one, at that!!!!! I had to walk out after waiting 18 minutes while the restaurant was 50% full! 

So, one of two things were going on with this restaurant: they don't respect peoples time/ $$ or they have no clue on how to run a restaurant. This restaurant has two speeds ......slow & super slow wait staff moving with no urgency, absent bus staff and bad management. 

Pearl's can't handle a busy Sunday brunch..... This is my second time there just to give it another assessment.... Same result!!!!! The food is NOT worth the wait or management style. 

I told the manager my issues and he stated you will only been waiting 18 mins....likewise, he stated I could sit people but my wait staff isn't prepared to service you. 

This hurts since this is a black business that I a writing a negative review. SAVE YOUR $$$ & TIME!!!!!!

I've been twice and my experience was similar both times. The space is very large. It's a nice interior with some thoughtful decor. Both times I was there, there were just a handful of tables. The service was good both times. They walk you through the ordering process if you aren't familiar and both times, our server made recommendations based on the fact that I was there with people who had never been. 

The first time I went, there were two of us and we ordered a pound of snow crab, pound of headless shrimp, pound of crayfish and smaller portion of sausage. We thought that sounded like a ton of food, but we ate all of it in it's entirety. I did wish there was a bread or in this case, I probably should have ordered fries to soak up the delicious liquid that had accumulated in the bottom of the bag. For the two of us without drinks, we spent $60. In retrospect, for two people, you might be better off doing the combo.

The second time I was there was with a large group, including a toddler. It was a ton of fun for a group of people. I definitely recommend going with people you are very comfortable with. This isn't a blind-date kind of place. You need to be prepared to tear apart limbs, suck liquid out of a crayfish head, lick your fingers and leave smelling like you rolled in garlic. Sounds delicious, right?! It was. The food was vibrant. The flavors were bold with a kick. I crave it now. It's also a lot of fun to do something a little interactive and different for dinner. Both times I went, I left thinking about how scrumptious the food was and how much I can't wait to go back.

Ordered thru GrubHub and paid thru my credit card.
One of the worst experiences I've had with a restaurant.  A sequence of things to go wrong 
1st, a lady from the restaurant called me which she could barely speak English, telling me that they didn't have the fresh crawfish that I ordered thru the app. They only had the frozen one that was $5 less by the pound. 2nd I asked her how I can be reimbursed my $5, she said she didn't know that I would have to call GrubHub then she said I would have to cancel the order.  In which I could not do thru the app. Alright whatever it's only $5 so I told her to proceed with the order. 3rd, We receive our order, the crawfish came too spicy to eat, dripping with oil- not what I ordered I asked for medium spice.  Absolutely disgusting and could not be eaten due to unbearable spice level. To the garbage it goes.  Go to the  Angry Crab instead, they have better service and quality food.

Just tried to order delivery.  The guy on the phone doesn't know how to run a credit card.  Spent 10 minutes on the phone, after he asked for all of my personal information and still couldn't manage to process my cc.  Absolutely ridiculous.  Unfortunate because I've heard the food is great, but I have to say that the service is horrendous.  

Btw...  He double charged my card, and I never received my food.  When I tried to call back, the phone was busy.  Wtf kind of restaurant is this???

Oh my goodness! They top all the seafood restaurants I have ever been to. In. My. Life. And they have really really great prices. Truly affordable. And the restaurant is super clean. And the food was very fresh-tasting. And it was well-seasoned. I thoroughly loved this place. It just seemed as if it was in an out-of-the-way location.

Tried this place out for the first time and gotta say I was very pleased. We ordered combo #2(comes with curly fries also!) with all 3 seasonings at medium spice. We also got the garlic edamame which was mind blowing! Get it!

Place is very clean. Service was great and food came fast. No lines like Angry Crab. Probably because we were super early maybe at 6:30pm? Either way, ! I would've given them 5 stars if the crayfishees were fresher. Had some that didn't taste too fresh off the boat. 

Would definitely go back again though!

Yum, yum, yum, yum!! Came in here this weekend after a long day shopping Andersonville with my boyfriend. He's allergic to seafood, and it's my all time favorite--which you can imagine is a nightmare 9 times out of 10. 

The restaurant is much bigger than I imagined, but we came in pretty early(4:30ish?) so it wasn't overly crowded. Our server explained the whole menu and pointed out the items my boyfriend could choose from. Surprisingly there were more options for him than I expected. 

I tried snow crab legs and clams in the mixed seasoning at medium heat. Man oh man, was it yummy! Buttery, perfectly spiced seafood goodness. The one complaint if any is that the tables weren't wrapped with paper, so I felt like I made a huge mess after. Again, not a big thing, just something to keep in mind! My boyfriend had the garlic edamame, crazy wings, and Cajun fries and thoroughly enjoyed everything.

Could it be?! A seafood spot we can actually both enjoy?? YIPPIE, will definitely be returning soon.

Generous portions and good spices.

Garlic edemame, fried calamari and oysters are great.

$38.00 worth food was  served in a double plastic bag. Owner might confused that patrons  were homeless or domestic animals?
Food was not bad,  but that kind of service and presentation will lead to the close down sooner than later

I didn't know what to expect.  I've seen Cajun places on shows but never in person.  This is a seafood place with Cajun flare.  Tell you the truth it wasn't half bad.  Is it authentic?  I've never been to Louisiana so I couldn't tell you but it was pretty good.  The staff is super nice since they just opened. I think the simplicity of their menu drives down the prices but keeps the quality pretty good.  

I'm going to go back for more and update my review when I've had a little bit more of the menu.   Bring friends lots of them.  From what I've seen about Cajun eating it's about getting your hands dirty ( and they will ) and talking up a storm.

So I'm a big fan of Angry Crab in West Rogers Park, but not as big a fan of their lonnnng lonnnnng wait times.  I just moved in with my boyfriend in Uptown, and we saw an ad for Crazy Crab #1 in the DNAInfo Chicago, Uptown periodical that gets delivered to our place, with a 10% off coupon.  We headed over for dinner last weekend, and was extremely surprised at how large the space was once we were inside.  We were seated promptly and provided waters and drinks (this place is NOT BYOB, but has a limited assortment of mostly domestics and some wines on the menu). 

We ordered the garlic edamame, two pounds of snow crab legs, one pound of head-on shrimp, and two corn cobs, all in the medium spiced mixture of their there sauces.  We also ordered two sides of white rice to soak it all up.  The food took a little bit to come out (although I was starving, so it probably just seemed longer to me), and the edamame we got first was REALLY good. Like SUPER garlicky and buttery and well seasoned. A great start to the meal. We got our seafood and rice shortly after, and overall the seafood quality was very good - the shrimp were fatty and the snow was nicely sized.  The sauce that they came in was really well flavored and pretty spicy (it builds up, don't say I didn't warn ya!).  Overall a really good and tasty meal.  They don't do the butchers paper on the table here, instead they serve a pail for shells and you get plates, which made it a little harder to eat since the snow crab legs completely took over the plate, but it's a small complaint.

Super excited that this is in my hood now - I will definitely be back again to devour more succulent seafood boil!

I came here on a Sunday night for dinner with my family and there were only a few occupied tables. The waitresses seemed inexperienced and/or new because whenever we asked them a question they were unsure and had to refer back to their manager. However they were nice and kept checking up on us to refill our waters. we mixed the Cajun and lemon sauces for all our seafood, which turned out pretty good. We ordered shrimp, king crab, and Dungeoness crab and it was delish. My only complaint would be that the fried seafood batter (fried oysters and fried squid) was too mushy.

A couple of crab shacks of the Louisiana/Cajun/you'll-need-fire-hose-afterward kind have been popping up recently, most notably The Angry Crab on Lincoln just north of Bryn Mawr. The latest one, Crazy Crab #1, has landed in a hilariously-nondescript strip mall on the southwest corner of Lawrence and Clark, just behind an Italian-inspired cafe. It's so tucked away you're more likely to find it under a bed sheet. Only the squished-together font of the restaurant's sign makes it slightly noticeable. This is beyond "blink-and-miss-it." Send out a search party, complete with bloodhounds, and you still might not find it. 

Odd thing, that. Because once you zone in on Crazy Crab #1 and walk through the front doors, you find a unique, Asian-Cajun-fusion that's really fun and inventive. And also damn good. 

It's also worth noting that the space is huge. Like, it could easily seat 100 without breaking a sweat. Given its facade, I'd swear this damn thing's a TARDIS. 

Crazy Crab breaks down the menu by what's live and what's fresh. You have choices of everything from mussels and clams to lobster tails, head-on (or -off) shrimp and lots and lots of crab. Whole crabs. Soft shell crabs. Blue crab. Snow crab legs. It's Bubba Gump-esque, the crab love. 

Sides are plentiful -- a basket of fries comes out as an amuse bouche -- along with the typical boil fare of potatoes, sausage and corn. My girlfriend, who runs her own annual crawfish boil, groused about a lack of mushrooms, which suck up all the boil spices like a sponge and give people (even vegans, those poor saps) something tasty to snack on. And I would agree, but not for the boil spice. 

No, Crazy Crab #1's goodness comes from its three sauces offerings, potent-garlic-and-spice-filled concoctions that will make you want to bathe in them, licking your lips be damned. 

The sauces include a traditional-yet-perfect garlic butter and a well-balanced "Crazy Cajun" with just the right amount of cayenne and paprika. But it's the lemon pepper that outshines them all. Tangy and garlicky with a earthy kick of black pepper that just augments anything it touches. We ordered the lemon pepper for our clams, which came as part of Combination #1, a great introduction to the restaurant that also included crab legs and head-off shrimp, corn and potatoes. Each came in a separate bag, swimming in saucy goodness. After inhaling most of the clams, I started scooping out what remained of the lemon pepper sauce to ladle onto my seafood fried rice (chuck full of shrimp and mussels. A great side. Highly recommend).

And don't worry, the rest of the seafood is just as good. Perfectly cooked. Quick delivery. Ready to be cracked open and devoured. A roll of paper towels sits on every table for good measure. Don't be ashamed. Go to town. Revel in the mess. 

As typical with restaurants that rely on good word of mouth in lieu of foot traffic, the owner came out and asked us how our meal was. And if I wasn't basking in the wake of this meal, teeth still gnashing the last of the shrimp and potatoes, mouth coated in sauce like some sloppy vampire, I would have told him to take these sauces, bottle them open and start selling them. Online, at outdoor food markets, grocery stores -- I don't care. Then he could move from this spot and find a locale with decent signage.

Visited this place last weekend.  We came right after opening and we were the only ones there.  The restaurant is very spacious and all the tables are neatly arranged and are equipped with the big buckets for shells, bibs, crab cracker tools, and a big roll of paper towels.  We decided to go with the first combo for $39.99.  It was definitely worth it and you get a lot for your money.  It's a great size for 2 people to share.  It came with Cajun fries, wings, and a bag filled with shrimp, crab legs, clams, corn, and potatoes lathered in the Cajun sauce.  Everything was delicious!  I plan to go back and maybe get a whole bag of whole shrimp just for myself!  Maybe try a different seasoning as well =)

Awesome food and awesome service! The owner comes to your table and greets you! The service was great and fast! Definitely going back love the 3 mix seasonings and spicy.....mmmmm!

Going back for the Alaskan crab and green mussels!
Awesome food at reasonable prices. Great owner who is vocal and hardworking. Great service.

There are a couple of things wrong that prevent Crazy Crab from competing with other restaurants of this genre around Chicago.

1. The seasonings were weak compared to the other places. I got all three flavors at medium spice level(2nd highest). I couldn't distinguish any of them and there was NO spice at all. The only thing I could taste was garlic. And maybe the recipe changed from when I had it because although another reviewer said it was salty, I found it to be disastrously under-seasoned.

2. The sausage they use is TERRIBLE for this application. Other places like Angry Crab and Lowcountry use a dense pre-cooked sausage that maintains it's integrity, but this place seem to use a raw Italian sausage style that water-logs and the casing turns into a rubber band that you have to peel off in order to make it edible.

3. I don't know what caused this, but I like to order head on shrimp because by the shell being  un-breached, the meat is a LOT more juicy and succulent compared to the headless shrimp which losses it's moisture during the cooking process. At Crazy Crab the heads were hanging off of the bodies as if they were cut before hand, making the meat more dry than expected. If you were the type to suck out the head juice, that would make this completely pointless.

4. They sent me an undercooked blue crab that was still cold in the middle. I didn't make a fuss about it because it was cheap and I didn't even know how to eat the damn thing but it's still was pretty weird.

I won't judge the fact that the drinks were limited to 3 products considering it was a soft opening, but it's important to note that this isn't a full blown creole/cajun place so don't expect the traditional offerings like beignets or cornbread, at this point it seems to be a stripped down seafood spot. It's cool to be in this neighborhood, but personally If I need a boil that bad I'd much rather go to one of the other places in the city.

Food:
This is my first experience with eating seafood straight from the bag but the other people with us were from California and this Asian Cajun concept is big out West and they said that this restaurant was a lot better than some of the restaurants that they've been to, which is a really good sign for this new restaurant. The portions are big and the flavors were so tasty. You definitely have to order the garlic edemame...you'll be licking your fingers after because it is so delicious. I had the snow crab legs & crawfish and mixed all 3 flavors together...the sauces together were amazing...I took the bag home with me and plan on making garlic noodles for lunch tomorrow. This is a great addition to our Ravenswood neighborhood; definitely visit this place and then head over to Bella M Brianna next door after for Italian coffee and dessert!

Service & Ambiance: 
Great service, food came out pretty fast. Ambiance is clean, casual, nautical themed decor. We went with 3 families with young children and a baby. Not too loud in there; my baby slept in her stroller next to our table. Can't wait for their bar/lounge to open with cocktails!

Got head on shrimp, mussels, clams, and king crab legs. All medium spice level and mixed three sauces. 

Wasn't spicy at all. Only tasted butter. 

One star for decent service, though some servers were trainees. One star for fresh shrimp / clam / mussel. The king crab legs were soggy. Not worth the try.
Food is very fresh with the amazing taste. Everyone should go try it. The crawfish is my flavor one

Food sucks, bad service. I had to go to the bathroom for whole night and take medicine for stomach. The waitress pretend as if she is my boss and want me to order more food. I understand why they are no people at that restaurant. I'm never going back again.

I had a great experience here the other night!  The food was delicious!  We got the combo #2, the lobster, and edamame which was all fantastic.  The service was really good as well.  My one gripe is that the bar selection was kind of limited when it came to the beers.  I'll definitely be going back.
Great service, flavor doesn't penetrate through the seafood shells  -___- I guess its pretty decent for a new place in Chicago bur the sauce could be better
Day two in a row eating crazy Cajun shrimp and mussels. So addicting! Nice little bar too- have me a very healthy pour of wine! Very nice folks working there as well!
The precious memories of crazy crab are archived.it was the best serviced and fresh seafood. i will be back!
I want to say #CRAZYCRAB #1 its a must Try!! A combination of Lousiana and Cajun food its what makes it bit different and UNIQUE!! the food and service were GREAT!!

I loveeeee the food. From the appetizers(fried calamari & Cajun fries) to the main and live foods( lobster& the headless shrimp) the service was unbelievably fast and I'm dyin to go back  looks like I am crazy for crazy crab !

I've been to two other of crab places on the Northside and so far I like Crazy Crab #1 the best. The seafood was fresh and the three varieties of sauce were all distinctly different. We had the #1 sampler, the seafood fried rice and the chicken wings. Also they bring you free spicy curly fries. Wouldn't change a thing. The space is also very large and modern. Excellent addition to Uptown.

I have hopes that this restaurant will go through the growing pains associated with a new restaurant and get its act together. Crazy Crab does have potential but I'm going to wait at least two month before I return. 
The biggest problem was I was never sure who our server was, and the servers seemed to just walked around the dining room carrying food with blank looks on their faces as if they were not sure which table to bring the food.
I had the headless shrimp which were pretty good, a couple were on the "tough" side. Two of my table-mates had the same thing and said that they were all on the "tough" side. Someone in the kitchen was probably not paying attention to the timing as that's a sign of overcooking the shrimp. You really need to be careful with shrimp (as well as most seafood). The garlic edamame was very good.
The beer and wine lists are not very inspired. With the glut of local breweries out there to choose from, they could do a lot better than "312" as the only local representative. Then if you're a wine drinker, you have only a choice of red or white (one of each). There is also a small menu of mixed and soft drinks.
I want to like this place since it's in my neighborhood, and I enjoy this new low-country style of food. But of the four of us who dined there last week, I'm the only who intends to return.

Not bad at all. I still prefer Low Country but the seafood is fresh.  When I asked for head off I was assuming the shrimp were at least deveined.  Nope..........Jut missing the head. But flavors were good. Spice level 2 really not that spicy.  Had the muscles  and shrimp so limited perspective.

Amazing tender and fresh Alaskan King Crab!! So messy but so fun at the same time!! Super staff to match the great food. Make sure those hands are clean, because you'll definitely be licking those fingers!! You won't be disappointed, I promise!!

This is a great place for seafood. Try the crawfish and the head on shrimp. You eat with your hands so it gets a bit messy but the two hand wash stations are centrally located. Also they do takeout and delivery. Not to be missed!
The food is good and Harry is very friendly and helpful. The price is reasonable and the space is big and nice. This is the best sea food I've had in Chicago!

I ordered the combo #3 for delivery. There was no sausage, but more importantly they only gave me two small crab legs. I called and the gentlemen on the phone told me crab is very heavy. Bullcrap!They sent me the sausage with more corn and potatoes. Great... Where's the $100 in seafood I ordered. If you are going to eat here, I highly recommend not getting delivery, they will take advantage of you.

Great food. Price is very fair. I expected our 3 lb live lobster to be close to 75 and our total bill was 110 with multiple courses sides and drinks. Lots of space inside. Definitely a place to check out.

I don't really understand the bad reviews here. My fiancé and I went in for dinner and could not have been more thrilled with the food. Flavors are out of this world! I recommend the Cajun medium was just enough spice! We tried king crab, snow crab and lobster tail all were amazing and don't hesitate to order the the wings! They were ridiculous - perfectly crisp with Cajun spice! Food came out fast and servers were attentive, friendly and helpful! Yes the menu is limited and beverage choices are limited but this is a soft opening people! There is much more to come and I will be back to roll up my sleeves and enjoy it all!!!!

Loved our experience here. The food was great and the service was attentive. We initially chose this place because we didn't feel like waiting for a long time at Angry Crab. We Walked right in, and the place looks nice too. We had head on shrimp, snow crab legs, potatoes, corn, and Cajun sausage. We did garlic butter and lemon pepper and mild seasoning but it was spicy enough. The food came right out and it was very tasty. Crab meat was easy to get out and the flavor was great. I highly recommend the place. Especially if you want this kind of food without waiting for a long time!
Filling a hole in the neighborhood! Food was delicious and reasonably priced. We will be coming back!

Four of us came for dinner - two ordered the $39 combo meal of shrimp, crab legs, mussels, potato and corn - which also comes with six chicken wings.  They chose the spicy sauce - medium. Shrimp were good, many of the mussels had detached from the shell and had to be fished out of the overly buttery sauce in the bag. Crab legs were fine but the only utensils available were the metal shell crackers, a fork and a red tool that was supposed to help get the meat but was difficult to use - and we had to ask for that. 
Third diner ordered green mussels and the 5oz lobster tail on the garlic sauce - medium spiciness. Mussels were tasty and large. Lobster was two small tails instead of one large 5oz tail - not as flavorful as expected. 
My meal - the crawfish - was a disappointment. I had no tool available other than my fingers to get the meat out of the claws and tail. The tails were small and very difficult to get the meat out. The one pound serving came with about 15 crawfish. I ate three and stopped because I was not able to get the meat - this after asking the server for a different tool and being given the red thing that looked like a staple remover with a handle. I ordered mine spicy - medium. As with our other meals - the ratio of butter to sauce was way too high. 
I brought home my uneaten crawfish meal for my college age son - who will eat anything - and even with the small metal forks we have at home he found that they were too much work for the effort. Ended up throwing out most of my meal. 
Two of us ordered a side of garlic pasta for $5.00. I swear it was Lipton Pasta-Roni that you can buy from Jewel for 75¢. 
Service was slow.  Our server disappeared at the end of our meal - we had to flag down someone else to get a bag for my meal and our check. 
If you are reading reviews - like we did - to decide if you will go. Please take a careful look at the 5 star reviews. At least four of them are from people who have been on Yelp for about three months before their review of Crazy Crab - and Crazy Crab is one of two reviews they have written.  I would have given CC two stars - for the mussels - but to have people write fake five star reviews to bump your rating is bad form. 
If you haven't guessed - unlike the 5 star reviewers - we will not go back.
Crazy crab #1 is the best seafood restaurant in Chicago. i never seen amazing seafood restaurant like this before in my life

This is the first time I've eaten at a restaurant that serves Crab Broils.  Typically I don't like crab legs only because I don't like working so hard for my food.   I'm a foodie, so I just wanted to try it as an experience. The Cajun seasonings are great.  Everything was pretty good (Crab Broil), except for the fried shrimp which were very mediocre.  Very nice staff and fast service.

Was super excited for this place to open. Finally tried it. Food was good but portions very small! If they can get the portions right then this place will be very good!! Owner very nice but slipped up and said they weigh the crab while still frozen which makes no sense because of ice factor!!!
Damn good seafood. The place is new and  service is pretty good as well. Super fresh seafood and great taste!

The food was delicious! I had the king crab legs with garlic butter and potatos, yumm.  The staff was very nice and attentive.  Went at an off time on a Sat and it was quite before the evening rush so it you want to go when it is not too crowded try 4pm on Sat.
Went there for dinner last night- food was really good and staff very friendly and attentive! Great addition to the neighborhood!

As i am typing this review i can still smell the spices on my finger, this is by far the best Cajun seafood restaurant in the Midwest. Although they were really busy but service and wait time were great. The seafood are fresh,  flavoring was on point. We ordered everything on the menu and everything taste fresh! Great environment, great taste and reasonable price, and excellent service.This place is amazing, definitely make your taste bud go crazy. Cant wait to go back.

Decide to try Zia's for brunch and it was a good choice. The menu is small but robust with some standards and some intriguing options. We tried one standard Crab Cake Benedict and one intriguing Stinky French Toast.

The Crab Cake Benedict was delicious. The cakes were the perfect size and full of crab meat not filler. They were a nuce carrier for the eggs and holindaise. They were  accompanied by crispy bacon, toast and lyonnaise potatoes. The potatoes were OK not great, but rounded out the dish nicely.

I had a bite of the Stinky French Toast, and it was delicious. I prefer savory breakfast items and so I tend to avoid pancakes, french toast etc. This dish was really well balanced a bit more savory with a hint of sweet. The Stinky part was a mixture cheeses in the sauce between the layers of French Toast.  It was a really unusual and delightful combination.  I was happy to try. I really enjoyed my dish so maybe next time...

Cute spot in a nice neighborhood with strong drinks

Ordered: Flatbread pizza (forgot what kind), jack Daniels/sour

DRINKS: I ordered simple whiskey sours with jack Daniels and these were very, very strong. And consistently so. It wasn't like the bartender accidentally overpoured. Each one was as strong as the last. And very, very good.

FOOD: The flatbread came out hot and fast. And the crust was nice and crispy. 

ATMOSPHERE: A dressy casual place with an open bar space that facilitates interaction. The place seemed to be pretty deep in, but i only stayed in the bar area.

My boyfriend and I come here often all the way from the West suburbs. Here's why, portions are large and perfect, interior is gorgeous and the food is absolutely delicious. 

We have been here a number of times, and we have had pretty subpar waiters and some really great ones. Food and service generally is nice and fast. Especially our last visit, we had a really sweet waiter I believe his name was Jake? 

The food has never been a miss, the bread and spreads that come out are delicious, they give u cheese with the olive oil- they get it! Another all time favorite of ours that we typically share is the butternut squash raviolis- yuuuum! The meatballs are also really great a must try.

I say this place is defiantly worth a visit, one of our favorite Italian places in the city!

Zia's Lago Vista was our dream wedding venue! They brought our ideas to life and were there every step of the way to make our day perfect. Ryan N, Ryan A and Emily were so helpful and accommodating with every request. Ryan N went through every decoration and idea with me with such patience... I can't thank him enough!! If you're looking for an elegant and rustic venue with AMAZING food... Zia's Lago Vista is it!!

I dined at Zia's Lago Vista for a baby shower during Sunday Brunch. Obviously, since I was there for an event, there was a set menu. 

Ambiance first, it was lovely! I didn't realize how big the place is. 

Service was awesome! There were about 50+ people in our party and my glass was always re-filled without asking! 

The food was yummy! To start off, we dined on a couple of different salads; the Capri (tomato, mozzarella, prosciutto, and roasted peppers w/ a vinaigrette)and the Zia Pena (mixed greens, pears, tomato, walnuts w/ a honey mustard dressing). Both were tasty, but I just love a traditional Capri salad! Next, we had the bananas foster french toast...it came with ice cream and bacon...YUMMMM!!!! Definitely a favorite of mine...I mean, who doesn't want some ice cream with their breakfast?! :) We also had some potatoes, omelettes, etc. The french toast is what sticks out though!!! :) 

I look forward to going back and sampling more of the menu and taking advantage of the unlimited Bloody Mary's for $12 during brunch!

Went with a friend. Standard italian food in a beautifully decorated place. Lovely outside patio with lovely lighting etc. Totally romantic.  Food was good. Not outta this world good but good. 
I had the seafood over linguine. This was tasty, the linguine a tiny bit softer than my expectations. I prefer a tender pasta with a bite to it.  The seafood variety was lovely with mussels, calamari, shrimp. Decent. 
Tasty desserts too: Tiramasu was good but the apple gallette (spelled wrong, sorry)  was absolutely delicious; flakey tender crust surrounding sliced baked apples with ice cream on top. Delicious and worth repeating. 

Service was fine. The server was training someone but he informed us immediately when he came to our table about it and asked if that was alright.  Of course it is.  They were attentive and sometimes too attentive but fine.  We were NOT rushed out, stayed for quite some time just talking and drinking our cocktails. 

The only annoyance to the restaurant were a few flies/gnats in the corner were we were seated. They were coming and going. My friend and I had to keep waving them off every 15-20 minutes or so. That was a pain. I swear it wasn't us as were were cleanly showered and smelled so fresh! :-)  

I would come to this place again  for some standard dishes at dinner because its conveniently located, gorgeous inside and just a lovely ambiance to the restaurant.

The place was a pigsty.  Tables everywhere that weren't cleaned up from previous customers.  Come on!  Clean up those tables!!  Bar was the same way.  Service lousy, no bread, no water.  Food was "ok" not great.  He staff wasn't overly busy and the restaurant wasn't that busy either.   I never judge a place on my 1st time.  But....this was my 2nd.  Both were like I described.  There won't be a 3rd.  They might be a good restaurant....in Appleton Wisconsin.

Huge fan, came here with the girlfriend a couple weeks ago and immediately couldn't wait to return (which i've since done so). 

I got the house specialty pasta the first time - the Rotolo - which was absolutely incredible. Two circles of tri-colored pasta wait sausage and this incredible house sauce which was the highlight of the dish. Susage, spinach, and a three cheese sauce. 
I'd get it again in a heartbeat.

We also returned for brunch with some friends. I will say, the only negative thing, the service was pretty poor. Despite open tables, we weren't seated for a long time. I can appreciate trying to place people outside, but when there are plenty of open tables all around maybe just ask us if we'd rather be seated sooner.
Regardless the food was amazing and the setting superb. Seriously, the whole place will remind you of an Italian villa. 
Also, portions are huge, definitely provides leftovers.

Looking forward to my next meal at Zia's.

I went to Zia's Lago Vista for a belated birthday dinner with my parents. The entrance doors are enormous and they are very similar to fortress doors. They had to have been a foot thick and 10 feet tall! Zia's had a dark, cozy ambiance. It was almost too dark at times. We had to illuminate our phones in order to properly read the menu. 

I ordered a bottle of the Bricco Riella, which was their Moscato. I'm not usually a wine drinker, but this wine was quite good. I tend to prefer sweet wine, and this Moscato did not disappoint.

The starter bread was warm and fresh, and they served homemade giardiniera, olive oil,  and Parmesan cheese to go with the bread. Our party had to be careful to not fill up on the bread! That always seems to be a challenge at an Italian restaurant. 

I ordered Bruschetta as an appetizer as I always do when at an Italian restaurant. It was satisfactory - warm toasted bread, tomatoes and fresh mozzarella. For my main course, I ordered the Vitello Caluzza, which included Veal, sun-dried tomatoes, peas, goat cheese, white wine and garlic angel hair. The veal was a little chewy and fatty. I was disappointed that the veal wasn't as tender as some of the other veal dishes I've had in the past. Despite this, it was a good mixture and the dish was satisfactory. 

Our waiter was energetic and fun. I enjoyed his charismatic nature. He seemed rushed but that's expected on a Saturday night. He entered in one of the orders incorrectly, but quickly rectified the situation. He comped our dessert dishes. I got the chocolate pate and it was one of the richest desserts I've ever had. 

I enjoyed my experience at this restaurant, and I am happy we tried it!

Got "the squad" together for brunch here on a Sunday and I don't think there was a single thing about Zia's we didn't just love. The bottomless Mimosas/Bloody Mary bar set the mood and it just got better. Everything we ordered was delicious, and yes, one of our number had the stinky cheese french toast. It was amazing.

The atmosphere was gorgeous, and the waitstaff was very friendly and attentive. For the first half of the meal I kept thinking "After this mimosa, I'm going to switch to a bloody mary." Finally I had to get up for the bloody mary bar regardless of my glass level, because the waiters never let it get close to half-empty. Now that's a brunch-lover's dream.

Additionally, we brought a couple with a 9-month-old here, and we had no trouble accommodating the baby with a high-chair. The kitchen was also happy to send us a plate of scrambled eggs for him to "eat" (and by "eat" I mean delightedly squish with his hands and smoosh around the plate. But I'm pretty sure some of it ended up in his mouth, too.)  Anyway, point was it was family friendly.

They also had a parking lot outside (assuming you're safe to drive after all those cocktails.)

This is what I want lunch to be. 

-Bloody Mary "Bar": they make the bloody mary for you, you add the spice and you skewer of accouterments. 
- Endless Mimosa Deal: it's incredible. $12 with the purchase of your entree.

The menu is pretty expansive, I ordered the breakfast pizza (which was divine) and my partner ordered Brennan Eggs (he scarfed down quickly). 

The patio area is lovely for brunch, while the inside is dark and cozy for an intimate dinner (or an intimate dinner of 12, this place is ginormous) 

I will be coming back with groups in the future!

Not sure how to start...very dark, extremely slow service, adequate food. 

We were seated at 6:25pm, food didn't arrive at our table until 8pm! No, I wasn't sitting there boozing and pushing off the waiter (you know me too well)! We were begging...for bread...for water...for Parmesan...for our appetizer...for our meal. The waiter (Joe) told us the restaurant was understaffed for the night. Ok Captain Obvious, but not a single employee in there was "rushing" around. The busboy would amble by and totally miss our water re-fill. We had to call him over. Three times. On one of those re-fills, he just skipped one of the diners. So two of us got more agua, the third had to hope he'd wander by again!

Waited a half hour to place our order, another HOUR for food to arrive. That's crazy. The ladies restroom had four stalls with a single stall in working order. That's crazy. 

The food was piping hot, when it finally arrived, with average tastiness. That, plus Joe being well spoken, rates this place two stars. Otherwise, me and my two 20 something kids kept saying...what a mistake! Why'd we stop HERE?!?  We honestly almost got up and walked out a couple of different times during the 90 minute wait.

We came here for our sons birthday, he's been there before and wanted to go. He's 12 so he doesn't really know food yet. Zia's has a gorgeous restaurant and outside which we sat in and the people working were very nice. 

The food...well in a city full of italian restaurants I'd rate it near the bottom. None of our meals were good, my girlfriend has been here before and always said it wasn't that great, but I had to see for myself. I'd prefer Olive Garden and no I'm not being a joker. I'd probably come back if they had happy hour for apps and drinks, but that's about it.

Zia's is amazing. End of story! 

I've been there for brunch after recommendations from several friends, and it was amazing. The bloody mary bar and mimosas were amazing. The food is just outstanding. I had the stinky french toast, which I dream about to this day. It is the best french toast I have had in my life. My friends had the steak and eggs, and the chicken and waffles--both amazing. It is a great deal for brunch with amazing food and drinks. I will be coming back for brunch and checking out dinner.

This place has great service, great brunch, and better drink specials. I have had Paris as a server the past two times and she is the greatest. She's friendly attentive and knows how to keep a conversation with patrons. 

The menu isn't huge here for brunch but the food on it is great. The first time I came I had to get the eggs Benedict because how can you not. They were great but I had the biggest food envy and had to get the breakfast pizza the next time I came. I highly suggest the breakfast pizza but nobody in my groups were unhappy with any items. 

But people let me tell you there is nothing better at this restaurant than the brunch drink special. It's 12 dollars for bottomless mimosas and bloody Mary's. That's right people this is not a drill. Bottomless anything in Chicago for that price is a sign from God to drink. But better than that you get to switch between the two! I always just want one bloody and then more mimosas than I can keep track of. And if you get Paris you will make sure that's what you get. 

If it's a rough morning and a little hair of the dog that by you is what you need then this is where you need to go.

My weekend brunching escapades in Chicago continue.  Am I turning into a pancake?...sweet, round, and pre-diabetic.  #thisislifeinchicago 

Sunday brunch review.  

Service - 3
Food - 4 
Ambiance/decor - 5

I specifically selected this place because my friend wanted to have unlimited Bloody Marys for brunch and I found this just for her.   Awww.  Well all that and she did not even get the Bloody Marys because it was a Bloody Mary "make-it-yourself" bar (but I did not find this odd as this is how I've seen it done at most restaurants...so yeah...).  For $12, you can get unlimited mimosas or Bloody Marys.  Pretty sweet deal. 

They have complimentary parking which is nice and a very large patio (covered in snow currently)!  

Their menu is fairly basic but a unique item or too such as the breakfast pizza.  No pancakes on the regular menu but they did have a "special" butternut squash pancake with ice cream and berries.  Our group split this as a sweet treat and they were fantastic.  Nicely flavored, not too overpowering, with a little ice cream and berries.  Well done. 

My friend and I split the chicken/waffles and the Bananas Foster French Toast with bacon.  Both were good.  The chicken and waffles were a bit ordinary but fine.  The french toast was very good.  A little soggy but I'm sure that's from the bananas and ice cream. 

The dining room is very large and is extra festive right now with really lovely holiday decorations.  Very inviting and interesting space, a bit rustic, a bit gothic, high ceilings, airy and open. 

Overall, a fine experience.

Let's rave about brunching here!! Food and drink game 100! 

The bottomless bloody/mimosas situation is a bargain and a half. Seriously wonderful. And the brunch menu is pretty much fire. I have had the breakfast pizza and not regretted getting that. All other plates I have seen looked great and didn't disappoint. 
Beyond brunch I don't have much to say, besides the wait staff. We have had great waiters. Shout out to Paris. You da bomb. It's great when your server is down to have fun with you and friendly. 
Everyone should go for brunch and who knows maybe other meals and occasions as well.

Let me tell you a story about how I spent my Valentine's Day here with four women. Well, one was my fiancee and the other three were our friends. But anyway, nothing says romantic like a big brunch and unlimited mimosas and bloodys, right? Well, we weren't the only one with that thought; the place was surprisingly packed despite it being V-Day and snow starting to hit.

It's not hard to see why - ZLV turned out to be a really beautiful space that, while only a few years old, felt like it could've been around for decades with it's gigantic front door, high ceilings and great decor. The food was good; everyone's plates were huge and I was perfectly happy with my chicken and waffles, which I'd recommend.

Of course, the real reason we were here was for the unlimited booze. You can jump between bloodys and mimosas at will, and the fixings for the bloody mary bar were good. You have cheese, cured meat, random veggies, and a small selection of spices and hot sauces. Putting it over the edge is the fact that they also have shrimp available. Though there was that woman who brought a plate up to the bar and just filled it up with shrimp and cheese...I mean, I get that it's unlimited, but that still felt kind of weird.

It's probably a good thing that I don't live any closer to ZLV, otherwise my fiancee would demand we come here every week and I'd be one step closer to liver failure. As for the rest of my Valentine's Day, the girls got their nails done and we finished our day off with some pizza. Would spend V-Day day drinking again!

Perfect al dente!!! I had the rigatoni which was excellent; everyone else at the table seemed delighted with their dishes as well.

THE PORTIONS ARE HUGE!!!!! Consider sharing a plate if you can agree on something.

This place could be great for a date, but there are definitely lots of families and parties here due to the large size of the place, so it can get loud.

It's good sometimes real good. Waiters need to settle their checkouts away from bar counter and let patrons enjoy what we pay for. A wet bluish brown bar towel to clean not a good idea as it looks soiled. And to not wring it out n leave your dining space soaking wet in blue brown what the you know the rest. 
I like this place get it together please

We made a reservation for our large group of 9 on a Saturday without a problem. Granted we were eating later in the evening, they made it work with a nice long table towards the back of the restaurant. I, personally, loved the rustic feel and the beams throughout the place. 

We made sure to reevaluate the menu, even though most of us had already peeked at the menu online. Many of us ordered salads, pizzas and the special butternut squash ravioli (not one ravioli was left behind). They also had a great wine deal, bottle of house for $20. Three of us split a bottle of red and I do not regret it. I ate the carpaccio salad and split the burrata salad with one of the girls. I had been craving burrata for a few days and it definitely satisfied. The service was efficient and they were very patient with us as the night went on. 

When I return to the Chicago area I will make sure to make it back to Zia's. I was pleasantly surprised.

Went here for brunch yesterday. The patio is super cute. Bottomless mimosas for $12 is a steal! Our server was great and kept refilling us promptly. The food itself was just alright. Nothing that great. And I'm really sad they don't serve pancakes!

This not being my first time here I have a few suggestions. First the lasagna is easily my favorite dish. They also have great meatballs and calamari. I would recommend getting a reservation early because this is a popular place!

BRUNCH ONLY:

What's not to love here? Prosciutto-laden brunch items: awesome. Bottomless mimosas and Bloody Mary's at $12 per person: also awesome. My heart belongs to the breakfast pizza with the over easy eggs on top, but I have been known to dabble in some prosciutto panini as well. Both items are phenomenal. Service has always been great (or, based on other reviews, maybe we were just too drunk to notice), the bartenders are fun to chat with, and the mimosa/Bloody Mary deal will have you calling an Uber home - and I mean that in the best way possible. 

TL;DR
Abundant amounts of prosciutto and endless booze: what more could you possibly need?

Disclaimer: This is probably not a place I'd bring kids nor a place I'd come for dinner. You have to take Zia's for what it's worth.

Three stars for now, due to two very disparate dining experiences.

#1: sat in the bar with a friend. Half price wine night, yes! Our server was a doll and super knowledgable about the menu. She was attentive and the food was delicious! Had a Caesar salad for starters, and the rigatoni Piedmontese as my entree. The entree is gargantuan--leftovers for days. All in all, a fun evening with good food. 

#2: sat in the bar with husband, son, and in-laws. Our server knew nothing about the menu, nor did he know what beers they served! He missed menu items that we ordered, including an entree with sauce requested on the side--the dinner came with sauce totally smothered and our diner was really disappointed. Unfortunately, this made for a tense evening with not-so-good food. 

I really like Zia's, and I'm willing to try again, but the inconsistency is killer. Plus, what's up with the paid valet? Best part about pulling up to Zia's used to be the free valet parking. 

I'll be back, but I guess I have to just cross my fingers and hope for the best.

Meh...

It seems like a good place to have a group meal and private events. My family has also had food catered from here and extended family seems to like their food. I just have never really been that big of a fan. One, because it's Italian food. Two, I've had better.

Recently went and tried one of their special dishes - tilapia. 3 pieces which was good and served with basmati rice. I didn't care for the sauce though.

I think I've only been here one or two other times and can't even remember what I had, it's that forgettable ha!

Some friends and I felt like Italian last week and since it was so nice out we also wanted a place with a patio. Zia's has a great covered outdoor area which opens into the interior as well with huge collapsible walls. The waiter we had was very attentive and definitely knew the food and wine/beer menu well. 

For the food:

-As an appetizer we ordered the escargot and the short rib ravioli (I don't recall the Italian name). Both were tasty but not very large portions, glad we ordered two appetizers. That being said they do have unlimited fresh bread with olive oil, a vegetable medley and parmesan cheese. 

-For the entrée I ordered the sausage pasta dish (sorry I don't recall the name for this either) and it was tasty and a generous portion. I would definitely recommend ordering this dish! One friend ordered the steak and while it was good it is a smaller portion, which you know beforehand of course (8oz). The steak was cooked correctly and seasoned well. 

Overall a great experience. I would like to get back to try the brunch since so many reviews here have very positive things to say...and you can't go wrong with bottomless mimosas.
