This is one of those places where it can be a classy date spot or a chill at the bar date spot. I guess I just now came to the conclusion that this makes a great date spot.

If you like wine, you've got it.
If you like cocktails, no worries, there's a full bar.
If you like great pasta, you're in because they make some of it in house
If you like seafood, you won't be disappointed
If you like dessert, you'll live with their standard choices

I can't give it five stars only because when comparing it to other italian restaurants of its caliber, it misses the mark only by a centimeter with not much innovation.

If you like consistent food and drinks enveloped in a non-pretentious atmosphere, Zia's will take you there.

Service = 5
Food = 3.5 or 4
Bloody Mary bar = 4.5

We came here was brunch. This seems like a popular place for larger groups and party area. 

Service was great and helpful. I thought it was pretty cool to see a self service bloody mary bar. The bartender hands you the basic vodka and mix and you get to add in the Worchesire sauce, hot sauce (they have quite the variety) and pepper. And then you take a skewer to pick up any olives, ham, celery, coctail shrimp, or cheese to garnish your drink. 

I got to share and try the following:
-crab cake benedict - the crab cake was tasty
-Brennan eggs benedict - the spicy ham and spinach was good too.
-the flat bread pizza was okay...but I think it would do best to share as an appetizer. 

The poached eggs on the benedict was not too great. I am such an egg addict but this was a slight let down because I could taste the vinegar used to poach eggs.

Had a resurvation for Sunday 10/30 at 4PM. We were told on the phone that if we were dining here and going to the cubs game that we could leave are car in the lot for free. It is even on their web site. When we arrive we were told that it would be $50.00 to park if we were dining and going to the game. The web site says that parking is free on cubs game days. When we questioned the manage he had an attatude and said I dont know why they would have told you that. Maybe if you looked at your web site you would know why it says free parking on Cubs game days. Not a good way to do business.

Great atmosphere, delicious food. Our wait staff switched out mid-meal which is strange. Ordered the Chicken Parmesan (not on the menu) and I would HIGHLY recommend it to anyone. 

Nice bar in front to grab a drink, and there appears to be outside seating.

I've heard brunch is great here too.
Hands down my favorite Italian restaurant in Chicago. Everything tastes amazing. I recommend the rotolo, pollo ripieno, and the tiramisu.

Driving around the area we discover this place we stopped and give it a try.. BIG MISTAKE. We walked in and the place was busy probably because the  $12 bottomless mimosas or bloody Mary's or Probably because the people won't mind to pay $5 for a parking space in their own parking lot!! But not us we drive far in found a parking space at the street. Looking the menu we notice was not much food to offer for lunch so as soon as our server approaches to us and ask if we wanted anything to drink and I said yes coffee and my bud ordered orange juice. Server turn around with a mad face. (Sorry if I'm a runner and I can't drink alcohol the day before one of my long runs buddy) it took him around 10-15 min con tome back to the table with the non alcoholic drinks. He finally decide to take the order. Two stars for the food cause the food was actually pretty tasty but the server attitude is something probably they will need to work on. We watch him pass by us the whole time we were eating he never stop to asked if I need more coffee or water or anything else when he saw the plates were empty for around 10-15 min and never said anything we actually had to asked to the check to the hostess. For that the server approach to us and every time (the 3 times he stopped by the table) keep calling my bud "BRO". Kind of annoying
PROBABLY WE WILL RETURN WHEN WE CAN HAVE SOME MIMOSAS SO I WILL GET DRUNK AND WONT PAY ATTENTION TO MY "BRO" NASTY ATTITUDE !!!

Chicken and waffles topped with bacon, powered sugar and syrup?! Best. Brunch. Ever! 

Did I mention bottomless mimosas or bloody Mary's?! Yes folks they have a Bloody Mary bar. Breakfast pizzas! Lemon French toast! Oh yes, my friends and I will be returning again. 

Quick tip: this place is packed for Sunday brunch. Make a reservation and if you want to sit on the patio specify it with your reservation. It was a gorgeous day outside (finally Spring is here!). 

Everything is very reasonably priced. I think my friends and I walked away stuffed (and some a little drunk) for just $20-$25 each. 

Perfect Sunday.

Came here with a bunch of coworkers for a celebratory dinner and it was fantastic! We started with a drink at the bar. The bartender wasn't the friendliest, but whatevs. We sat down and started to go hard on the bread with oil and cheese because we were so hungry.

We ordered a bunch of apps...grilled and fried calamari, the cheese board and a few other things I'm sure I'm forgetting about. Everything was really tasty. For entrees I split two things with my boss because I couldn't decide on one and she was looking at the same two items. We got the salmon (ooohhhheemmmgee) and a mushroom pasta special that was delightful. Chocked full of delicious mushrooms and the sauce was on point!

No room for dessert but definitely next time!

I went to Zia's with a group of friends and they take reservations which was nice as we didn't want to stand around and wait on a Sunday morning. We got seated right away and were offered unlimited bloody Mary's and mimosas for $12. Great deal! I ordered crab cakes Benedict and it was good - eggs cooked perfectly. Everyone else really enjoyed their meals as well and the brunch panini was a hit. Only down was that the service was a little bit slow getting refills on drinks.

Service was great! Portions were huge and food was delicious. Loved the unlimited mimosa option and the bloody Mary's people were bringing back from the Bloody Mary bar looked awesome. The atmosphere is great- wonderful patio.

Tried this spot on Sunday. I was with a party of 10. Left very satisfied and would definitely go back for another bottomless boozy brunch. Impeccable service and even though there was a 2 hour limit, we didn't feel like we were being rushed. Everyone had more than enough to drink and eat. The burgers looked amazing and my pasta was delish!

HORRIBLE SERVICE. Food was average but the service was absolutely terrible. As someone in the service industry, who makes a living from tips, I can say it was horrible. The server made us feel stupid for asking questions, and guilty for staying and drinking our bottomless drinks. 

Not only did the waiter ignore us (pretty much the entire time)...the host (or whoever she was) asked us to get up from our table because they had reservations and we needed to leave. When we asked for a refill on our "bottomless" mimosas...the host lady came over again and said that we needed to leave/move. We just stated we were getting a refill and then moving to the bar. She then said well you should just go to the bar because there were still waiting for the table. She also made us feel stupid and talked down to us because we thought there was no time limit on this mimosa deal. 

With that said...we left because why would we want to stay where we're not wanted...DO NOT EVER GO HERE if you want to have fun and drink and not hate everyone who works there.

For classic, big portion Italian food, Zias is a great place to go. Gotta say I love the building and decor here- if you've seen the Game of Thrones episode "the red wedding"....that's what the inside of this place reminds me of lol. Our party of 5 came here this Sunday- didn't need reservations. Was pretty quiet, maybe because it was still early, around 4:30ish. We got a couple bottles of the wine special (great wine for $20 a bottle), and shared the quail app as well as the pizza with the figs and I think pancetta? Both very good. For dinner I had the rigatoni with veal and pork ragout, husband had the pork served with polenta and broccolini. Phenomenal pasta, delicious pork. I'm not one to order polenta, but wow theirs was really good! Order that on the side, if possible! For dessert we all shared the apple one- forgot the name but OMG SO GOOD!

I came to Zia's with a friend for brunch on Sunday. They don't have your traditional brunch items or a buffet, but the food is different and good nonetheless. The decor is very pretty, and they have an outdoor seating area (there was a 30 minute wait to sit outside and not a lot of shade spots, so we sat inside). 

Their brunch items range from egg dishes to a breakfast pizza. I decided to go with one of the specials, which was a vegetarian version of eggs benedict (they used a tomato instead of a english muffin). It was very good, I was actually surprised at how good it was! My friend was not a fan of his breakfast pizza. However, they have $12 unlimited mimosas, so I guess that made up for it. Our server was very nice and came back around numerous times. Sometimes when they say "unlimited" anything it means as many times as the server comes around, which is 2. But this gal did a great job!

I would like to come back to try their wine bar and the lunch/dinner Italian dishes.

Looking for a great spot to start your Sunday Funday? Look no further than Zia's. They have the perfect combination to make your brunch a successful one - delicious food and a great deal for unlimited mimosas and/or an unlimited bloody mary bar ($10!).

-Breakfast pizza: thin and crispy crust, good amount of prosciutto and bacon, and topped off w/ 2 eggs. I definitely recommend this.
-Bloody mary bar: large assortment of hot sauces (sriracha, tabasco, tapatio, etc) and delicious garnishes (shrimp, salami, peppers, and blue-cheese stuffed olives just to name a few). I'm not a math person, but I'm pretty sure w/ all the offerings, you could make 237645 different combinations. Definitely one of the better bloody mary bars
-Other items at my table included the chicken and waffles, steak and eggs, omelette, and salad (I forget which one). There were no complaints about the food and everyone thoroughly enjoyed their dishes.

It gets crowded, so definitely make a reservation. 4 stars instead of 5 because our waitress was so hard to find when we were there. Yes, I know that we went on a busy day and we had a large party, and yes I know that she had other tables to tend to, but I feel like she could have done a better job checking in on us. We really had no idea where she was most of the day, and we had to flag down other servers whenever we needed something. Aside from that, I have no complaints. Zia's is definitely my new go-to spot for brunch!
The food is ok, but they do give good portions. One only ever been for their Sunday brunch which imo is one of the best deals In the city. The bloody bar is

Really bummed I moved out of the city because this would for sure be my go to weekend brunch spot. 

Even if I didn't eat at Zia's (I of course, did) I would still give this place 5 stars based on the solid fact that they have unlimited mimosas (and bloody Mary's) to $10!! Let's just say my gal pals and I had quite the festive Sunday when we were there.

The decor of the restaurant is super cool. The front doors are ginormous and makes you feel like you're entering a castle. It's a great spot for groups. There were twelve us and they had no problem taking a reservation and setting is up at a long row of high top tables. 

The mimosas were delish and our waitress was on point in regards to serving. Not once did we have to ask for another drink, because she had fresh glasses coming our way before we were even done with the ones we already had! Love it.

I enjoyed the panini on the brunch menu which had prosciutto and mozarella cheese along with some of the best potatoes I've ever had. Very very good!

I'm intrigued about their dinner menu so I'll OBVI be back for that and of course more mimosas :)

You really can't go wrong on the menu here. But if you're a college student like me and your parents are covering the bill, or you're a baller, take advantage of the steak (preferably, medium rare). It is perfection. But if you're not in the mood for steak I also recommend the:
* calamari
* bruschetta 
* lasagna 
* linguini pescatore
* rigatoni bolognese
* rigatoni with vodka sauce 
* rotolo

Basically the whole menu. 

Every time I've been here the service is great! The owner comes around and is a great guy, takes care of his customers, makes sure his staff is doing their best. I definitely recommend this place for any event, birthday dinner anniversary, entertaining out of town relatives, or just a date night.

I come here knowing the food is nothing to write home about. But i do enjoy the bottomless mimosa/bloody bar deal.  

Tip: be careful or do a walk around of the car if you valet it. the young staff they hired backed my car into a wall. The owner was quick to help and fix mine though. (I suggest not driving so you can really take advantage of the drink special)

We live close to Zia and go there relatively often. Last night we went to celebrate Valentine's Day and it was by far and wide the worst experience we have had with the place.

The waiter was in such a rush that he couldn't be bothered to explain the wine list or suggest what would be a good drink to go along with our food. At some point he came to ask how the food was, literally yelled it from two tables away and turned away before we could even tell him how horrible he was.

The lasagna was solid as usual but my wife's veal was dry and chewy; it felt like it had been in the fridge for a while before they finally decided to serve it.

Not a good experience at all. I'm not sure we will go back again.

This review was for brunch only.  We sat outside on a nice day (the patio is fantastic) and parking was free valet plus a tip of course.  The service was really good, and the $10 bottomless mimosa deal was incredible.  They kept the refills coming for a party of six, and I was feeling a nice buzz by the end of it!

While I'd give the mimosas a 5, I'd give the food a 3.  I got the fried chicken and waffles and would say they were average compared to other brunch places I've had them at.  Nothing to write home about.

But overall fun atmosphere, particularly if you're with a group friends that is looking to get the day started off with some mimosas.

I LOVE this place. I went here for brunch for my birthday and everything was great! The bottomless mimosas were delicious and the servers were constantly refilling our glasses, which isn't the norm for many places with this deal. The servers were very friendly and the food was so great that I brought my roommate here for her birthday the following week. They even gave me tiramisu when they found out it was my birthday! Highly recommend this place!

Just finished up a Christmas Eve dinner and the service was very disappointing. We had a 7:30 reservation and at 8 pm the server comes out to tell us the kitchen is closing at 8 so we hurriedly put in our order. Why would you take a 7:30 reservation if the kitchen is closing in 30 min?

Some other customer came in for their 7:30 reservation, got a drink at the bar and when they were getting ready to be seated they told them the kitchen was closed. Really? Why didn't someone tell us when we made the reservation, when we walked in, or when we sat down at the table that the kitchen was closing soon? 

The server proceeded to emasculate our husbands during dinner asking one if they would like another Cosmo (he had a Manhattan) and turns to the other and said ma'am, what would you like for dinner? He is bald and had a beard. While this might be slightly comical if we had already established a rapport, this was sadly not the case.

Ok tone poor tone. More on that later.

We sit at the table, two of us ordered drinks previously from the bar. The other two were thirsty. Waiter comes out, doesn't ask us about drinks or appetizers. Waiter said he didn't realize the other two people didn't have drinks. We order apps, then a bottle of wine. Food comes out. We begin eating, no wine still. Finally we remind the server and he gets it.

Kitchen was clearly rushed - burnt fish and dry chicken. But we also felt very rushed and pressures to leave simply because no one told us the kitchen closed at 8 when we booked a 7:30 reservation.

The worst was that toward the end of the meal (keep in mind we had a 7:30 pm arrival, check came out at 8:45 pm, left the restaurant by 9:05 pm) my friend went to the bathroom and overheard our server, the bus staff and others complaining about us being in the restaurant. They said, "What the f--- are these people doing, it's f---ing Christmas Eve." Referring to us already getting ready to leave the restaurant. 

This is absolutely shameful service and clearly a communication breakdown between the management and front of house. Very unfortunate because the previous year the other couple we were with had a great time and had an even later reservation.

If someone would have told us at any point of contact (when we made the reservation, when we got a cocktail at the bar, when we checked in with the host, when the waiter first greeted us) that they were getting ready to close the kitchen we would have made appropriate arrangements--either coming in earlier or going someplace else.

Insults with dinner, along with poor service is always a recipe for disaster.
$12 bottomless mimosa or bloody Mary's, patio seating and kind waitstaff. Need I say more?

Came here for a birthday lunch so it was a catered meal that the couple chose. Ambience of this place is super nice, staff was always around to check on us. Started with the calamari...you have to try it, so delicious! Had bruschetta which was very good, my favorite was the one topped with eggplant. Tried two salads, the caesar was my favorite; the zia pena one wasn't nothing great. For entree had a chicken dish with peas, but didn't think the chicken was flavorful. The pasta vodka cream was good. For a side had the grilled polenta marinara which was good. This place is great for groups and has complimentary valet.

If your friends who are 100% Italian love this place then it bodes well! :) I really enjoyed our dinner here on July 10th. Bigger group of us and we sat outside on the front patio. Comfortable seating and relaxing surroundings. We shared appetizers of the calamari and the octopus. Both were quite delicious even though the octopus was a tad chewy. The portions for the entrees are absolutely huge, which I appreciated. Great value here for what you receive. I ordered the Agnello (Lamb Shank) and it was impressive in size, tenderness and flavor. I had leftovers and was even better the second day! Service was fast and friendly. A friend of ours wants to come back with us for brunch which she says is phenomenal. Excited to agree on a date! xoxo

The first time I came for brunch, the service was terrible. Long stretches between ordering, mimosas being delivered only after we flagged our waitress down, another flagging for the bill. ... just terrible. But the food was OK. I had the chicken panini with the soup of the day and I felt pretty satisfied. 

But today the fuckery that is service at this joint reared its ugly head again. We sat for 10+ minutes before Kevin arrived and said he'd be taking care of us. Toward the end of brunch maybe he did .... but the beginning saw nothing more than empty flute glasses, no refilled coffee, a shout out from Kevin in the middle of the dining room to ask if we were ok, and then me having to go up to the bar for mimosas because our server disappeared again..... to boot, the food was very mediocre this time around. The fried chicken and waffles were blah.... chicken wayyyyy too spicy, waffles cold, no extra syrup (until I asked for it) and when I asked for no bacon, maybe they could have offered a substitute. 

I get it - most people are going here for the  champagne unlimited mimosas for ten bucks... but when the food and service are bordering crap..... I'd rather spend my money elsewhere.
Zia's is so much fun for brunch! The bottomless mimosa deal is wonderful and they are awesome at refilling for your class is empty.  Food is also soooo delicious! We will definitely be coming back!

I was recommended here by a work colleague. This place is great! Food is to die for. Bottomless mimosas were flowing and the service was some of the best we've had in Chicago. Would not hesitate in recommending this place or indeed returning very soon.

Let me start by saying brunch in Chicago is everywhere so what makes this place so awesome? Well..for $12 you have the option of bottomless mimosas or bloddy's! They have a pretty standard brunch selection with alternating "specials" I had the French toast and was expecting something just okay! Boy was I thrilled when they brought me my plate! Chocolate and hazelnuts galore, not to mention it's topped with a scoop of chocolate ice cream and came with 3 slices of bacon(my fave). Needless to say the service was on point never letting our glasses go empty! The decor is very comfortable and welcoming! Cannot wait to go back!
The food was great and so were the bottomless mimosas! The waiters and waitresses all got tattoos with us! I can't see myself going to any other place for brunch.
Perfect place on a rainy day with my daughter!!  Food and service was tops and the lunch specials reasonable!!!

LOVED this place. Came here with out of town guests which was perfect because they can accommodate large groups very easily. We basically ordered all the entrees on the menu and everyone loved what they got. They also had a great wine deal going on for white and red house wines for $20! Doesn't get better than that! The ambience made this place feel special and would definitely come back!

Great ambiance and food!

I came here around 6pm with 2 friends and a baby. No wait and we could choose inside or outside. The patio was very lovely but we chose to sit inside. The indoor dining space behind the bar area is absolutely gorgeous. It feels like you're in Italy! (At least in my imagination of someone who's never been). 

We were able to get a high chair for my friend's baby and the waitress also gave him a kid friendly drink cup that he loved. I have complaints about the service. Our waitress was really nice and a sweet girl. 

I ordered the Escargot en Cocotte for an appetizer and the Rotolo for my entree. The escargot was fresh and buttery, but I couldn't taste the garlic and overall I felt lacked flavor. The Rotolo was beautiful but there was something in the ingredients that made it tart. Maybe one the cheeses? It almost had a sour taste. Maybe it was the tomatoes sauce. I don't know this is how is supposed to taste, but it was just ok for me. 

My friends ordered the Filetto al Formaggio and the Pollo Ripieno. I tried a bite of each and it was delicious! I wish I would've ordered something else instead. I'll definitely be back to try another dish.
Delicious!  Consistently fantastic menu, great wine/bar list, fantastic lunch special (3-course meal for $12.95)! I am always happy and satisfied and would recommend Zia's Lago Vista to everyone!

Unlimited mimosas can't go wrong with that. Good was great just a few hiccups. Ordered poached eggs and it was over cooked. The host handled it really well and within 5 minutes a got perfectly poached eggs. 
There was also a butchers twine found in the a sandwich we ordered. 
The manager came and apologized and comped both our meals.
Overall great service on how they handled everything. Even with the problems we had I would still recommend this place

Zia's Lago Vista was the last restaurant I visited while I was in Chicago with friends and when I was there I felt like the ultimate 20-something. The place is full of people, offers an indulgent brunch menu, and boasts a $12 bottomless bloody Mary bar/mimosas deal. The inside is fairly dark, you'll likely need to yell to hear what people are saying, and the hits of yesteryear play the whole time. 

I ordered the banana nut French toast and subbed out the side of bacon for a side of fruit, which I think might have ended up costing me extra, but I never received an itemized receipt personally, so I don't know. I will say that this restaurant was extremely not vegetarian friendly, as not a single item on the menu is vegetarian without customization. Even still the food was amazing. My dish was banana bread made into French toast, topped with crème anglaise, chocolate sauce, and a scoop of hazelnut ice cream. Definitely not something I would get everyday as it was extremely heavy, but it was delicious. The side fruit salad was not nearly as good. It consisted mostly of underripe honeydew, cantaloupe, and pineapple, but the strawberries and blueberries were good.

The service on the other hand was terrible. Our server came up and forcefully asked everyone to show their ID's despite the fact that not everyone (myself included) was drinking. After being there for around 20 minutes she finally took our order. When the food came, some of the drinks had still not been delivered to the table. When my friend asked about it, the server responded with "Look, I have two tables outside and I can't be everywhere at once." When my other friends asked if they could have mimosas instead of bloody Mary's, our server said they would need to chug them before she could do anything as she couldn't have them "double-fisting." We had to explain that they did not want the bloody Mary's at all, which she understood after a little convincing. She did not keep the mimosas filled thereafter, however. When the check came, she told us it could only be split four ways. We took the time to write out what items would be on each card, which she thanked us for, but told us she needed it according to seat numbers, and basically redid all of our work. 

Maybe it was an off day, but I think you could probably find better brunch in Chicago. The food was good, but overpriced and lacking in content for vegetarians. The service was also horrendous, and I don't think I'd return.

The people at Zia's are very friendly. I have come here several times with my 3 year old twin boys. Everyone is so nice and sweet to the boys. My kids and I love the food. This restaurant is very child friendly.

Came back here for brunch, once again VERY pleased.  I loved their breakfast pizza. The cheese on it was super good and so was the bacon and prosciutto.  I had the same waitress as last time, Rebecca, I think?  She's the best, very professional and keeps the bottomless mimosas coming.  Zia's is easily my favorite brunch place in Chicago with their beautiful interior and awesome outdoor patio!

I came here with my son on a Friday evening around 6:45pm. They were not too busy as of yet. The waiter "David" was rude from the beginning. He didn't stand long enough ever at my table to hear what I ordered, wanted or needed. He didn't go over the specials and didn't over over the wine of the day. Instead he was curt, inattentive and snippy throughout the whole dinner experience. 

Our food was mediocre at best. The Seafood pasta.... it was spicy. I asked ahead of time for them not to make it such, as my son would not like it. When it came out...it was still spicy.  He didn't ask to replace it, when I complained. I had to pay and order for another meal for my son. 1 and half hour later we left unsatisfied and the best part???

When I shared my experience with the manager "Ryan" he gave an apology but David just came over to 5 mins later to back talk saying I never requested un-spicy. Nice. David, you have no idea what it means to be a server. 

I do not recommend this place at all. Its loud, the servers are rude, and the food is just expensive Olive Garden variety.

Its a pass

The brunch here was excellent and the deals were great. I got the flatbread pizza which was very good my friend got the burger and the stuffed French toast. The French toast was very rich but literally something you have to try and experience. It was out of this world. 

Unlimited bloody Mary's and mimosas for ten dollars during brunch were amazing. The bloody was made with zig zag mix which is the best imo. It also is a Bloody Mary bar which makes for an even better experience. This place is great for brunch and I will be back for sure. The people work hard to make sure you get enough drinks as well. Overall a great place for brunch.

Incredible - Can't believe I hadn't even heard of Zia's prior to yesterday. Zia's is the holy grail of brunch. 

A couple paradigm-shifting experiences here on Sunday:

1. A place exists where one can consume 3 bloody mary's and 2 mimosa's for $10. This is not a drill. 
2. A menu-item described as "Stinky French Toast" can indeed be awesome. If you go to Zia's, try the Stinky French Toast. The portions here are absurd and everything is reasonably priced.

Finally - If you're the type that cares about these things, the clientele here is absolutely beautiful. 

I'd like to visit again and try Lunch/Dinner and I plan to do so in the near future.

Brunch Rating: Their unlimited mimosas for $10 with great service gets them 4/5 (i mean, cheap boozy brunch!? come, on!!). Our server was so very attentive to refill our drinks and the woman who may have been the manager would walk around and help and check-in as well. They weren't being super annoying with the check-ins (big pet peeve of mine) with constantly asking how we're doing - they let us have our conversation. But they did notice quickly that we had an extra person come in about 30 minutes after everyone (aka Me) and was checked on pretty quickly. I didn't feel rushed to leave either - big plus! Though that did mean it took a little while to flag down our waiter for the check in the end. Oops.
Food-wise, I got the make your own omelette (mushrooms and provolone) with potatoes. It was yummy, though I've had better potatoes elsewhere, still good though so no real complaints.
I'll definitely be back!

Just dined here on 08/13/16. Food was pretty good. Had an appetizer so by the time my meal came out I was full. My plate was taken from me to be boxed up. When I got home later that evening, I opened my Togo box to find they had given me someone else's Togo box. Really upsetting considering I paid $18 for a dish I only took 2 bites of.  I was visiting from out of town and my flight left next morning, so it's not like I could have them replace my dish.

When this place is on, it's great. When you get one certain waitress who tries to do more than she can, you're gonna be miserably sober. The $10 bottomless Bloody Mary and/or mimosa brunch is the best deal in the city. But you have to make sure they're awake and keeping the mimosas rolling, otherwise it's gonna be 3 pm and you'll be wondering where the hell the waitress is and why they've one brought you 3 mimosas in the last 3 hours. The salads are great, steak and eggs superb, chicken and waffles divine. Bloody Mary bar has some great little accoutrements... We watched them stuff their olives with blue cheese at the bar. Draw some pictures on your table cloth/paper and have a great drunk brunch. Have not been to the other location but I'm sure it's swell. Also!!! Get the escargot if you come at dinner time.

The bottomless brunch is decent. The servers, the bar tender, and the hostess were all freaking thick. We had an hour and a half wait (no problem, we didn't have a reservation) but we went to the bar, ordered mimosas, watched as the bartender filled everyone else's mimosas for 20 MINUTES before I had to remind him TWICE that we were waiting. Then I go to check on our waitlist position and the hostess was too busy ON HER CELL PHONE, at the hostess stand, to even acknowledge I was standing there. This is absolutely horrible service, and I would expect so much more.

I need to rein in my prior five-star review of Zia's. 

I returned to Zia's on the strength of my prior visit 16 months ago as well as on the ongoing 4.5-star aggregate rating it carries. 

Well, things change, don't they?

This time, expectations just weren't met, and my mind is made up it will be Angelina or elsewhere going forward. 

First of all, I found it strange on a weekend evening it was so dead. Secondly, the thin crowd wasn't what I'd call cutting edge or trendy--not that there's anything wrong with that. I just found it odd compared to my prior visit and almost felt like I was in the burbs at the place with the bread sticks. Maybe my most recent visit to Summer House spoiled me? 

The food was just not up to par with my prior visit. To wit:

Bruschetta. Bland and needlessly overloaded with tomatoes such that over half of them inevitably fell off anyway. Remove two-thirds of the tomatoes and add some olive oil and maybe garlic, and you would be good to go.

Rosemary Potatoes. I'm not sure, but I believe they deep fried these? Otherwise, I have no explanation as to how they were so infused with grease. Shocking.

Pasta entree. Again, bland. 

Chicken entree. The chicken itself was actually pretty good and the highlight of the evening. 

Polenta. Uh-uh. 

Complimentary bread. Glad I left my diamond rings at home because they would have been in harm's way on the table with this stuff. 

Service was still very good, but I'm 80 percent about the food and 20 percent about the service. 

Arrivederci, Zia. We'll always have 16 months ago.

Nice atmosphere, good food and wine specials.  I love the front bar area that opens up onto the outdoor patio.  We generally belly up to the bar on a lazy Sunday evening, grab a bottle of wine and a couple appetizers / salads to share.  They always have a $20 white and red bottle special.  Nothing big name but always a decent red, especially for the price.  The Barbabietola beet salad is amazing, as well as the Burrata salad with grilled peaches. YUM!  They serve appetizer portions of the Roasted Butternut Squash and Beef Short Rib raviolis - both so good!  And great for sharing.  The only reason for 4 stars is inconsistent service.  Always nice, but can be incredibly slow...  Not that we are in a huge hurry but frustrating to wait 15 minutes to order sometimes!  Another nice perk was free valet, so you could park for a $5 tip.  Now they charge - which is why the parking lot is empty!  Still a great go-to spot.

When a friend suggested I meet him at Zia's, I said, where?  But I sure was glad he lives in the neighborhood and knows what's good, as this place blew me away the other night with it's outstanding food, impeccable and friendly service and ambiance that was cozy and large all at the same time.  It had the feeling of an established restaurant even though it hasn't been open that long.

First the doors.  I thought I had landed in a giant's castle so large were the two front doors,  And their size is only equaled by the energy it takes to pull them open, but that is just part of the charm.

In the front is a large bar area that is warm and inviting and in the back is the actual restaurant although you can eat in either space.  They had just decorated for the holidays when I was there so there were lights twinkling, ornaments hanging and just an overall wonderful feeling to the place.

We were seated along the wall by the wine and immediately given warm bread with olive oil and freshly grated parmesan to dip it in as well as a pickled carrot dish as a complimentary starter.   I wish I could remember our server's name as this guy was great, taking such pride in what he did that I wanted him to pull up a chair and sit awhile with us.

The menu has such a wide range of Italian favorites, it's hard to choose.  And there are specials each day as well so put on those reading glasses, loosen your belt and get ready for an Italian feast. 

I opted for a house salad as a starter and their Bolognese sauce over pasta as my entrée.  My friend ordered two appetizers (I use that term loosely as they were huge and one could have sufficed and this is for a grown man)  He had the Eggplant parmesan and the pumpkin stuffed ravioli and both were delicious.

Our drinks were perfectly poured, our food came up piping hot and served with a smile and the price?  Super reasonable.

Loved this spot and can't wait to go back.  And I can only imagine how nice it will be to sit outside in the Summer months with a bottle of wine and some great conversation to wile away the time.

This stretch of Ashland doesn't get a lot of accolades.  But  it should now that Zia's is here.  I'm just happy my friend lives nearby as it is definitely on the top of my "go to list" when in his neighborhood.  Check it out!

I have heard and driven by this place many times but never had the chance to go in. And sometimes with many reviews you're just not sure what to expect. I am happy to say that I was pleasantly surprised with this place. It caters to all age groups, so it won't be the young, hip place you might think, but it's also not a crusty, antiquated establishment either.
The wine list is good/smart, and bottle prices are reasonable (much more economical than places in the loop or river north for example). The pizzas have a nice thin, almost cracker like crust which worked for me. Service was very attentive without being overbearing. Anxious to go back and try other things on the menu.
Zia's has a great vibe, good food and wine. Patio is great in summer and brunch specials rock!! I like the food at Tutto Frescos on Broadway a little better, but love the atmosphere at Zia's.

I went here for brunch recently and it was amazing. For living so close, we could not believe that we had not been here before. Our waitress was extremely efficient and kind and the drinks and food were amazing. The endless bloody mary's and mimosas cannot be missed.

Went here for the 2nd time today for brunch....food was excellent and the service while slow because they were slammed...was tolerable due to the management making sure everyone was having a good experience.   We will be back!

I really love this place -- the food is marvelous -- service is outstanding (thanks George and Hugo). I would consider myself a regular here.  Always get the Rotolo -- that is the most amazing Italian dish I've ever had.  Always have a low-priced (but high-quality) wine every night ($5/glass or $20/bottle) which I greatly appreciate. They helped me celebrate my birthday with a yummy tiramisu with a candle.  The ONLY reason Zia's did not earn a 5-star review is that they have changed their bread to a low-quality "Wonder Bread".  They used to have a marvelous, crunchy Italian bread, please bring it back.  Also, the parking used to be free, so I could plan group meals with all of my suburban friends who didn't have to worry about finding a place to park.

I had the special Risotto and the Lamb Shank.

Terrible!!!!

Worst meal I've ever had.... Tough night in Chicago....

Great food and great decor. --Be ready for the doors when you walk in.

Update:
$5 glasses of wine on Thursdays!

Love love love this place! I've been meaning to write this review for a while. I am glad I found this spot- It might even be my new favorite place for brunch! 

My boyfriend and I came here for Valentine's Day as we were looking for a place that served mimosas. This place did not disappoint! Unlimited mimosas for $12? Yes, please. I had the crab cakes and it was divine! Mind you, I'm a very picky eater and don't usually take risks, but I'm glad I did this time. We didn't have to wait long to be seated, surprisingly. & our server, Gwen, was awesome! I have nothing but great things to say about her. All in all, this place had great food and great service. We will definitely be coming back.

Great food even for vegetarians.  I had the Spinach Ravoli.  So yummy.  Had bruschetta for appetizers and that was yummy as well.  My wife is a picky eater and she had good options to eat.  I would recommend those looking for a new Italian restaurant to eat at.  The only criticism I have is that it was so freaking cold in there and there was no light in there.  Also, it was busy, so it was a bit tough to get hold of our waitress.  However, what made up for my complaints was the food.  Simply amazing.

This is our new favorite brunch spot. Went with good friends for a GREAT brunch!!! Don't know how we didn't hear about this sooner! If you go , ask for Brian, great and friendly server. He makes sure your mimosas are truly bottomless! We will definitely be back, and ask for Brian!!!!! Xoxo

My girl initially wrote a 5 star review about a year ago, which was hugely warranted, but we've really disliked our recent experience. Lemme explain.

If you're looking for a brunch to get drinking, Zia's is great. They're the reason I learned to love Bloody Marys. 

If you're looking for a brunch to do that and get food if you're a vegetarian... Yeah. I try to be as accommodating as possible, I really hate when vegetarians go into a place without checking the menu, without knowing what they're getting, and make a hassle to get vegetarian food. I try to accommodate. If a place has some options, that's fine, if a place has none, I dodge it.

For the most part prior, Zia's had at least options that were fine for vegetarian. The breakfast pizza with veggies instead of meat is fine, but I'm allergic to eggs so I dodge that for the most part, and they had like waffles or some other usual breakfast item that came without meat. Never had a problem.

Until today. We show up, everything is like usual, and I check out the menu.. Low and behold, there's no other options outside of the pizza, not even on the special menu. Okay. Girl orders the pizza with veggies, I ask if I can get like waffles with fruit. They say its fine.

Pizza shows up with no veggies, no meat, and just eggs. I get three pieces of waffles and a cup of syrup, with nothing else on the plate period. No fruit, nothing. Thank god I ordered the side of potatoes which has been a staple of mine at Zia's.

Could have I ordered anything else and requested no meat? I've done that, you can tell that the recipe is catered to that specific ingredient, which is understandable, that's how it works, and unfortunately, that means the order doesn't taste as good because it isn't mean to exist without the meat counterpart necessarily. A salad that's meant to have meat will not taste good without it, because the recipe is meant to have it, and in the case of Zia's, they don't do much to accommodate making an alternative. Honestly, I'd be happy to have one brunch item that doesn't have eggs and doesn't have meat, and that's how it had been for over a year, but no longer.

A great dining experience. I had some fantastic wine and delicious pasta. I went with a very specific craving and although what I wanted wasn't on the menu, my server was sure to make it happen. He spoke to the chefs and they prepared an incredible dish for me. They are so accommodating and kind. A great place for a romantic date or wine night with friends. Will definitely be back! Thank you, Zia!

Unlimited mimosas and/or bloody marys at brunch for the low low price of $10!?
What more do you need?

Also, you actually need great food to deserve 4 stars. That helps. Good thing Zia's has that, too. And they even serve a great dinner! 

The place is huge... once you walk through the gigantic Game of Thrones-esque door, there's a huge bar and an even more huge dining room in the back. 

I think dinner is a smidge pricey for what it is, but I can honestly say I've never been disappointed with what I've ordered.

Definitely happy to have a nice restaurant like this close to home!

What a nice surprise Zia's Lago Vista was! Only a surprise because I had never heard of it before. I went for dinner arranged by a friend and was so happy with her choice. The atmosphere was really classy, dimly lit with quiet music playing in the background. It has kind of an old world Italian decor that turns out to be the perfect setting for a fantastic Italian meal. They have an extensive wine selection that happened to be half-off all bottles the Tuesday night that we went. I noticed on a display board that they offer really great specials on both drink and food for each night of the week. In addition to the wine, they also offer a full bar selection with an impressive beer selection on tap. The food menu offers just about anything Italian your heart could desire that definitely didn't disappoint. Our table ordered a wide array of options from the menu and after tasting how delicious my Rigatoni Bolognese was, I then proceeded to invite my fork to everyone else's dish to see if their's was as great as mine. They all were... from the Lasagna Classico, to the Meatball Salad, then on to the Cavolifiore. I could keep going, but I'll leave a little for you to discover! Go on a date, go with a group, take your kids, just go. It was great and I will absolutely be back!

Wow, is really all I can say.  Tucked away on Ashland away from the grind of other high end establishments in the gold coast, river north and west loop is this gem of a place.  

From the moment I walked in I was impressed.  The dark decor, the wood, the lighting was all amazing.  I was meeting a friend there and neither of us knew how...romantic it was going to be.  We both laughed it off and made it a point to say how we'd be sure to bring our respective partners here, but in the future, the next time we want drinks we'd better go somewhere else lest we appear to be carrying on an affair.  I digress.

We went on a Tuesday night and they had a bevy of drink specials.  The wine selection was pretty large and amazing.  The servers understood how to pair what wines with what foods.  

The food was awesome as well.  We did a bunch of appetizers and shared. We had the Ravioli Di Zucca, a butternut squash ravioli with a marscapone cream sauce topped with toasted hazelnuts, the  Spiedino D'Carne, grilled beef tenderloin tips skewered with portobello mushrooms, roasted peppers, tomato, bleu cheese, and a barolo wine sauce, and the Bruschetta.  Each of those items were as amazing as they sound.  It's not the cheapest place but it won't break your bank either.  If you're looking for a great dinner or a special occasion spot, you've found it.  You're welcome.

Very Impressed.  Stopped in quickly last night for a beer just to check the place out.  Decided to get some meatballs to give them a try.  I love meatballs.  It might have been the booze in the system from being AJ Hudson's most of the day, but they were damn good.  I had dreams about them last night.   

Can't wait to go back and try the main entrees.

Great Italian Resto!  Huge Door (The biggest doors I've ever seen) welcomes you to a very spacious bar/ lounge area.  Dining area in the back has a more rustic feel.  It's a very busy/ bustling joint.. Two hostess' and a constant wait!  They have a good draft beer list and an outstanding wine list, heavy on CA.  The menu is great but not as huge as you would think- 8 Apps/ 6 Pastas or so and 6 different meat options.  They also have a "Specials" list every night that seem to utilize whats fresh and in season.. most of these I've tried are "Don't Miss" bites!  They bring out the traditional bread-olive oil-parmesan cheese but also these amazing marinated carrots that are to die for!  I would recommend the escargot paired with any of the chicken dishes, so amazing.  Service varies, I've had two good bartenders and two just so-so..don't forget to tip the gorgeous hostess! get dat did

I love going to brunch here. I go every weekend. They have a fantastic drink special, which allows you to have truly bottomless mimosas and bloody marys, and you can switch between the two! Their food is always fresh and flavorful. The breakfast pizza is the best brunch item on the menu.

Amazing food and even better hospitality. Kat(y)(ie), thank you for the menu recommendations and kind gestures! People like you and restaurants like Ubelly make the city of Chicago worth visiting!

(Try the Coconut Pho, Sweet Potato Dumplings and Phat Rice!)

After having been to the West Loop location, we were skeptical about trying the new location but gave it a go. 

Things are tasty, but like my original post, lack an identity. It really messes with your ability to have a satisfying meal. The Urban Belly Ramen has a nice pork belly, but portions are small and lacking the variety of ingredients you find in most ramen bowls. The Phat Udon was tasty, but had three distinct portions - lemongrass chicken, pork belly, and a bulgogi-type meat; the three meats were so distinct in flavors that it was like eating three mini meals that didn't flow together. Also had the Phat Rice on a separate occasion and it has the exact same curry flavors as the lemongrass chicken of the Phat Udon. Now that I see they have the same name, that makes sense, but it was literally the same dish just on a bed of noodles instead of rice - it wasn't interesting to the palette. 

I wouldn't come back unless I had a desperate taste for Asian food (and I mean "Asian" food).  But then again, there's a lot of other Asian cuisine in the area to pick from.

The first time I came to Urbanbelly was on their opening day. I ordered the Phat noodles which are stir-fry udon noodles covered in lemongrass chicken, pork belly, and braised beef. The set up of the restaurant is very "fast casual". You order at the counter and they bring it out to your table once it is ready. The service was totally fine and normal. The largest issue is that the texture on this was just wrong, the flavors were off. It was just... "Meh, I've experienced better" in a nutshell. The second we lagged on a bite, the wait staff came by and tried to bus our table. This made sense, especially on opening day so it wasn't a huge deal. 
 
I made the mistake on my second trip of ordering the pork & pineapple, which was wok fired rice with scrambled egg, pork belly, & pineapple. The young lady behind the register actually came out to ask me about my meal and I told her, honestly, that it was not great. The flavors didn't work together and the texture wasn't great. I have to hope that, because I've only had two things off the menu, there are other things at Urbanbelly that make it shine. The location is great, the people who work here seem nice, but overall- I wouldn't send someone here to eat.

I was looking for an Asian Fusion restaurant on Yelp, and Urbanbelly came up. After looking through the photos, as well as looking on their website, I was excited to come and try the food. Unfortunately, fusion food tends to be a hit-or-miss, and this time it was a miss.

After walking into the restaurant, you go up to the counter to order. They will give you a number and you can seat yourself. They will bring the food out to you, and the food comes quite quickly.

We ordered the Phat Rice and the Urbanbelly Ramen, both which seemed the most popular. It was just okay. I feel like fusion foods have a hard time balancing authentic flavors with just enough fusion to make it different. In this case, I feel like the food fell a little too far on the fusion spectrum and just was okay. Also, both the ramen and the rice were spicy, and by the end of the meal, I couldn't taste anything other than that spicy kick. As someone who is not a fan of spicy foods, I just couldn't enjoy it. 

We also ordered a Passionfruit lemonade. i was super excited about this, but it was just okay. It tasted very strongly of passionfruit (syrup?), and not enough lemonade to it. It was also pretty pricey ($3) for not a lot. There was a lot of ice, and towards the end, it was just super watered down.

The restaurant itself is pretty cool and aesthetically pleasing. When you walk in from the main entrance, there is a wall with plants on your left. The decor is very industrial. The bad part is the lighting is pretty low throughout.

I probably wouldn't come back here. There are definitely better options to get this kind of food.

Meh.

We stopped here because 1) I knew they had shrub cocktails 2) I love asian food. 

I was happy about the service, the shrub cocktail that was free refills (!), and how fast the food came out. The shrub was a coconut which is pretty inventive -- they also let you pair it with any liquor you want (gin, in my case). It feels like the quickness of Chipotle which is pretty nice. 

The food isn't bad. I ordered the wheat berry bowl. It just wasn't anything memorable. the flavors weren't super cohesive. 

If this place was not around other awesome options, I think it would be a better option. But, smack in the middle of Wicker Park -- probably not worth it unless you just wanted something really quick and easy.

Came to Urbanbelly in Wicker Park with a friend for a late Friday night dinner. We ordered SO much, because everything looked good and overall, this place has a lot of potential, but imo the food doesn't justify the prices.

Venue is fun and divey with communal tables. (Order first and then sit down)
Friend and I ordered the Sweet Potato dumplings, Ramen Jr, Asian Bolognese, and Phat Noodles (yes for just the two of us O.o)

Not a fan of the sweet potato dumplings which were unnecessarily oily.
Ramen Jr. was a nice sampling of their house ramen. Pork wasn't memorable, but the broth was fairly decent though my friend thought it was salty. 
Asian Bolognese... a disaster! I was expecting more of a Dan Dan noodle or a Zha Jiang Mian, but it came with an almost sour tomato sauce that did NOT work. I was sad that those beautiful udon noodles were covered in such a strange sauce and it was clear we both were not feeling this odd mix of flavors. The exciting concept failed in execution and leaves me wondering how Asian fusion could have bombed so badly.
Meanwhile, the Phat were our favorite! We happily chowed down on the stirfry udon noodles and enjoyed the hearty chunks of chicken, beef AND pork belly - wow, living up to its phat name. Only complaint is that it was ended up really oily halfway through the dish.

As I mentioned, the price tag on this meal was not worth the sup-bar dishes served at Urbanbelly. The food is in desperate need of some refinement and restraint in terms of oversalting and too much oil! With all the other options in Wicker Park who have it together, I won't be returning to Urbanbelly.

First off the service was great. All of the employees were attentive and Monica the manager did a great job of explaining the menu to me. I had the coconut pho which blew me away! I had the "Kill Bill" mezcal based cocktail and loved the flavor profile. Don't listen to the negative reviews. If you look into what is written, it's clear that these are just snobby people who want management to maybe send them a free meal voucher or something. I would definitely be back to UrbanBelly soon!

Urbanbelly is open in Wicker Park! I love the OG Urbanbelly so am happy to have something a mere two blue line stops away from my abode. 

Yesterday was their 'Grand Opening' though they've been open for about a week or so. Upon walking in my friend and I were giving a little bag with some tea, coffee and coupons for Urbanbelly and Belly Shack. They had some sweet specials running yesterday, as well, which we took advantage of. I fell in love with Urbanbelly's signature ramen a couple months ago as it's strewn with slight spice, noodles, pork belly, mushrooms, an egg and pretty much everything nice. Typically it's a monstrous sized portion which takes me several meals to finish but yesterday they were serving up a Junior sized for just $5! My dreams had come true! I was able to indulge in this delicious ramen at a smaller portion that better suited me. Even in this junior kiddie size I'm certain it will make 3 meals for me.

My friend ordered up the Phat Rice with has some egg in it, lemongrass chicken, a bit of pork belly, a bit of beef and just like the ramen - just a dash of spice. I absolutely loved this dish, as well!

Not often do you find a grand opening running as smooth as Urbanbelly's did yesterday, only a testament to Chef Bill Kim's well-oiled restaurant group machine in this city. Urbanbelly was packed to the brim but food was coming out smoothly & quickly with friendly service. When I couldn't finish my ramen, they were quick to pack it up for me with a smile. I also saw them working away at cleaning up tables when someone left for the next group to sit down. And when we left - a friendly goodbye was bestowed upon us.

I was already a fan of Urbanbelly so knew what to expect going into this new location. However, with multiple locations, restaurants can sometimes fall off when it comes to the food or service. I'm happy to say this spot lives up to it's older brother and am grateful to have an Urbanbelly in Wicker Park!

First off, this restaurant is structured like Panera in that you order at a register and then they deliver your food to the table. The tables are mostly long tables that don't provide much privacy if you're only with one or two friends and the restaurant is busy. However, I really enjoyed the way the restaurant was designed as it was interesting. It was also clean, the food got out quickly, and the employees were nice. 

The reason why I didn't really enjoy the restaurant was solely because of the food. I got Phat Rice and Urbanbelly Ramen. Both seemed to mix different Asian tastes including Indian curry. I wasn't expecting that and while I enjoy all Asian foods including Indian curry, having it all mixed together wasn't enjoyable. I by no means hated the food, I just wouldn't go there on my own. However, if somebody I wanted to eat there really badly I would go along. 

In regards to the Ramen, there are definitely better places to get ramen. I do prefer more traditional ramen though, so do take that into consideration when deciding whether to go to Urbanbelly.

Ok sums it up.  

We ordered the dumplings, pad thai, shrimp and each got a drink.  The dumplings were delicious and were probably our favorite. We split the pad thai and shrimp for the main. The pad thai was not what I was expecting (round rice cake noodles) which was a nice change. The shrimp and pad thai were fine but not particularly memorable.  What was memorable was how small everything was for the price.

This place is okay/meh on its own, but such a disappointment compared to its predecessor. Oh, how I miss picking up a giant, inexpensive takeout portion and a Thai iced tea from Penny's on my way home from the Damen el stop. Anyway....

I've gotten takeout from here once -- the dumplings are ok, a little pricey and nothing to write home about. The rice cake pad thai is not great. Points for creativity, I guess, but the portion size is ridiculously small for $13. There just wasn't enough rice cake for the amount of garlic/chive topping.

The second time I came here, it was only because they sent a $10 off coupon, so a friend and I dined on the nice little outside patio. I got the phat noodle, which was decent enough, as were the maple-glazed mini donuts. Definitely recommend those two items over the pad thai and dumplings.

All in all, Urbanbelly is just too pricey for what it offers, and unfortunately, for those of us who have been in the neighborhood for a bit, cannot compare to Penny's :(

I'm an Urbanbelly fan. Id often order dinner and the next day's lunch from their first location so when I saw the wicker park location opening I was stoked to be even closer! I stopped in on their opening week knowing opening weeks can be tough. Well, it was busy and service was still great. Ordered quickly, sat down by the window and my beer and food came right out. Yum, the food was just as good as always.  Here are a few key recommendations of what to order.... Everything.

As sad as it is to see Penny's go, especially for two transplants who have a particular affinity for cheap Thai food, we (specifically my fiance) are happy to welcome to the neighborhood its replacement Urban Belly!

The Friday dinner crowd, its first weekend service, was at the newly remodeled space to celebrate the opening. 

Having not been to the West Loop location or its sister restaurant Belly Shack under the "Western" L, I had very little to expect other than I knew they had reasonably priced ramen, noodles, and rice dishes.

The Phat Rice and Pad Thai here are stellar. The Phat Rice included pork belly, lemongrass chicken, AND bibimbap beef. All great. The Pad Thai came with some rather non-traditional noodles and shrimp. I would certainly recommend both dishes.

Customer service was attentive and friendly, and the waiters were quick with the dishes and any requests we had.

While it is not bang-for-your-buck as Penny's, this is a fine option to have a few blocks away. I am eager to try some more dishes and hopefully have an opportunity to enjoy one of the in-house cocktails.

Best new dish in Wicker Park: pork & pineapple. Succulent, layered flavors, extremely fresh and a hearty but not crazy helping.

There's a ton of new noodle, ramen, Asian fusion places in Wicker Park as of late. I've been systematically trying them all. This is by far my favorite so far.

Open for lunch!!!!!! Great people watching out the big windows in the heart of Wicker Park.

Six Words: Enjoyed the dumpings but they're overpriced

A few days ago I checked out their "Grand Opening" on my way home from work. My friend and I heard about it online and decided to walk by. They had a bunch of specials on so it probably would've been a great night to sample more of the menu. But we didin't.

Maybe it's just me, but I'm sort of over all the ramen-esque shops that keep popping up around Wicker Park. So I didn't even look at the ramen options. But I did see dumplings so I ordered the beef and cheddar and the sweet potato ones for To-Go.

When I arrived home, I pounced. The sweet potato ones looked like little flying saucers and had so little filling. They weren't entirely flavorful. They also had spinach draped all over them. It was a weird presentation for take-out. The beef and cheddar ones are where it's at though. They looked like miniature pot pies and you could dip them in horseradish sauce (not too strong - just right). Those were good. I wish I could eat more of them right now.

My one issue is the pricing. Because I went during their "Grand Opening" (I heard it had been open for a least a week at that point), the dumplings were $5. Regular price is $6.95. You get 4 in an order. I'm sorry, but $7 and some change for tax is just a little too much, especially for the tiny sweet potato ones. I probably won't come back. Even though I really enjoyed the beef and cheddar dumplings.

I would glance by every day when it was under construction, and was dying to check it out once it opened. It definitely didn't disappoint. We had the urbanbelly ramen, sweet potato & maple dumplings, and the lemongrass chicken.
The urbanbelly ramen was really good, and the broth had the perfect level of spicy to give it that extra kick. As for the pork belly, I wasn't the biggest fan just because of the amount of fat, but it was definitely flavorful.
The sweet potato & maple dumplings were very sweet, but the faint hint of feta balanced it out perfectly. No complaints there!
As for the lemongrass chicken, the lemongrass flavor was very overpowering and was one of the only flavors in the dish.
Even though, I definitely can't wait to come back and try some of the other things on their menu.

Food is great, service is fantastic. 

Both instances take out & dine in have been pleasant.

Great new find we stopped by for a fantastic lunch today and were impressed with the flavors of the menu. Had the grilled sesame noodles and cleaned it up. The passion fruit lemonade was so refreshing. They even asked if we had any food allergies . One great plus is the had sparkling water and still water complimentary .

So I consider myself a bit of a hot dog snob, owning a few hot dog shops. I heard about the Belly Dog and had to stop in and try it, I mean noodles, kimchee and mango on a dog? Well after the first bit I fell in love with it, the presentation and the flavors were out of this world. Bill Kim and his staff have taken this dog to a different level, with the eye appeal, as well as the taste here. The relaxed atmosphere, as well as the upbeat feel provided are a win-win! Keep it up guys, a great addition to the Wicker Park area.

Howwww does this place have more than 3 stars!! Spent 27 on ramen for delivery and it was TERRIBLE!! Broth was weird and tomato based, no molten egg, pork was slimy in this soy mixture... Just bad all around

Went the other day with my girlfriend.  Nice fast-casual restaurant that is a little more relaxed than some of the places nearby.
I got the phat rice and she got the phat noodle.  The pork belly was really tasty and crispy and the chicken was delicious, although a little odd since it was sort of ground up?  The rice itself wasn't anything special and the beef was kind of eh.  The beef dumplings, however, were really good and had a very different flavor that I am used to.

Staff was friendly, food came out quickly(it appears to come out as its ready since I got my food first, then our dumplings and then my girlfriends entree).  Overall, pretty good place that I would recommend but it just barely gets a four.
Even better then the location in the west loop! You HAVE to get the phat rice and the Kirin on draft.

Urbanbelly is just OK.  For the price, everything could just be a little bit better.  For starters, it's super pricey for a counter service joint.  If I'm spending $20+, it feels like I should get a little more ambiance than communal tables with uncomfortable stools.  And if the portions were huge, that would be one thing, but they really aren't.  In my group of three girls, 2/3 finished their whole portion, plus we shared 2 orders of dumplings.  I would venture to guess that a bigger guy would legitimately leave hungry.  As for the food, it was good but not amazing.  I had the Phat Rice, which had a nice variety of meats, although the pork belly bits were by far my favorite, but the least plentiful.  Overall, not sure I'd go back considering how many other (better) Asian restaurants are in the area.

Came here by happenstance after great things about the OG Urban Belly downtown. 

The ambience is pretty cool, with ordering at the front and long tables dispersed around the locale.  At the table, there are extra seasonings, bowls, and silverware.

Food-wise, we unfortunately disappointed!  Although their pork and cilantro dumplings were pretty good, the rest of our order (phat rice and phat noodles) left much to be expected.

The seasoning of both dishes were good, but the meat itself was either too fatty or too dry!  The noodles themselves were strongly curried and did not retain the original flavor of the dish well.  I think a vegetarian version of the dish could have held up pretty well... But alas

Glad we tried it out but...Will likely not return due to the disappointing dishes and rather elevated prices for what we got :/

What happened here?  I love this belly group of restaurants and Belly Q is awesome.  This misses the mark repeatedly. Everything we have had in two occasions is too rich and flavors are not satisfying.  So now we have a more expensive version of a food similar to Penny's, yet nowhere near as good.

Please revisit your recipes and fix this!  The concept is great and the area will support it, but it's way off right now.

New place in the wicker park area. 
I ordered the pork and cilantro dumplings. They were decent. They tasted okay nothing too amazing. 

My boyfriend ordered the urban belly ramen. That was really tasteful. The broth had a kick of spicy which was great. The pork belly -personally- was good. Tasted like carnitas. My boyfriend wasn't a big fan of it because of the amount of fat it had. In it you're given about three big pieces of pork belly. 

Next the manger/owner (I'm assuming) recommended is the Pad Thai. And Oh my god.! It was delicious. Would definitely come back for that dish alone. The mix of flavors were amazing! Shrimp, cucumber, peanuts, chive and more. Took a big bite of everything together and its like I needed a moments to analyze all the flavors. So good. 

Welcome Urban Belly to Wicker park.

I knew when a non-Asian friend suggested we eat here that I was in trouble. This place is ok. Ramen noodle with pork belly soup was barely lukewarm. Ugh my pet peeve. Soup should be hot. It was tasty with huge pork chunk. Pork cilantro dumplings were ok. I hated the edamame sprinkled with spicy pepper. Yuck!  I love spicy foods, but didn't like spicing on edamame which ruined it.  Service was friendly.  Passion fruit lemonade was delicious.  There's better food in Chinatown.

The flavors are kind of bland. Nothing was really memorable except for maybe the dumplings. I wouldn't really recommend it, especially for the price. 

Food we ordered:

Phat Rice
Pad Thai 
Eggplant (served cold)
Kimchi 
Sweet Potato Dumplings
Pork and Cilantro Dumplings

Use to love going to Penny's but was excited that another restaurant was opening up so soon in their spot that was similar. Well let me tell you, it is NOT noodles and dumplings like you are expecting. I ordered the pork & cilantro dumplings to start. I love steamed dumplings but these were really watery and wet, and kept sliding around the plate every time I tried to cut them in half to dip into the soy balsamic sauce it came with. My next dish was the Phat-Noodle which I ordered per recommendation of the girl taking my order. This was an oily mess and the "crispy" pork belly was pretty much inedible and the braised beef was a little tougher than my liking for a noodle dish. Also, their prices are VERY high for the amount of food you are getting. 4 small dumplings for $7 and $13 for the Phat Noodle dish! If the food was amazing I wouldn't be so inclined to gripe, but it wasn't.
i'm a tourist here in chicago and the first place i stopped at was urbanbelly. the young coconut pho is definitely one to try during your visit here!

Newest location from the owners of belly shack (which I hear is closing soon)
We ordered delivery via grub hub. I had the peashoot rice, which was pretty good. We had the Lemongrass chicken ( Good, but the chicken was minced), and others had the Phat noodle and phat rice (short ribs and pork). All of the main dishes were pretty good, and resonanly priced. We started with the spiced edemame, and kimchi. We also had the feta and sweet potato dumplings which are really small, so order two orders for four adults. 
The kids all had breaded chicken and rice, the chicken was breaded and a bit hard, maybe would have been better in house
delivery was fast via Grub hub (cost is about 85 bucks for four adults and four kids (5 bucks a meal).
Overall, I would say good for a quick dinner, and I'm thinking eating there would have been better food in general

The pork cilantro dumplings are pretty damn fantastic. 



Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Proin ut ante dignissim ex accumsan sagittis quis eget ex. Duis aliquet, felis vitae scelerisque ornare, ante lectus ornare sapien, in dignissim elit erat ut massa. Morbi nulla odio, posuere eu ligula eget, tincidunt facilisis lectus.
Tasty engaging food and great service. Tried the pork and cilantro dumping, yum! I will be back.
Sucks! No flavor at all... Go to furious spoon and save ur money! Good concept poor execution

I will admit this place is a splurge for me but the menu is interesting enough to attract me. I've been here twice and both times, the food has been good quality and well flavored.

The sweet potato maple dumplings are excellent and the cold eggplant side IS worth the $4 price tag.  The staff is also very friendly and reliable. They're quick with suggestions and asked about allergies without having to be told.  Definite thumbs up there!

Also, the matcha mint and ginger plum teas have great flavor and aren't sweet.

That said, this place is a little too pricey for the experience. I'd come again, but not soon.

got takeout from here. the phat rice was awesome and the pad Thai was pretty legit too. the beef and cheddar dumplings were a must get for me. So overall the food was pretty awesome. 

I did not go to the actual restaurant so I can't comment on that. 

I would def eat here again!

I have no complaints! I got the phat noodles and the matcha mint tea, and they were both beyond my expectations. The meat in the noodles were cooked to perfection, the pork belly being especially delicious and moist. The noodles were yummy on their own, the sauce their covered in a meal in itself. The tea was incredibly refreshing. It was so smooth and light - I wish it were running through my veins. I love the self-service water station with the choice of still or sparkling water. The bowls on the table are great for sharing, not that I would let anyone near my food - it's way too good to share or even take home - no leftovers here! I would love to try everything on the menu, but for now the phat noodles were an uncontested A+!

Disappointed. We live in the neighborhood and were really excited to try it out. We did takeout a few nights ago. I ordered the pad thai after reading some good reviews and it was just not right. The noodles were very undercooked and after eating a few I fished through and took them all out. I'm not sure if they are less accountable for their takeout food than dine-in, but this one terrible dish will probably mean I don't try it again. My husband had another noodle dish that was ok, but not great. The dumplings were very good but pretty sad looking in the takeout container. Also, the dumpling sauce arrived spilled, but inside of a plastic bag as though they were planning on it spilling? Really not impressed and there is too much good food elsewhere in the neighborhood to go back.

Disappointing. Overpriced. Lacked value and enticing options on the menu. Have had the Phat Rice, the Wheat Berry Bipimbap, the Pea Shoot, and the Sweet Potato dumplings. Overall, unimpressed. Maybe ramen or pho is the way to go?  Much prefer Belly Shack over either Urban Belly.
Thank you for giving me legit gluten-free options! I miss Penny's, but I must say the food quality, menu, and service here have been consistently great. Pricey but worth it.

Such a disappointment. Every time we get delivery, never fails they miss something. The ticket on my bag clearly states my order & they just can't get it right. 

The second time, I called after placing my order online to confirm that they'd remember all my items and the sauces on the side-- fail. We wrote it on the ticket 3times and they still forgot the sauces.

So bad, that we decided to order from the Randolph Street location and pay extra for Postmates to deliver even though we live less than a few blocks away. Get it together Urban Belly, Damen.

Went here because it replaced penny's noodles which used to be one of my favorite spots in wicker park. Went to try this place. Was very disappointed in the food I chose, my co workers had Noodles Jr. I had the Phat rice we all disliked the food was cold, and top of that was not tasty at all. Very odd taste, we went back to return our food. Had never done that before but it was too over priced and we were not pleased at all. Will not return. And wouldn't recommend it.

Such a great addition to the hood. Bill Kim, while a different than his other "belly"  concepts, he has another winner here. Had the pork dumplings and lemongrass chicken rice. Great Flavors all around. The menu has some intriguing combinations I look forward to trying. Perfect location. Outdoor space forthcoming the staff mentioned. Interior design has me rethinking my own choices at home. Worth the trip if you are not from the area. If you are, walk in anytime(parking still sucks) ;)

I was really excited to see another Asian fusion restaurant open up after being disappointed to see Penny's noodles close. After trying this place out on Saturday evening it's safe to say WE WANT PENNY'S BACK!

Overall the atmosphere was nice, there is a decent sized patio and a large indoor dining area. I wasn't a huge fan of the order/pay first and then take a number to your table format. It's hard to distinguish how large these portions are going to be and how much food you will need. It also didn't help that we kept feeling rushed by the cashier as he continuously asked if we knew what we wanted yet. The staff should have more patience considering they're new in the neighborhood.

We ended up ordering a side of the eggplant, the phat noodles and the lemongrass chicken. First off, if you don't like scallions you should make sure to address this beforehand because every dish arrived covered in them and it is not included in the description. The portion sizes were smaller than anticipated - certainly not sharing size unless you're getting a couple. Eggplant was satisfactory, it was cut into small pieces swimming in this soy/vinegar sauce. The lemongrass chicken had good flavors and I didn't notice the chicken being too dry like many places. The phat noodles,however, was a salt mine! Holy sh*t, I had to chug at least 3 glasses of water to eat this dish. My tongue felt like it was dipped in the dead sea and left out in the Mojave desert to dry. I would not suggest getting this unless you have a high tolerance for salt.

Ultimately, it wasn't a great value for what you get but I would be willing to go back and try the dumplings. They looked pretty good at the table next to us.

Very flavorful. You cannot go wrong if you're looking for something a little bit different. The food came out super fast! Chef Bill Kim masters his marinades and will not miss. Noodles are on point. Beer list is legit. Sauces are spectacular. Great addition to the Wicker food scene.

I'd probably give this a 3.5 but am rounding up because of the excellent service. I had the pork and pineapple which was very good. My wife tried the wheat berry bibimbap but didn't care for it. Staff was incredibly nice about it and happy to replace it and customize a bowl for her which she liked. We ordered our kids the Chicken Rice. The chicken was like a fried chicken cutlet in slices. They were OK with it. Cool place, communal tables which weren't an issue for us as we were there during an 'off' time.
The food was good but unreasonably pricey for small portions. It wasn't worth the money.

PROS
- Great tasting food
- Fast service
- Super friendly staff

CONS
- Communal seating
- Small portions
- No fountain drinks

So we tried the new Urbanbelly on Damen before their open house. With as busy as it was, it makes me wonder what it'll be like after their open house. I ordered the Pad Thai, an iced coffee and the mini donuts. The Pad Thai had these round, flat noodles in them, which I thought were fine, but one of the servers said people either love them or hate them. REALLY enjoyed the mini donuts. All the food came out quickly. And everyone working there was very friendly, from the woman who took our order at the counter to the people who brought out the food and cleared the plates. 

The cons? I'm NOT a fan of communal seating. I like having a private conversation when I dine out, which becomes impossible when you've got someone you don't know sitting right next to you. And not having fountain drinks is just a pet peeve of mine. I was also surprised how small the portion of Pad Thai was.
