Food was good, service is bad, but with only one waitress for over 10 tables I guess you can't expect much, the crowd isn't great, I guess you can chalk it up to bad location, at least they don't charge a lot, I wouldn't be back, maybe just for take out.

Never knew about this place until my Co worker took me. What's crazy is my job is a block from here and I never heard about this place. Food is amazing service is just perfect. They have amazing live talent. Only thing is the music was so loud we couldn't talk to each other while we had dinner. Overall I'm definitely coming back!

Uninviting outside look, yet comfortable atmosphere inside.

The empanadas are a must try! I would recommend having them as an appetizer and highly recommend the ham & cheese and the corn & cheese. We also tried the beef which was good, though not much to it (just filled with ground beef and some onion). 

IMPORTANT: You get 6 empanadas and they are cooked where you can literally rip them in half - so if you only want to 'try' one of the options you don't have to order 2. 

The mojitos are good, just slightly over priced ($10 each). I would have liked to order a few of priced around $7-8, but when you can get an IPA for $6...

Server was friendly, music was nice. The place is dark inside but it works.

Never been here to dance, only for food and drinks. Some of the best steak I've had in Chicago. The Filet and the skirt steak are both incredible, as are the mashed potatoes and fries. It's well priced for a steak dinner, and a lot easier to get a table than at Tango Sur. Pretty dimly lit, and the few tables they have in the main room are pretty close together, but the food and helpful staff make up for it. (Plus it's sort of a romantic spot, so the dim lighting is expected.) The last time I was there it was not very crowded as we came right after it opened, so we sat at the bar, and the bartender was super nice and helpful, a lot of fun to talk with. I will definitely be back.

Came here looking for the same atmosphere as Tango Sur, sadly it wasn't ... Very slow night for a Friday, they sat us promptly which was great, but we were the only table in the back area. It wasn't byob which was a bummer, the filet was over cooked too. I'll be sticking to Tango sur for sure
Didn't do dinner however the drinks were great and the ambiance is very laid back and cool. Definitely a unique establishment.

I got the steak. Was quite fatty (not a bad thing) but a little simple for the price. The menu read almost like a lunch menu, rather than a dinner selection. 

The mojitos are fantastic. 

The ambiance left something to be desired. As did the service.

This place is a gem nestled along Elston. Came here with a group and we had the back room reserved. Mojitos are great and they have various flavors (guava, passionfruit, pineapple, and regular from what I remember).

Empanadas are excellent as well!

This has become one of my favorite places. THE DRINKS ARE PERFECT!! My favorite is their Mojito. They also have amazing food! I would recommend MILANESA (chicken) "la napilotana". It is a small place but the atmosphere makes it very welcoming. In the occasions that I have been to Ñ they have great music. Would recommend for anyone looking to have a good time.

Stopped in on a Tuesday around 6:30pm, was excited to try this place.  Inside it was almost empty, only 1 other table.

Pros - the mojitos and empanadas are delicious. Ample free parking nearby.
Cons - the other food we had was not good, espeically the mixta del mar - YUCK - defrosted seafood with olive oil and lemon.  Also, service was mediocre.

There are plenty of good places to get mojitos and empanadas in Chicago so you have to offer more than that to make me come back.  Disappointing.

This place is quite hidden, but it easily makes it on my list of top bars that I've been to in Chicago. The drinks are great! Their Mojitos are so damn good! The Mango Picado has a little spicy kick to it, but it's very delicious as well. The empanadas are so tasty, I definitely recommend them! 

Pretty dark and the music can get pretty loud, but I don't see that as a bad thing! I love the vibe of this place! Every time I go, I have a great time! I don't see too much dancing here. For the dudes: not a place to pick up girls at, I'd just bring a girl with you and enjoy what this bar has to offer! 

Everyone is so laid back here. You get a very diverse crowd of people. There's not a dress code, but people usually come here wearing something a little on the nicer side. Great servers and bartenders!

Overall: Highly Recommended

I was looking for a cool, casual place to get a quality cocktail near my house. Nailed it. Effing delicious mojito and other crafty Mexican themed drinks. Sexy, unique atmosphere. A DJ I actually liked for maybe the first time ever. 
Ñ place is a diamond in the ruff.

Came here on a random Sunday night and man was it popping!

The bar was dark and  very small in front but there is plenty of seating in the back area.The back area is really cute too. It would be great if they had like an open patio area that was more connected to the bar.

At one point my girlfriends and I ended up trying to dance on the smallest dance floor possible- it was awesome I felt like I was teleported to Latin America and just vibing out. But seriously the smallest dance floor possible like I literally could join the band drumming on the drums while dancing

They have live music there that night- it was a rotation between 2-3 bands. They were all very good but man was it loud! (Maybe, I am getting old lol).

Empandads were amazing- got an order of one of each kind. Each was just as good as the last.

The drinks were also fantastic!

I defiantly would love to come back but one thing I am not looking forward to would be the loud music.

What are you waiting for?!? Come to this amazing dive bar!
This place is consistently yummy,  fun,  & upbeat.  Love it every time! You HAVE to try the Argentinian empanadas! Deliciously great quality. Had my birthday party here last year.

If you get a chance to go on the last Thursday of every month you'll get to hear Damian Rivero playing with his band.
Great place to go and unwind. Friendly staff and the prices are accessible. Highly recommended bar.

I love the atmosphere for dinner here. Dark wood, dim lighting and plants make it cozy.  I got the eggplant with the tomato sauce which was creamy and rich and I loved. I really loved the corn empanadas. The crust was flaky and crispy and the insides were creamy.  Get a mojito! A quiet Friday dinner place slowly turns into a loud dance mix from the dj, but somehow it just worked.  I think this off the beaten spot is a treasure.

Came Halloween but probably the wrong time if we wanted something chill and quieter. Music was obnoxiously loud and we could not converse. Haven't tried the food if I'm honest and would come back for that bit tip to owners music in the bar area is fine but lower the volume in the dining area.

We did not eat here, but came in after dinner for some drinks. The drinks were amazing. We tried the mojitos as well as a couple of the martinis (peach and raspberry). All were phenomenal. Even though the drinks were strong, they tasted delicious!  We will be back and try the dinner next.

Came here with a group of girls after work and this place did not disappoint ! 

It's a small little place very cute and dim. The atmosphere is very intimate so it can also be great place for a date night ! 

Ordered empanadas and they were so finger licking good !  

When I asked a friend what drinks she recommended and she pointed at the menu and said all of them! Well I didn't get to try all of them but La Passion and La Piña were perfect !
Amazing drinks here, and the prices for the drinks were beyond fair for what you get.
Very good mojitos. Nice staff as well. Good music. Love this place. Very cute. I will def be back. Little pricey tho but that's expected for the area.

Neat little out of the way location and one I was excited to try. I always enjoy finding places off the beaten path. The only reason I knew of it was because I always take Rockwell off California and on to Belmont when I am going to the Marianos. (Y'all know what I'm talking about!)

Anyhoo the decor, and theme are appealing; Argentine gastro-pub, I like that. The interior is dim, but pleasant and the service was pretty friendly. Those were the good things.

The food was simply okay, no complaints but nothing that really impressed me either.

The music was absolutely atrocious though. House music blasting at such a high volume that I had to yell to talk to my friend sitting literally one foot away from me. I asked our waitress if she could turn it down and she said she could ask the DJ but that he most likely would not and she was right, he did not turn it down.... Keep in mind this was at 7 pm on a Wednesday. There were about six people inside all middle aged and all eating dinner, no one was dancing or at the bar. My head was throbbing after about 30 minutes of this so we quickly finished our meals and left. Maybe I'll stop in late night some time to check out the scene but I would never come in for a casual meal again.

This place is great, its so versatile. I've been there for my husbands birthday, a sweet 15 and a date night. Their mojitos are amazing and its a great place to rent out of good music and nice atmosphere!

I'm a huge fan of good Argentinian food and an absolute sucker for a semi formal, sexy ambiance that comes with a young, vibrant feel. This lounge accomplishes all of that.

We came on a Thursday night in a rather large group of around 16 people. The Dj was playing tango and salsa mixed with hip hop beats, Jamaican reggae and had a live performer playing the drums to the rhythms - that made the place extremely interesting to be at. The waitress was very sweet, and did her absolute best to accommodate us - by opening up the back room and adjusting everything to our liking. 

The wines were very good quality, and when everybody began to dance I knew I picked the right place. 

The range of diverse groups of people that come here is incredible. That same night we met a professional salsa dancer out for the night, an entire tango band, two reggae lovers from Jamaica, a rapper from the west coast and an aspiring writer. It was really fun and the atmosphere was unbeatable. 

We also came back on a Friday to a much smaller, more targeted crowd for salsa and bachata only. I'd say Thursdays are the nights to go for a more mixed experience (in every meaning of that word) which Friday and Saturday nights will be more specific to a particular type of crowd.

The bar is small but great to see and hear live music.  Their bands are all very good; I've yet to be disappointed.  It's a little too loud for dinner conversation during live music, but that's not why you're there!  The empanada sampler is great bang-for-your-buck, and there's always good drink specials on bottled beer or special cocktails.  It doesn't look like much on the outside, but it's dark and comfy inside.

Is there anything better than little hole in the wall restaurants that you might otherwise walk past without even a second thought?  No.  The answer is no.

Don't walk past N.  It is the perfect place for a girls night out or an intimate date night with your sig o.  There is a pretty good list of cocktails (around $9-$12) and even though the food list isn't that big, the taste certainly is.

I started off with La Passion: a passion fruit cocktail which was rum, passion fruit juice, and sugar.  I hadn't eaten in a while and I'm kind of (read: totally) a lightweight so I was definitely feeling my drink about halfway through.  I wish I would have gotten another one, but my wallet was happy I decided against it.  I had a sip of my friend's mango mojito and it was super refreshing.  I'd love to be sipping on that after strolling around the city on a hot summer day.

There were three of us at dinner and we were all eyeing pretty much the same things so we decided to split three dishes: 

Empanadas: Five stars.  So good!  The outside was nice and crispy while the inside was hot and delicious.  Our favorites were the corn and cheese and the spinach.  They came with an oil with herbs for drizzling/dipping.  Delicious!

Noqui (gnocchi): Four stars.  I love gnocchi.  A noodley dish made from potatoes and served with a creamy tomato sauce?  This is the kind of dish my dreams are made of.

Ravioli: Three stars.  The rav was okay.  Nothing great, but it wasn't bad.

Make sure when you visit N to get the empanadas and a cocktail!  My taste buds were all kinds of happy.  It's the perfect to place to begin or end your night!

I went to that place two times, and the last time that I went was because my friends wanted to know the place, and I still feel the same way, I do not like this place!!! it's too busy on weekends and it's too cramped

Amazing!!!! I'm one for Argentinian and South American cuisine and this place has perfected it well! 
Amazing empanadas !

I recommend going on a Tuesday night for the live bossa nova band

Ñ is a bar that apparently is owned by someone who wants to make sure that you can't find it when you search for it online. I'd love to know the thought process behind the name as you can't find it in your GPS, it's impossible to find on Google, and if I hadn't checked in when we got there I'm not sure I would've been able to find it on Yelp to review it. So, good job on that, I guess. Maybe they're going for some sort of super exclusive secret thing, who knows.

The bar seemed pretty typical for what I've come to expect out of most bars in the city. Small, sort of crowded, weird seating, really dark, live music that seems cool at first but then just becomes obnoxious as you can't hear what anyone is saying, etc. I don't know, I'd love to leave a more respectable Yelp review for this place as it feels really sort but Ñ to me just felt like every bar.

Their beer selection is decent, I guess. I was able to order a 5 Rabbit there which you can't find everywhere, and Delirium Tremens is also available. The mojitos they serve here are good, and come with enough citrus in them to fend off scurvy for months. At least parking nearby was easy.
Loved the food and drinks, but the service was very slow. Would definitely go back, but hoping for a better overall experience.

Welcome to Latin night!

My friends and I, a group of about 10, decided to venture in after a night out for dinner,  a few had been before and seemed to really enjoy it.  The entrance is a bit odd as one door leads to a tiny vestibule before another leads to the actual bar.  Upon our arrival many were already in full 'swing' as they moved their way around the somewhat small 'dance' area.

The bar is long enough to seat about 15 people comfortably and there were a few tables along the outer wall for others to sit.  Our group knew there was more, so we ventured past the somewhat interesting smelling bathrooms to the back room.  "Wow! I can breath!".

The backroom was completely empty it too had tables along the outer walls and a few lounge like seats just as soon as you walked in.  We took over, and the dance area was plenty big for most of us to enjoy the non-stop Latin spins.

The drinks weren't too pricey about 10$ each for what we had (sorry don't remember most of the night, let alone what I was drinking) and the 'waitress' was attentive and ready to help us 'enjoy our night'.  Unfortunately, the backroom closes at 1, so our 'personal space' was soon moved to the front, crowded and awkward dance area...  Didn't much matter, we still dance the night away.

Have always wanted to try this minuscule place on the corner. This place is so tiny, you might miss it if you blink. Or sneeze. I'm not a mojito kinda gal, until I tried their mango one. OH. EM. GEE. The mint is so refreshing, and the booze keeps me wanting more. Ordered the empanadas, which were quite tasty. The 'mar', which is a small appetizer of mixed seafood sautéed with olive oil was perfect. I ordered the breaded chicken, tho that one wasn't as fantastical to jump off a cliff to. The bf got the steak, which was definitely something worth slapping yo mama! Overall, the bill was worth it. Loved the samba music they played-- Very mellow and classy. Something Astrud Gilberto, Stan Getz, or I would love. Unfortunately, they ended up changing it to some ghetto big booty music. On a good note, I did love me their mojitos and am missing them already!!
Only giving 2 stars bc my review won't post otherwise::: Mediocre mojitos, Bad food, music blows your eardrums, bad Mar..will not be back!
Great atmosphere... Amazing Empanades! Try Brazilian Samba on Tuesday nights; great music, awesome dancers

Came to celebrate a friends birthday. Only the front part of the restaurant was open on this particular night so we sat at the bar. The bartenders are friendly and quick. Should have known that this place is owned by the same people from Folklore because it is so damn dark in there. There were maybe 12 people in total there and the music was way too loud. I could barely hear my friend and were siting right next to each other.  Didn't get any food here as we just came for drinks but don't think I'll be back to try it.
The ambience is perfect and the mojitos are amazing -- best in Chicago. You'll walk in and think the place is tiny. Don't be fooled, theres a whole back area.

Did I dream I went here last night? 

There is NO WAY I'm not hungover. 
Not possible. 
But, I am not. 
Abundance of fresh limes save the day? 

Once I figure out why the world has given me this gift, I shall complete this review....

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

I've concluded that the drinking gods granted me a freebie tolerance weekend...after careful reflection I really should've enjoyed this a little more, but one never knows when the rug will be pulled out, and they will be found spinning around the room eating peanut butter sandwiches and regretting the rockstar attempt. 

Ok, so. Ñ (from Wikipedia):  Nobel Prize winner in literature Gabriel García Márquez expressed "The 'Ñ' is not an archaeological piece of junk, but just the opposite: a cultural leap of a Romance language that left the others behind in expressing with only one letter a sound that other languages continue to express with two."

So, fitting. 

For the first time in all of my Chicago nightlife endeavors...I felt...content? fascinated? at ease? expressive. excited. 

Drinks: Join my Fantasy Cocktail League, here's my draft lineup: La Negra, served in a martini glass...basically a blackberry, blueberry, rum-laden blend of buzz. Mmmmmm, limit one for me. Desire = 4. Follow-up, blackberry mojito. Truth, I'm not even much of a mojito drinker, but this was a double tall glass of fairytale drunkness, complete with at least 1.5 fresh limes, squeezed...real blackberries. 

They must have a good produce hook-up, just saying. Magically fresh. 

Vibe: skews a bit older, thank God. Keep the youngins east, please. Dark, sultry, candlelight, wood floors, flickering fiery conversations, great music I've never heard, but after aforementioned cocktailing, I think I can know it, love it, dance to it and forget how white I am for just a night....perhaps. Just overall...genuine, non-pretentious, hidden, somewhat secretive...(not so much anymore, but still)...and real people. 

Location: absolutely unassuming, typical "diamond in the rough," a stone's throw from California/Belmont intersection (Avondale). Cabs are hard to come by, keep that Flash number in your phone, ours arrived moments after calling one in (+1 Flash). 

Sexy. It just is. As overused as that word is...it fits. A great after dinner cocktail spot...La Negra must be on your list, I implore you.

Ñ has a cool vibe and the good music makes for a nice atmosphere. Unfortunately the food for dinner left much to be desired. I ordered the tilapia that came breaded and smothered in a heavy butter sauce; there was more covering the fish that I couldn't even taste the fish itself. I might go back for the music and atmosphere, but will definitely pass on dinner.
The food was very good but there was a funky smell and I was not able to enjoy my food. The place is a bit dim for my liking.

I have been coming here for well over a year now, all of the staff know me and address me by first name not sure if that's good haha. Natti the bartender is super sweet and has become a great friend, I generally go in by myself but they always treat me like family. Food is still great, and parking is easy. Don't go on Monday they're closed...

Best kept secret in Avondale. I always drove past wondering what was inside. 2 years ago I was on a late night stroll with my pooches and noticed people outside smoking. Then someone opened the door and I smelled something so delicious I had to get a closer look. So I walked up to the front of the building. Read the menu posted outside. Then I peek inside a little and see people dancing salsa and there was a live singer and band. This was like an Oasis in the desert. I took my dogs home, called up a friend and went there for dinner immediately. The food, the music, the ambience and the people were amazing in my book. Haven't had a chance to go back but I will very soon.

I want to say I have to come back and give this place a second chance because they bombed my first meal experience.  

First off, you need a blind mans sick to get around because it is SO dark. I grabbed the candle plus my cell just to view the menu. Mind you, we were the only patrons there the whole night!  That was too weird. Then I had to change tables because they were so wobbly and my water kept spilling on each movement.  

I ordered La Negra and waited in anticipation for this wonderful martini. Um, to my surprise it was mostly juice with a fifth of liquor.  This was sooooo disappointing since this place is known for its drinks. 

We started off with the beef empanadas. I couldn't see what was in them so I was forced to use my sense of taste instead. They had boiled eggs in them which was so weird to me. I only had one since it was such a turn off.

I also ordered the beef milaneza which is the breaded steak.  This meat was thick wich is weird for milaneza which I've always had it thin and crispy.  It was ok but definately needed some salt. I ordered a side of chimichuri sauce just to give it more ooommpfffff.   

The waitress was so nice which made me feel bad that I was writing this place off, that is why I decided to give it one more chance - but only for drinks!  Hopefully this time they give me liquor.
Awesome vibe, food and drinks!  The empanadas are a must!  Can't go wrong with any of the steak options.  The chimichuri sauce on the side is pretty good as well.  Will definitely be back here
Loved the atmosphere and drinks! I had a drink called La Negra, totally recommend it!

So I went there with my boyfriend around 7pm on a Tuesday night and we were the only ones in the restaurant. I read that the mojitos were fabulous which i found it to be mediocre at best. My boyfriend had a pineapple coconut drink that was actually really good. 

    We ordered the 5 empanadas with one of each kind....the corn cheese one is soooooo good....definitely get those the others were good and the sauce it comes with was also heavenly. I ordered the Lomito completo (where a fried egg and cheese is added) which is a sandwich...i thought it was ok..i have made better myself. My boyfriend had the "Pescado" which was Tilapia served with mashed potatoes and a tomato salad. Ok so it wasn't anything special...i found it odd that it said it came with salad and they brought a bowl of tomatoes. 

I like the decor, its a very hip trendy kinda place, dark lit by tea candles, which were blown out by the draft coming from the window behind me. Service was good but overall I think it is way over priced for the quality of food and location of the place. I mean our bill including tip  with two drinks two entrees and an app came to over 70 dollars! I did not feel i received the experience I should have for that price.

This place is small but it's absolutely the best! Girls wanted to do a night out so we headed here for dinner. Started off with I believe it was a blackberry mojito. Amazing! I highly recommend it. There was great music being mixed by a Dj while we were chatting and enjoying drinks. We ordered some sort of seafood appetizer, sort of like a seviche. It was seafood on a bed of greens. Also pretty amazing! 
All us girls split an eggplant dish and the tilapia. I cannot describe to you how great the food was, I was totally sold on this place after the food. 
While we ate a guy jumped on drums while the DJ spinned. They had such good taste in music, they played everything from The Roots, to Salsa, to Pharcyde, Reggae and Eryka Badu. We couldn't stop moving around in our seats dancing while we enjoyed this phenomenal dinner. 
The waitress was amazing! She was so adorable because by the time we got to our meals quite a few couples and girls were up dancing and she would dance up to our table to check if we were fine and bring us more drinks. I loved that even she couldn't sit still. "Can you dance?" must be one of the requirements on the job application lol. 
I'm not sure what nights they have live music on but we got lucky on a Wednesday when we randomly stopped in. 
Beware, some legit dancers are in the house and you can tell they love this spot. They do not hold out on the Salsa moves. Impressive !

I really enjoy coming to ñ.... 

Let me start with what I love..... 

Great Date place ((Book mark Now)) 

I love the mojitos. And that one male bartender on Wednesday who just rocks it out. You think you'll wait for ever but he's so fast and efficient he gets the job done. 

I've been coming here for awhile now and I have to say the coconut and black berry mojito are my favorite. they usually add coconut creme or creme like substance but last night they didn't which made it taste like a regular mojito with the after taste of coconut. =( I switched to black berry and I was happy. 

Empandas are a must have. they're delicious. I esp love the beef empanada and that is hard for me to say because I truly live for my mothers!! 

The only mistake i made......was ordering ravioli in a Latin Fusion restaurant. This is why I'm taking a star away. 
The marinara was very water and runny it wouldn't stick to the pasta. 
There were NO Latin influences to the filling of the ravioli or the marinara sauce itself (million dollar idea). 

I have to reference my mom, My Italian gf came to my house for pasta and was amazed by the Latin influence my mom had put into the pasta she clearly could see something was different then her mom's "gravy." 

To top it off we waited a long time for it and some of the insides were cold. I think it was an off night ñ. 

We'll be back.....just not for ravioli.

Great food but located in such a weird place.

If it wasn't for my GPS, I wouldn't be able to find it. The sign is too small and the the corner that its on is very dark.

My hubby and I went in on a week night around 6pm so they just opened. We were the only ones there. We started with empanadas and then I had the dos tiras (short ribs) and my hubby had the choripan. We really enjoyed the food...I mean once it came to our table.

I would've given this place a 5 star but the the food took too long to come out and we were the only customers there. Maybe the cook was late...I dunno what it was but the wait time was not good. Great food though!

Don't let the outside fool you... this place is amazing.  Food, drinks, romantic atmosphere... I loved it.  The prices are also fantastic!  The empanadas are amazing and we loved the mojitos!

Will definitely be back!

Finally got a chance to visit this place after a few failed attempts by the gf to bring me here.

Nice Miami/Latin feel to it! Great sexy atmosphere and music. This place draws a very diverse crowd. The DJ rocked the house! They have a back seating area if the front is filled and the bar is sort of small. I tried the Mojito & Caipirinhas and they were both great. Around 11PM the place transformed from just a bar/ restaurant into a latin dance club, I mean people started burning up the floor and after we saw that, my friends and I joined in the festivities. I immediately thought this place was great! 

The staff was very friendly especially the people behind the bar. I dropped my hat at some point during the evening and I went crazy looking for it. I gave up and as a last resort asked the bartenders if they had seen it and he pulled it out and gave it to me. I thought that was really nice of him.

I will definately try this place again and again!

The only thing I really enjoyed about this place was the DJ. Music was great. I ordered a drink and the waitress brought me the wrong flavor. She insisted it was the mango mojito but it tasted nothing like mango. She never returned to ask if we needed anything else. Boo.

Went there for a girls night out and the vibe was great I had La Negra drink and it is Amazing i also had the Sangria but it wasn't that great the only slight complain I have is the music is a bit too loud other than that everything was great also the Empanadas are Delish

Great music and ambiance. Only been there on Tuesdays and Saturday. Tuesday they have bossa nova which is alway fun. Saturday the have a mix of everything but I liked the house music the most. Food is ok. Not a big fan. Drinks are good ...but always come with a hangover with all that sugar and house rum. . But it's a great place to hit up for last min plans.

Stumbled here one evening. Great place to sit back and relax and watch the street. Not too loud either. I'll come back here. I do recommend trying that Argentinian beer they have. Tastes good. 
Friendly staff too.

The only reason I rated this place is because there was a drink there called La Piña which was good, besides that everything was horrible. I don't understand how this place is open. Food was horrible and let's not even start about the service. Big mistake coming here, we had a large group about 25 people that almost filled out the back room and for some reason they couldn't get the speakers to work and no one even bothered in apologizing or telling us they are working on it... We just kept asking what's going on with the music and no one would respond... I guess there was no manager on Friday jan 4th???
The music finally worked about an hour later....lesson learned never coming here again.

Here's the breakdown:
When I used to eat meat, the pinchos (shish kabobs) were amazing! But I have not been there for food in years.  
There drinks are strong!  This is a good thing normally, but they make drinks sound refreshing, yummy, and sugary, but this girl finds them almost rude (but they do the trick).  
The music here is great and the atmosphere is dark.  It is a great place to hang out with one special someone or lots of friends.

We went here for my 35th birthday and we had a great time! The vodka gimlet and mojitos were really good, not sweet at all! The music was really good, awesome DJ! It ranged from old house, salsa, hip hop from back in the day & some alternative! Oh btw NO COVER!!
Drinks were tasty but kinda week, the place clearly under staffs because the service was bad but the music was good so I'll give them that but I would not suggest eating here food was nothing special

Heard a lot of good things from friends about this place, so me and the wife were really looking forward to try it out for a while. We were  disappointed sorry to say. I guess in my mind I pictured something totally different. This place is small, but the day we decided to go it was before a big snow storm so it wasn't really crowded but the tables are really close to each other so even with the loud music (which I don't mind) you can still listen to your neighbors conversations. The decor is nice, it's very dim a little to dim I like  to  see  my food when I eat, and the waitress was very nice and attentive.  I had a mango picado for a drink which tasted nothing like mango and had some old limes in it which made it taste funny my wife had a mojito which she loved. The empanadas were very good the corn and cheese empanadas were  something different. I ordered beef short ribs and it came with two steaks  and talk about fat on these things, the first one I ate had about 30 percent fat 70 percent meat, the other was the other way around no lie 70 percent fat 30 percent meat. My wife had some steak I forgot the name of it with a side of mash potatoes nothing special. I figure most woman will like this place because they can get a few mojitos and dance the night out on the smallest dance floor ever. It's one of those you can  really like it or hate it spots. A little pricey especially the drinks.
So crowded on Saturday night. Terrible service. The DJ and sound system are the ONLY good things here. I'm typing this as I've been waiting 10 minutes for service at the bar. LAME

Tuesday night live samba + mojitos = beautious.
Also, the menu is really, really delicious.

I came here on my birthday to get a drink on and chill a bit after a very filling dinner.  We got here early, so the party hadn't yet started.  That was cool because that meant we could populate the back room and take over the couch seating.  As much as I liked chillaxin' (I said it; what?) on some plush velour couches...the smell was a little gnarly.  I tried not to think about it, as I was having a good time but you better believe I made sure that no exposed skin or any part of my head touched any part of that couch.  I would not want to see them in the light of day.  PSA over.

The drinks are still strong, pure and cheap.  My entire party was amazed at how much you got for so little..and for how expertly crafted each was.  As hard as I tried, I could not escape my past as a Girl Drink Drunk.  Each cocktail I selected was served in a martini glass with some sort of trim.  My manly buddies looked on with resigned pity as they drank he-men drinks out of (what seemed like) 40 oz tumblers.  I didn't much care as I got a party on with my [name redacted for sake of salvaging any sort of love life].  It's my party and I'll drink what I please.  I did notice that, even, the waiters were like, "Man...no."  The waiters!  They were mad cool.  They were very patient and helpful with a large bunch of folks and made sure to keep us air conditioned and liquored up at all times.  Spot on service.

Another victorious night at N (yes, I still can't put the ~ over the letter).  Next time, however, I'll opt for the wooden bench.  But, maybe not.  For all the eating I am doing, my @ss is still sorta bony.  I don't need to be in pain while I am getting a drink on.

Oh Enye...how i miss you....I used to frequent enye years ago for their ever so popular brazilian night. the crowd was civilized, music was great and drinks were delicious...

I keep hearing from friends it is hoodrat central now. what a shame. all good things come to an end...hoodrats gotta kill everything.

Early for some food and beer. 
Quiet.  Exposed brick walls.  Great empanadas, chorizo chunks you grab w/ toothpicks & Quilmes bottles.  Nice.
Later for more drinks and music.  Cool crowd having a good time w/o losing their sh*t.  Nice.

WOW!  We hit up this place on a Sat. night and I didn't want to leave.  We originally met up to celebrate a friend's birthday and really enjoyed the food and the mixed drinks.  Especially the 5* worthy Blackberry Mojito.

As the night continued, people started pouring in.  I guess they're open from 6p-2a or something like that and people were just coming in and coming in.  I was sitting at a table with my back to the crowd and when I got up, Woah, ho, ho.  It was packed.  And there were so many hotties.  Too bad I had no make up on and looked like shit. Lesson learned.  

They also had a DJ set up at the bar, which I thought was pretty coola and he was jamming.  Playing mostly danceable upbeat, house tracks.  Couldn't ask for anything better.  Desafortunadamente, I had to get my ass to work.  I couldn't bear listening to my friends' accounts of how their night ended here.  I missed out big time.  Planning on a second visit very soon.  

Only issues were that the main room, the front room, is pretty small.  The larger back room was being used for a private party. And street parking is available, there is no lot.

Definitely come here after 10 pm on a weekend. The DJs changed at ten and the one from 10 pm on is infinitely better than the previous (unless you'd like to hear him sing along to Madonna remixes with your meal).

Food - spot on. Beef milanesa & ham and cheese empanadas = yum. Mojito =still superb.

I had some of the best dates of my life at ñ with my then boyfriend at now husband, this place is great. 

The mojitos are sooo delicious and the Tuesday Samba nights can't be beat. 

Let me tell you, the first time my husband took me to ñ it was my birthday in 2006 and I was skeptical to say the least. The place looks preeeety shady from the outside. Once we were inside and we were tucked away at a cozy table listening and eventually dancing to some of the best live music in town, I was sold. 

The small plates are great, but I really like this place for the music, mojitos and the vibe. The beat of the music just gets inside of you and you can't help but dance. 

5 stars all around!

Was a bit out of the way, and kind of cramped but this cool little lounge reminded me of Astoria, Queens (NY).

I was there on a Tuesday (technically now Wednesday by the time I arrived) for their Brasilian party.

Saw the hottest body I witnessed in Chicago on a girl with white pants on (too many flat booties everywhere I went), which is always a nice way to spend an evening... except that girl I was there with didnt like Brazilian music, so we didnt stay very long.

I dont care to try this place on a mainstream type of night, but would definitely come back for any Salsa or Brazilian night.
Good place to go for a drink and chill, music a little loud, DJ. Place is darkly lit, sportbar / lounge feel to it.  A bit small though gets filled fast around 10.
Hands down! best Tuesday night in the city! and best caiprinhas in Chicago as well! Charlie is awesome!

Oh, Ñ, I love you, your dimly lit front room, and all the fun filled late nights of dancing to house music that makes my heart go pitter-patter somewhere between 124 and 128 bpm.

True house heads will love what the DJs spin here: soulful vocal house, latin house, and even some old school. Throw in some good dancers, add a few mango mojitos to the mix, and you've yourself a great start to a night of good times.

I've been coming to Ñ for a few years and I recommend coming here late night on Saturdays. Lately, Sunday nights have been really great with Lego spinning an eclectic mix of Latin Jazz, Bossa Nova, Samba, Afro Rhythms, & Brazilian/Latin House!

I HIGHLY recommend the empanadas and if you come early enough to get dinner, DO IT!

Gluttony is a sin, and sin is IN! So, just do what I do: point to the menu & say, "I'll take everything on this side", hang out & drink like a camel after dinner, and dance like nobody is looking when the DJs begin to play!


Holla!!!™
We had a great time here, the drinks are good, empanadas are amazing and the service is wonderful. We were helped by Sylvia and she was accommodating and very kind. We Will definitely be back!

I want to start saying that this place has changed, I used to hang at this place and has changed for BAD; the whole concept for "ñ" was for latin place so we could listen to NOT the ordinary music and had a blast with Live Rock Band that used to play great songs; The Crowed used to be young professionals MOSTLY from South America, great educated people.

Yesterday I asked to some friends to come to this place and I've told them that how great it is, guess what I was wrong!... The place was empty (bad sign) gradually started to get filled, but the music was BAD, BAD and BAD... This was not a latin place, it was so ghetto... The DJ was horrible played 90% English music and in 3 hours 2 Salsa songs which by the way seemed that the small crowed felt like dancing more than the crap he was playing, RAP are u kidding me??? 

The food did not check it out, but drinks were great but EXPENSIVE!!! 

Overall: I won't go again, and won't recommend....

SHAME ON YOU " ñ " !!!

This is a great little bar. Very trendy, welcoming, and even though it's a small fit, the atmosphere is fun and people start dancing as the night goes on. The music was a great Latin mix and the drinks are delicious, especially the Mango Mojitos, Caipairinhas, and another called La Negra. 

I would totally recommend it as a place to start or spend the whole evening. It can be intimate at a table for two, fun with a group (we had like 15 people show up for us), and more casual or  fun dancing. Helpful wait staff and a clean bar.

Things were pricey but not ridiculous; I got three nice mixed drinks for $23. No cover. Open, I believe, until 3am.

You know what they say: You can't judge a book by it's cover. And so it is with ñ, a sexy Argentinian restaurant masquerading as a corner store. It could go unnoticed and is very unassuming. 
 
It  wasn't crowded, but loud and dark. I guess eating in the dark adds to the exotic allure of the place and it's crowd, but dag, can I get a flicker of light, please? On a hot, yet bearable saturday night, we opted for the patio which we had all to ourselves.

This is a great place for late night dining, as they're open until 2 a.m. We stopped in for late cocktails and dessert, and while I can't speak to how good the food is, the menu looked good. The desserts were stellar, especially the alfa jores, a layered Argentinian cookie w/chocolate, carmel and custard. Think the cookie version of a Napoleon.

The cocktails were superb--and I'm not really even a drinker! I usually stay safe with a mojito everywhere I go. But ooooh, honey chile, that La Negra... the sweet aroma of La Negra had me bent--over the glass, that is. Smells and tastes like a liquid flower. 

There was a dj spinning house music saturday but I anticipate returning for dinner on either Tuesday when they have the live Samba music or Sunday when they have live Latin jazz or Tango. I've been forewarned that it gets pretty packed and to come early.

Review based strictly on Saturday night music: Always on a the look out for a constant venue that spins disco/house/funk/boogie and always come up short in the city. Ñ is the spot for some nice house/world music mash ups.  I hope the music remains consistent every Saturday and if it does I will def be back. A lot of people weren't dancing except head nodding on the wall and when me & the girl began to git down a lot of people stare at us like we were crazy, otherwise dance floor is a bit small but the music was so on point it didn't matter

Love Tango Sur, thought we would give it a shot.  We went with another a couple and had an excellent time.  We waited for friends to arrive and had a mojito at the bar.  The bartender was excellent and mixed two excellent drinks.  Although they are a little pricey, they taste excellent.  We had empanadas for an app and they were excellent.  Our chicken kabobs were good, but not great.

Our main course was pretty solid.  Our group had ravioli, the filet, pechuga and the lomito.  I sampled everyones dishes and they were excellent.  My chicken was a tad dry, but still had excellent flavor.  I should have ordered the filet, but was stuffed from the drinks and appetizers we had.  Ravioli was so good.  Waitstaff was decent, left us alone which was nice being seated outside.  Would def go back!

This is a great place to go and have some drinks with a nice dinner. The food is good and the drinks are even better. I went because a friend recommended the place and their Mangotinis. I tried it and it was good, but what i really loved is their Mango Picado drink! That has become my favorite drink their along with their empanadas. The atmosphere is greta and the music is ok it all depends on your taste.

Drinks are great! Really all I gotta say about that...

The food isn't that great and we had bad service the time we were there. 

Would suggest to go back for the drinks and music, bout it.

Honestly, I don't give my five stars lightly but, I have to say this place deserves it, if for no other reason than its attached to a gas station, is super reasonable and cute decor..  oh wait and the beef is AWESOME!  I love a good Italian beef, and this one hit the spot.  Sometimes my husband and I play yelp roulette, we take turns picking a place simply based on our location and number of $$$ we're looking to spend.  This one was his choice but I have to say it was one of his best.   The beef was simple, super flavorful and dipped just the right amount.  Fries are crinkle cut, not typically my fave but these stayed crunchy all the way until we got home, 15 min ride.   Also, the cheese sauce with fries is a must, yes it's just a cheese sauce like any other but for some reason it was great with these extra crispy fries.  We got the 9inch beef and split it and it was a perfect amount for us and split a large fry.  The best part of all was our dinner was $12.55, we will be back and likely sooner than later!!

Popped in here for a late lunch one afternoon with great Chicago May weather. Apparently the place is relatively new as well. Really nice guys who work there, and it's almost like a hole-in-the-wall type of place. 
Simply had a hotdog and fries, but it was pretty tasty to be honest. 
If I'm ever in the neighborhood again, I'd totally stop in here again.

I found this place when I was hungry and not sure of what I wanted to eat. In times like these I usually go to yelp for some close by ideas.  And this place popped up, and I'm glad I found it. I always enjoy a good beef sandwich, and man oh man was this one tasty. From the first bite I was blown away by the delicious flavor of the beef. They season their beef perfectly,  not too overpowering nor too bland. The juice was definitely a perfect compliment to the flavorful beef. The meat was tender, yum. The giardinera was ok, the pieces lacked the crunch that goes along with the flavor, in my opinion. The fries were crinkle cut, not my favorite cut of fry, but they were delicious, especially with a cup of cheese  for dipping.  I am glad I found this place, it will definitely be added to my list of go to places for delicious Italian beef sandwiches.

I stopped in here for a quick bite to eat and I was so impressed with how incredible everything tasted. I had a Chicago style hotdog and cheese fries that were so delicious I honestly would prefer it to portillos! And at half the price :) yummy!

I ate here yesterday !  Beef combination !! Was Fye now I'm back again maybe try something different or if it a broke why fix the beef was good wasn't the best I ever had but it was good !! Also very very clean place from the bathroom to the eating area

Super friendly manager ! Beef was good but Au Jus didn't have much flavor ! I'll go back for a hot dog , but will stay with Portillo's for the beef sandwiches ! Crinkle cut fries are also a nice touch !

If you like portillos hot dogs you'll absolutely LOVE this place! Delicious food, great prices, and great customer service. It's clearly family owned and it's very clear by the quality of food and customer service they give their customers. I'll be back soon! 5 stars!
So excited that this place finally opened. Beef was exceptional, loved the crinkle cut fries. Senior beef is absolutely massive. Only get it if your very hungry. Can't wait to come back!

Yes Yes yes yes I've been waiting for a new burger restaurant to open up. All in one building.  Carwash, gas station,  dunkin donuts and now restaurant. Italian beef, burgers,  gyros.  I'm getting hungry now.
Just tried their breaded chicken sandwich - topped with lettuce, tomato and raw onion.  Outstanding - high quality sandwich.  Definitely on my 'repeat list'!

Came in a half hour before close and needed a beef before going south on Western. Got a beef with hot and it was very good. Tender beef and even better gravy. The giardinera was ok and the fries were ok. But that beef was definitely good. A must stop if your cruising down western and looking for a quality sandwich. It helps that the staff are good people and very friendly. For trying a spot for the first time at almost close, I did not feel rushed and the products were fresh.
had the beef dipped with fries! it was really good...i hope they do well given their location..attached to the gas station..workers were also really friendly..will definately go back!

This was a accidental stop. I was driving for LYFT and needed gas and thought why not. And glad I did. I like recognizing the small things like all the employey's giving a "Hello good afternoon". And then the restroom being spotless as was the rest of the restaurant. I went for just the beef, fries and pop combo. Kinda pricey but it was worth it. The problem Al's Beef (which SUCKs) and other Beef place's in Chicago have is they keep the Beef soaking in the crock pot all day which dries the beef out(FACT). And they don't here. And they weren't shy with the amount of beef in the sandwich either. Also quick so I have no complaints. If you live in the neighborhood I'm jealous. And it's not a hole in the wall or it would be dirty stingy and have good beef.
Solid beef sandwiches and fries! Nice portions and great flavor.  Everything was really fresh and tasty. Prices are very reasonable and there is ample parking in the lot.

Amazing beef, has the perfect amount of spices and the beef juice is so flavorful! But my favorite has to be the burger, it was cooked perfectly super juicey and was a healthy size patty! They were friendly but quick to give me my food which I appreciate! Love this place and recommend everyone to try it out!

It's awesome that they can make any of their entrees vegetarian (except for the poutine).

I had the vegetarian box and the veggies and sauce were really great. It's a little pricey at $11.

(This review is for the food truck only)

While strolling around The Loop trying to decide on lunch I came across the Döner Men food truck and decided to give it a try - it was a fine lunch.

The truck itself will certainly catch your eye and the menu (large w/ big pictures and helpful descriptions) helps draw you in. The staff was... fine; not overly friendly but not bad at all.

I had the Döner Box and it was very tasty. It had chicken and lettuce and fries, tomatoes and onions and... I don't even know what else was in there but it was pretty tasty. In fact, the sauces help to add flavor but it's the ingredients that really make this thing.

The one issue I have, and I have this issue with almost every food truck, is that the prices do not seem to reflect the portion size you receive. The Döner Men truck is no stand out from the others: tasty food but small portion for the price. My lunch appetite is usually very sizable and that tends to keep me away from most food trucks. Every once in a while I give a new one a shot but, like my experience here, the visits are few and far between because the food is usually not insanely outstanding that I'd want to double-down on the order. I'm not sure I'll be giving this truck another shot.

I had the currywurst with fries and I was very underwhelmed. I enjoyed the curry sauce, but it's hard to justify spending $9 on a box of fries dressed with a sauce and one cut up bratwurst. Service was very quick. If you're looking for your food truck fix near UChicago, I wouldn't come here. There are much better options.

You get delicious grilled chicken, fresh and crisp vegetables, flavorful sauces, and even some pickles in a reasonably large portion too.the box was $10 and it was a satisfying meal.overall, definitely worth taking a look if you see the truck on your lunch break.at first, this truck came late and opened late, but they seemed to have normalized their operations down to a t.seriously, everything you could possibly want in a lunch from creamy to fried to meaty to healthy to spicy to sour to starchy.the decor of the truck caught my eye so i decided to grab this for a quick meal outside my work building..i had the currywurst, which was phenomenal.i was iffy about the wurst since i don&#39;t like lamb but it was actually really delicious! glad i stopped by.the staff was.
Went to their food truck at the Christkindlmarket in the loop. The menu says any item can be made vegetarian which was a nice surprise. I had a veggie wrap which tasted fresh, spicy and delicious.

Yes working near the Sears (Willis) Tower is great because you can get some food truck traffic around here during lunchtime.  The colorfully decorated DönerMen truck serves its take on German street food.  I tried a Döner Box, loaded with all sorts of ingredients.  In fact this böx öf fööd is a microcosm of my "balanced" diet in general, a pile of both "good and healthy" and "good but not that good for you" ingredients.  There is the salad portion with lettuce, onion, tomato and cucumber and a generous portion of shredded roasted chicken, and somewhere in the box is a heap of fries, plus tzatziki yogurt sauce.  It is a good and filling lunch box for sure.  I think next time I will want to try the currywurst, which really is German street food to me.

The decor of the truck caught my eye so I decided to grab this for a quick meal outside my work building.  Nice down to earth dudes with super quick service.

I got the Döner box just because it seemed like it was a good combination of everything they had to offer. I am still not really sure what I ate, but it was pretty good.  The truck seems to be fusion-y with German and Mediterranean like foods.  The Döner box had flavorful chicken kebob, fresh crisp lettuce, tomatoes, onions, delicious crispy fries, and homemade white and red sauce.  All on point and blends perfectly together.  Also, they lay the food in the box in a picture perfect manner (important for us asian food pic takers)

The portions and price are typical of what you would expect from a Chicago food truck.  It's about half the portion for the same price as Benjyehuda (reminds me of a box from there but cleaner and with less mushy vegetables).  The Döner box portion is actually a perfect size since Benjye bowls can be split into two meals. If they were the same price I would choose Donermen over that any day.

As others mentioned, I wouldn't necessarily say this truck is synonymous or exemplary of straight German or Turkish food, but it was still tasty nonetheless, and I understood what they were going for. I stopped by Friday around 11:30 at Daley Plaza and got the Döner Box. I only waited a few minutes for this and the guys there were friendly. I enjoyed this very much, as all flavors and ingredients worked well together. The toppings were noticeably fresh. I also tried some of the curry fries and this was yummy. It had a great kick to it. Prices were appropriate. The box was $10 and it was a satisfying meal. The only other time I've had döner was in London, and this wasn't quite that, but I still quite enjoyed the Döner Men truck!

Both the entrees we tried were great. The Doner Box was clearly the best, with killer goat tzatziki (seriously, new favorite sauce? check). The Currywurst was a more one-dimensional  dish that also seemed a little less filling, but still quite good. The poutine didn't do it for me - the gravy didn't have very much flavor, nor did the cheese curds. Overall, definitely worth taking a look if you see the truck on your lunch break.

I am from Berlin Germany and have been looking for a similar food experience to the Döner and the Curry Wurst for a while after I moved to Chicago. It is sad to say that what these guys offer is by no stretch even close to the German/Berlin original. 

While I understand that there is room for international interpretation of the food + americanization of certain foods, you shouldn't advertise to sell "iconic German street food and cuisine" especially the famous Curry Wurst that tasted nothing like the original.

Overall both the Döner and the Curry Wurst lacked the bold flavor and texture you will experience from the Original, while the Doner was bland and flavorless.

Back I am to the never ending search to find food close or similar to the taste of Berlin Germany as Dönermen did not deliver.

Find a recipe online and make it yourself, you won't be disappointed.

FANTASTIC!  The food trucks were out in full force today in Daley Plaza.  I have a serious weakness for food trucks, so instead of getting any of my errands done during lunch, i decided to give myself a treat.  From Doner Men I tried the Doner Box, it was so delicious, fresh and full of flavor. It consisted of chicken on top of a small salad, on top of fries and finished with a delicious cucumber yogurt tzatziki. I can't wait to try something else.

At first, this truck came late and opened late, but they seemed to have normalized their operations down to a T.

These guys are cool - no BS, tattoo bearing, down to earth and down to business cool. And now they are good with two items I frequent:
Döner kebab
Döner box

Their version of the kebabs are a bit more planty than I usually go for, but its still a good kebab nonetheless - veggies like cherry tomatoes, Romaine lettuce, beets, with some chicken and tzatziki sauce. All excellent, crunchy and full of taste.

I initially went for the kebab but fell in love with the Döner Box, aka the Box. It does away of the wrap and gives you a bed of fries on the bottom. Yum! Had the Box since.

These guys have some soft drinks of which I never heard but are delicious: Dang! Butterscotch Root Beer and Cheerwine. Horrible for my diabetes, but hey, I'll choose a slightly shorter life span for an enjoyable life and tastes than a dull long life.

DönerMen food truck stops nearby 600 West Chicago Avenue, in the car park across the street on Larrabee Avenue from the so called Groupon building. Cash or cards can do. They serve 600 West and area at least once a week, occasionally more.

Mind the d20.

The doner box from Doner Men may be a nearly perfect food item.  It has just the right amount of everything: creamy yogurt, spicy harissa, fresh vegetables, grilled chicken, fried potatoes.  Seriously, everything you could possibly want in a lunch from creamy to fried to meaty to healthy to spicy to sour to starchy...it's all right there, in this lovely little box.  Nothing dominates; nothing overwhelms; everything is right there.  A nearly perfect lunch.

Was excited to try at the Fooda at my work today- until I saw the skinny tattooed guy eating food off his fingers while working the counter...  mmmm lax cleanliness standards...
I'm no priss, but if he's doing that in front of ten people waiting, what are they doing during the food prep?
Easily one of the best food trucks in Chicago. You can tell that all of the veggies are fresh and the sauces are made in house.  If you need a recommendation, definitely go with the döner box.

Doner Men came to visit me in the Willis today, and decided to try the Vegetarian Currywurst. The sauce was a little salty, but still delicious. My plate was clean in a matter of minutes. I'm already looking forward to trying the doner kebab. 

As a word to the wise, their potato salad is served cold. For whatever reason, the guy in front of me thought it ought to be served hot. When has ANYONE ever had hot potato salad? Anyway, without giving any attitude, the cashier immediately apologized and refunded the man. Overall the staff was great, and I really hope Doner Men comes to visit me again. I'll keep an eye out for the food truck too!

I was at the Christkindlmarket and stumbled upon Donerman's stall. I've never heard of them before but it smelled great and looked family owned.

I waited in line for about 15-20min. The line wasn't long but they were slow to serve (1 cashier and 1 chef).

I ordered the Currywurst and I was so amazed at how delicious it was. I've never had Currywurst before so I may not be the best judge but the wurst and curry sauce tasted like something I've never tried before! The curry was sweet but not in a bad way. I was iffy about the wurst since I don't like lamb but it was actually really delicious! Glad I stopped by.

Döner Men should apply for superhero status- they always show up when you need them in the most unexpected places. The döner is fantastic, perfect drunk food. Curry fries are also amazing. The only thing that is different from an authentic late-night German Dönerladen was the fresh vegetables. They are usually sad, slimy wilted iceberg snots- Döner Men served an awesome variation and must have a tomato garden in the truck. 
Last, they have Club Mate. At six bucks a bottle they are the only importer in the Midwest- and thank god for that. I bought all they had in the truck and would go back for more.

Seriously love the food here! I think the Döner Box is still my favorite, but I really like the Currywurst too (it's even better with a side of tzatziki). The service is always quick and friendly, even when they're slammed!

I visited them at Christkindlmarket in Daley Plaza and they had amazing hot apple cider, too.

The best lunch truck in Chicago!

I've eaten at several trucks over the years, but this place takes the idea of fusion food to a new level. 
The curry fries are amazing, fresh and very unique.
The wrap was very flavorful and full of different tastes and textures.

The artwork on the truck is creative and original. Kudos for a excellent truck.

Interesting concept of basically put a doner in a box on a bed of fries and salad. Reminds of taco in a box. The fries were really crispy but missing salt. The tomatoes were nice, but I wish there was a sprinkling of olives.  The salad just kind of got in the way.  The chicken was pretty good but I found a tad too many chewy fat vien pieces.
Went by their food truck one day and had their Poutine Fries w/ chicken. So delicious!! This is the only thing I've had but  I'm satisfied with this just item. You gotta try it!

Had a dönerbox today at chicago Xmas-market. This has nothing to do with German Döner. Lotsa letuce, 5 fries, and almost no chicken at all! And why the hell chicken??? An absolute rip off! I really can't recommend Dönerman! Whoever had a real Berlin Döner before knows that Dönerman is just a waste of money!

This was pretty awesome.  They go to Lemmings, a bar near our home, just about weekly, so we grabbed dinner from them one rainy night.  Everything we had was good, but the Doner Salat....OMG.  I can't even place what flavors were in there (plus Lemmings is pretty dark inside), but it was heaven.

After hearing so many good things about Döner Men, I have to say I was really disappointed. I've been searching for a Berlin döner for years here in the states. Living in Berlin for over 10 years may have spoiled me. The currywurst & döners are nothing like the authentic food trucks in Berlin. So if you want authentic Berliner eats, it's not here. My döner was more pita & lettuce than anything. It reminded me more of a Turkish Pizza than a Döner. The Curry Ketchup sauce was watered down & lacked enough curry flavoring. It was a bummer. But the customer service was great! Super friendly workers.
YES!!!  This is by far the best food truck in Chicago.  The salad is amazing and I have dreams about their curry fries. My husband and I are addicted!
Saw them on Chicago's Best ... yeah ... eat off this food truck.  Donerbox was off the hook. Just as advertised.

A beautiful day today in Chicago means eating outside. Eating outside means food truck! I tried the doner box. It was very tasty. The chicken was tender and nicely flavored with a slight kick. The tzatziki and veggies went well with the chicken. The curry fries were a little soggy to my liking but altogether this was a really nice lunch for 10$.

I was kinda skeptical to try this food truck because, honestly, it just isn't normally the type of food I chase after. Decided to give it a go after seeing all the good reviews. I chose the doner box, mostly because it was listed as a staff favorite. It is basically a bed of fries, topped with lettuce, tomatoes, onions, chicken, spicy pepper sauce, and tzatziki. I actually really liked their fries, which probably isn't the staple here but they were good. The chicken was spit roasted and probably some of the best chicken I've ever had (as good as chicken can get I suppose not deep fat fried LOL). Both the sauces were awesome and super flavorful! I wish the red pepper sauce was a bit spicier though. Honestly, the fat kid in me could have done without the lettuce and tomatoes. Overall, a very good plate of food. Next time I want to try the curry wurst.

Thank you, Döner Men, for posting up outside of a bar at night to satisfy my late night food cravings. I had the CurryWurst, which was phenomenal. Their curry is simply amazing (like lick-your-fingers-at-the-end-of-the-meal amazing), the fries are crispy, and the wurst is flavorful. Will definitely try to track down their food truck to get the CurryWurst again!

Tried this place last week during lunch at Daley Plaza and was happy to find currywurst since I haven't had it since 2008 in Germany and had been craving some.  The portion size was good, the fries could be a a bit crisper since there was sauce over them which made them soggy and hard to eat with the small pick, but were freshly made.  The wurst was decent, but not as good as in Germany.  The sauce was tasty and flavorful.

This food truck is a home run.  You get delicious grilled chicken, fresh and crisp vegetables, flavorful sauces, and even some pickles in a reasonably large portion too.  I got the "doner box" variation which takes all of this and puts it on top of a handful of french fries, and while that was very tasty I'll probably switch to the salad variation next time.  But I anticipate going here almost any time it's available.

Donermen is part of the Fooda program my work offers as a pop up.  Today I had the Doner Kebab (Durum (wrap style) doner with roasted chicken, tzatziki, harissa, greens, shirazi, pickles, and onions).  Wow I gotta say it was delicious!  So much flavor, I can't wait to have it again!

So good. Zehr gut is probably more accurate. It's hard to miss the colorful and elaborate Döner Men Truck on Chicago's street.  The explosion of flavor in your mouth when you order confirms that the Döner Men isn't just another fly-by-night trendy truck. They've got the goods. I often struggle with what to pick from a food truck but when I saw the döner kebab fries the choice was easy. Finishing this mountain of flavor was not, on the other hand, as easy. Large pieces of flavorful chicken, hand-cut crispy fries, bright fresh salad with a light dressing. The biggest surprise was the goat cheese tzatziki sauce. I am not a goat cheese person but this was awesome and that says a lot.  The truck also features curry wurst and a spicy curry sauce as well as the döner kebab in a wrap and salads.  Next time I'll have to try something new because there absolutely will be a next time.
Amazeballs. Döner Kabab, food of champions. Hand cut Belgian fries topped with curry sauce. You can also get the fries with Kabab toppings.  Can't get good like this in 'merica.
Haven't tried the food, but I'm giving 5 stars for the coolest paint job I've ever seen on a food truck!

I was very surprised to see such high rating.  Especially considering the quality of Chicago food truck scene on Adams and Wacker. 

I ordered the Döner Kebab and Curry Fries.  
The Doner Kebab is okay.  The wrap was stiff but the flavors were okay.  Nothing special. 

The Curry Fries were terrible.  They were smothered in a curry sauce that was too sweat.  I love Indian food and curry but this was bad.  Even if I could get past the one note sauce, the sweetness did me in.   

I love Indian food and was excited to try Doner Men.  Unfortunately, the items above are not good.  The wrap was okay but the fries were terrible.  I debated giving a 3 star rating but two sums it up, I've experienced better.   This has been the worst experience of the food truck scene and one I will not order from again.
mediocre food...and a bit expensive...i got a curry wurst which was OK...the bread was refrigerator cold...the red cabbage tasted like from a can...presentation was messy...

Hit these guys up at the Christkindl market! Food was fresh tasting, workers were super friendly and knowledgable and great prices! It was like a Mediterranean party in my mouth of flavors! Def one of the best food trucks in the city and great for a quick bite to eat.

If you're looking for an authentic doner like you ate in Germany, this comes close but no cigar.  But it was delicious and different than what you've had before and for the cash, it's a LOT of food!  Definitely give it a try if you like any type of schwarma/kebab/wrap sandwiches with generous helpings.  I may be small but I nommed the heck out of that wrap!  If only one of the Turkish guys from Germany would come to Chicago and put a LEGIT doner place together...

I really like German Doener Kebab. I've eaten at least 15 of them (?) on trips to Berlin. I was eager to find the equivalent in Chicago. 

I tried the Doenermen food stand  at the Christkindlmarkt. I am sorry to say I was a bit disappointed. I was expecting the real thing. 

First, they only have the option of durum doener which looks like a burrito. I don't mind it, but personally, I enjoy the doener that comes in the flatbread. 

The meat isn't the rotating meat thingy you see at doener shops. I'm not sure how it was cooked. 

One positive was the sauce, they got that right. 

Overall, it just wasn't the authentic German doener I was expecting based on the advertisement.

IMHO, the closest thing to German doener in Chicago can be found at SP Kebab in Rogers Park. 

It's not perfect, but closer to the real thing.

I encourage you to try Doenermen and come to your own conclusions.

Note: I tried their stand at the Christmas market at Daley Plaza.

Having had doner in Frankfurt Germany two days ago, I was eager to compare Donerman"s offering to the "real" thing.

Unfortunately, I have to say Donerman doesn't come close. Overdone meat and something really bitter tasting are the primary flavors I tasted.

I want to like Donerman, so I'll give it a second try, but the first was a disappointment.

This is my new favorite food truck in Chicago.  I was  so excited that they had a vegetarian option for their currywurst!  The sauce for the currywurst is so good I could drink it straight.  They also have Club Matte which I was very impressed by it was the first time I have seen in since being in Berlin.

Unfortunately i can't give Carnivale the full 5 stars due to the poor service upon our arrival. We had an 8pm reservation for 7, and checked in when we arrived around 7:50. They said our table would be ready in a moment, so we took a step back to give some space around the already congested hostess stand. Well, 8:15 comes around, and they still hadn't called us. We checked with the host, and she tried telling us that we never checked in or let her know our party had arrived! We assured her we did, but it didn't seem to matter much, so we waited some more...this time with a buzzer. Now it's 8:25 so I followed up again and the other host actually told us that our table was still sitting, but another opened up that she thought they were giving to ANOTHER PARTY! I asked her if they too had been waiting since 8pm, and she mentioned they had an 8:30 reservation. BAD SERVICE ALERT! finally a manager came over and quickly got us a table. So all in all it took us 45 minutes to be seated even with a reservation, which just seems ridiculous!

Looking past the initial service, our food was wonderful. For appetizers we shared the ropa Vieja, guac, and charcuterie board. The ropa vieja was truly amazing, highly recommend! For dinner we had almost everything on the menu: scallops, short rib, pork shank, lamb rack, and the arrachera. We loved everything! Our server was very knowledgeable on the menu and friendly throughout our time there. Food deserves the full 5 star, too bad their hostess stand couldn't get it together.

Been here so many times, but finally getting around to writing a review.  Was celebrating a bday dinner.  The ambiance is fun and very colorful and eclectic.  One downfall to all that is the noise, it's quite noisy and the musics a bit loud to carry on a conversation, but it's fun nonetheless.  Drinks were good and mine was strong which is always a bonus.  Started off with the octopus and the coconut shrimp.  Octopus I would never order again, it was slimy and just was not to my liking.  The coconut shrimp was great.  Great crust on it, not overly cooked, great chutney and sauces on it, was delicious.   I ended up with the snapper which was delicious that came on a bed of baby carrots and fingerling potatoes and he had the short rib which was braised beautifully and just melted.  Not a big red meat eater, but that tasted great to me.  That came on a bed of either risotto or grits which were super rich.  We ordered the brussel sprouts which were outstanding with this unbelievable corn with it and also the plantains which again were amazing...salivating writing this portion of the review.  We ended the night with 2 desserts, some apple crumbling pie a la mode which was good, but then we got the cigar mousse dish and that disappointed a bit.  It came out in a box that was steaming to mimic smoke coming out of a cigar, and it tasted smokey and all, aesthetically it was fun to see, but the taste wasn't all there. 

I would definitely recommend for something different, food's diverse enough to cater too vegans to meat eaters with a twist on latin food.

Carnivale was a great venue for our party. We rented out a private room to accommodate 25 people and did a set menu and set wines. The desserts weren't that great (cotton candy, tequila tarts), but the entrees itself were delicious and the waiters assigned to our room were attentive.

Would use Carnivale again for a private party.

No disrespect but this the absolute worst restaurant in the west loop / fulton market area. The overwhelming large warehouse type dining area had 15 out of their 2,000 tables occupied and we still had to wait for our "whole party" to be seated. You would think they would be ecstatic to get you a table, but it was honestly like pulling teeth.

Our poor server was really good at pretending he was busy. I truly think he tried his best, but he was just entirely disingenuous. He told us the chicken and waffles was "flying out the door", which was a lie because there was nothing or no one flying in or out of those doors.

:(

Carnivale reminds me of an abandon amusement park. 

"How about the food Juany?" You might ask yourself 

& to be honest, I don't even wanna go there. I'll just post a photo of my chicken with waffles and let your imagination do the rest.

Overpriced and overhyped. 

Came here with some friends for a bday dinner.. We got sat in the very back of the restaurant like we had the plague ..our server was nice but scarce and we had a bunch of fruit flies harassing us all night .. 

Let me start off by saying, I felt like we payed fine dining prices for carne asada plates.. 
 
Appetizers: 
we ordered the Ropa Vieja (the highlight of the night) small crispy tacos with tender shredded beef. Delish. The ceviche mixto.. 3-4 small samples of ceviche... $25 for literally samples (PASS ON THIS) And an order of the calamari was good, and crunchy.
Dinner: I ordered the Arrachera which was tasty, tender and a decent size, but literally a big chunk of carne asada, Definitely not worth the $30 price .. My boyfriend ordered the Vaca Frita, which was also good, with a side of black beans and white rice .. Tasty.. But again, not worth the price .. 

Overall, we enjoyed our dinner, but service sucked .. We waited 15-20 min per server visit, waited another 20 min to get our check.. and server gave us a hard time about splitting .. It was well over $500 dinner, and again.. We waited another 20 min for the server to return our checks. 

Overpriced, over hyped and terrible service.. Will not be returning.

This review is for a private event I attended at Carnivale. Overall the service was impeccable and the food of a high quality. I especially gravitated towards the guacamole, beef quesadillas, and the El Jimador margaritas. They provided live entertainment in the form of what I think is a type of yoga (where they climb upwards towards the ceiling on two thick bands of fabric). The only reason I can't give this place 5 stars is because there was something missing a bit in terms of the atmosphere, which may not be Carnivale's fault; it may have been our conference booking out the entire restaurant and not being able to fill it up. 

Extra points to Carnivale for their interior design, which became the subject of many conversations during our time there. This truly made the place memorable and special.

We went six people for dinner and it was awesome. The food was delicious. I had Arroz con Mariscos and I really love it. Appetizers very good and variety flavors.
The ambience was festive with latin music. The service was excellent.

Been wanting to come here for years, finally made it and it was worth the wait. Thanks to Yelp, I practically knew the menu by heart. Even after seeing the vibrant, Latin inspired pictures, I was overly impressed with the up close and personal vibrancy this restaurant offered. It was beautiful. The server was very knowledgeable, professional and polite, but interestingly insisted the most expensive items on the menu were the "must-try's."  After trying the recommended almost $30 cocktail, and it was underwhelming, I decided to stick to the Yelp recommendations. 
We had the ropa veja appetizer, which was delicious and so tender, it practically melted in your mouth. I had the arrachera, which was amazing. The chimichurri sauce was great. My husband had lamb chops me which I think were seasonal, but they were DELICIOUS!!!! I will definitely return.

Highly recommended place to try something new and have fun with a group! A favorite of me and my friends when eating out in downtown Chicago. We share a variety of dishes tapa style which is great for trying many menu items!  

Cocktail favorites: Sangria, Cotton Candy Martini, Mojito

The service was disappointing and the food was mediocre, but the bright decor was cute.

Don't waste your time here, there are way better places to eat in the West Loop.

A group of 14 came here to surprise our friend for her birthday. We had the tapas menu. The food at best was average , decent dessert and AWFUL management. Very rude, inconsiderate and  rip off. They birthday girl was very unhappy and so was everyone else. 
Will not be back and won't recommend to celebrate an event here.

The coolest bar/restaurant I've ever been in...no joke. Staff is very friendly and attentive. Atmosphere is mind blowing. Prices are fair- we went for brunch and everything was 10$-20$. Had the bloody mary bar (14$) I wasn't a big fan of the mix but was cool set up. Shared the bacon wrapped dates (were standard).
