This place doesn't even deserve one star. My boyfriend and I ordered a fried rice and red thai curry from this place. We ordered both very mild as my boyfriend is allergic to spicy food. They charge a $5 delivery fee, and we were super hungry and figured if this place charges a delivery fee, then the food must get here pretty quick. The food took 90 minutes to get here...and was cold once it arrived. My boyfriend even requested soy sauce and chili sauce, and our order didn't come with anything. Not even fortune cookies! Furthermore, their red curry was on fire! I can handle spice, and my eyes and nose were running. My poor boyfriend couldn't even enjoy the meal. When he called the manager to complain, he said, and I quote, "deal with it." My boyfriend then requested to be compensated the $5 delivery fee, and all the manager said was he could give us 20% off our next order. HAH! Like we would ever come back when there are a dozen Thai places in Chicago that offer quality service and good food! The fried rice was so so, the rice was sticky and undercooked. Don't order from here. You've been warned.

Everything made from scratch. We like to do family style and sample everything. Green curry with shrimp, drunken noodles and basil chicken were awesome. Chicken satay was tender - the peanut sauce makes it. Been to plenty of Thai joints and this is the one where I've liked everything we ordered. Service was great. BYOB with no cork fee is a plus too.

I am sad to give them 2 stars because the customer service is very good but we were very disappointed with the pat see ew. The place was very clean and the servers were super friendly. I was hoping to make this my go to place for Thai food but I don't think I can come back after this. 

In short: great customer service but bad food quality :(

Amazing food! We ordered delivery and expected it in about an hour, but it came about half hour late. (They did call us at the hour mark and told us they were leaving soon, which was nice.) We got the panang curry with vegetables at spice level one which was AMAZING (but still had quite a kick) and the drunken noodles with tofu (which was FANTASTIC.) My husband complained that the portions were small; they were probably "normal sized" and were satisfying, but there were definitely no leftovers. (Well, who's to know if that's because of the portion size or the tastiness of the food) Will definitely order again!
Excellent food and service. Can't go wrong with anything you order- best Thai on Taylor street- by far!

This hidden gem has the best Thai food on Taylor Street! I've lived in the neighborhood for 10 years and have tried every Thai place, this place is by far the best. The service was excellent and they have a few outdoor tables too. I had Chicken Pad Thai and Crab Rangoon and I would highly recommend it.

Fresher food than Thai bowl, but our food was 20 minutes late, the phone was busy when I tried to called, and the food we asked for not spicy is hot and the spicy food is bland. The pad see eiw was not cooked together or something - crunchy non sauced broccoli, bland tofu but sauce on the noodles. Guess we'll go back to Ma and I or Opart Thai. Disappointed since we are 4 blocks away.
Great place, nice ambience, amazing authentic food and wonderful service! 5 star absolutely!
Tried it with friends today. On arrival, I loved the ambiance and the decorations. Food was also amazing. Will definitely recommend.

The first time I went to this restaurant, I enjoyed it. They made a dish for me that wasn't on the menu and the waiter/owner (I believe a mother and son own the restaurant) was attentive. The second time, it was the opposite. My friend asked for a dish that was on the menu but to make a substitution of something. He said she should get something else instead, but that he would make it hot, because she wanted it spicy. Anyway, the only heat to the dish was the massive amount of black pepper on the top. The service was also horrible. We waited a long time for each thing - appetizer, meal, and then the check. We asked for the check several times, and it was to the point that I was going to walk out an not pay because we were needed to leave at that point and he wouldn't bring us our check. I also had to stay on top of him to run our credit card. And so, we won't be back.

So delicious! My absolute favorite is the papaya salad-crunchy, tangy, and spicy. We order it every time. Never disappoints. Tonight we also ordered the curry noodle soup which tasted a bit like khao soi and was just so tasty. Oh and for dessert we got the fried banana and it was heavenly. I can't wait to try everything on the menu.
Came for dinner with two friends. Was very happily surpassed with the quality, presentation, and flavor. Highly recommend.
Worst delivery ever. Why do people think that 45-60 minutes actually means 90+ minutes? Plus the food sucked. People giving this place good reviews should be ashamed of themselves. Pathetic.
Ordered a pad see yew, first time at the place. It was better than thai bowl. Flavor on point! And college discount was a bigger bonus!

Probably the worst experience I've had in a Thai restaurant.   I ordered veggie spring rolls and a Penang curry.   I asked for the rolls to be totally vegan...was specific about what that meant...and they still had egg. I sent them back and the new iteration had shrimp.  The curry took almost 90 minutes to arrive...I asked for brown rice and they brought white.  I asked for lots of veggies and they gave only bell peppers.   On the positive side, they owner came over, apologized profusely and gave me a 30% discount, and didn't charge me for the rolls.   In the end, it was all kind of comical.   They were certainly very nice, and the curry had a nice flavor.   It seemed like they were overwhelmed with Grub Hub orders, which could have had something to do with it.  Still, over an hour wait for a series of mis-orders can't merit more than one star (if that).
The food is amazing. The flavors are bold and clean. This will definitely become one of my go to places.
Delicious Thai food. So glad I found this place. Very fresh and flavorful. I will order from here again.

As authentic as it gets.  The owners will also prepare dishes based upon your preferences- spicy/mild and will mix and match proteins.  We had the honor of watching them prepare lunch for all of their deceased relatives to share on Chinese New Year.  An Asian and Thai tradition.  Very special.  Wonderful people.
I ordered the noodle soup with beef. The beef is yummy and savory. Great garlic flavor and the noodles were lovely. Will go here again!
A true gem! Great food, superb service, very clean and with reasonable prices. It's a regular stop for us.
Best Thai food I have had outside of Thailand. The green curry was as fantastic as it gets. The Pad Ped Catfish was also great!

I wish I could give 4.5 stars. This place has only been open about a month and I've already been here a few times. The service is excellent. While I can't rate authenticity, I will say all the food has tasted very fresh and flavorful. It's also pretty inexpensive for a very generous portion. I will definitely be returning.
Had Pad See Ew. It was amazing. Coming back later for panang curry or something like beef curry noodle

My boyfriend and I happened upon this place while apartment hunting in the area. It is seriously so delicious. I'm from NYC and am somewhat of a Thai food snob, so I was a bit skeptical of the great reviews other yelpers gave this place - and of the tiny restaurant's fairly dingy interior, but the food is soooooo good. I ordered the pad see ew, a safe standby, and I think it's up there with the best noodles I've ever had. They were light and fluffy, not dense and sticky, and perfectly seasoned. My boyfriend had the green curry, extra spicy, which was actually spicy enough and had fresh jalapeños. We would definitely go out of our way to come back here again. I think this place mostly does take out, but in the summer there's a little outside patio which was very pleasant to sit in.

Do not, do not order delivery from this place. I placed an order shortly before 6pm on a Sunday night, at 7:30 we got a text saying that the food was on it's way. Over 20 minutes later, a drive that takes less then 10 when the traffic is at it's busiest, the food arrived... Cold. As normal humans, I called the place and complained and told them I didn't want the food and I wasn't going to pay for it. They made up a ton of excuses as to why the food was cold, "It's cold outside" was one, apparently having never heard of an insulated container.  I ended up talking to the "owner" who told me I could get a credit on my next order, but not a refund -- because, yes, I do want to order cold food again (sarcasm).  Then he tells me that I will have to talk to the owner (wait, I thought that was you), and that he would call me tomorrow.  I'm not holding my breath.  Basically, wait 2 hours for cold food, horrible customer service, and it only cost me $50+ to find out that I should just give up on finding a good Thai place that can also deliver.

Oyster Bah is great! My boyfriend and I were really craving oysters so I searched up places that had a great happy hour for oysters. Oyster bah popped up pretty high on the list and was a great location. Their happy hour runs pretty long during the weekend 3-6 it's usually 5-6 on the weekdays. I made a reservation really easily on opentable the day before and showed up. They had more than enough seats and offer their happy hour anywhere you sit. I really hate places that only offer their happy hour JUST at the bar. That just really irks me so I was happy we could sit comfortably at a table and still indulge at the happy hour special.

They were pretty straight forward about which oysters were half off so we chose half a dozen of each (there were only 2 options). They did have an impressive list of oysters I wish they were all on the happy hour deal. They also had clams on the half price happy hour but we stuck with oysters. I wish they had more options for happy hour like drinks and what not that would've been nice. We ended up ordering a bottle of rose with our oysters and the waiter was super nice and always making sure our glasses were full. We ended up ordering another half dozen of the east coast oysters but both oysters were great choices. We were still hungry so ordered the grilled octopus. This dish was perfectly cooked and I suggest ordering it if you want something small to eat. 

This will definitely be my go to oyster spot place! It's super close to the train and it's such a great area with bars and other good restaurants around!

The food: 2/5. We tried a few cocktails on the menu, and even though we were told the cocktails were on the dry side, I thought they were on the sweeter side and not well balanced. I had the seafood salad, which had somewhat wilted lettuce and incredibly fatty dressing. Considering the salad was more expensive than a lot of seafood entrees on the menu, I had higher expectations. At least they can come up with a lighter alternative to louis dressing, which is all mayo. Fish and chips was nothing to write home about. Overall, it's a incredibly boring menu at inflated prices. 

The service: 2/5. Not particularly attentive. No one checked if we wanted another round of drinks and our bill was brought without asking if we wanted dessert. 

Overall: 2/5.  Oyster Bah has a vibe of an upscale Applebee's with zero creativity and overpriced entrees. Solid "meh" category.

My boyfriend and I went on a Saturday night. We made reservations so we were able to sit right down. Making reservations is highly recommended because the location is small and does get very busy and crowded. 

We ordered the oysters which were our waiters choice. Overall very tasty and shucked perfectly. The calamari we ordered had a very greasy batter and I didn't even finish it. Finally the seafood roll we ordered was small and very overpriced. Overall the oysters were tasty but everything else we ordered seemed overpriced and the taste was not worth it at all. 

The drinks I would recommend. I ordered the "cape for a cause" and "starbird". Both really good but the starbird was definitely my favorite. Its a take on a margarita. 

In the end I probably wouldn't go back unless they had specials on oysters during the week for a quick bite.

One word....delicious! Not to packed on a Wednesday night. It's a smaller space but doesn't feel cramped and has that east coast fish joint decor. 

I had the crispy Thai red snapper. Best choice there! It's a whole fish that's been fried. But it's the side of Thai sauce that really sets this apart! It's so good they should bottle it! 

Get this and enjoy!

My husband and I came one a Sunday night for our wedding anniversary dinner. The place wasn't packed, but still busy. Our server was really friendly. We even received a hand written card for our special day. That was a nice touch. 

Now for the food. They had a nice selection of oysters. I think we tried 4 types total. We liked the Kumamoto oysters the best. They were all very fresh. We also ordered the grilled oysters, and those were really good too. My husband ordered the New England seafood platter, and I had the Thai red snapper. Both dishes were pretty good. We made room for coconut cake, and they gave us a free scoop of peppermint ice cream. Both were delicious. 

I will definitely be back, especially for the coconut cake.

Okay so I thought I would absolutely love this place and I ended up just liking it and thinking it was okay. I made a reservation for my husband and two girls on a Saturday afternoon around 3pm thinking it wouldn't be the busiest time which is good since I'm bringing my kids. We got in and it was pretty empty so that was nice and I liked their cape cod like atmosphere! That's definitely nice! 

So we ordered their happy hour oysters that came to like $1.50 a piece which isn't a bad deal and I got some west coast and east coast ones to try. Honestly, they weren't the best I've had, didn't taste as fresh as I would have liked and the place is called oyster bah so I had high oyster expectations. We also got their wicked calamari which is fried calamari with a bunch of other veggies, I felt like the ratio of veggies was more than calamari and for $14 i thought that was okay.
What we did love were the lobster rolls. They were $27 and it came with 3 little lobster roll sliders, again I felt like it made it look bigger than it was since it's mostly bread and then there is some lobster chunks. But it certainly was delicious and I would still get it because the fries that it came with were crispy and tasty as well.

We were full from everything so we skipped out on dessert. But I would have wanted to try their coconut cake or key lime pie. Our server was also a little pushy and didn't care for him so overall our experience was okay, some of the food was good, some was a miss but I'm not sure I'll be back.

Fun seafood spot that brings you to the East Coast like you're dining at a local seafood restaurant next to the Atlantic. There are plenty of good seafood options and some delicious drinks to go with your dinner.

I have to give this place 5 stars because it truly has excellent food, service and ambience. It's on Halsted, a trendy street with some really good eats (and it's Chicago so plenty of bars too). Their specialty is oysters from the east and west coast. We had a dozen ($3 per) from 6 regions (did you know east coast oysters are more briney,  and west coast oysters have a scalloped shape?). We loved them all. And the best was the champagne vinegar (they mix champagne with vinegar, sugar and salt and herbs, freeze it and then chip off some for each oyster serving)... how can we ever go back to horseradish tomato sauce- we can't! We shared a nice roasted beet salad and fried whole snapper with coconut rice and Thai chili sauce. The fish was lovely and delicate and perfectly quick fried and dipped in the Thai sauce it was so so good. For dessert the hubs had clam chowder (for real) and he said it was the best ever and I had their famous coconut cake. Omg that cake was the moistest and most delectable cake I've ever had and not too sweet just naturally so. Gotta make reservations because the place is packed and a lively bar scene too. Decor is modern rustic with an updated marine room look (no dark lighting). The service was impeccable. The waiter knew the oyster selection, menu and drink items. Described the nuances of the oysters and the wine pairings. The wait staff immediately cleaned up after each dish was done. I'd definitely return.

Came back for another try and decided to stop in for dinner this time. Overall, a much better experience than my first visit. My boyfriend and I started off with the calamari because I raved about it from the first visit. Calamari was still good however half of the order was deep fried lemons. We tried a few oysters, pretty good - I can't remember what we tried but both were tasty. for the main course, he ordered the mussels and I ordered crab cakes. Unlike his delicious mussels (really good) my crab cakes were VERY tiny and did not resemble a crab or crab cake taste. They were sort of a let down for the $26 I paid. Again, his mussels were great and I would come back for those. Really a shame that two trips and the entree I choose disappoints me. I now have an understanding of what not to get.

May come back again for bloodys and mussels but not crab cakes.

Another "Lettuce" place that gets high marks for the interior.  While not authentically "shabby" like some shacks I've eaten at in Maine and Oregon, they manage to nail the "rustic" look.  

It's a very noisy venue. Make sure your hearing aids have new  batteries. Even if u changed them, you won't be able to hear shit.  Acoustically, it's like trying to have a conversation at an AC/DC or Metallica concert.

Nice selection of oysters, but by 7:30pm on a Friday night, the selection of 10 varieties had been whittled down to 7 choices.  Our server was knowledgeable however, so we trusted her suggestions for alternate sections. Hand-crafted cocktails were tasty.  Wine selections were seafood friendly,  but def on the pricey side.  

New England Seafood Platter was OK, not great.  3 butterflied shrimp were left on the grill too long, and were dry/overcooked.  The 2 sautéed scallops, and the lump crab cake were flavorful.  The small portion of jasmine rice with parsley was barely warm.  Fish & Chips were good.  Matchstick french fries were crispy, and lightly battered haddock was moist.  

Overall. OB is good.  
5 stars---I think not.

More like two stars.  Coming from lettuce that's why we gave them three stars. Svc was ok but how hard is it to serve a lobster role and salad.  That took some time ! I
Kept on thinking I could of made this @ home.  Example recently went to EMA and it was amazing.  Oh well. There is room for improvement.  Fries do dry.  Lobster role average.  Salad ,lettuce below average.  I was anticipating shaws level of quality.  ?!

A little bit of Boston in Chicago! For those who don't like seafood, go elsewhere since 95% of the menu is fishes and the like.

Oyster's Bloody (Mary): not too salty which is good but not spicy at all which is bad. Comes with a large shrimp cocktail and a Miller High Life back - YAY!

Chowdah: delicious but scarce on the amount clams. Could have used some chopped chives, scallions or parsley for a little extra flavor and color.

Stuffies (stuffed clam): you get one clam for $9 - yikes! Hard to taste the clam and chorizo amongst al the bread crumbs.

Our waiter, Clayton, was awesome! Very friendly, funny, patient, knowledgeable and calm and cool. And very accommodating - he brought over 3 extra hot sauces for us to experiment with.

I really wanted to stay and try some other items but didn't find the value in what we had ordered so far. Also, the music was dentist office bad - mostly easy listening / adult contemporary. REALLY??? We decided to leave before Yanni or Kenny G. came on.

Really loved the oyster po'boy! This whole review should be about that!
However, loved the decor and service too! I ordered a broccoli side because most of their menu is just sea food, even the broccoli was amazing!! I would not recommend ordering the stuffies, only because it is one small clam and very bread-y! The baked oysters were delicious! Our server was really sweet too.

Lettuce Entertain You continues to show that they know what they're doing when opening new restaurants and trying out new concepts.

The atmosphere here is great and the inside reminds you of an East Coast seafood restaurant.

We had a group of 3 (including myself) and instead of everyone ordering main dishes we went with the Chilled Seafood Platter which has Oysters, Shrimp, Little Neck Clams, Stone Crab, Tuna Poke and Crab Bites.

All of these was very fresh and very good! 

We also got the Kennebec Fries on the side which were great!

All-in-all it was a very nice evening and while I would certainly come back nothing about this place stood out as being amazing or special.

Chicago is a hard market to be a restaurant in since there are soooo many good options too choose from, but overall the Oyster Bah is another solid seafood option to add to the list.

Wanna know where I'll be on my birthday--the one day a year my wife will take me anywhere I want to go and spend any amount of money without contest? I'll be at Oyster Bah.

Yes, that's how much I loved this place. I'm a bit of a seafood addict, and, in my dream life, I walk down a rock New England beach each day, meandering to lunch in my favorite seafood shack.

That's probably not going to be my reality anytime soon, but eating at Oyster Bah sure filled that void.

We went recently on date night, wanting a good, but casual, meal. The vibe at OB--complete with kitschy seafood shack decor--really fit the bill. We'd made reservations, which I'd suggest, and were seated immediately. 

I expected all of the good raw bar options: oysters, crab legs, shrimp, etc. What I hadn't expected was the entree listings, which were packed full of pretty much every one of my death row meals: lobster roll, fish tacos, NOLA BBQ shrimp, whole fried snapper in a Thai sauce. I could go on.

Our poor waiter, who was AMAZING, fielded a gazillion "what would you order?" questions.

We ended up with oysters--both raw and charbroiled, crab bites (OMG--can I have these instead of a birthday cake?!), tuna poke (needed a bit more spice and salt, but pretty good), clam chowder, garlic bread, fish tacos, and the whole fried snapper. Everything was insanely delicious, fresh, and plentiful. 

We also had two cocktails, including The Cape--their take on a cranberry and vodka. Also delicious.

For dessert, they only have two options: coconut cake and peppermint ice cream with hot fudge. We did what any self-loving people would do; we ordered both. WOW. You really don't need multiple desserts when the ones you have are so gosh darn perfect.

Our bill was well over $250, which was a bit much for a casual night out, but what could we expect? We ordered half the menu.

We left satisfied and woke up the next day craving more. "That's where I want to go for my birthday," I told my wife on the way home. And that's where you'll find me.

I had such a great food experience here!  Our party of five (I was the fifth wheel) arrived one hour before the kitchen closed, and we were promptly seated and serviced.  Our drinks and appetizers quickly came out.  I highly recommend the clam chowdah and calamari (which tasted so fresh!).  

It was tough deciding which entree to order, so I asked our helpful waiter how he would rank the three dishes that caught my eye.  His vote: 1- burger 2- fish & chips 3- po'boy.  I was surprised that the burger was the top suggestion at a seafood place, but boy was he right.  It was juicy, cheesy, and filling (especially with the fries).  My brother got the fish & chips, and they were also out of this world.  

For dessert, we shared the homemade key lime pie (also amazing).  I'm sure you'll eat something you love at Oyster Bah!

There are so many things that I like about this concept that this should have this be a 4 or 5 star review.  After all, there are at least 10 different east and west coast oysters daily, a cocktail  list that has a little of something for everyone, and servers who really seem to love what they do.

But after two months, they are still working out some of the "new restaurant blues" which I found surprising, given this is a Lettuce Entertain You concept and usually they nail it from day one.

But I digress.  This was actually my third try to get into the Oyster Bah.  On my first attempt, the hostess told us we "didn't need a reservation but just to come before 6:30".  So we did.  Only to be told when we arrived at 6pm that the earliest that they could seat us would be after 10pm.  And clearly she told this to others as well as the two couples in front of me had the same story at the hostess stand.  And if she sends you down the basement to the "Crab shack", know that the space there is even tinier so all the people who didn't fit upstairs are now downstairs.

On my second attempt, there was an OpenTable glitch and while I had the much needed reservation, they couldn't find me in the System when we arrived.  Hmmm . . .so their sister restaurant Summer House was great about getting us in.

Third time's the charm and on this visit, the reservation went fine and we had a nice table for two, but on this visit, the kitchen pacing was off.  But let's start with the good.

Our server, Clayton, was terrific!  Friendly, knowledgable, and just all around nice, he was quick to suggest some of his favorite drinks and items on the menu, which of course we followed.

My friend had "The Cape" which was a vodka based cranberry drink (with crushed ice, my fav) and I had the Nor Easter which was rye based and smooth and creamy, says a lot for the drink as I am not a huge of rye.

We ordered a range of oysters to start as well as the tuna poke and a crab cake, but this is where the timing issues started.  We waited an hour (yes, I checked my watch) for the oysters to show up.  We were joking that they must be out catching them or that the little buggers were putting up a huge fight about being opened. The tuna poke (super fresh) came as did our crab cake (just like Shaw's and served with a horseradish sauce ) and both were excellent but still no sign of those darn oysters.  Odd given this place is called the "oyster bah".

Our server was very apologetic and ended up comping the oysters, when they did come, which was very nice.

But the next delay came in getting our entrees to come up.  I ordered the trout which was delicious, split, fried in some glorious butter with crispy skin, then served with creamy potato salad and was spot on.  My friend had the BBQ shrimp and just like our server warned, was "very messy".  The shrimp have their shells on which means you have to peel them through the BBQ sauce, thus the mess, but hot towels and lemons were provided to clean up afterwards.  

But this food, again, took a very long time to come up.  So much so, by the time we left, we had been at the restaurant for almost 2 hours and 20 minutes.  And while that would be okay in a fine dining restaurant with many courses, this place is all about a casual dining experience.

Also- save room, as while they only have 2 desserts on the menu, on this night, it was a coconut cake that was smooth and creamy and certainly calorie worthy!

If you drive, valet parking is available out front for $14.  And while this is casual dining, know that the prices may be higher than what a "crab shack" might conjure up.  Dinner for two with two drinks was $160 (the oysters had we been charged for them were another $18) but it's priced right for the quality of the food and the neighborhood.

All in all, I came,I saw,I ate.  But I am wondering what all the hype is about?  The food is good, the place is cute, but the timing hiccups are probably going to find me heading elsewhere to get my "oyster fix" until they get those resolved.

The wine selection is fantastic! The service was great! Loved the food. I recommend getting the poke for sure! Very fresh and simple flavor. I also got the fish tacos. They had a great spicy sauce and allowed the flavor of the fish to come through. The coconut cake is to die for! Super moist and not too sweet.

Swordfish Schnitzel Bah!

Doesn't have quite the same ring to it. 

On a mid-December Tuesday evening, I found myself seated downstairs in the nearly empty Crab Shack (Cellar) which, with its red-n-white picnic table cloths, mismatched chairs and black-and-nautical themed shortie bar, was acceptable enough in itself. Where it went awry for me...was the "just my imagination...runnin' away with me" and "every-body plays the fool..." I'm a fan of Motown but it just didn't seem to fit the scene. 

Something else was off: timing. 

Soup came out quickly - the clam chowdah was good, as compared to my other experiences with the Lettuce Entertain You Ent (LEYE) restaurants, and it tasted as expected.  

Then what? The Swordfish Schnitzel chef must've been overwhelmed. The waiter explained "it's the same kitchen as upstairs," (where it was bustling) but this server too, timing-wise, seemed uneven: pregnant pauses, an air of formality in a casual setting...the service just felt "off."

As a fan of LEYE overall, I'm happy to return and to try again. The schnitzel and accompanying potato salad was good, as expected, (& hey, coming from Christkindl Market & nabbing a tasty fish schnitzel, how fitting) even if the service/pacing/music downstairs was not exactly to my liking, I liked the menu choices. 

Next time, I'll stick to upstairs, eat oysters and enjoy the more vibrant atmosphere and hopefully a smoother dining experience. 

Oysta Bah!

I've wanted to try this restaurant since it opened plus they were participating in Restaurant Week so it was a great opportunity.  Fourth LEYE restaurant in the area.  

Making a reservation was very easy via opentable.com.  When I had arrived, I was greeted by the hostess and seated right away.  Dina M, server, had greeted me within a few minutes.  She was very polite and very professional.  Since I had reviewed the menu prior to my arrival, I had decided to order off of the Restaurant Week menu. Beginning with Shrimp Cocktail and then Fish n' Chips for the entree.  

This is a smaller restaurant than most of the Lettuce restaurants with a nautical ambiance.  There is a small bar area.  The dining area has various size of tables.  A little cozy.

My appetizer was delivered - no complaints.   After the appetizer, the food runner had delivered the main entree.  The entree was just the right size and delicious.  Meanwhile, Dina would check in with me without being intrusive. 
 Great service!   I did save room for dessert.  I had ordered the Peppermint Ice Cream with Hot Chocolate Syrup on the side - excellent.

My entire experience was excellent.  I would highly recommend this restaurant and Dina M for service.

This place is awesome.  The ambiance is neat and feels like an old oyster shack in Massachusetts.  

We started with a dozen oysters.  We mixed to get most of the menu and cover both coasts.  Our server (Nick) seemed to know quite a bit about the menu and was happy to help us pick what we wanted.  The oysters we all fantastic.  On top of that, the restaurant has some of their own hot sauces and they were all really good, too.

Both of our main dishes were really good.  I got the manila clams and gnocchi and was really happy with my meal.  It was rich and a good portion without leaving you feeling like you needed to be wheeled out.

In all, we will definitely be going back soon!

I saw they were opening a couple months ago and made a note to go. Finally had the chance to stop in this week. Started off with a dozen of the oysters. I generally like west coast over east, and the Washington based oysters were by far the best. My friend had the blackened fish which I believe was actually the mahi, with the grilled asparagus. 

I went with the mussels which were massive. Generally I go with a spicy red sauce with mussels but their white garlic is amazing! Our waiter suggested dessert so we went with the coconut cake which was light and moist. Overall the food was amazing, I only wish the cocktail menu was a little more developed, but I'll definitely be back!

East coast charm to the extreme! Small inside which just adds to that cozy feeling of walking into an old, neighborhood east coast seafood joint. We were seated right away and after some recommendations on wine and food, we threw in a bunch of orders. Everything we had was amazing so I recommend it all! The oysters, crab bites, clam chowder, and poke were the apps worth getting. The snapper and the swordfish are two of their most ordered entrees- I can see why! For dessert the blueberry pie tasted like homemade. Phenomenal meal and service.
Downstairs is an even smaller space called the "crab cellar". Its a bar and a few tables and they serve a few things there if you're hungry and can't get a seat upstairs. Their focus down there is the king crab platter. Be sure to grab a drink at the bar from the friendly bartender, Rudy. 
Will def be back!

My boyfriend and I came here this evening for a nice Wednesday date night. I was actually way more impressed by my second Oyster Bah food experience(tonight)  in comparison to my first one. I was able to easily make a reservation for this Wednesday night dinner, but unfortunately we were running late due  to CTA delays. Despite our 15 minute tardiness, we were welcomed with a smile and seated right away. 

The dinner started with a refreshing glass of one of their white wines. For appetizers, my boyfriend and I ordered some of the oysters the waiter recommended, and also the fried calamari. I was very pleased with the taste and quality of the oysters, just like during my first visit. The calamari had a good balance of lemon and spice to it. The portion of the calamari is also very generous, and would be fine for groups up to 4 people. 

As my main dish I had the shrimp and grits, and the tomato type gravy that is used really complements the meal perfectly. I only had the shrimp and grits like 4 hours ago, but I can't wait to have it again. My boyfriend had the bbq shrimp, and that dish was unexpectedly delicious as well. When I imagined bbq shrimp, I almost was imaging some shrimp swimming in Sweet Baby Ray's or something. I don't know what this bbq sauce is made of, but it is unlike any other bbq sauce I've ever had and I'm sure it's homemade. My second Oyster Bah experience was wonderful in every way.

Fabulous food and good service.

Crowded, very loud, and very pricey.

Clayton was an excellent server.  Oysters were good.  Garlic bread was ordinary.  Shrimp and grits were better than I've ever had in New Orleans.  Coconut cake was moist and light, absolutely perfect.  Wine listing was very weak - good variety but few choices, I can't even call it a wine "list."

End result:  We agreed, we'll stick with Shaw's,  Closer to home, not as noisy, larger menu selection, and similar quality food.  But if you're a lot younger than us and enjoy the noise and crowd, give Oyster Bah a try.  The food is outright fabulous.

Atmosphere is cute and very cape cop. Fun for a date or out with friends. We sat in the back but the bar looked really cool.
- get the regular shrimp cocktail and skip the old bay version

This was hands down such a wonderful experience from start to finish!  From the ambiance, to the service, to the food, my friends and I loved everything about Oyster Bah.

We sat in the downstairs lounge area and were fretted by the world's best server, Dina.  We started with the Cape cocktails (delish!!) and ordered the stuffies right away.  Dina recommended a few dishes and we ended up with bowls clam chowder, red snapper, salmon, and fish tacos.  I loved my red snapper and would order it again.  My friends enjoyed their dishes as well.  

The lounge was an adorable spot, perfect for any occasion.  I loved the "boat feel" of the space and the cozier vibe.  

I can't wait to go back to Oyster Bah...if this first experience was any indication, the next will be just as great if not better!

We came here for an 8 p.m. dinner reservation this past Friday night. They did a really amazing job with the decor and we were seated right away. First impression: fabulous. 

We ordered three oysters each - their three most popular ones they had on the menu that night. I thought they were a tad overpriced for how small they were, but the taste made up for that. So fresh and so delicious. After that, we shared the Poke Poke (some of the freshest, best raw tuna and salmon I've ever had), the Smoked Trout Dip (was very creamy, but that didn't overpower the fish which was excellent), and the New England Stuffies. I know everyone here raves about the stuffies, but I just wasn't a huge fan. They were a little dry and lukewarm by the time they arrived.

Why only four stars and not five: The place itself is pretty small. The jam a lot of tables into a small space, so we felt like we were on top of everyone else. The server was great once she arrived, but it did take a while to get our drink order. We ordered a bottle of white and it arrived after our first dish. Stuffies were just okay.

All in all, a pleasant experience. I'd probably come back.

Had an 830 reservation but our table wasn't available yet so we sat at the bar for a little bit. It took maybe 20 minutes for us to get our table but once we were seated our waitress was great. And because of the wait they gave us a dozen oysters for free! 

The oysters were delicious! We also had the tuna poke and it was really good. Over all a great experience. For a Friday night it was busy but not ridiculously overcrowded. I would recommend reservations!

We went to oyster bar and I can say we ate oysters till we were tired! We went during happy hour and two oysters (1east+1west) are half off so of course we did that. My favorite are Pink Moon,Little Island, Shigoku, and Summerside. Least was the Kumamoto it didn't deliver the sweet taste finish. Pink moon and Shigoku did Yum! Trout dip was eh if u like mayo do it and the ceviche was subpar but we do that right in TX so try it at own risk. Clean, nice Place w a sweet waitress.

Had a craving for oysters this afternoon and Oyster Bah did not disappoint! While the food was great, the menu needs to be updated to reflect happy hour criteria. 

We went after lunchtime, prior to the dinner dinner rush, so we had most of the place to ourselves. Our hostess informed us we were just in time for happy hour* and that all oysters we half off, score! 

Our waiter was very friendly and knowledgable about the selection of seafood. Normally I wouldn't order a dozen oysters by myself, but the happy hour price of $18 wasn't bad. I ordered every single oyster that was offered! 

The oysters were delicious, and our waiter was very attentive and came back to discuss which ones were my favorite and the differences between east and west coast selections. 

However, when the bill came, we were charged the original price of $36 for a dozen oysters. After discussing with our waiter apparently only 2 kinds oysters are under the happy hour special. What? 

This was disappointing, as it doesn't say anything on the menu about only getting those 2 choices. While our server was apologetic we were still charged the full amount. Not a deal breaker, I just would have gotten those specific 2 or only half a dozen. 

Be sure to try the coconut cake before you leave! It changed my life. So moist and delicious! 

Overall a bit pricey, especially with the happy hour mixup, but the food was enjoyable. 

*happy hour is from 3-6pm Fridays through Sunday's. Please be sure to discuss with your server which oysters are included in happy hour, as this is not outlined on their menu.

What we got:
Dad: Trout Dip appetizer, Fish and Chips
Mom: Tuna Poke appetizer, shrimp cocktail app as an entrée
Me: Originally lobster roll, substituted with BBQ Peel & Eat shrimp
Dessert: Coconut cake

What was good:
-Tuna Poke was great but very small and my mother doesn't believe in sharing
-My Peel & Eat BBQ shrimp was excellent and I thoroughly enjoy any appropriate reason to get BBQ sauce all over myself and have it be publicly acceptable
-Ambiance and décor is awesome
-In which countries is it legal to marry coconut cake? 

What was meh:
-the trout dip was just weird, but maybe I'm just not a trout fan

What was bad:
-I originally ordered the lobster roll and it came out looking fine enough, but one bite set off a red siren in my head. My dad is the king of "it's fine, just put it in your mouth and eat it" so I had him take a bite...and for probably the first time in my life, he agreed that something tasted really off - almost sour and the lobster was uncomfortably warm. I was not in the mood for digestive issues that evening and flagged down the waitress, who was awesome about it and my new order came out in record time.

-The prices are higher than Willie Nelson. Let's break this down: I had 7 pieces of shrimp and two drinks. My dad had fish and chips, a thing of dip smaller than the size of my fist, and a beer. My mom had two drinks, 6 pieces of shrimp, and 4 chips worth of tuna poke. We all split one dessert. Before we applied our Lettuce Entertain You points, that came out to almost $60 a person. Unless the fish is blessed by the Pope, that seems a little insane for the amount of food we actually ate. Maybe it's me, but this place is way over priced for what it is.

TL;DR
come on payday / with a wealthy significant other and cry tears of joy whilst eating your coconut cake

From the owners of Boca this great seafood spot opened across the street just a little while ago and has been the buzz.

I came here on a Thursday night and the place was packed!

We started with the chilled seafood platter.  Being a midwest girl I'm not a huge fan of oysters but gave it a shot.  The platter included oysters, shrimp, little neck clams, poke, stone crab and crab bites.  We asked the waitress to give us a few char grilled oysters instead and she happily accommodated.  I  definitely enjoyed the garlicy grilled flavor the oysters had with the crunch of breadcrumbs.

For entrees we had the crispy rainbow trout and the crispy one-sided red snapper with thai chili sauce.  I wasn't that impressed by the rainbow trout but the crispy red snapper was amazing!.  It took a bit for me to get the hang of fish on the bone but the flavors and heat definitely made up for my labor involved meal.  The chili sauce was addictive and the crisp texture was perfect.  I didn't sense it to be greasy and the fish was flaky and moist.  The french fries as a side were a great option to dip in the thai chili sauce as well.

Over all I loved the laidback vibe and fresh fish options.  The hostess, manager and wait staff were all great and I would definitely be back!

What a fun, casual, and good food place! We ate in their lower dining room which is smaller and a little more quiet. It's also a great place for a party!
There were 4 of us and we worked our way through a lot of the appetizers. We had a big selection of oysters to choose from and our dozen were fresh and flavorful. I ate many without the dips and drank the juice in the shells. 
The trout dip was terrific and next time we'll order 2. Loved the crab bites, which are chopped pieces of legs. You push out the meat and we had 2 dips for them. And the last cold dish was the Poke poke with sesame ginger tuna and cilantro chili salmon. A real treat!
Our hot dish was the wicked calamari and it had some good spice!
We were filling up pretty fast so we shared the grilled fish tacos. The fish had a nice mustard char glaze. 
Finally we had the coconut cake everyone raves about and I saw why. It was very light and airy but with amazing moisture. We also tried the key lime pie and it also was perfect, nice and tart without to much sweetness.

Have been here twice with my wife and we really enjoyed it both times. The most recent trip to Oyster Bah was a really stellar time. We were sat right next to the open front facing window on a beautiful day. The Cotes Du Provence Rosé we ordered was delicious and surprisingly a 1L bottle instead of the typical 750mL (could have had something to do with the amount of enjoyment that occured!)

Our waiter, whose name I forget unfortunately, was far above average. He had a very good knowledge of the menu, good humor, and provided great service.

We ordered oysters (6), clam chowder (2), and split the Maryland-Style Crab Cake Platter between the two of us. Everything was outstanding.

We had the Poke-Poke, trout dip, and coconut cake on a prior visit and all of those are great options. ESPECIALLY THE COCONUT CAKE!

A group of us were looking for somewhere to brunch and since we're all from New England, decided that Oyster Bah would be a great spot. The interior is really fun and feels just like a bar on an East Coast beach. It's nautical and fishy without being tacky. We were easily able to get a reservation at 11 on a Sunday morning and it really never got too packed or hectic. Our server was helpful and friendly. We took forever to order and he was very patient with us. 

The others in my group had the bloody mary, which came with a ton of toppings like pickles and shrimp. I had the Pearl in the Park but with vodka instead of gin. My drink was delicious. It was like a fancier mimosa with a nice fruity flavor, but not too sweet. The others started with three types of oysters (not my thing) and they really enjoyed them. There's a great selection of oysters available, I think there were 12 the day we visited, from both the East and West coast. I had the fish tacos, which were insane. You get three tacos. The fish pieces were huge and so crispy. They also had a really nice amount of meat in the middle so they weren't all batter. It had a cabbage slaw and some kind of nice spice on it as well. My husband had the oysters benedict, which he said was delicious. My friends got the shrimp and grits and it looked awesome as well. 

We had a really nice time at Oyster Bah. When it was time to pay our server helped us sign up for the Lettuce Entertain You app so we could get points on our meal. I'll absolutely be back for food, and definitely cocktails.

Happy hour oysters on Saturdays count me in.

As soon as you walk in it smells "fishy." It's a seafood restaurant, duh. No its because they don't have AC on!?

Order more cold drinks: check.

The eagle rock oysters were on their 1/2 off happy hour and are delicious. Ordered 3 dozens of those. The calamari came with a spicy mayo which was yum. They mix in fried vegetables in their calamari which was different in a good way. I've never had a deep fried lemon but it was tasty. 

The staff is nice but they need more help. It was a long wait to place my drink order and a long wait to have it in front of me. 

Lettuce restaurants have a decent level of consistency besides a few bad apples. (Big bowl)

TLDR: if u like oysters come during happy hour. Hope it's not a heat wave day.

No. Just no. 

I wasn't sure what to expect from this restaurant since I LOVE LOVE LOVE Joe's, but absolutely hate Shaw's--- so what could another seafood venture from LEYE bring?

The calamari is alright, just another heavily breaded calamari dish, as if we didn't have enough of those in this city. The red snapper with Thai chili sauce was decent, but nothing to write home about. Oysters weren't bad. Service was acceptable. Restaurant was smaller than I expected, which gave it a very cozy feel. 

Overall, just another unmemorable dining experience that won't have me jumping in any conversations to recommend this place to others.

Even though I don't eat oysters, I really liked Oyster Bah. I know what you're thinking: If she doesn't eat oysters, why in the world would she eat at a place called Oyster Bah?

Well, I happen to be married to someone who can eat oysters any time, and since man cannot live on oysters alone, I knew they would have other seafood offerings I would love. After all, this is a LEYE spot, run by the team from Shaw's Crab House. I go to Shaw's all the time, so how could I not like OB? I'm also a LEYE points whore, so there's that.

We popped in on a Thursday night about 8, and were quoted a 45 minute wait, which we expected. (They do take limited reservations, but I believe only until 6:30), so we got drinks at the bar. A "Cape" for me, and my husband chose the "Nor'easter." The Cape was a twist on a classic Cape Cod, but with fresh sage and cranberry bitters. The Nor'easter was a rye-based drink with lime, ginger beer, and freshly grated nutmeg on top. Both were delicious.

After about a half hour, two seats opened at the bar, so we decided to sit there instead of waiting for a table. We love sitting at bars anyway so it worked out much better. And as luck would have it, one of the bartenders is someone I recognized from Shaw's. Luke took great care of us, as did the female bartender (whose name I didn't catch).

We ordered 8 oysters (they offer 10 kinds daily; a mix of both east and west coast varieties): 4 of the Umami, and 4 of the Spring Creek. As I mentioned, I don't eat oysters, but my husband devoured them.

We also shared the calamari, tuna tartare, roasted broccoli, and kennebec fries. Everything was on point. My only quibble is that there was too little of actual calamari--the plate was heaping, but it was mostly fried lemons and peppers, and a huge slice of toast under all the fried goodies. Kind of misleading as there was barely any calamari.

When you only offer two desserts, you better knock it out of the park. Coconut cream pie and blueberry pie are the only options. I didn't try the coconut, because after trying the blueberry, I didn't need to. If you've ever had the raspberry pie at Shaw's, this is the blueberry version. Excellent sugared crust. Dense fruit filling. Not too sweet. Perfection.

We quite enjoyed Oyster Bah, and we'll definitely be back to try more seafood offerings.

Great dinner and atmosphere at Oyster Bah. Had a 7:30 reservation on a Friday night and we were promptly seated at one of the few remaining tables. By the time we ordered drinks there were many more people standing around, hoping to get downstairs to the Crab Cellar. 

Our server was friendly and helpful. We took some of her recommendations and order a few smaller plates and an entrée to share: 

 1/2 dozen oysters--so fresh. I also really appreciated that on the oyster menu they include descriptions of what they have rather than just the name. Our favorites were the Island Creek ones (which comes as no surprise as they are always our go to when in Boston)
Tuna poke--so good and just the right portion. Would definitely order again.
Fried oysters--Instead of ordering more fresh oysters, we wanted to try their fried ones and I have to say, they didn't disappoint. Not too greasy and a good size.
Red Snapper--great flavor and plenty big to share between 2 people. We opted for the rice, but it was the only thing that we were disappointed by (and why this is a 4 star review instead of 5). It wasn't anything special, flavor-wise, and not cooked very well. We dined at Naoki the previous week (another LEYE spot) and they should just steal their rice recipe!
Fries--because we wanted fries but opted for rice with the snapper, we got them as a side order. Though they look like regular fries, they are actually harder and crispier, kind of like kettle potato chips. Didn't bother either of us as we were perfectly happy with them, but it's worth noting.
Coconut cake--I am not much of a dessert nor coconut fan, but having read the rave reviews on here, I wanted to make sure we saved room for this. It did not disappoint! So so good and definitely more than enough for 2 people. It's sweet and I don't even want to know my caloric intake from the night, but sometimes you gotta live a little. 

If you're looking for a quieter date night, I would look elsewhere. The atmosphere at Oyster Bah was pretty loud and lively. Not so much that you're yelling to hear your dinner mates, but not a great place to come and discuss anything serious. They also REALLY committed to the boating theme; it really is on the edge of being a little tacky. I saw some reviews on here mentioned timing and long waits in between courses, we experienced a little bit of that, but nothing too extreme.

A great little spot next to Stella Barra & Summer House.  We went on a Thursday and it was very busy.  My only suggestion is if you make a reso on opentable make sure you confirm it with them over the phone.  I did not and they canceled my reso which was kind of annoying.  But I called them before we went and they were nice enough to accommodate my original reso.  

The crab cake was very good.  My husband enjoyed the oysters and the crab bites.  I thought the lobster roll was delicious but he thought the fish tacos were better.  Either way they are both great!  The ambiance is fun and upbeat and the service was super friendly.  Prices are high but I guess with seafood that's what you get.  

Since I gave up meat for Lent I'm sure we will be back many times.

Cute place, it's been open 2.5 weeks but I think this place will do well. Really cute nautical shabby chic interior (including some bait/chum buckets for lights on the ceiling). There's also the crab cellar downstairs which isn't very big but has a full bar.

The menu has a little bit of everything from the sea. We tried each of the oysters they had available that day, in addition to the clam chowder, mussels and dirty rice. All of our food was good, I really liked the mussels and they will toast up more bread for the broth too if you run out. We eat a lot of oysters and I thought what we had was fine, but they aren't GT level IMO/or at least with that day's offerings. I prefer minionette sauce too which isn't offered. The pacing of our food was a little odd despite that it wasn't too crowded but we were in no hurry and it's a new place. Our server was very sweet.

It's not a huge place but the tables are spaced such that you get a seafood shack feel with quality not all fried food options. Looking forward to seeing what more they do here. Check it out!

Wanted to love this place but the entrees fell short. I give 3 stars because 4 isn't justified. Arriving for our reservation we were excited. Ordered two cocktails before sitting down and they were delish. At the table we ordered a bottle of wine, oysters, and the poke poke poke... All excellent. Everything up to our entree was great- including staff, timing, etc. 

For our meal I ordered the lobster roll and he ordered the snapper- per the server these were the 2 top things on the menu. Do not waste your money on the lobster roll. I believe the cost was $27 and I received 3 bite size pretzel buns with barely any lobster ingredients inside them. All three combined should have been one. I ate one as it came and then combined the 2 remaining lobster portions into one. The fries it came with were mediocre at best. It was a complete disappointment. When I mentioned it to the server she said, "I'll let them know". 

The snapper was good but overall the entrees didn't meet our expectations. When spending over $200, I expect to be happy when I leave. 

I recommend the cold portion of the menu along with the cocktails.

Was looking forward to a new seafood place in Lincoln Park but wasn't as impressed as the other reviews. 

The crab cake was big and delicious, it went well with their mustard/mayo sauce. The other food was just okay-- clam chowder, fish tacos, trout hash. They did have moody tongue sliced nectarine IPA on tap which was a huge plus! 

The decor is nautical but looked fake, can see it being more of a family spot for the area. Service was great, attentive and friendly. 

I would maybe go back to try the oysters and cocktails but seemed overpriced for the quantity.

It was OK. I had looked at the menu online and was not completely persuaded. It was pretty pricey as well. As you probably have guessed, we went anyways. We stopped in on our way back into down on a Sunday evening around 5 p.m. It was not super busy yet, but we were not alone. My fiance really wanted to try this place. We love Shaw's and had really high hopes. They do have the Shaws' famous crab bits on the menu; that was a plus. 

The place is really neatly decorated with an old timey feel ye hipster with the oldies but goodies station playing. Pretty sure the menu changes a bit and often. 

The crab bits must stay! They make a good appetizer. I also got a large bowl of the Clam Chowder. It was think and creamy with  enough substance to serve as most of my meal. We also compromised on the Crab Cake as an entree. Two portions of the crab cake were pretty fulling. The cakes were a wonderful portion of crab to other stuff ratio. Of the few items we ordered the price tag was hefty. I also was not that interested in the rest of the menu which made me sad. I will defintily be back and I hope something else appeals to me.

Went back after speaking with a manager. My boyfriend and I were in Lincoln Park on a Saturday morning and decided to stop here on a whim. Definitely better service this time! My boyfriend's grits were so good and I was jealous I didn't order them. We also got oysters and the server was helpful and honest in picking out which ones we wanted. It was definitely more of a relaxed meal the second time around.

This is the kind of restaurant you hope you can find when you come to a big city like Chicago! We walked in at 6pm and we're seated immediately. Our server was very helpful and used fancy words to describe how everything was prepared. We enjoyed a dozen Oysters, Calimari and Mussels......yum!

Did not enjoy our experience here. The only lettuce restaurant I've ever felt that way about. Oysters were fine, clam chowder was good. Mussels were ok and key lime pie was good. We had the seafood trio for dinner and it was sad. Plain white dry rice with 3 sad tiny scallops and 3 tiny shrimp. The crab cake was good but also small. Very expensive bill and we were still hungry.

Oh man... this place is SO DELICIOUS.

Two of my girlfriends and I went to Oyster Bah for dinner last night. We had made reservations earlier in the week without a problem. When we arrived last night, their main floor seating was filled so we were directed to their downstairs area called the Crab Cellar. The Crab Cellar is an intimate room with minimal seating - seems like it would be the perfect place to bring a date. 

Dina was our server, and she was FABULOUS the entire time. She had some really great recommendations, and we all loved her bubbly personality. She seemed very excited about the restaurant and menu which made us excited as well!

I ordered a 1/2 dozen oysters, clam chowder, and grilled salmon. We also ordered the "stuffies" to share. Everything was so, so, so good and the oysters tasted super fresh. 

YUM YUM YUM - Oyster Bah gets two thumbs up from me!

Finally I was able to came here today,I saw this on yelp few months ago and i wanted to go yet the time didn't permits me, I'm so glad I made it today. As an oyster lover you will certainly love this place. I've been to a lot of restaurant that have the dishes yet never had the same taste like this, for me it's spectacular. Freshness is its utmost level and flavor is incomparable.
I got a mussels also which were great specially the one with spicy red sauce. As I asked for some dessert, the server suggested that i should try their coconut cake i i did order one, it's pretty delicious, price is  a little high but still i wanted to come back for more yum dishes.

Went on a Sunday with some friends and they had a happy hour special. The choices of oysters were just alright.  The quality and choices weren't anything special. Nothing really stood out enough for me to want to come back. It was also very warm inside on a hot day. Probably wont be going back...

We love love love oysters so came here the day after it opened to check it out - we were not disappointed.

In order of favorites:

Swordfish Schnitzel - sounded interesting so I orderd it and absolutely loved it
Oysters - we tried 3 different oysters - all fresh and nicely shucked
Mahi Mahi - bf (and his dad) love fish - they smoke it, grill it, etc and he was impressed by how nicely prepared it was
Wicked Calamari - really fresh and light breading, some places will have a lot of breading on it so you can't even taste how fresh the calamari is, they do it right here! 

Drinks - Remember the Maine & Ward 43 were both excellent.

Would definitely come back - excellent service and menu!

We met Hubby's colleague for a weeknight dinner last week.  Thankful we were able to make reservations since it was pretty packed when we arrived.  It's a very cozy spot that's pretty narrow.  I was worried about bringing the baby, but the hostess greeted us warmly, took care of stowing our foldable stroller, and asked us if we wanted to us a high chair or sling.  I was impressed they had several options for the baby!  We were taken downstairs and seated in the small dining room that also had a bar space.

We started with a round of drinks (yay they serve the oyster porter here).  The cocktails packed a punch.  I tried The Cape, which was refreshing, but pretty potent, at least to a lightweight like me.  For starters we shared a plate of fried oysters.  They were HUGE! and crispy, and divine.  I had the lobster roll, which had a great ratio of lobster meat to filling and not runny at all.  The buttered roll was able to contain the meat, but still on the small side.  I was only disappointed in the quality of the fries that came with the dish.  They were soggy sad.  Hubby enjoyed the Crispy One-Sided Snapper with the coconut ginger rice.  The Asian me thought, how can they only serve one side of the fish, what a rip off?!  Nonetheless, it was delicious.  For the table we shared an order of the Roasted Broccoli and the Cajun Dirty Rice.  The sides were good as an addition, but not necessary since the entrees were pretty filling alone.  No dessert menu, just two options, one of which was peppermint ice cream but we passed since we were all pretty full.  Our server was great, and even took the time to interact and play with baby.
Overrated. Go to the half shell better and more food for way less. The food was underwhelming for what they charge.

We tried oyster bah for dinner yesterday.  Oysters were very good and they have a good selection.  The issue I had was with the King Crab Bites.   This is a Lettuce Entertain You spot, and with myself being a regular of Joes assumed the food quality and service would be up to par.

I took 1 bite of the King Crab bites and spit it out.  The crab had a rotten pungent taste I will never forget. To make things worse when the waitress noticed neither of us we're eating it she asked if everything was ok.  My girlfriend said no, and I said something was wrong with it.  The waitress replied, oh sorry you don't like it, its really popular here. She then took it away and brought the bill with the crab bites were still on it.  I didn't feel like arguing with anyone at the time, but figured I'd let you fellow yelpers know.  Be careful with the Crab Bites, and expect to pay for everything even if its uneatable.
The oysters seem fresh and a good variety. Our cocktails were nothing special. But the soft-shell crab was expensive and almost  inedible. I think I'd stick with the raw options.

We went to this place expecting a great time and it definitely delivered.  It is a casual place with amazing food. 

Oysters - There is a variety of oysters that are fresh and delicious

Old Bay Shrimp Cocktail - the shrimp cocktail was great and the old bay seasoning gave the the dish a unique twist to a timeless classic. 

New England Clam Chowder - a good mix of light and heavy with the correct amount of everything. You should at least get a small bowl 

Asparagus - at first when I tried the fried asparagus I wasn't to sure about it, but upon a second taste I really enjoyed the dish. It was just an unexpected combination. The lemon and asparagus really compliment each other well

Fries - thin, crispy, and topped with old bay. Great side and a big portion

I went to Oyster Bah on its opening night and have been back a few times since. Each time I go back seems to be better than the last. 

The seafood is always fresh and prepared perfectly. They have a great oyster selection and are knowledgeable about type. You really can't go wrong here, the staff is very friendly and accommodating. 

Make sure you make your reservation early because they are often booked. Save room for the coconut cake, it is the best! I'll be back for sure.

The highlights:
- east coast nautical decor provides the right vibe for oyster shucking. 
- oyster definitely tasted fresh and the menu changes daily. 
- coconut cake was decadent. 
- wait staff was friendly and attentive from host to bartender to waitress and bus boy. 

Areas to improve:
- ordered the red snapper which was good but the this chille sauce was too strong and overpowered the dish. 
- prices are high especially for the lobster roll.  I think it was $27 and came with fries. 
- no bread or crackers served with an order of oysters.
- out of the specific oyster I ordered and crab cakes.

Highlight of Oystah Bah - The menu

Low moments of my Saturday night visit - WATER DOWN MY BACK and service, which was horrifically bad.

I really wanted to like this place more.

Oystah Bar is a charming New England-inspired space. With an upstairs and downstairs seating area. Both are tight and narrow though, so it can get warm and cozy inside (in good ways and bad, especially in winter). Reservations are available but go quickly, but there is a good size space for walk-ins, which I like to see.

Went on a Saturday night with a friend and I was really disappointed with the level of service. It took 10-15 minutes to get a menu (and all of them), 20 minutes for our drinks (of which my beer was wrong, cue another 10 minutes to get the right one), and on average, about 15 minutes between courses, so order all at once.

Due to the small space, the high-top walk in tables are stacked together, and you feel everything if you're facing the walkway. I had a delightful evening of sweaty male staff and waitresses rubbing against my back. Capped off with a delightful glass of water poured down half of mine from a male staffer clearing a table. Not exactly refreshing. I could not wait to get out of there simply for that reason.

Food, we got the tuna poke (delicious), clam chowder (good but next to no clam), assortment of oysters (lovely) and split the fish and chips. Portions are small (but expensive for what you get), but the quality of seafood is really good. My only complaint was that we got the end of the fry bin and the cup of clam chowder (for $5.95) was very small.

Beer, wine and cocktail menu is pretty well varied, no complaints there at all. Surprisingly good assortment.

This place only gets 3 stars because of the food. It would be 2 because of service. I get it's Saturday night in the city and it's Lincoln Park, but this place has been open for 8 weeks and still can't get in a groove? That was disappointing.

Overall, I walked out of here not wanting to be touched (got enough action at the table facing the walkway) and feeling like my Oystah Bar meal could be described in the worst way: expensive and with terrible service and okay food. Ouch.

I may try it again another time, but apparently more time is needed to figure out the Saturday night crowd.

This place was great! 

To the people complaining about the wait/service, I'm a little confused because the service we had was awesome! First, the host was amazing! Her name is Jordan. She was super polite and friendly to us, almost felt like a long lost friend! We wound up deciding to wait for a seat by the bar upstairs. Then as we were waiting, one of the staff offered us a menu and asked if we would like any drinks while we wait-so we did (try the fish house punch!). I think we wound up only waiting 20-25 minutes which isn't all the bad. People need to understand that this is a new place, so of course the wait is going to be long if you walk in without a reservation, especially on a Friday/Saturday night. 

The food was also just as good! My boyfriend selected 1/2 dozen oysters off of the menu and we split the calamari, which was some of the best calamari I've ever had. Then I had the grilled oysters, SO YUMMY-almost reminded me of the oysters I had when we went to New Orleans. But anywhoo, we didn't eat any entrees, which was fine because the food we ordered was more than enough to fill us up. 

Overall, I highly recommend this place. The staff is amazing, food is delicious and the atmosphere was great!

Oyster bah in the Mid West? Yes, plz! Dining experience 1/1/15 evening

The place: Walked in to 'Ain't No Mountain High Enough' playing overhead, random for this establishment, but I enjoy Motown so I dig. The walls are decorated with nautical themed items like fish nets which I find appropriate. The lights had shades made from plastic buckets which I thought was s cute touch. There was a decent sized raw bar at the front. Located downstairs was the 'Crab Cellar' like a speakeasy of sorts just passed the bathrooms. Looks cute, I just might have to check it out next visit.

The service: Friendly wait staff. It was a fairly busy night but our server was responsive to our needs.

The food: Nice oyster selection from both East and West coasts, including some of my all time favorites-- Hog Island and Island Creek oysters (same ones that Thomas Keller uses at TFL). The oyster sizes were a little inconsistent though. A few were way too scrawny and barely contained any meat. The clam chowder was a little runny and contained too much potato/celery for my liking. Too few clams. Sorry, a bit of a chowder snob after living in Boston for close to a decade. The star was the New England Stuffie. Basically stuffed quahogs. It's smaller than your typical stuffed quahog from New England, but it packs a nice flavor.

Overall, I think I would visit this establishment again the next time I visit.

Unbelievable!! I went here for a double date and it was perfect from start to finish. We got dirty martinis which were delicious and started the night with some of the oysters that are flown in daily. Best oysters I've ever had, even better than what I've had in Boston! I had the crispy red snapper which was so delicious and came with an awesome spicy Thai sauce. I will definitely be coming back to order all the same things, plus try to save room for the coconut cake. Thank you Oyster Bah!

We had a long wait (75 minutes) which was expected for a group of 4 on a Saturday night at a newly opened restaurant in LP. Tried making reservations on OpenTable but they were all booked. 
The atmosphere and decor were home runs. The cocktails were consistent but a bit dull. The food and service was A++! Staff seemed very informed on their selection of Oysters. 
I will definitely be a regular here.

This place is awesome! We literally got so much food an everything we got was insane.. Oysters, fried oysters, char grilled oyster, clams, tuna poke and more. Come and sit in the basement in the crab cellar.. Awesome service and Renee is amazing
Huge portions!  Love Dawn the bartender--she's saucy & funny & great. The food is a bit pricey, but fresh and delicious.

I'm from Boston so I loved the concept of the restaurant before I walked through the door. We were sat immediately for our 8:45 reservation. The service was good - a little bit slow but that's understandable for a Friday night. We ordered the oysters, stuffies and the tuna poke for appetizers.  The oysters were fresh and wonderful! Growing up I loved stuffed clams so these were a great trip down memory lane. The tuna poke was fresh and good! 

For dinner we split the red snapper, mussels, I can't remember exactly what the salad was called but I believe it was just a seafood salad. The red snapper is a must order - it was truly awesome. Ask your server to show you how to cut it! The mussels were good but very sandy, I understand how fresh they are so it didn't bother me but bothered the people I was dining with. The seafood salad was awesome - there was king crab, lobster and shrimp in it. 

The wine list was good, nothing amazing but very affordable. If you like seafood please go here!

Glad to see an Oyster Bar opening up further north!  What a fun and great place.  I arrived a little early (or my friend was a little late...ahem) and so decided to wait at the bar and have a drink.  The bartenders were super nice and Dawn was great - had a ton of information to share about the oysters, great suggestions, and really made you feel 'at home' and like you were a regular.  

The oysters were super fresh and delicious.  Prices are pretty reasonable for oysters and the selection was really good between East Coast, West Coast and Canada.  The Tuna Poke was SUPER good - we got two because we couldn't stop enjoying it :)

Can totally see myself going back here!

WOW! I think I found my new favorite place for FRESH seafood. We walked in on Sunday without a reservation and got sat promptly. (Before the dinner rush came @5pm.) Nick our server greeted us in a great mood and we got our delicious cocktails really fast. Try the Fish House punch if you like rum. We also ordered the calamari, tuna poke, and an order of casino oysters.

The calamari was SO TENDER and flavorful. It melted in your mouth. I was impressed.

The tuna poke was so good I wanted to order 3 as my dinner.

The casino oysters were devoured within 2 minutes by my boyfriend who "doesn't like oysters." Until now!

I tried multiple kinds of fresh oysters per nick's recommendation. All were fantastic and unique!

My boyfriend got the blackened fish as his dinner and I got a dozen charbroiled oysters. He loved the fish. The oysters were okay. I was thinking they'd be drowned in butter like Drago's charbroiled oysters in New Orleans. The flavor was good. But once I put the HOUSE MADE FRESNO HOT SAUCE on them. It took the plate to a whole new level. I bought a bottle of the sauce because I fell in love.

If you're looking for something new and fresh seafood THIS IS THE PLACE TO GO. Lettuce entertainment group has stepped up their game. Can't wait to come back!

Price wise it was a good deal. Dinner for 2 with three appetizers and a few drinks a piece only cost us  $150. We left full too. That doesn't usually happen at these small plate trendy places. I think for seafood and drinks downtown it was a more than fair price.

THANK YOU NICK FOR YOUR OUTSTANDING SERVICE AND RECOMMENDATIONS.

I had a dozen oysters and the calamari.  Some of the oysters were spawning, which was really gross.  Unfortunately I didn't know what 'spawning' was until I went home and googled "oyster soft creamy yuck'.  If I had known I would've sent them back.  I guess that's a risk you take when you order oysters during the summer.  Thankfully it was Happy Hour so the oysters were half off.  The calamari was really tiny but tasted ok - but the dipping sauce was watery and there wasn't enough.  I thought the service was great and the decor was fun.  One issue was somebody kept smoking right outside, and because the whole wall was open, smoke kept flowing into the restaurant.

I had dinner with my boyfriend here the other day and it already started off on a bad note as they cancelled our reservation on Opentable even though I confirmed with them earlier in the day that we were coming in so we had to wait 10-15 minutes for another table. 

When we finally got our table we decided to order the Poke, Poke, Poke, Fried Oysters, Wicked Calamari, Shrimp & Grits, and Crispy Fish Tacos. With the Poke, Poke, Poke it was good but we thought the portions were pretty small and it could've been marinated with the sauces a little more seeing as there was so much avocado in the bowls with the poke. The Fried Oysters were okay but it wasn't anything to wow us with. If given the chance between raw oysters and fried oysters I'd honestly go for the raw oysters. The Wicked Calamari was alright as well. The breading was too flaky so it got all over and wouldn't stick onto the calamari even though it should've been fried. After a while we just got tired of eating it and didn't even finish the plate. The Shrimp & Grits were alright. I never really had grits before this and realized that we both didn't like grits. The shrimp in the dish was average and seemed like it was frozen shrimp. The Crispy Fish Tacos were average yet again and there was nothing to rave about them. The fish in the Crispy Fish Tacos weren't seasoned at all and tasted like nothing and the overall seasoning used on the toppings of the fish tacos was way too strong and spicy for the both of us.

So overall I really wanted to like this place but everything in this meal was just average and honestly it made us sad that we chose to eat at this place our first night back in Chicago.

It is so hard to find good seafood in the Midwest but Oyster Bah delivers! Hands down the best oysters, shrimp, and lobster I've had since moving to Chicago! The service was also fantastic... Our waiter was attentive, knowledgable, and all of his recommendations were spot on! If nothing else get the lobster roll... It's melt-in-your-mouth good!

Came here for Valentine's day dinner. When looking at the menu my girlfriend and I decided to get all small plates and split.  We ordered 6 raw oysters, the char-grilled oysters, New England stuffies, tuna poke and crab cake.  For dessert we ordered the coconut cake.

I would say the stuffies and crab cake were our favorites and a must get.  They had a good selection of raw oysters and they came with stout ice which was unique for me.  The char-grilled oysters were on the smaller size and came 5 to an order.  The tuna poke was tasty but I felt like could have used a little more avocado in the order.  Last the crab cake was a very nice size and a lot of crab meat.

The coconut cake was amazing, and we are not a couple who orders dessert a lot. When we ordered our waiter exclaimed "we only offer one dessert for a reason." (I believe they do have ice cream as well but who's keeping track)

Also our waiter was very helpful and attentive.  Will definitely be back.

Somehow I was able to grab a reservation for 6:15p.m. on a Friday at Oyster Bah. It was packed when I arrived and I overheard the wait for walk-ins was about an hour (so head in early or be prepared to wait). The dining room is relatively small and unfussy, which contributes to a relaxed and unpretentious vibe (heels welcome but not required). Adding authenticity is a bar right up front with about ten stools for those who want a first-hand look at the magic that is oyster shucking. 

Service was phenomenal. This is a place where you can put trust in your server from start to finish. Case in point: My friend and I wanted a bottle of white wine but couldn't decide on one off the bat. Our server, Dina, was more than happy to bring us multiple samples and didn't seem annoyed at all, even though she was clearly busy.
