When we asked her a question about one bottle in particular and she didn't know, she brought the manager, Rose, to our table. Similarly to Dina, Rose was incredibly friendly to us and, best of all, did not try and upsell by recommending a more expensive bottle (average bottle price ranges between $45 - $90). The entire night continued this way. The stuffies are a standout and the fish and chips will make you forget you're in Chicago. And let's not forget about the oysters! A wide variety (about ten) of both east and west coast jems, including standards like Blue Points and Kumamotos, and lesser knowns from PEI. All were perfectly shucked and so fresh that there's no fancy ice needed (although they'll give you that, too!). 

During my visit Rich Melman and a managing parter were walking around the dining room for quality control. As far as I could see, they stopped at about every table, as well as the bar, to evaluate service. 

I will definitely return, not only because I love oysters and fresh seafood, but because the service made the experience one of the best I've had in the city. It should be noted that the busers also contributed to this- we never had an empty plate or emplty water glass on our table for more than five minutes, seriously. Everyone on staff here was working to make things top notch. 

TLDR: I loved Oyster Bah so much that I'd move in if they let me.
Average at best. So many other great seafood places for the money (cold storage, etc). Pass

Food was disappointing and overpriced. I got the shrimp and grits and it was extremely bland and I would not be surprised if the shrimp was frozen and the grits came from a bag. My husband got the $27 lobster roll and there was a very meager serving of lobster for such a ridiculous price. Whole place felt like it was trying too hard too... very cliche and cookie cutter.

Great Fresh Sea food!
I would recommend fresh oysters of course. I mean it is in the name of the restaurant, you have to have try their oysters! They have a largest variety of fresh oysters I have ever seen. All are delicious, extremely fresh and are flown from west and east coast each day.
The place is a little loud, great for appetizers and cocktails.
Would definitely come back for the oysters.

YUM! Seafood lovers must go! Oyster selection is great and staff is very knowledgeable- helped guide us through the list and pick options everyone would enjoy. Besides oysters- try the lobster roll, blackened fish, tuna poke, and smoked trout dip. Lastly- the coconut cake is actually life changing. It's the only dessert they have and the only dessert I may ever eat again- amazing!
Enjoyed the ambiance. The oysters were awesome and the staff was very knowledgeable. Also, had the fish tacos which were pretty good. The drinks were great. I would definitely return for the oysters.

Oh, my, I don't often feel ripped off but I really felt that way last night.  $78 with tip for one entree that was mediocre and the other that was even less than mediocre.  Fortunately we had a lovely wait person, but really -- my co-diner had blackened snapper which was barely thicker than a sheet of paper and came with a serving of rice.  That's it -- no veggie on the plate, no garnish, and no bread or rolls were served.  I had the lobster roll -- had seen a photo of it in a review and knew that I had to have it.  It came with fries -- that's it.  But the crazy thing is that the lobster was tough.  Ever had tough, chewy lobster?  Had to cut it with a knife as I couldn't bite into it.

We ordered coffee and it came in paper cups!  I asked for a mug -- no can do.  Server very proudly stated that this way they can top off your coffee for you before you leave and you can take it with you.  I HATE drinking out of paper containers, and thought a restaurant charging $3 for a coffee and (I think) $28 for the chewy lobster roll could have done much, much better.
No need to mess with the food when you have fresh seafood. They know what they are doing, follow the lead!

Went here early on a Saturday night and the restaurant was full so we gladly sat at the bar downstairs.  It was a really great atmosphere and I felt like I was in a classic New England seafood joint.  Really appreciate it, since sometimes I miss the east coast.  The bar tender was very friendly and helpful.  He was very knowledgeable and patient and let me try a few of the wines and made some great cocktails.  We started out with the Chilled Seafood Platter.  He mad an exception and let us choose the oysters we wanted and it came with tabasco ice and Guinness ice.  These were really delicious on the raw clams and the oysters.  Very cool and innovative.  Only complaint is that the Alaskan crab was a bit water logged.  They green split the salad for us which was simple and delicious.  Green goddess dressing was spot on.  We were very pleased with the shrimp and grits.  The grits had a texture to them that was good and made it clear that you were eating something from the earth.  Boyfriend would have preferred them to be creamier so I guess that's a personal preference thing.  Overall a great spot!

I came here for dinner and had a great experience! I believe our server's name was Dina and she was awesome. She made some great recommendations including our all time favorite the COCONUT CAKE. This cake is life changing. I never would have ordered it without her telling us about it. We ordered the Chilled Seafood Tower which sounds like a ton of food but, it wasn't very filling. So, we ordered the Fish Tacos to split which were pretty good. My fiancé had the fried and I had the grilled. My only compliant was there wasn't a ton of fish in my grilled taco. This place is a bit pricey for the amount of food you get. But, I will for sure be back for the coconut cake. If you come here you have to try it!
Wow, way better than I expected. Bit pricey but the Oysters are super fresh and from all over. Nice date spot, dimly lit and they have a cool basement room with a bar. Make a reservation though

We came for a belated birthday celebration with my 80+ parents. Renee was our server and her recommendations were so helpful and on point!  We started with the poke which was delicious and a half dozen oysters. When we mentioned that they were smaller than expected she brought out an enormous oyster for us to taste. Her wine recommendation was perfect.  We had   The house special red snapper bone in and the seafood salad. We will return for happy hour!

I'm conflicted as the food was really good, but I'm not sure it was worth the price point! My friend and I came for dinner last week, and sat in the bar "area", I guess? There was a heater above me and it was BOILING. We asked the waiter to turn it down and thankfully they obliged. We started with 8 oysters, and they were good, however, I would not recommend that Guinness coffee thing they have going on. It didn't work for me. Secondly, we had the Tuna Poke and this was good. Smaller portion, but it was a nice share item. Lastly, we split the mussels and the half Red Snapper. The snapper was delicious, but why not jut give the entire fish if you're going to charge $28! It was a good dinner, but I certainly did not walk out of there stuffed. We split a bottle of wine as well. We walked out spending more than $100 per person. I feel like I could go to Bavette's and spend that much and get WAY more food. Not sure I would go back, but wouldn't be opposed, if that makes sense...
Charming little spot that makes you feel you are living the coastal life! Staff was knowledgable about the whole menu, but especially oysters and cocktails. Will look forward to going back!

Oyster Bah is an overpriced, causal dining experience. It is almost as expensive as Joe's Seafood and as expensive as GT Fish & Oyster, but with half the experience (and half the portion). You would be better off taking the $200 you will spend at Oyster Bah and going to one of those places.

Service was amazing. The oysters were delicious. We had to wait about 15 minutes past our reservation time, which was frustrating because there was a table for 2 open the entire time we waited. We each had an oyster shooter, a bloody mary, and one of each available oyster. They were arranged well on the ice in the same order as on the menu so it was easy to see which ones we liked.

I have to give it up for the service at Oyster Bah. We came in around 9pm (a little late for our reservation) and told we would have to wait a while for a table. This was ok with me considering we had missed our original reservation time. The front area was packed with people. This is to expected for a Friday night. What was particularly impressive, was that the bartenders were coming out from behind the bar and taking cocktail orders for people that could not reach the bar to order a drink. Amazing! I've never seen that before! And, even though it was crazy, they were having fun and smiling. It was cool to see a business that goes above and beyond when they know they have a small space to work with. We ended up with seats at the bar and continued to have a great night. I highly recommend coming here for fantastic service and great food!!

Pretty cool place. Service was excellent very attentive ad knowledgeable. All recommendations were good. The oyster selection with both east and west coast choices was very good. All in my party enjoyed their entries,  but I out ordered them by getting the trout. Also cocktails were good.

Simply amazing.  The food was fantastic, the service was perfect.  After our delicious meal the manager came over since it was our first time there to make sure we enjoyed our time.  We will definitely be coming back and I strongly recommend this restaurant.

Fun, casual seafood "shack" dining with an open front - in Chicago. Oysters were very good (some were half price during 'Happy Hour.') My husband loved his New England clam chowder and tomato mozzarella salad. Poke poke appetizer (tuna and salmon) was delicious. Lobster roll and fried oyster po' boy were both excellent. But best of all was the coconut cake - believe me, it is absolutely worth it to leave room for this delicious cake. We had the BEST waitperson/server ever (Clayton); and the music in the background was also outstanding. Will definitely visit again.

We were in town visiting out son and he recommended that we try this place. We were not disappointed!  The space is a little tight but still very quaint. The service was awesome. They were on top of our every need.  We started with a variety of fresh oyster that were recommend by our server. I prefer the east coast oysters so we had a nice selection to choose.  They were very fresh and set the tone for the lunch. The seafood selections were nice. I got the shrimp special which was a great addition to the oysters.  You can tell fresh seafood and this place definitely had it.  We went at lunch and had reservations and probably did not need them for lunch.  Will be coming back to this place as often as I can. A place you have to visit when in the Windy City!!

This place just opened and is what the neighborhood needed! To start, we got a dozen east coast oysters. Fresh as can be, just like their sister restaurant Shaw's. We also got the lobster cocktail (delicious) and stuffies--so good! For dinner we had the seafood pasta which was fantastic and the swordfish schnitzel--an awesome dish. We ordered rose which paired perfectly with our seafood. We got the coconut cake for dessert which is a must try! The vibe is very casual and our server, Renee, was great. I can't wait to check out the downstairs bar which looks super cozy and cool. A great addition to Lincoln Park, definitely worth checking out!
Excellent Italian food the sausages are delicious.   They also have some very delicious desserts especially the lemon desserts and they have old fashioned candy which I love to get for the kids
One delicious bakery. Simply put: there's something for everyone and prices are very reasonable. Customer service is great, too.

I absolutely love this place. What a gem! Came in this late afternoon for a sugar fix and came out with way more than I can chew! 

The staff is amazing, every one of my visits is always such a great experience. Today my boyfriend and I came in for gummy worms and ended up getting chocolate chip cookies,pizza slices, and cannolis!

This particular visit, we were greeted immediately by a very nice (handsome) man who ended up giving me 2 free slices of the spinach pizza with the 2 slices I already picked up!!! That just goes to show how amazing the staff is, real personable too, totally adds to the bakery's at home atmosphere. Can't get any better than that!

The baked goods / desserts are nothing short of perfection! The candy display always makes me feel like a kid. I love the selection and always leave wishing I ordered more!!! They have a full menu equipped to fill your hearts Italian desire!

Oh and I have to mention that my very first cannoli was from this bakery and I'm totally hooked for life!  This is a local neighborhood business that my Boyfriend and I will continue to support. The kindness of the store doesn't go unnoticed. Thanks!

We googled best cannolis in town and we ended up here.  It's close to my condo and right off of taylor street so we stopped by for lunch.  We got 2 sandwiches the Signature and the chicken.  The spicy chicken sandwich was great the panini had a nice color and the peppers were delicious.  The signature was kinda on the dry side.  It reminded me of a dry version of a jimmy john's sandwich.  The cannoli was good but had way too much cinnamon and lacked the chocolate chips.  We also tried their Napoleon and it had the one day old kinda taste to it.  It wasn't crispy but soggy.

Fresh, authentic, delicious. Need I say more? Ferraras is such a hidden gem. Prices are great, ranging $5-7 for a sandwich/salad/lunch entree. I love the meatball sandwich and Ferrara Original. Keep meaning to try the lasagna plate one of these days. 

And then there's desserts...tasty cannoli, cookies, tiramisu, cheesecake, etc. What more could you ask for!? If you live in Chicago (or even if you don't) and you haven't checked out this great Italian fare, you're missing out!

This place needs no more reviews. They are probably all 4-5 star.
I live right next to the place, that walking by I can smell almonds and sugar in the air usually every day and can see the many customers eating in and taking out. a regular customer, they know my order my heart. A nice feeling in an anonymous kinda time. 
good prices, good selection.

Everytime I have been in here for the last 4 years they never have the eggplant sandwiches lol!! So frustrating as I'm not a meat eater! The desserts are good and the hubby always loves his meatball sub! Please please actually make more eggplant so I can finally eat here !

Love this bakery / cafe .excellent selection of Italian sugar cookies , cannoli and pasta/ panini
A great part of the neighborhood!

I make excuses to zoom there to buy their italian cookies - their fig cookies make fig newtons look like cardboard.  They always have the most delicious cannoli, they have qualisimale cookies all the time and they have the most delish iced lemon cookies.  They have added soups and pastas - if they have it when you go - try their super dooper meat sauce on top of any pasta.  Flavorful, reasonable, tasty.  Last week I zoomed there to pick up a couple pounds of cookies for a thank you to my insurance guy.  Very few folks travel 15 miles for a box of cookies but?  Ferrara is worth it!  I am handicapped and use a walker - I called them and asked if I could place an order and have them fill it and bring it out to me.  They were very accommodating and helped me alot!  This place just keeps getting better!

I have to say I have only had the cookies and they are my favorite thing to bring to parties or as a thank you gift. The sort bread with the chocolate Carmel and nuts are always the biggest hits. I like the cinnamon and powdery ones too. I need to try some food some time. I wish they were open later as I would love to go after work on the days I stay in the area for events at united center

We wanted an authentic cannoli and eclair and oh boy did we get them!! The sweets and treats are delicious! The cannolis are enormous and they are very liberal with the filling which is fantastic! The eclair was enormous too and an absolute treat! I can't wait to go back and try some other sweets!  

My only concern was the area... It's literally 2 blocks away from juvie. But that has nothing to do with the quality of the food in this gem of a bakery!

I didn't have great luck with baked goods here, so this time I stuck with a solid sandwich.  

I went with the Tuscan chicken and the hubs had the grilled chicken sandwiches.  Both were simple sandwiches with solid, fresh ingredients tucked inside amazing Italian bread.  The kind that has that classic crusty crust, a soft inside and a slight meaty chew to it.  Best.Bread.Ever.  The sandwiches were not large like a Subway sub but the portion was just right for me.  Only downer was they are pretty pricey for what you actually get, less than 6" and not very large girth for over $7 after tax.

Overall, it's a nice lunch option if your in the Tri-Taylor area.

We went here to get some slices of cake for my birthday and some cannolis. Decided to get some lunch while we were there. The Italian beef sandwiches are tasty enough, but we loved their cannolis the best. If you want some authentic cannolis this place definitely has them (according to my girlfriend, I never had them before myself). They also sell a lot of candy. We didn't buy any of that though.

Family owned since 1908!! I make a point to ALWAYS stop by before heading back home to pick up Italian cookies and pastries. Having spent a lot of my childhood in Little Italy-NYC I may be a bit fussy when it comes to Italian sweets and this place NEVER disappoints!! The absolute BEST Sfogliatella in the Midwest, now I just need to create a reason to order a cannoli cake

Original Ferrara Bakery is one of my favorite bakery store in Chicago. It is a hole in the wall as you drive by Taylor street, BUT you gotta try it! And believe me, one you did, you will be hooked! Their tiramisu is soo good, it makes you dreaaam about it. They cannoli is oooooh delish! Even when I am writing this review, my mouth is drooling thinking about their tiramisu and cannoli!

Went out in search of authentic Italian pastries and lunch  and we were satisfied leaving! Their Caesar salad was big and delicious! The girl taking my order was very nice ! The decor is very authentic and you can tell this business is family Owned. I got a very unique cake that was amazing. It's a pound cake with cannoli cream as filling. Also got 6 cannolis to go! Everything tastes amazing ! This is my go to place in Chicago for pastries! Thanks Ferrara!

The Italian food outside of Italy can hardly be called authentic at all. But Ferrara is amazing--I had tiramisu and chocolate flan last time, and it was just as I'd tasted in Europe. I feel lucky to live close to the bakery!

A chicago institution!  I think this maybe affiliated with Ferrara Pan Candy located in Forest Park.  I think both were started by the same family but I could be wrong.  Who cares?  This is a great little place.

I'm not much of a sweet girl so this place for me is all about the sammies, focaccia and pizza.  You cannot go wrong with any of these!  Trust me, my middle name should be bread...or yeast...or gluten.  Whatever!  I adore anything this place creates with a bread base.  I know it's a bakery but they really  are a legit place for lunch.  Ya, the service is often surly and slow but I still think their food makes up for it.

Came here to try out some bakery items.

I had the tiramisu. It wasn't the best I've had, but it was okay.

Cannoli has peanuts and not pistachios like other have stated, but I wasn't really a fan of it.

My sister didn't care for the strawberry shortcake. She said it tasted like cheap cake and overly sweet.

Sorry, but doubt I'll be back.
I come here for lunch weekly and always order the summer salad with double chicken. Everything I have had here is good but small space and always crowded.

I've been to this place a few times and what I always go back for is their cappuccinos and the sfogliatella. I get the cappuccinos made with whole milk (as one should always do). They're always really good and have the perfect amount of foam . The sfogliatella is sweet, but not overwhelmingly so. They have an excellent texture and a hint of orange zest, which gives them a unique taste. As for their cannolis, I don't find them particularly great. The shells are better than the cream, which always tastes a little off to me for some reason. Overall, Ferrara is a good place with an interesting history and is nicely located. Definitely worth going to.

I had lunch here yesterday and it was satisfying. I am not sure I think I was expecting a little more based on the reviews I read. I ordered the chicken tuscan, it was good but I felt like it was missing something. I also ordered the lentil soup, the soup was ok tastes burnt but evened out with the sandwich. Today I went in for some cake and a custard filled eclair and I was not impressed. The custard was not what I expected, it was bland and I felt like it had been sitting on display for a few day by the way it tasted. Overall, its ok , a lot better than fast food sandwiches. The lady on the phone was really nice though!

Love this bakery, it's a true taste of the old Taylor St., although most of Taylor has been transformed. I love the aroma as soon as I step in. They do most of their menu items consistently very well. So well that I consistently leave here with a big bag. They have the best Italian sweet selection in the city. The service here is always welcoming and helpful to those not sure of what to buy. I have been coming here for most of my life, and will continue to do so.

This bakery is very close to my work and have had some catering orders for meetings and such. The salad and sandwiches are good, nothing to write home about, but fine for a quick lunch. The bakery portion isn't huge, and I've only tried the limoncello cake as far as their pastries go, and I thought that was a little too sweet for me, would have liked a touch more lemony vs sugary taste. I'll probably try a few other baked goods at some point and update then.

Came here on a Sunday afternoon and ordered five different pastries that the cashier said were all made fresh that day and everything tasted stale, not to mention the lemon cream tasted like it had gone bad. Will not be visiting again.

Although I've been going to Ferrara for many years, I've not written a review mainly because I just don't know where to begin.  It's a bakery, and yes, I have ordered more than my share of Cannoli cakes for family events, I've eaten many cookies and pastries - more than I care to admit, but it's so, so, so much more.  It's been awesome to experience the expanding menu of savory items on Ferrara's menu over the years, some have been misses (no one is perfect), but most have been hits, from soups, to sandwiches to pastas to pizzas and salads - so much good food!!  

On my most recent visit, I decided to keep it simple and try something I never had before - a Garden Salad with ranch dressing on the side.  I figured it would be a small salad - something I could eat at my office to get me through the end of the day.  When the young lady came out with a big bag I had to ask "What did I order?"  She repeated exactly what I ordered...when I got back to my office I pull out this huge container with a beautiful salad with romaine, tomatoes, cucumbers, onions, olives, roasted red peppers, croutons (made in-house), celery, carrots and more that I can't remember.  And the ranch - which tasted like it was also made in-house, was SUPER-DELICIOUS!!  Seriously, sometimes, it pays to keep it simple.  This was one of the best salads ever.  

The staff at Ferrara are also worth mentioning, they are all so friendly and attentive.  It's always a pleasure to go for a visit.  Hope Ferrara is around for many more years.

For some reason when I saw the address on Taylor I figured it was east of Ashland, and then realized that this was actually west of Damen! I made the trek  out even though my Groupon was expired so that I could try out some of these pastries. I understand I was a couple of hours away from closing time, so they had already run out of a lot of stuff. I missed out on tiramisu and probably many other more popular items. It was also the day before the 4th and they were selling the goods at 50% off to reduce inventory and avoid tossing stuff out. I got the apple tarte, carrot cake, and the strawberry shortcake. I think these are all a little more on the sweeter side for me, which is a little too much. I like that the place also sells other food items like sandwiches, salads, pizza, and other entrees. The prices are very reasonable and the staff is pretty quick and efficient.

Great lunch spot in this area. Food is homemade and pretty consistent. I don't care for their baked goods but I don't  eat baked goods very often.  I like the fact their Chicken Parmesan sandwich is grilled chicken and is not breaded or fried.  I'm a regular.

Good but not great. The biscotti is light to the point that it disintegrates when it hits coffee. I prefer a heavier biscotti that can get dunked into coffee and still be intact for a bite.

Other baked goods are similarly okay. This place is the best thing going in a sort of lackluster neighborhood :/

I'd give this place a 3 for the sandwiches, but a 3.5 for the cookies and ambiance...well call it a 3.

I love the no frills flavor of this place. Decor is mismatched, and menu options are standard. The Italian sub is ok, not great: it's much better with Parmesan cheese sprinkled in it, which is easy with the old schoolish Parmesan shakers on the tables.

The desserts though, are delicious, especially the various butter cookies. I work around this place so I'll be back often I'm sure, and Ill have to get a cannoli next time.

Okay here I am, back at where it all started. I haven't been here in almost a year, although I work less than a block away, I just stopped cold turkey due to eating so much of the same. But its been almost a year since I had come here and I just decided to see what has changed. To my surprise NOT MUCH! Which to me is just perfect since their food has always been good. 

Now today I decided to see if they had the Tuscany Chili, and although it didn't state the name, I KNEW THIS CHILI. Oh good lord with the nice taste of Italy and just a hint of heat, this is what its all about. I tasted their chili for weeks on end and than one day they stopped making it I guess due to clients not requesting it so much, well that's what I was told. 

But its back and for that, I am happy. Ferrara's is still family owned and I expect it will always be, I hope they always stay true to form with their taste and that all these various flavors will always be passed down from generation to generation.

This place has been around since I can remember.  My mom used to get all our birthday cakes here when we were little.  We lived a couple of blocks away and she remembers the small cake costing 8$.

The canolli cakes are still delicious and their trays of cookies and pastries still mouth watering.  Apparently they sell pasta and sandwiches now.  I guess this is convenient for all the people who work at the nearby hospital.  I have not had a chance to try the food but I will soon.

Still my favorite Chicago birthday cakes!

Original Ferrara Bakery catered the cocktail hour and the sweet table for our daughter's wedding reception. O. M. G. everything was absolutely out of this world delicious!  Nonni and her staff are wonderful and she made placing our order a breeze.  They even delivered out to Oak Brook and everything arrived on time, fresh, and plated beautifully.  We live in Orland Park and to be honest, there isn't a bakery in our area that makes authentic Italian bakery offerings like Ferrara. ( believe me, we have tried them all in our search ) Our daughter and her then fiancé don't like cake, so we didn't need a wedding cake, but we knew that the sweet table was going to have to be spectacular and we were not disappointed.
Our daughter's absolute favorite item is the cannoli, which they made a separate box up just for her to take to the hotel after the reception.  The cocktail hour sandwiches and pasta salad were a huge hit. The cookies and pastries for the sweet table had all of our guests going back for seconds and thirds! Everyone wanted to know which bakery we had used because it was just that good.  We couldn't have been happier in our choices and we will be using their services every chance we get.

This review is purely based on customer service.

Little did I know when I bought the groupon that I wasn't just paying for a dozen cannoli, oh no... I was also buying the opportunity to be mean mugged the whole time by employees. The moment I walked in, I wasn't greeted, smiled at, or even acknowledged. Instead, the girl that was behind the counter glared at me until someone from the back came and helped who said "did you want something?" ... No, I just came in to fucking do nothing and stare back at your dumb asses. The experience didn't get any better from there, as I was cashed out by a server who could not be any more disinterested in being there. Needless to say, I will not be back because there is no way I'm supporting the wages of all these useless teens. 

......... PS. The cannoli were fucking amazing. :-(

This bakery is adorable. I've lived by it for years and would always go in for baked Italian goods and to grab some Lemonheads. I finally stopped in for lunch and it was quite good! The place was packed at noon. I ordered a soup and sandwich and it was reasonably priced and quite good! I will keep coming back for more cookies and another lunch! And you can't beat their cannolis!
Cannolis are so good!! Tuscan chicken sandwich is amust have! Lemon roll, carrot cake and chocolate mousse were the best!!!!

This is my go to for Italian cookies. Their pignoli, amaretti and macaroons are among my favourites. Their coffee is fabulous, too. Worth the commute for some of the tastiest, most authentic Italian cookies in Chicago.
Just judging from their chocolate truffle moose, I knew everything else has gotta be completely fantastic. And then I tried their pasta, and wow, fantastic!!

I havent had the privilege to stop by the store myself, but my husband brought cookies here one day and i was BLOWN AWAY! Maybe its a good thing i dont stop by myself coz i wud go crazy on a cookie/pastry spree! The cookies are delicious and im actually writing this review while munching on the salted caramel cookie w a nice cold glass of milk, and its frickin awesome. Now whenever theres a potluck i always pick a box of it and everyone loves it. Cant wait to try other pastries.

Pretty good place to go to for lunch!
They have coffee, sandwiches, pasta, desserts, candy, and a lot more
I've tried their Italian beef and Tuscan Chicken
And a couple of their desserts on a whim, I have no idea how Italian desserts are like so I picked out random things but they always turned out decent
The sandwiches were pretty good as well, but nothing extraordinary, but I did prefer the Italian over the chicken
I live right by this place, it's not something I'd go to everyday if I had the chance, but when I do I'm usually satisfied.

I am giving this business a low rating based solely on their HORRIBLE customer service!!!  I have worked nearby for years and been in countless times.  To their credit, I must say that they are consistent. The food (soup and sandwiches) are always quite tasty.  The cookies all taste the same all the time.  And, the business owners are regularly unpleasant, unwelcoming, unappreciative and generally just nasty.

A few years back after a several month stint of daily trips (Monday - Friday)  for their soup, I ordered a salad.  The salad came with a live green bug on it.  After quietly calling it to the attention to the woman in charge, she barked "What do you want me to do about it?  We don't make the lettuce?"  Needless to say I swore of the place from that day forward.

Admittedly, I occasionally give in to an urge for one of their items and find myself going back for some more EXCEEDINGLY POOR customer service.  Today was one of those days. I am regularly surprised (shouldn't be) that the rudeness continues.  I have once again sworn off of Ferrara's because I prefer that my business be appreciated and not be regarded as a bother.  Do not waste your time if you value customer service at all - the same or similar items can be purchased elsewhere and you may even get a "thank you" for your purchase.
Cool little bakery and plenty of lemon head variants as well! A little bit of a hike but a nice stop.

I used to live down the street from Ferraras. The saddest part about leaving the neighborhood is missing out on my sfogliatella every Saturday morning. 

I docked two stars because they haven't taught their counter girls how to make a proper latte or cappuccino. The "foam" is dish-soap like bubbles that pop in your face and is quite frustrating. 

But again, the sfogliatella is to die for! Go there for it NOW!

We come here regularly from work, as this is one of a few places to eat in our neighborhood. The chicken sandwich with pesto (order extra) is my favorite, followed by the pizzas! I've never had a dish here that wasn't good. I don't love the pastries or cookies though. They are a bit flavorless and bland to me. So, come here for lunch but get your sweet treat fix elsewhere.

Came to the bakery to get Tiramisu for my sister's birthday.  The store is huge and full of all kinds of delicious looking sweets.  The tiramisu was some of the best I've had.  If I come back, I'll resist getting it again, simply to try some of the other delicious cakes and other desserts on display.  Definitely a hidden gem.

I must admit I've eaten hear at least 20 times, no because it's good but it is across the street form my work. 
This place has been overrated by reviewers who apparently have never had good Italian food. 
Ferrara's is really an overpriced cafeteria. The bakery does not have a large selection and as with the food, if it's not Italian fair, its sub-par. Their cannot and tirmisu are excellent, apple slices and German chocolate cake have way too much frosting, enough to gag a sugar crazed 9 year old.
All their sandwiches are short on meat, they are mostly toasted bread.
The lasagna and eggplants are above average, but it stops there, everything else dissapoints. There are better and cheaper delis on the same block, skip this one.

Great Italian spot in the middle of a veritable food wasteland, I get the same thing almost every time I come here:

Summer Salad w Tuna - Delicious, grapes, bleu cheese, olive oil and regular salad stuff with a health dose of mayo laden tuna so I can justify it as being protein

Spinach Pizza - Bomb

They recently got rid of their pizzas, which I thought were awesome, and if you come in here at noon it gets super crowded from the hospital people. This place is solid, def. try it for lunch.

This place is cute the first time you go: it's got Italian food, cute chairs and tables, some old school Italians in pictures on the wall....Basically, it's the most charming place in an area surrounded by the VA and the Juvenile Court.

BUT, where Ferrara's FAILS miserably (and hence, my 1 star review) is their SERVICE.  Ferrara for some reason is hell-bent on finding the rudest and most incompetent late-adolescent girls to work at their establishment.  Now, when I say rude and incompetent, I mean: rude and incompetent.  These girls channel every horrible telephone operator you have ever had the displeasure of talking with and are able to surprisingly WORSEN the experience by the fact that they are what stand between you and your precious food.

I'll have to admit: the food is alright.  But the disinterested girl who has stains all over her shirt and is shuffling over to my table with it? No thanks. I already lost my appetite...

A quality Italian bakery. 

I was here yesterday, about 8 minutes before their 6:30pm closing time.  I came specifically to try their cannoli ($2.25).  They didn't have any left in the case, but they offered to make one on the spot for me. In the meantime, I took a look around. They have so many different Italian cookies to choose from, I ended up getting two, a lemon knot and an Amaretto meringue type cookie (I don't remember the exact names).  The cookies are $9.99 and two cookies were $1.09 by weight.

I ate the cannoli about 25 minutes later.  The filling was spot on, perfect.  The shell, however, was way too thick and unbelievably crunchy, not in a good way. I like a crispy, fresh cannoli shell, but it needs to be thinner to be enjoyable. Also, the ends are dipped in peanuts. I am really used to the pistachios on the end, so it seemed a bit of a downgrade.

On the plus side, the cookies were amazing.  The lemon knot especially - I loved it because it was straight-forward lemon. Many times I have bitten into a lemon knot and have had an anise aftertaste, which is not something I look forward to. 

They have many sandwiches on the menu, they all seemed reasonably priced, about $4 - $6 each. And they sell Mr. Luigi's brand of frozen pastas (love, love, love the gnocchi), and Ferrara Pan candy (same family) such as Lemonheads and Red Hots.

Also, metered street parking in front was very easy to find when I was there.

This review is not intended to sway anyone from doing business with this bakery, but is intended as a wake-up call for the ownership.
I have been coming here for close to 20 years.  Today I had to turn around and leave because the service was so completely abysmal and I couldn't wait any longer. I think this is the third time I've had to do so in the past year. I have seen others do the same.
The people at the counter have absolutely no clue, or possibly just don't care about trying to move the line along when it gets busy.  When it's slow you can easily wait 5+ minutes for anyone to even appear at the counter. When there are more than 3 people waiting in line to be dealt with they seem to just kind of shut down.  Today there were two people behind the counter and about 5 ahead of me when I stopped in.  One gal was completely focused on preparing an espresso drink the entire time I waited.  The other was having a long happy chat with someone at the register. Nothing was moving at all.  Neither one of them ever even looked around to see how many people were waiting to be served, and neither seemed to have the slightest concern for getting to the customers in a reasonable amount of time.
It's like this more often than not.
When this place goes out of business, I have no doubt they'll blame it on "the changing times/neighborhood, e-commerce, Costco, etc." but it will be completely their fault for not being service-minded.

came with a groupon and bought

cannoli - the cream too sweet and the shell too hard
pasticiotto - the lemon cake outside was good, but the cream inside too sweet
chocolate eclair - good chocolate crust but bad filling

focaccia - the crust too chewy and stale

the cannoli cream that's ever-present in all their pastries is the downfall. too sweet and lumpy.

Just a quick review, not much more I can say that hasn't already been posted. 

Great Italian food and pastries.  Good portions and fair prices. 

Had a nice sized meatball sub for lunch, with a bag of chips, pop and of course desert, all for about $10. 

Cannot say enough about how good the pastries are here..  Don't walk out with out trying something sweet.

I was a little shocked to find that this bakery is the oldest bakery of Little Italy but is the FARTHEST establishment away from all the other stores on the main strip of Taylor street. Oh well. Luckily I was driving and not walking.

I only tried two things from this bakery, both of which I thought were delicious. I had the cinnamon butterfly cookie (elephant ears), and the apple turnover. YUMMIE! I wanted to try some of their other cakes and cookies but thought I'd save myself for my next trip back.

Definitely not located in the best of areas, so bring a buddy or go during the day.

Cannoli, cannoli filled cakes, cannoli filled pastries, biscotti, European cookies, cheesecakes, chocolate covered strawberries, cream or custard filled horns, elephant ears, tiramisu.....do I really need to go on?? 

The Original Ferrara bakery is conveniently located near the Juvenile Detention Center and the Illinois Medical District. Hahaha, that makes no sense at all. Anywho...it's on Ogden and Taylor. 

After walking in today, I noticed it has been expanded. There are many more tables to sit at and enjoy some coffee and pastries or one of their Italian dishes. They have racks and racks of cookies, pastries, trays of cannoli, and several kinds of coffee drinks.

Oh, check out their website for a full list of pastries.. www.ferrarabakery.com

We ordered a cake for a baptism and a birthday (two separate occasions). For both events, my guests said the cake was fantastic. My wife's grandmother said it's the best cakes she ever had.
Separately, they are the best cafe (and/or restaurant, for that matter) in the Tri-Taylor neighborhood.

I ordered a cannoli cake for my mom's birthday and not only was it beautifully decorated, it tasted amazing. The last time she'd had a cannoli cake was 30 years ago and it was all she wanted this year. She's not even a dessert person and she had two pieces. In fact, I think we all had two pieces. There was less than half the cake left when we were done with it. 

The bakery itself is great. Plenty of seating for eat-in customers and a huge selection of Italian pastries and cookies. No wonder this place has such a good reputation. Everything looked gorgeous and the cake was positively delicious.

Ah Ferrara's.. I'm a fan.  And even if I wasn't, I have no choice as it's one of the few good Italian eateries in the area.  I tend to go with the sandwiches here, particularly the Positano (prosciutto, mozzarella, tomato with EVOO and balsamic vinegar on french bread).  It's delicious!  The place is very Italian authentic, including in food, decoration, and, unfortunately, service.  Lots of chatting, which is not a bad thing, except when you've pre-ordered and are in a hurry to make it before the short lunch break ends at work.

I recently purchased a canoli cake to celebrate a birthday.  It was delicious!  It was fresh and moist. The canoli fill with fresh strawberries was excellent.  The buttercream frosting was not too sweat.  I will definitely purchase another cake for the next birthday celebration.

Armed with a $10 Groupon and my italian boyfriend, I walked in seeking dessert after a delicious Italian sub lunch at Conte di Savoia.  The cannoli and tira misu did not disappoint, and I left wishing I'd bought a box of cookies for the train ride home.  If I'm ever back in the neighborhood to reminisce about my boyfriends college days again, I'll be begging to go to Ferrara.

Honestly their baked goods are not very good.  I would recommend the chocolate caramel cookie and a cannoli. but everything else is dry.  I think the cannoli would be better with chocolate chips on the ends rather than nuts though. 

The food is actually pretty good. I highly recommend the tuscan? sandwich (red peppers, spinach, and chicken). The summer salad is also tasty.  I should have asked for the dressing on the side because they put too much dressing on the salad for my taste.

I did not like the pepper and artichoke pizze (aka pizza).  They only have pizzas from 11-2 pm on Tuesdays, Thursdays, and Fridays. I bought into the exclusivity and thought this pizza will be delicious. Nope, I was wrong.  The sauce had a really odd flavor (almost tasted sour) and it was covered in cheese (usually a good thing but that's not like an original Italian pizza). The red peppers were soggy and the artichokes did nothing for flavor. Overall the pizze tasted like a bad frozen pizza. 

As for the frozen food, the chicken pastini? was very salty. My grandparents could not finish it.
The stuffed peppers took forever to warm up.  I asked the owner how long to put it in the oven for. She said 30 minutes in 350 degrees Fahrenheit.  Not even close, I had it in the oven for 1 hour and it was still cold in the middle.  I eventually had to put it in the microwave to warm it up and then it was soggy.  As for the taste, a bit flavorless. 
I have tried the frozen lasagna and that was worth the money.

As for the service, I think the young girls work hard and are relatively friendly.  The owner, however, is not  friendly and she is constantly barking orders/ correcting her staff making for an uncomfortable environment. She takes your order or rings you up and you're on your way.  She makes no effort to engage her customers. 

I only come here because I live very close. I would not suggest going out of your way for it, unless you want a cannoli.

This place has been in my neighborhood since the 70s.my mom use to buy my birthday cakes from here when I was kid.i been coming ever since I was a kid.they have some very tasty cookies,pound cake,rum babas,canolis,chocolate strawberries,etc.when I was a kid i use to come here to get my lemon heads,Boston baked beans,fishies an other candies.love this place:-)
Very cute and quaint place! Ordered a tray of various small pastries for a potluck. Everyone enjoyed them and commented on how delicious they were. Service is also very nice and helpful. :)

One of those hidden bakeries in Chicago... they have excellent pastries and they struggle with some of their more savory dishes... but the SFOGLIATELLA is out of this world!  I did find lots of their food to be too oily for my liking and my friends too. 

Update 9/6/12:
This restaurant is difficult to find with only an old sign on their brick building, but it is a great place for lunch, especially if you are not wanting to spend too much money and are craving some Italian food.  The crowd varies from nurses to doctors to students and construction workers.  Whatever you do, everyone comes here hungry and leaves satisfied!

I had a banana creme boat and was not that impressed with the pastry part nor the creme part.  The lady kindly gave us some cookies gratis (neon pink, green and yellow ones), but I liked those even less, one bite was enough for me.
I really wanted to like it but sorry, I just didn't.
To make matters worse, my friend waited for quite a while at the counter and they seemed to help everybody but him, until he finally have up and sat back down with me.

Okay, My grandmother clearly makes the best red sauce in the world.  She is my Italian grandmother and there is no comparison.  So, to make me happy with a real good bolognese? WOW! A big bowl of pasta with red sauce, bread, and salad for like $6 and the pasta is for reals, the bomb.  Francescas? Rose Bud? Tuscany? (Yes, Tuscany) Crap. Crap. Crap.  Ferrara has a great, authentic bolognese that tastes like its been on the stove for a good 6-8 hours before served with a very generous serving of pasta. Add a meatball or an italian sausage and you have yourself a great meal, for under $10. 

Do be careful, when you walk in and order, there is some 30-40ft worth of display case with cookies and desserts galore! Again, the biscotti, nothing can compare to my grandma's but this stuff is good. I could eat them by the pound.  And the cannoli cake? WOW! Another favorite.  

This should be anybody's staple joint if you are in the area. Because its really good food time after time. 

The service just leaves you wanting a little more.  I feel like the girls behind the counter are often really impatient.  And there was a time I stood at the counter for like 4 minutes, as I needed a spoon (any proper italian knows pasta is eaten with a spoon) while an owner (male) stood on the other side of the counter and decided just to not acknowledge me until, oh, I don't know, he was good and ready? Yea, not cool. 

Anyways, the food is awesome.  Desserts are dangerously amazing.

My chocolate horseshoe cookie was so hard that I thought I made one of the brackets on my braces pop off.  I had an assortment of cookies, and all but one type were stale. 

The cannoli filling lacked something...it just wasn't sweet enough. And WTF, garnished with peanuts? 

The spinach and ricotta foccacia is still awesome, but by the time I got there (around 4pm) there was only one piece left.

Meh!
One of Chicago's best vintage, family owned businesses! The best Italian bakery in Chicago! Everything here is phenomenal!  The cannoli cake is beyond belief amazing!

I have gone here multiple times and I have no complaints! They have never messed up my order, and I mostly go during the lunch rush. I normally get the pasta dishes which is around $6. They give you a huge bowl of pasta with a side of bread and salad. You can't beat that price for good quality food.
Pretty good Italian sub.  OK minestrone soup. Really good cannoli.  I would go back.

During my 2 months working at the JBVA, I've probably had at least 10 of their Ferrara Signature sandwiches. Not joking, I was OBSESSED with this place. Everything about that sandwich is fantastic, from the bread to the cold cuts to the tomatoes and lettuce, all delicately assembled and topped with a drizzle of olive oil and vinaigrette--at a great price, too. 

Also love love love their tiramisu (one of the best I've had). Their other pastries are meh (cheesecake, cookies) but the tiramisu is amazing. The shells with broccoli is not bad, either, though the chicken parmesan  with pasta left something to be desired. Would not go anywhere else for lunch if I still worked in the Illinois Medical District.

Best Bakery Ever! I could not understand some of the comments because I have always had a great experience here. I have been coming here since I was a little kid and there has always been delicious food, and great service. When ever I go in I am immediately greeted and helped. I have never been disappointed in anything I ordered (although I do stick to the Italian staples). I would also disagree that this is a "bad area" it is right by the medical district and the bakery is only open during the day... I think you will be safe. I still have yet to try any of the meals they serve.

I bought a cannoli to take home for after dinner on a Tuesday morning and immediately came down with a case of flu and did not get to the cannoli until Saturday.   I opened it thinking I would just take a little bite to find out whether it was worth getting again and throw it out.    To my surprise the cannoli was still crisp, the filling was still fresh tasting and delightful.    Very impressive.   
I also bought one of the big boxes of mixed cookies, biscotti, candy, etc.    I was not overly impressed.    I was expecting buttery butter cookies, tasty biscotti and found everything was a little under sugary, not very buttery and quite blah.

Maybe I made the mistake ordering a carrot cake from an Italian bakery and not the cannoli cake or something....but why offer something if it tastes so bad?
I ordered a huge carrot cake for my sister's birthday and brought it to the family gathering.  SO embarassing! I watched as everyone politely  took a bite or two and then quietly set it down on the table.  I could not believe what I tasted, is that hint of cardboard? or gym shoe?  My favorite part was when I cut a few slices out of it and there was some sort of cake structural damage that had been filled up with frosting.  Literally, a hole the size of my fist out of the top 2 layers that had been filled with that tasteless cream cheese frosting.  I'm confused, did the dog get to this cake first?
Why the heck didn't I just go to Weber's?

I love Ferrara.  Maybe because its on my walk to (and from) work... but I think this place if fab.  They sell a variety of cookies by the pound, which are great for family/work parties, or even get togethers with friends.  I have tried a couple of their pastries which were pretty good as well.  Haven't gone their for an actual  meal, but had a bite of an italian beef which was pretty awesome (very spicy).  I love the neighborhood feel and how helpful everyone is!

I've found the amore della mia vita!  Once you try the original Ferrara's Cannoli Cake, you won't be able to eat Jewel's or any average Shmoe cakes anywhere!  Made of sweet canoli filling, yellow cake, homemade whipped cream, fresh strawberries, and all this pinched with shaved coconut, it's SWEET HEAVEN!  Although it's $18 a cake, it's perfect for any special occasion.  If my partner and I were ever to get married, it would be his family's expectation to have a supersized Wedding-style Cannoli Cake there.  After all, they were the first ones to introduce me to this gastronomical tradition that has been at every family celebration since their grandparent's grew up on the old Taylor Street, now what is well-gentrified called 'University Village.'  Although the area continues to changed, the bakery has not.  In other words, don't miss out on this one-of-a-kind Italian immigrant bakery or you'll be missing out a piece of Chicago's history.  

Oh and the best part of the visit (other than the adorable older nonna who secretly treats cutie pie visitors with a few pieces of candy--yes at 23 years old I can still pull it off!) is when they use their pulley contraption attached the ceiling to wrap up the products packaging with yarn.  Yay for old school!

amazing canoli, pignoilia (sp?) nut cookies, pizelles, napoleons, you name it... a lil pricy, but not above that of any other good italian bakery.
The only negative thing i have to say is that they close too early

Thanks for all the reviews on here! I was in a bind on Friday, needing a Tres  Leche cake, and someone gave it a good review, and I called 6 places and all need 3 days!

I called in the order at 2pm on Friday and it was ready for pickup 10am on Saturday. Easy parking in front, was able to get right in, and pick up the cake. They showed it to me, making sure it was what I wanted, before writing on it. 

It came out spectacular! They box it up, wrapping strong around the box to keep it in place. The owner (who was actually the person that came out to right on it, and rung me up, who is on the website), she was very kind, and gave us a free piece of their canoli cake. Wow! 

Now I want the Canoli cake, it had 3 layers of cake, with a layer of fruit in between one, and then a layer of, I think a pudding. Very good! 

Would be back in a heart beat, and recommend to anyone!
Fantastic cannoli!  BUT when you go in, do NOT pass up on the bow tie pastries!  Buy yourself at least 1/2 lb!

Things were just ok.
I actually felt like I was bugging the girl behind the counter by asking questions about the different pastries so I just quickly ordered a few cookies. I agree that the cookies weren't anything to sing about. I don't think I would make a special trip to the area for this bakery.

I haven't been to this establishment for 35 years.  I almost got into a car accident as I saw Ferrara's in the corner of my eye as driving by on Taylor St.  Naturally, I had to stop to taste the cannoli.  Yep, they are the same as I remember them, and to be sure they are the standard by which all others are judged.  However, the bakery is a mere shadow of its former self.  I remember when as a kid in the 50s this was the center of the universe when it came to Italian cookies and pastries.  Today, except for the cannoli, I not sure about the baked goods.  I would have given the establishment 5 stars for the cannoli alone if they had not pre-filled them.  World class cannoli must always be filled on order and not a moment before.

I have to admit that I have a HUGE weakness for a good rum baba (baba au rhum), and they are hard to find in Chicago.  The summer I worked a block from Ferrara Bakery was a dangerous one... Everyday during lunch, the rum babas in their pastery case called my name.  9/10 times, I caved (that+sitting all day long was bad news for my bathroom scale). The moisy pastry and the creamy filling... yummmmmy!

Because they made rum babas, I rarely got anything else, but their italian beef sandwichs were also pretty good.

The bakery is located in a really busy street, pretty hard to find parking but if you look hard you may be able to get one. 

The insides of the shop looks a little bit... ancient. This is similar to some chain bakeries like Goldilocks (not sure if they have this chain in Chicago), the walls are all glass, a lot of glass display cases for the pastries and the furniture is just so-so (well I don't think anyone paid too much attention on their chairs anyway). There's an interesting sign stating that the store has been around for awhile and I would believe it (the decor looks a little old)

I tried to order some food but the cashier said the only thing they have are cold sandwiches (Saturday noon and this is all you have?) The owner overheard and tried to correct her, just cold sandwiches and spaghetti. (maybe not., the guy around the corner is eating spaghetti and it doesn't look appetizing). So we just tried some of the sandwiches they have. Not bad, decent. I still feel miffed about that cashier trying to convince us that there was no hot food (why did I get a meatball sandwich huh? Isn't that hot food?) 
 
I just came here to try out their cannoli and it was just alright. It was good just not spectacularly good (yes I have had several cannolis from various places before). I could still say that still the best cannoli I have ever had is from the Bay Area.

I can't believe this place only has 70 some reviews!  It is one awesome place with some delicious Italian fare and pastries.  Their tiramisu is by far the best and what I believe to be the most authentic I have ever found.  A young man that was working the counter when I was there for one of the first times was a descendent of the original owners and said all thief recipes are old family recipes that are much older than the bakery itself.  Recipes that were probably brought here by his clearly Italian heritage past.  The cannolis were delectable as well as the red sauce I took home after finding out the recipe was most likely older than my grandparents.

You will not find a better Italian bakery.  The cannoli's and cannoli cake are the best hands down.  Their cookies are fantastic and their pizza is awesome.  They have a little restaurant/cafe inside the bakery also if you would like to eat there.  They are not cheap by any means, but they are the best.  You get what you pay for.
Do yourself a favor and eat here. My family orders cakes, cannoli's,ect... for the holidays and I LOVE IT!

The place when I first entered recently. Was actually better than I expected. Lots of Italian cookies to choose from. Some other Italian pastries as well. The selection of beverages, take home foods, even Ferrara Pan candies are a real treat.

I stopped in here on a whim because I needed a java fix while waiting for someone. 

This is a very old school place, but with new school prices. It's obviously got that nostalgic draw going on - I could just imagine tiny, lil Italian woman ordering bread and sweets, barely seeing over the counter. 

So, I ordered one cream puff, one cherry turnover and a coffee. 7 bones! Ouch. Okay, so I am a lil cheapish. 

The cream puff was yuck. Whipped cream instead of custard. Not good. The turnover appear to have a pizza crust-like base to it, and was not at all light. Kind of bland. Meh. 

I will try it again sometime.

Growing up I remember having had delicious cakes from here, but I guess I've learned how to differentiate between good and bad!

I ordered a carrot cake from Ferrara's for my dad's birthday. It was a "small" cake, your stardard 8" inches wide and probably about 6-7" inches high. It looked nice but failed miserably. My family typically loves carrot cake, but was hugely dissapointed with this one. 

There was way too much cream cheese filling.  The actual cake portion was moist but not flavorful. The cream cheese ratio to actual cake was about even. Not a good thing. With so much cream It was difficult to taste the "carrot" in the cake, the cream cheese was overpowering.  It wasn't the worst carrot cake I've ever had, but it was close.  Next time I want a cake, I know where I won't be going.

Decided to go Little Italy to find the elusive pignoli cookie. I have been searching and searching since I moved to Chicago to find these nutty delights. Now Ferrara has a pignoletti (which means small) that is pretty tasty and close to what I have been making for years, and what I find every time I go to NY to visit. Their other cookies and pastries are spot on, fresh, creamy and delicious. Service was good, the people friendly, and even though it was a little crowded, quick and efficient. Definitely reminded me of the bakeries I grew up near in Brooklyn!
Awesome tiramasu and other desserts. Always stop by here before having guests over so that we have a tasty treat for dessert.  They have awesome sandwiches too!

Delicious sandwiches. I only ate here a couple of times when I worked on Taylor, but the food was definitely worth the trip. But I'm in the habit of taking my lunch to work more often than not, so I'm sad to say I didn't make this a regular pit stop. The focaccia is delicious. Do yourself a favor and give it a try if you find yourself in Little Italy.

Went in here on a recomendation to try a sandwich.  Decided to get an italian beef and may have found my new favorite beef in the city.  It was so good, that I'm going to have to go back, and make sure this wasn't just a fluke. 

Before I left, I had to get a slice of carrot cake, and some kind of chocolate cake.  Neither dissapointed.  I also grabbed a premade couple breasts of spinach stuffed chicken from their in store freezer.  Heated it up in the oven and it was delicious.  I can't wait to go back.

This place is by far the best and only place to get authentic Italian pastries and cakes. I have not been to any other bakery that can compare. My parents went there as kids and I have been going there since I was a year old. We would always make sure to get birthday cakes here and a wide variety of pastries for Thanksgiving and Christmas holidays. 
So, you are say "Why only 4 stars if this place is the best around?" I stopped in a few years ago and found that the place had put in all these long tables in the bakery so that people can come in and have lunch. I understand that the owners are just looking for a revenue stream to bring in new customers, but you should have seen this place before. When you walked in there used to be small tables where old people sat and had coffee or espresso and pastries. There were fancy display cases that held Marsala Crystal Glass that you could purchase in sets. When you walked in, you were not just buying pastries, but going in for an elegant experience. It was much different from the penitentiary style dinning that they currently have in place. I guess that the old people eating pastries have passed on and their kids have moved to Elk Grove Village or Orland Park. 
None the less, this place still knocks out a top notch product!!

Anytime I find myself on Taylor St., the first thing I think of is Ferrera.  Immediately the smile begins to spread across my face and I can almost smell the sweet pastry in the air.   I think I've eaten everything on the menu and I've never been disappointed.  

I love sweets.  My inner cookie monster is so satisfied after a Ferrera binge.  The Chocolate Dip Almond Bars are heavenly.  The quality of the chocolate they use for dipping isn't like other bakeries.  They don't skimp on the dip and they don't use cheap grade chocolate.  All their cookies have the perfect texture.  They're firm enough to feel substantial and soft enough that they don't crumble into a million pieces when you bite into them.  

The Chocolate Cherry Almond Biscotti....oooo....yes.  Dip one in your cup of coffee and I guarantee your morning will be brighter!

Chocolate Cannoli what a marvelous invention. 
I could seriously rave on for several pages, but the sentiment would be the same.  You just need to stop by and see for yourself.  Trust me you won't walk away disappointed. 

They have a casual set up of tables and chairs which i appreciate, because I can sit right down and eat a few cookies before I head out to the car.  So the next time your in Little Italy pop in, you might just find me there.

Excellent sushi. We shared the Halloween, Cherry Blossom and the UIC rolls, and they were all amazing! Delicious, delicate and flavorful, you can taste the subtleties off each ingredient, but they blend harmoniously into their own unique roll. This place will become a mainstay for sushi.

I'm trying not to be harsh, but I want to be honest. The moment I walked into this restaurant, it smelled like a stinky toilet bowl. Did I come on an off day? 

We came here just to snack and to check out our 'hood. We had another dinner to attend shortly. We tried the following:

1. Hamachi roll - good. Nothing fantastic. 
2. Ramen - it's nothing special. It was a quick-job-kind-of-broth. 

The total bill was probably like $25-30, not much. Based on the better reviews though, I would consider coming back here for the rolls.

Let me begin by saying I will be back. But I'm giving this place 3 stars because I'm sure other rolls are better than what I ordered. 

It's been a couple weeks since I was there and forgot to review right away but I'm pretty sure my two rolls were something to do with Halloween and the other was Chicago Fire roll, or something along those lines. The Halloween roll was sooooo sweet. The other roll, Chicago Fire, was good and spicy but still had sweetness. 

There presentation is nice but ease just in the sauces on the plate. Perhaps that is what over did the sweetness but I couldn't pin point what it was.

It was completely empty and parking right on Halsted was easy.

I tried both the ramen and the sushi. I would give the sushi 4 stars but the ramen only 2. So, on average, I give 3. The sushi is pretty good and I think it is worth to go to South Kawa for it. But, please, don't go there for the ramen. Definitely, there are so many ramen places in Chicago that that South kawa falls far from the top list.

We ordered delivery from here on a lazy Sunday night. They don't advertise that they deliver to our area, but we were able to order through GrubHub. We tried it out, because we seem stuck in our old ways with ordering from Talay every time and wanted to venture outside of our box. 

There were definitely some pros and cons of our meal! We ordered the Spicy Roll Combo, which was a deal! You get a spicy tuna roll, spicy salmon roll and a California roll plus a salad and miso soup for $17! We also got the dynamite roll, which is your tasty/standard dynamite roll. Finally, we go the Fallen Angel roll, which neither of us really enjoyed. I love scallops but the combination of scallops and crab meat on a roll makes a really fishy and slimy texture that was hard to get past. 

All in all, we enjoyed our sushi, but probably would have chosen different rolls if we could do it over again. I am interested in trying the dining in experience, as well!

I live 2 blocks away and it took me a year and a half to try. I have no idea why. Cute and clean decor, good service, absolutely delicious sushi at reasonable prices. I had the sweet potato & the Hawaiian Roll, both were some of the most delicious sushi I've ever had. I'll be back soon!

I like my sushi rolls to not have so much rice and I commend south kawa for being more generous with the fish than the rice. I give it three because there is nothing amazing about the sushi. Very typical of the many sushi restaurants in Chicago. You will have a satisfactory experience here. The sushi is fairly priced, service is prompt not friendly, dark lit ambiance is nice too. I like going here during my lunch break when it's not too busy. Great nearby place
I have no idea why this place has more than two stars. The food was terrible and I got FOOD POISONING! Clearly inauthentic and poorly handled "sushi." Stay. Away.

Went here for dinner on a Friday night with my friends I was in the mood for some noodles. 

Pros: 
-We were promptly greeted and seated right away. There was no wait and it was around 8pm
-Staff was friendly and courteous
-Local neighborhood restaurant
-You can bring your own bottle of wine, and they will uncork it...for a small fee of course  
-Food came out quickly and it was piping hot

Cons:
-Our server when asked questions about what vegetables were in the Udon Stir Fried noodles seemed a little confused
-When I asked her how they tasted, she responded "They smell really good." Side eye . She then went on to tell me that, she would have to purchase herself so she just makes her own.
-They bought out one entree for our two person party. The other one had to wait another 3-5 mins for the other entree to come

We ordered Gyoza, Spicy Tuna Roll, Beef Ramen, and Chicken Udon Stir Fry.

For the cost (which is very reasonable) you get a nice portion, quick service, and hot food. Just don't go here thinking you will be WOW'd or anything.

I've past thru South Kawa many times and finally decided to dine-in to try their rolls. I ordered a couple of rolls that surprisingly were actually very good (Halloween and Seventeen). 

The restaurant for that day was pretty packed but the service did not fault and was prompt. 

TIP: If you pay cash, you get a 10% discount.

Came here for lunch with a couple of friends and we had a decent time. The food was average and the lunch deals are good deals. I had 3 rolls for $10 and it came with miso soup or salad. The service was average and its an okay place to make a quick stop for lunch.

This is my favorite sushi restaurant in Chicago. Last winter there was a -20 night windchill, with tons of ice on the sidewalks, but I was craving Kawa so I walked the mile from the red line stop. It was worth it. Every bite is always worth it.

Kawa's aesthetic is nice, simple, and relaxing. The Asian influences in decor do a great job of fitting the Japanese menu without transporting you to the tackiest corner of China town like so many other places do. The staff is always wonderfully courteous and are more than happy to share recommendations.

Their specialty rolls are wonderful, especially the Fallen Angel roll. Around Valentine's Day they have a special Cupid roll and it's also awesome.

South Kawa is my FAVORITE sushi place. 
The food and prices are great and for the south side they are most definitely above par.
We try new rolls every time and they never disappoint.
The jalapeño poppers are an awesome spin on the traditional kind and the shrimp tempura is crunchy, light and delicious.
We love this place so much that we always forget that there's coupons we could use.
South Kawa is a must try!

I order two rolls and it look different then the menu. So I call back to ask if it was suppose to look different. The thing lady said no it should look the same. She was very rude. I was not trying to get a refund and was wondering if it was suppose to look different. Save your money and go some where else.

Amazing service & even better food! Miso soup was fresh and so yummy and the fried jalapeños are HOT but definitely worth the burn! We ordered the dynamite, Chicago, America eagle, Mexican special rolls! They were absolutely DEEEEEELICIOUS! Hidden little spot and great sushi! :)

We got the free edamame check-in, the fallen angel, and the UIC roll. The edamame was fresh, the fallen angel with the sliced scallops on top was delicious and sweet, and my companion really enjoyed his UIC roll.

Kawa has the worst customer service. I placed a lunch order and was running behind.  Right before my arrival,   one of the workers called and cancelled my order, despite the fact that I was only five minutes away.  I am a regular and loyal customer,  but after the way I was treated, I will never go back there.  I was so upset, I had called the next day to speak to the owner,  and of course they claim he wasn't there.

I'm not really thrilled with this place as others seem to be. I have gone here on 3 occasions and each time was disappointing. The sushi selections are not that impressive and I think I got sick on another occasion. Another time my sushi roll seemed really dry.  It's so close to my house, that I've substituted going here instead of going to my usual Chinese/Sushi spot on 31st. I'm on the fence about South Kawa. Nothing stands out and it always looks dark and dirty...and kind of has a stench when you go inside. 

I will give it one more go, to see if maybe I'm missing what the excitement is about this place.

Oh yes, how happy I am that this treasure is not far from where I live. 

I came here for my 22nd birthday this past Wednesday with 5 of my friends. We ordered 7 rolls and no appetizers but were given fried shrimp drizzled in two types of sauces which were delicious and complimentary with edamame as well. One of the sauces was sweet and the other was spicy. The rolls were made to perfection and quickly since we were the only table there. Then, service started to pick up as the restaurant filled. Customer service was great and the best part was that there was no corking fee. Mind you, we had about 3-4 bottles of wine that night. It was a great time and I'll definitely be back. Thanks Kawa Sushi!

No longer need to go to the North Side for delicious sushi! We had the Gyoza for an appetizer, and I wish we ordered two! My husband and I also shared the Anaconda, the Sexy Mama, the Chicago Fire, and the Fallen Angel rolls - and every single one was YUMMY in its own right! Highly recommend.
The food is amazing. Truly fast service and the server was really friendly! Definitely will come back!

My go to sushi joint when I can't travel far. Everything always taste amazing and super yummy. They have a lunch special that is 3 rolls for 10 dollars and that is a steal! The service is always super fast and friendly. Can't get enough of this place. Love it.

Very good. BYOB! Had the anaconda roll, the rock shrimp, and the cherry blossom roll.

I also tasted Uni for the first time!

Place was small, but clean, and easy parking. Waitstaff were very friendly.

All were fresh, and affordable ! We had a groupon but I will be back one day, full price or not.

So glad I found an affordable sushi place that isn't in the north side. This place is small but the two times I've come at night it is not packed with people and I've gotten seated right away. The place is BYOB which is a plus since I did come to celebrate a friends birthday. Because they have a lunch special and the sushi is affordable and good  I'll be coming here more often!

Me and my colleague frequent this spot during lunch time. It's easy to overlook against all the other spots if you're driving down Halsted. We usually go an hour after they open, when there are only a couple tables busy. Their lunch specials are a steal, and it comes with amazing miso soup! We always get seated right away and they ask whether you want hot tea, ice water or a drink. The entire selection of sushi on the lunch menu is delicious. The ambiance inside is calm, not too quiet. Definitely one of Bridgeport's gems.

This is one of those good news/bad news places. Since I'm a little bit of an ass, we'll start with the negative.

The sushi is not very good. It's what I consider sushi buffet quality. There is nothing inherently wrong with that; there are days when I want to just pig out and have some all-you-can-eat sushi, but when you're ordering rolls by the roll (and paying for them by the roll), it really does not make a satisfied customer of me. 

If you'd like me to nitpick further, well here goes: the fish didn't seem all that fresh, the rice was cooked all that well, and the rolls themselves were quite small. I ordered a staple of any sushi place: the salmon skin roll, and I was very disappointed. Usually, the fried salmon skin provides a nice crunchy contrast to the bed of fluffy rice around it; here, the salmon meat was not filleted off of the skin enough and so you ended up with a somewhat awkward bite. Crunchy, yes, but also quite tough to chew through. Color me disappointed. 

Another negative was the special dessert offered on Valentine's Day. Though given to us for free, it really wasn't very good. Matcha frosting and filling on a yellow-cake cupcake? No, that's okay, but thank you anyway.

And now on to the good news:

Tonkotsu Ramen. 'Nuff said. Delectable pieces of marinated pork belly swimming in a pork broth with handmade ramen. Fantastic! Truly the star of yesterday's meal. Friends and all raved on and on about that fantastic bowl of noodles. If I were running Kawa, I'd make the ramen the star of the show; hey! it's popular now, anyway. But that's just me, and my four friends, and an acquaintance who recommended your restaurant to us. 

Also, Olivia. Great job, lady. You're a great server, and truly a valuable asset to the Kawa team. 

Well, that's that. Go for the ramen, eat sushi if you want to, skip dessert. Once again: TONKOTSU RAMEN. That is all.

I have came here about 3 times in the past month alone and I believe everything is good for the most part. I am just happy there is a good sushi spot so close to home, but this place is average compared to a few of my favorite sushi spots up North. Plus, this is a BYOB spot, so that is definitely a plus. The service here has been pretty good, but I believe they have introduced a new wait staff. It is a pretty small location, so I would recommend making a reservation just to be safe because this place is pretty random. Sometimes it would be empty and at other times it would be packed.

For my fellow Yelpers, if you check-in, you get a free Edamame, but our waiter still charged us for it on the bill, which we never complaint about, but keep this in mind if you use this offer.

For appetizer, the Fried Calamari is pretty good and the Thai Chili Sauce goes perfect with this.

For sushi, I like the American Eagle, Cherry Blossom, and Fallen Angel. The Black Dragon, Anaconda, and Mexican Roll is okay as well. The Grayslake Roll is suppose to be popular there, but we didn't like this. It tasted kinda bland compared to the other rolls. Also, the Spicy Tuna Handroll here is okay at best, but for $6, I think I will pass next time around.

I have lived in Bridgeport now for over 2 years, but when I moved here, one of my first concerns was: where am I going to get my sushi from now??? South Kawa; you have been a dream. I have tried almost all of their sushi rolls and I absolutely love them! I order delivery and for take out, mainly delivery,  and they almost always arrive within 30 min of my order and never once has my order been incorrect (I order about once a week). When I come in to pick up food, they are always friendly and kind and seem speedy in trying to get me my order so I can go home and enjoy my delicious sushi!!
