I came here for dinner on a Friday evening with friends.  Upon arrival, we were seated immediately.  As others mentioned, it is just an average diner.  However, I gotta give credit for all the food options they have here!! wow!

Food - reminds me of Denny's, but with a lot more options!

Grecian Chicken - Generous with food portions.  The chicken tasted ok, nothing too amazing.

Costs - around $10 for a meal with generous portions

Customer Service - nice, seems like the folks that work here have been here for awhile and they just seem happy which is always a plus.

Decor - I really liked the decor inside the restaurant, pretty neat! :)

Parking - plenty of parking if you park near the whole foods and just walk down to the restaurant.

I would come back here to check out the other food items on the menu since there's just soo many!!

This is simple as it gets, it's a diner, it's open 24 hours! The coffee is always fresh, hot and a good medium brew. It's what coffee was in Chicago before all those dedicated coffee storefronts popped up on every corner.

I've heard many good things about the fried chicken so I tried it once, imo it's good but not worth the hype. I do like any of the breakfasts here, and yes places do manage to screw up breakfast, they make it to order and they make it right. My husband generally gets the catfish and has been happy with it.

At times the place can get loud, remember it's a 24hour joint, so all the sudden you may find them vacuuming around you. There used to be more of these places in the city, now they're dying off, I hope this place stays around for a long, long time. Everyone needs a diner in their life.

I don't know why this place has such low ratings! I found the food to be delicious, and I shared a skillet with my BFF & we were both full and satisfied! 

The place is pretty janky, but I like the diner atmosphere. There are some weird rules about pre-paying if you have a party of 5 or more and paying $3 per person if in a booth. No splitting the bill either, so it definitely has a lot of terms and conditions!

The food, however, is very good for your buck! Paid $10 for a chicken fajita skillet and pancakes came with! Love how the place is open 24 hours a day! Will come again!

WARNING! MOLD - HEALTH RISK

We came here excited to eat at a restaurant featured on Diner's, Drive In's & Dives. We were not able to order what Guy Fieri ate, so we ordered:

Meat Lover's Omelette w/ Side of Toast
Blue Plate Special "Steaker"

The Steaker was basically a bacon cheeseburger with no bun, with steak meat(?). 
The sausage in the meat lover's omelette was undercooked tasting

At the end of our meal, we realized that the side of TOAST, GREEK TOAST, had MOLD on BOTH PIECES. 

I brought this to the manager. He took it back, and ASKED IF WE WANTED MORE TOAST. 
NO APOLOGY, NO ATTEMPT TO RECOVER. 

Thank god there was no bun on the Steaker Special. BEWARE. CHECK ALL FOOD.

This place gets a three stars just by being open all night. The food here is great if you are drink but it gets really noisy and shady at night. The service was a little bit underwhelming considering that my party was forced to pay up front and a mandatory gratuity. However, the overall feel is still welcoming.

I want to just start this off with a summary but I can describe more of the food. The coffee is unlimited refills as expected but it was difficult to get a refill. I ordered a reuben sandwich that came with soup and fries. First, I love how they have crinkled fries, but the reuben was okay. Standard reuben. I had a clam chowder soup that had a fair amount of clams. Another plus for this place. 

Overall, it is still hard to beat a late night diner. Skillets and pancakes or chicken and waffles. I would recommend pregame before coming in at night ; just to fit in with the environment. Really noisy at night, but will come again.

We tried this place for the first time yesterday. It has been here since the 1930's so they must be doing something right. The decor is classic diner of days gone by. Really nice if you like that kind of thing. The service here was very good, polite and prompt.

As for the food it was ok not great. My wife had the patty melt with fries and chicken noodle soup. She said it was very good but not great. i had the chicken and waffles which came with 2 eggs and hash browns. It was pretty good but the chicken was average. You get 3 strips which are just ok. I do not see what all the rave is about this place but I may try it again and this time something else as the chicken and waffles cannot be the best thing here.

Not really impressed with this tacky restaurant. The food has no taste and I was disappointed. There's better restaurants for that kind of price. The drink was not even how is supposed to taste. Dirty glasses. So all your getting if you go is a quick fast salt less meal. Don't get your hopes up. And prepare to pay for parking.
Service was great, the diner looks like a blast form the past, classic 50's diner which is cool, but the food was mediocre. If people come here its for the great service and vibe, not for the food.

White palace are so racist. We walked in this big guy of European descent asked us how many people are in your party. I told him 3 and we we were waiting on our third person from our to park the car so we said okay we will abide by their policy. After 3mins of waiting a women of European descent walks in says she has a party of 4 and their was 3 of them the same big guy sat them straight down.  I told the big guy that it wasn't right not to make a huge scene he said what you say. I said its not right and you are not right. Afterward We sat down and felt really uncomfortable so we all got up and left.


To respond to your response below  what you are saying is lies as far as the size of the party that was seated. The host claimed the woman's husband was parking. The woman's husband did not come the 5 mins we sat down before decided not to spend money in your establishment. As far as the staff being intimidated you must be talking about a different person because I only addressed this with your hostess. I told him calmly he was wrong when tried to explain I said sir you are wrong. Then we were seated and after talking with the members of my church we decided to leave. I'm a pastor and we did not cause a scene but we just walked out with no comment left the free water on the table. To lie to try and discredit what I have said is wrong and I hope you all change your heart and the way you treat people because it's 2016 and no one deserves service the way you do business. As far as your staff being 70% African American. I don't know if it's true or not but on Sunday morning I only saw 3 African Americans out of a staff at least 15. I can't say it's false but I can say what I saw was not 70%.

OMG this place was delicious ! Had the chicken and waffles and they were perfect 
Definitely coming back here !

This place is absolutely horrible is across the street from my job me and my co-workers come here regularly I ordered a breakfast sandwich wheat toast turkeys bacon scrambled eggs with cheese sandwich on the phone get there leave check the box is not nothing that I ordered she said that's what I ordered I did not I don't even  eat sausage  the pitcher looks nothing like I ordered the whole order was wrong argued with the manager and he refused to give me my money back or give me a new sandwich never going back horrible

We wanted to eat lunch somewhere after cheering all morning in the Blackhawks 2015 rally. Hubby remembered this place called White Palace Grill that was nearby and it was on diners drive-ins and dives and Chicago's best tv shows.
When we walked in, we were greeted right away and we were able to sit in a booth by the window so we can people watch.  The place had a dinner feel with red/white/black colors of the interior.  The place was pretty clean and neat, not bad for a restaurant that is open 24/7 for over 70 years, wow impressive.  They must be doing something right!  They make everything from scratch even their Italian bread crumbs! I believe it's owned by a Greek family so you know your portions will be plentiful.
Here is what we ordered for lunch:
-Chicago Deluxe Burger-it was juicy on toasted brioche buns.  Served with crinkle fries that were hot and crispy.  It came with a soup which hubby chose creamy mushroom.  His soup was thick a hearty with sliced of mushrooms.  I tasted it and I would get it too lol.
-Catfish Sandwich Deluxe-it was two large pieces of breaded catfish filet on toasted Italian bread with crispy fries and a soup.  He would get this meal again. 
-I got the hot Meatloaf, it came with mashed potatoes made fresh topped with beef gravy and a cup of soup which I got the chicken noodle.  My soup had plenty of noodles and it was also hearty and not salty, I would order this again.  I LOVED this meatloaf dish, I got 4 pieces of moist meatloaf that had a crispy crust on the outside.  The gravy was so good not salty at all, I even asked extra on the side for dipping.  The meatloaf was flavorful with bits of carrots and celery in it.  I wanted to save some to take home, but I liked it a lot that I ended up eating it all.  If I say hmmm while eating without thinking, then I know it's good haha!   Good comfort food. 
Even our server was really nice and polite.  She was very attentive when we asked for more mayo , we got more, I asked for more gravy, I got it.  Our drinks were filled without us asking, nice.  Overall, I like this place and it's 24/7 all year round.  I'll be coming back as I want to try other things on the menu as seen on TV  lol!

It's epically great! Pancakes are on the thick side, almost like yellow cake but I liked them. Eggs and bacon cooked great. Our waitress was friendly and had a nice attitude despite being busy and be food game quick.totally great!!

This place won't receive one star as they try I imagine and perhaps I came in when better chefs were on rotation. That being said I think Guy Fieri is full of shit when he came and ranked this place so highly.

The burger I ordered was mediocre at best and a bit on the over done side; the veggies that came with were what you may have had in grammar school as a kid and obviously straight out of a can; they were soupy, tough and sad looking. The soup options were clam chowder and chicken noodle; I opted for the former and learned that there are tomato based clam chowders; the soup was average.

The second dish I ordered was the Grecian Tilapia, and from the menu description lead me to believe it was expertly prepared and high on taste; I don't know what the hell I was thinking as it was anything but. The saving grace to this entree was the greek rice that made it passable. The fish was over cooked, burnt on one end and looked like the cap came undone on the seasoning bottle; something akin to a young girl discovering makeup for the first time, too much.

The nail in the coffin was when I asked the manager if I could charge my phone as it was on 16% and I figured I would be here for at least an hour; he asked if I was a customer and I motioned to the table directly in front of him with my winter attire and open menu. He said no. I just stared at him and took my seat. This review was written on my dying phone after the meal had been finished. I could forgive shit service or bad food, but not both; the twenty minute wait time to be served would have been dissmissable had other things been different.

I opt you check out laurence fishery for some decent seafood on canal and cermak as that was where I intended to go originally, but hunger won out for me.

Stay curiously hungry and adventurously hungrier on the quest for good eats.

This was one of the few restaurants around the loop area that is open late. Since it was profiled on Guy Fieri's show, we decided to give it a try. We ordered one of the chicken and waffles dishes, along with some pie. The chicken tenders appeared to be out of a frozen bag. The pie also looked to be the frozen kind that you buy at the grocery store. It was okay. The service was good, with our efficient and friendly waitress.

My mother used to read me a picture book called "The Little House" when I was a tot. It's about a house in the country that, over time, gets surrounded by a city. But when it was built, the owner declared that it could never be sold, even for gold. (You can hear someone else's mom read it here: http://youtu.be/YqlOJKt4-RA.)

This is my impression of White Palace. It's been there forever, and whoever owns it gets a big tip of my sombrero for not selling out. Moxie is worth an extra star. It's one of the few independent businesses in the area, after being surrounded by every chain store that you ever find in the suburbs (can you say Marshall's, DSW, Michael's, Best Buy, Home Depot, Bed Bath Beyond, Staples, Nordstrom Rack, whew, I've gotta stop... Though I'm giving you a pass, you over-priced gem of a goody-two-shoes health nerd, Whole Foods!). And it's a classic diner with consistently tasty, value-priced large portions, especially good for breakfast. (And the perfect antidote to a trip to Whole Foods, I might offer.)

I've been coming here since I moved into the neighborhood more than ten years ago. In fact, I used to phone ahead for comfort food takeout on the way from a god-awful job in the north suburbs. I NEEDED that open-faced roast beef sandwich on white bread with mashed potatoes and a lot of gravy as a mommy replacement to soothe my nerves. In fact, one night the counter guy had accidentally made a strawberry milkshake. Did I want it? Hell yeah! And that's exactly how it tasted. Hell yeah!

On a Saturday afternoon at around 2 or 3, I sat at the counter and the waitress offered me the Sun Times, the perfect read for the occasion. I had the skillet with corned beef--long, sandwich-style strips of corned beef, rather than the little cubes of beef and potatoes, which I also appreciate, but this had those crispy hash browns that I can't get enough of. Yum. A good afternoon was had by all.

I only hope that this place doesn't end up like The Little House in the picture book, whose owner's granddaughter finds it in disrepair in the middle of the city and moves it out to the country. I love this place, but not enough to move out of the city to partake in its haute cuisine.

My husband & I came here because my husband said it was on Diner, Drive ins & Dives and apparently we drive past it when we go to Chinatown. So we decided to stop here for breakfast.

We sat at the counter and it was a few minutes before anyone greeted us to take our order. It seemed like there was a lag time between greeting us, giving us water, etc but they were busy so I guess I will give them a pass.

I got the Ultimate Meat Skillet - holy cow there was a lot of food! It came with a choice of toast or pancakes and I picked pancakes....bad choice for me because my eyes are bigger than my stomach. There was probably enough food to feed at least 2 people. My husband got biscuit & gravy and he said that he got more biscuits than he expected - he scarfed them down like there was no tomorrow.

I would go back again...for sure!
This place is worth the trip. Beautiful decor! The service was outstanding! The french toast was fluffy and tasty!

I had the Chilaquiles and the taste was just good, they were serve with beans and avocado but I can tell they were from a can. 

My daughter had the 2x2x2x2 and she loved it. 

Maybe some music will help in quiet times.
A mid priced all night joint, what more can one ask for? I've only eaten breakfast here and it's plentiful and good. The service is usually quick and the place is bright and clean.

Sometimes an incredibly busy place with a long wait, and sometimes empty. Open 24 hours 7 days a week! Very wide variety of food with tons of options for sides, entrees and desserts. Some are better than others, so it's really hit or miss. Staff is usually accommodating, but can be overwhelmed by the business.
Really delightful meal. Ribeye steak, eggs, hash browns, and toast. Typical diner feel in terms of atmosphere and food served. I will come here again when I want a greasy feast.

From their website:

"Please Note:
*  For parties of 5 or more, a 18%  
service charge is added to the check
*  Booths for two or more people
*  No check splitting
*  Between 1 a.m. and 6 a.m.,
parties of 5 or more must prepay
*  We are not responsible for lost 
or exchanged articles
*  Minimum charge in booth - 
$3.00 per person
*  One refill only for 
coffee-only customer"

Sorry, White Palace, too many rules and regulations. Do you know you're in the service/hospitality industry? I.E. YOU ARE THERE TO SERVE CUSTOMERS. Not the other way around.

Seems like White Palace is concerned that they have too many customers, who are spending too much time in their restaurant. So, I'll do them a favor and eat somewhere else.

With all of the new construction around White Palace Grill, it looks even more divey than it actually is, and make no mistake my friends- this place is a dive. Don't let that new construction fool you though- there's good people and good breakfast.

Our waitress was right out of the "stereotypical diner waitress" handbook- she looked like she had a little attitude, she playfully messed with the regulars at the counter and she definitely called me "hon" more times than my grandmother. But she was super nice and moved around the restaurant like she knows it blind and backwards.

The walls are covered in faded news clippings and paintings that celebrate Chicago lore- everything between the Bulls, Harold Washington, Oprah and everything in between. Forget the Chicago History Museum- just get a booth at White Palace Grill to get your fill of Chicago's history.

My cousin and I had a pretty straightforward breakfast- pancakes, eggs, sausage and the like. We definitely got our food in less than fifteen minutes, even with a packed house and a line almost out the door. Everything tasted great and came at a reasonable price.

What I was most impressed with was the speed and efficiency with which the staff took care of their customers, all while remaining warm and friendly. I'm not sure what breakfast restaurants are in the new mega malls surrounding White Palace Grill, but don't count out the old guy on the block- not by a longshot.

Seems really overhyped. Perhaps I just didn't pick a winner.

Everyone knows what constitutes a typical DDD place. I've been to a few and always had some great tasting food, whether it was a dive or a nicer-looking joint.

I ordered the fish/grits/eggs (perch) for about $9. Also came with toast. This is a ton of food for the price, no complaint there! The grits were flavorless and disappointing and the eggs had an odd texture. Can't mess up toast, nor fried fish. All in all it was very disjointed - I felt like it was eggs, grits and toast with a side of fried perch. Maybe that's how it was supposed to be and maybe I'm an idiot.

All in all, I feel about WPG how I feel about Navy Pier -- I'd bring a friend here if they wanted but I don't think I'll be back.

Had breakfast here on a Saturday and the place was absolutely packed. Typical diner atmosphere with big greasy portions of food. I got 2 eggs sunny side up which were slightly undercooked, bacon which was a little chewy, and hashbrowns that were barely browned. It came with a choice of toast or English muffin, I chose the English muffin and it was charred on one side. The pancakes were fantastic though, very fluffy and plenty of syrup and butter. Service was quick but not the best. 

My favorite part if this place was the place itself. Amazing murals, art on the ceiling, old newspaper clipping and art on the walls with a typical retro diner feel.

Open 24/7 with breakfast served all day.

My wife and I love this place!! We eat breakfast here at least twice a month. It's our go to place for guaranteed good breakfast choices and strong coffee (none of that watered down stuff you get at other diners). It's always clean, and we love the staff.

On the outside, it looks exactly like what a diner is supposed to. It has a very old-fashion style. The food is good. I haven't gotten any breakfast food there yet. I have gotten their quesadilla and I thought it tasted great. What makes the place great is the people, though; they deserve a lot of the credit. They are always happy no matter what day or time you go there.

Came Here on a late evening and there was a group of African American teens looking like they just came from prom. The security guards was so rude to them and all they asked for was a menu. After at least a half hour of no service the teen were getting ready to leave just as the security guard said a raciest remark. I couldn't take it any more being an African American women so I left and vowed never to return. Worst experience ever. Raciest staff and security.... Booo

Loved this little place! We always look for great little diners for breakfast and this certainly fit what we had in mind. Coffee refills every time it went below 3/4 cup, great pancakes, eggs, sausage gravy and biscuits. The food was delicious and the service was spot on. We'll be back!

They serve a nice hearty portion of food , I got the bacon egg and onion omelet that came with hash browns and toast . I don't like the oil they use for their food , I'm not sure what it is but it leaves this gross taste in my mouth .. Also I couldn't finish it because there was a piece of hair in my food, I was grossed out ! 

I told the waitress and she looked at it against my hair ! I said I don't have grey hair so no that's not mine !
I get that things happen , I wasn't expecting her to cut the bill or anything just letting her know but to then be treated poorly after was unbelievable .

Went to the White Palace just for a quick bite to eat in the evening. Our meal was far from being served quickly. We were seated very quickly, but the waitress made error after error with our Order. I had the corned beef skillet which was tasty. My sister ordered chicken and waffles. It cost her extra three dollars but received chicken wing dings. My brother had the 2 x 2 x 2 and it was just OK. This is a place that people go to because it's open late. Otherwise not on my top list of places to dine.
Food is OK. Not great for the price. Service gets slow late at nights. Offers a wide variety of selection.
The place was crowded and the service was lacking. They do not split checks. The place was dirty but the food was fine for the price!

Great diner food! They're open 24 hours which is great, and I love the atmosphere in there its designed like an old school diner which is really cool! I got a Polish Sausage meal which was great and filling so u get your money worth and our waitress was super friendly. I will definitely come back!

This restaurant used to be one of my favorite places, the food was always great and reasonably priced. 

However, I will not be returning to this restaurant ever again! I went with 3 other people for breakfast, and had the worst experience of my life.

Our waitress didn't come to the table for 15 minutes after sitting down, our food (three out of four of the meals, anyway) came before she brought us silverware. My meal came out at least 10 minutes after the rest of the meals, and in two parts. I ordered chicken and waffles, a popular choice. The chicken was brought out 5 minutes after the waffles, and once I took the chicken off the plate to eat it with the waffle that had been getting cold waiting for the chicken, my boyfriend pointed out a hair on the empty plate. 

Throughout the the meal we found two other hairs in the food on different plates, and my chicken was grey and uncooked in the middle. 

We were made to walk around the restaurant to find a manager to ask for something to be done about all this. The head manager proceeded to accuse us of lying, as all of his cooks wear hairnets and hats (but nothing to catch the beard hair, like the ones we found). 

He wouldn't comp our meal, apologize, or make any effort to rectify the situation. I've worked in restaurants for years, and his reaction was simply ridiculous, he should lose his job, so they don't keep losing customers.

WOULD NOT RECOMMEND.
The most foul garbage I have ever put in my mouth. Honestly there was nothing edible and the prices are outrageous. My waitress was sweet but dear god that food is horrible.

Solid and filling moderately priced diner food! Biscuits and gravy are tasty. 

Nice place to eat alone or in a large groups. Avoid weekend nights

The service is very poor. The waitress was very rude and unprofessional.  It was five of us she got everyone's order wrong and then had an excuse for every mistake she made.
I will never ever go there again and if you're smart you won't either.

They're most always crowded and the wait can pile up at times, though it's always been worth it. Service is prompt and friendly, and the food has always been exactly as we ordered. Delicious too. The loss of two stars is for the chicken strips. They're far from something straight from a chicken, more of a McDonald's McNugget kind of chicken. They've been dissected, some stuff added, then squashed back together in the shape of a chicken tender. The taste is marginal at best, and the texture is fair. My suggestion: Avoid the chicken tenders at all cost and stick with just about anything else on the menu.

Husband wanted classic diner food for New Year's Day breakfast. This wasn't far from our hotel so I drove over.  Had to wait but that was expected.  Large menu, lots of choices. Husband loved his skirt steak and eggs but when did skirt steak go up to $16??  Hashbrowns good, omelette typical, good Greek toast.  Would go again for sure if in the neighborhood.

Glad I finally made it out here.I was told this place has really good bisquits and gravy.I loooooove bisquits and gravy.Im very picky when it comes to that.Not very many places makes me wanna come back to eat them again except ONE PLACE.After trying them here @White Palace now its TWO PLACES.lol.Actually,I like them better here.Service was really good and place is nice and clean.Nice to know they're open 24 hours.Im a nite owl so thats a MAJOR PLUS.I have my spots for different foods.This is my new SPOT for bisquits and gravy!!!!!!!
This is a great breakfast spot open 24 hours they serve lunch and dinner as well .. The food is very delicious here. The service was great. The phone comes pretty quickly.

I used to love coming here (1-2 times a month). However, I will NEVER be going again due to terrible service, hair on my food, and rude management.

It all started off with having to wait 15 minutes, after sitting down, for staff to come over to our table of four people to get our order. The place wasn't busy at all. 

Once our food got to the table, we didn't have any silverware. However, that's not even the worst part! There was hair on THREE DIFFERENT PLATES of food. Disgusting. The waiters took the plates back, and once they brought back the replacement plates there was ANOTHER PLATE WITH HAIR IN IT. It was at this point that we all decided we didn't want to continue eating here. 

Our waiter said that the manager had removed one of our orders, but we would have to talk to him about removing the rest of the orders. Okay, sure. All four of us go over to the manager and complain about how terrible our experience has been. He has the nerve to ask if we purposely put our hair on the plates, and says that it's impossible for hairs to have gotten on the food plates because all of the cooks wear hairnets. This manager was by far the most incompetent person I've ever spoken to in the food industry. We ended up having to pay for a meal that we didn't eat, and terrible service.

I WILL NEVER EVER BE GOING BACK HERE OR RECOMMENDING THIS PLACE TO FRIENDS AND FAMILY.   

I WISH I COULD GIVE THIS PLACE 0/5 STARS!

Great traditional diner. Visited on a Saturday morning around seven. We were in the mood for some greasy, yummy breakfast food and that is exactly what we got. Friendly, fast service. I had the tex mex skillet with potatoes, peppers, onions, chorizo, eggs. My hubby had the corned beef omelet. Delicious!

I have not been here since college! The food was okay.  We came here at 3 am and it was packed, we actually had to wait to get a table.  The service wasn't horrible and it wasn't even mediocre. The cashier was a jerk and our waitress looked like she was over worked.  This was the only place open at that hour-so it was just ok.

Stopped in here for breakfast, after being referred by a local Chi town man. I am a huge fan of breakfast, and the menu offers many choices for those who enjoy savory or sweet dishes. The flexibility of the menu and the staff made ordering the food simple and stress free. The staff and quickness of the meal made my entire experience that more enjoyable.

During my fun filled visit to Chicago we woke up one morning hung over and one of my friends wanted ________. This is a typical dinner with decent food portions and adequate pricing. Nothing stood out but my meal was good and I was full. I had ordered my steak well done but I should have ordered it medium because its hard to make a well done steak not dry. Aside from that my food was good. I suggest adding cheese and onion to your hash, makes a difference.

I'll be Back!

I loved this diner. They had me immediately as I walked down Canal Street and saw the architecture of the building itself. Then when I entered the door, the ambiance screamed vintage diner and the cooking was true Home-Style. 

The menu was so vast, I could not decide what to order. There were so many items that either are a favorite breakfast item of mine or one of my featured list here on Yelp. 
I was tempted by the Chicken and Waffles and The Biscuits and Gravy, but went with a simple Egg Breakfast. I choose two eggs, hash browns with bacon and wheat toast. 
My eggs were done right, over easy. So many diners over cook  "over easy" eggs, but not here. They also made my hash browns crispy and the bacon was crisp, thick cut and wide. My wheat toast was a thick slice making for a perfect foundation for an egg with bacon sandwich. 

My waitress was friendly, provided service with an early morning smile and made sure my coffee cup was never empty. For me that is a good diner server. 

I had the tiny booth next to door which was perfect for people watching in the diner and those out on the street where Canal intersects with Roosevelt. No need for my iPad, I was totally entertained. In fact one of the last diners to arrive took my breath away. Good people watching!!!

This place used to be my favorite restaurant. Some chef they are so nice to let people split their bills even the menu said no split bills. Well...I accept it if the menu says it and we didn't see, no split bill I get it. However the chef worked on 12/11/2015 Friday evening. I walked to the cashier asked him to check out for us, he point out no split bill which is fine, but he gave me the attitude and not glad to take my check at all and I wondered why? I don't come here to see shitty faces to ruin my dining experience okay? Really don't want to come here again.

This place was jam packed. I couldn't substitute the hash browns for bacon or anything really till I talked her into it. She gave me wet fries that tasted like the potato wasn't cooked. I didn't ask for scramble eggs and got scrambled eggs. The only good thing was the 8 pieces of bacon I got for 8$. This place was terrible.

Good, sweet diner gods. That is who have blessed this place.

Came in after a long day of walking around and shopping July 4th sales. My fiance and I were pretty tired (hungover really) still from July 4th and didn't want any silly salad business. We needed comfort food. White Palace was there to deliver.

We each thought we were going to go for breakfast for dinner - perhaps some waffles, an omelette, or a skillet of some kind. Then I saw it...I saw their chicken and waffles option. I had been debating if I truly wanted breakfast or if I should go for a savory dinner...

It's just like that girl from the Old El Paso Hard and Soft Tacos commercial. WHY NOT BOTH?

So yes, I went for it. And it was glorious. My fiance decided to have their Gypsy Baquet skillet and it was also incredibly tasty. 

Everything about our meals was classic, felt like home and made just right. No fancy fixins or additions - just good ol' diner food. 

I need to go back for a burger and milkshake though...that review to come!

Went here on Guy Fieri's recommendation. It's a diner, open 24 hrs, surrounded by "no-peddling" signs. 

We took a cab here and found it easily. The environment is like walking back in time. The staff were friendly, especially our waitress.

What I really wanted were the braised short ribs, but they didn't have it as a special the day we went, so I ended up with the breaded porkchops. It was a LOT of food but delicious. I couldn't finish the gluttonous masterpiece but was happy I got to experience it! (My crew got chicken and waffles, which were decent.)

I expected more, after the Food Network raving, but I'd recommend it to anyone who's hunting for food late night and everyone else shuts down.

Beyond awful, the food sucks. For this place to have been on Diners Drive Ins and Dives (Guy Fieri show) is a jaw dropper. Not only is the food pricey for the low quality of the food. They don't even allow you to split the bill. At the end of the day you're getting paid(white palace). I don't know why they (white palace) make it that difficult to pay. All legal money is currency! No matter how and where it comes from White Palace. If you're coming for the chicken and waffles.... don't. The meat is processed taste like McDonalds chicken. The waffles are bland. I recommend going to Churches Chicken ( as greasy as that sounds) They have some "bomb @$$ chicken &waffles cost way less (4 something) and you leave satisfied . Just a heads up.

I'm well aware my main man Guy pulled up to White Palace in his muscley red car and spikey head of hair and slammed back some late night diner creations. I'm also well aware that this is not a diamond in the rough, it's just a typical 24-hour joint with the proper decorations, expected menu items, and a mixture of really awesome and really sad, apathetic employees. Luckily, I've gotten a few of the former in my lottery of visits, and I can't say anything terrible has come out of the meals. I will say their inability to split checks past a certain hour is irritating when you're with 5 of your drunk, brain-dead friends and you're the only one who can see the numbers on the receipt, or remember math from high school. PS - go for the pies.

If you have a craving for chicken n' waffles this is the place to go! I always order the Mama White's because it also comes with hash browns. Adding cheese to the hash browns hits the funny bone. It is right by my school by UIC so this is a great  place to go for a cheap, comforting meal. The staff was attentive and kind to me as well.

I came here with my family and found a roach walking up the booth.
My son found hair weave in the bathroom and just dirty in general.
We will never go there again.
They must have hid the roaches when Guy was there.

Classic diner feel. 24/7 and HUGE menu. Could be a go-to place for breakfast/lunch/dinner if it was closer to my area. 

Not the fanciest place since it's been there for a while, but who cares because reasonable prices and our waitress was super thoughtful and nice. I got the chicken and waffles which was pretty decent except they were just chicken strips instead of traditional. They accidentally made me two eggs (yay), and the french toast was dense and filling, "melts in your mouth" as my friend said. But overall, the taste of the food was predictable. Typical diner, but would possibly come again to try other things on the menu since that was my first time.

24 hour french toast!!!!! 
da bomb chicken n waffles!!!!!! 


p.s. order the french toast with chocolate chips for extra flava

"I came here for the great personalities of the servers." -No one

I've been to quite a few dive diners in my time and this pretty much fits the standard of "we get too many attitudes on a daily basis and yours is no different" considering that this area is cleaning up. The menu is your average comfort food and they have a great selection. Food is on par, no better or worse.

If you are ever in need of good food, great service, and an all around pleasurable experience stop here anytime of day or night. Great place to warm up while waiting for a bus or train. Their service is like being transported back in time, where the waitresses and servers are completely professional, timely and always have a smile. Can't say enough about this place very happy with my experience I plan on making it a regular stop on my trips through chi city
if you are a tourist, don't waste your time here.  the food is seriously stuff you would buy from wal-mart, and make in your kitchen.
This is a nice and cozy place it has got that classic American diner feel. Burgers are amazing and even the waffels are pretty good. Its a place you can go frequently

First, for $32.75, we fed three adults almost to the breaking point...I basically didn't eat again the rest of the day after doing brunch at White Palace yesterday.  Second, solid all-around performer: cheap, huge portions, pancakes were very good, the skillet was chock-full of meat, service was fast, food was ordered and served in about 12 minutes.  Of course you wouldn't pick this over high-end brunch spots around town, but if you are getting over a long night of drinking and want to hang with the locals and drop $10 for a big meal, this is the spot!
The Food Options Are Varied, & The Food Is Always Great!!!! I Continue To Come Back For More!!

The gf and I came here on a Wednesday evening after driving around for 20 mins debating on what to have for dinner.  It's a diner, so we figured they would have something on the menu that would satisfy both of our taste buds.  We were seated immediately which was great, but the service failed to be on point after that.  While the menu was filled with tons of tasty options, I stuck with the beef sandwich platter with fries, while she ordered a cheeseburger with fries.  The food was just ok...  I was more dissatisfied with the service.  After dropping off our meal, our server disappeared, never to be heard from again.  Throughout the first 15 mins of our meal, we kept looking around for someone to refill our drinks and for some silverware (the gf likes to cut her burger in half lol).  One of the other servers finally noticed and notified us that our original server had an emergency and went home. Ok cool, I understand, but when there are more servers on the floor than people eating, I figure that we would get checked on more than once.  As I mentioned before, the food was just ok and I'm more than positive that an alcohol filled me would be loving this place at 3am, but a sober me at 6pm on a Wednesday feels otherwise.  I'll give this place another try and may bump up my review then.  Perhaps I should stick with an omelette.

When my friend and I decided to come here, I was really excited by all the rave I've heard about this place. I heard this place was beyond underrated and served pretty decent diner food. Maybe it was what we ordered, but I left this diner with a less than okay impression. 

We ordered grilled cheese and strawberry Belgium waffles with whip cream. The grilled cheese wasn't melted all the way and I was still able to see the unmelted slices. Also, the waffles looked good at first, but the whip cream melted way to fast. It just showed me the quality of the item they use for the food isn't the best.

I don't know if I will give this place another shot. I heard about it from a show on the food network, but since I live in Chicago, I'm sure i can find much better hidden gems around the city.

ThIs is great, the food and the strive can't be beat.  The prices are reasonable.  
This was wonderful.  You need to watch the parking to avoid a ticket.
Huge portions, great value, good tasty food. They have everything you could ever want. It's like Golden Corral met Waffle House

went to white palace grill this morning, this is our 5th time there and it was great again .we come from central Illinois to Chicago to visit our two collage kids and we love going to the white palace grill to eat , every time we go the food is great and the service is friendly. three of us had the 2x2x2x2 all three came out just the way we ordered. way to go white palace keep it up, great place to eat.

During the day it can be quite empty but this location is 24 hours which means if you go there after midnight expect a crowd of loud possibly drunk people. The menu is full and packed. This always tell me that they specialize in nothing particular. I had a spinach chicken wrap which was good. I am a fan of their chicken soup and they do give you large portions for the price. Overall the food is good, the atmosphere is diner dangerous at night with security and prices are fair.

If I were to give White Palace a rating it'd be NC-17. You definitely don't want to bring the kids, but if you're looking for some late night entertainment that's not a strip club then this is diner theater at it's finest. 

The food is what you'd expect from a 24hr place and so are the shenanigans.  Lots of drunk people and other crazy characters that stay up waaaaay past their bedtime. Extremely friendly and patient staff considering the shit they have to deal with on a daily basis. 

If you've got the late night munchies and want a story for the next morning do yourself a favor and bookmark this place.

Be prepared to wait for a table in a cluttered area by the washroom. The greeter isn't that friendly and she makes it seem like it's your fault their is no space. My wife ordered the fried tilapia with fries and I ordered the chicken and waffles. My wife liked the food, but I wasn't a big fan. The waitress was nice and she checked up on us. This place is definitely   overrated. We will not be going back.

Yummmmm!!!! I had spaghetti and sausage. It was delicious. The customer service is great. Even being as busy as they were they still were able to make you fell like you matter. ( that's important to me )

Terrible terrible terrible. I went here with my boyfriend because we were starving and both wanted nice, simple comfort food. We both ordered breakfast food (because I'd heard how good it was here) and when my plate arrived (strawberry french toast) it had a long hair laid across the top. We told the waitress, who apologized and took the plate, only to bring us a "fresh meal" from the back that also had hair in it! What was unbelievable to me was the fact that several people saw this plate before it got to my table and not one saw the hairs when they were the FIRST things I saw both times!! After that she then brought a 3rd plate but at that point I'd lost my appetite. Haven't been back since.

The White Palace Grill is an institution.  I've been coming for years. I try to stop in the wee hours of the morning after leaving one of the blues clubs around town.  It's worth the "L" ride, walk, or drive.

This is almost the perfect late night hangout.  Some of the best times are had in White Palace after midnight.  The food is worthy.  In the earlier hours it's just want you're looking for and need.  I always get breakfast no matter what time of day it is.  So if it's 12 noon or 12 midnight, it's breakfast.

Some of my favorite breakfast items; 
Biscuits and Gravy with sausage, unreal!!  
The Meat Lover's Omelet is two meals in one! It's huge, stuffed with sausage, ham, and bacon.  Merely awesome!  
The Egg Breakfast with Italian sausage is killer!

But don't be fooled, the live action in this place is real, day or night, which for me, makes it even more interesting and fun.  Yes, it's NC-17 at times!

OMG. They sent me a plate of salt. I went here tonight with my brother and his girlfriend thinking that this place would be good because I saw it on TV. Big mistake. I ordered the baked meat loaf and they sent me a salty turd and dirt flavored mashed potatoes. I wouldn't give this mess to my dog. BEWARE OF THE SALT!!!!!!! Oh, but on a positive note the water and the waitress was good!! That's where the one star comes in.

Old diner feel which you can't find in a lot of places.  The wait staff and manager on the floor were friendly and talkative.  Its a small place but the food comes up quick!

Parking sucks... thats all.

Great place to come in after a long night of partying.. I usually go to IHOP but you can defiantly taste the difference.. 4 stars for the food 2 stars for the interior 4 stars for the hospitality and service . They are very nice here love it!

Super friendly staff and owner. Well maintained and clean. Food is heavily processed, featuring battered meats, waffles, sandwiches, etc. Great place, I suppose, if you want "comfort" food. Not a place to go if you like fresh, whole food.
Great food, the biscuits and gravy is amazing. I live an hour away and it's completely worth the drive.

Pros:
+Good Location
+Good Portions
+ On Diners Drive-In's & Dive's 

Cons:
-Shady Practices
-Prepayment 
-No Splitting the Bill
-No Warning of Refill Charges
-Cleanliness 

Our waitress approaches our table and asks us if we're ready to order, we hadn't noticed the menus had been tucked behind the condiments so we needed a minute and ordered soft drinks. After she gets back to the table with tiny 10 oz tumblers filled to the brim with ice, she takes our order. An eternity later, watching her eat her soup to completion, she finally gets up to get our food & another set of refills. 

We get the pleasure of seeing her again 20 minutes later to ask for the things that had been missing from our order & a third round of refills. Finally after a whopping 40 minutes of watching our waitress slather toast with butter using her finger, yes HER FINGER, and handing it to the cooks as we ate, she finally came to us to drop of the bill and walk away without a word. 

I was feeling another refill, naturally, so upon asking she informs me that she had already charged me for a refill 3 times already and this would be my 4th. My eating buddy declined their refill on lemonade as well. Finally she returns to our table with a bill close to $46 for two $8.99 entrees and soft drinks that surmounted to $46 some how. When approaching the counter to pay, the sullen man at the cash register informed me that they cannot split the bill or charge two cards so I swallowed the $46 and tip. 

Long story short I don't think I'll be back here again unless they get rid of their questionable business practices, their should be a sign informing guests about no free refills , just like the massive sign that says parties over 5 must prepay after 1am, as well as a sign stating their inability split a bill at that high of a price point.

Went here after shoppingin the area since I've heard great things about it. The service was really good, but the food isn't all that. I ordered the chicken fajita skillet and the chicken seemed dry, the eggs that I ordered sunny side up were not fully cooked on top of my skillet and the whole dish pretty much didn't have much flavor. I probably won't eat here again unless I'm drunk or something and need late night food.

Excellent food
Excellent service
Excellent ambiance

Did I mention excellent food and service???

This will be a long one but I've never experienced such rude service. 

Extremely disappointed with this place. I ordered a pizza on a Friday night and knew the wait would be long but I never expected a 1 hr 45 min wait for a small stuffed. The girl on the phone seemed to not know what she was doing, told me my card was declined, and then said never mind it went through. 

When the pizza finally arrived I gave the delivery driver a really nice tip EVEN though it had taken so long. I kept hearing my phone going off in the next room and when I finally answered it was the manager saying quite rudely and loudly that if I didn't pay for the pizza NOW she was going to call the cops. That the driver had been knocking and no one had paid! I tried explaining to her that the girl on the phone said it had gone through just fine but was cut off.

One we never heard knocking at the door. Two there was no need for her to act up the way she did when it was a simple misunderstanding. And then she hung up as soon as I gave her my card information. I was pissed off. Never have I ever been spoken to like that by a "manager". AND the pizza wasn't even good. Barely any sauce. I'm NEVER ordering from this giordanos again.

Food was a 4 but what happened when we paid is another story that left a very bad taste in my mouth.
Got deep dish pizza, good ingredient, great taste, made to order. Way less greasy than I anticipated, which is great.
However, upon paying, waitress took our credit cards and then came back to ask for ID stating that her manager would need to see the ID's. Didn't think twice and handed the waitress our ID's. She took them to her manager. 
This is when I thought it was highly strange and irregular that they had to take our ID's out of our sight. So I went back to the cash register where the apparently appointed  manager was running credit cards, I told her I thought it was entirely inappropriate to have our ID's taken to her and I needed my ID right there.  
This is highly inappropriate and now I wonder if they are running a scheme. There is absolutely no need for this, the waitress can ID customers without taking their cards where God knows what they can do with them (scanning machine, copies, etc)

Very disappointing end to what could have been an ok meal. Now, I am wondering if I will be the victim of credit fraud. 
I am alerting my credit cards and mentioning them as a potential source of future problems. 
Oh, and the "manager" acted surprise when i told her I need my ID CARD back. Unbelievable bad commercial manners, what a witch! Will not return in the future.

The best pizza pie in Chicago! I came here for the first time and will most certainly be back. Giordano's was recommended to me from a friend and he was not wrong! We sat at the bar and Debbie took care of us. She was friendly and very helpful. 
    I ordered one of the pies, it takes 45 minutes once you order it, but it's well worth the wait. That's what a pitcher of beer is for anyway, right? My friend ordered a thin crust and loved his as well.
Always my go to place when in Chicago over night, nut much you can say except "extreme stuffed deep dish pizza" that will definitely satisfy any taste!

The rating for our visit for the food is three stars, maybe three and a half. The final rating overall rating including the terrible service is two stars. Our explaination follows:

I will not bore the reading with tales of how or why we ended up eating dinner here on Wednesday July 27 about 5pm.  It does not matter and we absolutely find those stories utterly so self-absorbed that anything the reviewer types afterward becomes suspect. 

Our server was a chunky male with black hair and he had a short name, but just cannot recall.  Part of our order for the appetizers was the parmesan fries.  He brought out a small plate of regular fries.  When I asked about the parm fries he said "I heard you just say fries. I will take these back to see if they can do something." About two minutes later he brought the exact same plate of fries, now with some parm sprinkled on them.  I still had to ask for the ranch sauce.

Time and time again throughout the meal he would pass by to refill other tables water or beverages, but never stopped at ours.  Several times he had a full water pitcher as he raced past with no eye contact at all. 

After the meal we sat for almost 15 minutes for him to bring a check.  Another 10 to get the credit card and receipt back.

I watched as other servers gleefully assisted their customers.  Not us.

We had a view of the entrance toward the kitchen area.  Bussers stood there often. One frequently biting his nails and spitting what he chewed off out onto the floor.

The calamari was fantastic.  Chicken chopped salad divine blew my mind with the texture and flavors.  Do not pass it up and the portion was yuuuge.  Now the pizza.....sigh...well....bland. Almost no sauce and just was bland. There is a shaker of some seasoning at each table, please use it because the kitchen does not. 

So, that sums up the visit. Even though the hotel we stay at is just down the street, on the next visit we will certainly find another pizza joint. This one is just too pricey to give it a second shot and it to fail. Be well, my friends.

Before I start my review, I want to there to be complete disclosure that I am a New Yorker and will always have a bias towards the New York style pizza. 

So visiting Chicago for the first time, being a total tourist. How could I not have the Chicago deep dish pizza.

After, much debating my wife and I finally decided to go to Giordano's along with a few friends. We decided to order the bruchetta since the wait time for a deep dish pizza is 45mins-1 hour. For the pizza, we decided to play it safe by ordering classic pepperoni. 

The bruchetta did not disappoint. The tomatoes were as fresh as they could be and the bread nice and crispy. It had a nice flavor. 

A little while after getting done with the bruchetta, there it was, the moment of truth, our deep dish pizza finally arrived. The cheese was nice and gooey, the filling was nice and fresh, and the crust was perfectly crispy. All in all a solid pizza. We ordered a medium, which was good for 4 people. 

Now was this the greatest pizza, perhaps not, maybe because I'm too used to having my pizza New York style on the go with the cheese dripping and the paper plate being greasy. Having said that, the pizza was still pretty solid and would recommend it to someone. The only thing which was disappointing was the service. The servers looked confused and were not very accessible.

Located next to the airport I went there with lower expectations but was surprised of the quality of ingredients and pizza served. The deep dish pizza was a true Chicago style pizza, the crust very well done and ingredients overall fresh. 
Very well recommended when you are staying in the area or on a short business visit.

Great pizza! Got the deep dish and it was amazing. Would have 5 stars but sat at the bar for dinner and service could have been better. Not bad, bartender was personable but seemed a bit distracted even though it wasn't that busy. Definitely would come back if I get back here.

We were in town for a family gathering and this location was a few minutes from our hotel.  We were here on a Friday night, and it was busy but we were seated immediately.  We ordered the Meat and more meat stuffed deep dish pizza.  It takes about 40 minutes to get to the table.  The pizza was good, but I didn't think it was as great as we we had heard.  The service was good in the beginning, but towards the end of our meal the waitress became very busy and we waited about 15 minutes before she came over to ask if we needed the check.  Overall an average experience.

Let's start by saying that the deep dish pizza is good. Two of us had the small veggie which is 6 slices and ended up saving one slice each for breakfast the next day (take note...equally as good cold as it was warm the night before). There are naturally a lot of pizza options, and we also split a side Greek salad as an appetizer. Speaking of appetizers, I had joined the Giordano's e-club and had a coupon for a free bruschetta or garlic bread. Unfortunately, I was informed that they cannot be shown on a mobile device, they must be printed, which is fine, but what bothers me is that it is not written anywhere so how would we have known? Anyway, our pizza took over an hour to come out which I should add is completely normal and should be expected (even when we just ordered a small pizza and the restaurant was relatively empty at the time). Our waitress got the job done, though I wouldn't go out of my way to praise her friendliness by any means. For the pizza, salad, and we each got a pint of beer (not a huge beer list), the tab came to about $50.
Bomb bomb bomb!!! This pizza is life. I love cheese and its full of it no matter what kind you get. Taste is amazing. I don't like red sauce and I ate theirs without asking for lite sauce.

Food was basic. The meat on meat thin pizza had great big piece of yummy meat on it. Crust was not good. The extra thin olive and mushroom pizza was good. Small size pizza is a great size for 2-3 eaters. Bloody Mary had a weird citrus taste to it. Waitress was hard to keep around.

Pretty mediocre.  Pizza took an hour.  Waitress was horrible, had to ask for silverware 3 times.   There were two floaters in our lemonade and she seemed upset when we had to ask for a replacement for the third time.  Couldn't get the fountain lemonade right so they finally bought a bottle lemonade

Overall just mediocre.  Very unimpressed.  Will not be going back.  There are plenty of better options.

great pizza, deep dish style, Chicago status. on our way to a competitor that closed early on a Sunday so we stopped here instead. place the order while you wait, saving time and hunger pains. beer on tap was decent too, not just Miller lite.

My family has enjoyed and loved Giordanos Pizza for over 20 years and while the pizza is still as good as it always has been, the service is not. I live a few blocks from the 63rd and Cicero location and it's the location I normally order from. The last few times I've ordered for delivery it has taken close to 2 hours for the pizza to arrive  which is not a big deal since they tell you up front that it's a long wait, the problem is that by the time the driver makes other deliveries and gets to me my pizza is already cold. 

Second issue is that they stopped accepting coupons as of June 1st so the extra coupons I had (with no expiration date) are no longer valid and they wouldn't even honor my $5 coupon as a courtesy given that I didn't know they had stopped accepting coupons.

The gentleman who took my order suggested I sign up for email alerts or whatever in order to get coupons via email. Soooo you still issue coupons but you can't honor mine? Mmm, okay so I register online and the coupon code never arrived, how annoying.

I will continue to buy from them because I love their pizza, I just wish their service was a little bit better so I can happily recommend it to other people, for now all I can say, if you don't mind paying a lot of money and waiting up to 2 hours for lukewarm pizza then this is your place!

Greet service and great food .  Sharon was our server and so personable.  The experience from the time we walked in to sitting down was phenomenal.  I recommend this place to everyone staying at the nearby hotels.  I'm looking forward to eating there again and will recommend this to all my colleagues.
Always a great experience and service when I come here. Great food and drinks across the board, so I won't go on and on lol My server Valerie K. was very nice and courteous.

Finally had the opportunity to try a real deep dish pizza while visiting from California. I really like it a lot and wish we had them back home. As far as the restaurant, it was very clean and had plenty of parking. Our hostess and waitress were both really friendly. We ordered the garlic parmesan fries and the fried calamari for our appetizers and had a Chicago style deep dish pizza. I would definitely recommend this place based on the outstanding service and great food.

Been a while since coming to Chicago, so ive gotten used to, mostly NY style pies.  Having this has now changed my mind about having to have NY style pies.  So, the debate goes on.  But Giordanos pizza was very good.

Hmm I like pizza . This was my first deep dish . But it just more  bread and cheese in general. Not sure it's worth $28 . It's preference I guess. I rather stick with thin crust. It's just bread your paying for . If this is the Chicago staple it's def not for me . Sorry Chicago peeps . I tried :/ (one slice filled me up since it's all thick bread) something to consider when ordering :)
Excellent deep dish pizza. Good service. Place was very busy but staff was attentive and took good care of us.

Had to stop for my Chicago Italian "fix" again!  Giardanos at Midway.  The service really improved since my last visit!  Miranda suggested the bruschetta and it was fabulous.  Had chicken parm and a salad.  Hint for Caesar Salad.  It's much better if you let them toss it rather than take dressing on the side.  Big improvement over my last visit.  Hats off!

Friday night. Seated on entry. Decent cocktails, yummy chopped salad to split between two, and a spinach stuffed pizza. Service was good. Giordano's reliably dishes up the best stuffed pizza in a casual setting. I've been coming here (as well as other locations) for a long time, with no plans to stop. It' a Chicago classic. : )

Wow. I'd always dreamed about what true deep dish should taste like and upon a business trip getting stuck in Chicago, I was finally able to see for myself. The deep dish here was so delicious. I tried the stuffed pizza with pepperoni and everything about it was heavenly. The crust on this pizza was flaky and light, which is different than any deep dish variety you can get out east which is normally dense. The inside of the pizza oozed unendingly with cheesy goodness. I can normally eat quite a few slices of pizza, but here I struggled through two. I won't even think about the potential calories so I'm glad I live far far away. Try this pizza if you're in the area and you won't be disappointed.
I am from California  and this place rocks. Good customer service exelente food  I strongly recommend this place   I will be back
Amazing deep dish! This is a great place to hit right before you go to the airport, and the pizza will survive a 5 hour flight!

Best pizza I've ever came across in my life. I called in my pizza and they told me how much it was and 45 minutes later I sent to pick it up.  They had it hot and ready for me and I swear to God that a medium pizza weighs about 5 pounds.  2 slices was more than enough for me. Big clean restaurant. I will be coming back before I go back to Texas

First time having a truly Chicago deep dish pizza.  I was never really a fan until my friend took me here.  It was really good.  The first time I had a deep dish pizza was one a single serving pie.  I guess, like a burger, the ratio of size to toppings to dough makes a huge difference.  We ordered a half and half which is great because you order 2 different types for share.  Servie is great.  Plenty of parking.  I was forewarned the pies are made fresh so it takes a while for the order to arrive.  If your in rush, it might be an issue.  If you have plenty of time like we did, it was worth the 40 minute odd wait.  A definite must do when in the Windy City.

The food is always on point. But the waiter is racist! To the racist lady at the bar who changed the Hawks game while I was clearly watching it just because the white kid who just came in wanted to see the Oklahoma game screw you!! That was rude and uncalled for! Horrible! Just
Horrible!! I made a point and stated "hey! I was watching that!!"" And she ignored me and kept walking. It didn't matter to her that I was there first and watching a Chicago team in Chicago play. She changed it because I wasn't white. Shame on you giordanos shame on you!! Brown people love hockey too!!

*Giordano's Midway  best place for Pizza and excellent quality good food, great customer service, love delightful chicken wings (buffalo) spicy... mmm thin crust crispy Hawaiian Pizza and Tiramisu for dessert, my order actually for pick up they say 35 minutes, live at 5 minutes from here $38.00 dlls.

*I just got red wine; perfect for invite some friends on this beautiful evening. 

*Great experience when you're there, expect waiting time or make reservations in advance.  
  
*Servers at Giordano's: Thank You

Chicago-Style Pizza in the shadow of Midway Airport.

A work colleague and I had finished a business trip to Michigan City, Indiana and we drove back to Chicago for our respective flights home the next day. Actually, I was going to Des Moines for the weekend to visit my Parents, and Jeff was heading back to Northern California. After checking in at the nearby Hampton Inn, we separately asked for restaurant recommendations and pretty much got the same response (word for word) from 2 different front desk staff. Oh well, beggars can't be choosers, especially since we didn't want to get in the car, 

Giordano's is one of the Chicago Deep Dish Pizza chains that some people swear by. And so much so that cross-country delivery is available. We ordered cheese and spinach, with a starter salad, and a few glasses of Goose Island beer. It was all delicious and with enough left over for another meal over the weekend. Service was most hospitable for these weary travelers, even though I wish I were a little closer to Chicago proper for this dining experience.
Horrible. Ordered delivery, pizza was cold - like out of the refrigerator cold in the middle, and my chopped salad was not chopped! It was super disappointing - can we give zero stars??

Clean, noisy family joint with excellent service, convenient location (inadequate parking - everybody's caught on to this place). Comfy seating, quickly seated. Great Chicago style (deep dish) pizza, great salads!
I'm a New Yorker so the deep dish was not for me. To much cheese and when it got cold it didn't seem edible.  I should have ordered thin crust.

Went today. Was great. Got a good table. Mozzarella sticks were amazing. Ordered a small deep dish. Didn't take that long to come out. Service was good. Pizza was out of this world good Everything was great. Went to the bath room. And it was COMPLETELY a mess. There was a crap in every bowl there was a sign not to flush toiletries, to use  the garbage ..but there wasn't one in each stall. So there was pads every where. The bathroom was super dark. Someone could a been in the corner and i wouldn't have even seen them. When I got in there I didn't even have to use the bathroom anymore 
Everything else was amazing. Sad that I had to deduct a star cos of how well they kept the bathroom. 
Will be back (the restaurant... not the bathroom)

It was our first time in Chicago this past month for a week long vacation and we decided to try this place first since it was the closest to our hotel.

Let me tell you...it's simply jaw-dropping and mouth-watering delicious! This pizza changed my view of "deep dish pizza" and I now completely understand why they call it a "pie"! Patch P. and I ordered a 2 person pizza that came with 6 slices and were barely able to finish 2 slices each in one sitting with some beer! We were greeted by the friendly owner who told us his personal favorite toppings are the all-beef meatballs and the chicken sausage.  We went ahead and ordered half all-beef meatballs with mushrooms and then chicken sausage with mushrooms on the other side. The winning protein topping was the all-beef meatballs! We had to get a personalized 6" pizza combo each before we left Chicago.  Each combo came with a bottle of soda and choice of a side salad or garlic fries for $8.95.  We also ordered fried calamari to-go. Everything was delicious from start to finish! We noticed they do nationwide shipping on their website and will definitely have to try that in the future.

Tip: Each pizza takes about 40-45 minutes to make, call ahead and order to go, or if you're dining in, order some appetizers to hold you over! Also, don't forget to join their mailing list as they offer a complimentary appetizer of bruschetta to try!

First time here and pizza was great along with our server who was quick and very happy to serve us
Thank you!!!

Pizza was good. Not as good as I've had in the past though. Service however was FANTASTIC! Our server was great! Everyone was friendly and we had a good meal. The chocolate cake was good but not as good as the last time we were here. Overall, our food was just ok. But I wanted to say Thank You to the staff for making our meal that much better

I hadn't realized that Giordano's was a chain, until I ventured downtown and saw one on every other block. But... with that said, I think the deep dish was pretty freaking phenomenal. I have Celiac Disease, so I have to eat Gluten Free items so I wasn't able to get the deep dish for myself. However, I had a couple bites of my boyfriends deep dish pie and was in love. Trust me, the stomach pains were worth every bite.

The gluten free pizza is pretty good as well. I haven't really found a place where I rave over the pizza but I think Giordano's offers a good alternative for pizza, since I can't eat it that often anymore. The toppings are ALWAYS so fresh, with the mozzarella cheese being so deliciously gooey and yummy. I would just recommend, that if you are ordering the GF Pizza to order it "crispy" because the center of the pizza always comes out with half cooked raw dough that I have to eat around.

Came here on my way to my hotel from the airport hoping to get some deep dish pizza. Unfortunately this place isn't very solo diner friendly if you want pizza and are traveling. They do not do pizza by the slice or offer pizzas small enough for one person. I stayed in a hotel with a tiny mini fridge so I couldn't really take leftovers with me. I was about to leave but in an effort to try and accommodate me the waiter offered the Beefzza as an option. I decided to try it and it tasted alright but it wasn't the deep dish pizza I was looking for. Maybe if it had had tomato or Alfredo sauce in it it would have been enough but instead it had a dipping sauce (which tasted good but again, was in the mood for deep dish pizza). Probably won't eat here again unless I'm with other people and can split something. I gave it three stars because the staff was friendly and attempted to accommodate me.

This is one of the 3 giordanos  locations I order from. It's the Closest one to my house. But sadly the pizza here is garbage. It's never consistent. I have no complaints about the other locations I go to by my job or my friends house. Maybe it's jus the cook or something. But I will avoid this location.

Raw crust and no replacement.  Just the worst.  

The. Worst.

Wonderful way to experience Chicago-style stuffed pizza! The pizza is delicious: even the leftover slices tasted good the next day after microwaving. Not usually a fan of pizza crusts, but this crust was flaky and tasty.

The atmosphere is informal and they do get busy. Our waitress advised us up front that deep dish pizza would take approximately 45 minutes to prepare, so we ordered an appetizer sampler and drinks while we waited. Wait staff is stretched thin during busy periods, but we managed to get our waitress's attention when we needed her.

This place was absolutely the best deep dish pizza I think I've ever had! They treated us like family they addressed my child and made him feel very welcomed and sang happy birthday to us. I came all the way from Denver Colorado for vacation and this was simply the best way to start a vacation in Chicago.

Back in Chicago after a few year (from Cinti).  Got the special - was disappointed in how little sausage was on this pizza - expecting a layer of sausage per normal.  Came across as a vegetarian pizza.  All else was fine if a bit suburban.

Picture lasagna in a pizza. Gooey delicious mozzarella cheese inside a pie with a buttery flakey crust. The sauce is divine with the perfect amount of sweetness to it. One slice and I was full and between the two of us (my husband and I) we took half of the smallest pie size home. We decided to get meatballs in it which we regretted because they didn't do much for the pizza but wow we thought this pizza was delicious. We also did get a small size of the Harvest Salad to start which was a perfect size for both of us to snack on during the 45 minute wait for the pizza. The wait is typical because they need every minute to make this pizza perfect. I liked the feel of this place. It reminded me of a Friday's meets Italian restaurant so it was casual but nice enough to enjoy a glass of wine with our food. We are not local to the area so we won't be able to return but I'd say this would be the type of place I wouldn't go to often because it is super filling. More of a special treat. Their menu is huge though so there are many other options other than their famous stuffed pizza.

Omg I just spent a week in Chicago and went to the original Pizzeria Uno for deep-dish pizza. I paid for parking, waited for awhile for a table and then pizza took an hour to cook. I wish I knew about Giordano's then! A friend mentioned it so I ordered it delivered when stuck in a hotel outside Midway when my flight was cancelled. 
It's effing amazing and 20 times better than overrated Pizzeria Uno or Due. The crust is flaky where PU's is brittle. The sauce is perfect- not too sweet. I wish there was one in DC!!

First place we went as soon as we landed at Midway. It is literally at the end of the runway.  Our first experience with Deep Dish Pizza.  It takes 45 minutes from the time you order it and IT IS WORTH IT!    It is amazing. The service was excellent.  The atmosphere was perfect for a pizza joint.   We had a variety of appetizers while waiting for our pizzas.  All excellent.  Our drinks were constantly refilled.  Great experience.  Thanks for making our first stop in Chicago a good one!!

This place use to be my favorite now it's my least favorite. This restaurant does not even deserve a star I'll give it a negative review the manager was playing with the hosts lady and just putting a bad example. I am really disappointed and also the service sucks very slow waited almost 40 minutes for the drinks and food. I do not recommend this restaurant the employees are super rude.
always one of the best pizzas in the area.  Would be great if they delivered to more places.
Gotta try the Chicago Deep Dish Stuffed Pizza. Oh-Man it's Good!! And have a Greek Salad. WOW! Says it all

I really love their stuff pizza..  We celebrated my son's 22nd Birthday we brought his cake here.  We ordered  soup and fried cheese sticks and mushrooms  delicious.  The pizza was very good executed which means it was not raw nor was it over done.  I do not burned crust.  The sauce was just perfect.  The drinks were delicious.  I like coming here because is not too far from my mom's house.  The servers was very nice he helped us with the plates for the birthday cake.  The service was prompt and very nice
In my out of Towner opinion this place was great.... Not just the food but the overall dining experience.
Excellent pie, clean good looking place.
Great place for awesome pizza! It took awhile for the pizza to cook (we waited an hour) and the service wasn't the best, but the food was delicious! The deep dish is definitely recommended! Must try!

Busy for the 1st time but I can't wait to come back. Awesome pizza, I tried The Chicago Style", the ingredients were fresh, the pepper and onions were crispy. The pepperoni has a great flavor, and the mushrooms were delicious. Again an awesome pizza.
My family was full and pleased. Great place and excellent service.

This place is the real deal Holyfield. Their stuff pizza weighs about 4 pounds and is chock full of good stuff. Great taste and a very friendly atmosphere. I can only imagine that one of the pizzas is about 4000 cal plus. I had to try this place because there was a lot of hype and it lived up.

I love this place, the food is amazing and it's such a treat to eat here. 

The reason I did give a three star to this fabulous establishment is because we had the enjoyment of sitting next to two young people. 

Not only were they loud and rude but the girlfriend was swearing extremely loud. There were kids everywhere, parents and older guest kept staring and the staff didn't seem to care but their waitress seemed annoyed. This shouldn't reflect on how great the service and food are but I hope the staff becomes more aware of people like this in a well respected restaurant.


Again this is not a reflection on the food or service, that was fantastic just the people in it need to be more respectful to other guests.

I wasn't a deep dish pizza fan growing up and way into my adult years moreover I love, adore and would drive out of my way for a Home run Inn pizza (thin crust) . But recently l visited this restaurant on Cicero and l have to say l really liked it. Now, I've had deep dish before, many times, its just not my favorite ,however ,l started my meal with fried squid and cheese sticks and then the main course a medium deep dish. I was impressed at the freshness of the ingredients, the favor and the crust. Crust and tomato sauce are key for me. I found a new respect and admiration for this place and will be back. 
m

The salad I started with was very fresh & well prepared. My server was attentive & very friendly while I waited for my brother to join me. There are not many good options near the airport I am thankful to Yelp for leading me here. The pizza was good very filling. I could only eat one slice after the salad. I also had some cocktail with cucumber vodka that was very refreshing.

My review is 100% based on the Stuffed spinach pizza.   Giordano's sets the standard for Chicago Stuff pizza.  When you try other places you will always compare them to Giordano's.

This is a meal that is worth taking your time, and enjoying.  But if you are in a hurry phone ahead and they will have the pizza ready when you get there.

I've never had a bad stuffed pizza from them, no matter which one I go to.... 

Also try this one at night, you have great views of the airplanes landing.
First place we go to when landing in Midway.  Great way to experience Chicago-style pizza. Definitely worth the wait!

When you visit Chicago for the 1st time you have to try deep dish pizza right?!  The restaurant was within walking distance from our hotel, which was a nice break from the plane & cab ride. Our server Miguel was very friendly and attentive, making sure he checked in on us throughout the meal making suggestions about toppings and sizes.  The pizza was good, not great, and we could only eat one piece each, which goes to show how heavy it is.  Glad I experienced it, but will not be ordering one during my next visit to Chicago.

Hey Yelp, Can you please consider adding 10 stars as a rating option? I don't feel that 5 stars is enough when speaking of the amazing Giordano's Pizzeria.  My friend was going to take me out for some Chicago deep dish pizza on my last night in the city.  We were going to the Navy Pier afterwards so we were gonna head out to the location closest to there.  We decided to call ahead of time and were told the wait time on Saturday nights can be up to 2 hours during dinner time.  We were too hungry for that, so we stopped at this location near the Midway Airport.  When I say near the airport, that's an understatement.  You can actually see the planes landing through the window looking to be only about a couple hundred feet above you.  Kinda scary/cool.  Anyway, back to the incredible food...
