It's a fun place. The location is great, because after dinner you can grab a drink. Be mindful that it's usually crowded on weekends, but we've always managed to hunt down a seat somewhere. They have couches, tables, bar stools, and high tops. 

It's an entertaining place! The vibe is sort of new-age, vintage-hipsterish, as well as general. So, it's a good mix of folks. They have a pool table, Uno cards, and tableside campfires. LOL You can make your own s'mores with a mini-camp fire grill!

The beer selection is great and so are the cocktails! Our waitress, who was great, even brought us a free sample of this spicy, yet savory, tecquilla shooter. It was really kickin'. 

We've been here a few times and plan to return.

Sliders, music, craft cocktails, and a pool table. ..all in a swing club. What more can you ask for? This place gets crowded quickly as customers seat themselves. Service isn't always the friendliest or attentive, but usually good enough. I like the wide variety of options and the top notch people watching. Cool spot for a date or just hanging out with friends.

COST: 
$12 (Some cocktail off their regular menu)
$2.50 to $3.50 (sliders)

First of, the food was incredible. I tried the blue cheese and the kimchi sliders and they were both amazing. I've never had kimchi before, but their slider was amazing!

The place has nice decor, and it's definitely one of the classier bars in Chicago.

I rated this place 3 stars on the sole fact that my bartender told me the price of the cocktails is by the hour you order it. I ordered it at 6 so I thought I'd pay that much and not the full $12 price.

Well, I checked their wall and if you order Monday to Tuesday, happy hour prices are 5-7, Wednesday and Thursday it goes 7-9... or something like that. MAKE SURE YOU CHECK THE WALL (I went on a Thursday)!

The drink was good for $6, but definitely NOT worth the $12. I wouldn't really mind paying that much either really, but at least know your menu. That's the least thing you could do as a server.

Tiny yet hearty food, amazing cocktails, and a great liquor selection...what else do you need?!  Henrys offers a fabulous experience, perfect for date night, groups, and parties.

The slider menu is AWESOME.  Fun, creative combinations that include gyro meat, chicken, and beef.  Try the Kentucky Hot Brown and the Merkts Cheddar--yum!  The best part?  Each slider is between $2.50-$4 so you can try an eclectic variety at an adorable cost.   

The cocktail list reminds me of something you might find in a speakeasy and the options are delicious!  The Swingin Doors is my favorite.

Henrys staff is attentive, friendly, and efficient, which I'm a huge fan of.  Don't be afraid to ask a million questions about items--they have the patience of saints!

Can't wait for my next visit to Henrys--I know I'm in for a great time!
Got my a** whopped in pool here!!! I had a great time though. Staff was nice. Music was great . They where playing 90s music

A group of 6 of us walked into this bar Saturday evening after a horrendous experience at London House and I'm so glad we did. We found a table right away and our waitress was polite and attentive.  The music was so good.  They play a little bit everything.  Some 90's and some current upbeat jams.  There is a little dance floor and a cute photo booth which cost $5.  Such a cute a idea!  Drinks are reasonably priced.  I only wish we had tried the food as it looked delicious.  If I'm in the area again I will definitely be back.

Been to this great bar several times. So many reasons to love this place: the decor, the crumpled 1980s Playboy magazines just sitting about, the ram testicles on the menu, the $100 bottle service of only Jack Daniels, the classic rock music.

Unfortunately, the bartender service at the main bar was extremely slow during this past visit and that is the sole reason for the one-star deduction from the perfect five-star score.

Keep up the great work guys, maybe hire another barkeep.

Solid option for a more chilled out bar in River North.  Went on their Wednesday night 90's night, which consisted of Friends episodes running on the big screen and a 90's playlist that brought back good memories of grade school, except for the drinking. Good happy hour special running with draft cocktails (normally priced $11) for whatever the hour from 5-8pm. i.e 6:38 = $6.  Draft beers are included as well, but those are almost all 6 bucks so not much of a deal. Sliders were also all $2.  Bar was pretty busy, especially during happy hour time. So much so that it was pretty hard to hear the people sitting at your table, everyone had to shout, but whatev's I guess it's the cool place to be!

Food wise we all really like our sliders, we tried an assortment and the burgers were probs the fav. We also tried the Merkt cheese fries and is maybe just go with the regular next time, these were mush city USA. To top off the meal they gave us some "love" (as they coded it on the receipt) and comped us some s'mores that we toasted at our table. Super fun!

Cocktails wise, we tried a couple of the drafts, I liked the Killing Floor which was watermelon with spicy tequila.  Good aftertaste hit of spice. All the drafts were quite sweet though and maybe not particularly strong. To end the night I decided to get my trusty standby, an old fashioned, and was kind of disappointed. Haven't been to a cocktail bar in a while that doesn't do an orange peel around the rim!

Nice spot though, would be back for the happy hour or maybe the Sunday comedy night.

In town from Dallas for the weekend. Great service!!

What a fun and cute place. Super artsy. Reminds me of Austin, which I love. We were the only people there promptly at 3:30 but whatever. The bartender was friendly and attentive. All of the food is served individually and super cheap. We ordered sliders and the bartender gave us free cheese fries which were delish!!! The ambiance here is great. They play cool music. They were all super nice and gave us some great tips on delicious pizza places that were off the beat and path. If I lived here is absolutely come back!! 

Oh and the watermelon beer was great for summer time! Yum.

Very nice place with great drinks. I tried the Moscow Mule and it was nice and smooth. The music is very loud though and they close down at 1:30. But if you are looking for a clean and nice place to spend your weekend night's this is a good option.

Really great bar with an amazing happy hour special. I managed to try 3 different craft cocktails & 3 different food items while I was there. 

First I ordered the swinging doors drink, next I had top hat and finally I tried pocket watch. I would like to note that as we drank, the waiter said "oh, you literally ordered the last one of those" which was nice to hear. That means they do change up their draft cocktails. In fact, I went late March, and they were already prepping the fall menu for drinks. Each drink was fairly strong, but went down easily. I wasn't a huge fan of the top hat, but it was still drinkable. It was just too spiced for my taste. L

As far as food, I tried the Kentucky hot brown, pretzel & fries. All of these items were tasty. The Kentucky hot brown had melted cheese that really was melted and gave the sense of gravy more than cheese. I would like to note that it was a single serving, meaning, there's no fries or side salad served with this. If you want a full meal, you'll either have to order more food, or go elsewhere. With he pretzel, I'd seriously recommend getting a double order of cheese instead of cheese & mustard, but that just because it's a brown mustard that is quite strong. The pretzel itself is wonderful, it's crispy on the outside, yet soft on the inside. The cheese is so velvety. The mustard is well, mustard-y, I mean its great, but I'm not a mustard fan, so I can't judge. The fries were also good, same cheese as the pretzel, but just lathered on top with green onions.

I give Herny's 3 stars for 1 reason: Service. Service was very very slow. It literally took 5-10 minutes to get a drink. We all ordered draft beer or draft cocktail since that was the special, so I'm not sure what took so long. My to go pretzel took over 15 minutes, it also didn't come with a bag, silverware or napkins. When I ordered my final drink I ordered my finally drink & check. Total time from that moment until I relieved my check was 20 minutes. That's quite a long time.

The atmosphere of Henry's was really chill. I could go back time and time again.

This place serves a Ramos Gin Fizz..... But in a bottle /womp womp/  lets just say that it's lacking. 

Also, if you want food, don't bother. The servers will never notice you are there. Or care.

If I had an inner hipster, she'd think she'd died and gone to heaven here. Posh-hipster heaven.
Even without being a bearded-tight-jean-wearing-bicycle-riding-Logan-square-type, Henry's delivered. There's a modern vibe that is eloquently meshed with a chill, speakeasy atmosphere. Top that off with the vampy sexiness of burlesque dancers, stripping down to their skivvies, and you have the makings of an unparalleled drinking environment.
And boy, did we drink. I think I had 5 of the Hemline, which was the perfect combo of tart and boozy. It was a sipping drink, smooth yet sassy, which mimicked the feel of the bar.
In retrospect, I wish I dabbled in their food offering, outside of the creepy staring/drooling I was doing from a far. They had this s'mores platter complete with mini flames to roast your mellows while you sip on your beverage. It looked like campfire goodness. Mess and all.
I recall a conversation (or parts of one) where my bestie and I teased a table of burley dudes as they mauled down a massive platter of nachos. It was a heaping mountain of chips, cheese and toppings.... And somewhat intriguing to witness four dudes straight up devour.
There's a photo booth. Because alcohol always makes a photo booth an optimal idea. Plus- it was less than the cost of a drink, and (at the rate we were sipping those down) lasts a hell of a lot longer.
So Henry's is definitely a great avenue to spend an extraordinary evening out with friends- if you're down for the hipster scene transplanted, you must venture in. 
Come thirsty, and prepare for flesh and follies remnant of the prohibition era. 
Actually looking forward to visiting again!

Tarkila was awesome ! NRA show block party, amazing experience for me. Staff are amazing and  the space is fabulous. They have two floors, the basement is cool too. Plenty drinks options-you name it sort of.
Unique place with great food and drinks! So much variety and everything was delicious. I will be back to visit the basement area next time.

Consistently great service here. Bartenders are friendly, they will make suggestions, and seem happy to be there. We even had a group a five and the waitress proactively split the check and memorized our multiple orders throughout the night; going above and beyond!

I have mixed reviews... been to Henrys 3 times but only been inside once. Twice there have been private parties. Even checked online beforehand and there was nothing. You would think there would be something online that they would be closed so people to come and can't get in. Otherwise, once you get inside it's really fun with great drinks and free pool.

I popped in here on Saturday evening with a friend who had maybe one too many already. We sat at the bar and the bartender couldn't have been nicer. She was quick with some water and a diet coke. I had an old fashioned and it was perfect! I love the vibe in here. They were playing a great mix of music and there were a few people playing pool in the front (which is fun b/c usually pool tables are in the back). I quickly ordered some food. The bartender kept me from ordering too much for two ladies. I was trying to get some carbs into my buddy! We ended up with the chicken tamale of the day, tuna melt slider, and the big pretzel. Both the intoxicated and sober ate them right up! Everything was super tasty! I loved the slider which was really an open-faced piece of toast with tuna salad and cheese on top. The tamale was so good that when my other friend joined me I insisted that he order one.
After the snack I ordered my friend a Lyft and we helped her into the car. Everyone was cool.
I stayed there by myself for a bit and it was perfectly ok. Great music, The Blues Brothers on tv, and an attentive bartender. I can't wait to come back!

I had a great time at Henry's with my friend Yvonne.  
Nikki C. even popped over to sit with us for a bit.  
Yvonne had a gift certificate treat for 4 cocktails and a GIANT NACHO. 
The giant nachos were as described - GIANT! we did not have it in us to finish them. 
I also ordered 3 of the sliders: kentucky hot brown, fried chicken and elvis!
They were all really good but my favorite was the fried chicken. 
We had the semifreddo version of the mezcal mule due to it not being completely frozen but they were good. 
Yvonne also tried a phosphene dream and I had another candy says.  The drinks and the food were both great.
Service was on point as we arrived early and were one of only a few tables. 
I will definitely be back to try out the downstairs rec room area.
Really cool bar! I love the secret room they have downstairs with the games and a dance floor that is really cool!! The upstairs is good for watching sports.

I really want to give them 4.5 stars, but Yelp won't let you.  I've been here a few times, and will definitely be back.  They have a happy hour special now, where their "regular" cocktails are priced based on the hour ($5 at 5:00, $6 at 6:00, etc.).  The cocktails are very creative and try different combinations.  

If you have any bit of a sweet tooth, get the table-side s'mores.  How often do you get to have (let alone cook) s'mores at a bar?!  I've also done the big-ball challenge, which was mind over matter because they tasted just like any other fried appetizer if I didn't think about the fact that I was eating testicles.  But you do get $2 off your bill for eating them!  I've had many of the sliders too, some were better than others, but all were pretty good, especially for the reasonable price.

The one big downside for me is that it's very loud in there.  Hard to have a conversation at all, because the music is turned way up and then everyone talks loud over it.

They also have a photo booth in the back, which is pretty cool as well.  I definitely plan to make this a regular hangout.

Henry's is one of my favorite bars in River North! It has a significantly younger, and more low key vibe than most of its neighbors on Hubbard and lacks the pretentiousness of the higher end cocktail bars in the area.
Got to Henry's Saturday night around 8 pm with a group of 6. We seemed to be in between the dinner rush and the late night rush so it was a great time to snag a table (everything is first come first served). The bar is just one huge open area, with small tables and chairs in one half with the bar itself while the other is more lounge-y, with couches and a pool table. Our server was very attentive throughout the night and very polite. 
Henry's has a great cocktail list, with some of them bottled, as well as a solid beer selection. I started with the Sarsaparilla Sling, which was an easy to drink, whiskey based cocktail. They have some pretty amusing beer and shot combos if you're looking to party. There's also more of a dance bar downstairs too if that's your thing.
Great drinks, great vibe, great place to hang out with friends. I would expect nothing less from the DMK guys. Will definitely keep coming back!

My very favorite bar in River North! There never is much of a line, which can be a novelty in this area. Most of the time there are seats available at the bar or on the comfortable sofas in the front, where the large windows are opened up on comfortable summer/fall evenings. 

I've never eaten here, but who needs food when they have the Killing Floor on their drink menu. This is the most amazing jalapeño infused tequila and watermelon drink! Yes, watermelon and jalapeño sounds like a strange combination, but go there and try it and then tell me it doesn't work! Damn, it's good! 

The music can be LOUD so make sure you're sitting close to those you plan to talk to. The walls are plastered with topless playboy cutouts and there may be half naked go go dancers walking around depending on the night. It has a very laid back vibe, but you can never know what to expect, but I guarantee that with enough Killing Floors you'll enjoy it!

If you're looking for a cool, fun, sexy and trendy bar in Chicago, this is the spot. Awesome room with plenty of bar seats, tables, couches, and chairs. The walls are papered with topless pinups and classic entertainment pics. There is a pool table and UNO playing cards available, which was great. Awesome drinks and food. There is a photo booth. Classic movies play on the TVs (WOLF OF WALL STREET was on this Friday), along with great tunes. The bar staff was excellent and accommodating. Perhaps best of all, they have maybe every issue of Playboy magazine ever printed stacked around the barroom for your reading pleasure. We loved this place.

Stopped by one evening with a large group of people, middle of the week, and ordered their in house bottled gin fizz and a sage/gin drink they had on tap. The gin fizz was very delicious, and had a nice creamy texture and the milk was a great twist. The sage/gin drink was also really delicious - sweet and savory, but not overwhelming of either flavor (you'd just not have to mind the flavor of sage). And knowing that it is an unusual flavor, my bartender was ready to change out my drink.

We also got a deck of UNO cards from the bartenders to play while we were there and the first floor was a mash-up of tables, chairs, sofas, pool table and bar seating. Definitely a hipster vibe and cool black paneling and wood all over. Didn't head downstairs but heard its a dance floor on the weekends.

I love this place especially to be around River North without being pretentious. No cover, no attitude at the door. The finger food is excellent and the drinks are awesome. 
Super chilled on the first floor and the rec room does not disappoint.
Drinks..good. Music....good. Food... Underwhelmed. Everything was Luke warm and overworked. But... Sliders were good

This is my favorite place in Chicago. Hands down! I came here 2 nights in a row two weekends ago (the night before my birthday and the night of my birthday) because the drinks and food here are that damn good. The prices are UNBEATABLE. I dream about the s'mores... I dream about the $3 oyster sliders (they're all good, trust me!) It would've been three nights in a row but they're closed on Mondays.

The people that work here are super friendly! My friend and I got free shots for my birthday, my friend has gotten free s'mores for hers, and they also do industry nights where people who work in the industry get discounts.

I talk about this place to my friends a lot because even though it's not a dive bar or a sports bar or a pool hall or a hipster-scene underground speakeasy, it really has the best elements of them. It's a cool and hip place with TVs to watch sports, a pool table or two, fun and creative drinks, and really great food. It's comfortable without being dingy, edgy without being intimidatingly alternative. 

Also, if you have the balls to eat balls, they pay you $2 to do it!

I came here for a second time after leaving Sable down the street halfway thru dinner after experiencing sticker shock. We paid $12 for two tiny, mediocre sliders there which caused us to leave as I realized I could come here and get way better sliders for $2-3 each. We ordered one of the burgers and one of the chicken sliders and they were large and delicious. We also got an iceberg salad that was a good portion and decent for only $3. Overall we finished our dinner for $10 while enjoying good music and super friendly servers. 

Highly recommended for drinking, hanging out or eating. Great servers, low prices, cool atmosphere, and delicious food make Henry's a big winner.

Such a neat local find in River North! This is a very casual bar/group dining atmosphere. The restaurant is dark but it just adds to its character. 

I had no idea what was in store for me prior to coming here. The menu is fairly straightfoward and easy to navigate. Note the burgers are "bite sized" but you can get really full on just 2! Order with caution haha

We loved the onion rings, tamale (SO SPICY), Kentucky Hot Brown, Roast Pork and Kimchi. My favorite was the fried chicken with wallflower honey - so tasty. 

Food comes out pretty quickly and you will be stuffed! Come hungry and ready to have some fun!

Servers are very nice and prompt with orders. Recommended for groups of friends. 

They don't really have take out bags/containers so you will be bringing a plate and foil back for any leftovers.

Tried 3 different drinks all of them too sweet... Even though I specified not sweet. They were very nice to change them and agreed with me.
The place looks cool from the outside... But it's just a nice empty shell, no real ambiance inside.
Too bad, I was looking forward to trying this place.
Maybe just the wrong night.
I'll come back !

Very good food, good drinks, optimal staff, music, tv's, cozy and rocky.

Great place to be!!!


Highly recommend.

I've been wanting to go to Henry's for sooo long and I finally got the chance when my parents were in town for a visit.  We decided to go on a Sunday night because I've heard it gets busy and loud and I wanted us to not have to yell at each other.  We walked in shortly after they opened and were able to take advantage of their happy hour- draft cocktails and beer are the price of the hour.  We definitely took advantage of this with three of the four of us going the cocktail route.  We had the scarlet begonias, swingin doors and top hat mag.  I had a taste of each and they were all good!  We started out with an order of Merkt's fries and onion rings, which we devoured while we were trying to decide which sliders to try.  I cant even remember what everyone ordered, but everyone was happy with their choices.  We also did the balls challenge, which was actually chicken gizzards the night we were there.  Our server (Lauren I believe) was excellent.  She made sure we had everything we needed just the right number of times.  The complimentary table side smores was the perfect way to end our evening at Henry's.  We can't wait to come back!

Sweet music , good and not to loud atmosphere . got nachos (they were GIANT) (and delish)
Tasty draft cocktail
Got some drinks here ... Cool bar and atmosphere. Not too crowded. Left a great impression of the city and all it has to offer. I had a fantastic time there.

This place is a lot of fun! I'm a fan of DMK so thought the sliders would be good to try out and indeed they were spot on.  

PROS: 
Tried a couple beef sliders and the kentucky chicken slider which were all flavorful, moist and delicious.
House carbonated cocktails come in a cool cola-style glass.
Music and ambiance was great for casual eating n drinking.
Check out downstairs during the weekend for a basement-style house party


CONS: 
Not great for vegetarians (basically a grilled cheese and a pretzel).
The draft beers came in 12 oz cups, not pints...? maybe i ordered a special one.
Random 70's porn on the screens?  i guess this could be a pro if you're into that.

Will definitely go back!

Only reason I make a point to go to River North area is to enjoy Henrys. I have been treated well here on multiple occasions including at the bar and sitting at a table in both sober and not so sober states. In particular, the server Danny and manager Jason were great! 

Henry's has an excellent cocktail menu with happy hour deals, cheap shots if needed, and a decent beer menu. I have always enjoyed my drinks here, I think it is great they have their own bottled cocktails as well.  The food is good in itself and great for the price. It is hard to find a place in River North that is all a la carte where you have the option to pay just a few dollars if you want one taco or one slider. I've never been disappointed in the food here, and have particularly liked the pretzel, buffalo slider, merkts cheddar, and some type of poblano pepper goodness on rye bread. The servers are always happy to provide recommendations as well! 

Overall, Henry's has higher quality drinks/snacks compared to the surrounding area and is slightly cheaper with excellent service. Great for groups at anytime in the night, very chill yet fun atmosphere!

Henry's?! You snuck up on me.  Like you were dropped from outer space on a slider UFO.  I guess it's a blessing and a curse that you were dropped in river north.  

The blessing? You bring a nice relaxed feel to the tour trap that is river north.  The one huge projection TV is great for having some sports in the background and the mixology/cocktail list is impressive.  I even like the sporadically lit Christmas lights and eclectic random couch placement acting like hybrid booths.  

The curse? You can't escape the douchiness.  Trust me, we still ran into it. 
But let's be honest, just being in river north puts your douche-o-meter at a 4 out of 10.  At least you only register like a 5 out of 10.   Can't blame you for the environment.  Streets raised you.

But back to business.

::Food (aka Sliders)::
80% of the menu are sliders, but they give you the international range of sliders.  From Italian Cold Cut to Greek Lamb to Viet Banh Mi to Wisconsin Cheddar.  Everyone's invited.  Get some fries and onion rings with that, and you are good to go.  Although next time I do want to dabble in the big-ass tamale.

::Booze::
This is really where Henry's starts to set itself apart.  They offer great cocktails for $10 (which is great for River North).  And these cocktails aren't just vodka lemonades with a fun name.  
I had the Burma Shave, since I'm a sucker for good tequila cocktails.  Great spice, mellow sweetness, and still get the refreshing jalapeno-infused tequila undertone.  One of the better tequila cocktails I've had in Chicago. 

Next time I make the way to river north... the suggestion will be Henry's.

Not the quickest service,but the food is great! Join the rewards club here you can get a free drink!!! The prices are reasonable for both food and drinks! Also, if you are bold enough try the balls of the day (YES BALLS)!!! It will take money off of your bill if you can stomach the balls or offal (FYI Fried and Tasty!!) I will definitely be back!!

Drinks - 5 stars
Food - 3 stars

Great vibe and great drinks. 

They have a good list of unique cocktails.  I liked the one that was jalapeño infused. 

The food is mostly small bites but it's set in a way so you can order much or as little as you want and get your variety. it may not seem like much but things can add up quickly. Im sure the place gets a great profit margin with the menu set up with mostly sliders. The oyster slider with arugula was good and the pulled pork was okay too. I would probably try the lamb next time after having heard some good things. 

Their nacho appetizer is large and it needs to be shared.

Was so excited to try Henry's and even more excited that it did not disappoint. 

I came in around 9:30 this past Saturday evening with my friend and we easily found seats at the bar. Henry's was the opposite of other places on Hubbard (packed with long lines and girls dressed like they were heading out in Vegas) and I couldn't have been more glad it was. 

I tried a few of their cocktails while I was there: the Mezcal Mule, Sangria, and Sugarfoot. 

The Sugarfoot was probably my favorite. It was light, bubbly, and refreshing. Definitely a great choice to cool off with on a humid summer night. 

I also really enjoyed the Mezcal Mule. The flavor can be quite jarring when you first try it but the flavor really grows as you enjoy the drink and had I not wanted to try other things I definitely could've had more than one. 

The Sangria was a bit sweet for me but I really like that they add tequila, definitely gives it a much needed punch. 

For food I went with the Kentucky Hot Brown and Merkts Cheddar sliders. Both of them were outstanding and came on some of the freshest bread I've ever eaten a slider on. You can tell that while the food at Henry's is inexpensively priced they do not skimp on the quality. Portions work and the food is delicious. 

I cannot wait to come back to Henry's to enjoy the casual ambiance and try out more of their amazing sliders. This place is a must try.

Go to Henry's. You won't regret it. 

This is my new go-to spot for drinks and dinner. Every slider I've had is fantastic, the poutine is to die for, and the servers do a great job of recommending cocktails based on what you tend to drink. And let's not forget the big ball challenge! Do it. They're not as bad as you think - I'd even venture to say that they're downright delicious.

Two thumbs WAY up for Henry's.

This places was the freaking best, first off let me say I had my bday party here and I didnt reserve a section because I knew it would be packed anyway. Shoutout to Security who worked July 1st in the evening. You gentlemen were the best, my guest and I were a bit more dressier than most patrons and they escorted us up and down the stairs without any complaints. Also the cute bartender working down stairs :-D

The food was great I orded like three different sliders and some drinks and they were made with such perfection omg.  Then the fridge food came out omg! Love that my guest were like "is that free and i yelled hell yea," I had a great time the music was great a good mixture of hip hop and top 40's 

Oh and by the way you all I left my card their and they made sure it was put up safely. I'd definitely would go back.

I was super excited to try DMK's latest venture, and it did not disappoint! 

Met my fiancé here for dinner and drinks after work recently. I arrived shortly after 6, and I had my pick of tables. The beer list is shorter than at DMK, especially the draft list, but they have more cocktails. I'm not a cocktail girl, so was happy to see they had Lagunitas on draft. 

We tried a variety of sliders- we ordered enough that the waitress threw in an oyster slider to round out our smorgasbord! I particularly liked the spicy lamb and the honey chicken, and my fiancé loved the pork kimchee and the merkts cheddar. We also had the poutine, which was good but not great. I love DMK's fries, but these are crinkle cut and waaaay below expectations. Please use your normal, delicious, hand cut fries, DMK gods!

The prices are super reasonable for River North, and the atmosphere is low key and relaxed. We'll definitely be back!

First impression with the ultra loud music was a little put off, but the staff, drinks and food quickly made me forget about it.

Tried the Pocket Watch and Killer Floor, both delicious and under $10.

Ordered so much food with nothing double to give the whole menu a chance. Everything was great!

Burger- patty was big for a slider and cooked well.
Fried chicken w honey- crispy and lots of honey! 
Fish taco- soooo good! Crispy! The waitress didn't like seafood but I'm glad I ordered it anyways.
Pork bahmi w Kim chi- it's the same bread as the sliders but taste Asian. Meat and kimchi blended well
Lamb- meh.... I'll try again next time but it was way too tart. I think it might be the sauce is off
Oyster slider- my bf fav out of all. Light and crispy
Chili fries - tasty and flavorful but not overloaded
The fucken tamale- today was a special w the chili meat and not the listed chicken but dammmmn it was good! And giant!!!! It is literally 4 times the size of a reg one for $5!!! Amazing!

Everyone loved it, price is right. We'll be coming back real soon!!

It's okay if you're into music so loud you can't talk to the person next to you. Henry's gives a vibe it's a dive bar but in fact it's part of a corporate restaurant group. That said the food is tasty but the beer taps are limited. Again I don't get it with the loud music. It's good music but  There is no band or dance floor, rather tables chairs and couches so you'd expect this to be a place to meet and hang. But all I can do is bounce my head to the music and nod at the person next to me Because I'll be damned if I know what they're saying. Ordering drinks or food is a constant shouting match with the staff trying to repeat yourself and all you do is say WHAT over and over and hope she gets your order correct. Maybe after midnight but just a bit much early in the evening.

Great place, tasty drinks & cool people!! I've visited on a Tuesday & that's their live music evening the band was great the atmosphere fantastic & there was a great bunch of people! 
Special thanks to the great band!! Really enjoyed my stay the atmosphere was very easy going & enjoyable!!

What a FUN space! The CULINARY Fight Club event last night was hopping and the venue was perfect for the event!
If you have not made it there it's a must experience!

From the chef to the bartenders were fun and accommodating and the menu had great fun names and YUMMY too!  Like "Henry's Big Balls" the  pay YOU $2 to try them! Oyster Sliders - YUM!  Menu is sole and FUN just the way it should be.

we had much fun and look forward to found back soon!

Place is great, good prices, all their sliders were super tasty

They didn't have balls (booo), but they did have gizzards which were tasty enough.

The drinks were great too, fun happy hour special, but they could have had MORE drinks on special :(

Good and relaxed atmosphere.

The idea is to bring as many friends as possible and try as many things as possible. This isn't even "small plates" -you craft your meal slider by slider. The slider selection is well crafted, highly varied, and not your standard beef patties. Try the sweet but crispy fried chicken slider with wildflower honey. Other highlights include the truly Giant Nachos for a very reasonable $14. 

Henry's Swing Club is an incredibly special place in River North. We're talking about a place where you can absolutely FEAST for cheap. The central location, good beer selection, and more-than-reasonable prices. The only slight downside is their dark, loud, sports bar atmosphere - not the best for conversation.

Came in for after-work drinks with colleagues and had a great experience. Food was great, huge cocktail and beer list, and excellent service. 

Love the mini apps and chill vibe.

I don't frequent River North much anymore, so when a friend planned a Friday night here, I preemptively rolled my eyes ("ew. Gross. Hubbard Street is all the same.") Then I came to Yelp, saw the awesome reviews that Henry's was a breath of fresh air from all the other joints on Hubbard Street, and got my hopes up.

I dunno, guys. Not sure how this place is SOOOO much different than any other place in the area. It's crowded. It's relatively small. The drinks are still pretty spendy. The pool table is awkwardly placed. And...it's just another cocktail bar. Perhaps the beauty of it is in the food, which we did not order. So for now, we are going with "doesn't want to make me poke my eyeballs out" as the eval. Perhaps, if I ever head back up that way, I can see what everyone else is seeing here on Yelp.

Located in the heart of River North on the main club/bar strip of Hubbard street in comparison to it's bottle popping neighbors Henry's really does seem like the pinnacle of culture and refinement. Grab some pretty well mixed and creative cocktails or a beer and chat with friends or play some board games over a bottled mix drink in the basement. If you're feeling crazy you can also make s'mores at your table or get paid to eat some duck balls (better than you think, but you could probably fry and bread anything and make it taste acceptable).
Your moody guy who works at the bar on a Sunday (beard, plump guy) needs to try his best to crack a smile or do his best to find a job where he won't give attitude to customers

I had a great time when we came in for dinner and drinks. The drinks were great, the service was fantastic, the food didn't quite meet the hype.

Coming from the same family as DMK and Fish Bar, I set my expectations pretty high when coming into Henry's Swing Club. While the drinks and service were consistent with the other restaurants, the food wasn't as great...still good, but not great.

I would still recommend coming in, but don't expect a DMK quality slider.

Henry's is a great River North bar...restaurant...dance party. The have an extensive food menu comprised mainly of really unique sliders all for affordable prices. Their cocktail offerings are where I feel they shine though. They have so many really great options that I'd never think to order if they didn't have them on a menu for me. It's definitely more bar than restaurant and gets packed really quick. It's a really fun, vibrant place. Its dim, loud and very hip atmosphere make it a routine stop of mine when I am bouncing around the bars on Hubbard Street. My only complaint is they raised their cocktail prices closer to those of all of the other bars in the area. It used to be much cheaper and for that reason was my number one spot in River North. That being said, it's not ridiculously priced. Its increased prices are more in-line with everything else in the area, which doesn't stop me from coming back, but prevents it from being where I'd stay all night.

It can be hard to find good food and drinks that won't make your wallet cry in this neck of the woods. That's where Henry's Swing Club comes in. It's low key, but not in a "let's just roll across the street in sweatpants" way. It's kind of hipster, or at least as close to it as you can get in River North. And mostly, I like it because it's not pretentious, neither in the "we won't serve you unless you reserve a $400 table" way, nor in a "your beard is inferior" way.

I love places that have draft cocktails because you can sample a few before committing to anything. If you want something refreshing but not "girly," swingin door is great, but if you need something stroooooong, you can't go wrong with a brooklyn. Is it wrong that $10 for a cocktail sounds super inexpensive to me? Because that's what we're looking at here.

Their menu is so fun, as is trying all the different sliders. I didn't care for Italian hero or new mexican hatch, but the spicy lamb and the fried chicken with honey were very good. Their sliders aren't tiny; you can get full on two or three. I just wouldn't recommend trying to split a slider with more than three people (for those of you "let's order everything and each try a bite!" types).

As far as a Hubbard Street bar goes, Henry's is about as good as it gets. The space is huge, has a super hip vibe, and relaxed feels that make a night on the town a really chill time. 

I've been to Henry's about a dozen times at this point, and every time, the wait staff are super friendly and helpful. They've even given us drink vouchers for drinks on the house when they first opened--so super cool!

The reason Henry wins for best hospitality, though, is the drunk eats are some of the best in town. They have absolutely DELISH sliders that range from fried oysters and pulled pork to your more standard honey fried chicken and beef. They also have tacos (why not??) and $2 off your bill for trying to cow testicle sliders... (no, I am not kidding). The GINORMOUS nachos are some of the best nachos ever. They literally just throw the kitchen sink at these things and serve them on a platter the size of two heads.

It's fun, it's zany, it's tasty... what could go wrong? :)

Being owned by DMK I expected their sliders to be better. I've been here twice now and I'm not thrilled about the sliders. My favorite one so far has to be the lamb slider. Still not the best but better than the rest. But what keeps me coming back is the atmosphere. There is something about it that I like and each time I've had very good service.

Best place on Hubbard Street... And maybe even all of River North. Maybe even all of Chicago! This place is effing epic in a nonchalant, low-key sort of way. 

Once described by a friend as "upscale hipster" or "a bit of Wicker Park in River North" for all you locals, Henry's is a breath of fresh air in a neighborhood of pretentious nightclubs (and that's coming from a regular guest of Paris Club and Underground) and boring bars lacking personality. 

The staff is welcoming, knowledgeable about the menu and attentive. I've been to Henry's on weekend and weekday nights and can always grab a table. The menu is mostly composed of small snacks (a bunch of slides and some pretty awesome tacos), which means if you're not hungry you can get full off $6-7 or feast for $20. The crispy whitefish taco and the giant nachos are my favorite (I'd recommend passing on the fried oyster sliders). I cannot comment on the cocktails but the beer list and bourbons/whiskeys are both on point.

I keep coming here with groups of guys (I'm a bro) and we buy a $2 deck of cards and play drinking games a la the good old college days. Everyone I've brought here absolutely loves the vibe and has a great time. We've gotten a couple of rounds of shots comp'd and free s'mores (score!), which is always delightful. To the management and staff of Henry's, keep up the good work (but please don't get too popular unless you grant me a standing reservation)!

Have been dying to check this place out since I'm a huge fan of DMK, finally got a chance to celebrate friend's birthday. We arrived an he earlier thinking we can just grab seats for everyone, but it was so full we had to wait in line to get in. Management was awesome and tried to accommodate us. The drinks were delicious and well priced. The sliders were also excellent. Music was extremely loud but I guess nobody goes there to chat...?

We swung into Henry's Swing Club (see what I did there) on a Saturday night for an after-dinner drink. 

I love the other DMK establishments & have been excited to check out Henry's. 

They were busy, but it wasn't packed by any means... the bartender took a while to get over to us, but she apologized for the delay & offered us bourbon-of-the-day shots on the house (who says no to that?). I ordered the Shake Appeal, and it was de-freaking-licious.

I wasn't 100% sure what to expect from Henry's, I think I was expecting something more swing-y... I guess in my head I had pictured something very 1930's/big-band-ish? but that's not at all what it was. I was loving the 1960s/70s soundtrack & vibe. I'm not a fan of hanging out in the River North clubs, etc. ... usually they are full of douche, but Henry's has a completely different vibe than those other places. I can assume after a certain time of day it has a douche-factor, but the bartenders were super friendly & not River Northy at all. Big fan.

Can't wait to come back and check out some of the small bites on the menu.

Also, don't forget to sign up for the DMK Spring rewards card!

Amazing place , have been coming here for over a year. The reason this is not a 5 star review is some of the new staff, the guy behind the bar didn't seem to know our order and just poured beers and it was clear he didn't care very much when hearing him yell at a another waitress that his job here was to "get people drunk" not process the correct order. 

I recommend this place highly just hope you don't get the one bad apple
Of an otherwise amazing staff

Ew, sad but I must drop my rating. Seems the word is out. I'm not one of those people who wants to keep a great place a total secret (because then it'll fail, duh), but this place has jumped the shark.

Used to be able to walk in and (gasp) EAT! Wanted to show a couple of friends this place since we always loved to eat here. Well, we met there at 7:45pm on a Friday, and there was no host. Nobody checking ID's at the door. Nobody to put your name on a list for a table. Nothing. Strange. 

Place was a madhouse. Instead of being able to grab a table and order some delicious sliders, fries and beers, we wandered around by ourselves looking for an open table. Any table. Most folks weren't eating but were drinking. 

Still, I saw no waitstaff. Some folks were just hanging out at tables or standing around tables like you would at a club. Didn't this used to be a restaurant?! Nowhere to sit, and we hung out for 25 minutes waiting on the last member of our party to show up. STILL no host, and I saw one server in all that time. They don't take reservations. Sad, but I no longer feel this place is an option for a drop-in meal.
Five stars for the bouncers but the music could be WWWWWAAAAAAYYYYYYY better. Pedro and Pierre are the best and i will be back with my girls.
The best bar / club I've eva been too ..s/o the bouncers Pierre n pedro  for the great service

5 stars for the awesome mezcal frozen cocktails alone. Get one of these. Seriously. Before they're gone. Their other cocktails are good too, and the beer list isn't shabby, but I'd get the frozen drink every time. Even though its pre-made... It's that yummy. We came here because it was a friend of a friend's birthday, and everyone was having a good time. Pool tables are really popular so you'll be lucky to snag one. Good music and a casual vibe make Henry's a place I'll frequent more often.

I'm so excited to have a low key, down to earth bar in River North.  The best part is that the prices to this River North bar is so affordable!!!  We went and hung out with a bucket of Schliz and the total came to be under $24 for 2 buckets of beer (which totals to be 10 cans).  They also offer $2 playing cards so you can sit around and play games while enjoying your beverages.

Nobody there was incredibly pretentious, the service was prompt, and the server was incredibly nice!  

The next thing I want to try is their s'mores!  You can make s'mores at your table over a sterno.

1. STRONG COCKTAILS. 
2. Less stuffy than the typical Hubbard street establishment (in my humble opinion). 
3. The music is loud. 
4. Lots of food options. The nachos are incredible. 

I like it.

Had a quick drink and some of the sliders with the girlfriend on a Saturday night.  Atmosphere and decor inside was unique and cool.   All kinds of people were at Henry's.  Will definitely go back.

All the sliders were great and overall prices were cheap for River North and Hubbard.

Great vibe, friendly staff and very good food to boot.

Walked in to Bruce Springsteen being played loudly!  We were instantly greeted by staff who got us situated (told us that we can just find any seat we wanted).  First, this is a huge plus for me because I have been to places before where you wait for someone to just tell you to seat yourself.

Our server was amazing.  She actually sat down next to us to have an actual conversation about the menu.  She also made some killer recommendations for us.  

Food: You must get the Merkt's Burger!  Its is pure cheesy deliciousness and I found myself sad when it was all gone.  The Kentucky Hot Brown is also something of a must to get while here.  For desert there really is one option: Happy Endings!  I love the fact that you make S'mores right at the table.  

Overall great place to grab a bite (small) and a drink.  One of my favorite places in the city.

Normally I reserve 5 stars for outstanding culinary experiences - this is probably my first 5 star based on concept and execution alone.  Holy shit,  this place is fun!  

First of all. .. exactly 93% of all menu items (I counted - nerd at heart) are $3 or less - I'll wait a minute and let that sink in.  The mainstay is sliders - and they are funky and good.  From my Elvis (PB, bananas and bacon) to my banh mi to my thai fried oyster - the sliders were damn good!  My oyster shooters may have been better (tequila and Tabasco). On top of that is an incredible beverage program with bargains everywhere - and some of the best signature cocktails I've had in a while (both the Vampiro and Swinging Doors were amazing). 

But the service may have been the best part of all - amazing combination of hip and hospitable across the board - and if you have the pleasure of Mae serving you at the bar (careful,  she'll sample you on everything! ), it will really round out your night!

I booked and confirmed a bachelor party. Someone called me from the place the day of to make sure we were coming. I told them over the phone that we did not have a definite time, somewhere between 10-1030. They told me that it wasn't a big deal, they would hold the spot for us. We were there at 10:39 and they gave our reserved area away. No phone call, nothing. I confirmed for a $40 per person with 17 people right off the bat, and that was just to reserve an area, and apparently that is not enough business for them. Idiots. Don't book any parties here.

I will give this place 5 stars because the Killing Floor drink is amazeballs and because the fried oysters kick ass as well. I love all jalapeno infused tequila drinks and the combo of watermelon and lime with it was perfect. (Just a tip don't get the jalapeno cocktail from South Branch--- first time I didn't like a jalapeno infused drink) My girlfriends loved my drink so much they each ordered one for themselves. Had the frozen strawberry margarita too, which wasn't bad but not as good as Killing Floor. 

Ordered the sriracha ginger oyster slider and the aioil oyster slider--- both were pretty legit. I wish there was no bread though so I could enjoy more of the oyster. But I guess that's why it's a slider! Had the fish taco too---- SO MUCH FISH for $3.50. LOVED IT. 

I would definitely come back for more food. It's really loud in here though. But our waitress was awesome-- very sweet and helpful with suggestions. Also, there was a huge group of drunkies at the table next to us. Witnessed the birthday girl fall out of her chair, followed by the guy next to her fall out of his chair. I doubt it was a furniture defect. They ordered the s'mores plate which included a tiny grill so you could make your own s'mores--- not so sure it's safe to serve that to drunk people. I was surprised though that the staff didn't kick out those two drunkies though... I also think the birthday girl puked because I saw them using a lot of paper towels to clean up the floor later.

But how nice is the staff then if they don't even kick out people that drunk? I mean, sucks for them to have to put up with that shit, but that's how good their customer service is! I think they felt bad that we had to sit next to the drunkies, even though it was a good show, so they sent us some free shots. So nice of them. Love.

Schwing!

Too young to remember that reference? I thought so.

Henry's is one of the newer additions to the River North bar scene. I was skeptical at first to try it as I dismissed as just another trendy River North bar that caters to its twenty-something denizens.

Well, it definitely *is* that kind of place, but that doesn't mean I didn't like it.

What's not to like about delicious sliders and drinkable cocktails at completely reasonable prices (especially by River North standards)?

Nothing.

A little bird who frequents this place advised me to try the "Bartender's Whim"  - a frozen concoction (changes daily) created by the bartender. Our server told us that it was a strawberry jalapeno margarita which sounded right up my alley. Then the server informed us that the bartender wouldn't serve it for another hour at least because it "wasn't up to his standards" as it hadn't frozen enough at that point. Dude's got some integrity about his cocktails. I can respect that.

Anyway, I rebounded with a Picket Fence and I enjoyed it very much. It was a lovely shade of pink and very tasty. Gin, raspberry, lemon, and kina make for a mighty-fine drink.

For sliders (there are way too many fantastic choices) I went with the fried chicken and then the spicy lamb. Both were terrific, and bigger than I thought. The chicken had a great crunch and was well-seasoned, and the lamb definitely had a spicy kick (it's nice that when something is referred to as "spicy" it actually delivers on the spice) which was tempered by the tzatziki. Two sliders are plenty, especially if you add a couple sides.

Which brings me to...

The portobello fries. Get these! Big fat strips of meaty portobellos in a crunchy batter. So, so good! We also got the onion rings, which were fine, if not remarkable. But whatever you do, do not miss the portobello fries.

After we finished, we wanted a little something sweet. The aforementioned little bird warned me to skip the chocolate fondue (which was hard because the server made it sound really good) and go for the s'mores instead. We got the half-portion, which was plenty. They bring you several marshmallows, graham crackers, a Hershey bar of milk chocolate, and a sterno pot to toast everything. I thought it was kind of cute/funny that they bring you straight-up non-gourmet chocolate and grocery-store marshmallows completely unapologetically. There are no pretenses about what you're getting and it's refreshing.

Other than being SO loud in there that today my voice is hoarse from shouting across the table at my friend while trying to carry on a conversation, I loved Henry's. If it was this loud on a Thursday, I can't imagine the decibel level on a weekend. This is probably not the best spot for a date unless you really don't like talking to each other because you probably won't be able to hear a word either of you are saying.

My only legitimate complaint is that it's not open for lunch, but that's for purely selfish reasons.

Great, laid back bar/restaurant... The ambience is hip and warm.. I like the varying cocktail drinks and beer choices, it would be nice if they had some wine options outside of their sangria and prosecutors concoctions. What I like about the food is that it is served as little bite sized dishes almost like tapas in an Americanized cuisine.. I also like that you can order as you go and it's more like filling snacks rather than a sit down dining experience centered around the meal. Great place together after work or I could even see this a casual/relaxed first date.

We have been here now a half dozen times and we are continually disappointed. They are routinely out of beer- tonight I asked for a Budweiser and got a Lone Star.  Their cocktails are sub par for the River North but their prices are standard for the street. The layout is not conducive for a busy weekend night (there is a pool table the front entrance).

Stopped in here for some food and drinks while downtown. It was located across the street from a Bro bar that was totally obnoxious and could've sworn they were filming an episode of the jersey shore. The burger sliders were ok and they did have lagunitas so it wasn't all bad. I definitely wont be going back the service was terrible even if the people watching was fun.

So Henry's isn't a SwingERs Club, but I will say this...the servers are more SwingER-esque than the majority of the bars within a 5 block radius. No....I don't mean that they're down to get busy with a slew of random customers, but they are more free spirited, fun, and all around interesting than the likes of many of the entitled, "I'm-hot-so-I don't-have-to-be-nice-to-you" wait staffers in this neighborhood. It's totally a breath of fresh air. 

Combine the staff experience with a Logan Square-like interior vibe, a menu of awesome cocktails and beers, and DMK/Fish Bar foods served tapas style and this is my new haven in an area that I normally cringe at the thought of going out in. 

Get an oyster or lamb slider, Portobello fries, and a strong cocktail. Then chat up the cool folks that bring the food your way and I dare you not to agree that this is one of the best places to hang out in River North.

This place was a lot of fun. We came on Saturday night around 12:30 and surprisingly found an open table to sit down at and a server helped us right away! I got the NIghtengale drink, which I wouldn't get again, but  I just prefer different flavors in my cocktails. My boyfriend ordered redbull vodkas so those are hard to screw up. 

The ambiance in this place is really cool, they have a pool table, movies on the large TV, GREAT music and a photobooth in the back corner. We didn't get to try any of the food but next time we will. Deff a good time, and a plus for not having a line or cover to get inside. 

Would have given 4 stars if I didn't spend $50 on four drinks... But hey it's Rivernorth Chicago.

Great place to pop in for a light meal and a drink. Amazing beer selection and their sliders are unmatched. Really friendly staff and our server Lauren was incredible! She even sent a complimentary make your own s'mores to our table. I wish I lived in Chicago so I could visit more regularly.

Please jesus, turn on the AC when it is 90 degrees out. Came here on a saturday before going over to House of Blues for a show. Food was pretty hit or miss. The sliders were good but the crispy cauliflower was basically mush with seasoning. We couldn't order anything from the tap because they were out of gas for the bar (how???) but ok. Our waitress was really sweet and made the best out of the situation. We wanted to drink more but literally felt like we were dying because it was hotter inside than it was outside.

I can't say enough good things about the nachos! Huge and spicy! Ay-yi-yi! We followed the yelp reviews and ordered the smores and were not disappointed. Not sure why they'd allow intoxicated people an open flame beats me, but it worked and was fun!

For a Saturday night, it was slower, being it was slower, service should have been prompter.  Every drink took at least 10 mins to be delivered!

Also two Chicago Bulls players were there, so if you're into celebrity sightings might not be a bad place to check out.

First off, I really would like to give this place 4.5 stars, but unfortunately that is not an option.  

Second, I hate this area for going out.  D-bags abound.  Rockit, Moe's, Social, Hub, Paris.  On and on, they all suck . This place, you can actually hang out and talk and meet people who aren't total cheese.  I will definitely be coming back.  

Atmosphere: Never got too crowded, front area full of comfortable chairs, windows open to the street.  Good music, wasn't too loud.

Food:  Mostly sliders, I had the buffalo chicken, the roasted pork with kimchi, and the New Mexican natch with green chili and fried egg.  $2 and $3 each, and I was happy to pay that.  14 people in our group, the only complaint I heard out of the whole bunch was one guy wished the Kentucky Nut Brown (chicken. bacon, cheese sauce) was a sandwich sandwich instead of open-faced.  Big whoop.  If that's the worst thing that was said out of a group that size, I'd say the kitchen is doing pretty well.  

Drinks:  So, over the course of the night, I had Lizard Boots, Pocket Watch, Picon Punch, Pisco Punch, Mezcal Mule, Rio Grand, Dogwood, Old Fashioned, Dandelion and Brooklyn (also had a few beers and shots, but no one needs a review of Lagunitas or Tallgrass, but I will say the selection is pretty good for being a cocktail place) and there was not a disappointment in the bunch.  If I have to pick favorites, I am going with the Mule, the Pisco and the Dandelion.  Bartenders were all friendly, seemed to know their stuff.  Seems like Henry's really tried to hire quality behind the bar.  Which leads to...

Service:  This is where they came up a little short.  Maybe we just drew the short straw that night, but our server was neither proficient nor enthusiastic.  You have to either be a really good server with an average personality or an average server with a great personality.  We got meh and meh.  Once we got done ordering food, most of us started going to the bar for drinks.  I would by no means let this influence anyone's decision, as the other servers I saw appeared to be well above meh and meh.  

Overall this place is a winner, and I applaud them for appearing to have their act together so soon after opening.  I'll definitely be going back.

I learned that the people behind DMK were opening a bar in river north.  While this isn't my favorite neighorbood to be in... I love DMK, so I came to check it out the night they opened.  They didn't disappoint. 

The drinks were great. I'm a liquor person, so I got a few cocktails.  I started with the Pocket Watch, followed by the Picket Fence.  They were both really good.  After that I decided it was tim to move into spicy cocktail territory. I got the Killing Floor.... which was dominated by the jalapeño flavor.  I love spicy stuff, so it was perfect fit for me.  Loved the drink.

I love the sliders concept!  It's great having so many small delicious options as it gives you an opportunity to try many different things.. like tapas.  I had the sriracha oyster slider.  Didn't know what to expect, but it was great!  Tried the fried chicken slider and that was really good as well.  The only slider that I wasn't as fond of was the Elvis.  It was basically a half sandwich on rye bread.

I'm still trying to decide what I thought of the decor of the place.  Dim red lighting... with those old timely restaurant candles on each table.  I do however think that it's really cool that they dedicated some real estate to a pool table in the front of the bar.

My server (Aylah) was awesome.. so friendly and also made sure to keep checking up on me.  Didn't really expect that when I walked in on an opening night. 

The prices were also really reasonable.  The few times I've come out in this neighborhood before and paid more than $10 for a simple mixed drink.  At Henry's I was able to get craft cocktails for less than $10.  It's also really hard to spend a ton of money on food as well, as most of the items like sliders are just a few dollars.

Anyway, suffice to say, I am enamored with another one of DMK's establishments.

I love this place. It's trendy and hip. There's always a good crowd. You can even make smores at your table with a little small portable fire thing.  The food is pretty solid and they have creative fun drinks.

Finally made it into this place!  We had a chocolate shake a few weeks back that was really good, but hadn't gotten to try the burgers!  

Sunday we finally made it in for a snack.  Had a double cheese and fries.  It was amazing!  Service was helpful and quick. As other have stated, definitely reminds me of Small Cheval - easily as good as them (though Small Cheval is delicious, it unfortunately does not hold up to the original Au Cheval).  Also, the fries - they were fresh fried and golden.  Nice and crisp!  We loved them.  

As for those who complain about price.  All the stuff is made in house - and it's grass fed beef.  Parts & Labor curlyfries are limp and cold half the time, their burgers they make in house but use pork to cut down on cost (also, not trashing them, like their place its just like comparing apples and oranges on quality).

The fact is, if you want a $3 or $4 burger, go to Mel's, or just hit up corporate fast food for that matter.  If you want quality quality and deliciousness then stick with these guys in LS, and Small Cheval in WP.

The one thing I'd say we would enjoy is for them to get a liquor license so we can enjoy a beer while eating!

This place is actually 5 minutes from our place and we it will now be our goto when craving a quick burger.

Also, Kudos for the glass bottle Dr. Pepper!

We walked in this place around 8pm and there was no cashier. One of the people in the back kitchen came back to tell us she was in the bathroom then walked away. We gave him a weird look...shouldn't you step in and take our order? So he offered it up. When we asked what kind of dipping sauces they had for their fries (this is their schtick), he had absolutely no idea. We ordered, and the cashier came a few minutes later to charge us. No hello, how are you doing etc. she was busy texting/snapchatting when she finally got back to her post, and asked us a minute later what we had. Rang us up with piss poor attitude. The food finally came and they threw it on the table and walked away. Overall the service was extremely poor, and the food was bland. I can't wait to see what opens here once this place is forced to close their doors, which will not be long. 

Edit: the owner reached out and explained a sudden loss of personnel, so my experience was an isolated situation. I still prefer other burger joints in the hood, so give them 3 stars. Nothing Amazing, nothing terrible.

Had to wait 30+ minutes at 2 in the morning to watch a large group and several other orders be filled before ours, apparently they lost our ticket. So they comped us for the order which ALMOST made up for it, but then we walked out and realized they forgot our fries. Which they also comped us for. But CMON

Ok. Then after waiting for 30 minutes our burger was raw, id give 0 stars if that was a thing

The burger game is tough in this neck of the woods. You've got Owen and Engine, Small Cheval, Parts and Labor, and a handful of small fast food restaurants all viciously competing against one another for our burger dollars. I tried Small Fry's double burger with the works and fries to see what might set this newer place apart from the others nearby. I'm sad to say that the answer is not all that much. 

The patties in the double burger weren't seared/browned in any way. Think of a grey hockey puck with a pink center, with a similar consistency. The toppings didn't add any crunch or other notable flavors. They were out of their fry seasoning add-ons at the time, and seemed to be trying to promote their "awesome sauce." it's just another version of a thousand island sauce, and mostly only okay in my book. 

For positives, I will say that the fries were crispy and notably good. The service was nice for a counter service type format, and I liked the neat graffiti and punk ambiance inside the shop. It's a perk that they stay open until midnight during the week, too.

If I'm in need of drunk munchies after a night out along that stretch of Milwaukee, I'd consider stopping in again, but only for their fries or poutine. This place is fairly new, so maybe there's time for them to work the kinks out and improve. I hope they do so.

The Sloppy Richard was SO good. The fries are awesome! Only tried the cool ranch spice so far but it was delicious. The burger was just ok, the meat seemed like it had been frozen. But everything else was great! Can't wait to try a shake. Everyone's super nice in there too, although I really am not a fan of the atmosphere so I get it to go.

COOLER RANCH SEASONED FRIES ARE YOU KIDDINGGGGG ME?! Mind blown. 

I visited SmallFry a couple days ago with some friends, and I ordered a single cheeseburger (I know - how boring probably) and a chocolate milkshake. The cheeseburger had a special sauce on it and was super yummy in my tummy. I would say that it is comparable to a Shake Shack burger but A TAD MORE DELICIOUS.

ALERT ALERT - There are freakin' GUMMIES in their milkshakes. Yes, gummies. Well, gummies/Sour Patch Kids (I think) which are pretty much the same thing. Let me tell ya'...that was quite a pleasant surprise. 

Also, back to the cooler ranch fries...they have a bunch of different seasonings and sauces for their fries, but the cooler ranch seasoning was THE BEST by far. Am I eating Doritos? Am I eating fries? Who knows!

I will be back to stuff my face in the near future FOR SURE.

Small Fry is a good addition to the neighborhood for greasy spoon type of food that tastes above average and can be eaten in a super chill and friendly environment. I love all the wall art throughout the small fast casual restaurant - makes for fun looking around while you're eating.

Coolest food item at Small Fry - Their corn dog! There are actual corn pieces in the batter. Why everywhere doesn't do such a cool little trick, I don't know. For whatever reason, I feel like it makes the corn dog taste ten times better! Loved their corn dog, om nom nomz.

The burger we had seemed slightly overcooked but the flavor was tasty with their special sauce. It was oozing with ingredients! 

Triple deep fried fries sounds monstrous but they are pretty darn good. You can get seasoning with them or a dipping sauce and we did the truffle mayo dip which was the best possible option to go with the fries. I absolutely loved it and the fries were awesome dipped in it. Highly recommended!

They played good 90s alternative music the whole time we were in. This made me happy as I sang along to the songs like a freak. Their tables are soooo wide. Maybe slightly too wide because we were stretching a bit. They have one high long table, one low long table and a few counter seats along the window. Food takes a little while to come up so speed could be improved upon ever so slightly. Overall, good, cheap new addition to the 'hood. I'd love to try one of their chicken sandwiches as they have three different styles - Asian, Garlic and Spicy! I'll definitely be back for more!

You can't go wrong with triple fried fries and poutine. 
I heard about small fry before it opened (thanks eater) and I was ready for the hype. 
I love poutine and their poutine is THE BOMB. 
Triple fried fries with BRISKET and the gravy is delicious!
Not too salty and the brisket adds so much more favor! 

This place is a great nightcap after a night out, came here after the radler and slippery slope which is just down the block! 

Can't wait to come back!

Ok I'm not saying this is going to happen to you but I walked in for lunch and their credit card machine was down and I was about to leave but then they hooked me up with a free burger and fries and a coke WOW. The dude making the burgers was #1 and the girl taking my order was also #1, nicest girl ever. Also the burger was en fuegoooo  #SmallFry4prez can't wait to go back

We were out for a late night post drinking meal and walked into this place. It's your typical good greasy spoon burger place. Cheese sauce is homemade (but small portion). Good burgers and great fries. We paid $35 for two burgers and two fries (one with cheese sauce) so on the expensive side. They also brought us the wrong food At first but were quick to amend the mistake.

In my heart of hearts I want to LUV this place, but I just can't as it stands. I want the chicken sandwiches to have a little more zip flavor-wise. And, I want a slightly lower price point, especially if the chickens aren't organic, free-range birds, as I'm guessing they're not, given the lack of description as such.

The spicy chicken sandwich is buffalo style, which they should make clear, and depending, it might be hemorrhaging sauce such that the entire sandwich falls apart, making it impossible to eat. The Asian-style version was pretty bland except for the slaw.

The milkshakes are solid. Loved the cold brew, but HATED the styrofoam it was served in. Styrofoam is EVIL, find another option, or at least serve the shakes in pint glasses for those eating in.

Small Fry was everything I was hoping they would be when it comes to a getting good solid, fast food style burger, fries and shake. It was honestly one of my favorite burgers I've had in Chicago lately, and I've tried almost all of them.
I would compare the burgers and shakes most closely to Shake Shack. They are very similar in proportion, flavors and for that matter, price. The chicken sandwich and corn dog (with homemade corn, jalapeño batter) are really great too. 

It IS a tad on the pricey side for what it is. And not unlike Shake Shack, the burgers are on the smaller side.
 Order a double if you're hungry, because it's not that big. Not like Portillos or Au Cheval size doubles. The prices compare to those, but this also isn't downtown off the Mag Mile, or the West Loop. However, I don't mind paying a little more if it's really good.
 The shake was unexpectedly good, and I am picky about hand scooped shakes.

I'm only leaving one star off because both times I've been in, though not busy, it's been pretty a little slow. (After the first experience, we were comped a free meal, so not a big deal. And it redeemed itself. )
Also, maybe we could use a little more in the way of accoutrements. Like more than one roll of paper towels for the whole place to use. Or a ketchup and mustard bottle on the counter, just in case. The little things.

Stopped by mid-day on a Sunday - they must have just opened for the day- and the man at the front was really helpful and apologetic in his letting me know that the veggie burger isn't vegan. I asked him to let the owner/manager know that vegans would appreciate something to eat other than fries and he said he would. Few minutes later the owner/manager let me know that they are working on a vegan burger and should be available in a week! Woo! Apparently they're frying with canola and had been frying in beef day before? Vegan score!

I got the togarashi fries and they were pretty tasty. All their sauces are aolis ... maybe they'll make one vegan!

"Small Fry. Big Problems." Credit Brad K. and my wife for the "headline".

Based on the positive reviews thus far, something must have been going wrong when we came to visit yesterday, July 22. The place was not extraordinarily busy, yet from the time my friends and I placed our order, it took about 35 minutes for all of us to get our food. 

The food also came out over a span of 20 minutes rather than all at the same time. What resulted was one friend who was nearly completely done with her meal when my other friend was just getting his food. Yes, she could have waited, but we urged her to eat, because honestly, not much is worse than a cold burger and cold fries.

The food was actually pretty good -- it is just a shame that it took so long to get and we couldn't all enjoy it at the same time. I understand that SmallFry is still a newer restaurant, so they are still working out the kinks, but honestly, with a such limited menu (cheeseburger, veggie burger, chicken sandwich, poutine, fries and shakes), it shouldn't be too difficult to pump out food in less than 20 minutes, and all at the same time.

Two stars for the food and ambition and one star for the design. 

There is only one option here for vegetarians, a beet based veggie burger that thankfully doesn't taste much like beets. However with the cabbage on it, it tastes very much of slaw and "awesome" sauce (extra). And it was very mushy. The fries are triple fried and a bit too done for my taste. The milkshakes are small. My companions said the corndog was extremely greasy, and the crease covered mat confirmed that. 

The design is cool, with fun graffiti covering the walls. The staff was friendly but forgot some of our order, but I just chalk that up to being new.

Let's get this out of the way first: if you notice the reviews for Small Fry, 8 of the 5-star reviews (out of only 20 total) are made by accounts with no other reviews and are only as old as the restaurant itself. 

I get it. Sometimes a new business needs the help of some friends in order to boost their "cred." But this is unbelievable. 

This place is a total ripoff. The food itself isn't bad but it's certainly nothing out of the range of mediocre. A cheeseburger is $6 and a double will run you $9. A chicken sandwich will cost you $8 and - keep in mind - none of these come with fries. So make sure you tack on another $3 for a small order of fries. 

The cheeseburger itself (despite these bogus pictures on Yelp) are roughly the size of a Wendy's Jr Cheeseburger. They also taste very similar to a Wendy's Jr Cheeseburger, except these are running $6 instead of 99 cents.

So what does this all mean? It means that the self-labeled late night greasy burger joint of Logan Square doesn't even let you out the door for under $10. A cheeseburger, fries, and a drink is $10 BEFORE TAX and that doesn't include any of the seasonings or sauces they tote. At these prices, why not just go to Small Cheval and get a significantly more bang for your buck?

Maybe I was there on a bad night - maybe not. But it only took one time to get scammed out of $26 before I've decided not to return. Again, there was nothing particularly bad about the food, but to charge $10+ for a Happy Meal is a joke. Apparently people will pay literally anything just to say they've been to the new, trendy joint.

The fries were great. The chicken sandwich was horrible. It was not white meat chicken at all. It was hardly edible dark chicken. I couldn't even eat it. 3 stars because fries would get 5 but the chicken sandwich 0.

The owner had reached out to me to try them again which was very kind of him! For the price though, I don't think this would be my go to spot. 

I ordered the chicken sandwich, asian style and no pickles, and fries just as they come. The same issue occurred where they put pickles on my sandwich, so that was a bit frustrating; and after two bites of the sandwich it all fell apart and was difficult to eat. The fries were delicious though!

I might go again after some time with them being open to change things up. :)
Best place for fast burgers in the city. Come in often and order 2 burgers and the poutine. In a city with $14 burgers, this place is refreshing.

Came in here with the wife on date night. The staffs were very friendly and helpful in recommending the specialities here. We got the Chicken Sandwich, Cheeseburger and Cheese fries. The Chicken Sandwich is amazing, a must have when here. The atmosphere is great for hanging out. We will definitely be back.

Fries are brown, crispy and delicious. Try the garlic sauce. I asked about the veggie burger and it sounds like the main protein is beans and farro along with around 30 other ingredients. I got the veggie burger with cheese and although it falls apart pretty easily, it tastes amazing. The cheeseburger tasted like an upscale mcd's hamburger. Onions, pickles, sauce and patties but all better than a standard fast food joint. Looking forward to trying the milkshakes and chicken sandwiches. Definitely going back. 

I would recommend lowering the lighting slightly (if they are on a dimmer) to accentuate the christmas lights on the ceiling and allow the green neon to give the place more of a beetlejuice lounge feel. Love the floating shark and casual vibe in here.

Doesn't live to the hype. 

Issues:

Soggy buns
Overcooked fries
Little seasoning on cheeseburger meat, but awesome sauce is a good concept. 
Chicken sandwich was soggy and not crispy as other reviewers have said about their sandwiches
Downright pricy!!! 

If I am paying $6+ for a sandwich it should be well done and well presented. 

Alas, my first and my last. This is a place to go when you're drunk off your head. 

Farewell SmallFry
I shall not come back

The positive: The food was good.  I would say it's on the level of Small Cheval or Parts and Labor.  It's not better than either of those, but not demonstrably worse.  The burger was solid, without a lot of extras getting in the way of the bun and the beef.  That said, I like some extras if done right, but this was definitely a burger I would order again, and the fries were very good as well.  

The negative: A little pricey compared the combo at Parts and Labor.  A few bucks extra for the combo, especially considering you get a soda instead of a beer.  The person who took our order, a perfectly nice guy, apparently dropped our ticket and took a half hour to get our food.
