People who arrived after us received and finished their meals before we got ours.  In his defense, he offered to give us our money back, but mistakes happen, and we didn't want him to lose any money over it.  Still, we were hungry and frustrated.  And it was pretty slow when we went in, so it should have been kind of obvious that the kitchen guys weren't cooking anything while there were people sitting without any food.  

Bottom line, the food was good.  If I lived within a five minute walk or so, I could see going there quite often.  We live a little further away, and have at least one burger joint that's just as good, much closer, and cheaper. Difference maker might be their Poutine, which looked terrific, but we didn't order.  It's a burger place, and for our first visit, we wanted a burger.  Maybe next time.

Just ate here sober and it was phenomenal can only imagine what it's going to be like when I hit this place late night after a night of excess. 

The spicy chicken sandwhich was smothered in really solid habanero sauce. Also got the Korean BBQ seasoned fries, completely hit the spot. Really cool vibe in there with really nice employees. Excited to have a cheap option for a quick bite. Also it's BYOB so the perfect spot for a good night cap.

Obsessed with Smallfry.  

Came in with a group of friends and ordered one of just about everything on the menu to try.  Nothing disappointed but my absolute favorites were the poutine fries, cool ranch seasoned fries and the burger.  I REALLY wanted to try the burger so I brought my own GF bun and they were super accommodating about it.  They prepared it on my bun and told me they were actually searching for a GF bun option to offer soon!  Very awesome service & food!

Not worth the money. Portions are very small. With every bite, my boyfriend and I kept saying "we wish we would've gone to Small Cheval instead". 

Service: guy was nice but very slow. Brought food out in sections. Also, asked for ketchup and was given 2 small containers for 2 burgers and 2 orders of fries. Asked for more and got a strange look and was given only one more for the two of us eating. 

Food quality: flavor wasn't awful but also wasn't nearly as good as Small Cheval. 

Lets just say I won't be going back.

we just ordered a cheeseburger and a double cheeseburger with bacon and my god, all we were doing was making sour faces. the amount of salt in our burgers was just wayyyy too much. okay, i get it; its fast food, it's going to be salty BUT it was seriously overload. i couldn't even finish my burger because the sodium was just too much. to be fair the fries were good but i wish they would consider the amount of salt in the sauce/burger patty. not to mention, way overpriced! can't believe how small the burger and fries were for the price! probably won't be going back.

I live in Logan Square so I get very excited when things open up in the neighborhood. Not too bad. I think the burger size is a little small even if you do order a double but it taste really good. I'm a happy customer.

It's okay ..not worth the price honestly. I'm talking White Castle sized burgers for like 8 bucks a piece. The cool ranch and cheesey fries were great and different but again SUCH a tiny portion. Not worth it. Go here for a snack and nothing more. Overpriced  and not filling one bit. IF I go back it'll be for fries. Burgers were nothing special.

Smallfry is amazing! I think i've had it like 6 times in 2 months. The fries are delicious, I like to eat them with the garlic dip. The burgers are gooey and wonderful, only reason i'm giving it 4 stars is because they have a little too much onions on them for my taste. The cheese curds are enormous but I love the corn breading on them, so good! Smallfry for the win!

Rather disappointed with this place, ESPECIALLY  based upon reviews and pictures.  The cheeseburger and fries were pretty good, but not great.  I just don't necessarily agree with the value of what you pay for and what you get.  I don't mind paying for great food that would bring me back time and time again BUT I think their prices should be a bit more reflective of what you're getting.  SmallFry seems to be trying to get into the niche of fast casual trendy gourmet burgers, but it falls short of that. In my opinion, they don't beat out Five Guys on price, quantity, or quality and that's a shame.  If they are in business 1 year from now, I would be surprised by that news if they don't change something and make improvements to earn repeat business. At this point, there isn't anything that would really bring me back to eat there again.

Q-Tine has a much better corndog. They really screwed this one up. I also am not sure why I paid an extra quarter for flavoring on my fries to taste like nothing. Will be nice for late nights though and I'm sure I'll be back
I love the food!  The only reason I can't give it five stars is because they can't seem to figure out how to open on time.

The fries are amazing. They are seriously addictive. The veggie burger is ok - small but the bun is tasty. The texture was a little crumbly, which didn't bother me too much but is a little annoying because it means it's a little messy to eat. The only thing I wasn't a huge fan of was the pickled slaw on top of the veggie burger. If you're gonna order it, I'd suggest nixing the slaw and adding cheese if you're not vegan. Service was great - I mentioned my fiancé and I were gonna split the burger and they sliced it in half for us. The only other thing was it's a little warm inside. Otherwise the vibe is cool and they played good music. We'll be back :)

This place just opened today. We tried the burger and the chicken sandwich. Both were great. And the fries were amazing. We got the cool ranch flavoring. They didn't have shakes yet. (They haven't had their grand opening). They're open til 2am. They have some seating. The music is dope-rap. We'll definitely come back!

Update-went back recently late night and had fries and a milkshake. The milkshake was perfect. Fries were really good too but I knew that. Also the owner was super nice despite my drunken friend. I appreciate that.

Recently checked this place out. It screamed "HIPSTER" but everyone needs to be a hipster at some point in life. Now on to the food, the menu is simple and sweet and nothing too special. I ordered a burger and fries and I must say it was DELICIOUS. The sauce that comes with the burger is awesome, reminds me of a better version of Big Mac sauce. But I recommend this place for anyone in the area and it has a great display of graffiti across the street.

Tl;dr: Slow, overpriced, not good. 
We had to wait for 30 minutes (no line, maybe 5 other customers total) for a single chicken sandwich and fries. Thirty. Minutes. And it was cold and flavorless. And $12. 
Y'all, they only have hamburgers, fries, and chicken sandwich on the menu. How hard can it be?

All around great spot. Tried one of the burgers as well as fries with cooler ranch seasoning and malt sauce. 

Burger was perfectly sized for a meal that is not going to leave you in a food coma at the end. Cooked so that it was still juicy and the signature house sauce is fantastic. The crowning jewel was the fries though. I chronically leave about half of my fries uneaten at restaurants, but this is not the case for fries coated in the delicious dorito inspired cooler ranch seasoning. Ate every last scrap of fried potato goodness and then processed to empty the rest of the seasoning in the bottom into my mouth in true dorito bag fashion.

Well done, Small Fry. Well done indeed.
Place is awesome, I suggest the Piri Piri Chicken and the corndog, though that poutine was amazing. Plus how can you go wrong with twice fried fries dusted in flavors.

Really great fries. We got cooler ranch and umami with garlic and awesome sauce (it really was awesome). Burger was super great! Reminds me a bit of an In n Out burger in size and meat to bun and condiment ratio. Service was super friendly and the atmosphere is fun. I'll be back for sure, I hope Smallfry is here to stay!

The veggie burger looks great, its some kind of bean/beet mixture, but is a little too mushy and not savory enough to really feel like you're eating a burger rather than a sort of veg pate spread. I'd stick to fries if you aren't a meat eater unless you've got a big appetite.

The fries are legit,if heavy on the grease. They were a little too heavy for me, but that's as advertised and would probably be lovely after a night at the bar. Crispy and soft, and a decent portion size. I was disappointed that there was no ketchup? I understand they're trying to push their sauces, and I believe they had an in-house BBQ for an upcharge, but if I'm coming somewhere for the fries, I'd like the option for just some Heinz ketchup. Everything doesn't have to be artisanal and hand-crafted when it comes to a burger and fries. 

Which is kind of the odd thing about this joint - it sells itself as simple grab and go/late night indulgent food, right down to its pegboard menu. But the prices are a bit high ($6-7 for burger alone) and the details slightly elaborate and expensive ($2 for cheese - but its house-made American [why?]). Its kind of like shake shack pricing without the same payoff. 

That said, the fries are quite good, the staff was nice, and the food was hot and came out pretty fast. I wish I was eating beef to give the burger a try, although I think the food in general is a little too heavy to be a regular stop.

Amazing new spot in Logan. I'm slightly biased because one my roommates works there, but even that doesn't explain why I go there ~3x a week. The fries are amazing, burger's on point, and shakes are ridiculous. And they're apparently experimenting with using cereal milk(like milk that's had cereal in it) to make shakes, which I'm pretty sure I thought of when I was like 6. I'll be honest, I'm hurt that they stole from me, but also HOW DOPE DOES A REESES PIECES SHAKE AOUND? 

Also try the poutine, so worth the toilet troubles the next day. Highly recommend.

If you're in the Logan Square area, Smallfry is definitely worth stopping by. My girlfriend and I had a great meal and the owner was real helpful in helping us decide through what flavors to add to our choices. I had the chicken sandwich, Asian style and it was absolutely delicious; had a fantastic crunch and the inside was still juicy. My girlfriend had the cheeseburger and she claims that the cheese is to die for. We split fries with jalapenos cheddar seasoning; definitely coming back to try some of the others!

For just opening, the food was spot on and we'll definitely be coming back!

Delicious chicken sandwich (try the piri piri: spicy and vinegary,  and... plain delicious),  super crispy fries,  interesting sauces.... And a combo gets you a surprise milk shake (along with fries)!  BYOB as well (one group of folks were enjoying their elevated fast food with a bottle of prosecco,  so that's an option)
This place is exactly what Logan Square needed. Food was unreal, and I can't wait to come back and try and the different seasons. Don't miss the veggie burger or the cooler ranch fries. Obsessed.

Best new Logan Square restaurant, by far! I went there on a Thursday night and there was a steady stream of locals filing through.

The customer service is fantastic, the guys working the counter are happy to walk patrons through the menu and willing to give advice. The staples are chicken sandwiches, served one of three ways, cheeseburgers, single or double, a veggie burger, and of course hand cut fries with a great selection of seasonings and sauces. 

Went with the chicken sandwich, served bahn mi style. In spite on what the hater said below, the bun was soft and ridiculously fresh and the fried chicken was extremely crispy and juicy. The slaw, house made pickle, and sauce put this up there with the best chicken sandwiches in Chicago.

The fries are perfect -- crispy, hot and golden brown. The cooler ranch seasoning is a fun change of pace and the awesome sauce is exactly what you'd expect, awesome. 

The vibe in this place is incredible, from the dudes working the counter, to the local art on the wall, to the 10 foot great white hanging above the tables.

I'll for sure be back here, many many times.

Welcome to the neighborhood, Small Fry! :)

Tried this place out last week!  The burgers are delicious with super gooey cheese and a great bun. I made the mistake of ordering a single and then had to go back up for another it was so good. 

Fries ate great too! My friend got the cool ranch topping but I loved mine the old fashioned way.  Can't go wrong! 

Looking forward to giving the chicken sandwich a try next time in but it'll be hard not to order an extra burger on the side.

Good burger slow service. Went in for a burger on a Friday night and waited 45 minutes just to order. Then another 20 minutes for the food. The fries were over cooked but the burger was delicious, that is why they get 2 stars instead of 1. Hopefully the kitchen service improves over time. Ridiculous wait time, not sure what was going on. SMH.
Best chicken sandwich I've ever had....love the atmosphere and the employees are always so nice!
Awesome veggie burger, great fries, really like the Jalapeno cheddar, and welcoming staff!
Great fries. Try sauces and seasonings! Burgers are small but good. Mostly it's a great late night place after the bars or before going to the owl until 4am.

Good burgers at a good price. Great fries and shakes, too. Very nice staff. Seating is a little goofy, as they only have 2 big communal tables, and last time I was there, two groups were taking up most the seats, so I had to order to-go. It also seemed like a surprisingly loud restaurant overall, especially if there are groups in there, as everyone is trying to talk over each other, and the openness of the room created loud echoes, but that in no way takes away from the great food. A great addition to the neighborhood.
the corn dog is phenomenal!! actually has roasted corn in the batter.

I went to this place today, I truly enjoy the vibe and the owner and the staff seem to be very friendly. The burger is pretty tasty, and I enjoy the vibe I get. They are BYOB so bring anything you please, I truly enjoyed it I just wish the burgers were a bit bigger. Great and Tasty, would definitely go back.

My daughter's favorite cheeseburger.  We've been here twice-- time to write a review!  We are so happy to be able to walk to such a delicious place in our neighborhood.  Everything is cooked fresh and with excellent quality.  Love the Awesome Sauce and whatever substance comprises the cheeseburger topping.  Fries are unfailingly great.  Asian Chicken sandwich  was also good--very crispy.  Can't wait to try the veggie burger.

I went to Small Fry again today. I got a double cheeseburger.  One thing I forgot to mention before is that they manage to leave the burgers with a little pink. That is hard to do for thinner patties, but they get it perfect, not rare but medium and juicy! I asked for the fries to be double fried as opposed triple as I don't like them super crispy. Like the burger,  they came out perfect. Finally, I tried the Vanilla shake again. They are now using a Vanilla bean ice cream. It was so much better than last time with just the right amount of milk and excellent pure Vanilla flavor! Again, perfect. I will definitely be going to Small Fry when I'm in the neighborhood.

My wife and I popped into SmallFry after seeing their article in the Tribune and we were very happy with our experience. The staff cares about customer experience which is refreshing in Logan Square.  I had a spicy chicken sandwich with cooler ranch fries, very bomb! We will be back.

Quiet place during the lunch time we were there. 
But the chicken thighs that we ordered were done just right. Charred outside, juicy on the inside. It was really delicious. I wonder why it is so quiet that day.
We usually go to Nando's on Randolph and also on Wabash downtown. But this joint takes the cake in terms of friendliness and deliciousness.
Tastes just like the one at Cabot Circus in Bristol!
Must come back again!
---
So I came back last Sunday afternoon and was very disappointed with the quality of the chicken thigh. Not cooked properly, I think. Some part tasted slimy. I want it charred and perfectly spiced like last time, please!
I hope it is only a one time thing.

Solid sandwich and flavors. Hard to eat without the middle parts sliding out from the bread. Got the chicken sandwich with pineapple...couldn't taste the pineapple at all.

Seasoned fries were good and evenly cooked.

Chicken sandwich, fries, soda about $15. A little spendy for having no table service.

I lived about five minutes away from the first Nando's in DC, so it's about time that Nando's made it to Chicago!

I don't know if I would say Nando's makes world-class fare, but it's very tasty and does the job, especially for the friend that doesn't want to roll the dice checking out food in lower-brow establishments.

Last week, I went with a half-chicken order with two sides, the macho peas and the mash with a slice of the chocolate cake.  All good, nothing stellar.  Love the space at this location and the service was fantastic.  Nando's has a ton of locations now so it's hard to go wrong!

Finally got to try Nandos. Just a solid and flavorful chicken spot with lots of good sides to go along with it. Lots of great choices and sauces for a chicken lover like myself. Definitely a South American vibe on the menu including Peruvian style rice. The garlic bread sticks are a delicious side dish and the mashed potatoes as well. 
Was not too crazy about the wings but it's nice to try them with all the different sauces they offer. Staff was friendly and the facilities very clean. I thought the prices were a bit high for what they are offering. $14.75 plus tax for a half chicken with 2 sides.  A little much for a fast casual restaurant where you have to stand in line to order.

CHICKS DON'T RULE HERE

I have to be honest and say that the staff here is really sad. I'm not mad at them but I'm furious at the management for not properly training them about customer service. If you want to see perfect customer service wall across the courtyard here to the Canadian based restaurant on the ground level. It is like worlds apart. 

When you walk into a restaurant the staff can make or break a location. It's the difference between me ever coming back again or never setting foot in here again. The two workers behind the counter were very unhappy and didn't even want to be there. 

I almost wanted to leave but I had already placed my order. I ordered a half of chicken and they pulled my chicken from a metal container full of precooked chicken. I understand that grilled chicken properly done takes a while to cook but when I see the process they use here I feel like I'm eating a frozen dinner or leftovers. Honestly I could do this at home if I wanted reheated chicken. 

The restaurant was not crowded at all. There was a single table of 4 people dinning. The room is huge but very dark. It felt very depressing and I was glad that I was carrying out. At least I could enjoy my chicken in a happy place...my home. 

When ordering my chicken the girl at the counter scared me about the level of heat. I decided to go with medium and I'm not happy I did. Medium was more like mild. For all I know, I didn't even get the right sauce. The cook threw my pre cooked chicken on the grill and walked away. The cashier made several comments to him about my grilling chicken. He didn't respond or even come over to check on my chicken. She then picked up a spatula and flipped my chicken. She then took the spatula and pressed it hard against my chicken on the grill. I cried a little as I watched all of the juice from my chicken run into the flames of the grill. When I saw this I was kind of done with this place. Are they trying to be fast food? Because they are acting like it. 

I think this franchise is growing too fast without the proper staff or managers in place. I don't see them making it long term. There are too many places that cook fresh food with fantastic amazing customer service. This place isn't one of them. 

I haven't even talked about the chicken. It was okay. I honestly make better seasoned grilled chicken at home. I probably won't come back here unless I'm trapped in group fun and everyone is making me come here. I'll do my best to redirect them across the way. It would be even better if we went to the grocery store at New City and let them grill our meat because at least it would start out raw and fresh. 

I never like writing a bad review but with an unfriendly staff and precooked warmed up chicken I would rather spend my money elsewhere with a business that appreciates good service and great food.

I got take-out at the Clybourn location after an appointment at the Apple Store, and all I can say is DAMN. I had heard great things about Nandos but the food seriously exceeded my expectations. I got the half chicken and peri chips (suggested under their first-timer section) with lemon herb sauce. While waiting for my food, I went and sampled some of the sauces and all of them were insanely flavorful. The sauce isn't too think but not too funny, and the lemon one that I got to go with my food had a slight kick to it, but was still a perfect balance of lemon (but not too sour) and herb (but not overwhelming). 
My chicken was cooked to perfection, the skin was flavorful, the meat was tender, and you got tons of it too. The peri chips (fries) were crispy and I absolutely loved the seasoning. Without the food even, the decorations and interior are really cool, and the upbeat music they play makes you want to stay and hang out even when the meal is over. Great meal, I'll be back!

It's all good. Chicken is on point and the sangria is great!

I'm not even a chicken person but I can eat this everyday lol.

Stopped by the New City location of Nando's and really loved it.

I tend to skip a restaurant if I can't figure out how to order. That's the reason I've never returned to Baja Fresh. But Nando's makes it easy and even assigns you a table, which I thought was weird at first. But it does control diners better and prevents the two person party from taking up a booth designed for four. I had the chicken breast wrap with medium spice with peri chips. I also opted for extra chicken in the wrap. The wrap was quite tasty with just the right amount of spice. Love the peri chips but didn't care for the peri mayo on the side.

Menu is fairly large so I'm looking forward to going back and trying more items. Overall, a great somewhat quick lunch spot.

First of all, the process is here is a bit unique. In a nutshell: Walk in and get seated by a host(ess), with a number on a stick matching a table number. Sit down with menus and decide what you want. Go order and pay at the counter, telling them your table number (you don't give them the stick, that goes in the holder on the table). When your food is ready, it will be brought out to your table. When you're done, simply leave.

Now that we have that out of the way, I have only tried a couple things here, but the food is pretty good. On my first visit I had a boneless chicken breast which was tasty, but the skin was soggy and not appetizing, so I picked it off. The description on the menu said the skin would be crispy. The chicken thigh sandwich (Thigh and Mighty) was quite good (it comes with "PERinaise", their mayo-based special sauce.. I say skip it, it doesn't add anything but unneeded calories). The macho peas, which I've had twice, are great and just a bit spicy.

They do serve alcohol, though I've not partaken. They have Coke freestyle machines, which may be the best part!

It can be hard to find this place; while the inside is spacious, the entrance is narrow and tucked in a corner, next to the King Bowl entrance. There are a few tables outside as well.

Um, if you are a fan of chicken liver, try it out here! You will be in for a treat, for sure. I ordered it as medium spicy, but you can order it to your liking. The rice was a great choice as the side cuz it was very flavorful and different, but I think I would have enjoyed some garlic bread or corn as well.

My boyfriend got the wings and loved, loved them. I got to taste the butternut squash and also really good. The best thing is that Nandos has so many hot sauce choices, so I basically tried every one to see which went best with my meal. The verdict? Wild herb. Delissh.

Love the decor, love the music. They also validate parking, so wins all around!

Nando's is life. Just kidding, or am I?

Beginning with my first exposure to Nando's in the UK in 2011, I was a fan. A chain that specializes in elevating chicken to something juicy and flavorful without deep-frying it? It seems too good to be true, but it is the real deal. 

I'm embarrassed to say that I find the medium-hot almost too hot, since I'm a fan of spicy food! But I always try a bit of the hot sauce to test my limits :) 

The sides are great, too. I also love the atmosphere at every Nando's I've been to - very cool interiors. My friend does not love spicy food and found her meal slightly spicy, but she still liked it, as she did her sangria.
Great tasting chicken. Helpful staff who walk you through all the options. Fast casual with great food. Go to place for a quick meal.

Nando's is seriously the best. Been to the West Loop location and this one is just as phenomenal if not better.

Place was busy of course on opening week and so awesome that they teamed up with After School Matters, donating 100% of the proceeds!

While the line was long, it moved quickly. Super well staffed, friendly, and efficient.

As noted in my other review, they are almost full service. They give you a table number and you order your food at the front and they bring it out to you. You also grab sauces, utensils, etc. at the self-serve area. However, the staff will check up on you and will certainly get these things for you if you forget. 

I got the half chicken in extra hot sauce with macho peas and corn on the cob. Food came out pretty quickly. Gosh, their chicken is sooooo good. So much flavor and so juicy. While it is spicy, it has so many other flavors going on. It doesn't even need additional sauces. Didn't think peas could be anything spectacular but proven wrong here. Drizzled some of that garlic sauce on my corn on the cob and I was elated. 

Pretty good value imo in terms of quantity and quality relative to the price.

Love the atmosphere here as the décor makes you feel like you are in South Africa and definitely feel the Portuguese flare to it. Great place honestly for any occasion. 

Nando's is one of my top go-tos.

*Note: this is in the New City mall complex.

I moved to Chicago from Washington, DC in February 2014 during the Polar Vortex (because YOLO) and all winter (so February until June 2014), I walked the cold, dark, damp streets of Chicago wishing I could have some hot and spicy Nando's Peri Peri chicccckkaaaan.  It was just one of *those* restaurants you miss when you move to a new city.  

Well, great news.  Nando's has followed me here to the Windy City.  'Tis true.  They opened a location in Lakeview, West Loop, this one, and as of about two days ago, a location in the Loop.  Yay.  Nando's Sauce is back in maaaaa life.  

I've visited all of the location except the newest Loop location and they're all darling.  

This one is large, warm, welcoming, clean, bright, beautiful, unique and creative in true Nando's fashion.  I took lots of pics (for yoouuuu, yelp) of the dining room.  The colors are fun and bright and it's just a happy artsy place.  We dined on Saturday night around 7-7:30 PM during the first snow storm of the season and it wasn't crowded but I hope it will soon get busy and buzzin' soon.  Line out the door, yo!  You're all gonna want some Nando's Sauce!  Everybody say it with me now, "Nando's Sauce!" 

We had an exceptionally friendly waiter, the chicken was delicious as always (juicy as always) and the garlic bread was buttery as always (two sticks of butter per piece of bread is the recipe, I think...yesm).  The garlic mashed potatoes were melt in your mouth creamy delicious.  

They have the usual suspects too, like nuts, corn, fries, wings, and somewhat boring plain desserts and they have those fancy soda dispensers (I don't drink soda but had way too much fun pressing the touch screen buttons!!!).  

Okay kids, go to Nando's Peri Peri.  It's good stuff.  All my friends in DC, we love us some Nando's Peri Peri.  The SAUCE!  (My fave is the lemon).

After dinner, you can wander around this darling little plaza.  There is a parking garage (not sure if they validate your parking ticket).

Yes, perfect spot to end your day shopping at Mariano's or eye-shopping. This place is spacious and has awesome servers. Love the design of the place and most importantly the chicken! So tender and juicy with every bite. 

I ordered the chicken thighs along with two sides: peas and fries. Although I was still hungry afterwards, place was good.

Chicccckkeeeennn... yummm...

BEWARE: Some of the worst food I've ever had the displeasure of eating.

I ordered the grilled chicken breast with french fries ($13).

The chicken was INCREDIBLY over-cooked. It was absolutely disgusting--so chewy and tough, it was almost inedible.

The "hot sauce" on the chicken had no flavor whatsoever.

Both the french fries and chicken were completely cold when I got them.

Overall, very expensive, terrible food. I will never return.

Nando's is amazing. I have been twice in London and three times in the location on Randolph and I liked the location on Clybourn just as well, if not more so. It's a bit hard to find initially as it's tucked into the "New City" conglomerate, but there's a clean and bright welcome once you do. My gal pals and I had a fun round table near the door and we happily ordered our food and sat down to wait for the delicious chicken to reach our grubby little hands. The staff was extremely helpful in helping the newbies order and settle in by bringing us forgotten silverware and sauces. 

I tried the lemon herb chicken for the first time and was delighted to find that this is a bit spicy as well. The potatoes are still one of my favorite sides and I tried my friend's custard-filled pastry and found that dessert is a must here as well. A friend brought her toddler and was happy to discover they have a children's menu as well, with unlimited yogurt! I will undoubtedly be returning to this and all of the other locations. And now that I have a punch card, I'm on a mission to fill it. So glad you're here, Nando's!

This was my first experience with South African cuisine and it did not disappoint! 

Food: 
Chicken - Tasty and grilled perfectly. Served as is, I think it needed more sauce, but luckily there was plenty on the side. 
Peas - I've never had peas like this before, and they were sooooo good! They had a lot of flavor and had a slight crunch on them.
Liver - Don't let the name scare you, this was by far my favorite dish of the night! It was SO flavorful and served in a hearty gravy. 
Naughty Natas - this is like a deep fried chinese egg tart with puff pastry for the crust. i never knew this was a thing before coming here and now I want it all day every day. 

Service was quick and the food was very affordable. They offer a MYRIAD of sauces, some better than others, but I appreciate the variety. My favorite was the spicy garlic - I was pouring that ish on everything.

Who knew Peri-Peri was Portuguese for salty? 

I didn't hate it, but I'm not sure I get it either. A butterflied chicken breast (was overcooked but willing to overlook), fries and a soft drink was $15. You can get a half chicken dinner at most places for that price. Would try again because a lot of people seem to like it but even all the dipping sauces tasted the same.

This Nando's PERi-PERi location is a bit hidden but once you find it, you're golden! It has it's own parking garage which is nice in the bad weather but it'll cost you a couple dollahs - be sure to validate!

The Nando's way -
1. Let the team know how many are in your party & they'll assign you a table.
2. Get in line/look at a menu
3. Order at the register.
4. Get your fountain drink, find your table, chill out.
5. Servers deliver your food.
6. Eat and enjoy! Wahlah!

It's a little different than other spots, but it's nice not having to worry about holding tables and all that nonsense. Staff is all incredibly friendly and very accommodating, willing to help with anything you need!

I'm way weak with spice and Nando's is not exactly for my kind of weak-blooded peoples. The spice is strong with this one! Even the most mild flavor still had my mouth on fire so I sadly think I'm going to have to stick to plain & then pile on my own flavors. Even the fries are spicy! You must get the mayo with the fries...because mayo makes everything better! Love their mushy peas but those too have some kick to them thanks to chili! All that being said, the chicken is quite yummy, all ingredients are fresh and no dry meat here! Their Natas dessert is nice and served warm, but I've had a much better version of the Portuguese tart at Fat Rice so there's no looking back from that.

Prepare your tastebuds for an explosion of spice and flavor & head over to Nando's PERi-PERi to try chicken the Portuguese South African way!

Maybe it's my age, but I am getting flocking sick and tired of these so called "hostesses" and their flippant attitudes!
I called to place my order and did not indicate the type of sauce I wanted. When she asked me what type of sauce I wanted, what she should've said was, "our choices are...", but she didn't, so I replied medium. This "northside Trixie in training" says "I don't know what medium is". Then  proceeds to run through the choices at breakneck speed. Did she use any deductive reasoning to align my request for "medium" to their offerings? Nah. C'mon! That's like being customer friendly, duh!
 Obviously, I decided not to take the 2 minute walk across the street to help pay her salary.

We stopped in after a movie on Saturday night and waited just a bit for a table. However, the table was still pretty dirty so we had to track someone down to clean it again. Once we got our table assigned, we ordered at the counter. Food was pretty pricey for a counter service place, but it's fresh and delicious. For $20 I got a soft drink, the butterflied chicken breast meal with 2 sides and the grilled cheese side. The chicken was decent, I got it with the lemon herb sauce and it was good. I got the cole slaw and garlic bread as sides and they were amazing! At my friend's recommendation I also got a side of the grilled haloumi cheese..WHOA! My first time trying that cheese and I already went to the store looking to buy some. It was SO good. I don't think I will be craving the chicken, but the rest of my food was fantastic.

I think it's a new location, bathrooms needed attention and one of the soda machines was broken. Hostess was texting the entire time she was at the front.

Overall, I enjoyed my experience here trying South African chicken for the first time!
Good food, quick service. I always get the boneless chicken breast, hot sauce, with a side of the peas and whatever the seasonal vegetable is.

Tired Nando's for the first time and I left there satisfied with the results. I tried the 1/4 chicken breast with the Peri Chips (fries) and I enjoyed it. The chicken wasn't dry and was flavorful, the fries were very tasty as well. Now that I know they're in my neighborhood, I'll definitely be coming back.

TIP:  DON'T GO TO THIS LOCATION

Like the previous reviewer said, "I'm getting sick and tired of these "hostesses" and their flippant attitudes!  Right on bro, it's Nando's Peri Peri way of training... hire anybody off the street, pay them minimum wage, make sure the customers pay first before tasting the food or getting any service so nobody skips out without paying!!!

When I placed my order with the dippy cashier/manager I got fake-nice responses to questions I asked about the menu, especially about the sauces.  It seemed as though this was her first day on the job and I was her first customer ever. Kind of like, the glass half empty or half full.  

So what kind of service did I get..... the server brought out the meal and that was the last I saw of him!  There's no can I get you anything, there's no bringing water to your table, they don't show you where all the extra sauces are, the extra butter, etc.  I had to get up twice and ask where the butter was, it's carefully hidden AWAY from the condiment section.  Once again, that dippy manager seemed beside herself when I asked where she moved the butter. 

Although the chicken I ordered was tasty, it was puny.  I've never had a half a chicken before that was more like a few pieces of wings.  It's not filling.... and this is from someone that doesn't eat large portions.  The corn on the cob was good, but that was it.  After I left Nando's I was STILL hungry! 

The END -- After leaving (hungry) I passed by the cooking area and all of a sudden these mini bottles came flying out of nowhere almost hitting me.  So what does dippy manager say, NOTHING, ignoring it like it didn't happen and walking away.  When I confronted her she pretends not to hear me and then I yelled at her reminding her what just happened and she just walks away, no apology, nothing!  Are you kidding me?  Who hired her?  I'll be talking to the general manager about this location.

This place is a joke.  No wonder no one was eating there.

The menu is really hard to read and needs simplification so it's a little overwhelming but once you figure it out the overall experience is a lot better. The chicken is REALLY freaking good. The sides are amazing, I recommend the corn on the cob and mashed potatoes. I recommend to ask a lot of questions to your waiter. But other than that, the experience is great and the owner of the restaurant checks up on his customers frequently so the service is awesome. Wish the outside patio was a lot bigger because they're situated in a great area. I definitely recommend eating outside when the weather is nice. The imported beer for Portugal is also great. More people should check out this place.

Another day. Another Nando's! This establishment in NewCity is no different than the other ones I have been to, and it did not disappoint! 
We got the whole chicken dinner with nando's chips and garlic bread. I always prefer the extra spicy, and dipping the chicken into the lemon-garlic sauce to get a good mixture of flavors. 
The service was good and the food left me full! Another successful Nando's!

I absolutely love nando's food - the chicken is always so moist and so flavorful and the sides are to die for. their macho-peas are probably my favorite, nice and mushy with a good kick to them! 

however, my experience at this specific nando's was SO HORRIBLE.

i walked in to pick up my take-out order. I had to pay for parking bc there wasn't any free parking available at the time - but i was willing to pay in order to get the yummy food!

the host greeted me, took my money and I asked how long it would take because my order confirmation had said 7p. He then walked to the back (restaurant was practically empty, mind you!) - came back and said "they ran out of chicken.." - no follow up of what that meant or what I should do.. he barely made eye contact and shrugged his shoulders. i then explained to him that my confirmation said that my food would be ready by a certain time to which he said "i'm just the messenger!" and walked away.. 

at 7:02 (which, is totally fine, time wise to me.. i am not picking at a 2 min delay in food!!) - the manager himself comes out hands me my food and mutters under his breath "7 o' clock on the dot!" with attitude and walked away. 

first: you don't tell your customers you're out of the food you specialize in AFTER their order has been accepted WITHOUT an explanation like "but they are getting more" or "we apologize for the wait, it may be just a little longer" 

second: don't passive-aggressively mutter something under your breath when it was YOUR employee who told your customer that you "ran out of chicken" 

all this to say - customer service was horrendous. I did not appreciate their service and unkind gestures. It was enough to make me never want to go back to their restaurant. it's sad - because the food is pretty amazing..

Nando's PERi-PERi was delicious, quick, and easy! This fast casual spot offers tasty chicken dishes with the famous and tasty PERi-PERI sauce. I ordered 1/4 of a chicken breast (on the bone) with two sides for around $10. For sides, I tried the macho peas (peas with a delicious mint and chili sauce) and the garlic mashed potatoes. Both were delicious! You can order your food with mild, medium, hot, or extra hot spices. I love spicy food, and the medium was definitely spicy enough for me. You can also grab tons of extra free sauce bottles to bring to your table while you eat. Will definitely be back!

I had been to their other location on Randolph and had thought the chicken was a little spicy for my liking. My friend was hungry and wanted to try this place. The seating is confusing and complicated for no reason....just let people sit where they want! I got the chicken sandwich plain and the mashed potatoes...it was alright. My friend got the 1/4 chicken and rice...he ate it all despite confusing their mustard sauce for not being spicy...which it was. Again, I think these brand is alright but I am not going to run back here again. It will do if you are not into the other places in this center.

I was SO excited to drive by and see Nando's on the sign at this new development. My husband has gone to the other location for lunch several times and raves about it so I wanted my turn! 

Guys. It was so good. The chicken was well seasoned but still tender, and the sides are delicious. The butternut squash one I went home and immediately googled how to recreate it at home (it won't be quite the same without adding a few dashes of their yummy sauces but will do in a crunch!) The garlic bread sandwich my hubby had looked even better so that will be my next try. In terms of the flavoring, I found even the Lemon Herb to have some heat so if you don't like spice I would stick with the lowest level!

The only downfall was the sangria. It seemed like wine with sparking water or something bubbly added, then fruit added as an afterthought. Not impressed, and it wasn't cheap either! I heard another table discuss this with a worker too, so maybe it will improve. 

Another potential worry is about parking when all of the businesses open (especially Marianos!) and parking is paid so be sure to ask for validation to reduce the price down to $2 for us when we ate there, if you do carry out and leave right away it might be free with validation, maybe?? I also just foresee lots of trouble with the paying to park situation in general here but we'll see how it goes! It's also a short walk from the red line North Clybourn stop so that's an option :)

Oh and there's patio seating! Woohoo!

Best grilled chicken. Meat inside was juicy with crispy skin. I also ordered nutty date chicken salad. It tasted great. I liked shredded peri-peri chicken that was in salad. It had a little kick of spice in it. 

Reasonable price and nice decor. Can't wait to go back again.

Really good. Spice is not my friend lately so I went with a leg/thigh designated "plain-ish" and took a few samples of sauce at the condiment/beverage station. The chicken is delicious without anything added. I'd also strongly suggest the up-charge for the mayo dip if you order fries (chips) as it was a great addition. 
I didn't love the chocolate spoon cake as much as I expected but it was fine.
The chardonnay by the glass was quite respectable and it was a generous pour.
Best thing of all was Kelsey. She was a really friendly guide for this Nando's first timer.

Food is great, frequent the west loop one regularly. This one needs a little work on their carry-out for call-in and online orders.  They need a separate line for carry out, no one ever knows what they want here so waiting in the same line as the orders doesn't make any sense. They also forgot 2 things in my order and didn't prepare the chicken sandwich as ordered.  

Overall good chain but this one is going through some starting issues.

Food was Just ok.  Had the boneless chicken breast with one side.  Nothing special.  Small portion, overpriced.
Felt the staff was friendly and helpful.  Clean, inviting environment.

Delayed review for my visit with coworker's back in late November when I worked downtown. We arrived here for lunch and were seated promptly. The restaurant is beautifully decorated. You get a few sauces at your table to try out, which I liked. You order your food at the register and the servers bring it to your table. I personally liked the food because it was very flavorful. Ordererd a lemon chicken wrap with a side of rice. The rice was good but needed just a touch more seasoning. 

My first qualm about this place, was a lack of menu options. 

Second complaint, was for my credit card being charged twice for one meal. I saw a double charge on my bank statement and had to call the restaurant about this matter. 

Overall I still enjoyed the food and atmosphere here, so I'll give this place another try if I'll be in the area. Cash only this time.

OMG this place is fantastic! Despite first impressions, this is not a sit down restaurant, but actually a kind of "serve yourself" place. Even more convenient place to fill up on delicious food if you are seeing a movie after; you know, to avoid buying the rip off $7.00 barrels of popcorn from ArcLight theatre.

My party and I shared the chicken sampler which came with two sides. The deal is, like I said, you order from the counter and then sit anywhere you like. Oh, and for drinks, you go over to a drink station which has every kind of soft drink, fruit juice or tea you want. I had a meltdown when I saw they had Mr. Pibb (didn't know that was even made anymore) because I had sworn off soft drinks for years. Update: I had 5 glasses of Mr. Pibb here. :-O And there are free refills!! And while you're over there, pick up the four sauces to top your chicken with (Hot, garlic, herb, lemon.) 

Now for the chicken....it is DELICIOUS. Tender, fall off the bone tender! Now get busy and douse it with one of the awesome sauces and you've just entered HEAVEN. Service people are pleasant and efficient!
Fun vibe and good food. I love that you can try all the different sauces to see which works for you. The chicken is very good - tender and flavorful. I really enjoyed the pea mash oddly enough.

Randomly stumbled upon Nando's PERi-PERi restaurant while in North/Old Town area and though it was completely unexpected, I loved my meal there.  The restaurant's ambiance is the first captivator because it had fantastic Afro/Latin beats pumping around the clock and a fantastic design and color scheme.  Beautiful wooden seating under dim lighting with color and fabrics everywhere, made for a sensory experience.  This location in particular is beautiful.

Now onto the food!  Not expecting fire-griled chicken, I chose the double chicken wrap special.  It arrived in a large wrap with clear grill marks on it.  The wrap was stuffed with fantastically marinated and cooked chicken with a hefty amount of romaine lettuce and sauce.  The chicken spice I chose was the Lemon Herb, lower on the heat scale, but the flavor was slightly acidic, a well balanced savory level and a delightful flare of heat here and there.  It was a heat that reminded you of its presence occasionally, but never overwhelmed you.  The wrap was coupled with fresh romaine and a nice peri-style sauce.  The wrap would have benefitted from more veggies though, great base ingredients but the flavors demand more textures (crunch).  The "chips" were perfectly cooked and well seasoned with a hint of spice.  Honestly some of the best fries I've had and the peri-sauce was a great addition (who need ketchup!).  I look forward to returning to sample the larger menu.

Nando's also offered great service with a friendly and attentive staff.  Now my final reason for 5 Stars... they had a handsink in the dining room, right next to the beverage and silverware station!  I know that doesn't sound like much but the former-health-inspector in me appreciates the role of hand washing and raising its accessibility like this (in a casual and well designed way) is extremely important.  I've never seen that and can't wait to see that design element spread.  Saúde!

I have been to the location on Diversey many times, and I have been to the location on Clybourn once. Let's face it, the food here is delicious. I love all of the sauces that are available for dipping, and I could eat the chicken all day, every day. I love the peas here, too.

The ambiance in this place is fun, casual and friendly. If I wanted a nicer dinner, I probably wouldn't go here, but it's perfect for lunch or a low-key dinner.

We loved this place!! 

First off the service was really good.  Very welcoming  staff and when I asked for suggestions they were happy to give them.

I had the half chicken with two sides, those being garlic bread and fries.  I ordered my chicken hot and it had a lot of flavor.  The sides were great.  My mouth was not on fire but there was a nice lingering heat.  My friend had a chicken sandwich and he said it was one of the best he's had.  He also had the mashed potatoes which were really tasty.

The peri peri sauces are great, I sampled a little of each and I must say the garlic one was my favorite, so much so I bought a bottle to take home. 

Great decor and a big mix of people for a Tuesday night, lots of ethnicities and great African-Esque house music.  We will be back!!
An absolute treat to dine here! Phenomenal service as always! Couldn't have started the year with anything else but the peri peri chicken! #nandoschicago #periperi #hotchicks

We went to The New City to find a place to eat. My Fiance and I were so hungry so we chose to eat here today. We had a lot of coupons to use so we decided to try Nandos (we thought it's a Mexican  restaurant)...but it's a South African/Portuguese. We decided to used the free entree with an order of another entree. Pretty much self-service. I ordered the chicken breast with a side of fries...fast forward... Food came, I got a side of rice instead. At first, i was hesitant to tell the server that they made a mistake.... But the good thing was, it's the assistant manager who served the food, I think her name was, Jenna. Right away, she apologized and told me she'll gives us a side of fries.... Awesome! We felt spoiled. Food was very flavorful. I ended up liking the rice. Love that they have different kinds of hot sauce to choose from. We'll be coming back to explore the menu. Must try....

Nando's is the best. We're excited to have it in Chicago! Try the 1/4 or 1/2 chicken, Portuguese Rice, and Butternut Squash and Couscous Salad! The Garlic Olives are fantastic too!!! You can't go wrong at Nando's. My son once said, "This is the best chicken I've ever had. It's way better than how you built it up...and you REALLY built it up, dad." The staff is so welcoming and the business regularly gives back to the community. The food is excellent, always fresh and flavorful. Start with the Plain-ish Sauce and work your way up the heat chain. You won't regret it. Bring you family and friends to a brand new local fave. @NandosUSA #TheNewEatMoreChickenPlace

We love PERI-PERI but our experience at the Clybourn location was less than pleasant.There is a display of PERI-PERI sauces in the restaurant area so we picked up two and placed them on the table to pay for them on the way out. The manager came over 3 times to make sure that we knew we had to pay for them. He had his hostess interrupt our dinner to bring us a bill and ask if we were ready to pay for the sauces, total $11.04 while we had food in our hands! We told her we would pay for them after we ate. The second my husband took his last bite, the manager came over with a second receipt asking us to pay for the sauces!

We were told they would comp the parking fee but when we left, they only stamped the ticket for $6.00 and parking was $8.00. We are seasoned adults and were completely insulted that the wait staff who are probably 20 years our junior, thought we would steal 2 bottle of sauce that they had on display! We will never go back and I suggest you don't either.

Try the Diversey restaurant, maybe they are friendlier!

This place is a chicken lovers paradise. The peri peri chicken is just amazing. The spicy fries and mayo a must have. 

There are sauces to suit anybody's tolerance to heat. This place ia buzzing on the weekends, but a very nice option to grab a quick meal during the weekedays with very little wait times. I have been a regular here since it opened and definetely enjoy the ambiance and food.

I have many South African friends who for YEARS have longed for Nando's chicken, and now it is here, and now I know why the longing. Nando's works to create a richly marinaded chicken, that is completely infused with flavor and moisture. Combine that with a cool vibe, great customer service and excellent sides like the seasoned fries and mayo, and the cole slaw, and you've got a winner here. This location has well-trained attentive staff. You order at the counter, then you can eat in with some table-side service and bussing, or take it to go. My husband enjoyed the medium heat on his chicken, while I ate the lemon herbed chicken, both were delicious. Extra bonus: liquor license.

Came here with my wife food was amazing! Love the concept and environment! They were welcoming and the manager took the time to explain everything about the Resturaunt.  I ordered the 1/4 chicken breast with macho peas and garlic bread.  I was almost going to lick my fingers clean how delicious it was.  My wife enjoyed her Portuguese rice and thigh.  Overall great experience a little pricey but worth experiencing and trying their delicious food at least once!

I've had the Chicken Wrap here a couple times.  Nothing very unique but still good, and the sauces are very tasty.  Fries are also good.  The atmosphere of the restaurants are casual, relaxed, and modern, so it's quite an enjoyable place to sit down for a relatively affordable lunch.

grateful vegi...

substantial options for us veggies in the land of the famous chicken, thank you. i've had nando's overseas and have thoroughly enjoyed their veggie burger. i should've stuck to that. i branched out and tried the veggie wrap and it tasted like pickled goat cheese on a wheat tortilla. it also tasted like it came straight from the refrigerator. not what i was after. the mushy peas are the best, however, especially because i just don't care for their fries - not crispy and too chunky. also, the glorified bread sticks are exactly how they are described. it's toast, people. pass.
my friend loved her chicken breast and was intrigued by the different sauces. we both loved the laid back atmosphere with wine/beer offerings - perfect set-up right before our movie. pretty sure the management was there from overseas probably to get this new location off the ground. hoping the remarkable service remains once they leave!

This place would normally have a higher rating but for the fact that I know what nandos is supposed to taste like. We have had nandos in England for over 10 years, I am sure with a couple more years of practice this nandos will catch up and make the best chicken in the world too!
Also staff were absolutely lovely

I have been to Nando's countless times and have never had a bad experience. They are an excellent spot to stop for either lunch or dinner. I recommend the chicken burger extra hot but it is equally good for those who do not prefer the extra spice. This is easily the best place to eat in new city. And in addition to excellent food, the staff are always incredibly friendly and helpful. They even have good beer to boot.

The manager Jalisa was super rude. We were actually dining inside when we called for a carry out order because we were running to the store hoping it would be done by the time we were done shopping. Jalisa answered and said it was super busy and we would have to be put on hold for awhile. When we left she wasn't even doing anything except standing around. I stayed on hold for 30 minutes... I finally hung up and we decided just to come back and place the order. When we came in she was by the door...no where near the phone, so she definitely forgot about us on the phone. She asked how many for a table and we said we called for carry out. I was in the middle of explaining that she left us on hold for so long, but she completely ignored me and just moved on to the next customer. She was really rude to the guy behind us telling him he couldn't get a drink while he was waiting 30+ minutes for a table because he was thirsty. When we got to the register, we asked if she was the manager and the cashier said yes. We asked for her name, he told us, and she answered "do you need me?". We explained we needed her a half hour ago when we were put on hold and all she said was "oh sorry" and walked away. I'm sorry, but as a manager, you shouldn't act all nonchalantly about being rude to customers and forgetting about them. She must not care about her job that much to be acting like that. I understand it's busy, and you're probably frustrated, but do not ever take it out on me when I'm trying to give your company money for your manager paycheck. Point blank. I'm really disappointed and this was my first time here. I won't be back.

The fries and perinaise are amazing, and I love the atmosphere. The chicken is just ok, and should be better for the price. The staff is super friendly, however on multiple occasions they have misunderstood my order... Perhaps more training is needed? Still a solid place for lunch, just don't expect a 5-star experience.
The food is great but the service is horrible. The hostess was so rude and sassy to me for no reason other than asking a question about the menu.

Nando Peri Peri is an amazing restaurant. It is a great place to go for plain grilled chicken while allowing different options for sauces! The sauces are delicious! The entire restaurant is an awesome atmosphere and I would recommend it to anyone.

That peri peri seasoning is just too good. I can't wait to go back and try more, but I had the 1/4 turkey leg with the side of portuguese rice. Tried a little bit of my husband's peas and that was good too. You can't really get carrot cake wrong, and they did not fail on that either. The atmosphere is perfect for families, and a good chain to bring to the Chicago area. My one wish is that the portions were just a little bigger. Skip the hummus app.

Ah yes - this place hit the peri-peri shaped hole in my heart. Really tasty chicken, super good fries with the peri peri mayo and the macho peas were fantastic. Would highly recommend the house red sangria. It was full of spice and magic. Definitely come here.
Fantastic! The best place to grab a cheap bite in the area. Chicken is delicious!! Definitely check it out.

I love this place! Coming from the UK I have visited this place often. I am a vegetarian and my favourite is halloumi  wrap with mash and peas. The corn and coleslaw is good too. Go to Nando's it's delicious!

Great new local place!! There food is very authentic and tasty! 
I love the little interior and the decorations! 
We will be back soon!!

Haven't had good pad si ew in a long time and was craving it so I found this place while traveling for work. Almost couldn't find the place because it's so small and they didn't have a sign. I asked if they just opened,  but the lady said they've been open for a few months. 

Was very good...fresh and juicy made with Chinese broccoli! I get so upset when places make it with American broccoli...yuck! This place serves it with a hot sauce which I've never seen before. I didn't eat it though because I like the sweetness of the pad si ew and didn't want to ruin it by burning my mouth up! Just wish they gave bigger portions because I like leftovers. 

It's very small... you get your own utensils, water, and clean the dishes off the table so there's really no service.  The only con was they didn't have a bathroom and I like to wash my hands before I eat so that's not very good. Plus if I had to go to the bathroom, they recommended starbucks a block away lol. 

Overall, cute little place. More for take-out though.

While I hunted for this place for a while (the address was incorrectly listed for a while) I did happen to finally find this place in the Daley Plaza.

Amongst the sweaty vendors, fragrant flowers and tourists who were ruining my lunch hour..I found Rock n Roll noodles. A perfectly quaint vendor with lunch to go, Anna was slinging pad thai, pad see ew and various other dishes with ease. The pad thai was ****/****


Anna takes card if you're worried about it being cash only!

So thrilled about my lemongrass chicken bowl takeout! Sometimes when you order to go what you get is less inspiring, but not the case here! Ample portion and a whole pack of different additions (crunchy things, peanuts, shoots, cilantro, limes, hot sauce, AND peanut sauce). I was so excited when I opened my brown bag (*‿*)

This listing is rather confusing at first glance - they used to be at Farmer's Markets, but now have a storefront restaurant at Montrose & Ravenswood.  Check the address, not the map!

I was happy with my visit to Rock 'n'Roll Noodle Company for lunch this afternoon.  The location is great (right under the Montrose brown line station, and near the Industrial corridor on Ravenswood for all of the office drones to come by) and the decor is fun and funky.

The owner, Anna, was behind the counter herself, taking orders and running back to the kitchen.  It was a little hectic with the lunch rush, but not bad, and you always get a break when you've only been open for 2 weeks.  I misread one of the menu items and ordered incorrectly, and Anna insisted on comping it even though the misunderstanding was ultimately my fault - I tried to pay, honest!  She was super nice.

The food was overall very good - stand-outs included the super-tasty egg roll and the pad kee mao, which comes with skirt steak.  Order it spicy! My coworkers who ordered the pad thai did say that it was strangely bland and one-note - perhaps it was an off day, or maybe it's just better to order more adventurously off the menu!  Also, be sure to grab one of the cane-sugar sodas for a bubbly pick-me-up.  Or, the thai iced coffee looked amazing too.

I am definitely looking forward to coming back and trying the massamun curry (made with beef cheek) and the incredible-sounding rice pudding.

Yummy, authentic Thai food. Easy for the family. Friendly staff. Neat neighborhood. Convenient for brown line. So glad we came!
We had lemongrass chicken with noodles, pad Thai and pad see ew. Great portion size. Plenty for big eaters.

I tell my kids let's try the place under the train
Mad love
$$$
I paid $35 dollars
For
2 egg rolls
Lemon grass chicken
Papaya salad and thai ice coffee
You order and pick up in the counter
Serve self your own water
Was ok

I met the owner today when she was serving her food at my office through Fooda. See was so welcoming and passionate about her food. With good reason too, everything it homemade and delicious. You can taste the love she has for Thai food. I had their potstickers and red curry with chicken. It was topped with homemade fried garlic and fried shallots.

We are fans of Rock n' Roll Noodle's booth at the Daley Center Farmers' Market, so we knew we had to check out Mad Love.  We came during opening week, on a Saturday afternoon. 

The dining room walls are covered with hand painted murals and a cool decoupage area, great for I Spy with the kids while waiting for your food.  Vintage cash register and music played from a record player round out the atmosphere.  

The highlight of our day was of course the food.  We ordered lemongrass chicken, basil chicken, massamun curry, pad thai, fresh pad thai spring roll, fried rice, and sticky rice pudding.  My 2 favorites were the basil chicken and the sticky rice pudding.  Wonderful!

The chef / owner Anna Abbey checked on us and chatted for a while.  Another member of the kitchen staff came out and was also really sweet.  

We left with full, happy bellies and even a few leftovers. We are looking forward to returning and eating our way through the rest of the menu.  If you are not into sticky rice pudding, Margie's is across the street.  I'll take the pudding over ice cream any day!

I want to love this place hardcore; it's right in my backyard.

The food was good. I tried the Pad Thai dish on my first visit. They use an interesting rice type noodle that you don't see a lot on this dish. This paired with a can of Hansens soda and tip was $20! I'm not saying the food isn't better than competing Thai places, it is....but not double the price, especially when it's order at the counter.

The decor is cute and gives it a definite sense of place. Great that it's right off the train. 

I might come back and bring a friend to try it out again, but I wish the prices were a little more competitive.

Just to be clear this will not be a review or a critique. Think of it as a guide from a customer that could lead to future sucess. A yellow brick road where you might encounter some Lions, Tigers, and Bears but eventually you end up seeing the Great Wizard.

There were some very imperfect parts of my dining experience that I think could be improved with a little time and experience. Starting with service. I was there for quite some time maybe an hour or so and outside of when they initially brought me the food I never heard from them again. That didn't seem to be the case with the other review so there seems to be some inconsistency. The plasticware in my opinion should be replaced with silverware. I just think it  makes things  little more legitimate. Plasticware works at the farmers market but it shouldn't be present at a legitimate Thai spot. The idea of using Mashed Potatoes as an option with Massannamon Curry is brilliant, I love it. However by the time my food came out the potatoes were barely luke warm even somewhat cold in spots. Being a Mashed Potatoe fan I know how quickly they can cool off. There has got to be a way to keep them hot when they arrive at your table. Lastly my Curry dish along with a Thai Iced Coffee was almost $20 a little steep for a casual spot in Ravenswood. Again I am not critiquing my experience I'm just pointing out a few things that could improve as they begin their what hopes to be a successful journey. 

The good points include an extremely flavorful bowl of Curry. A very interesting flavor combination made everything dance in my mouth. The Mashed Potatoes is a brilliant alternative to rice. The sounds of Motown provided an interesting and comfortable vibe. 

Overall I understand it's just their first week open so imperfections are bound to happen. Hopefully I provided a few areas where they could improve. I do love to support mom-and-pop spots and so much want them to be successful. I will be back and encourage as many people as possible to check them out and support them.

Fabulous flavors, cute and cozy ambiance, but for the high prices (for Thai food), it should not be counter service and the dishes and flatware should be upgraded.  

Also, closing at 8pm is beyond insane.  I've wanted to order from here for dinner at least 6 times now and have had to choose otherwise because they were closed. At 8pm. Seriously.

Please stay open later and you'll have a happy customer base!

Came in the first week they opened and have come every chance I can get since.  I absolutely love the pad Thai - it's so flavorful and doesn't feel heavy and greasy like other restaurants.  Also love the egg rolls and spring rolls - everything I've tried here is great.

I greatly enjoy the decor and communal eating set up.  I also have had great experiences chatting with the staff including the owner - it really seems like it's important to Mad Love to be a part of the neighborhood and they value regulars and the opportunity to connect with the community!

I'm actually going to get some today. Yum.

We were walking down Montrose trying to pick a place to eat, when we looked inside Mad Love and a patron at the table by the window motioned us to come in. That was enough to convince me! 

I had the lemongrass chicken bowl on a bed of greens and a Thai iced coffee.  The bowl on a bed of greens was basically a salad with very good portions of meat, herbs, and pickled veggies.  I really liked the pickled vegetables that came with the bowl and they paired well with the chicken. The staff was super friendly and the decor was nice.

Fresh and flavorful, the best Thai food I've had in a long time. My favorite dish so far is the lemongrass chicken bowl. I also like the fun, upbeat oldies soundtrack and cute, cheerful decor. They need better signage, though; I passed by it for months before I noticed it, which happened with the previous restaurant in that location, or maybe that's just me?

I was so looking forward to having another  restaurant in the area - especially since I work from home.  But I must say, I was highly disappointed. 

Food - I ordered a noodle dish (the one with sweet potato noodles) and it was completely bland.  I finally asked for some hot sauce (I was surprised the standards were not on the tables or out by the water)

Another reviewer commented about the plastic utensils - I found them tacking since I was eating In.

Owner / waitstaff / employees - I went got a late lunch on a weekday.  When I got there only one other customer was there. He was standing at the counter speaking to the other but not about the food.  This went on a while & it took her a while to barely acknowledge my presence & take my order.  There was at least three "employees" there but not one picked up the garbage at a vacant table until a couple came in and asked if the table was occupied.  I also got the privilege of hearing one of the employees Skype conversation (both ends of the conversation). Super annoying & unprofessional I found it.  

I might try something else for take our as the place is so close.

I've been looking for good thai food in the city for awhile now so I was thrilled when I came across Rock 'N Roll Noodle! Hands down the best pad thai in Chicago! It's so fresh, light, and full of flavor. 

The owner, Anna Abbey, is extremely passionate about serving authentic, fresh thai food. Her passion for serving top quality food is incredible. Also, she is super friendly...talk about fantastic service. I have nothing but great things to say about this establishment. I'm excited to try different things on their menu once their new location opens up in Ravenswood!

Not a good start for this new local spot. Their AC hasn't been working. They have been out of Spring Rolls the first two times I have visited the restaurant. You order at the counter and then bus your own dishes, yet they seem to expect a tip when you place your order (using square). The food seems fresh but needs some seafood (every Thai restaurant offers Shrimp) and variety.  Please improve.

I live close by and am elated I have a high quality option so close to my door. I've probably eaten from here a couple of times take away, and once dine in. Super flavorful and fresh, the quality really comes through. It's higher end than hangover food, but it's great hangover food.

Such a great addition the the neighborhood food scene. Don't miss the sticky rice pudding, if you have room after the generous and delicious dishes on the rest of the menu. Anna, you're a goddess! Welcome!
Great neighborhood addition.  I have ordered a number of items on their menu and have not been disappointed.

I had an amazing dinner this evening!  The service was fantastic... the food was delicious... the portions are enormous!  This authentic Thai restaurant is filled with flavor, fresh ingredients in a cheery, bright environment.  I highly recommend that you give this a try for yummy food outside of downtown Chicago!

Great name for this place because this is how I feel about it.  First time here, after checking out their food at a farmer's market and not being able to forget how delicious it was.  I tried all their vegan stuff previously, and today I had succulent lemon grass chicken, and the hubs had garlic chicken that was savory like you can't imagine.  Right across from Margie's Ice Cream on Montrose, so you can get an outstanding dinner and then head across the street for dessert.  Five stars fo sho.

I had the tofu bowl with mixed greens, and it was awesome! Just the right amount of spice and flavoring and the tofu was so well seared and not too watery as many tofu dishes are. The veggies were also well cooked and added more variety to a very tofu-heavy dish, and the bed of greens was a nice crisp and refreshing finish. The décor inside is super cute and hand painted. The staff was very friendly and the owner came out and made sure we enjoyed our dishes. My boyfriend also loved his dish. We'll definitely be going back!
One of my new favorite places for Thai food on the north side. Delicious vegetarian options that always taste fresh & flavorful without salty. The roti bread is a fun surprise too!
Solid options. Fried rice was excellent.

Based on rave reviews from fellow Yelpers, I tried Pad See Ew for the first time here for a weekend dinner. The dish was too salty and too greasy.  Although the portion was generous, I felt a little sick about the half way.  The price was a little high side ($10) for this relatively plain dish in the Thai competitive neighborhood.

As a very loyal consumer of a neighborhood Thai place that always performs, it was hard to step out of my comfort zone to try Mad Love. Luckily, it did not disappoint! Lemongrass chicken was amazing-fresh and flavorful, a simple but perfect combination. The pad Thai was very good and had a light feel (if that is possible for pad Thai). Keep it up, Mad Love. Welcome to the neighborhood!

I've been a fan of Rock n Roll Noodle from the Daley Plaza farmer's markets and have been excited for a brick and mortar restaurant to open! I have to say, after my first visit, I was not disappointed and will be back again. I decided to try the Pad Kee Meow (hahaha) and it had just the right amount of spice without being overpowering (and I do love things hot).  The noodles were luxurious and I feel like I got way more veggies in my dish than your typical pad kee mao.  We also had Pad Thai spring rolls which were delicious as usual and I had a little taste of curry on mashed potatoes (who knew- a winning combo!). 

The space is really cute, I just wish it was bigger and I can't wait to see what's in store after they've been open a little longer.

Cute counter service/take out Thai street food spot. They provide a couple tables in case you want to eat there :) and of course you do. The music and vibe is great you feel like you are at home. We had almost everything on the menu by now... My favorites: pod kee meow, basil chicken, massamun curry, kids love larb! and of course the rice pudding is amazing. The food was steaming hot, and fresh. Can't wait to go back.
Had the basil chicken and pad thai. Both were excellent and massive portions. Will be back.

I take issue with the person who found the prices high. My group of three people who all eat at lots of Thai restaurants found the prices one of the best parts of our meal. Also, we all found the food to be terrific and each had different entrees plus egg rolls. As others have said, the portions are large, food is fresh and we're going back asap. We were thrilled to find a great new spot!

I've been working nearby since January and miss the options downtown. Needless to say, I was anxious to try this cute spot when it opened! Mad Love has exceeded my expectations. I frequently crave and have to indulge in the Lemongrass Chicken. Curious? Try it! Perfect lunch spot. The only thing they are missing is option of delivery!

I have been eating Rock and Roll Noodle for years and was so excited that Mad Love is finally open! This is the best Thai food around! I've been in for dinner and lunch in the past week and was not disappointed. The Larb is my absolute favorite - it's so fresh tasting and bursting with flavor in every bite! I also had the Lemongrass Chicken salad bowl which hit the spot. I loved all of the colorful garnishes that are a perfect accent to the rich, savory chicken. The classic spring rolls were full of crisp veggies and were so refreshing - a perfect starter to share with a friend. Other bonuses: the decor is adorable and I love supporting this family run business! I can't wait to go back!

On a recent visit to Chicago for a conference, I was desperate for some fresh, smart food.  Heard through a Los Angeles friend that a new Thai-inspired noodle place had opened up in Chicago.  With Google maps in hand, I abandoned the overcooked meat and limp vegetable fare offered at my conference hotel and headed out in search of Rock 'n Roll Noodle.  I was thoroughly pleased by my choice to venture out:  the freshness of the food, the service, and the cute neighborhood were well-worth the trip.   Chicago--I'm jealous.  You've got a great restaurant.

As soon as farmers market season starts, I eat this stuff at least once (sometimes twice) a week. Good-sized portions and big flavors. Sometimes they run out of certain menu items later during the lunch rush, but it really doesn't matter what I order everything has been nom nom nom good!  (Note: Please be kind and bring some singles; it's nice to go to the market with more than $20s)

I was SUPER sad when my favorite Thai place closed but then two weeks later, I found this GEM. Seriously a GEM.

Twice now, I've visited the Nosh Marketplace in Block 37 and Rock and Roll draws me and impresses me every time. 

I get a combo plate and am then surmounted by delicious food. They are so attentive when preparing the food to make sure you like everything they're putting on your plate. Those ladies take me out of my standard-order bubble and pop it into a confetti of shower down on me, dance because it's so delicious, bites that hit all the taste buds.

Rock & Roll is not to be missed or passed up. You'll be hooked for forever.
Very good vegetarian sesame noodles and pad see ew from their stall at the Federal Plaza farmers market.
Just picked some up at the Federal Plaza farmers' market.  Really really good!!  Worth $8, as I can eat the other half tomorrow!!

They visit my work thru Fooda The lemongrass Curry Chicken IS AMAZING!! all the ingredients are SUPER fresh. My only concern is am I able to get this food all the time??? Im not sure what famers market is, if its a restaurant. But the food is awesome and the staff is totally cool too!!! I have had it 3 times so far and every time great!! you got a customer for life!

They came to my office today with Fooda and I got the Neau Nam Tok Bowl which was seriously delicious and  a pad thai spring roll which was huge and super fresh.
