Everything was so good that I rushed back in line to get the chap chae to eat for lunch the next day. I hope they come back to our office soon!
At Daley Plaza.  Purchased Noodles with pork, carrots, cilantro, and sauce.  Very good.  Nine dollars, but large portion.

I have been going to get fresh Asian food from them for over 2 years now and I hate the winters because of them.  I usually get the chap chae and it is epic and their sticky rice, oh their sticky rice.  A-MAZING!!  I wish that I had a way to get their dishes throughout the year because one day a week for a few months out of the year just isn't enough!!
The basil chicken with brown rice was amazing today!  Well worth $8!
Amazing noodle salad at the Daley Plaza Farmers Market.  $8 for a generous bowl of noodles that more than filled me up.  I will be having them for lunch each & every Thursday when the market is open!

Everything I've eaten there is amazing. The coconut curry is to die for. The spring rolls...delicious! Pad Thai...yes please! Almost everything is gluten free and soooo fantastic! Run, don't to the Thursday Farmers Market at Daley Plaza!!

Great find at the Thursday Daley Plaza Farmer's Market.  I had the lemongrass bahn mi sandwich.   It was deliciously spicy and full of flavor!  A great fresh lunch option for $7.  May have to make this a regular stop.  Get there early, they sell out!

I appreciate the fact they use locally-sourced, organic and sustainable ingredients in their dishes.  Healthy inexpensive gourmet!

Ready to explode - in a great way!
Rock-n-roll Noodle Company is great.  I just enjoyed 3 full days of their food at Lollapalooza's Farmer's Market and super excited to see them get huge in Chicago!  Healthy, full of flavor, socially-conscious - win win win!
I heard Whole Foods might start carrying some of their yummy food.

Whether it is at the Daley Center's Farmers Market, Division Street Farmers Market, pre-packaged at Whole Foods, or a restaurant (please?): Rock-n-Roll Noodle Co., you are a new star that will hopefully only get brighter and brighter!

PS - Although I read reviews, I have never posted one - RnRNoodle changed that!
The best service in Pilsen the best tacos the most flavorful and it's cheap  veryyyyy good COME TO THIS PLACE
This is a tasty, authentic Mexican spot. Highlights for me were the warm salsa and the homemade tortillas!
This place is really casual, but has some of the best chilaquiles I've tried so far.

This place is great.  I've been here a few times.
The service is okay and everything I've had so far tastes fresh. 

It used to be called La Condesa and they have free parking across the street. 

It is also one of the few places that have Tacos de canasta. It's not on the menu but just ask, I would suggest getting Chicharron. 

The food is delicious, I would just suggest skipping the ceviche and if you're going to get the tortilla soup make sure it's not to go.

Awesome fajitas. Good service. Made sure my allergies weren't going to put me out (they don't use soy oil--it's all corn, and no milk in the beans). 

I will be back!

Service was not to our liking. Had to ask for napkins instead of bringing to us from the beginning. Requested extra plate and bowl when we ordered. Had to remind the waitress. Food is mediocre for the price paid. There are other Mexican restaurants with same type of food and price with better quality.
Omg! BEST place EVER!!!! food was delicious.  Great flavor, good portions, and good customer service.  Zero complaints.  Will most definitely  be back.
Best Mexican I've had in a long time. The fajitas were fantastic. BYOB - so don't forget to plan ahead.
Just had a nice little dinner at La Cecina, enjoyed the food and service, great value, tons of food. Definitely recommend.

My boyfriend and I had Nando's last night, after we couldn't decide what we wanted, and we definitely did NOT regret this place! We absolutely LOVED it and loved their array of hot sauces. 

We ended up getting the whole chicken with two large sides. We got the hottest choice they had, and it wasn't as hot as they claimed, but still delicious! We love heat, though, and honestly it wasn't spicy or hot at all. It tasted like normal chicken with spices.

The side that I chose was the rice, and while it was decent, it wasn't anything amazing. The mashed potatoes were pretty good, though! They looked bland to me, but it packed a lot of flavor!! I really want to try the coleslaw and peri peri fries next time. I'll keep y'all updated!

The lemon herb sauce was amazing mixed with the extra hot sauce. I dipped my chicken in it, and even some of my rice and mashed taters.

We were full but still got dessert. The raspberry cheesecake is pretty good, but it isn't something I'd get again unless I really, really wanted cheesecake and I was already there.

The staff was friendly and helpful. Loooved it. I'll definitely be back!

Is it fair to compare, sure when it's the same operation. I was more impressed with the location on Delano. I had the same wrap here and found it smaller, less chicken and not as much lettuce. This time I ordered the coleslaw as a side, I was hoping for it to be a bit different, however it was pretty standard. 

Having lunch with a friend of mine this time, she just ordered a side of veggies, the cashier who I believe looked as if he was the manager should have suggested that I just place the one order with two sides, instead of mine alone with one, and her order. It would have been a buck or two less. Not that it's their responsibility too, however when I was a server I used to make suggestions like this all the time. I found that customers appreciated a good tip in their favor, a little goodwill brings a person back in.

I really wasn't sure what to expect since I just walked by, looked at the menu, and decided to give it a try... but I was pleasantly surprised by my serendipitous visit.

Since I really haven't eaten Portuguese food, the flavors were full and interesting - giving what would have been a very normal chicken sandwich a completely different flavor profile.

For dessert, I decided to try Naughty Natas, which is a Portuguese tart, and I was sorry that I didn't get more than just one. Do it!

The place itself looks unique/vibrant with the decor, oversized hanging lamps, cool chairs in front.

This place is definitely worth a visit, especially if you like chicken sandwiches!

I like this Nando's a bit better than the one at New City. As with any location, the seating and ordering procedure is confusing at first, but Nando's is a great choice for solo diners or diners in a group or pair who need to pay separately. The food is fresh and wholesome. I usually get a 1/4 chicken with 1 or 2 sides. (Try the peas!) But I've also tried 2 of their salads, which were delicious. There is plenty of seating. Last but not least, Nando's plays the best music! I wish they would have dance parties after hours.

I've had some boring chicken wraps in my life, and this was the blandest, most underwhelming chicken wrap of them all.  Even the chicken pesto wrap from a recent Amtrak diner car was better than the chicken breast wrap at Nando.  For the prices and inflated healthy aspect of their chicken, the wrap isn't up to the hype.  A few smallish chunks of chicken and a bunch of lettuce in a grilled medium-sized, food service tortilla that almost fell apart.  Where were the tomatoes?  Maybe some avocado.  Maybe some Parmesan or melted cheese.  Nothing.  Just the few pieces of chicken and some romaine lettuce.  The sides weren't imaginative.  Mashed potatoes and coleslaw.  Seriously?  Sure, they were tasty but potatoes and slaw are not the best complements for a wrap.

The employees were super friendly, and the interior design is spectacular.  It's obvious I ordered the wrong thing here, but I'm not feeling the magnetism to venture back anytime soon.

Peri peri chicken! Luv this place, great food with hip decor.  I love the hammock chairs. Wish we had one in St. Louis.

Street parking at this location is a bit hard. But you can park for free at Trader Joe's garage across the street (90 minute limit). Make sure that you buy something from Trader Joe's though (I suggest getting their Macaron's $6/dozen on the chilled isle).

4.5/// This place is pretty cool, I was very surprised! First off, the girl at the counter was great/ explained everything to me as I had never been. Secondly, the restaurant is beautiful and also SPOTLESS! I mean every sauce bottle I grabbed was clean and filled to the top; 100's of bottles of sauces. Had the signature chicken and it was really good.. great flavor from that 24 hour marinade & flame grilling! As far as the sauce I liked the "Hot" the best with the "Lemon Herb" coming in second. The inside is huge and like I said at the beginning the service was great! The Manager came by not once but twice & they have spotless well stocked bathrooms. Must try on Diversity Ave! Get dat did!

Overall: Easy go-to option for some quick delicious chicken. 

The good: Great sauces that had great flavors, mild or spicy. The portions are good sized for the main courses and the food tastes great. Lots of different options to choose from. Atmosphere is cool and unique.

The bad: The prices get a little high. They aren't too bad, but if you get more than a regular item it can be more expensive than it needs to be. The breadsticks were so small. Just two pieces of bread.

Atmosphere: 8/10
Service: 8/10
Food: 8/10

Just tried this place for the first time with my nine-year-old daughter. We both loved it! They have a range of spice levels. I had the mango lime chili sauce on a fantastically fresh chicken sandwich. I'm a real coleslaw snob and theirs was perfectly seasoned and crunchy. My daughter had a chicken sandwich with a side of corn. She ate the whole thing and she usually can't finish a meal.  

The decor is really cool.  They have hanging basket chairs that are so fun for kids to sit in. Plus the bathroom is one huge chalkboard. 

The service was incredibly friendly and attentive. Very sweet people. And the music was awesome to boot. Definitely recommend it.

SUCH GOOD CHICKEN. And Sangria. The flavor of the chicken without any sauce is already great, but add the garlic herb sauce and you're in business. Also delicious mashed potatoes.

I like this place because it's no frills but still provides a really cute interior/atmosphere. Food is semi-cafeteria style where you order at the register and someone brings it over to you, so you rarely have to wait for a table. Deeeelicious.

Love the food--mango sauce is addictive! Great location here in Lakeview, and they've got a cool space to boot. I like sitting on their outdoor benches in nice weather. 

Skinner is my favorite staff member because she's friendly and has got a great handle on multitasking (plus that platinum hair!) :) I've been accidentally hung up on while ordering via phone during the lunch rush a couple of times, but my order is always right when I arrive to pick up. Happy to recommend this place to locals and tourists alike.

This place has great chicken ! Ok done with the review ! lol 
Some things to note : when you walk in you greeted and seated . But you go to the counter to order your food .A little different from the norm. 
The chicken : juicy and so good , but get the super hot flavor . The hot wasn't hot , more like mild really. 
The sides : the fries !! So good !! 
The rice with the mashed potatoes was a perfect side to the chicken . 
The butternut squash with corn and cranberries was super healthy but still tasty 
but go for the hottest flavor option !

My friend dragged me out to try this. After going in London she insisted that we HAD to go and that it was the best restaurant ever. I told my other friend that went to college overseas I was going here and had high expectations, she laughed at me and told me this was the Panera of the UK. ...... She was right.

I ordered 1/4 mild chicken, fries and a pitcher of sangria. The chicken had a tangy flavor to it I liked that there were a ton of different sauces to try on my chicken. My fries had seasoning on them, i liked it, no complaints there. The sangria was good too...but I found my pitcher to be rather small for the price I paid. 

Overall my meal was ok, nothing to drag me out of the burbs for. Its rather expensive for what it really is and the smaller portions that are served. Id be much happier eating chicken from Chapala in Streamwood for less then half the price of this meal.

Portuguese - style Chicken that began in South Africa. It eventually wondered it way to Europe and finally Washington D.C. in the US. Now in Chicago I decided to give it a try. Actually I have a friend who works here so I get to sample many of their menu items. The chicken is quite good actually I like it better than pretty much all fried chicken places in Chicago. However the other day I had some of their Lemon & Herb wings and whoa! the lemon citrus-y flavor was just too much. Not an enjoyable experience. It's gotta be a subtle flavor not "hey you want some chicken with your lemon juice". The other times I had their chicken I had plain and medium sauces. Both were very good. Tastey juicy chicken that melts in your mouth. I was quite impressed.

Inside the decor is quite interesting. State of the art Coke Machine that is pretty cool but unnecessarily complicated. It takes a few minutes to figure it out. The seating is interesting as they have these swinging birdcage seats by the window that offer great people watching in a bustling area of Lakeview/Lincoln Park. However away from the window the seating can get quite cramped if it's really busy. You might get an unwanted body part rubbing your back when it's busy. Never saw erotic massage on their menu.  I'm just saying.

Overall the Chicken is delicious and the decor is quite interesting to look at. However a few quirks need to be improved such as inconsistency amongst their flavors and cramped seating. Customer service still needs a little work depending on the server. They have only been open 3-4 weeks now so some quirks are to be expected. They deserve 3.5 stars but since Yelp does not provide half stars I will round up to 4 because I really do like their chicken. Hopefully soon they will DESERVE 4.

COST: 
$7.75 (1/4 Breast and Wing Plate comes with one side)
$2 (Upgrade cost for a small side salad instead)

This is literally THE reason why I moved to Chicago. Well this place and Shake Shack of course. 

Kidding aside, I first had Nando's in the UK and then again in Toronto. When I learned they have multiple Chicago locations, I was in!

It's so fresh and the food is so great. The way their dining works is you come in, they ask you for the size of your party, they give you a table number and walk you over to your table. After that, you look over the menu and make your way to the cashier to order. Then they bring you your food.

To be honest, I don't really understand the purpose of this! It's too confusing. I just thought I'd throw that out there.

As for the food itself, it's BOMB bomb bomb. The sauces are delicious and this restaurant is top notch. GO! NOW!

If I could, I would give Nando's a 3.5. The food is good but the price is a bit high. It's great if you're looking for a casual spot for tasty chicken, salad, or wraps. The portions are comfortable but are not really worth the price you are paying. The rice and mashed potatoes are a safe option for sides but if you are adventurous, I'd recommend trying the Macho Peas as well. I got the flame-grilled chicken breast with Medium sauce and my friends enjoyed their Country Salad (very generously portioned) and Halloumi Wrap. Be wary that the Medium spice is comfortably spicy so do not try any hotter unless you are used to Habaneros and Jalapenos. They also have sauces on the side so don't be afraid to experiment with their various garlic, herb, and citrus sauces.

Nando's is great for larger groups. Be sure to take advantage of their loyalty card rewards or order take-out if you are in a rush. It's truly a unique offering in terms of food.

Stopped here for a takeout order for the third time today, and for the third time they've forgotten part of my order.

Ordered 2 chicken sandwiches, a wrap, and a salad, and soon enough my order was called.  I didn't bother to check the bag because I figured if the employees can count to 4, they don't need to worry about forgetting something.  So I get home, realize my $11 sandwich is absent, and call Nandos.  I explain to the girl on the phone what happened, to which she replies the sandwich is there waiting for me.  I tell her that I live 20 minutes away and it's not my responsibility to come back and get something they forgot.  When I ask for a credit for a future order instead, SHE HANGS UP ON ME. What a joke.  It's a shame because the food is great, but this establishment is let down by abysmal service and even poorer quality control. Stay away from this place.

Terrific fast casual dining option. We drove in and wanted a quick and non chain restaurant meal. The quirky atmosphere, very helpful staff and varied options were fantastic. Lots of choices of sauces, interesting beverage options and overall great option.

So happy for the new location near me!

My coworker who has had Nando's overseas was so excited about Nando's coming to Chicago that she wouldn't stop talking about it for weeks. Then when it finally opened I had to go. The Randolph location is really nice but it's far for me to frequent since I live in LP. When I noticed that they were opening across from Trader Joe's and next to Kuma's I couldn't be happier! 

Today was their grand opening and it wasn't as packed as I expected. There was a consistent line but it moved quickly. The service is great considering it's mainly a self-serve kind of place. I hope they stay friendly and helpful even when it's no longer new. 

I ordered the 1/4 chicken leg and thigh with 2 sides. I can't eat spicy so I got the lemon herb seasoning and for my two I got the Portuguese rice and Macho peas. For me the peas were a tad too spicy (but I am sensitive to spicyness). The chicken was great, just like the Randolph location. It's juicy and the meat falls off the bone.

The interior makes you feel like you're in another country and the lively music isn't too loud. I will definitely be coming here often!

I've been to another peri-peri chicken place before and this definitely tops my experience! As far as the look and atmosphere of the place is well lit, music not loud,  and very spacious with variety of seating options including 3 pairs of swing seats! Food was amazing! We tried the 1/2 medium spicy level chicken with fries, 12 chicken wings half mango lime/lemon and herb, chicken sandwich with rice, side garlic bread! Service was quick! And you know its as good as it gets when the manager makes the effort to thank you as youre leaving!

I really liked this place! A unique spin on chicken and counter-service dining. 

I ordered the half chicken with lemon sauce and a side of mashed potatoes. It was $12 which is CHEAP for the size and quality of food. The lemon sauce was delightfully spicy, but also had flavor aside from spice. The mashed potatoes were heavenly, red - skin potatoes with garlic, my favorite! Even though it was counter-service, servers came around frequently to refill drinks and ask if we were enjoying our meals. I loved this place, I will definitely make another stop on my next city trip!

We decided to try this place since I live so close. I had the Nandocas sandwich with corn and it was so delicious. And the restaurant design is really modern and cool. I would go back but maybe just to order food to go. When we walked in the server gave us menus and pointed us to a table. We had no idea what she was saying or which table. She explained nothing to us so we sat and waited at the table until realizing we had to get up and order. Very very confusing. The food is great but the severs/hosts need to explain how it all works :)

I've heard a lot of good things about nandos from everyone that has gone here. However I thought the flavor was too lime-y for my taste. The chicken was very tender, which was a great plus. But all the sauces had an overwhelming tangy flavor. The garlic bread was amazing btw. The service was excellent, I believe the manager even checked in on us.The ambiance was really warm and welcoming. The swings were a great touch and the everything was clean and well kept with great arts.

Only if you're into chicken, and who isn't!! =)
Great place!!.

I love this place - consistently delicious food, amazing selection of sauces, and any level of spicyness you desire...this place is my comfort food, my only "regular", and I will have it every time I go to the only two cities in the country that it exists in (metro DC and Chicagoland). Get their loyalty cards - I've gotten lots of free yummy goodies using it! Chicken os fall off the bone and seasoned just right..this isn't easy to do (and do consistently) if you like really well seasoned, spicy, moist chicken. Yumm!!!

I like the concept of this place. You stand in line to order, place your order, receive a number and the food comes out to you.

The chicken was tasty. The family meal was enough for 3 people. The garlic bread wasn't anything great.

I especially loved the the different dipping sauces. Also a HUGE fan of the self-serve frozen yogurt.

The chicken is tasty. The ordering method is confusing. It's too dang 'spensive for what it is. The food takes FOREVER.

On my second visit to Nando's Peri-Peri I was less than impressed again. I decided to give them an additional try since the first time was later in the day and they were very slow. 
  Walking into the restaurant you are greeting by a super friendly individual who spoke to me for way to long about all their sides/samples/specials. The person at the door gives you a metal chicken on a stick to coordinate with your table. You have have to chose your table before even seeing it. 
  I ordered a chicken sandwich with a side of Brussel sprouts, fries and a drink. I was never offered any of the samples the individual at the door spoke about. My total came out to $20, I filled my drink and waited for about 20 minutes. I was sat next to the kitchen window so I noticed that my brussel sprouts came out of the microwave. 
  The chicken sandwich was ok, their chicken is properly cooked and juicy. The fries were insanely salty and since they say in window under the heat lamp for a while waiting on the brussel sprouts to be microwaved they were a bit soggy. The brussel sprouts were worse than green giant microwave pouches. I can't believe they are charging a premium for them over other sides. Ick. 
  My consensus is that I'd rather frequent a locally owned roasted chicken place or even Boston market. Their peri-peri peppers must be made of gold if they are charging $20 for lunch.

I've been here 5 times in the past 7 days. :(

The garlic bread is AMAZING.
The mango and medium peri-peri sauces are what's up.
The slaw and the mashed potatoes are so good.

I held off on trying this place forever, and now I'm addicted. I'm telling any and everyone that they must have THE CHICKEN.  

One day I will try the sandwiches but I just can't pass up the quarter or half chicken with two sides. I can't!

3.5 stars

The flavors are really good but the portion sizes leave much to be desired. I'm a small girl with a medium appetite but this place definitely does not fill me up in the least. I ordered the 1/4 chicken breast and wing with a salad ($9). The mango sauce is where it's at! I like that they have a large variety of sauces for the chicken which are really delicious but for the pricing, it's super disappointing. My dining companion ordered the 1/4 thigh and drumstick with rice and salad and was still starving at end of the meal. 

Both of us left hungry and ended up at crisp. Maybe I'll try the 1/2 chicken next time but it's overpriced so probably won't come back.

Y'all, get here. This food is so effing good I could live here...in fact, I am here right now and had to type this immediately. I am usually dubious of sweet-sounding sauces because I don't have much of a sweet-tooth, but they gave me a side of the mango-lime sauce and it has a fantastic kick. I wish I ordered a bigger piece of chicken. I could eat the PEAS (no joke) for every meal. All the sauces are good (put the garlic sauce on the mashed potatoes, for real). The staff is awesome, they gave me recommendations and coupons and a punch-card. Good beer list, next time I'm going to try the sangria (it's pretty). Good seating, good lighting, comfortable temp. My only, only complaint is that you have to get your own everything except the food. As a person that frequently dines alone, I dislike leaving my things at the table to grab silver. That's it though. Eat here. 

Oh, and free wifi!

I've been to Nando's a couple times now, it's a very unique style of food. It's portugese but I've been to Portugal and didn't have quite this style of food.

That being said, the chicken's fantastic. The sides and extras are also great.
My first time there, my gf and I split the chicken breast sandwich as well as the mediterranean salad. The chicken breast sandwich was good, the sandwich somewhat disguises the chicken so you can't fully enjoy it as pure chicken, but I liked the sandwich. 
But to be honest, what stole the show was the mediterranean salad. It had dates, chicken, and some other stuff in this mix next to your salad greens and pita slices. Man, it was fantastic. I'd get it again in a heartbeat.

I went back again recently and just got a chicken breast with a pair of sides. The chicken breast was good but smaller than expected and for the price I paid, I would've thought the chicken breast would be a bit larger.

For those who don't know, peri peri is apparently a Portuguese style of cooking. The chicken isn't remotely dry and has great flavor to it. I like to add the different sauces they have which have a very unique flavor to them. But they are quite salty, so be prepared to drink plenty of water after the meal.

So good! I loved everything I tried. I ordered the chicken with two sides. One was red skinned mash potatoes and the other was the garlic bread. I especially loved the mashed potatoes. They had a hint of garlic flavor. I'm not sure what they did to it but the mashed potatoes are so creamy and delicious. I usually don't even like mashed potatoes. The garlic bread is amazing as well. I can't remember how I ordered my chicken but I wasn't expecting it to be spicy, however it was. I didn't mind because it was the right amount of spice. It complimented the chicken. Not set your face on fire. I really like this place. Next time I go I wanna try the butterfly chicken breast and macho peas. 

The seats in the front of the store are so cute! They are big basket swings. Never seen anything like that before. They also have tables outside if that's your thing.

My first time was such a good experience!

Walked in on a late Sunday afternoon (~3pm). It was pretty empty, so we were immediately seated by a friendly hostess and told to go up to the counter when we were ready to order. 

I read all the yelp reviews about their chicken, so we ordered a whole chicken full platter w/ corn on the cob and rice. All their sauces are house-made, and you can choose which sauce you want cooked with the chicken. I was worried the hot sauce might be too hot for me, so we did half hot and half medium. 

After you order, there's a separate section to pick up silverware and bottles of hot sauce in case you really like to drench your meat in sauce (as I do). They even had a sink in that area so you don't have to walk all the way to the bathroom to wash your hands!

Order came out in ~10-15 min. The chicken was DELICIOUS- juicy with just the right amount of crisp on the skin. I wish I had the recipe. The sauce was also delicious but not overpowering. It was hardly spicy so I definitely added a lot more. The corn was sweet, even without the added butter they give you on the side. The rice was the right amount of savory, but the portion was not enough for two people (the only bad thing I can say).

Bill came out to ~$30 before tip.  I can't wait to go back!

5 stars on service.
4 stars on the cool soda machine and good iced green tea.

Sadly, food was only 2 stars for me. The "peri chips" were just seasoned fries that were very salty and coldish (definitely not crispy). "Portuguese rice" - sigh I've had much better from a Zatarain's box. The rice was hard, not very well flavored, and again kind of coldish. I tried a medium spicy half chicken and a lemon basil chicken. The skin was soft, fatty and again not crispy! The sauces were ok and helped with the flavors, but overall it was overpriced grilled chicken that you can get much better (and cheaper) from a Mexican place (think pollo express).

Wasn't quite sure what this place was all about before I went here for the first time yesterday. Brother in law lives nearby and recommended it. Holy hot sauce, this place is great! It's an order at the counter and server brings you the food kind of place. Interior is decorated pretty cool too. Our party of 5 shares the olives (amazing) and a bottle of red. I had the boneless chicken breasts, hot sauce, with a side of peas and the butternut squash/corn. Chicken was so tender and the seasoning/sauce was phenomenal! Just enough heat to make me wanna get those waters down. I dipped my chicken in the garlic hot sauce too- loved it. The peas were honest to god the best peas I've ever had. They had mint and chile in them- omg amazing. Husband HATES peas, but he couldn't stop eating these! The butternut squash/corn was also really good. Service was great- pretty quick and definitely friendly.

Roast Chicken on itself with natural char marks gives me half of an idea on what my meal will taste like but soaking the chicken itself in marinated sauce is another thing.  I've enjoyed Nando's in other countries and was excited to see on in Chicago. 

I can actually say now that the Chicago's Nando's is not the same, the portions for one thing is definitely smaller here in Chicago. I had ordered two .25 dark meat chicken with mango sauce with a glass of peach sangria. The two chicken legs overly salty and felt like I did not get enough chicken for the price. The peach sangria was half filled (last cup of the pitcher), was good but should have ordered an IPA. 

Overall, don't think I will come back.

I heard of Nando's two years ago from my cousin who lives in Australia - she told me to go to Nando's Facebook page and vote for Chicago as the next Nando's branch. I did - and I'm so happy that there are others like me who voted for Chicago! 
My favorite, all-time go-to meal consists of lemon-herb flavored grilled chicken, macho peas, and chocolate spoon cake! 
I also like the way the label their bathrooms - it is definitely very gender-friendly!
And by the way - I have started going to the Nando's branch close to me - the one on Lake Streeet in Oak Park. They don't have the basket seats but the place is cozy just the same!

I ordered a half chicken spicy, a side of Portuguese rice, mashed potatoes, grilled corn on the cob and garlic bread. Every bit of it was delicious. Succulent chicken, mashed potatoes that didn't taste like they had been prepared from powdered mix, rice that wasn't sticky, sweet corn on the cob, and garlic bread that was not toast, I was one satisfied customer. And I earned my extra stripes for being an active member of the Clean Plate Society.

We came here hangry after circling the neighborhood looking for parking for what felt like a million bazillion years.

We almost were lured into Kuma's by their patio siren song.  But then remembered that we had both been there separately and thought it kinda sucked.

Grilled chicken was what we were craving.

The menu was overwhelming, but the cashier helped us navigate through it.  We were so hungry that without her we would have ordered essentially an additional dinner that we didn't need.

I ordered the butterflied breast with medium sauce and a side of fries.  Of note - I wish I would have gotten the hot sauce for more flavor but was glad that I got the peri sauce with the fries because there's nothing better than a flavorful dipping sauce for my frites.  Also appreciated was the garlic sauce available by the Coke machine.

Fiance got the breast with hot sauce (yum) and garlic bread as his side.  We split the cucumber salad.  He loved everything.  I thought the garlic bread tasted like those loaves of pre-schmeared garlic bread that you make in the oven.  Lots of garlic flavor, though.

We sat in the basket seats in the window and made plans to attempt to recreate this back home.  We will fail miserably, of course, but we're up for the challenge.

It's my mother's birthday weekend and she seen the channel 7's Hungry Hound review of the restaurant.  We dined in at 2:00 we were greeted to a smiling face and the decor of the restaurant was nice very Afro Brazilian. I like that you don't have to worry about being waited on by a waiter. Also loved that the water came in glass containers.

My mother and I decided that we would share a whole chicken because it is a cheaper option. We got the whole chicken half lemon herb half mango lime and ordered the Portuguese rice and Butternut squash and corn salad and also the pea slaw and a side of olives.  ALL OF THE FOOD was GREAT. They had very helpful wait staff.  The chicken was juicy and succulent and most important flavorful and the side dishes created a melody of flavors to compliment the chicken. 

The only negative and it's not really a negative is the sauces, they aren't really needed but they will add a different flavor to your chicken they have a lot of sauce flavors.

I would definitely recommend this restaurant who wants a hearty or light lunch or dinner. GREAT!!! Definitely coming back

We ordered the whole chicken platter for two which comes with two large sides. We chose to order the Portuguese rice and macho peas. You can choose the level of spiciness of your peri peri sauce, and you can add other sauces that are available at the self-serve condiment bar. The total came to $29. 

Considering the cost of the meal I would say the the experience was largely underwhelming. The chicken and the sauce were just okay. There was not a lot of meat on the chicken, and it was not as "fall-off-the-bone" delicious as others described. The only meat that amounted to more than a few nibbles came from the breast. The macho peas were the only highlight of the meal. We found that the Portuguese rice was forgettable.  

The restaurant seems to have and identity complex--it can't decide whether it wants to be an order at the register place or a restaurant with a hostess and servers. Instead, it seems to retain a confusing combination of both service styles. It is difficult to gauge whether you were being served or serving yourself. 

Overall, this experience does not inspire a return visit.

I hadn't been to a Nando's since living in DC years ago and was curious to see how it stacked up against the other options in Chicago.  The answer is: reasonably well.  The portions are a little small and simple for what you get, but on the other hand you do get some flavorful and moist chicken and a range of plausible vegetable sides.  They are not afraid to amp up both the acid and the heat in their sauces and marinades, which is a very good thing.

I'm positive that it's not the comparison they'd be looking for, but for me the real question is how it compares to the Chicken Hut up the street on Broadway.  The Chicken Hut is faster, and has more flavorful skin but less flavorful flesh.  The Chicken Hut is also much closer to my house.  But Nando's has real vegetables, which is the thing I most wish you could get at the Chicken Hut.  And for that reason alone it has now earned a non-redundant place in the Lakeview chicken market.  That's no small achievement.  (Nando's is also nicer, so it becomes a place where you could plausibly go on a casual date.)

Worth trying.

So this place is ok. I've heard about Nando's for years from SAfer friends and it's opened up in the DC area which is my home town. We went here early on and saw the wave of people. Our first visit was a little disappointing considering there are sooooo many people on staff here. Seriously there have been at least 10 people aside from those in the kitchen working at any one time.

We were ignored on our first trip by the 3 young ladies working at the door who offered a menu and whatever other directions to everyone but us so we were disappointed when we got to the register and realized we should have received a rooster to claim a table. Ok, so to explain it another way you choose which cock to sit on. You don't put in your order and pick a table, you choose your table initially. So anyways we get our table.

Our food and drink is delivered. I really like the medium sauce, it's not hot it's just most spicy. I got the half chicken with the chili sweet potato side. He got the fries and chicken something with fries (chips). The sides are awesome, the fries are good, surprisingly the chicken is the missing link. The drinks, well don't ever order wine from here. Our tab was $49 which is pretty ridiculous. The last time I went I had a quarter chicken with the chili sweet potato side and my friend got the chicken wrap with chips. Again, it's fine but just pricey.

I think there's potential, but I certainly wouldn't wait to eat here.

This location opened literally today.  I couldn't be happier that there's a Nando's so close to where I live. It's located in the heart of Lakeview. It's very lively, clean, positive and vibrant inside. Service was prompt and positive. We got a great rundown on the menu and serving while we were in line. They were clearly very organized and prepared for a rush for their first day. 

The chicken itself was amazing. It was so flavorful. There's a multitude of different flavors including lemon herb, mild, wild, hot, and extra hot. Each flavor offered something different and the extra hot wasn't so hot that it scalded my mouth. 

The fries were great and the mayonnaise that comes with them is unbelievable. I am also being told by my fiancé the sangria is also very good.

I'm extremely happy this location is open and I will definitely be coming back!
Food is good and consistent with other Nando's locations. However the cashiers they have are friggin idiots!

After passing by a million times and thinking, "I have to check that place out," I finally went for lunch, and am so glad I did. I had the boneless chicken breast with medium spice and the garlic bread. Both were fantastic. The chicken was tender, juicy, and the medium was the perfect amount of heat for me--I usually err on the side of caution and always go mild. I'd originally wanted my side to be corn, but that wasn't available (not in season, obviously), so after reviewing the caloric info for all the sides, I decided on the garlic bread. DO NOT PASS IT UP. So delicious. What's nice about this place is that I was full and satisfied, but didn't feel like I'd just eaten three days' worth of food/calories. Service is good, setup is good, I'll definitely be returning.
Amazing place. Chicken liver was delicious. Will come back again and again and again....

Peri peri is supposed to be a Portuguese spice concoction to dazzle your taste buds., this place had some of the most boring spicy chicken I've ever had. Not sure if they watered it down for Chicago but the same chain in South Africa lives up to what peri peri is supposed to be.
This place is a big disappointment ... Don't go expecting anything spicy here.
Delicious chicken.  Incredible butternut squash dish. Staff was super friendly.  So glad we stopped in!!  My wine drinking friends loved the Cara wine. The carrot cake was absolutely perfect.

There was nothing wrong with the food: leg quarter, rice and slaw, and a brownie.

Like I said, nothing wrong but not great and the chicken portion size for the price was expensive. The leg/thigh serving looked like it came from a small cornish hen. I expected that they would include a small cup of PeriPeri sauce but they only baste the chicken with it, the rice would have been pretty good if there was either some of the sauce or if was moister. The slaw was so so.  The brownie had a great texture but much too sweet.

Several years ago I went to Nando's in Cape Town and it was incredible - but not here. Very disappointed. 

This was a take out order.

The food was so good that I seriosuly ate here two days in a row. The chicken is AMAZING and I LOVED the mashed potatoes!! The mango and peach sangria was awesome! Really cool environment and the staff was really polite. Also, really awesome artwork!!! Ill be back to Nando's on my next trip to Chicago

Very cool place from the moment you walk in. You can tell that they've put a lot of money and thought in the decor. It's very colorful and festive. My kids loved the chairs in the window that hang from the ceiling. The thing to get here is the chicken and wow is it flavorful! You get to choose your own spice level and various unconventional sides like macho peas, grilled corn on the cob, and Portuguese rice. You can also grab some additional sauces. I couldn't get enough of the garlic sauce. They also have amazing looking wraps and salads. There's a great kids menu as well. Really good place for families and large groups. Parking is somewhat challenging in the neighborhood but that's life in the big city. Definitely give it a try if you want a great healthy meal in a very casual and fun atmosphere.

Love this new location, it has a different set up to it from the Lakeview one but as always with any Nandos you are gurunteed amazing food with top notch banter. 
Chicken is good and when topped with that wild herb herb peri peri sauce (munofa nekunakirwa) magnific. Great service and manager took some time to have a conversation with us as we talked about their future expansions.  
The full platter is the best deal from the menu as it comes with 2 sides which for me are always the Chips and Portuguese style mashed potatoes. Nandos has some amazing chicken livers :) yes chicken livers so a small plate for the table gets some friends trying something new. Can't wait for the 3 location to open and see if they match up to the current 2 spots.
I like the decorate. I get there 2 times and staff was so nice. Always feel friendly from them. Today i try chicken livers and chicken breast. They weww delicious. Willl back to try other.

The chicken was cooked to perfection. We got it plain and I'm glad we did because that way we were able to try out a lot of the sauces. They had the best mashed potato I've ever had in my life. The garlic bread was amazing as well.  Crispy but not at all burned.
Everyone was so nice. The manager came out and asked us how everything was and personally took our order.
I really enjoyed my experience here and already wanna go back!

Delicious chicken! Nice break from the countless chicken places with pita bread and salsa. The heat scale is "true-to-taste"...not dumbed down to American palates. 

Service is very friendly, drink selections complement the meals. The macho peas are a must!

This place was great! Easy parking nearby, no wait inside, and super friendly staff! My friend and I split the 1/2 chicken and the chicken breast sandwich and both were delicious! We worked on our computer using the free wifi and the staff was very receptive to our hanging out for a bit. They even brought us over little cups of ice cream to enjoy while we worked! We will definitely be back!

This has become my go-to place when taking people out to lunch!
This is such an enjoyable place to go to. Their food is amazing and the atmosphere is great! It's gorgeous inside.

My favorite is the grilled chicken pita! But my friends and family have also gotten other things like chicken livers, wings, and etc. and they've always enjoyed it.

I LOVE NANDO's.

Phenomenal chicken with many sauces to choose from to amp up the flavor. I love the hummus with the peri peri drizzle.  Very unique food for the price range.  Its a necessity for the neighborhood, no good food options around there besides Nandos.  And they serve alcohol.

Definitely recommend sitting in the hanging chairs.  Cool vibe.  Incredible food.

We tried this place by accident, and thank goodness we did!! Didn't really know what to expect. But I was blown away! Got the hot half chicken and oh so yummy! Peas and corn also good! And we tried the livers I'm usually not a fan but hubby loves it! I tried it and also loved it!!! As they say, no such thing as an accident!

After being spurned by the kiddie Kuma's and its obvious wait, Nando's it was. Chicken is healthier than beef anyway, right?

Nando's has kind of a Carnivale-like vibe to it--except Nando's has way more of a crush to it due to close quarters and is way more frantic, structured and regimented in its churn and burn approach. 

The system at Nando's is almost a scientific formula and ends up having the feel of arriving at the concentration camp for processing. 

Upon arrival, you're greeted by the host and handed a menu, which is extensive and will need to be studied, and a table number. Pro tip: review the menu online prior to arrival to avoid being caught up in the system. You'll have zero control over your table and will be pointed in the general direction of its location. 

While you're studying the menu in the sluice area between the host and the order counter the employees will direct you to "move over to the booths" on the left rather than stand on the wall to the right. This happened twice. It's your first indication you're in their system. 

Once you decide, you approach the counter and place your order and pay your damages. Nando's isn't cheap. Pro tip: stay away from the cheap wine, especially the cabernet sauvig-NON! 

After you order and pay you go on your journey to locate your temporary barracks, er, table by walking in the general direction pointed out by the host and then matching your number with the number on the table. And then you wait for your soup and your slice of bread, er, your chicken and sides. This place is so regimented the wine was already on the table prior to arrival. Those guys in central Europe several decades back have nothing on these guys. 

As to the most important part:

Chicken breast sandwich...pretty darn good, but I'd rather it were pounded thin.

Mashed red skinned potatoes...O'Delicioso.

Grilled corn on the cob...very good sweet charred taste.

Vino...non, non, non.

I'd say the food was pretty good and a return visit is warranted. I can't say I like the whole overly structured system employed or the organized chaos of the place. It might be better suited as a lunch place. 

It's 3-1/2 clucks. And they're somewhat pricey clucks.

Always love going to Nando's! The peri peri is delicious and cravable. Had the boneless chicken breast with peri chips and the absolutely necessary perinaise. Also got the bottomless frozen yogurt, which is delicious. Love the atmosphere and the service is always top notch.

Well-cooked chicken. I liked the coleslaw and mashed potatoes -- good flavor.

BUT: their "quarter chicken" was more like a "quarter cornish game hen." NO WAY was that one fourth of a full grown chicken and NO WAY was that a filling meal. Your plate comes with nothing else -- and if you want, for example, a piece of (oh, I don't know) BREAD with it, that costs another $2.75! 

ALSO, unlike some other reviewers, I DON'T LIKE the sauces -- the hot & extra hot are just that -- hotness -- with NO FLAVOR. And the lemon&herb and wild herb taste like salad dressing! not good on chicken.

ALSO, the other sides don't taste good, AT ALL. Peas with mint & chili? Squash with 
cranberry, cilantro, & chili? I do not like them.
Skinner was awesome!!!! What lovely costumer service... Oh and the food was amazing! Thanks for a great lunch :)

My husband and I came here for the first time tonight! The location was super cute! The young lady at the door was welcoming too and asked us if we dined before and quickly explained how things work! She gives u a table number and u order at the counter find ur table number and sit down and then food comes out to you! 
I did not like the girl at the register at all, it was a young African American girl with a mono tone voice and straight face! She didn't look or sound like she wanted to be there working. Loll anyway, I got a sangria so that came out right away! We went up the the sauce counter to get couples of bottles of dipping sauces and fork knives etc. our server was super sweet!! She came out in about under 7 mins and was like enjoy your food etc etc! I got the boneless chicken breast bc I hate boned chicken and two sides. Got the rice and mashed potatoes! My husband got half a chicken and two sides rice and peas. We wouldn't get the peas again that's a waste of $2 for an extra side! Portion is more than enough and food was amazing, loved the flame grilled chicken!!! To change things up it would be nice to get a second side that would be worth the $2. Bc peas garlic bread and potato portion I wouldn't pay $2 for that! Our bill was $42 by the way...We will be back many more times so can't wait! I'm attaching pictures to help first timers like us

I'm a big fan! If I lived closer to here, Id be here more often.

Came with a group of 5 and we got one of the sharable platters with some sides. With 5 hungry climbers, we devoured the platter and still had left over. The medium spice chicken wasn't that spicy at all. Next time, we will go for the spicier one. Everything was delicious!! The staff were super friendly, and there's a ton of seating inside and in their semi-upstairs patio area. 

Loved it. I had some peri-peri when my team was in South Africa last year, and this was a fun reminder of our time there. Will definitely be back.

The chicken is so delicious, tender and has some kick ass flavor. You can pick from mild, medium and hot Peri-Peri sauces or none. I love that it is flame grilled. I had the 1/4 chicken breast-medium, mashed potatoes and garden salad. They were really good. Mash heaven. My friend ordered french fries, mushy peas, the lemon herb chicken and Sangria. She really liked it. Red Sangria had flavors of cinnamon and orange. Killer. I also like that they have a nice selection of sauces in bottles that you can take to your table. The ambience is causal and modern. Customer service is friendly and attentive. The price is inexpensive. Will be going again when I want some really good comfort food.

I used to eat at Nando's at least once-a-week when I lived in Dubai, so I was excited to see one opened up within walking distance from home. Unfortunately, the menu items aren't the same and the price is insane. I got one chicken breast and a leaf salad to go, for $13.73!

As an additional bummer, I got the order for take-out and didn't realize until I got home that they didn't include any kind of dressing. The other Nando's I've been to include dressing and a few packets of peri-peri sauce by default. Not here.

The food is pretty good and the portions, while small, are probably about what we should be eating. But they'll need to up their game and lower their prices to get more stars.

Well I gave Nando's a second try and it was still a nightmare.  Now they have a hostess seat you with a menu and your number but your number still has to match the table.  A couple of old people were offered a booth.  They said they wanted a table.  She took them to the back, right by the kitchen and they said it was too hot.  They pointed to several open tables in the middle of the restaurant and the hostess gave some lame excuse so they decided to leave.  What?  Does it clash with your attempt to be hip by having some senior citizens sit up front?

As for the whole numbering junk, Culvers has you order, gives you a number and then you sit down.  Somehow the folks who bring you the food at Culvers has no issue finding your number.  Let people sit where they want like a fast food restaurant OR have waiters.  Nando's hybrid system at an attempt of upscale fast food is inefficient, confusing and in the case of the older couple straight up rude.

Anyway, I ordered a chicken breast sandwich that somehow took nearly 20 minutes to get.  I cook chicken at home faster based on the number of staff members standing around not doing a damn thing, I guess one of them could have joined the kitchen staff since, you know, it was lunch rush.

Then that price.  A sandwich, fries and a soda...over 13 bucks.  I asked for mayo and when she rang it up she asked if it was for the sandwich or the fries.  I said fries.  Bang, that counted extra so 75 cents added.  Before it showed up on the register for free.  I should have said "It's for my sandwich but can I have it on the side" and seen what happened.

The sandwich itself is okay.  The tangy mayo is nothing special.  In fact I make something similar at home all the time.  It is just mayo+hot sauce.  Whoopdy do.  The fries were overly salted and not very many considering the sandwich was 6.85 and the "with one side" was 2 bucks.

I was amazed the place seemed more chaotic than before and the food showed zero improvement and they still charge too much.  I mean nickle and diming costumers for mayo, really?  This isn't baseball, Nando's isn't getting a third strike from me.  I'm done.

OMG - If you like perfectly spiced - no matter what level you want - and moist chicken - this place is amazing.  The sides and salads and stuff are super solid - but just get chicken...the half is perfect with a salad.

The 5 star hot is super-hot but not irrationally brutally so - they know how to make spicy an intense flavor and not a torture.

We came in at a time when it got busy, and they do not take names or create a wait list. However, the greeter did get us seated very quickly.   You order your food at the counter and wait, which the food came out timely.  

If you don't like spicy, order your chicken plain. However I do, so the medium was perfect and I loved all the dipping sauce.  The peri peri wings were good, the corn was really good, and so were the fries.  I also loved the peas.  I was with a large group and we shared a bunch of food.

OK, I came in and ordered 12 chicken wings. Just over $10.00.  Now, 2 parts of the chicken wing are typically served, the wingette (2 small bones, not a lot of meat, lots of skin) and the drumette (yes, the small drumstick with more meat).  Guess what, I got 12 wingettes!?   Now, if you think this was just bad luck you are probably wrong --- for the mathematically inclined the chance of randomly grabbing 12 wingettes is (1/2)^12,  or less than 3 in 10,000.    Are you kidding me?!  

If that was not bad enough they were undercooked, pale, soggy --- I had to put the scrawny things in my oven for 10 minutes.   They didn't taste bad after that, but I was still hungry.

I won't be back.

Seeing Nando's bring back my high school memories in Asia. There's one down the street from my high school where I go from time to time.

Perhaps it's a regional thing, but it disappointedly do not stacked up. The Nando's I know was very flavorful and comes with very delicious, crispy skin. The chicken here has very soggy skin, and the meat tastes bland. Not sure if they really marinaded it for 24 hours. 

Kinda disappointed since I've experienced better.

We went to Nando's a hot Friday evening. We have been to Nando's in the UK and love the food. The food was great, however, the restaurant was like an oven. It was hotter in the restaurant than outside, and that day it was above 90 degrees fahrenheit. The stifling  restaurant, combined with hot food (both temperature and spice) was too much to bare. My boyfriend got so hot he had to wait outside... In the 90 degree temperature... in order to escape the heat in the restaurant, and we took our food to go.

I assume their AC was broken...?

I have only been here once. The Lakeview location is nice, and they were very efficient at getting our order and our table, I haven't experienced an ordering system quite like Nando's, I don't prefer it, but it's fine. 

I found that the chicken wings all tasted the same, and I could not distinguish the three different flavors of the large family plate that we ordered. This may just be due to my American nature of not appreciating subtlety and drowning everything in sauces my whole life, so who knows. They have bottomless frozen yogurt which is probably the coolest thing! 
The sides were good. 

Overall it was enjoyable and I would definitely like to try it again and order something different. Try it out!
I have ate at Nandos many times and have always enjoyed the food. However, I got food poisoning last night from this location.
Place is awesome! Just like South Africa. Chicken is the best in Chicago. Go to Nandos with a hungry stomach! 2 thumbs up

Despite my undying love for fried chicken, I'm always looking for a "healthier" chicken option and was excited to hear about Nando's opening in Chicago.  Hubby had tried it in London and thought it was good.  We took his mom here with our baby for Sunday lunch.  I think we had a split of the medium and the lemon herb full chicken platter.  The chicken itself was good.  It can stand alone, but better with a little sauce.  It doesn't seem to matter the choice of marinade for the chicken since there are so many dipping sauces to choose from that you can just drown the meat it in if you didn't like what you picked.  Although I thought the sauces were all on the salty side.  The corn and coleslaw were good sides and the fries were just okay.  This location is huge and has a ton of seating options from booths to regular tables to the hanging chairs in the front that is perfect for people watching.  I also liked how their bathroom had a changing table.

Don't really understand how this place has 3.5 stars. I don't think people really appreciate this almost perfect blend of flavorful food+healthy good for you. The restaurant has a unique/colorful/bright setting. I've only been to the Diversey location but they're opening another in Lincoln park. The peri peri chicken comes in different spice levels I get the hot but for flavor sensitive eaters the medium will also work. The red skinned mashed potatoes are really good. Also don't forget to use the sauces usually placed by the pop dispenser. There's extra hot/garlic/wild herb experiment and find your flavor because the chicken itself is dry rubbed. 1/2 chicken is usually good for 1 person and only 500 calories can't beat it!

We popped in to Nando's randomly on a Thursday night. LOVE the look and the decor, hate the ordering system and having to see the kitchen while dining.

We both got the grilled chicken breast and added our sauce at the table. The chicken was good, but nothing I couldn't whip up at home. All the sauces tasted the same. Super citrus-y and lots of herb. they were just okay. 

I will say the sides were the star of the show. Excellent corn on the cob and very delicious garlic bread. I may be back to give it one more shot, but I'm not in any rush.

My friend from Malaysia is crazy about this place so we came here together. I got the quarter chicken leg with corn on a cub. The leg was tender, kinda hard to cut because it was connected to the bones around the chicken breast. The cub was smaller than I thought.... Tasted ok. The price is pretty good. Their  house beer was good.

This place is a amazing. The decor is great, food is amazing. Spicy but some non spicy. Everything chicken - my favorite is the 1/4 plainish with the wild herb on side. Aaaaand do not leave without the Natas!!!!

The food is great and I love the decor inside! I had a wrap when I went and it was delicious (Chicken breast wrap). The jam in it, in particular, was very unique and a game changer! Their sauces are really good and have nothing but good things to say about the food.

The only reason I give it a 4 and not a 5 is that it is pricey. My meal was about $10 (I went for lunch) but if you look at this as a dinner, then not so bad!

I recommend!
My kids and I come to Nando's often.  We love the fresh grilled chicken and sides.  The macho peas are not to be missed.  Love butter?   Try the mashed potatoes.
I am soon happy we got Nando's! Nando's is the absolute best chicken. I also love their cole slaw and rice.
It's the only place that I can think of that excites our kids as much as it excites our kids. The wings and the rice are our favorites, but you cannot go wrong - the sauces are all excellent!
Nando's has definitely upped their spiciness since the first time we've been there. Hot packs quite a punch now. Glad to see the improvement.

The chicken is very very good. The chicken was moist and full of flavor. The sauces that come on the side are amazing. The sides were amazing as well, corn on the cob was flavorful along with the rice. Be sure to try the sangria. Overall food is great and you won't be disappointed. Some of the staff could be a little bit friendlier, but overall good food and great area for dinner with the family.
Their food made me sick the entire next two days. Pretty sure it was from the Macho Peas

It's ok. Not great. Not the juiciest chicken in the world. The mashed potatoes are awesome! But for the price, might as well get a $4.99 rotisserie chicken from The Marketplace grocery store down the street----it is way juicier.

I love this place.  It's the type of place that doesn't make you feel guilty for eating there. The chicken pita and sides are all great.  It's reasonably priced, but not crazy expensive.  I suggest getting the fries with the perrinaise sauce.  Really all the chicken and sauces are great.

I love Nando's! The staff at Nando's is helpful and pleasant. No complaints from me.
 Seating is at the outdoor patio, inside on chairs and tables or in rattan swings at the front window. I do not particularly care for the blue plastic chairs, but all the other seating is fine. As others have mentioned, you tell the host which area you want to sit at and they give you a rooster to put in a holder at your table. That's how they find you to,give you your order.
The chicken has been marinated and flattened before cooking. It is not a fried chicken. It's grilled. I got the quarter chicken (breast) marinated in medium sauce and then add the wonderful sauces located for self service.  Its very tender and juicy. I get it with one side- the Portuguese rice- which has a beautiful turmeric color and small chopped vegetables in it. I was not impressed with the cole slaw, however. Skip it- it's small and tasteless. The soft serve ice cream can take out the burn from the sauces.
I think Nando's has a winning formula.

Most of the restaurants that I go to they will have their good days and they'll have their days where the food is so bad you never would go again if you went in the first time. Every time I have gone into Nandos they have given me an excellent experience from the service to the amazing chicken that makes me question why you would need to fry chicken if it can be made to taste better grilled?

I've been to Nando's many times each with delicious results. Quick service, and have never not liked something from the menu. Although a little pricey, I can't resist getting the 2 sides vs. 1 side with my orders. The dessert menu is delicious as well.

Walked on a whim and loved it. The interior is great I really dig it- especially the swings by the window. We split chicken wing platter and it was probably one of the best decisions I made in my life so far. Delicious doesn't even begin to cover it. Butternut squash and corn side was amazing as well, wish they gave you more. Maybe I'll just order double since the wing platter comes with two sides.

There's only one way I like to drink margaritas, and that's in pitchers.
Pitchers on pitchers on pitchers. 

All day, erryday.

Have it coursing through my veins.

Practically half margarita, half human.

Okay, I'll stop, you get the point. 

Cafe El Tapatio delivers. Their margaritas are the perfect balance of strong and not too sweet. These bad boys will get to you after one pitcher.
Obviously doesn't mean you should stop there.

Their shrimp ceviche is fiiiiirrreeeeee. I swear I could live off of their ceviche, it's so fresh. Steak quesadillas are a little more on the greasy side, but were still fairly tasty. 

So just like Trump would, grab those margaritas by the pitcher (hahaha no?) and order some awesome ceviche. 

Get it, get it!

I've visited here several times, ordering different dishes each visit, and have always come away raving about this place. Everything is delicious from their salsa to their margaritas to their entrees. 

The best is how authentic their food is. My mother makes enchiladas from scratch as her mother from Mexico did, and Cafe El Tapatios is the CLOSEST I've ever had to them. I would eat them every day if I could that's how good their enchiladas Tapatios are. I've already turned on all my friends to this place so I'd HIGHLY recommend trying a dinner here.

Quite honestly the best tacos on the north side of Chicago and a truly great mango margarita. I was deeply impressed with the enchiladas--the mole sauce is to die for (well, not literally but in the metaphorical sense). Went there feeling a little blue and came out of there feeling rather happy and festive!

This is not the place to go if you're on a budget, though as the tacos will run you around $8 with refried beans and rice. The only less expensive items on the menu are the drink specials. To get a margarita of that strength and potency for right around $5 on a Friday was truly quite amazing. I was buzzed after having only one, and I weigh 240 lbs.

I have ordered take out here several times now.  The food is very good and seem authentic.  I really liked their steak burrito because the meat quality was really good and my bf always enjoys their fajitas.  The only negative I can say about this place is that it's kinda pricey.  I paid $43 for a burrito, fajita, and guac.  Oh, and be careful, their salsa is very spicy!
Those Avocado Tacos are out of this world! A little pricey for what it is but that's okay. The bartender served us and she's very nice. Cheers!

I hadn't been here in years, but I was in Lakeview with a friend and we wanted tacos. I wanted to revisit this place, as it is cute and has nice margaritas, from what I could recall. What I totally forgot was how super whitey gringo suburban transplant this food is, as it does not qualify as real Chicago Mexican food in my book. It wasn't bad, but rather a bit bland. Seemingly tailored for the mainstream sort of transplant resident typically found in Lakeview. Service and atmosphere deserve a better rating. I was just very disappointed in the food, and that stupid boring neighborhood.

The location is fine, the owner charming, the food?  Meh.  Cerviche was missing seafood - just a bowl of pico with half of a shrimp hidden, served with saltines and a sickly cocktail sauce.  Guacamole?  Dull tasteless.  Main Mex combo?  Standard without being remarkable.  What about the margarita you ask?  Picture a pitcher of ice and mix without much kick and you've got it.  Overall, thee are better options for sure

Finally got a chance to try Cafe El Tapatio after passing it so many times on Ashland. My friends had raved about it so I was really excited to go.

Got a table for 2 around 7 pm on a Thursday. I think we got the last table, which shows you how busy they are even during the week. For drinks we opted for the $5 mojito special they have on Thursdays. They can add fruit too if you want!

Dinner I went with the sincronizada de papa con chorizo. All of the ingredients were sandwiched between two tortillas with rice and beans on the side. It was really good, a little different than your typical enchilada-like dish which made it fun. My friend's shrimp tacos looked amazing as well. Their prices are on the higher end for casual Mexican dining in the city but they have really huge portion sizes, which in my mind, combined with the quality justifies the price.

Really enjoyed Cafe El Tapatio! This will definitely be my go-to Mexican place in Lakeview moving forward!
Been passing this place for 25 or so years, finally stopped in the other night for dinner. Cute space, excellent food, and my wife was VERY happy with her margarita. Will definitely be back!
I really like to like this place but the not really.....service could be good, asked for salsa 5 times, stuff has no clue what on the menu....never again.

My wife and I have been coming here for a couple of years, and was genuinely impressed with the food and margaritas (pineapple being my favorite and as big as your head!) They had a good flauta - a top notch carne asada burrito, and their adobo chicken gringas were fabulous.

Then we heard about their choice to expand. I thought "as long as nothing changes, it'll be okay." Things have changed and it's no longer okay.

They seem to be transitioning to a new menu, since they dropped 2 in front of me. There are similarities on both menus, but there are significant differences like the a la carte taco section. I ordered a carne asada taco, a chicken adobo taco, and a jumbo pineapple margarita. My wife ordered her favorite: the chicken gringas with chihuahua cheese and a jumbo lime margarita. The drinks came out and they were a shadow of their former selves. The glass was at least 30% to 40% smaller than they used to be - I was OK with that until I discovered they're $17 each! For a roughly 16oz margarita? The food? They used to serve it with care, now the gringas had very little cheese (all clumped on one side) and the chicken was inedibly dry. My wife couldn't eat it. My tacos: the chicken one was passable, but the "carne asada" one had ground beef in it that almost tasted like boiled beef tongue and pickled onions - I literally spit it out.

It seems they're trying to finance their expansion by giving lower quality food and smaller drinks, and it saddens me. My wife and I were loyal customers here, but I can't support anyplace that makes me feel like I'm getting shafted on quality and price.

So, I'm not really a "yelper", but I had to sign in to temper all of the 5 star reviews this place has mystifyingly received. The only thing I can think is that people in Lakeview have no idea what good mexican food tastes like. If you want the real scoop, check out this guy's review: https://www.yelp.com/user_details?userid=eQsSEnmUtP5Xz7Lf0a6s8g

I'll cut to the chase: the chips were cold and slightly stale. In their defense, both the waitress and the manager (who came to our table to explain without our asking) told us their chip warming machine was broken. The service was slow (which also was not a real big deal, honestly). The food, however, was bland and sort of luke-warm. This would be enough to trigger a below-average review, but the real kicker here was that it gave my mother diarrhea and vomiting early the next morning. Yes. We ate there around 8pm (had nothing else to eat afterwards), and *very* early the next morning my mother woke up with very clear food-poisoning symptoms.

This was our first (and last) time to try El Tapatio. Maybe we just happened to catch a bad night, but when you give my mom diarrhea and vomiting, it's an automatic disqualification for me. One strike and you're out.

This is hands down my favorite Mexican joint in Lakeview. The food never disappoints, they have a nice outdoor seating section in the spring/summer, and the service is fabulous. I will say, it gets busy on the weekends so you may have to wait a bit for a table, but it's worth it! Plus the restaurant being packed just goes to show how good the place really is.

I've had just about everything on the menu but a few personal favorites are the ceviche, the Coctel de Cameron and the enchiladas. The shrimp cocktail is the biggest I've ever seen, it comes in a HUGE Margarita glass and is smothered in yummy tomato cocktail sauce. They also have giant cocktails served in a 32 oz. terra-cotta pot if you're looking for some extra fun! They're great to share with a few people, and definitely get you feeling good.

Lastly the service here has always been particularly great. Twice that I've been there now the owner has given my table free tequila shots just because.  That's my kinda place!!!

Hells yes this is the BEST Mexican I have ever had! 

Although they don't take reservations and the small space fills up quickly, there's a conveniently located Irish pub (complete with real live Irish bartender) that will furnish you a beverage while you wait for Tapatio to call you with your table's status. 

Now let me start off - if you're perusing their menu online and are shocked by their prices, let me reassure you this is NOT your run-of-the-mill Mexican restaurant. The food is fresh, high quality, and delicious rather than something to soak up the booze at the end of a long night.

From the start of the meal with homemade chips and salsa, prepare to have your expectation of another greasy Mexican joint shattered. The fresh salsa has just the right amount of spice, and the chips are fresh from the fryer. I also recommend the guacamole which comes with delicious pickled red onion on top.

As for entrees, I have had the Tacos Del Mar and the Tacos De Mar De Cortez and have never been disappointed. The fish is fresh, the corn tortillas are warm, the rice is flavorful without being overly salty. I especially LOVE the Tacos De Mar De Cortez - HUGE beer battered shrimp are crispy and delicious.

They also have awesome margaritas here. If you don't like to be overpowered by sour mix, I would recommend going for the Rolls Royce which is much too big for me to drink alone (I did so once and don't remember much else about the evening) but perfect when shared. At $18 it seems pricey but it is a shareable sized marg with premium liquor. I would rather pay a bit more and not drink well tequila, thanks.

The staff is also friendly and amazing. The owner floats around making sure everyone is satisfied. This place is truly a gem!
Its alright. The staff was quite rude too. Nothing exceptional about the food.

If you're looking for both good food and good drinks, this is the place for you. I'd heard great things about this place and can't believe I waited so long to check it out. Getting a table outside for 6 on a Saturday afternoon was no problem. 

We ordered margaritas and the bowl drink (I can't remember the name). Margaritas were delicious but pretty expensive. The bowl drink on the other hand is the biggest steal in the city. Seriously, order this. It's delicious and boozy and everything you could want. 

For an entree I ordered the grilled shrimp tacos. I was very impressed. Even better was the rice that came with it. It's no ordinary white rice. I can't explain it. You'll just have to try it. 

Even if you're not in the neighborhood it's worth a trip. Luckily I am so I'll be back often.
The food and the service are both killer. This is my favorite Mexican restaurant in the city. Highly recommended!

Great place ! Love the atmosphere , super friendly people , lots of outside and inside space . Great food , lots of great selection on the menu , drinks are awesome , very strong and a variety of special seasonal drinks . A must go to .

Easily, one of my favorite Mexican restaurants in the city. Between the service and the food, it's all been great. 

As far as service, I've ordered both carry-out and ate in-house a few times, and every time it's been great. I live around the block and the pick-up orders are lightning fast. The service in-house is really great as well, considering how pretty crazy it can get on a given night. What's really great too is, if the house is full, that they'll recommend a local bar across the street (McGuiggan's) and give you a call (or even come into the bar) when you're table is ready. I've spent many a night at McGuiggan's as well and you can tell they both try to support each other which is nice to see.

For the food, it's all been great. One of my particular favorites was the Beef Short Rib in Tomatillo sauce which was quite good. The usual suspects are all great though as well, especially the queso fundido after a few margaritas! One area that is particulary great are their Al Pastor taco's... the Al Pastor has been on point everytime I've eaten it. I only wish they gave you more than two tacos per order!

Overall, it's a great neighborhood joint and I highly recommend!

I lived in Chicago from 1997 to 1999.  My girlfriend then (now wife!) and I used to frequent this place way back then.  In fact, I was a regular here before this restaurant received a favorable review in the Chicago Tribune (which greatly increased their business, if I recall correctly).  The food, service, and atmosphere was great back then, and I'm happy to report it is still GREAT.  I ate here earlier this year on a business trip to Chicago.  I hadn't been to this restaurant in over fifteen years.  I went by myself for late lunch on a Saturday and sat at the bar.  I ordered the chimichanga because I firmly believe this restaurant has the best chimichanga I've ever eaten in my life.  I was elated to find that it was just as good as I remembered.  I had my own mini-Proustian moment eating the chimichanga because it tasted EXACTLY as I recalled it tasting 15+ years ago.   I also spoke to the owner/manager of the restaurant while I was there.  This restaurant has remained under the same family ownership for 15+ years.  I told him that I used to come to his restaurant years ago and that the food in his restaurant was just as good today as it was then.  He told me that he has had the same lady cooking the food in his restaurant for 15+ years.  I realize this review is a bit sentimental and that I may have an idiosyncratic love for this restaurant, but I have recommended it to numerous people and they have enjoyed it as well.  I should also add that I now live in San Antonio, Texas, and the food at Cafe El Tapatio is just as good and as authentic as the Mexican food down here.  STRONGLY RECOMMENDED!!

One of the best mexican spots in the city. 

Tasty drinks. Warm, gooey appetizers and huge selection of food. 

We came for a late dinner and had to wait a bit for a table si we gabbed drinks at the bar. Once we were seated we weren't rushed with our food at all. We ordered apps before we ordered our entrées. Everyone in our party was very happy with their food. One friend noted that his burrito wasn't soggy like a lot of other places. Ingredients were fresh and tasty. 

A must-go place if you're craving a strong drink and a belly filling mexican meal.

I live right down the street from this restaurant, so I go frequently! As a lover of Mexican food, I have tried many places throughout Chicago. However, Cafe El Tapatio is hands down one of the best. Their rice and beans are the best I have ever had anywhere!!!! Their enchiladas and carne asada are perfectly seasoned, which can be hard to find. This is my favorite Mexican restaurant in all of Chicago! It is a must try!
