Becoming one of my favorite spots in Lakeview. Went here on a Saturday night for a late dinner and drinks. Amazing service, severs and managers came to check on us plenty of times. The food and ambiance is great. Great weekly specials. I will be back!

I have been going to this restaurant for years. The food unfortunately gets worse with each visit and I think I'm finally over it. I'm not quite sure why people continue to love this place. Food is greasy , bland and hands down worst guacamole in the city.

I have always loved the dine-in experience, but decided to finally rave about the place after a delivery mishap. They accidentally delivered the wrong thing, but were SO apologetic afterwards and sent me the right order right away. It's service like this that sets places apart. Keep up the great service!

Oh and the food and margaritas are excellent ;) 5 stars!
This is one of my favorite restaurants in Chicago. They have very fresh and tasty authentic Mexican dishes. Definitely a hidden gem! Best Margaritas and most friendly bartenders-
The margaritas were great, the salsa was the worst, the rest of the food was pretty good.

3 stars are for the service, not the food. 

Went to Cafe El Tapatio for the first time on Sunday around 9:30 p.m. with my girlfriend and her friend. The place said it was open until 11 p.m. and it was full when we got there. After waiting for a few minutes we got a seat and ordered within minutes of sitting down. I ordered a full pitcher of Margarita for the table and each of us ordered a full meal. While waiting for the meal, we finished one portion of the chips and another one was brought. Fast forward to 10:30 p.m. I barely finished my meal and I was chomping on the chips when suddenly the lights came on and staff started to clean up. This is fine except that we were basically getting kicked out at 10:30 with a half a pitcher of margarita left (~$30). One of the staff members tried to grab the chips off the table with my hand still in the basket-so I stopped him. Minutes later, when I turned my head, another (maybe the same one) staff member swooped by and took the chips of the table so that we would leave.  That is not a way to treat customers.  If we were told that the restaurant was closing early that would have been fine. If we were asked if we minded leaving because the staff would like to go home early it would not have been a big deal. Rather, the behavior of the staff left a bad taste in our mouths. It is a shame, because the food was very tasty.

This is our "go to" place for Mexican food in the neighborhood. Consistently really good food, terrific, friendly service. Love the enchiladas verde along with full bar and specialty drinks. Great outdoor patio. BTW... best salsa! Joe's a great host.

On our second visit it was a beautiful night so we dined outside. Unfortunately  the waiter forgot to put in our appetizer order for empanadas, which are delicious, so we ended up taking them home. My daughter had the vegetarian enchiladas rancheras and really liked it. I had the sinchronizada de papa chorizo which was a bit heavy on the onions but otherwise very good. The rice and beans are always very good but could be larger portions

This place was really good, we came here with my parents (who aren't easy food pleasers). I was a little skeptical when we waited for 40 minutes and I thought this food better be worth the wait. Well it was definitely worth the wait!! Excellent fresh tasting Mexican food. The service is quick and food is delicious. Plenty of options for vegetarians and they are very receptive to modifications. I think we found our new city spot when my parents come to visit. Can't wait to come back!

We were up on the north side looking for a yummy taco joint. We decided to try this place but we had seen it before from the outside it looks a little too funky for me. But I must say that the yelp reviews were so terrific that we figured we would give it a shot and it's spectacular. Do not let the outside of the building fool you. The service is great, food is fabulous, and we will bring the girls back with us One night when we can have some margaritas.
Want to try something unusual but really great? Try the fried shrimp taco dinner with a fresh salad and some rice. It freaked me out because it was so good.

Solid 4 star Mexican place in the city. Their salsa is great.. Tastes homemade and chunky. Steak fajitas are my favorite but the carne asada is pretty bomb as well. Drinks are fairly strong. Recommend for dinner over brunch. The omelettes are only ok.

If you're truly a fan of authentic and 'muy delicioso' Mexican cuisine, then look no further than Café El Tapatio. With a small and intimate setting, this restaurant is ideal for a first date or a casual night out. But, if you are looking for more of a party, they do have a back room that is available to reserve which accommodates about 10-15 people. The atmosphere is relaxing and fun, a great spot for any day of the week. Plus, the staff is very friendly, welcoming and accommodating. We even had the opportunity to meet and shake hands with the owner who thanked us for coming by.

Before ordering, they serve some of their house chips and salsa, which is awesome! The chips have just the right amount of salt on them and the salsa has a good bite to it. For a meal that will really get your taste buds going, I highly recommend the Guisado de Res beef shorts ribs, which are cooked in a verde salsa and served with potatoes, rice and beans. All I can say is...SO damn good. My husband enjoyed the Carne Asada, which includes an 8 oz. skirt steak char broiled and topped with grilled onions. It's served with a cheese enchilada, rice, beans and tortillas. Let's just say he was smiling after one bite into that!

When the weather is nice, be sure to take advantage of their outdoor seating! There's nothing better than sitting outside on a sunny day and enjoying a frozen margarita or a Corona. You do, however, have the option to order take out (for the nights you just want to hang at home!) or you can even get on your laptop, ipad or phone and place your order right on their website and it's delivered right to your door step in minutes! Now that's service.

Whether it's the cold drinks, great food or neighborhood vibe you're looking for - Café El Taptatio is where it's at. It was definitely my go-to Mexican spot when I lived in the city and I can't wait to go back next time I'm in town!

I was excited to try Cafe El Tapatio because I had heard great things!!! My very first order was a taquitos and a steak taco dinner. The taquitos was very good; they maintained their crispness through delivery and I was pleased with that. I was however disappointed that my my $11.00 taco dinner included two tacos and a tiny side salad. TWO tacos and a side salad. There was no detail on the menu so I should have called, but it never crossed my mind that  anyone would sell two tacos for $11.00. Not cool.

5 stars to Cafe El Tapatio for all of the awesome meals I've had with friends and family here.  Both brunch and dinner are delicious and reasonably priced (esp considering how much food you get - I usually get a second meal out of whatever I order), and the folks who work here are lovely.

They have excellent, amazing customer service here and on top of that, delicious Mexican food & margaritas!! This friendly neighborhood joint will easily became a favorite and I would not mind coming here on a weekly basis- at all.

Their complimentary salsa & chips was the perfect prelude to a fabulous dinner.  The tomato-part of their salsa was pureed very smoothly (which was new to me- Im so used to chunky salsa) but it was SPICY and definitely had a chile-infsued bite to it.

No worries because to wash down the spiciness our table of four (seated outside on their lovely patio) ordered a pitcher of their blended strawberry margarita, which we were told was the most popular flavor.  It was the perfect balance, the alcohol was not too strong but definitely present, and it was also fruity and delicious.  They have adorable glasses to serve the drinks and and each glass was garnished with a lime wedge, and then anchored by two mini black straws.

When it was time for the second pitcher (mhmm) - we went with the blended mango-tamarind which was a much thicker consistency.  Think mango-lassi but a mexican version.  It was really good and my favorite of the two.

This restaurant is where you can lazily linger over a relaxed dinner: from the minute you sit down until dusk.  They don't take reservations but I came here on a weeknight at 7pm and was seated immediately on the patio. We never felt rushed, the food came out in a timely manner and if they had turned on their heat lamps when it got chilly after dark - you would've had to drag me to leave this place.

There were families with kids, diners who bring their dogs to the outdoor seating space, couples on date nights, birthday parties (they will bring you a sombrero) etc. Overall El Tapatio was THE place to go to see a snippet of everyone- from young to old. There is no way you cannot leave this place feeling happier, your stomach fuller and your soul more content.  El Tapatio has that effect.

I didn't go into too many details on the food because it speaks for itself!  I had the Tapatio Combo, which comes with a burrito, rice & beans, a taco and a quesidilla ($11.95).  Now their service was beyond what I'd expected because there was a small hiccup with our salsa-- our server was apologetic and to our surprise, at the end of the meal he gave us a complimentary dessert crepe, stuffed with fresh mango cubes and smothered in caramel and topped with powedered sugar.

They go above and beyond here, and I think the owner/manager even stopped by our table and asked us how we were enjoying our meal. Four stars for now, but easily a five when I come back... probably next week or so!

Came here with the wife and kids.  Been searching steadily for a decent mexican or even tex-mex gig in Chicago and sadly come up short.

Let me explain something important here.  Anyone here who rates this place 5-stars has absolutely no idea what good mexican food tastes like.  I grew up in Houston, Austin, San Antonio eating authentic incredible mexican cuisine.  Sorry, but this place ain't it.

I can remember being in College Station in 1982 when I had this "new" dish called Fajitas.  Honestly, it was one of those moments in your life when you realize just how good food can be.  They came out on this cast iron skillet just sizzling hot and piled high, not like you get in most places these days.  The skirt steak was marinated and grilled over mesquite wood.  

The beef was sliced in very thin strips along with equally thin sliced grilled onions.  The server would squeeze a lemon wedge over it, but the skillet was so damned hot that it evaporated in seconds imparting a just hint of citrus in a perfect balance.

As you can probably tell, I love this dish.  When it's done right, it's truly a work of culinary art. Which is why I give this place just 2 stars.  My wife ordered the chicken fajitas.  She has some food allergies, which is why she likes fajitas.  It's just marinated chicken breast, grilled over a wood fire and sliced.  Nothing fancy.  Easy, plain, delicious.

When her dish arrived, it was... I don't know what the hell it was.  Chicken slices with a tomatoey sauce covered in some soupy spice mix.  I mean, you needed a spoon to eat it.  Still remember the poor waiter's face... so proud of it.

Yet again, Chicago seems to have failed us in our quest.

My dish was awful.  It was one of the saltiest meals I've ever had.  I really tried to eat it, but ultimately had to send it back and ordered the skirt steak... medium.

It came back...  super rare.  The meat in the middle was barely warm.  I'm gonna send a meal back twice?  Knowing it wouldn't kill me, I stomached it down.  Both dishes were mediocre and amateur... all the way.  NEVER going back.

Look, I know what some of you are probably thinking...  This fool writer must think anything not from Texas is garbage.  He doesn't know what he's talking about.  Not true.  I'm the firs to say that Smoque Bar-b-que is on par with if not BETTER than the best barbeque I've EVER had... in or outside of Texas.  

If food tastes good, it is good.  I call it like I see it.  This place ain't that good.

If you see my initial review, you will note I had an issue with the delivery.  I believe it was actually Eat24's fault because I ordered delivery again, but directly from the restaurant and there were no issues.  

The food was really good.  The only thing I would change if I order delivery again is to ask them to not put sour cream or lettuce with the taquitos because they get soggy.  Otherwise, they are really tasty.  I enjoy the salsa and sauces that come with the order.  The tacos and quesadillas are good too!
I've been here a couple times. The food was awesome! They have good coffee and the atmosphere is very nice as well.

Been here a couple times now and the food's great. Good atmosphere, reasonably priced I feel for the quality of the mexican food (this isn't your terrible cheap mexican place). 

First time I got chicken enchiladas in a mole sauce. It was fantastic, it was a poblano mole sauce which was really nuanced and tasted great. The enchiladas were cooked great and full of flavor as well. I would highly recommend the dish. 

One other of my favorite dishes there are the crepas de pollo. Pretty much 3 chicken crepes / enchiladas smothered in this absolutely delicious chipotle creme sauce. That sauce is the highlight of the dish and is truly fantastic.

As with any nice mexican place, one of the big deciders is the chips and salsa. They're great. The chips aren't oily at all, decently thick, and the salsa is wonderful. Though I hate when Mexican places charge for chips and salsa. The first to baskets of chips and salsa are free, but it's then an additonal $2 for more chips/salsa. I recently went with a large group and we went through quite a bit of chips and salsa, charging the extra $2 just seems petty and unnecessary. 

But I'll be going back, really like it and really convenient location.

I just ordered grub hub delivery from here and it was easy and came promptly. I was impressed with that aspect, 

As for the food... I can't believe I spent $50 for the most bland Mexican food I've ever eaten. I didn't even know that was possible, 

I ordered the fabulous combo which was carne Asada, chile relleno, and a flauta. The carne Asada was alright, tender. My flauta was not crisp and I did not like the picadillo filling. I also HATED the chile relleno and could not eat it, which is a shame because it is one of my favorite things. I asked for no sour cream and it was definitely loaded on there. It was bitter and I also could not chew it. So that, $17 combo was a dud. 

I did not know that they added sour cream to the guacamole or else I would not have gotten it. It was runny and took away much of its substance and natural flavor. Plus it was a very small portion. Not even 1 avacado's worth. So $7 later... 

My spouse had the tapatias enchilada. He said that they were alright but only ate the stuffing. 

I'm really disappointed but it happens. Not coming back here.
Was here on a Sunday night after a recommendation from a friend to take my family. With a picky mom and my parents eating vegetarian, this restaurant exceeded their expectations and will return back!

I came here for lunch today for the first time and was very pleased with the food. The complimentary chips and salsa were perfect. I ordered simple cheese enchiladas with verde sauce, refried beans and rice. The food came out in adequate time and the presentation was lovely. My only complaint was the big dollop of crema on top of the enchiladas of which I am not a fan. In addition, my friend ordered the shrimp tacos and requested the sauce be served on the side, which it was not. She was not a fan of the sauce and found that it completely overpowered her taco. Service was attentive, but it did take a while to get the check after the plates had been cleared from the table. Overall, I enjoyed the ambiance and food enough that I will definitely be back to try the rest of the menu!
This place is so great. The Micheladas are superb! We go to meet Don tapatio also who was such a lovely man. The food is delicious and the patio is so cute. I highly recommend this place :)

As a lover of Mexican food who is also a Mexican food snob, I la la la love Care El Tapatio.  I'm from Arizona, so I have a hard time finding Mexican restaurants that remind me of the brand of Mexican food in AZ.  Cafe El Tapatio is one of the few places that does.  I really enjoy their margarita selections and they are mixed well together.  But their food- I love.  I recently discovered the enchiladas de platano.  It's plantains rolled in corn tortillas with mole sauce on top.  It was amazing and hit all the flavors- the mole was a little spicy, the plantain was sweet.  It blew me away.  I also love their chips and salsa.  The salsa is delicious and the chips are always hot and just keep on coming!

The space is a bit of an issue.  I've been here in the summer and in the winter and this place is definitely better in the summer.  The rooms are small and difficult to navigate.  But when it's summertime and they have their patio seating, it's much nicer.  I would definitely recommend sitting outside when the weather permits.

We're stuck in a rut when it comes to dining in Chicago. We tend to eat at the same handful of places which are good- but we need to branch out.
So, this weekend we mixed it up a little and tried Cate El Tapatio. I'm vegetarian, my husband is not, and our kid is selectively picky. But, we all ate harmoniously. The patio area is great, and a pleasant spot for lunch or dinner. The vegetarian selections are plentiful- and the enchiladas de platinos were the bomb- sweet, caramelized plantains smothered in a creamy mole sauce. Yum. Serious yum. 
Husband had pork rib and potato tacos- he cleaned his plate in record time. We also tried the shrimp in coconut milk, served over pineapple; and it was one of my more memorable appetizers to date. 
Drinks were good- sangria was a little weak, but that's really my only complaint. Great atmosphere, attentive service and delicious food. Glad we ventured outside our comfort zone.

You all have to try my favorite dish from here since 1990: Enchilladas Suizas!!! Their chips and salsa are greater welcoming starters, followed by their steak fully loaded nachos! Love it here! Best place to eat by the Cubs home!

Small, crowded, and loud! Mojito was good, salad was good (mixed greens with chopped tamot and onion in vinaigrette), rice and beans were the usual thing, chicken enchilada was decent but not exciting. The creamy tomato sauce they put on it was bland. The chips and salsa were good.
I recently  rediscovered them for lunch.    Nice atmosphere and good service.   The pastor tacos were excellent.  Also had some pretty tasty horchata.

My husband and I discovered this spot while looking for a spot to post while waiting for our son to get out of school. Very casual, friendly and food & drink  specials during the week. I'm vegetarian and my husband eats everything from the "roota to the toota" and they have options that we both can enjoy. Honestly, you really can't really go wrong here. Make sure to try their tortas- they're not your run of the mill torta, bread is substantial but light and oh so good! Just had one last week and wondered where they'd been hiding them all these months! And during the warmer months, they have a small alfresco space on the adjacent sidewalk that's cool. Check them out, you won't be disappointed.

Maybe I chose the wrong dish? But maybe there shouldn't be bad dishes at a restaurant, especially one with high ratings such as this one. My fajitas ($18) were swimming in a pool of oil and grease, the beef was absurdly overcooked, tough, underseasoned and it tasted gamey which should not be the case with beef. The side dish of rice, guacamole and beans was bland and meager at best. The water tasted and smelled so awful I wasn't able to drink it. Really bad tap water with a lot of ice. Service was friendly and accomodating. About the atmosphere, the music and the crowd were very loud and disruptive.

One of a handful of truly wonderful authentic
Mexican restaurant in the Chicago area, nothing fancy, won't break the bank, just really good food and excellent service.

This place has been a favorite of ours for a few years, but it wasn't until today that we tried the brunch menu. Excellent selection of drinks, I say go for the Michelada (on the regular menu) with Negro Modelo. They also have bottomless mimosas. Hands down the tastiest item for brunch is the huaqulenos. Would also recommend the tacos huevos. For dinner you can't go wrong with any of the seafood items or fish tacos.

Great option for Mexican food and drinks. Been a neighborhood staple for decades and has quietly improved year over year. The renovations over the past few years, the new bar, the summertime outdoor seating, and the recent expansion have set this place apart from its rivals in dramatic fashion. There are legions of regulars who enjoy the consistent staff's recognition. It is typically filled to capacity for dinner so it is best to go early if you expect prompt seating, though at that time you may cross paths with screaming baby families. Everyone is welcome here. We come back for the fresh food and great drinks, but really enjoy the people more than anything. It has a family owned vibe which reverberates in the comfort food. The Pechuga Oaxaca is so good I can't seem to order anything else. So basic yet perfectly executed every time.

A really great Mexican restaurant, that way too often I don't make it to. This beats Garcia's in Lincoln Square IMO, and is about equal to Campeche for my personal fav Mexican within Chicago. Better than El Tipico and That Little Mexican Cafe, but lol both places are an easy bar to be better than anyway. Great margaritas(and even beating out the ones at Garcia's slightly), and the food has never disappointed me here, unlike sometimes at Garcia's. I wish I didn't have such a bad record, when it comes to persuading and talking people into places I really want to go to, since I'd do it a lot more with Tapatio. If only could finally persuade at least 1 or 2 of those infrequent times someone wants to go to Wishbone, to come here instead for a change of pace.

Belated New Year's resolution: At least put my foot down a lot more for coming here(& over Garcia's, and etc.) when it comes to Mexican restaurants for family gatherings. And that includes even if I can't sway my sometimes reluctant friends into better places to eat.

Cafe El Tapatio was the first restaurant my boyfriend and I ate at when we moved to Chicago last year.  Fast forward one year, and Tapatio is still one of our favorite spots for lunch, dinner and/or happy hour.  The food is always delicious, we always start with the queso with chorizo, which is served with warm tortillas & of course the complimentary chips & salsa (beware, it's hot!).  Favorite dishes include the burrito suzio, which is bigger than my head, and the crepas de pollo.  The combination dinners also never disappoint.  Great drinks, every margarita I've tried (probably all of the flavors) have been delicious and strong.  **Special thanks to the staff who have put up with my friends and I after one too many cocktails on a couple occasions.**. 

Best Mexican in Lakeview!
Food and service were terrible.  The food was soggy and not fresh.  Service was very slow

Loved this place!!! The margaritas are strong and delicious! The chips and salsa were good. The best part of my experience was the Crepas De Espinacas!! I am usually not one for creamy sauces... But this cream sauce was totally worth it!!! This meal was phenomenal. Ask the people who were eating with me.... They were probably annoyed by the number of times I kept repeating that it was the best meal of my life (although I may have started exaggerating once the margaritas kicked in).

The service was great too!!!

Yahtzee! Tapatio is the perfect spot for a huge margarita and some great fajitas. But please don't stop there... Be sure to try the Pachuga a la Tapatia, the Carne Asada, the enchiladas, and the chimichanga.... They're all good, I swear. You may need to head over early to get your name on the list and grab a drink at the bar before you dine as the restaurant is small (but I hear they're expanding - a proud testament to how great of a little hole in the wall this place really is).

I have been on a quest to find a replacement for our now closed go to Mexican restaurant we loved. We have searched Chicago high and low (well actually only in areas close to Lakeview) no tortillas was left unturned every salsa was tasted and as hard as it was we sampled every margarita we could. I had been to El Tapatio years ago and my memories about it had been mediocre, finally the day had come to go back and give it another try. I am not sure if my taste buds where out of town on my last visit or El Tapatio has changed either way I was impressed. The staff was very nice and service was great the atmosphere was just how I like it  the walls painted with numerous bright colors,  I think Martha Stewart might call it kinda cheesy festive.

The food overall was very good and the menu offered a nice selection containing all the standard mexican dishes plus a few unique extras I had never seen. Much like a egg role is a barometer of a good chinese place I think chips are a good indicator of how good a mexican place is. I am happy to say the chips were served hot and crisp a perfect thickness not to thin not to thick. They brought out two sauces to dip in one is a standard salsa but it had little garlic taste and a nice kick to it and one is a milder ranchero sauce they bring out warm. We started with the nachos and ordered the carne asade and the chicken enchiladas with mole for our entrees. The Nachos where excellent I normally am a queso fundido guy but I'm glad I strayed this time and swung with the nachos I hope the queso was not to jealous.They put the nachos under the broiler for a bit and everything comes out as a bubbly hot gooey mess of good stuff. The guacamole on the nachos had a hint of lime lots of avocado flavor I'm sure ordering the straight up guacamole would be a great call. The carne asada was a good portion of meat, cooked to a perfect medium still pink in the middle with a nice charred flavor. The dish came with tortillas  I asked for a mix of flour and corn unfortunately they where all stuck together and tore apart so it was hard to make a taco with them. The tortillas did not seem like anything special  and kind of a let down. The chicken mole was awesome great flavors if you like or wanna try mole this seems like the place to order it up.

The pitcher of margaritas seemed a little small for the price and they seemed more like fizzy lime then a real good margarita but other then that I have to say I was pretty happy.

Went back again second Visit

Quick update we went back with a few friends and the food was awesome once again the margaritas seemed better this time and the service was right on. We had to wait to be seated but they said we could wait at the bar across the street and they would call when table was ready. We even got to bring our drinks with us when we were called over. Pretty solid place 4 1/2 stars.

My wife and I, who are from Texas, come here often when we are in search of our Mexican food fill. It's the best Mexican food that we've found in Illinois. They have fantastic fajitas and my wife loves the enchiladas. This place is great for dinner and margaritas with friends and even great for lunch with the kids. Our son loves the warm salsa they make. Would definitely recommend this place!

Given the other strong reviews for Tapatio, I was disappointed that the majority of my food was so plain.

Full disclosure--I had brunch at Takito Kitchen earlier in the day yesterday.  I had their version of a Paloma cocktail and it was amazing.  The $8 version at Tapatio was garbage, literally untaste (I just made up a word).  I got the tilapia with the chile rub, and the fish was very well prepared, with a good amount of it to boot.  But the rice and vegetables were also untaste; just crazy bland filler.  Service was fast, but for me, it was actually a little too fast, at least for the prices, if that makes sense; if I'm going to drop $15-$25 per entree, I don't want the food brought to me eight minutes after ordering.  If I wanted fast food, I would just go get it...but sadly, this is a thing with many American restaurants, and I'm used to it by now.  For many people--especially those who are showing up hungry--food super fast is a benefit.

I drove farther to eat at Mixteco last week, and now having been to both places, Mixteco is the place I will go back to.  In Tapatio's defense, my wife thought her shrimp tacos were pretty good.
I have been coming here for years. I have NEVER been even slightly disappointed. Great food, drinks, and staff! Might just have to head over there for dinner tonight!

WOW.

Can I get some chips with my salsa please? Yep, I could drink their homemade salsa it's so good. I could eat here every day if I had the fastest metabolism in the world, it's so good. Their food is awesome. Much higher quality than some of the other Mexican joints in the area. Every Thursday evening they have half off margaritas. WOW. They have the most savory dishes. I recommend their enchiladas rancheros or crepas de espinacas. OH WOW. So creamy and bursting with flavor. 

I don't know what else to say. It's just so good.

I just didn't give it five stars because sometimes the service people are rude, but that does not stop me from coming to the BEST MEXICAN RESTAURANT in CHICAGO.

Had the most super deliciously tasteful carne asada dinner tonight. And Cheecho (I have no idea how to properly spell that) the bartender is the best. Great Mexican spot that I will continue to visit!

Great place for a date! I love their food, service is always friendly and the atmosphere is romantic and chill. On the weekends it gets a little too busy for my liking, but that's just the sign of a good place to go.
Literally waiting for carry out to bring to a friend's place and decided to grab a beer while I wait.  They, without asking, brought me some chips and salsa.  I love El Tap!

Wonderful atmosphere and even better food!!! I got the steak fajitas and they were hands down the BEST I have ever had! So yummy and worth the wait! Get there earlier on the weekends for dinner, they get packed with people!

Awesome and authentic food in a cute setting with a string kit outdoor patio. I went a couple weeks ago with 5 girls and we had great Paloma's at a great price. 

I will definitely go back, especially after talking to some of the staff and hearing about the 40+ year history.
The best tacos and ceviche around. There's a reason it's always crowded. Worth takeout or a trip in!
The pechuga a la tapatía and micheladas were fantastic. Salsa was also delish. Highly recommend!

Visited this fine establishment to celebrate our family members anniversary.  The food never ceases to satisfy us! We came in for their brunch, I had the eggs over easy with chopped steak tacos which were perfect and served with potatoes! The chips and salsa is awesome! The salsa has a garlicky taste which is my favorite.  Can't wait to go back! The owners are the most lovely people!

If I could give it negative stars I would. I ordered nachos which is a pretty basic menu item. What I got served was tortilla chips covered in tomato sauce with strands of mozzarella cheese over it. They came cold, looked unappetizing, and were the weirdest "nachos" I've ever encountered from a Mexican restaurant. My date and I had no words when the server set the nachos down in front of me. Big thumbs down.

A decent neighborhood Mexican joint with a solid outdoor section. I wouldn't go out of my way for Cafe El Tapatio but I was glad to try it. Nothing was extraordinary or particularly memorable. They have an extensive menu and the margaritas don't disappoint. We ordered the guacamole to start and enjoyed the warm chips. I ordered the plantain enchiladas which were incredibly heavy and rich. The steak dishes my parents ordered were more appealing. The beans on the side were delicious. Go for the margs as the main event.

Went in on Valentines day cause I was craving a good margarita and fajitas. They brought out this tiny margarita, never been to a mexican restaurant that skimps on a margarita! Then they brought out this pan with so much grease and oil with the steak and onions floating in it....I have never seen something like this ever in a mexican restaurant...and I go to many. The meat was super tough.  I was just really disappointed in the food. Even had a bite of the chicken enchiladas my boyfriend had and they were so gross...it had the most awkward flavor. Ill be sticking to my other mexican restaurants.
Totally not worth the money. My husband got some quesadilla looking thing instead of tacos and I wasn't thrilled with my mushroom tacos. Definitely not worth it. Won't be ordering from there again.

My husband and I have eyed this spot for a long time. We love the vintage lighted restaurant sign and the patio always looks like a nice place to have a drink on a hot day.  

We finally got our chance to dine in and really enjoyed our dinner there. It was the 3 of us and although they are kind of family friendly (lots of highchairs available), the space is kind of tight so I am glad that we went during early dinner hours so it wasn't that crowded and we were seated immediately. 

My husband and I split the beef and chicken fajitas and enchiladas.  Both were really good, although I enjoyed the fajitas a bit more--the meats were tender and flavorful and the peppers and onions were also cooked just right and not super soggy or mushy. The corn tortillas were fresh and the guacamole was well-made and creamy too. I also tried sips of his Michelada--it was a HUGE serving--but delicious and refreshing. 

They didn't have a kids menu but I asked if their quesadilla could be made with just cheese (their q's have cheese, chicken and peppers).  Our server said it wouldn't be a  problem and would I like a small serving of rice and beans for the kiddo. How perfect was that? They have horchata too so the kid got one of his favorite drinks as well. 

Super service, fresh food. Next time we're patio bound!

Came here for lunch today.  Had the carne asada tacos with rice n beans.  For $8.50 I thought this was a great deal.  I was stuffed.  Add in the very delicious chips and great salsa.  Yum.  I'm usually not fond of Mexican rice, but this was different. Fluffy rice with that nice orange color and some sort of spice.  Delicious!   We finished our meal off with a small coconut flan..  Also delicious.  Service was top notch!

Came here for a Sunday lunch. First time having Mexican food in Chicago. Moved here from South Carolina a week ago. I asked my server to choose for me between 2 different tacos. He ended up bringing out one of each for me-such a nice touch that did not go unnoticed by me! Delicious margaritas and their guac is fresh tasting. So glad to have this place in my neighborhood!
By far the best Mexican food in the city. Nothing compares. Been here multiple times over the past several years and it's always great. The food, drinks, and staff are all excellent!
A must in Chicago for Mexican. The homemade salsa and margaritas are awesome. Go for the crepas de pollo with the most amazing chipotle cream sauce ever. I could eat that everyday!

Great service, huge portions, fun atmosphere. 4.5/5

Food was solid, but nothing out of this world. Think the Yelp reviews are too bullish on this place. Would definitely come back, but not something I'd go out of my way to do. Even though lower rating, good food quality, ingredients didn't feel cheap or anything like that. 3.5/5

Very solid mexican fare in lakeview. Carne asada, cjeese enciladas as well as guacamole and chips are standouts here. Margiritas and cold beer? Of course my friends. Stay thirsty and hungry my friends.

Quaint place with amazing authentic Mexican food.  It has a nice outside patio although being on Ashland is a little loud especially when the EL swings by in the background, it is still no biggie.  I had the carne asada that was cooked and garnished perfectly.

A friend recommended this place.  We each ordered a combo plate.  They charged an extra buck for a pastor taco.  My cheese enchilada had shredded cheese in it...not melted.  Couldn't taste any tequila in my house margarita.  My friend's chile relleno had a long piece of some hard material in it.  Couldn't cut it with a knife, much less eat it.  Was replaced by the waiter.  Somebody doesn't know/care how to cook.

Today was my first time coming here and I will definitely be back! It was lovely inside and outside. I got a shrimp fajita fish and a mojito. I enjoyed the atmosphere. It got pretty loud for a while, but I can only blame that on drunk Cubs fans at the bar. The waiters were quick and friendly.

Stopped by today and had the chorizo with eggs and hash. I was extra hungry so I also got the taco meal with the pastor tacos. To my surprise the flavor on both was definitely on point I asked for the hot sauce... Hotter than the basic mild one they gave me... It was the bomb.com! I recommend! Authentic as can be!

Finally, a decent Mexican place within walking distance, especially after finishing a jumbo margarita!  The jumbo did me in the first time we ate here, so I ordered a large the second go so I could remember what I ate.  

Good guacamole, but the chips are pretty thick.  The tacos were good, I ordered three and had enough to take home.  Hubby had a delicious spicy shrimp dish.  It's fun to eat on the patio for people watching, but the bar was a great place to watch the World Cup games.  It took a little while for the bar tender to acknowledge our presence, but the service was pretty quick thereafter.  Also, they are celebrating their 40th anniversary so appetizers are half off at the bar on Sundays.
Really great service, really delicious authentic Mexican food! I got the chicken special and it was fabulous.  Also,  bottomless mimosas!

This place is a gem!!!! The food and service is excellent! My husband and I split a burrito and the shrimp quesadilla, both were great and a lot of food. The restaurant is small but we only waited about 20 min for a table and the food comes quick so it was fine! We will definitely be going back!

Pretty good Mexican restaurant. The heaters outside are awesome will keep you warm on a chiller day. The food is really good. 

Went in cinco de mayo and the food/drinks took forever but they were busier then usual.

We were looking for a new Mexican restaurant to go to and Cafe El Tapatio is the answer!!!
Margaritas are as good as hand made and the food was excellent.
However, it is the service and attitude of the place that makes it a winner!!

Friendly and efficient service - the place has a 'buzz' that is exciting and fun.

No better place for home cooked Mexican food in Chicago then Tapatilo.  The freshest of food available with a knowledgeable staff. The carnitas are amazing and Joe and his family does the place righteous.

Let me first start by saying that I used to LOVE Cafe El Tapatio and would say my husband and I visit once a week. The reason for my review is due to my experience with service and lack of quality in the food the past three times I have gone. For starters, I used to go for the salsa because it was SO good. During my last visit, the salsa was so runny I couldn't even put it in my mouth, our appetizer and my entree were brought out first and my husband had to wait, our food was cold, and the burrito in the combo was awful. The food used to be DELICIOUS and now it is not near as good. I won't be returning which is sad.
